hebrew_text: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם.
human_translation: who brings a bill of divorce [ get ] from a country overseas, is required to state was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence.
llm_translation: The one who brings a bill of divorce from the country of the sea, must say, "It was written in my presence and signed in my presence."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמֵּבִיא מִן הָרְקָם וּמִן הַחֶגֶר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מִכְּפַר לוּדִּים לְלוֹד.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Even one who brings from Rekem or from Ḥeger, Rabbi Eliezer says: Even from the village of Ludim to Lod
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Even one who brings from the embroidery and from the girdle. Rabbi Eliezer says: Even from the village of Lud to Lod.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אֶלָּא הַמֵּבִיא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וְהַמּוֹלִיךְ. וְהַמֵּבִיא מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מֵהֶגְמוֹנְיָא לְהֶגְמוֹנְיָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say one is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, only brings from a country overseas and one who delivers And who brings from region to region within overseas countries is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: even from district [ hegmonya ] to district
llm_translation: The sages say: It is not necessary to say, "Written before Me and signed before Me," rather one who brings from a maritime province and one who brings from province to province through a maritime province, must say, "Written before Me and signed before Me." Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even from gathering to gathering.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מֵרְקָם לַמִּזְרָח, וּרְקָם – כַּמִּזְרָח; מֵאַשְׁקְלוֹן לַדָּרוֹם וְאַשְׁקְלוֹן – כַּדָּרוֹם; מֵעַכּוֹ לַצָּפוֹן, וְעַכּוֹ – כַּצָּפוֹן. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַכּוֹ – כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְגִיטִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: from Rekem eastward and Rekem is like east From Ashkelon southward and Ashkelon is like south from Akko northward and Akko is like north Rabbi Meir says: Akko is like Eretz Yisrael with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: From Merkam to the east, and Merkam is like the east; from Ashkelon to the south, and Ashkelon is like the south; from Akko to the north, and Akko is like the north. Rabbi Meir says: Akko is like the land of Israel for divorces.

hebrew_text: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״. וְאִם יֵשׁ עָלָיו עוֹרְרִים, יִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו.
human_translation: One who brings a bill of divorce within Eretz Yisrael is not required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. And if there are those who contest it, it should be ratified through its signatories.
llm_translation: One who brings a bill of divorce in the land of Israel, does not need to say, "written and signed before me." And if there are objections against it, it is validated by its seals.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? רַבָּה אָמַר:
human_translation: What is the reason Rabba says:
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for this? Rabbah said:

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: because are not experts for her sake.
llm_translation: According to the Talmudic text: "Because they are not proficient in its name."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ.
human_translation: Rava says because there are no witnesses available to ratify it.
llm_translation: Rava said: Because witnesses are not readily available to establish it.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאַתְיוּהוּ בֵּי תְרֵי. אִי נָמֵי, מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: What is between There is between them where two brought Alternatively, from region to region within Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them that they come from two houses. Either way, from province to province in the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, בְּאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: Alternatively, within that region in a country overseas.
llm_translation: If so, in that province in the province of the sea.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ – לִיבְעֵי תְּרֵי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַכֹּל עֵדֻיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה! עֵד אֶחָד נֶאֱמָן בְּאִיסּוּרִין.
human_translation: And according to Rabba, who said because they are not experts for her sake, let us require two just as is with regard to all testimonies in the Torah. One witness is deemed credible with regard to prohibitions.
llm_translation: And for Rabbah who said because they are not knowledgeable of her name - let two come, since it is a matter of eating testimonies in the Torah! One witness is trusted in matters of prohibition.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמְרִינַן עֵד אֶחָד נֶאֱמָן בְּאִיסּוּרִין, כְּגוֹן חֲתִיכָה סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן, דְּלָא אִיתַּחְזַק אִיסּוּרָא;
human_translation: say that we say one witness is deemed credible with regard to prohibitions such as a piece uncertain fat ḥelev uncertain fat. as there is no presumption forbidden.
llm_translation: Statement that we say: one witness is believed in matters of prohibition, such as a doubtful piece of fat or a doubtful piece of cheese, as the prohibition is not established.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִיתַּחְזַק אִיסּוּרָא דְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁבָּעֶרְוָה; וְאֵין דָּבָר שֶׁבְּעֶרְוָה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם!
human_translation: However, here, where there is a presumption forbidden, as a married woman, is a matter of forbidden sexual relations, and there is no matter for forbidden sexual relations fewer than two
llm_translation: However, here, where there is a presumption of the prohibition of a married woman, it is considered a matter of adultery; and there is nothing that is considered adultery less than two!

hebrew_text: רוֹב בְּקִיאִין הֵן. וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיעוּטָא – סְתָם סָפְרֵי דְּדַיָּינֵי מִיגְמָר גְּמִירִי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּאַצְרוּךְ; וְהָכָא
human_translation: most are experts And even according to Rabbi Meir, who is concerned about a minority ordinary judicial scribes, are learned And it is the Sages who required And here,
llm_translation: The majority are experts. And even according to Rabbi Meir who is concerned for the minority - the ordinary books of the judges are learned from the tradition, and it is the Rabbis who are meticulous; and here

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם עִיגּוּנָא אַקִּילוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: due to desertion, the Sages were lenient with her
llm_translation: Due to the concern of Iguna, the Rabbis were lenient with her.

hebrew_text: הַאי קוּלָּא הוּא?! חוּמְרָא הוּא! דְּאִי מַצְרְכַתְּ לֵיהּ תְּרֵי – לָא אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעֵר וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ; חַד – אָתֵי בַּעַל וּמְעַרְעֵר וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Is this a leniency? It is a stringency, since if you require two with regard to husband cannot come contest and invalidate it, one husband come and contest and invalidate
llm_translation: This is a question?! It is a string! For if you need two - the one who nullifies it does not come, and the idol does not nullify it; but if one comes, the one who nullifies it and the idol nullify it!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: בִּפְנֵי כַּמָּה נוֹתְנוֹ לָהּ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא; חַד אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְחַד אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה; מֵעִיקָּרָא מִידָּק דָּיֵיק, וְלָא אָתֵי לְאוֹרוֹעֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Since the Master says: In the presence of how many give it to Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Ḥanina One said in the presence of two and one said in the presence of three at the outset careful and he will not act to his own detriment
llm_translation: As soon as Mar said: "In front of how many should he give it to her?" Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Chanina; one said: "In front of two," and one said: "In front of three." Initially, he was precise, but he did not come to the light of his soul.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ – לִיבְעֵי תְּרֵי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקִּיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא! עֵד אֶחָד נֶאֱמָן בְּאִיסּוּרִין.
human_translation: And according to Rava, who said because there are no witnesses available to ratify it, let us require two just as is typical ratification of documents, One witness is deemed credible with regard to prohibitions.
llm_translation: And for Rava who said that since witnesses are not readily available to establish it - it requires two, because it is a matter of upholding the documents of the world! One witness is trusted in matters of prohibition.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמְרִינַן עֵד אֶחָד נֶאֱמָן בְּאִיסּוּרִין, כְּגוֹן חֲתִיכָה סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן, דְּלָא אִיתַּחְזַק אִיסּוּרָא; אֲבָל הָכָא אִיתַּחְזַק אִיסּוּרָא דְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ – הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁבָּעֶרְוָה, וְאֵין דָּבָר שֶׁבָּעֶרְוָה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם!
human_translation: say that we say one witness is deemed credible with regard to prohibitions such as a piece uncertain fat uncertain fat. as there is no presumption forbidden. However, here there is a presumption forbidden as a married woman. is a matter of forbidden sexual relations, and there is no matter for forbidden sexual relations fewer than two
llm_translation: Statement: As we say, one witness is believed in matters of prohibition, such as a doubtful piece of fat or a doubtful piece of cheese, where the prohibition is not established. But here, where the prohibition of a married woman is established - it is a matter of adultery, and there is no matter of adultery less than two!

hebrew_text: בְּדִין הוּא דִּבְקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת נָמֵי לָא לִיבְעֵי, כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עֵדִים הַחֲתוּמִים עַל הַשְּׁטָר, נַעֲשׂוּ כְּמִי שֶׁנֶּחְקְרָה עֵדוּתָן בְּבֵית דִּין – וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּאַצְרוּךְ; וְהָכָא מִשּׁוּם עִיגּוּנָא אַקִּילוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: By right that with regard to ratification of documents as well, should not require in accordance with of Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish says: Witnesses signed on document become like whose testimony has been examined in court, And it is the Sages who required And here, the Rabbis were lenient with her due to desertion.
llm_translation: It is in a case where the validity of the documents is not in question, as Reish Lakish expounded: Witnesses who are signed on the document are considered as if their testimony has been examined in court - and it is the Rabbis who established this; and here, due to the suspicion, the Rabbis were lenient with it.

hebrew_text: הַאי קוּלָּא הוּא?! חוּמְרָא הוּא! דְּאִי מַצְרְכַתְּ לֵיהּ תְּרֵי – לָא אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעֵר וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ; חַד – אָתֵי בַּעַל וּמְעַרְעֵר וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ! כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: בִּפְנֵי כַּמָּה נוֹתְנוֹ לָהּ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא; חַד אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְחַד אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה; מֵעִיקָּרָא מִידָּק דָּיֵיק וְלָא אָתֵי לְאוֹרוֹעֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Is this a leniency? It is a stringency, since if you require two with regard to husband cannot come contest and invalidate it, one husband can come and contest and invalidate it. Since the Master says: In the presence of how many give it to Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Ḥanina One said in the presence of two and one said in the presence of three at the outset careful and he will not act to his own detriment
llm_translation: This voice is it?! It is a stringency! For if it requires two - the owner does not come and annul it; if it requires one - the owner comes and annuls it! Since the Master said: In whose presence do we give it to her? Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Chanina; one said: In the presence of two, and one said: In the presence of three; initially, he was precise and did not come to endanger himself.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבָּה? אָמַר לָךְ: מִי קָתָנֵי ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב לִשְׁמָהּ, בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם לִשְׁמָהּ״?!
human_translation: And Rava, what is the reason he did not say like Rabba, said to you: Is taught It was written in my presence for her sake, it was signed in my presence for her sake?
llm_translation: Rava, what is the reason why he did not say like Rabbah? He said to you: Who is the one who writes, "In my presence it was written for her, in my presence it was sealed for her"?!

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה? בְּדִין הוּא דְּלִיתְנֵי הָכִי, אֶלָּא דְּאִי מַפְּשַׁתְּ לֵיהּ דִּיבּוּרָא – אָתֵי לְמִגְזְּיֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabba By right that teach this However, as if you increase speak, he will come to shorten it.
llm_translation: And Rabbah? It is in a case where it does not teach thus, but if she reveals his speech - he comes to divorce her.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי אָתֵי לְמִגְזְּיֵיהּ! חֲדָא מִתְּלָת גָּאֵיז, חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי לָא גָּאֵיז.
human_translation: Now too, he will come to shorten it shorten one of three, he will not shorten one of two.
llm_translation: At that time, he came to visit him! One was from the third floor, one was from the fourth floor and did not come.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא? אָמַר לָךְ: אִם כֵּן נִיתְנֵי ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ וְתוּ לָא; ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: And Rabba, what is the reason he did not say like Rava, said to you: If so, let teach: It was signed in my presence, and nothing more, Why do I It was written in my presence? Conclude from it we need for her sake.
llm_translation: Rabba, what is the reason why he did not say like Rabba? He said to you: If so, it should have been written "b'fanai nechtam" and not "b'fanai niktav." Why do I need "b'fanai niktav"? Understand from it that we require it for its own sake.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא? בְּדִין הוּא דְּלִיתְנֵי הָכִי, אֶלָּא דְּאִם כֵּן, אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא – בְּעֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: And Rava by right that teach this But if so, will come to confuse with the typical ratification of documents. of one witness.
llm_translation: Rava? In judgment it is not so, but if yes, he comes to exchange in the fulfillment of worldly documents - in one witness.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה: מִי דָּמֵי?! הָתָם ״יָדְעִינַן״, הָכָא ״בְּפָנַי״;
human_translation: And Rabba are comparable There, We know here, in my presence.
llm_translation: Rabba: Who is similar?! There, "we know," here "before Me";

hebrew_text: הָתָם אִשָּׁה לָא מְהֵימְנָא, הָכָא אִשָּׁה מְהֵימְנָא; הָתָם בַּעַל דָּבָר לָא מְהֵימַן, הָכָא בַּעַל דָּבָר מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: there, a woman is not deemed credible, here, a woman is deemed credible there, an interested party is not deemed credible here, an interested party is deemed credible,
llm_translation: There, a woman is not believed, here, a woman is believed; there, a husband is not believed, here, a husband is believed.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: אַטּוּ הָכָא כִּי אָמְרִי ״יָדְעִינַן״ מִי לָא מְהֵימְנִי?! וְכֵיוָן דְּכִי אָמְרִי ״יָדְעִינַן״ מְהֵימְנִי, אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא – בְּעֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: And Rava, said to you: Is that to say here, if say: We know, they are not deemed credible? And since when say: We know, they are deemed credible, will come to confuse it with the typical ratification of documents, via one witness.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: Now here, when they say "we know," who would not trust me?! And since when they say "we know" they trust me, they come to exchange in the fulfillment of worldly documents - with one witness.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, מַאן הַאי תַּנָּא דְּבָעֵי כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ, וּבָעֵי
human_translation: And according to Rabba, who said because they are not experts for her sake, who is this tanna who requires writing for her sake, and requires
llm_translation: And for Rabbah who said because they are not proficient in its name, who is this Tanna that requires writing its name, and requires

hebrew_text: חֲתִימָה לִשְׁמָהּ? אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר – חֲתִימָה בָּעֵי, כְּתִיבָה לָא בָּעֵי! דִּתְנַן: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין בִּמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע. כְּתָבוֹ עַל הַמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע, תְּלָשׁוֹ, חֲתָמוֹ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: signing for her sake? If Rabbi Meir, requires signing he does not require writing As we learned One may not write on attached to the ground, he wrote it on attached to the ground, detached it, signed it, and gave it to her, valid.
llm_translation: Seal it for its own sake? If it is Rabbi Meir - a seal is needed, but not a writing! As we learned: One may not write on a joined surface to the ground. If one wrote on the joined surface to the ground, he should erase it, seal it, and give it to her - it is valid!

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – כְּתִיבָה בָּעֵי, חֲתִימָה לָא בָּעֵי! וְכִי תֵּימָא לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, וְכִי לָא בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חֲתִימָה לִשְׁמָהּ – מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מִדְּרַבָּנַן – בָּעֵי; וְהָא שְׁלֹשָׁה גִּיטִּין פְּסוּלִין דְּרַבָּנַן, וְלָא בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חֲתִימָה לִשְׁמָהּ!
human_translation: If Rabbi Elazar, requires writing he does not require signing And if you would say actually is Rabbi Elazar, and when Rabbi Elazar does not require signing for her sake, by Torah law, by rabbinic law he requires but three bills of divorce invalid by rabbinic law, and Rabbi Elazar does not require signing for her sake.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar - writing is needed, sealing is not needed! And if you say perhaps it is always Rabbi Elazar, and if Rabbi Elazar does not need sealing for its sake - from the Torah, from the Rabbis - it is needed; and these three get are invalid according to the Rabbis, and Rabbi Elazar does not need sealing for its sake!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה גִּיטִּין פְּסוּלִין, וְאִם נִיסַּת הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר: כָּתַב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ וְאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים, יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים וְאֵין בּוֹ זְמַן, יֵשׁ בּוֹ זְמַן וְאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה גִּיטִּין פְּסוּלִין, וְאִם נִיסַּת – הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: As we learned Three bills of divorce invalid but if married the offspring unflawed wrote in his handwriting but there are no witnesses on there are witnesses on but there is no date on it; there is a date on it but it has only one witness These are three invalid bills of divorce And if she married, the offspring unflawed
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Three gittin are invalid, but if the fetus was born, it is valid. If he wrote it in his own handwriting and there are no witnesses on it, if there are witnesses on it but there is no date, if there is a date but there is only one witness – these are three invalid gittin. But if the fetus was born, it is valid.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים – אֶלָּא שֶׁנְּתָנוֹ לָהּ בִּפְנֵי עֵדִים; כָּשֵׁר, וְגוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים. שֶׁאֵין הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִים עַל הַגֵּט אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even though there are no witnesses on but he gave it to her in the presence of witnesses, a valid And can collect from liened property, as that witnesses sign the bill of divorce only for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even though there are no witnesses against him - except that he gave it to her in the presence of witnesses; it is valid, and collection from encumbered property. Witnesses do not sign on the divorce document except for the sake of the world's order.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְכִי לָא בָּעֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ – מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מִדְּרַבָּנַן בָּעֵי; וְהָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֲפִילּוּ מְצָאוֹ בְּאַשְׁפָּה,
human_translation: But rather, is Rabbi Meir, and when Rabbi Meir does not require writing for her sake, by Torah law, by rabbinic law he does require But didn’t Rav Naḥman say Rabbi Meir would say: even found in the garbage,
llm_translation: And rather Rabbi Meir it is, and if not does Rabbi Meir require writing for its own sake - from the Torah, he requires it from the Rabbis; and this is what Rav Nachman said, Rabbi Meir would say: Even if they found it in the garbage,

hebrew_text: וַחֲתָמוֹ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – כָּשֵׁר! וְכִי תֵּימָא אֲנַן מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא קָא מַתְנִינַן לַהּ, אִי הָכִי, ״אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּבַר תּוֹרָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: and he signed it and gave it to a valid And if you would say we learned this by Torah law, if so, should have Rabbi Meir would say by Torah law
llm_translation: "And they sealed it and gave it to her - valid! And if you say that we are giving it to her based on the Torah, if so, 'Rabbi Meir used to say a Torah verse' - he requires it!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, וְכִי לָא בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חֲתִימָה – הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים כְּלָל; הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים – בָּעֵי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּמְזוּיָּיף מִתּוֹכוֹ, שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל.
human_translation: Rather, Actually, is Rabbi Elazar, and when does Rabbi Elazar not require signing Where there are no witnesses at all where there are witnesses, he does require that Rabbi Abba says: Rabbi Elazar concedes with regard to falsification is inherent in it, that it is invalid.
llm_translation: Rather, forever Rabbi Elazar it is, and when does Rabbi Elazar require a signature? Where there are no witnesses at all; where there are witnesses – he requires it. For Rabbi Abba said: Rabbi Elazar concedes in the case of a forged document from within it, that it is invalid.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹסֵל, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתִיבָתוֹ וַחֲתִימָתוֹ בְּתָלוּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda. As we learned Rabbi Yehuda invalidates unless its writing and signing on detached
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: What is the ruling? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda disqualifies until its writing and sealing are hanging.

hebrew_text: וּמֵעִיקָּרָא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא מוֹקְמִינַן לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: And initially, what is the reason we did not establish in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: And from the outset, what is the reason that we do not establish for her like Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: מְהַדְּרִינַן אַרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דִּסְתַם מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי מֵאִיר; מְהַדְּרִינַן אַרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּקַיְימָא לַן הִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: We seek in accordance with Rabbi Meir, that an unattributed mishna Rabbi Meir. we seek Rabbi Elazar, as we maintain the halakha is in accordance with his with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: We honor Rabbi Meir, for he established anonymous Mishnayot; we honor Rabbi Elazar, for he upholds the law in matters of divorce.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמֵּבִיא מִן הָרְקָם וּמִן הַחֶגֶר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מִכְּפַר לוּדִּים לְלוֹד. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בַּעֲיָירוֹת הַסְּמוּכוֹת לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמוּבְלָעוֹת בִּתְחוּם אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עָסְקִינַן,
human_translation: We learned Rabban Gamliel says: Even one who brings from Rekem or from Ḥeger Rabbi Eliezer says: Even from the village of Ludim to Lod. And Abaye said We are dealing with towns are near Eretz Yisrael and within the boundary of Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: Rabban Gamliel says, "Even one who brings wool from the weaver and from the belt-maker." Rabbi Eliezer says, "Even from the dyers of Lod to Lod." And Abaye said: We are dealing with cities adjacent to the Land of Israel and intermingled within the boundaries of the Land of Israel.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הָהוּא אַתְרָא, וְהָוֵי כְּמִבֵּי כוּבֵּי לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא.
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: I myself saw that place, and it was similar from Bei Kuvei to Pumbedita,
llm_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: According to my opinion, that place appears to me, and it should be like the house of Kubbe of Pumbedita.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר הָנֵי לָא צְרִיךְ; מַאי, לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהָנֵי גְּמִירִי; וּמָר סָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְהָנֵי נָמֵי לָא שְׁכִיחִי?
human_translation: by inference that the first tanna holds these is not required What, is it not they disagree with regard to this as Sage, holds because are not experts for her sake, and these are learned And Sage, holds: because there are no witnesses available to ratify it, and these are also not frequently
llm_translation: From the principle that the first Tanna holds, he does not need; what, is it not in this that they disagree - for the Master holds that they are not knowledgeable of its name, and these are learned; and the Master holds that reliable witnesses are not available to establish it, and these are not common?

hebrew_text: לָא; רַבָּה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ. רַבָּה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר, הָנֵי כֵּיוָן דִּסְמוּכוֹת מִיגְמָר גְּמִירִי;
human_translation: No, Rabba resolves to his reasoning, and Rava resolves to his reasoning. Rabba resolves to his reasoning, as everyone because they are not experts for her sake. And here they disagree with regard to this The first tanna holds since these are near are learned
llm_translation: Rabah does not agree; Rabah interprets according to his reasoning, and Rava interprets according to his reasoning. Rabah interprets according to his reasoning: because everyone in the world is not proficient in its name, and here in this case they are arguing – the first Tanna thought, those who are close to the source learn the tradition thoroughly.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתָא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמֵימַר, מוּבְלָעוֹת גְּמִירִי, סְמוּכוֹת לָא גְּמִירִי; וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמֵימַר, מוּבְלָעוֹת נָמֵי לָא, שֶׁלֹּא תַּחְלוֹק בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: And Rabban Gamliel came to say: are within are learned near are not learned. And Rabbi Eliezer came to say, are within also not that you should not make a distinction within the country overseas.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel came to say: "Muvla'ot we learn, semuchot we do not learn." And Rabbi Eliezer came to say: "Muvla'ot we do not learn, so as not to divide in the province of the sea."

hebrew_text: רָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ – וְתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר, הָנֵי כֵּיוָן דִּסְמוּכוֹת מִישְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחִי;
human_translation: Rava resolves to his reasoning. that everyone because there are no witnesses available to ratify it. And the first tanna holds: Since these are nearby are frequently
llm_translation: Rava resolves according to his reasoning: Since everyone in the world is not established by witnesses - and the first Tanna holds, those cases where there are presumptions are common.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתָא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמֵימַר, מוּבְלָעוֹת שְׁכִיחִי, סְמוּכוֹת לָא שְׁכִיחִי; וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמֵימַר, מוּבְלָעוֹת נָמֵי לָא, שֶׁלֹּא תַּחְלוֹק בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: And Rabban Gamliel came to say: within are frequently near are not frequently And Rabbi Eliezer came to say are within also not that you should not make a distinction within a country overseas.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel came to say: "Mubla'ot are common, semuchot are not common." And Rabbi Eliezer came to say: "Mubla'ot are indeed not common, so as not to divide in the province of the sea."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אֶלָּא הַמֵּבִיא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וְהַמּוֹלִיךְ. מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר מוֹלִיךְ לָא צְרִיךְ; מַאי, לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ,
human_translation: We learned And the Rabbis say one is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, only brings from a country overseas and one who delivers by inference that the first tanna holds one who delivers is not required What, is it not they disagree with regard to this as Sage, holds because they are not experts for her sake,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah, and the Sages say: It is not necessary to say, "written before Me and signed before Me," rather one who brings from the province of the sea and leads. From the inference of the first Tanna, he holds that leading is not necessary; what is the reason? Is it not because he does not agree with this - for the Master holds that those who are not knowledgeable in the matter.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי גְּמִירִי; וּמָר סָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְהָנֵי נָמֵי לָא שְׁכִיחִי?
human_translation: and these are learned And Sage, holds: because there are no witnesses available to ratify it, and these are also not frequently
llm_translation: These are the Gemara; and Mar holds that since reliable witnesses are not available to establish it, are these not reliable witnesses?

hebrew_text: רַבָּה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ. רַבָּה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהָכָא בִּגְזֵירַת מוֹלִיךְ אַטּוּ מֵבִיא קָמִיפַּלְגִי –
human_translation: Rabba resolves to his reasoning, and Rava resolves to his reasoning. Rabba resolves to his reasoning, that everyone because they are not experts for her sake, and here they disagree with regard to a decree one who delivers due to one who brings
llm_translation: Rabba interprets according to his reasoning, and Rava interprets according to his reasoning. Rabba interprets according to his reasoning: because everyone in the world is not proficient in its name, and here, with regard to the decree of carrying, it leads to a dispute –

hebrew_text: דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן מוֹלִיךְ אַטּוּ מֵבִיא.
human_translation: that the first tanna holds: do not decree one who delivers due to one who brings.
llm_translation: As taught in the first Tanna: We do not decree from "moleich" to "attu" but we do decree from "attu" to "mevi."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי סָבְרִי: גָּזְרִינַן מוֹלִיךְ אַטּוּ מֵבִיא.
human_translation: And the later Rabbis hold: do decree one who delivers due to one who brings
llm_translation: The sages in the West say: We decree that carrying is prohibited, but bringing is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי – לְפָרוֹשֵׁי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא הוּא דְּאָתוּ.
human_translation: And Rava resolves to his reasoning. that everyone because there are no witnesses available to ratify it, and the later Rabbis they come to explain the reasoning of the first tanna .
llm_translation: Rava resolves according to his reasoning: Since everyone in the world is considered as if witnesses are not available to establish it, and the Rabbis in the latter clause – according to the interpreters of his reasoning as the first Tanna came.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם – צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״. הָא בְּאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם – לֹא צָרִיךְ. לְרָבָא נִיחָא, לְרַבָּה קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: We learned One who brings from one region to region within a country overseas must say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. But within region in a country overseas he is not required works out well according to Rava, according to Rabba, difficult,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who brings a bill of divorce from one province to another in a coastal province - he must say, "It was written and signed in my presence." But in that same province in a coastal province - it is not necessary. Rava finds this acceptable, but Rabba finds it difficult!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: הָא בְּאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם – לֹא צָרִיךְ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – לֹא צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: do not say Within region in a country overseas, he is not required Rather, say From region to region within Eretz Yisrael, he is not required
llm_translation: Do not say: In that province in the province of the sea - not necessary, rather say: From province to province in the land of Israel - not necessary.

hebrew_text: הָא בְּהֶדְיָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״! אִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי דִּיעֲבַד, אֲבָל לְכַתְּחִילָּה לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But is teaching it explicitly: One who brings a bill of divorce within Eretz Yisrael is not required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. If from that I would say: This applies after the fact, However, not ab initio ; teaches us
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: In Hadia, it was taught to him: One who brings a bill of divorce in the land of Israel, he does not need to say, "It was written and signed in my presence"! If it were from there, I would have said that these matters happen, but initially, no, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמוֹתֵיב לַהּ הָכִי: הָא מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – לֹא צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: And some raise objection like this, from region to region within Eretz Yisrael, he is not required
llm_translation: And there is one who said to her thus: From province to province in the land of Israel - not necessary.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּה נִיחָא, לְרָבָא קַשְׁיָא! לָא תֵּימָא: מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – לֹא צָרִיךְ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: הָא בְּאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם – לֹא צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: works out well according to Rabba, difficult according to Rava. Do not say from region to region within Eretz Yisrael, he is not required. Rather, say: Within region in a country overseas he is not required
llm_translation: To Rabbah it is pleasant, to Rava it is difficult! Do not say: From one province to another in the land of Israel - it is not necessary, rather say: But in that province by the sea - it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַאי, צָרִיךְ?! לִיתְנֵי: ״הַמֵּבִיא מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה״ – סְתָם!
human_translation: However, from region to region within Eretz Yisrael, what he required let teach One who brings from region to region without specification,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But from one province to another in the land of Israel, what is the law?! It should be taught: "One who brings from one province to another" - it is unspecified!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי לֹא צָרִיךְ, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא עוֹלֵי רְגָלִים, מִישְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: Actually, from region to region within Eretz Yisrael is also not required Since there are who ascend for the pilgrimage Festival, are frequently
llm_translation: Always from province to province in the land of Israel it is pleasant, not necessary, since there are pilgrims, forgetfulness is common.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים; בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא בָּתֵּי דִינִין דִּקְבִיעִי – מִישְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: works out well when the Temple is standing, when the Temple is not standing what can be said? Since there are courts that are fixed are frequently
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When the Temple is standing, the law is established; when the Temple is not standing, what can be said? Since there are established courts - it is found common.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מֵהֶגְמוֹנְיָא לְהֶגְמוֹנְיָא. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: עִיר אַחַת הָיְתָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וַעֲסָסְיוֹת שְׁמָהּ, וְהָיוּ בָּהּ שְׁנֵי הֶגְמוֹנְיוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ מַקְפִּידִין זֶה עַל זֶה, לְפִיכָךְ הוּצְרְכוּ לוֹמַר מֵהֶגְמוֹנְיָא לְהֶגְמוֹנְיָא.
human_translation: We learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says even from district to district And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: There was one city in Eretz Yisrael, and Asasiyyot was its name, and it contained two districts that were particular with each other consequently they were required to say from district to district.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, "Even from Hegemony to Hegemony." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: There was once a city in the land of Israel called Asasyot, and there were two Hegemonies there who were particular about each other, therefore they had to say 'from Hegemony to Hegemony.'

hebrew_text: לְרָבָא נִיחָא, לְרַבָּה קַשְׁיָא! רַבָּה אִית לֵיהּ דְּרָבָא.
human_translation: works out well according to Rava, difficult according to Rabba, Rabba is of of Rava,
llm_translation: To Rava it is pleasing, to Rabba it is difficult! Rabba has a difficulty against Rava.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאַתְיוּהּ בֵּי תְרֵי.
human_translation: Rather, what is between them, There is between them where two bring
llm_translation: Rather what is the difference between them? There is a difference between them that they come in pairs.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, בְּאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: Alternatively, within region in a country overseas,
llm_translation: If so, in that province in the province of the sea.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אִם יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – יִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו. וַהֲוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי ״וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לוֹמַר״?
human_translation: We learned who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas, and he is unable to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, if has witnesses on it it shall be ratified by its signatories, And we discussed What And he is unable to say?
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, and cannot say, "It was written and signed in my presence," if there are witnesses against him - it is validated by his seals. And we ask about it: What does it mean that "he cannot say"?

hebrew_text: אִילֵימָא חֵרֵשׁ, חֵרֵשׁ בַּר אֵיתוֹיֵי גִיטָּא הוּא?! וְהָתְנַן: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִים לְהָבִיא אֶת הַגֵּט, חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן!
human_translation: If we say a deaf-mute, is a deaf-mute fit to bring a bill of divorce? But didn’t we learn Anyone is fit to bring a bill of divorce except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor,
llm_translation: If you say "deaf-mute," is Deaf-Mute Bar Eitoyei a get?! But we learned: All are fit to bring the get, except for a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנְּתָנוֹ לָהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא פִּקֵּחַ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ עַד שֶׁנִּתְחָרֵשׁ. לְרָבָא נִיחָא, לְרַבָּה קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: With what are we dealing here? where gave to her when he was competent, but he did not manage to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, before he became a deaf-mute. works out well according to Rava. difficult according to Rabba,
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when they gave it to her while he was still conscious, and he did not have the opportunity to say, "Written in my presence and signed in my presence," until he became silent. It is easy for Rava, but difficult for Rabba!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – לְאַחַר שֶׁלָּמְדוּ. אִי הָכִי, יָכוֹל נָמֵי! גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַחְזוֹר דָּבָר לְקִלְקוּלוֹ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? after learned If so, is able also decree lest the matter return to its corrupt state,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - after they learned. If so, it could also be! A decree lest a matter return to its detriment.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל נָמֵי! פִּקֵּחַ וְנִתְחָרֵשׁ מִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא, וּמִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא לָא גְּזוּר בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: If so, is unable also competent who became a deaf-mute an uncommon matter, and the Sages did not decree with regard to an uncommon matter.
llm_translation: Thus, he is unable to say! He is intelligent and remains silent about a matter that is not common, and a matter that is not common the Rabbis do not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִשָּׁה, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא, וּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה עַצְמָהּ מְבִיאָה גִּיטָּהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁצְּרִיכָה לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״? שֶׁלֹּא תַּחְלוֹק בִּשְׁלִיחוּת.
human_translation: But a woman an uncommon and we learned The woman herself may bring her bill of divorce, provided that she is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. that you will not distinguish with regard to agency.
llm_translation: And this, a woman, that is not common, and we learned: A woman brings her own bill of divorce, but only that she needs to say "written and signed in my presence"? So that there should be no dispute in the matter of agency.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בַּעַל נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: הוּא עַצְמוֹ שֶׁהֵבִיא גִּיטּוֹ, אֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״?
human_translation: If so, a husband also Why is it taught himself who brought his bill of divorce, he is not required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence?
llm_translation: So it is, Ba'al Nami! Why is it taught: He himself who brought his bill of divorce, there is no need to say "written and signed in my presence"?

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעַר וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ; הַשְׁתָּא מִינְקָט נָקֵיט לֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ, וְעַרְעוֹרֵי קָא מְעַרְעַר עֲלֵיהּ?!
human_translation: What is the reason the Sages said is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence? perhaps husband will come contest and invalidate now holds in his hand, and he will contest it?
llm_translation: Reason, what is it that the Rabbis say? It is necessary to say, "Written in my presence and signed in my presence," for perhaps the owner of the document will come and disqualify it; now, she takes it in her hand, and the skin is wrinkling on it?!

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דִּבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל מֵרַב הוּנָא: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, צְרִיכִין שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״ אוֹ אֵין צְרִיכִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין צְרִיכִין. וּמָה אִילּוּ יֹאמְרוּ ״בְּפָנֵינוּ גֵּרְשָׁהּ״, מִי לָא מְהֵימְנִי?!
human_translation: Come hear, as Shmuel raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: two who brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas, are they required to say: It was written in our presence and it was signed in our presence, or are they not required said to him: They are not required And if these say, She was divorced in our presence, aren’t they deemed credible
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Shmuel inquired of Rav Huna: Two who brought a bill of divorce from the land of the sea, do they need to say "it was written before us and signed before us" or not? He said to him: They do not need to. But if they were to say "we divorced her before us," who would not trust them?!

hebrew_text: לְרָבָא נִיחָא, לְרַבָּה קַשְׁיָא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – לְאַחַר שֶׁלָּמְדוּ.
human_translation: works out well according to Rava, according to Rabba, difficult, with what are we dealing here? after learned
llm_translation: To Ravah it is pleasing, to Rabba it is difficult! Here, with what are we dealing? - With matters learned afterwards.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, חַד נָמֵי! גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יַחְזוֹר דָּבָר לְקִלְקוּלוֹ.
human_translation: If so, one also decree lest the matter return to its corrupt state.
llm_translation: Thus, it is so, one point! A decree lest a matter revert to its detriment.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בֵּי תְרֵי נָמֵי! בֵּי תְרֵי דְּמַיְיתוּ גִּיטָּא, מִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא; וּמִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא לָא גְּזוּר בָּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: If so, two also Two who bring a bill of divorce an uncommon matter, and the Sages did not decree with regard to an uncommon matter.
llm_translation: So it is, the house of two faiths! The house of two who resemble a divorce document, a matter that is not common; and a matter that is not common, the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִשָּׁה, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא, וּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה עַצְמָהּ מְבִיאָה גִּיטָּהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁהִיא עַצְמָהּ צְרִיכָה לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״! שֶׁלֹּא תַּחְלוֹק בִּשְׁלִיחוּת.
human_translation: But a woman an uncommon and we learned The woman herself may bring her bill of divorce, provided that she is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. that you will not distinguish with regard to agency.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And this, a woman, that is not common, and we learned: this woman herself brings her bill of divorce, and only that she herself needs to say 'written and signed in my presence'! So that there should be no dispute in the matter of agency."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בַּעַל נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: הוּא עַצְמוֹ שֶׁהֵבִיא גִּיטּוֹ, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״? טַעְמָא מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – דִּילְמָא אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעַר וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ; הַשְׁתָּא מִינְקָט נָקֵיט לֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ, וְעַרְעוֹרֵי קָא מְעַרְעַר עֲלֵיהּ?!
human_translation: If so, a husband also Why is it taught himself brings his bill of divorce he is not required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence? What is the reason the Sages said is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence? perhaps husband will come contest and invalidate now holds in his hand, and he will contest it?
llm_translation: So it is, Ba'al Nami! Why is it taught: "He himself who brought his bill of divorce, does not need to say 'it was written and signed in my presence'?" What is the reason that the Rabbis say he needs to say "it was written and signed in my presence" - perhaps a Ba'al Mera'ar comes and disqualifies it; now he takes it in his hand, and the skin is wrinkling on it?!

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ וְלֹא אָמַר לָהּ ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אִם נִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו – כָּשֵׁר, וְאִם לָאו – פָּסוּל. הֱוֵי לֹא הוּצְרְכוּ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ לְהַחֲמִיר עָלֶיהָ, אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Come hear who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas and gave it to but did not say to her: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, if is ratified through its signatories, valid, but if not invalid. is did not require him to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, to be stringent with her. Rather, to be lenient with her,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, and gives it to her without saying to her, "It was written and signed in my presence," if it is confirmed by his seals - it is valid, and if not - it is invalid. He did not need to say, "It was written and signed in my presence" to be stringent upon her, but rather to be lenient upon her.

hebrew_text: לְרָבָא נִיחָא, לְרַבָּה קַשְׁיָא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – לְאַחַר שֶׁלָּמְדוּ.
human_translation: works out well according to Rava, according to Rabba difficult, With what are we dealing here? after they learned
llm_translation: To Ravah it is pleasing, to Rabba it is difficult! Here, with what are we dealing - after they learned.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַחְזוֹר הַדָּבָר לְקִלְקוּלוֹ! כְּשֶׁנִּיסַת. אִי הָכִי, הֱוֵי לָא הוּצְרְכוּ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ לְהַחְמִיר עָלֶיהָ אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עָלֶיהָ?! מִשּׁוּם דְּנִיסַּת הוּא!
human_translation: But didn’t you say decree lest the matter return to its corrupt state? where had married If so, is did not require him to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, to be stringent with her. Rather, to be lenient with her, is because she had married
llm_translation: And the saying: "A decree lest the matter revert to its detriment!" When you tried. If so, it should not have been necessary to say, "Written on my face and sealed on my face" to be stringent upon it, but rather to be lenient upon it?! Because you tried!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכִי תֵּימָא לְהַחֲמִיר עֲלַהּ וְלַפְּקַהּ, הֱוֵי לֹא הוּצְרְכוּ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ לְהַחְמִיר עָלֶיהָ אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עָלֶיהָ,
human_translation: This is what is saying: And if you would say be stringent with her and remove her is did not require him to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, to be stringent with her. Rather, to be lenient with her.
llm_translation: So it is saying: And if you were to say to be stringent regarding it and to be lenient, it is not necessary to say, "It was written on my face and sealed on my face" to be stringent upon it, but to be lenient upon it.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מַאי – דִּילְמָא אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעַר וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ; הַשְׁתָּא בַּעַל לָא קָא מְעַרְעַר, אֲנַן נֵיקוּם וּנְעַרְעַר עֲלַהּ?!
human_translation: What is the reason Perhaps husband will come contest, and invalidate Now, the husband is not contesting will we, arise and contest it?
llm_translation: Reason what? Perhaps comes Baal Me'arar and invalidates it; now Baal does not invalidate, we should come and invalidate upon it?!

hebrew_text: בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, חַד אָמַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ.
human_translation: with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. One said because they are not experts for her sake. And one said because there are no witnesses available to ratify it.
llm_translation: In the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, one said: Because they are not knowledgeable of her name, and one said: Because there are no witnesses available to establish it.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי הוּא דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר אַבָּא אַיְיתִי גִּיטָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: צְרִיכְנָא לְמֵימַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: It may be concluded that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi is who said because they are not experts for her sake, as Rabbi Shimon bar Abba brought a bill of divorce before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and said to him: Am I required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, or not?
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, he said because they are not knowledgeable in her name, Rabbi Shimon bar Abba brought a bill of divorce before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and he said to him: Do we need to say "written in my presence and signed in my presence," or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא צְרִיכַתְּ, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּדוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, אֲבָל בְּדוֹרוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים דִּבְקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ – לֹא. תִּסְתַּיֵּים.
human_translation: said to him: You are not required they said only in the earlier generations, when they were not experts for her sake. However, in the later generations, when they are experts for her sake, no, It may be concluded
llm_translation: He said to him: You do not need to, they only said this regarding the earlier generations, who were not knowledgeable in her, but in the later generations who are knowledgeable in her - no. It is concluded.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! וְהָא רַבָּה אִית לֵיהּ דְּרָבָא! וְעוֹד, הָא אָמְרִינַן שֶׁמָּא יַחְזוֹר דָּבָר לְקִלְקוּלוֹ!
human_translation: And can you understand But Rabba is of of Rava, And furthermore, we said lest the matter return to its corrupt state.
llm_translation: And it was created?! But Rabba has the opinion of Rava! Furthermore, we say perhaps a matter will return to its detriment!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר אַבָּא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא הֲוָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְהָא דְּלָא חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ – מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ דְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon bar Abba had another person with him, and that did not mention him due to the honor of Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon bar Abba another person was present with him, and what he did not consider him - out of respect for Rabbi Shimon's honor.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: בִּפְנֵי כַּמָּה נוֹתְנוֹ לָהּ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא; חַד אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְחַד אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: It was stated In the presence of how many give it to Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Ḥanina One says in the presence of two and one says in the presence of three
llm_translation: It was stated: In whose presence should it be given to her? Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Chanina; one said: In the presence of two, and one said: In the presence of three.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, דְּרָבִין בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא אַיְיתִי גִּיטָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל הַב לָהּ בְּאַפֵּי תְּרֵי, וְאֵימָא לְהוּ ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״. תִּסְתַּיֵּים.
human_translation: It may be concluded that Rabbi Yoḥanan is who said in the presence of two as Ravin bar Rav Ḥisda brought a bill of divorce before Rabbi Yoḥanan, and said to him: Go give to her in the presence of two and say to them: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. It may be concluded
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Yochanan, who said in the presence of two, Ravin bar Rav Chisda brought a bill of divorce before Rabbi Yochanan, and he said to him: Go bring it before two, and say to them, "It was written in my presence and signed in my presence." The completion.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, קָסָבַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ; וּמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה, קָסָבַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this as the one who said in the presence of two holds Because they are not experts for her sake. And the one who said in the presence of three holds Because there are no witnesses available to ratify it.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case where he is in doubt, for whoever says in the presence of two, he holds: because they are not knowledgeable for its sake; and whoever says in the presence of three, he holds: because there are no reliable witnesses to establish it?

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! הָא מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְהָכָא הֵיכִי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם?
human_translation: And can you understand But from Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, because they are not experts for her sake, Rabbi Yoḥanan, said because there are no witnesses available to ratify it. And here, how can Rabbi Yoḥanan say in the presence of two
llm_translation: "And was it created?! This is like what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, that because there are no experts in its name, and Rabbi Yochanan said, because there are no reliable witnesses to establish it. And here, how does Rabbi Yochanan mean, 'in the presence of two'?"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הָא רַבָּה אִית לֵיהּ דְּרָבָא!
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabba is of of Rava.
llm_translation: And furthermore, there is Rabba who has the opinion of Rava!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעֵינַן עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְהָכָא בְּשָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד וְעֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מַאן דְּאָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, קָסָבַר: שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד, וְעֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה, קָסָבַר: שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד, וְאֵין עֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין.
human_translation: Rather, everyone that we require witnesses available to ratify it, and here they disagree an agent can become a witness and a witness can become a judge The one who said in the presence of two holds an agent can become a witness, and a witness can become a judge. And the one who said in the presence of three holds an agent can become a witness, but a witness cannot become a judge.
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world, in our eyes, we require established witnesses to uphold it. And here, with a messenger, he becomes a witness, and a witness becomes a judge, they dispute: Whoever says in the presence of two, he holds: a messenger becomes a witness, and a witness becomes a judge. And whoever says in the presence of three, he holds: a messenger becomes a witness, but a witness does not become a judge.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן בִּדְרַבָּנַן דְּעֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין!
human_translation: But don’t we maintain with regard to of rabbinic law that a witness can become a judge,
llm_translation: And this is established for us in the words of the Sages, "When we will become judges!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִשָּׁה כְּשֵׁירָה לְהָבִיא אֶת הַגֵּט, זִמְנִין דְּמַיְיתָא לֵיהּ אִיתְּתָא וְסָמְכִי עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, here they disagree with regard to this As Sage, holds since a woman fit to bring the bill of divorce sometimes a woman will bring it, and rely upon her.
llm_translation: Rather, here in this case he argues, for Mar holds: Since a woman is fit to bring the divorce document, there are times when another woman may come and rely on her.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: אִשָּׁה – מִידָּע יָדְעִי וְלָא סָמְכִי עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: And the other a woman, know and they not rely on her.
llm_translation: And the other opinion: a woman - immediately know and not rely on her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ וְלֹא אָמַר לָהּ ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, one who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas, and gave it to but did not say to her: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, must divorce and the offspring a mamzer . the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, and gives it to her without saying to her, "It was written and signed in my presence," - he may divorce her, and the child born from this union is a mamzer, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? יִטְּלֶנּוּ הֵימֶנָּה, וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיִתְּנֶנּוּ לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְיֹאמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: The offspring is not a mamzer . How should act take from her, and again give it to her in the presence of two and he should say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence.
llm_translation: The sages say: A mamzer does not exist. How should one act? He should take him from her, and then return and give him to her in the presence of two, and say, "It was written in my presence and signed in my presence."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא אָמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, יוֹצִיא וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר?
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, because did not say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, must divorce and the offspring is a mamzer ?
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, because he did not say "written on my face and sealed on my face," does he exclude a mamzer and his offspring?

hebrew_text: אִין, רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְטַעְמֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כָּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה מִמַּטְבֵּעַ שֶׁטָּבְעוּ חֲכָמִים בְּגִיטִּין – יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Yes, Rabbi Meir to his reasoning As Rav Hamnuna said in the name of Ulla: Rabbi Meir would say any one who deviates from the formula coined by the Sages with regard to bills of divorce, must divorce and the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, Rabbi Meir le'taamei. D'amar Rav Hamnuna mi'shmei d'Ula: Omer hayah Rabbi Meir: Kol hamshaneh mimatbea shetav'u chachamim begittin - yotzi, vehavalad mamzer." English translation: "No, Rabbi Meir according to his reasoning. For Rav Hamnuna said in the name of Ula: Rabbi Meir used to say: Anyone who changes from the natural way that the Sages established regarding gittin - he is valid, and the child is a mamzer."

hebrew_text: בַּר הֶדְיָא בָּעֵי לְאֵתוֹיֵי גִּיטָּא, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַחַי, דַּהֲוָה מְמוּנֶּה אַגִּיטֵּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צָרִיךְ אַתָּה לַעֲמוֹד עַל כָּל אוֹת וָאוֹת. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לָא צְרִיכַתְּ.
human_translation: Bar Haddaya sought to bring a bill of divorce He came before Rabbi Aḥai, who was appointed over bills of divorce said to him: You are required to stand over each and every letter came before Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi they said to him: You are not required
llm_translation: Bar Hedya sought to bring a bill of divorce. He came before Rabbi Ahai, who was an expert in bills of divorce. He said to him: "You must stand on every letter and every word." He then came before Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, and they said to him: "You do not need to."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא אֶעֱבֵיד לְחוּמְרָא, נִמְצָא אַתָּה מוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל גִּיטִּין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים.
human_translation: And if you would say: I will act stringently, you are casting aspersions on the earlier bills of divorce,
llm_translation: And if you say, "I will do it stringently," you are found to be bringing a goat on the first gittin.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אַיְיתִי גִּיטָּא, פַּלְגָא אִיכְּתַב קַמֵּיהּ וּפַלְגָא לָא אִיכְּתַב קַמֵּיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא כָּתַב בּוֹ אֶלָּא שִׁיטָה אַחַת לִשְׁמָהּ, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר:
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana brought a bill of divorce, half was written in his presence and half was not written in his presence. He came before Rabbi Elazar said to him: Even wrote only one line of it for her sake he is no longer required Rav Ashi said:
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana brought a bill of divorce, half of it was written before him and half of it was not written before him. He came before Rabbi Elazar, he said to him: Even if it was only written with one letter for its name, go back, it is not necessary. Rav Ashi said:

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ קַן קוּלְמוֹסָא וְקַן מְגִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Even heard the sound of the quill [ kulmusa ] and the sound of the scroll
llm_translation: Even a reed and a scroll.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם – אֲפִילּוּ הוּא בַּבַּיִת וְסוֹפֵר בָּעֲלִיָּיה, הוּא בָּעֲלִיָּיה וְסוֹפֵר בַּבַּיִת – אֲפִילּוּ נִכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא כָּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rav Ashi: one who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas, even he in the house but the scribe in the loft he in the loft and the scribe in the house even he entering and exiting the entire day valid
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ashi: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas—even if he is in the house and the husband is writing it, or the husband is in the house and he is writing it—even if he enters and exits the entire day, it is valid.

hebrew_text: הוּא בַּבַּיִת וְסוֹפֵר בָּעֲלִיָּיה?! הָא לָא קָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו כְּגוֹן דִּשְׁמַע קַן קוּלְמוֹסָא וְקַן מְגִילְּתָא.
human_translation: he in the house and the scribe in the loft, he does not see him Rather, is it not where he heard the sound of the quill and the sound of the scroll?
llm_translation: He in the house and scribe owner?! This not see to him! Rather not like that heard voice of whisper and scroll.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֲפִילּוּ נִכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא כָּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ – כָּשֵׁר. מַאן? אִילֵימָא שָׁלִיחַ, הַשְׁתָּא הוּא בַּבַּיִת וְסוֹפֵר בָּעֲלִיָּיה, דְּלָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ – אָמְרַתְּ כָּשֵׁר, נִכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא מִיבַּעְיָא?! אֶלָּא סוֹפֵר? פְּשִׁיטָא! מִשּׁוּם דְּנִכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא נִפְסְלִינֵּיהּ?!
human_translation: The Master said Even he entering and exiting the entire day, valid. Who If we say agent, now he in the house and the scribe in the loft, when does not see you said valid, is necessary he entering and exiting Rather, scribe is obvious, would we render invalid because he entering and exiting?
llm_translation: Master said: Even if he enters and exits the entire day - it is valid. Who? If you say a messenger, now he is in the house and the homeowner is counting, since he does not see him - you say it is valid, he enters and exits from the door?! Rather, a counter? Obviously! Because if he enters and exits, his count is invalidated?!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּנְפַק לְשׁוּקָא וַאֲתָא; מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No, necessary where exited to the market and returned Lest you say another person found him and told him teaches us
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he went out to the market and came back; lest one might say, another person found it and told him, "He is listening to us."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: בָּבֶל; רַב אָמַר: כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְגִיטִּין, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: כְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: It was stated Rav says Babylonia like Eretz Yisrael with regard to bills of divorce, and Shmuel says like outside of Eretz
llm_translation: It was stated: in Babylonia; Rav said: like the land of Israel for divorce documents, and Shmuel said: like outside the land.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהָנֵי גְּמִירִי; וּמָר סָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְהָנֵי נָמֵי לָא שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: Shall we say disagree with regard to this, that Sage, holds because they are not experts for her sake, and these are learned. And Sage, holds because there are no witnesses available to ratify it, and these are also not frequently
llm_translation: Let us say in this case they are in disagreement: for Mar holds that since they are not experts in her name, and those are learned; and Mar holds that since reliable witnesses are not present to establish it, and those are not common.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! הָא רַבָּה אִית לֵיהּ דְּרָבָא!
human_translation: And can you understand it But Rabba, is of of Rava,
llm_translation: And will it be created?! But Rabba has the opinion of Rava!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעֵינַן לְקַיְּימוֹ; רַב סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא מְתִיבָתָא, מִישְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחִי; וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: מְתִיבָתָא בְּגִירְסַיְיהוּ טְרִידִי.
human_translation: Rather, everyone we require to ratify it, Rav holds since there are academies are frequently And Shmuel holds academies are preoccupied by their studies;
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world we require for its establishment; Rav holds: since there is a contradiction, we find it common; and Shmuel holds: the contradiction in their versions is resolved.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עָשִׂינוּ עַצְמֵינוּ בְּבָבֶל כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְגִיטִּין, מִכִּי אֲתָא רַב לְבָבֶל.
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Abba says Rav Huna says: We made ourselves in Babylonia like Eretz Yisrael with regard to bills of divorce, from when Rav came to Babylonia.
llm_translation: It was stated similarly: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna: We made ourselves in Babylon like the Land of Israel regarding divorce documents, for when Rav came to Babylon.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מֵרְקָם לְמִזְרָח, וּרְקָם – כַּמִּזְרָח, מֵאַשְׁקְלוֹן לַדָּרוֹם, וְאַשְׁקְלוֹן – כַּדָּרוֹם, מֵעַכּוֹ לַצָּפוֹן, וְעַכּוֹ – כַּצָּפוֹן. וְהָא בָּבֶל לִצְפוֹנָהּ דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָיְימָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֵלָי מִצָּפוֹן תִּפָּתַח הָרָעָה״,
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda says: From Rekem eastward and Rekem is like east From Ashkelon southward and Ashkelon is like south From Akko northward and Akko is like north But Babylonia is situated north of Eretz Yisrael, as it is written “Then the Lord said to me: Out of the north the evil shall break forth”
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a contradiction: Rabbi Yehuda says: From Merkam to the east, and Merkam is like the east, from Ashkelon to the south, and Ashkelon is like the south, from Akko to the north, and Akko is like the north. But isn't Babylonia to its north, where the land of Israel is established, as it is written: "And the Lord said to me, 'From the north, disaster will be poured out.'"

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַכּוֹ – כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְגִיטִּין; וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר לָא קָאָמַר אֶלָּא בְּעַכּוֹ דִּמְקָרְבָא, אֲבָל בָּבֶל דִּמְרַחֲקָא, לָא! הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: לְבַר מִבָּבֶל.
human_translation: And we learned Rabbi Meir says: Akko is like Eretz Yisrael with regard to bills of divorce, and even Rabbi Meir said only with regard to Akko, which is close However, Babylonia, which is far no, raised and he resolved it with the exception of Babylonia.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Meir says: Akko is like the land of Israel regarding divorce documents. And even Rabbi Meir did not say this except in the case of Akko, which is close by, but not in the case of Babylon, which is far away! He presents it and he explains it: regarding a son from Babylon.

hebrew_text: עַד הֵיכָן הִיא בָּבֶל? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּמַחֲלוֹקֶת לְיוּחֲסִין, כָּךְ מַחֲלוֹקֶת לְגִיטִּין. וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: מַחֲלוֹקֶת לְיוּחֲסִין, אֲבָל לְגִיטִּין דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עַד אַרְבָּא תִּנְיָינָא דְּגִישְׁרָא.
human_translation: Until where is Babylonia? Rav Pappa says: as a dispute with regard to lineage so dispute with regard to bills of divorce. And Rav Yosef says: dispute to lineage. However, with regard to bills of divorce, everyone agrees until the second arch of the bridge
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ad heichan hi Bavél? Amar Rav Papa: Ke'machaloket le'yuchasin, kach machaloket le'gittin. Ve'Rav Yosef amar: Machaloket le'yuchasin, aval le'gittin divrei hakol ad arba tinayina d'Gishra." English translation: "Until where is Babylon? Rav Papa said: Just as there is a dispute regarding lineage, so too there is a dispute regarding divorce documents. And Rav Yosef said: There is a dispute regarding lineage, but regarding divorce documents, everyone agrees until the fourth clause of Gishra."

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא מַצְרֵיךְ מֵאַקְטֵיסְפוֹן לְבֵי אַרְדָּשִׁיר, וּמִבֵּי אַרְדָּשִׁיר לְאַקְטֵיסְפוֹן לָא מַצְרֵיךְ. לֵימָא קָסָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהָנֵי גְּמִירִי?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda required from Akteisfon to Bei Ardeshir But from Bei Ardeshir to Akteisfon he did not require Shall we say he holds because they are not experts for her sake, and these learned
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda requires from Akteisfon to the house of Ardeshir, but from the house of Ardeshir to Akteisfon is not required. Let us say he holds that they are not knowledgeable in its name, and these are the traditions?

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! וְהָא רַבָּה אִית לֵיהּ דְּרָבָא! אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעֵינַן לְקַיְּימוֹ; וְהָנֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּאָזְלִי לְשׁוּקָא לְהָתָם – הָנָךְ יָדְעִי בַּחֲתִימוֹת יְדָא דְּהָנֵי,
human_translation: And can you understand But Rabba is of of Rava, Rather, everyone that we require to ratify and these since they go to the market there, these recognize the signatures of these
llm_translation: And it was created?! But Rabba has a companion! Rather, the whole world needs him to fulfill; and these, once they go to the market to be there - you know by the seals of the hand of these.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי בִּדְהָנָךְ לָא יָדְעִי. מַאי טַעְמָא? בְּשׁוּקַיְיהוּ טְרִידִי.
human_translation: But these do not recognize of these What is the reason They are preoccupied by their market
llm_translation: These in the city of Bidehank do not know. What is the reason? In their markets they are occupied.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ מַצְרֵיךְ מֵעַרְסָא לְעַרְסָא, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מַצְרֵיךְ מִשְּׁכוּנָה לִשְׁכוּנָה, וְרָבָא מַצְרֵיךְ בְּאוֹתָהּ שְׁכוּנָה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Avuh would require from side to side [ me’arsa le’arsa ]. Rav Sheshet required from group to group And Rava required within the same group
llm_translation: Rabba bar Avuh requires from courtyard to courtyard, Rav Sheshet requires from dwelling to dwelling, and Rava requires in that same neighborhood.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ? שָׁאנֵי בְּנֵי מָחוֹזָא, דְּנָיְידִי.
human_translation: But Rava is who said because there are no witnesses available to ratify it, the residents of Meḥoza are different, as they are mobile,
llm_translation: And Rava is the one who said: "Because reliable witnesses are not available to establish it?" This is different with the people of Mahoza, for they are meticulous.

hebrew_text: רַב חָנִין מִישְׁתַּעֵי: רַב כָּהֲנָא אַיְיתִי גִּיטָּא, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא אִי מִסּוּרָא לִנְהַרְדְּעָא, אִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא לְסוּרָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צְרִיכְנָא לְמֵימַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אוֹ לָא צְרִיכְנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא צְרִיכַתְּ,
human_translation: Rav Ḥanin relates: Rav Kahana brought a bill of divorce, and I do not know if from Sura to Neharde’a if from Neharde’a to Sura. He came before Rav said to him: Am I required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, or am I not required said to him: You are not required
llm_translation: Rav Chanin from Ish'ta'ei: Rav Kahana brought a get, and I did not know whether it was from Nehardea to Sura, or from Sura to Nehardea. He came before Rav, and he said to him: Do we need to say, "Written in my presence and signed in my presence," or not? He said to him: You do not need to.

hebrew_text: וְאִי עֲבַדְתְּ – אַהְנֵית. מַאי ״אִי עֲבַדְתְּ אַהְנֵית״? דְּאִי אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעַר, לָא מַשְׁגְּחִינַן בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: But if you do you provide benefit. What If you do you provide benefit? that if the husband comes contest we pay no attention to him
llm_translation: "And if you did it - you benefit. What is 'if you did it - you benefit'? For if a destructive force comes, we do not pay attention to it."

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהֵבִיא גֵּט לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר לוֹ: צָרִיךְ אֲנִי לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אוֹ אֵינִי צָרִיךְ? אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, מֵהֵיכָן אַתָּה? אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, מִכְּפַר סִיסַאי אָנִי. אָמַר לוֹ: צָרִיךְ אַתָּה לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, שֶׁלֹּא תִּיזָּקֵק לְעֵדִים.
human_translation: As it is taught An incident involving a man who brought a bill of divorce before Rabbi Yishmael, said to him: Am I required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, or am I not required said to him: My son, where are you from? He said to My teacher, I am from the village of Sisai. said to him: You are required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, so you will not need to witnesses
llm_translation: As it was taught: There was an incident involving a man who brought a bill of divorce before Rabbi Yishmael. He said to him: Do I need to say, "It was written and signed in my presence," or not? He said to him: My son, where are you from? He said to him: Rabbi, I am from the village of Sisai. He said to him: You must say, "It was written and signed in my presence," so that the witnesses will not be invalidated.

hebrew_text: לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּצָא, נִכְנַס לְפָנָיו רַבִּי אִלְעַאי, אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, וַהֲלֹא כְּפַר סִיסַאי מוּבְלַעַת בִּתְחוּם אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּקְרוֹבָה לְצִיפּוֹרִי יוֹתֵר מֵעַכּוֹ; וּתְנַן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַכּוֹ – כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְגִיטִּין, וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן לָא פְּלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אֶלָּא בְּעַכּוֹ דִּמְרַחֲקָא, אֲבָל כְּפַר סִיסַאי דִּמְקָרְבָא – לָא!
human_translation: After left, Rabbi Elai entered before said to him: My teacher, but isn’t the village of Sisai within the boundary of Eretz Yisrael, and closer to Tzippori, more than Akko. And we learned Rabbi Meir says: Akko like Eretz Yisrael with regard to bills of divorce. And even the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Meir only with regard to Akko, which is distant. However, the village of Sisai, which is close, no,
llm_translation: After he left, Rabbi Elai entered before him, and said to him: Rabbi, is it not the case that the village of Sisai is situated within the boundaries of the land of Israel, and is closer to Tzippori than Akko? And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Meir says: Akko is like the land of Israel for divorce documents, and even the Rabbis do not disagree with Rabbi Meir except in the case of Akko which is distant, but as for the village of Sisai which is close - no!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: שְׁתוֹק בְּנִי, שְׁתוֹק, הוֹאִיל וְיָצָא הַדָּבָר בְּהֶיתֵּר – יָצָא.
human_translation: said to Be silent my son, be silent. Since the matter was issued as permitted, it was issued,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Be silent, my son, be silent, since the matter has been permitted - it has been permitted."

hebrew_text: הָא אִיהוּ נָמֵי, ״שֶׁלֹּא תִּיזָּקֵק לְעֵדִים״ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ! לָא סַיְּימוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: But also said to so you will not need to witnesses. did not conclude before
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "The, where is he, 'that he not be broken for witnesses' he said to him! Not they finished it before him."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶבְיָתָר לְרַב חִסְדָּא: גִּיטִּין הַבָּאִים מִשָּׁם לְכָאן, אֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״. לֵימָא קָסָבַר לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהָנֵי גְּמִירִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Evyatar sent to Rav Ḥisda bills of divorce that come from there, to here, is not required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. Shall we say holds because they are not experts for her sake, and these are learned
llm_translation: Send to him Rabbi Aviyatar to Rav Chisda: Divorce documents that come from there to here, no need to say "written and signed in my presence." Let us say he holds that since they are not knowledgeable of her name, are these valid?

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! וְהָא רַבָּה אִית לֵיהּ דְּרָבָא! אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעֵינַן לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא רַבִּים דְּסָלְקִי וְנָחֲתִי – מִישְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: And can you understand Rabba is of of Rava, Rather, everyone agrees that we require to ratify But since there are many who ascend and descend are frequently
