llm_translation: And will it be created?! But Rabba has Rava! Rather, the entire world we require for its existence, and once there are many who depart and arrive - we find it common.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּרַבִּי אֶבְיָתָר בַּר סַמְכָא הוּא? וְעוֹד, הָא אִיהוּ דִּשְׁלַח לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה: בְּנֵי אָדָם הָעוֹלִין מִשָּׁם לְכָאן, הֵן קִיְּימוּ בְּעַצְמָן: ״וַיִּתְּנוּ (אֶת) הַיֶּלֶד בַּזּוֹנָה וְהַיַּלְדָּה מָכְרוּ בַיַּיִן וַיִּשְׁתּוּ״, וּכְתַב לֵיהּ בְּלָא שִׂירְטוּט;
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Who will tell us Rabbi Evyatar is a reliable And furthermore, He the one who sent to Rav Yehuda, People who ascend from there, to here, fulfill by themselves “And they have given a boy for a prostitute, and sold a girl for wine, and have drunk” And wrote him without scoring,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Who will say to us that Rabbi Aviatar bar Samka is reliable? Furthermore, he who sent to Rav Yehuda: "The children of those who ascend from there to here, they have established themselves: 'And they gave the child to a prostitute, and the girl they sold for wine, and they drank,'" and he wrote to him without hesitation.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שְׁתַּיִם כּוֹתְבִין, שָׁלֹשׁ אֵין כּוֹתְבִין; בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: שָׁלֹשׁ כּוֹתְבִין, אַרְבַּע אֵין כּוֹתְבִין!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says One may write two one may not write three it was taught in a baraita : One may write three, one may not write four.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Two write, three do not write; in the Mishnah it was taught: Three write, four do not write!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַטּוּ כֹּל דְּלָא יָדַע הָא דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק, לָאו גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא מִילְּתָא דְתַלְיָא בִּסְבָרָא – לְחַיֵּי; הָא – גְּמָרָא הִיא, וּגְמָרָא לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Is that to say anyone who does not know this of Rabbi Yitzḥak is not a great man? Granted, a matter that depends on reasoning, it is well, this is a tradition, and did not hear tradition.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Now, everyone who does not know this that Rabbi Yitzchak said, is he not a great man?! Granted, a matter that depends on reasoning - yes; but this - it is a tradition, and a tradition is not heard by him.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הָא רַבִּי אֶבְיָתָר הוּא דְּאַסְכֵּים מָרֵיהּ עַל יְדֵיהּ; דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּזְנֶה עָלָיו פִּילַגְשׁוֹ״, רַבִּי אֶבְיָתָר אָמַר: זְבוּב מָצָא לָהּ. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אָמַר: נִימָא מָצָא לָהּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Evyatar that his Master, agreed with as it is written “And his concubine went away from him” Rabbi Evyatar says: He found her a fly Rabbi Yonatan says: He found her a hair [ nima ].
llm_translation: And furthermore, this is Rabbi Aviyatar who agrees with his master; as it is written: "And his concubine played the harlot against him," Rabbi Aviyatar said: A fly found her. Rabbi Yonatan said: A gnat found her.

hebrew_text: וְאַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶבְיָתָר לְאֵלִיָּהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי קָא עָבֵיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָסֵיק בְּפִילֶגֶשׁ בַּגִּבְעָה. וּמַאי קָאָמַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶבְיָתָר בְּנִי כָּךְ הוּא אוֹמֵר, יוֹנָתָן בְּנִי כָּךְ הוּא אוֹמֵר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Evyatar found Elijah said to him: What is the Holy One, Blessed be He, doing said to him: He is engaged in the concubine in Gibeah. And what is He saying said to him Evyatar, My son, says this Yonatan, My son, says that.
llm_translation: And he found Rabbi Aviathar to Elijah, said to him: What is the Holy One, blessed be He, doing? He said to him: He is engaged with a concubine on the hill. And what is he saying? He said to him: Aviathar my son says so, or Jonathan my son says so.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם, וּמִי אִיכָּא סְפֵיקָא קַמֵּי שְׁמַיָּא?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ דִּבְרֵי אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים הֵן – זְבוּב מָצָא וְלֹא הִקְפִּיד, נִימָא מָצָא וְהִקְפִּיד.
human_translation: said to him: God forbid, is there uncertainty before Heaven? said to him: these and those are the words of the living God, He found a fly and did not take umbrage, he found a hair and took umbrage.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Peace be upon you, is there any doubt before the heavens?!" He said to him: "These and these are the words of the living God - a fly was found and was not concerned, a gnat was found and was concerned."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: זְבוּב בַּקְּעָרָה, וְנִימָא בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם; זְבוּב – מְאִיסוּתָא, וְנִימָא – סַכַּנְתָּא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בַּקְּעָרָה; זְבוּב – אוּנְסָא, וְנִימָא – פְּשִׁיעוּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says a fly in the dish and a hair in that place, a fly disgust, but hair danger, There are who say: This and that in a dish. fly circumstances beyond control, but the hair negligence.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A fly in a bowl, and a mosquito in the same place; a fly - disgust, and a mosquito - danger. Some say: both in a bowl; a fly - coercion, and a mosquito - violence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לְעוֹלָם אַל יָטִיל אָדָם אֵימָה יְתֵירָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁהֲרֵי פִּילֶגֶשׁ בַּגִּבְעָה הֵטִיל עָלֶיהָ בַּעֲלָהּ אֵימָה יְתֵירָה, וְהִפִּילָה כַּמָּה רְבָבוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: A person should never impose excessive fear upon his household, as the husband of the concubine of Gibeah imposed excessive fear upon her and caused the downfall of many tens of thousands of Jews
llm_translation: Rav Hisda said: Always a person should not cast excessive fear within his household, for behold, the concubine in Gibeah, her husband cast excessive fear upon her, and she fell, causing the death of many thousands of Israelites.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַמֵּטִיל אֵימָה יְתֵירָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, סוֹף הוּא בָּא לִידֵי שָׁלֹשׁ עֲבֵירוֹת: גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, וְחִילּוּל שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Anyone who imposes excessive fear upon his household ultimately come to three sins: Engaging in forbidden sexual intercourse, and bloodshed, and desecration of Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who instills excessive fear within his household, ultimately leads to three transgressions: revealing forbidden relationships, shedding blood, and desecrating the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: הָא דְּאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים צָרִיךְ אָדָם לוֹמַר בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה: עִשַּׂרְתֶּם? עֵרַבְתֶּם? הַדְלִיקוּ אֶת הַנֵּר! צָרִיךְ
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said this that the Sages said: three matters a person must say in his home on Shabbat eve at nightfall. Have you tithed Have you placed the eiruv light the lamp must
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: This that the Rabbis say: Three things a person must say within his home on Friday evening at dusk: Have you given tithes? Have you made an Eruv? Light the candle! It is necessary.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרִינְהוּ בְּנִיחוּתָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיקַבְּלוּ מִינֵּיהּ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנָא לָא שְׁמִיעָא לִי הָא דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, וְקִיַּימְתִּיהָ מִסְּבָרָא.
human_translation: say them with calmness so that they will accept from him. Rav Ashi said: I did not hear this of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, and I fulfilled it through reasoning.
llm_translation: To say to them in a gentle manner, so that they may accept it from him. Rav Ashi said: I did not hear this that Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, but I have established it through reasoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לְעוֹלָם אַל יָטִיל אָדָם אֵימָה יְתֵירָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם גָּדוֹל הֵטִיל אֵימָה יְתֵירָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וְהֶאֱכִילוּהוּ דָּבָר גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: A person should never impose excessive fear upon his household, as a great man imposed excessive fear upon his household and they fed him something a great
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Always a person should not cast excessive fear within his house, for behold a great person cast excessive fear within his house and they fed him a great thing.

hebrew_text: וּמַנּוּ? רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. הֶאֱכִילוּהוּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! הַשְׁתָּא בְּהֶמְתָּן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדָם, צַדִּיקִים עַצְמָן לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: And who was Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel. Would it enter your mind they fed him Now the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not cause an error through the animals of the righteous. the righteous themselves not all the more so?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is it? Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel. Did they feed him to you without your knowledge?! Now, in the livestock of the righteous, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not bring a calamity through them; the righteous themselves, all the more so?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בִּקְּשׁוּ לְהַאֲכִילוֹ דָּבָר גָּדוֹל. וּמַאי נִיהוּ? אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי.
human_translation: Rather, they sought to feed him something a great And what was this? A limb from a living
llm_translation: Instead, they sought to feed him something large. And what is it? A limb from a living animal.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ מָר עוּקְבָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּנֵי אָדָם הָעוֹמְדִים עָלַי, וּבְיָדִי לְמׇסְרָם לַמַּלְכוּת, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Mar Ukva, sent to Rabbi Elazar, people who stand over me, and I have the power to deliver them into the government, what is
llm_translation: Send to him Mar Ukva to Rabbi Elazar: "People standing against me, and in my hand to deliver them to the kingdom, what?"

hebrew_text: שִׂרְטֵט וּכְתַב לֵיהּ: ״אָמַרְתִּי אֶשְׁמְרָה דְרָכַי מֵחֲטוֹא בִלְשׁוֹנִי אֶשְׁמְרָה לְפִי מַחְסוֹם בְּעוֹד רָשָׁע לְנֶגְדִּי״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרָשָׁע לְנֶגְדִּי, אֶשְׁמְרָה לְפִי מַחְסוֹם.
human_translation: scored and wrote to him “I said: I will take heed to my ways, that I do not sin with my tongue; I will keep a curb upon my mouth, while the wicked is before me” Even though “the wicked is before me,” “I will keep a curb upon my mouth.”
llm_translation: He sketched and wrote for him: "I said, 'I will guard my ways from sinning with my tongue; I will guard my mouth with a muzzle while the wicked one is before me.'" - Even though the wicked one is before me, I will guard my mouth with a muzzle.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: קָא מְצַעֲרִי לִי טוּבָא, וְלָא מָצֵינָא דְּאֵיקוּם בְּהוּ. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: ״דּוֹם לַה׳ וְהִתְחוֹלֵל לוֹ״ – דּוֹם לַה׳, וְהוּא יַפִּילֵם לְךָ חֲלָלִים חֲלָלִים; הַשְׁכֵּם וְהַעֲרֵב עֲלֵיהֶן לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, וְהֵן כָּלִין מֵאֵילֵיהֶן. הַדָּבָר יָצָא מִפִּי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וּנְתָנוּהוּ לִגְנִיבָא בְּקוֹלָר.
human_translation: sent him They are tormenting me a great deal and I cannot stand them. sent to him “Resign yourself to the Lord, and wait patiently [ hitḥolel ] for Him; “Resign yourself to the Lord,” and He will strike them down as many corpses [ ḥalalim ]. Rise before and stay later than them to the study hall, and they will disappear on their own. The matter emerged from the mouth of Rabbi Elazar, and Geneiva, was placed in a neck iron [ kolar ],
llm_translation: Send him: he is causing me distress, and I did not find that they have risen against him. Send him: "Be silent before the Lord and wait for Him" - be silent before the Lord, and He will cause them to fall before you, slain, slain; rise early and bring them to the study hall, and they will be consumed from their own strength. This matter came from the mouth of Rabbi Elazar, and they gave it to Gneiva in a collar.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לְמָר עוּקְבָא: זִמְרָא מְנָא לַן דַּאֲסִיר? שִׂרְטֵט וּכְתַב לְהוּ: ״אַל תִּשְׂמַח יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶל גִּיל בְּעַמִּים״.
human_translation: They sent to Mar Ukva: From where do we song is forbidden He scored and wrote to them: “Rejoice not, O Israel, to exultation, like the peoples”
llm_translation: Send to him to Master Ukva: From where do we know that it is prohibited? He drew and wrote to them: "Do not rejoice, O Israel, to jubilation among the nations."

hebrew_text: וְלִישְׁלַח לְהוּ מֵהָכָא: ״בַּשִּׁיר לֹא יִשְׁתּוּ יָיִן יֵמַר שֵׁכָר לְשׁוֹתָיו״! אִי מֵהָהוּא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי זִמְרָא דְמָנָא, אֲבָל דְּפוּמָּא שְׁרֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And let him send them from here: “They do not drink wine with a song; strong drink is bitter to them who drink it” If by that I would say this matter instrumental music, however, vocal permitted. teaches us
llm_translation: And to send to them from here: "In song they shall not drink wine, bitter shall be the drink for those who drink"! If from there, I would have said these words of song are prohibited, but plain drinking is permitted, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״קִינָה וְדִימוֹנָה וְעַדְעָדָה״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָתְוָותָא דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָחָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Natan said to Rav Ashi: What which is written: “Kina, and Dimonah, and Adadah” He said to him: is listing the cities of Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna the son of Nathan said to Rav Ashi: What is the meaning of what is written, "Kinnah, Dimonah, and Adadah"? He said to him: The cities of the Land of Israel are significant.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ אֲנָא לָא יָדַעְנָא דְּמָתְוָותָא דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָא חָשֵׁיב?! אֶלָּא רַב גְּבִיהָא מֵאָרַגִּיזָא אָמַר בָּהּ טַעְמָא: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִנְאָה עַל חֲבֵירוֹ וְדוֹמֵם, שׁוֹכֵן עֲדֵי עַד עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ דִּין.
human_translation: said to him: Is that to say I don’t know that is listing the cities of Eretz Yisrael? Rather, Rav Geviha from Argiza said an explanation of Anyone who harbors jealousy [ kina ] toward another, and silent [ domem ], He who dwells for all eternity [ adei ad ] performs judgment on his behalf.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Do I not know that the deaths of the Land of Israel are considered significant?! Rather, Rav Geviha from Argiza said in it a reason: Anyone who has jealousy for his fellow and remains silent, is as if he consents to his actions until he brings judgment upon himself."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״צִקְלָג וּמַדְמֵנָה וְסַנְסַנָּהּ״ הָכִי נָמֵי?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה רַב גְּבִיהָא מִבֵּי אָרַגִּיזָא הָכָא, הֲוָה אָמַר בָּהּ טַעְמָא. רַב אַחָא מִבֵּי חוֹזָאָה אָמַר בַּהּ הָכִי: כָּל מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ צַעֲקַת לְגִימָא עַל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְדוֹמֵם, שׁוֹכֵן בַּסְּנֶה עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ דִּין.
human_translation: said to him: If that is so, also “Ziklag, and Madmannah, and Sansannah” said to him: If Rav Geviha from Bei Argiza was here, he would say an explanation for it. Rav Aḥa from Bei Ḥoza’a said this about that Anyone who has a complaint against another over a sip [ tza’akat legima ], and silent [ domem ], the One who dwells in the bush [ seneh ] performs judgment on his behalf.
llm_translation: He said to him: Rather, from now on, is it thus stated, "Ziklag, and Madmenah, and Sansannah"?! He said to him: If Rav had been among the residents of the city of Argiza here, he would have given a reason for it. Rav Acha from the house of Choza'ah said about it thus: Anyone who has a complaint against his fellow, and remains silent, dwells in the thornbush and brings judgment upon himself.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא לְרַב הוּנָא: כְּלִילָא מְנָא לַן דְּאָסוּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: בַּפּוּלְמוּס שֶׁל אַסְפַּסְיָינוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת חֲתָנִים וְעַל הָאִירוּס.
human_translation: The Exilarch said to Rav Huna: From where do we prohibited a garland said to him: by rabbinic law, as we learned In the war [ pulmus ] of Vespasian they decreed upon the garlands of bridegrooms, and upon the drum [ irus ],
llm_translation: He said to him, the head of the exile to Rav Huna: "Do we count that it is forbidden?" He said to him: "From the Rabbis, as we learned: In the city of Aspasyanus they decreed regarding the crowns of grooms and brides."

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי קָם רַב הוּנָא לְאִפְּנוֹיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא, קְרָא כְּתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים הָסִר הַמִּצְנֶפֶת וְהָרִם הָעֲטָרָה זֹאת לֹא זֹאת הַשָּׁפָלָה הַגְבֵּהַּ וְהַגָּבוֹהַּ הַשְׁפִּיל״ –
human_translation: In the meantime Rav Huna stood to relieve himself, Rav Ḥisda, said to A verse is written “Thus says the Lord God: The mitre shall be removed, and the garland taken off; this shall no more be the same; that which is low shall be exalted, and that which is high abased”
llm_translation: So, Rav Huna arose for the purpose of turning over, he said to him, Rav Hisda, a verse is written: "Thus says the Lord God, Remove the turban, and take off the crown; this shall not remain the same. Exalt the lowly, and bring low the exalted."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן מִצְנֶפֶת אֵצֶל עֲטָרָה? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: בִּזְמַן שֶׁמִּצְנֶפֶת בְּרֹאשׁ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל – עֲטָרָה בְּרֹאשׁ כׇּל אָדָם, נִסְתַּלְּקָה מִצְנֶפֶת מֵרֹאשׁ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל – נִסְתַּלְּקָה עֲטָרָה מֵרֹאשׁ כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: But in what way is a mitre connected to a garland? Rather, to say to you: When the mitre is on the head of the High Priest, a garland on the head of every man the mitre is removed from the head of the High Priest, the garland is removed from the head of every man.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And what is the relevance of the mitznefet (turban) in relation to the atarah (crown)? Rather, to tell you: when the mitznefet is on the head of the High Priest - the atarah is on the head of every person; if the mitznefet is removed from the head of the High Priest - the atarah is removed from the head of every person."

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא רַב הוּנָא, אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דַּהֲוֵי יָתְבִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָאֱלֹהִים! מִדְּרַבָּנַן, אֶלָּא חִסְדָּא שְׁמָךְ וְחִסְדָּאִין מִילָּךְ.
human_translation: In the meantime, Rav Huna came he found them sitting He said to By God! by rabbinic law. However, your name is Ḥisda and your words find favor [ ḥisda’in ],
llm_translation: So now Rav Huna came, found him sitting, said to him: "O God! From the Rabbis, rather, Your name is kindness and Your acts are kindness."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי דַּהֲוָה גָּדֵיל כְּלִילָא לִבְרַתֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר: ״הָסִר הַמִּצְנֶפֶת וְהָרִם הָעֲטָרָה״?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דּוּמְיָא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל – בְּגַבְרֵי, אֲבָל בִּנְשֵׁי – לָא.
human_translation: Ravina found Mar bar Rav Ashi braiding a garland for his daughter He said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold “The mitre shall be removed and the garland taken off”? He said to him: similar to a High Priest, with regard to men. However, with regard to women, not
llm_translation: Ravina found Mar bar Rav Ashi who was wearing a crown on his head, he said to him: Does the master not hold: "Remove the turban and take off the crown"?! He said to him: The turban of the High Priest is for men, but for women - no.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״זֹאת לֹא זֹאת״? דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי עַוִּירָא, זִימְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַמֵּי, וְזִימְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: ״הָסִר הַמִּצְנֶפֶת וְהָרִם הָעֲטָרָה״, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, זֹאת לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁהִקְדִּימוּ לְפָנֶיךָ בְּסִינַי ״נַעֲשֶׂה״ לְ״נִשְׁמָע״?!
human_translation: What “This shall no more be the same”? Rabbi Avira interpreted homiletically. Sometimes he would say it in the name of Rav Ami, and sometimes he would say it in the name of Rav Asi: When the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Jewish people “Remove the mitre and take off the garland,” the ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, this for the Jewish people, who, at Sinai, preceded “We will do” to “We will hear”
llm_translation: What is "this is not this"? Rabbi Avira sought to explain: Sometimes Rabbi Ammi said to her in the name of Rabbi Ammi, and sometimes Rabbi Assi said to her in the name of Rabbi Assi: At the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Israel, "Remove the mitznefet (turban) and lift the atarah (crown)," the ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, this is for them (the Israelites), for they declared before You at Sinai, "We will do" before "we will hear"?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: לֹא זֹאת לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁהִשְׁפִּילוּ אֶת הַגָּבוֹהַּ וְהִגְבִּיהוּ אֶת הַשָּׁפֵל, וְהֶעֱמִידוּ צֶלֶם בַּהֵיכָל?!
human_translation: said to them: this not for the Jewish people, who lowered the exalted and who exalted the lowly, and they established an idol in the Sanctuary?
llm_translation: He said to them: "This is not for them, for the Israelites, that they lowered the high and raised the lowly, and established an image in the sanctuary?!"

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב עַוִּירָא, זִימְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַמֵּי, וְזִימְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי – מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אִם שְׁלֵמִים וְכֵן רַבִּים וְכֵן נָגוֹזּוּ וְעָבָר וְגוֹ׳״? אִם רוֹאֶה אָדָם שֶׁמְּזוֹנוֹתָיו מְצוּמְצָמִין – יַעֲשֶׂה מֵהֶן צְדָקָה. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן כְּשֶׁהֵן מְרוּבִּין.
human_translation: Rav Avira interpreted homiletically. Sometimes he would say it in the name of Rav Ami, and sometimes he would say it in the name of Rav Asi: What which is written: “Thus says the Lord: Though they be in full strength [ shelemim ], and likewise many, even so shall they be cut down, and he shall pass away; If a person sees that his sustenance is limited he should use it for charity, and all the more so when it is plentiful.
llm_translation: Rav Avira expounded: Sometimes he said to her in the name of Rav Ammi, and sometimes he said to her in the name of Rav Assi - what is the meaning of what is written: "So says the Lord, if they are complete and so are many, and so they are afflicted and pass away, etc."? If a person sees that his sustenance is constricted, he should give charity from it. And all the more so when they are abundant.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְכֵן נָגוֹזּוּ וְעָבַר״? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל הַגּוֹזֵז מִנְּכָסָיו וְעוֹשֶׂה מֵהֶן צְדָקָה – נִיצָּל מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם. מָשָׁל לִשְׁתֵּי רְחֵילוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹבְרוֹת בְּמַיִם, אַחַת גְּזוּזָה וְאַחַת אֵינָהּ גְּזוּזָה; גְּזוּזָה עָבְרָה, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ גְּזוּזָה לֹא עָבְרָה.
human_translation: What “Even so shall they be cut down [ nagozzu ], and he shall pass away”? the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Anyone who shears off [ gozez ] of his property and performs charity with it will be saved from the judgment of Gehenna. a parable to two sheep that were passing through the water. One shorn and one unshorn. shorn crossed but the unshorn did not cross,
llm_translation: What is meant by "and thus they were sheared and passed over"? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: Anyone who shears from his possessions and makes charity from them - he is saved from the judgment of Gehenna. It is compared to two streams that were flowing, one sheared and one not sheared; the sheared one passed over, and the one not sheared did not pass over.

hebrew_text: ״וְעִנִּתִךְ״ – אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: אֲפִילּוּ עָנִי הַמִּתְפַּרְנֵס מִן הַצְּדָקָה, יַעֲשֶׂה צְדָקָה. ״לֹא אַעֲנֵּךְ עוֹד״ – תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: שׁוּב אֵין מַרְאִין לוֹ סִימָנֵי עֲנִיּוּת.
human_translation: “And though I have afflicted you [ ve’innitikh ]” Mar Zutra says: even a poor person [ ani ] who is sustained from charity perform charity. “And I will afflict you [ a’anekh ] no more,” Rav Yosef teaches: will no longer show him signs of poverty [ aniyyut ].
llm_translation: "and He will afflict you" - said Mar Zutra: Even a poor person who sustains himself from charity, should give charity. "I will not afflict you anymore" - taught Rav Yosef: Return, and signs of poverty will not be visible to him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, מִרְקָם לַמִּזְרָח כּוּ׳: לְמֵימְרָא דְּעַכּוֹ לִצְפוֹנָהּ דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָיְימָא?! וּרְמִינְהוּ: הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ מֵעַכּוֹ לִכְזִיב; מִימִינוֹ – לְמִזְרַח הַדֶּרֶךְ – טְמֵאָה מִשּׁוּם אֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים, וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר וּמִן הַשְּׁבִיעִית, עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ שֶׁהִיא חַיֶּיבֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: From Rekem and eastward Is this to say that Akko is located to north of Eretz Yisrael? And raises a contradiction was traveling from Akko to Keziv, on his right, to the east of the road, impure due to the land of the nations, and is exempt from the tithe and from the Sabbatical until where it is known to you that it is obligated.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One who walks from Akko to Ziv, to say that the land of Israel is to its north?! And it was asked: If one was walking from Akko to Kziv, to his right - to the east of the road - it is impure due to being land of the nations, and exempt from tithing and the seventh year, until it is known to you that it is obligated."

hebrew_text: מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ – לְמַעֲרַב הַדֶּרֶךְ – טְהוֹרָה מִשּׁוּם אֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים, וְחַיֶּיבֶת בְּמַעֲשֵׂר וּבִשְׁבִיעִית, עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ שֶׁהִיא פְּטוּרָה. עַד הֵיכָן? עַד כְּזִיב. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: עַד לַבְלָבוֹ.
human_translation: on his left, to the west of the road, pure with regard to the land of the nations, and obligated in the tithe and in the Sabbatical until where it is known to you that it is exempt. Until where Until Keziv. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said in the name of his father: Until Lavlevu.
llm_translation: From his left - to the west of the road - pure because of the land of the nations, and obligated in tithing and the seventh year, until it is known to you that it is exempt. Until when? Until the time of ziv. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: Until the heart.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רְצוּעָה נָפְקָא. וְיָהֵיב תַּנָּא סִימָנָא הָכִי?! אִין; קְרָא נָמֵי יָהֵיב סִימָנָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ הִנֵּה חַג ה׳ בְּשִׁילוֹ מִיָּמִים יָמִימָה אֲשֶׁר מִצְּפוֹנָה לְבֵית אֵל, מִזְרְחָה הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ לִמְסִלָּה הָעוֹלָה מִבֵּית אֵל שְׁכֶמָה, וּמִנֶּגֶב לִלְבוֹנָה״, וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְמִזְרָחָהּ שֶׁל מְסִלָּה.
human_translation: Abaye said: A strip extends But tanna provide a sign this Yes, a verse also provides a sign as it is written: “And they said: Behold, there is the feast of the Lord from year to year in Shiloh, which is on the north of Bethel, on the east side of the highway that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah” And Rav Pappa said: to the east of the highway.
llm_translation: Abaye said: A stake came out. And a Tanna gave a mnemonic like this?! No; the verse itself gave a mnemonic, as it is written: "And they said, 'Behold, there is a feast of the Lord in Shiloh from year to year, which is on the north side of Bethel, on the east side of the highway that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah.'" And Rav Papa said: To the east of the highway.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא חֲדָא: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט בִּסְפִינָה – כְּמֵבִיא בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ – כְּמֵבִיא בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ!
human_translation: It was taught one One who brings a bill of divorce on a boat like one who brings in Eretz Yisrael, And it is taught another like one who brings outside of Eretz
llm_translation: One scholar taught: One who brings a bill of divorce by ship - it is like bringing it in the land of Israel. And another teaching: it is like bringing it outside the land!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָא רַבָּנַן. דִּתְנַן: עֲפַר חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ הַבָּא בִּסְפִינָה לָאָרֶץ – חַיָּיב בְּמַעֲשֵׂר וּבִשְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: not difficult, this Rabbi Yehuda, that the Rabbis. As we learned soil from outside of Eretz that is brought on a boat to Eretz is obligated in tithe and in the Sabbatical
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Not difficult, for Rabbi Yehuda is considered the Rabbis. As we learned: Dust from outside the land that comes by ship to the land - is obligated in tithing and in the Sabbatical year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַסְּפִינָה גּוֹשֶׁשֶׁת, אֲבָל אֵין הַסְּפִינָה גּוֹשֶׁשֶׁת – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When When the boat is skimming [ gosheshet ] However, the boat is not skimming exempt.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda: When? When the ship is aground, but if the ship is not aground - exempt.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הָא וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין הַסְּפִינָה גּוֹשֶׁשֶׁת, כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַסְּפִינָה גּוֹשֶׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: Abaye said: this and that Rabbi Yehuda, and not difficult: Here, when the boat is not skimming there, when the boat is skimming
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Here and here is Rabbi Yehuda, and it is not difficult: here when the ship is not tilted, here when the ship is tilted."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: עָצִיץ נָקוּב הַמּוּנָּח עַל גַּבֵּי יְתֵדוֹת, בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: a perforated pot that is resting on pegs, we have arrived at the dispute Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: A perforated flowerpot placed on top of its pegs, we come to the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דִּילְמָא לָא הִיא – עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם אֶלָּא בִּסְפִינָה,
human_translation: Rava said, Perhaps is not so, Rabbi Yehuda says only there, with regard to a boat,
llm_translation: Rava said: Perhaps it is not so - until here Rabbi Yehuda did not say there, except in a ship.

hebrew_text: הָעֲשׂוּיָה לִבְרוֹחַ, אֲבָל עָצִיץ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי לִבְרוֹחַ – לֹא.
human_translation: which is made to move, However, a flowerpot, which is not made to move, no,
llm_translation: The vessel made for fragrance, but a flowerpot, which is not made for fragrance - no.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם אֶלָּא בִּסְפִינָה, דְּלָא מַפְסֵיק אַוֵּירָא – דְּמַיָּא כִּי אַרְעָא סְמִיכְתָּא דָּמְיָא; אֲבָל עָצִיץ, דְּמַפְסֵיק אַוֵּירָא – לָא.
human_translation: Alternatively, the Rabbis state only there, in a boat, where there is no barrier of airspace as water is considered to be like solid earth. But pot, where there is a barrier of airspace, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy nama: ad kan lo ka'amri rabanan hataam ela bisfinah, d'lamafsik avira - d'maya ki ara semicheta d'maya; aval atzitz, d'mafsik avira - lo." English translation: "It is not so. Until here, the Rabbis did not say there, except in a ship, for it does not interrupt the air - for the water is like the ground; but a flowerpot, which interrupts the air - no."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: בִּנְהָרוֹת דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. אֶלָּא כִּי פְּלִיגִי – בַּיָּם הַגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: With regard to rivers that are in Eretz Yisrael everyone agrees However, when they disagree with regard to the Great Sea,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: In the rivers of the land of Israel, everyone does not disagree. Rather, when they do disagree, it is in the Great Sea.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: אֵיזֶהוּ אֶרֶץ וְאֵיזֶהוּ חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁשּׁוֹפֵעַ וְיוֹרֵד מִטּוּרֵי אַמְנוֹן וְלִפְנִים – אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל; מִטּוּרֵי אַמְנוֹן וְלַחוּץ – חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. הַנִּסִּין שֶׁבַּיָּם – רוֹאִין אוֹתָן כְּאִילּוּ חוּט מָתוּחַ עֲלֵיהֶם מִטּוּרֵי אַמְנוֹן עַד נַחַל מִצְרַיִם; מִן הַחוּט וְלִפְנִים – אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל; מִן הַחוּט וְלַחוּץ – חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: As it is taught What is Eretz and what is outside of Eretz Any that descends at an angle from Turei Amnon and inward Eretz Yisrael. From Turei Amnon and outward, outside of Eretz the islands [ nissin ] that are in the sea, one views them as though a string were pulled taut over them from Turei Amnon to the River of Egypt, From the string and inward, Eretz Yisrael; from the string and outward, outside of Eretz
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: What is considered part of the land and what is considered outside the land? Any place from which water flows and descends from the mountains of Amnon and inward – that is part of the land of Israel; from the mountains of Amnon and outward – that is outside the land. Those who test the waters of the sea – they see them as if a thread is stretched over them from the mountains of Amnon to the River of Egypt; from the thread and inward – that is the land of Israel; from the thread and outward – that is outside the land.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁכְּנֶגֶד אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּגְבוּל יָם, וְהָיָה לָכֶם הַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל וּגְבוּל, זֶה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם גְּבוּל יָם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Any that across from Eretz Yisrael, is considered of Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated: “And for the western border, you shall have the Great Sea for a border, this shall be your west border”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Anything that is opposite the Land of Israel - behold, it is like the Land of Israel, as it is stated: "And the Great Sea shall be your border; this shall be your border of the Great Sea."

hebrew_text: וְהַנִּסִּין שֶׁבַּצְּדָדִין, רוֹאִין אוֹתָן כְּאִילּוּ חוּט מָתוּחַ עֲלֵיהֶן מִקַּפְלוּרְיָא וְעַד יָם אוֹקְיָינוֹס, וּמִנַּחַל מִצְרַיִם וְעַד יָם אוֹקְיָינוֹס; מִן הַחוּט וְלִפְנִים – אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִן הַחוּט וְלַחוּץ – חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: And the islands that are on the sides, one views them as though a string were pulled taut over them from Kefalorya, to the Atlantic Ocean, and from the River of Egypt until the Atlantic Ocean. from the string and inward Eretz Yisrael, from the string and outward outside of Eretz
llm_translation: And the ones who test on the sides, they see them as if a thread is stretched over them from Caplurya to the Ocean Sea, from the River of Egypt to the Ocean Sea; from within the thread - the Land of Israel, from the thread to the outside - outside the Land.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״וּגְבוּל״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְנִסִּין. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, נִסִּין לָא צְרִיכִי קְרָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this “And for the border”? They require it to islands And Rabbi Yehuda verse is not required islands,
llm_translation: The sages asked, "What does this term 'ugvul' do?" They needed it for testing. But Rabbi Yehuda said, "Testing does not require a verse."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַכּוֹ – כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכוּ׳: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: הַמּוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לְסוּרְיָא, כְּמוֹכֵר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Akko is like Eretz Yisrael raised a dilemma before Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba: One who sells his slave to Syria, he considered like one who sells outside of Eretz or not?
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Akko - like the land of Israel, and so on. Regarding a certain type of produce from Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba: One who sells his slave to a Syrian, it is like selling outside the land, is the payment due or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַכּוֹ – כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְגִיטִּין; לְגִיטִּין – אִין, לַעֲבָדִים – לָא, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן סוּרְיָא דִּמְרַחֲקָא טוּבָא.
human_translation: said to them: You learned Rabbi Meir says Akko like Eretz Yisrael with regard to bills of divorce, With regard to bills of divorce, yes, with regard to slaves, no, and all the more so Syria, which is far more distant
llm_translation: He said to them: "You should give it." Rabbi Meir says: Akko is like the land of Israel for divorces; for divorces - yes, for slaves - no, and certainly for the best Syrian distance.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּרָכִים שָׁוְותָה סוּרְיָא לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּבִשְׁלֹשָׁה לְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. (סִימָן: עָב בַּר רַק). עֲפָרָהּ טָמֵא – כְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, וְהַמּוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לְסוּרְיָא – כְּמוֹכֵר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. וְהַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִסּוּרְיָא – כְּמֵבִיא מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: The Sages taught In three ways Syria is equal to Eretz Yisrael, and in three to outside of Eretz a mnemonic Ayin beit , beit reish , reish kuf . its soil is ritually impure like outside of Eretz And one who sells his slave to Syria is like one who sells outside of Eretz And one who brings a bill of divorce from Syria is like one who brings from outside of Eretz
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Sura is considered like Eretz Yisrael in three ways, and in three ways like outside of Eretz Yisrael. (Siman: Av bar Raq). Its dust is impure - like outside of Eretz Yisrael, and one who sells his slave to Sura - is like one who sells in outside of Eretz Yisrael. And one who brings a bill of divorce from Sura - is like one who brings from outside of Eretz Yisrael.

hebrew_text: וּבִשְׁלֹשָׁה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל: חַיֶּיבֶת בְּמַעֲשֵׂר וּבִשְׁבִיעִית – כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהָרוֹצֶה לִיכָּנֵס לָהּ בְּטׇהֳרָה – נִכְנָס, וְהַקּוֹנֶה שָׂדֶה בְּסוּרְיָא –
human_translation: And in three to Eretz Yisrael: obligated in tithe and in the Sabbatical like Eretz Yisrael. And one who wishes to enter it in ritual purity may enter, And one who acquires a field in Syria
llm_translation: And in three to the land of Israel: obligated in tithing and in the Sabbatical year - like the land of Israel, and one who wishes to enter it in purity - may enter, and one who acquires a field in Suria -

hebrew_text: כְּקוֹנָהּ בְּפַרְוָארֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם. חַיֶּיבֶת בְּמַעֲשֵׂר וּבִשְׁבִיעִית כְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – קָסָבַר כִּיבּוּשׁ יָחִיד שְׁמֵיהּ כִּיבּוּשׁ.
human_translation: is like one who purchases in the outskirts [ parvarei ] of Jerusalem. obligated in tithe and the Sabbatical like Eretz Yisrael holds conquest of an individual is called a conquest.
llm_translation: As one who acquires it in the markets of Jerusalem. Obligated in tithing and in the Sabbatical year like the land of Israel - he holds that the disgrace of an individual is called disgrace.

hebrew_text: וְהָרוֹצֶה לִיכָּנֵס לָהּ בְּטׇהֳרָה נִכְנָס – וְהָאָמְרַתְּ עֲפָרָהּ טָמֵא? בְּשִׁידָּה, תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל.
human_translation: And one who wishes to enter it in ritual purity may enter. But didn’t you say its soil is ritually impure? in a chest, a box, or a cabinet.
llm_translation: "And one who wishes to enter it in purity may enter - and you say its dust is impure? By a shed, a box, and a tower."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל – רַבִּי מְטַמֵּא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְטַהֵר. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי לָא קָא מְטַמֵּא אֶלָּא בְּאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים, דְּגָזְרוּ עַל גּוּשָׁהּ וְעַל אֲוִירָהּ, אֲבָל סוּרְיָא, עַל גּוּשָׁהּ גָּזְרוּ, עַל אֲוִירָהּ לֹא גָּזְרוּ.
human_translation: As it is taught one who enters the land of the nations, in a chest, a box, or a cabinet, Rabbi deems impure, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, deems pure. And even Rabbi deems impure only in the land of the nations, which they decreed upon its clumps and upon its air. However, Syria, they decreed upon its clumps they did not decree upon its air.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who enters the land of the nations with a chest or a tower - Rabbi declares impure, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda declares pure. And even Rabbi only declares impure in the land of the nations, for they decreed regarding its enclosure and its airspace, but in Syria, they decreed regarding its enclosure, they did not decree regarding its airspace.

hebrew_text: וְהַקּוֹנֶה שָׂדֶה בְּסוּרְיָא כְּקוֹנָהּ בְּפַרְוָארֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם – לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לוֹמַר שֶׁכּוֹתְבִין עָלָיו אוֹנוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And one who purchases a field in Syria is like one who purchases in the outskirts of Jerusalem. to which halakha Rav Sheshet says: to say that one writes a bill of sale [ ono ] for this and even on Shabbat.
llm_translation: The one who acquires a field in Suria, it is as if he acquires it in the outskirts of Jerusalem - for what halakha? Rav Sheshet said: To say that they write upon it its boundary, even on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בְּשַׁבָּת סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ?! כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא: אוֹמֵר לְגוֹי וְעוֹשֶׂה; הָכָא נָמֵי אוֹמֵר לְגוֹי וְעוֹשֶׂה. וְאַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲמִירָה לְגוֹי שְׁבוּת, מִשּׁוּם יִשּׁוּב אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – לָא גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: enter your mind on Shabbat? as Rava says one tells a gentile and he does Here too, one tells a gentile and he does And even though that telling a gentile a rabbinic decree, the Sages did not decree, due to settling Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: On Shabbat, has your mind gone astray?! As Rava said: One may instruct a non-Jew to perform work; here too, one may instruct a non-Jew to perform work. And even though instructing a non-Jew to perform work on Shabbat is prohibited due to concerns about the Land of Israel being desolate, the Rabbis did not decree against it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֶבֶד שֶׁהֵבִיא גִּיטּוֹ, וְכָתוּב בּוֹ: ״עַצְמְךָ וּנְכָסַיי קְנוּיִין לָךְ״, עַצְמוֹ – קָנָה, נְכָסִים – לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a slave who brought his bill and it is written in it: You and my property are transferred to you, he acquires himself he does not acquire property
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A slave who brings his bill of manumission, and it is written in it: "Yourself and my possessions are acquired to you," himself – he acquired, possessions – he did not acquire.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״כֹּל נְכָסַיי קְנוּיִין לָךְ״, מַהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁקָּנָה עַצְמוֹ, קָנָה נְכָסִים.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before All of my property is transferred to you, what is Abaye said: Since he acquired himself he acquires property
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: "All my property is acquired for you," what is it? Abaye said: Because he acquired himself, he acquired property.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא עַצְמוֹ לִיקְנֵי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַגֵּט אִשָּׁה, אֶלָּא נְכָסִים לָא לִיקְנֵי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקִּיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא!
human_translation: Rava said to Granted, he should acquire himself, just as it is in a bill of divorce a woman, However, he should not acquire property, just as it is in ratification of typical documents.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: With regard to purchasing real estate, it is understandable, as it is necessary for acquiring a woman through a marriage contract. However, with regard to acquiring movable property, it is not necessary, as it is only for the fulfillment of worldly documents!

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא קָנָה נְכָסִים – לֹא קָנָה עַצְמוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא נְכָסִים לָא לִיקְנֵי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקִּיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא, אֶלָּא עַצְמוֹ לִיקְנֵי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַגֵּט אִשָּׁה!
human_translation: Abaye then said Since he did not acquire the property, he does not acquire himself Rava said to him: Granted, he does not acquire the property, just as it is in ratification of typical documents; however, he should acquire himself, just as it is in a bill of divorce a woman,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar Abbayei: mitoch she'lo kana nechasim - lo kana atzmo. Amar lei Rava: bishlama nechasim lo liknei, midei dehaveh akkiyum shtarot de'alma, ela atzmo liknei, midei dehaveh aget isha! English translation: Hadr said Abbayei: since he did not acquire assets - he did not acquire himself. Rava said to him: it is understandable that he did not acquire assets, as it would lead to the establishment of worldly documents, but he did acquire himself, as it would lead to the giving of a marriage contract to a woman!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה, עַצְמוֹ – קָנָה, נְכָסִים – לֹא קָנָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה לְרָבָא: כְּמַאן – כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר פָּלְגִינַן דִּיבּוּרָא;
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: both this and that, he acquires himself he does not acquire property. Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Rava: In accordance with whose In accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said we divide the statement.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: One this and one this, his own – he acquired, assets – he did not acquire. Rab Adda bar Matna said to Rava: Like whom? Like Rabbi Shimon, who said we differentiate in speech.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַכּוֹתֵב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לְעַבְדּוֹ – יָצָא בֶּן חוֹרִין. שִׁיֵּיר קַרְקַע כָּל שֶׁהוּא, לֹא יָצָא בֶּן חוֹרִין. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: As we learned One who writes, all of his property to his slave, has been emancipated, reserved any amount of land, has not been emancipated, Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who writes all his possessions to his slave - he has gone out as a free man. If he leaves over any amount of land, he has not gone out as a free man. Rabbi Shimon says:

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם הוּא בֶּן חוֹרִין, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״כֹּל נְכָסַיי נְתוּנִין לִפְלוֹנִי עַבְדִּי חוּץ מֵאֶחָד מֵרִיבּוֹא שֶׁבָּהֶן״.
human_translation: He always a freeman unless it says All of my property is given to so-and-so my slave, except for one ten-thousandth of it,
llm_translation: He is always a free man, until it is said, "All my possessions are given to so-and-so, my servant, except for one of them."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁקִּילֵּס רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֶת רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁנֶּאְמְרוּ דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, קָרָא עָלָיו הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה: ״שְׂפָתַיִם יִשָּׁק מֵשִׁיב דְּבָרִים נְכוֹחִים״!
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Yosef bar Minyumi say Rav Naḥman said: Even though Rabbi Yosei praised Rabbi Shimon the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, As it is taught When matters were said before Rabbi Yosei, he recited this verse about him: “He kisses the lips that give the right answer”
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: Even though Rabbi Yosei outshone Rabbi Shimon - the halacha is like Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: When they spoke words before Rabbi Yosei, this verse was recited about him: "The lips of the righteous feed many with proper words" (Proverbs 10:21)!

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁכָּתַב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לְעַבְדּוֹ, וְעָמַד – חוֹזֵר בַּנְּכָסִים, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר בָּעֶבֶד.
human_translation: And did Rav Naḥman say this, But didn’t Rav Yosef bar Minyumi say Rav Naḥman said: on his deathbed who wrote all his property to his slave, and arose he can retract with regard to the property but he cannot retract with regard to the slave.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said it thus? Did Rav Nachman say so? But didn't Rav Yosef bar Minyomei say in the name of Rav Nachman: 'If a master frees his slave and then changes his mind, he can retract regarding the property but not regarding the slave.'"

hebrew_text: חוֹזֵר בַּנְּכָסִים – מַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע הוּא, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר בָּעֶבֶד – שֶׁהֲרֵי יָצָא עָלָיו שֵׁם בֶּן חוֹרִין!
human_translation: He can retract the property, it is the gift on his deathbed. But he cannot retract with regard to the slave, as it has been publicized about status a freeman.
llm_translation: Returning to the estates - a gift of a dying person he is, and he does not return to the slave - for he has acquired the status of a free man!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו כְּרוּת גִּיטָּא הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: There, this is the reason: Because it is not a document that severs
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: There, that is the reason, because it is not like a cut-off document.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ עָלָיו עוֹרְרִין, יִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו: עַרְעָר כַּמָּה? אִילֵימָא עַרְעָר חַד, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין עַרְעָר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם!
human_translation: if there are those who contest it should be ratified through its signatories. How many contestation? If we say contestation one but didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Everyone agrees a contestation no fewer than two
llm_translation: If there are hairs on it, it is established by its seals: How much is the minimum? If you say the minimum is one hair, but didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: In all cases, the minimum is not less than two!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא עַרְעָר תְּרֵי? תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי נִינְהוּ, מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַהָנֵי, סְמוֹךְ אַהָנֵי! אֶלָּא עַרְעָר דְּבַעַל.
human_translation: But contestation two they are two and two. What did you see that you relied on these Rely on these. however, contestation by husband
llm_translation: And rather, two cities? Two and two are they, what do you see that you rely on brothers, rely on brothers! Rather, a city of Baal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אִם יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – יִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו.
human_translation: one who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas and is unable to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, if has witnesses on it, it should be ratified through its signatories.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, and cannot say, "It was written and signed in my presence," if there are witnesses upon it, it is valid with his seals.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְאֶחָד שִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים, שָׁווּ לַמּוֹלִיךְ וְלַמֵּבִיא, וְזוֹ אַחַת מִן הַדְּרָכִים שֶׁשָּׁווּ גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים לְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים.
human_translation: Both bills of divorce and of manumission are the same with regard to delivering and with regard to bringing And this is one of the ways in which bills of divorce are equal to of manumission.
llm_translation: One bill of divorce for women and one bill of manumission for slaves, are equal for taking out and bringing in, and this is one of the ways in which bills of divorce are equal to bills of manumission.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לוֹמַר״? אִילֵימָא חֵרֵשׁ, חֵרֵשׁ בַּר אֵתוֹיֵי גִּיטָּא הוּא?! וְהָתְנַן: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לְהָבִיא אֶת הַגֵּט, חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן!
human_translation: What He is unable to say? If we say a deaf-mute, is a deaf-mute fit to bring a bill of divorce? But didn’t we learn Anyone is fit to bring a bill of divorce except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "he cannot say"? Perhaps we are dealing with a deaf-mute, is a deaf-mute able to bring a bill of divorce?! But didn't we learn: Everyone is fit to bring the bill of divorce, except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנְּתָנוֹ לָהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא פִּיקֵּחַ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לוֹמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ עַד שֶׁנִּתְחָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: With what are we dealing here? where gave to her when he was competent, but he did not manage to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, before he became a deaf-mute.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when they gave it to her while he was intelligent, and he did not have time to say, "Written on my face and sealed on my face," until he became mute.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְאֶחָד שִׁיחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּרָכִים שָׁווּ גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים לְשִׁיחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים: שָׁווּ לַמּוֹלִיךְ וְלַמֵּבִיא; וְכׇל גֵּט שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵד כּוּתִי – פָּסוּל, חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים; וְכׇל הַשְּׁטָרוֹת
human_translation: both bills of divorce and of manumission The Sages taught: In three ways bills of divorce are equal to manumission: They are equal with regard to one who delivers and one who brings, And any document that has a Samaritan witness on it is invalid, except for bills of divorce and of manumission, And all documents
llm_translation: One is bills of divorce of women and one is bills of manumission of slaves. The Rabbis taught: In three ways bills of divorce of women are equivalent to bills of manumission of slaves: they are equivalent for the purpose of taking and bringing; and any bill that has a Kutite witness on it is invalid, except for bills of divorce of women and bills of manumission of slaves; and all documents...

hebrew_text: הָעוֹלִים בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחוֹתְמֵיהֶן גּוֹיִם – כְּשֵׁירִין, חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים. וּכְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר – בְּאַרְבָּעָה: הָאוֹמֵר ״תֵּן גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי, וּשְׁטַר שִׁחְרוּר זֶה לְעַבְדִּי״, רָצָה לַחֲזוֹר בִּשְׁנֵיהֶם – יַחְזוֹר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: that are produced in gentile courts [ arkaot ], even though their signatories gentiles, valid, except for bills of divorce and of manumission. And according to the statement of Rabbi Meir, in four who says: Give this bill of divorce to my wife, or: this bill of manumission to my slave. desires to retract with regard to both of these he can retract. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Those who ascend in the valuations of non-Jews, even though their seals are of non-Jews - are valid, except for bills of divorce of women and documents of manumission. And according to the words of Rabbi Meir - in four cases: one who says, "Give this bill of divorce to my wife, and this document of manumission to my slave," if he wants to retract both - he may retract, these are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּנַן, מִנְיָנָא לְמַעוֹטֵי הָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מִנְיָנָא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: Granted, according to the Rabbis, the number to exclude this of Rabbi Meir, However, according to Rabbi Meir, what the number to exclude?
llm_translation: In peace to the Rabbis, what is the count for the exclusion of that which Rabbi Meir said? Rather, for Rabbi Meir, what is the count for the exclusion of what?

hebrew_text: לְמַעוֹטֵי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: עֵדִים שֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִים לַחְתּוֹם, מְקָרְעִין לָהֶם נְיָיר חָלָק, וּמְמַלְּאִים אֶת הַקְּרָעִים דְּיוֹ.
human_translation: to exclude that which is taught witnesses who do not know to sign, one tears blank paper for them, And fill in the gaps ink
llm_translation: Regarding what was taught: Witnesses who do not know how to sign, tear for them a piece of paper, and fill in the tears for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים, אֲבָל שִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁטָרוֹת, אִם יוֹדְעִין לִקְרוֹת וְלַחְתּוֹם – חוֹתְמִין, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין חוֹתְמִין.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? with regard to bills of divorce. However, manumission and all other documents, if know to read and sign, they sign, and if not, they do not sign.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what are these matters said - in bills of divorce for women, but in manumission documents of slaves and all other documents, if they know how to read and write - they may sign, but if not - they may not sign.

hebrew_text: קְרִיָּיה מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמַיהּ? חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: עֵדִים שֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִין לִקְרוֹת – קוֹרִין לִפְנֵיהֶם וְחוֹתְמִין, וְשֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִין לַחְתּוֹם – מְקָרְעִין לָהֶם.
human_translation: Reading, who mentioned anything about it? is incomplete, and this it is teaching: witnesses do not know to read, one reads in their presence and they sign. And they do not know to sign, tears for them
llm_translation: The one who remembers his name? Hasorei Mechassera, and thus it was taught: Witnesses who do not know how to read - they read before them and sign, and if they do not know how to sign - they tear for them.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא?! וְהָאִיכָּא: הָאוֹמֵר ״תְּנוּ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי, וּשְׁטַר שִׁחְרוּר זֶה לְעַבְדִּי״, וּמֵת – לֹא יִתְּנוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה, ״תְּנוּ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי״, וּמֵת – יִתְּנוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And is there nothing else But isn’t there says: Give this bill of divorce to my wife, or this bill of manumission to my slave, and he dies, they not give after death. Give one hundred dinars to so-and-so, and he dies, they give after death.
llm_translation: And is there not here?! But there is here: One who says, "Give this bill of divorce to my wife, and this document of manumission to my slave," and he dies - they should not be given after his death. "Give a hundred to so-and-so," and he dies - they should be given after his death.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָתָנֵי, מִילְּתָא דְּלֵיתַיהּ בִּשְׁטָרוֹת, מִילְּתָא דְּאִיתַיהּ בִּשְׁטָרוֹת לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: When teaches a matter that not to documents it does not teach matter that is to documents.
llm_translation: The text reads: "For it is taught, a matter that is not in his documents, a matter that is in his documents is not taught."

hebrew_text: דִּשְׁלַח רָבִין מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: הֱווּ יוֹדְעִין, שֶׁשָּׁלַח רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לַגּוֹלָה מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁאָמַר ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי״, וּמֵת – אֵין כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין,
human_translation: As Ravin sent in the name of Rabbi Abbahu: You should know that Rabbi Elazar sent to the Diaspora, in the name of our teacher, on his deathbed who says: Write and give one hundred dinars to so-and-so, and dies one does not write and give
llm_translation: Rabin sent in the name of Rabbi Abahu: Be aware, that Rabbi Elazar was sent into exile on behalf of our master, for he said, "Write and give a hundred to so-and-so," and if he dies - one does not write and give.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא לֹא גָּמַר לְהַקְנוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁטָר, וְאֵין שְׁטָר לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Perhaps he resolved to transfer only with a deed and a deed is not after the death
llm_translation: Perhaps he did not complete to acquire it except with a document, and there is no document after death.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא לִשְׁמָהּ?
human_translation: But isn’t there for her sake,
llm_translation: And where is it for its name?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּה, הַיְינוּ מוֹלִיךְ וּמֵבִיא. אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, Rabba, this is delivering and bringing, However, according to Rava, difficult.
llm_translation: In peace to Rabah, that is, bringing and taking. Rather, to Rava, it is difficult!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: בֵּין לְרַבָּה בֵּין לְרָבָא, הָאִיכָּא מְחוּבָּר! כִּי קָתָנֵי פְּסוּלָא דְרַבָּנַן, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And furthermore, both according to Rabba and according to Rava, there is attached When teaches invalid by rabbinic law. does not teach by Torah law.
llm_translation: And come: between Rabba and Rava, is there a connection! For it was taught: the disqualification of the Rabbis, it is not taught from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְהָא עַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, דִּפְסוּלָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי! בְּעֵדֵי מְסִירָה, וּכְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: But gentile courts, which is an invalidation by Torah law, and teaches to witnesses who observe the transmission of a legal document, and in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, who says Witnesses of the transmission effect
llm_translation: The text: "And the 'arakh' measurements of non-Jews, they are invalid according to the Torah, and it is taught! In the case of witnesses for divorce, and like Rabbi Elazar who said: I have cut off witnesses for divorce."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף אֵלּוּ כְּשֵׁירִין, וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: יָרַד רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְשִׁיטָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי; מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר – לָא!
human_translation: But from that it teaches in the latter clause Rabbi Shimon says: Even these, are valid, and Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi Shimon accepted the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, who said witnesses of the transmission effect by inference that the first tanna not hold
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection from the latter clause: Rabbi Shimon says: These are also valid. And Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi Shimon adopted the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, who said: Witnesses of removal have the status of witnesses who cause a karet penalty. From the fact that the first Tanna holds this way – no!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שֵׁמוֹת מוּבְהָקִין.
human_translation: the between unambiguous [ muvhakin ] names.
llm_translation: There is a distinction between them, their names are clear.

hebrew_text: וְהָא חֲזָרָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְקָתָנֵי!
human_translation: But retraction by Torah law, And teaches
llm_translation: And behold, it is a return of the Torah, and it is taught!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי קָתָנֵי – מִילְּתָא דְּלֵיתַהּ בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, מִילְּתָא דְּאִיתַהּ בְּקִידּוּשִׁין – לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, When teaches a matter that does not with regard to betrothal; it does not teach a matter that does with regard to of betrothal.
llm_translation: Rather, for it is taught - the matter that is not in Kiddushin, the matter that is in Kiddushin - is not taught.

hebrew_text: וְהָא חֲזָרָה גּוּפַהּ אִיתָא בְּקִידּוּשִׁין! בִּשְׁלִיחוּת בְּעַל כּוֹרְחָהּ, דִּבְגֵירוּשִׁין אִיתַהּ וּבְקִידּוּשִׁין לֵיתַהּ.
human_translation: But retraction itself is with regard to betrothal, with regard to agency against will. as with regard to divorce, it is but with regard to betrothal it is not
llm_translation: And this, she returned, her body is mentioned in the betrothal! Through the agency of her husband who divorces her, for there is divorce with her and there is betrothal without her.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל גֵּט שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵד כּוּתִי – פָּסוּל, חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים. מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לִכְפַר עוֹתְנַאי גֵּט אִשָּׁה, וְהָיוּ עֵדָיו עֵדֵי כוּתִים, וְהִכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Any document that has a Samaritan witness on it is invalid, except for bills of divorce and of manumission. An incident which they brought a bill of divorce before Rabban Gamliel in the village of Otnai, and its witnesses were Samaritan witnesses, and he deemed it valid.
llm_translation: It was taught: Any bill of divorce that has a Kutite witness on it - is invalid, except for bills of divorce for women and certificates of manumission for slaves. There was an incident where they brought before Rabban Gamliel to annul a bill of divorce for a woman, and its witnesses were Kutite witnesses, and it was deemed valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא, וְלָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְלָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל!
human_translation: Whose the mishna? not the first tanna , nor Rabbi Elazar, nor Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, mani matnitin? La tana kama, v'la Rabbi Elazar, v'la Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel! English translation: Gemara, who is the author of the Mishnah? Not Tana Kama, not Rabbi Elazar, and not Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מַצַּת כּוּתִי – מוּתֶּרֶת, וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹסֵר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין בְּדִקְדּוּקֵי מִצְוֹת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁהֶחֱזִיקוּ בָּהּ כּוּתִים – הַרְבֵּה מְדַקְדְּקִין בָּהּ, יוֹתֵר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: As it is taught matza of a Samaritan is permitted and a person fulfills his obligation on Passover with it. Rabbi Elazar prohibits because are not well-versed in the details of mitzvot. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: any mitzva that the Samaritans embraced they are more exacting in its than Jews.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Kutit Matzah - permissible, and a person fulfills his obligation with it on Passover. Rabbi Eliezer prohibits it, because they are not well-versed in the details of the commandments. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Any commandment that the Kutim have embraced - they are more meticulous in it than the Israelites.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי תַּנָּא קַמָּא, אֲפִילּוּ שְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת נָמֵי! אִי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אֲפִילּוּ גֵּט אִשָּׁה נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: Whose If the first tanna even other documents If Rabbi Elazar, not even a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna? If it is the first Tanna, even other documents are also valid! If it is Rabbi Elazar, even a bill of divorce for a woman is not valid!

hebrew_text: וְאִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל; אִי דְּאַחְזוּק – אֲפִילּוּ שְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת נָמֵי, אִי דְּלָא אַחְזוּק – אֲפִילּוּ גֵּט אִשָּׁה נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: And if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, If they embrace even other documents if they do not embrace not even a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: And if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel; whether it is a case of being strong - even other documents are also effective, or whether it is not a case of being strong - even a bill of divorce for a woman is not effective!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, וּדְאַחְזוּק בְּהָא וְלָא אַחְזוּק בְּהָא, אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא חַד? אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵי נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִכְשִׁירוּ בּוֹ אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד כּוּתִי בִּלְבָד?
human_translation: And if you would say is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and embrace this but do not embrace this if so, why specifically one even two as well. Why, does Rabbi Elazar say: deemed it valid only just one Samaritan witness
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you say, perhaps it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and they were firm in this and not firm in that, if so, what is the difference between them? Even two! Why did Rabbi Elazar say: They only permitted it with the testimony of one Kutite alone? English translation:

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וּכְגוֹן דְּחָתֵים יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבַסּוֹף,
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Elazar, And where a Jew signed last,
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Elazar, and for example, as thorns Israel at the end,

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָאו דְּכוּתִי חָבֵר הֲוָה, לָא מַחְתֵּים לֵיהּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ שְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת נָמֵי!
human_translation: as, if not that the Samaritan was one devoted to the meticulous observance of mitzvot [ ḥaver ], not him sign before him. If so, even other documents as well,
llm_translation: If it is not that he was a close friend, they would not have erased him from before him. If so, even other documents also!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן רַוְוחָא שְׁבַק לְמַאן דְּקַשִּׁישׁ מִינֵּיהּ; הָכָא נָמֵי, רַוְוחָא שְׁבַק לְמַאן דְּקַשִּׁישׁ מִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, we say he was leaving space for one who was older than he is Here too, was leaving space for one who was his elder.
llm_translation: Instead, we say: Leave the wind to the one who is strong enough to withstand it; here too, leave the wind to the one who is strong enough to withstand it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, עֵדֵי הַגֵּט אֵין חוֹתְמִין זֶה בְּלֹא זֶה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: That is to say, the witnesses of a bill of divorce may not sign one without the other;
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, this is what it means, witnesses of the divorce document do not sign this without this.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם ״כּוּלְּכֶם״.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Ashi says: decree due to All of you
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Ashe said: A decree due to "all of you."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִכְשִׁירוּ בּוֹ אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד כּוּתִי בִּלְבַד. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: כׇּל גֵּט שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵד כּוּתִי – פָּסוּל כּוּ׳!
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Elazar says: They deemed valid only just one witness a Samaritan. What is he teaching us We learned Any document that has a Samaritan witness on it is invalid
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Elazar said: They only permitted it with the testimony of one Kutite alone. What does this teach us? We learned: Any bill of divorce that has the testimony of a Kutite on it - it is invalid!

hebrew_text: אִי מִמַּתְנִיתִין, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵי נָמֵי; וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי חַד, מִשּׁוּם דְּבִשְׁטָרוֹת אֲפִילּוּ חַד נָמֵי לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from the mishna I would have said even two also And that teaches one because that for documents even one is also not teaches us
llm_translation: From the Mishnah, I would have said even two hairs; and this that it teaches one, because with regards to documents, even one hair is not effective, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וּתְרֵי לָא?! וְהָא קָתָנֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהֵבִיאוּ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לִכְפַר עוֹתְנַאי גֵּט אִשָּׁה, וְהָיוּ עֵדָיו עֵדֵי כוּתִים, וְהִכְשִׁיר! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תְּנִי: ״עֵדוֹ״.
human_translation: And two not But teaches: An incident which they brought a bill of divorce before Rabban Gamliel in the village of Otnai, and its witnesses were Samaritan witnesses, and he deemed it valid. Abaye said teach Its witness,
llm_translation: And two not?! And this it teaches: A case and they brought before Rabban Gamliel to annul the marriage of Otneil the son of Kenaz, and his witnesses were Samaritan witnesses, and it was validated! Abaye said, Teach: "His witness."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם תְּרֵי, וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִיפְלָג פְּלִיג; וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַכְשִׁיר בִּשְׁנַיִם, וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לִכְפַר עוֹתְנַאי גֵּט אִשָּׁה, וְהָיוּ עֵדָיו עֵדֵי כוּתִים, וְהִכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, two and Rabban Gamliel disagrees And is incomplete and this it is teaching: And Rabban Gamliel deems valid that two and an incident which they brought a bill of divorce before Rabban Gamliel in the village of Otnai, and its witnesses were Samaritan witnesses, and he deemed it valid.
llm_translation: Rava said: Always two, and Rabban Gamliel from Yiflag divides; and lacking from lacking, and thus it is taught: And Rabban Gamliel validates with two, and there was an incident where they brought before Rabban Gamliel to annul the marriage of a woman, and the witnesses were Kutim, and he validated it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַשְּׁטָרוֹת הָעוֹלִים בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחוֹתְמֵיהֶם גּוֹיִם – כְּשֵׁירִים; חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף אֵלּוּ כְּשֵׁירִין, לֹא הוּזְכְּרוּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ בְּהֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: all documents produced in gentile courts, even though their signatures gentiles valid, except for bills of divorce and of manumission. Rabbi Shimon says: Even these are valid, mentioned only when they are prepared by a common person,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All documents that are evaluated by non-Jews, even though they are signed by non-Jews, are considered valid, except for bills of divorce of women and deeds of manumission of slaves. Rabbi Shimon says: Even these are considered valid, but only when they were executed in the presence of laymen.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָא פָּסֵיק וְתָנֵי – לָא שְׁנָא מֶכֶר לָא שְׁנָא מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: categorically teaches is no different a sale is no different a gift,
llm_translation: "Gema' ka pasik ve'tanei - la sh'na mekher la sh'na mattanah."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מֶכֶר, מִכִּי יָהֵיב זוּזֵי קַמַּיְיהוּ הוּא דִּקְנָה; וּשְׁטָרָא רְאָיָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא – דְּאִי לָא יָהֵיב זוּזֵי קַמַּיְיהוּ, לָא הֲווֹ מַרְעִי נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ וְכָתְבִין לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: Granted, a sale from when gave money he has acquired And the document is merely a proof as if he had not given money in their presence would not act to its own detriment and write a document for him,
llm_translation: In truth, a sale, when he gives the money before them, he acquires; and a regular document is merely a formality - for if he did not give the money before them, they would not have confidence in themselves and write for him a document.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתָּנָה, בְּמַאי קָא קָנֵי – לָאו בְּהַאי שְׁטָרָא? וְהַאי שְׁטָרָא חַסְפָּא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דִּינָא דְמַלְכוּתָא – דִּינָא.
human_translation: However, a gift, by what acquire not via this document? And this document is merely a shard, Shmuel said: The law of the kingdom is the law,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, a gift, with what is he acquiring? Is he not acquiring with this document? But this document is merely a piece of paper! Shmuel said: The law of the kingdom is the law.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, תָּנֵי ״חוּץ מִכְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say teach: except for like bills of divorce.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: It was taught, "Except for the bills of divorce of women."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף אֵלּוּ, כְּשֵׁירִין וְכוּ׳: וְהָא לָאו בְּנֵי כְרִיתוּת נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even these are valid But they are not subject to severance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even these, when they are fit, etc. And is it not that they are not considered children of divorce?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: יָרַד רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְשִׁיטָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: Rabbi Shimon follows the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, who says the witnesses of the transmission effect
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: Rabbi Shimon followed the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, who said witnesses of removal are like those of cutting.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּמְזוּיָּף מִתּוֹכוֹ, שֶׁפָּסוּל! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן –
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Abba say Rabbi Elazar concedes with regard to whose falsification is inherent in it that invalid With what are we dealing here?
llm_translation: And it was said by Rabbi Abba: Rabbi Elazar admits to a blemish from within it, that it is disqualified! Here, what are we dealing with -

hebrew_text: בְּשֵׁמוֹת מוּבְהָקִין.
human_translation: with unambiguous names,
llm_translation: In the names of the sages it is stated.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי שֵׁמוֹת מוּבְהָקִין? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, כְּגוֹן: הוֹרְמִיז, וַאֲבוּדַיָּנָא, בַּר שִׁיבְתַּאי, וּבַר קִידְרֵי, וּבָאטִי, וּנְקִים אוּנָּא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances unambiguous names? Rav Pappa said: such as Hurmiz, and Abbudina, bar Shibbetai, and bar Kidri, and Bati, and Nakim Una.
llm_translation: "How are the names distinguished? Rav Papa said, for example: Hormiz, Avudayana, Bar Shibtai, Bar Kidrei, and Bati, and the verse is fulfilled."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל שֵׁמוֹת שֶׁאֵין מוּבְהָקִים מַאי – לָא?! אִי הָכִי, אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: לֹא הוּזְכְּרוּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ בְּהֶדְיוֹט; לִפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּשֵׁמוֹת מוּבְהָקִין, אֲבָל שֵׁמוֹת שֶׁאֵין מוּבְהָקִין – לָא!
human_translation: However, ambiguous names, what not If so, instead of teaching the latter clause mentioned only when they are prepared by a common person, let him distinguish and teach within itself, In what is this statement, said? With regard to unambiguous names. However, ambiguous names, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But names that are not well-known, what is the law? - No?! If so, it was taught in the latter clause: They were only mentioned when they were done in public; to dispute and say: In what case are these words spoken? - In the case of well-known names, but names that are not well-known - no!

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּשֵׁמוֹת מוּבְהָקִין, אֲבָל בְּשֵׁמוֹת שֶׁאֵין מוּבְהָקִין, נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ בְּהֶדְיוֹט, וּפְסוּלִין.
human_translation: That is also what he is saying, In what is this statement said? With regard to unambiguous names. However, with regard to ambiguous names, becomes like one that was prepared by a common person, and are invalid.
llm_translation: Thus he said: In what case are these words spoken? In the case of names that are distinct, but in the case of names that are not distinct, it is considered as if they were done by laymen, and they are invalid.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְגִיטֵּי מָמוֹן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא הוּזְכְּרוּ גִּיטֵּי מָמוֹן דִּפְסוּלִים, אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ בְּהֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: And if you wish, say last clause we arrive at financial documents. And this is what is saying: Financial documents were mentioned as invalid only when they were prepared by a common person,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The latter clause comes to teach about bills of divorce involving money, and thus it states: Bills of divorce involving money that are disqualified were not mentioned, except when they were made in the possession of ordinary people.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, כָּךְ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לַחֲכָמִים בְּצַיְדָּן: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וַחֲכָמִים עַל כׇּל הַשְּׁטָרוֹת הָעוֹלִין בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחוֹתְמֵיהֶן גּוֹיִם – כְּשֵׁרִים, וַאֲפִילּוּ גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים; לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ בְּהֶדְיוֹט – שֶׁרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַכְשִׁיר, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹסְלִים – חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said Rabbi Shimon said this to the Sages in Tzaidan: Rabbi Akiva and the Rabbis did not disagree with regard to all documents produced in gentile courts, that even though their signatories are gentiles, valid, even bills of divorce and of manumission. They disagreed only when they were prepared by a common person, as Rabbi Akiva deems valid, and the Rabbis deem it invalid, except for bills of divorce and of manumission.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said, thus said Rabbi Shimon to the sages in Tzaidan: Rabbi Akiva and the sages did not disagree regarding all documents that come from the archives of the nations, even though their seals are of non-Jews - they are valid, even bills of divorce and certificates of freedom. They only disagreed when they were done in the hands of laymen - Rabbi Akiva deems them valid, and the sages deem them invalid - except for bills of divorce and certificates of freedom.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף אֵלּוּ – כְּשֵׁירִין בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין יִשְׂרָאֵל חוֹתְמִין, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל חוֹתְמִין – לָא.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even these, are valid in a place where Jews do not sign. However, in a place where Jews sign, no,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even these - are valid in a place where Israelites do not sign, but in a place where Israelites sign - no.

hebrew_text: מְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין יִשְׂרָאֵל חוֹתְמִין נָמֵי, לִיגְזוֹר אַטּוּ מְקוֹם שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל חוֹתְמִין! שֶׁמָּא בִּשְׁמָא מִחַלַּף, אַתְרָא בְּאַתְרָא לָא מִחַלַּף.
human_translation: Let us also decree a place where Jews do not sign due to a place where Jews do sign. confuse name with name. not confuse place with place.
llm_translation: Place where not Israel sign, we decree perhaps place where Israel sign! Perhaps in name change, you will see in you will not change.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא סָבַר לְאַכְשׁוֹרֵי בִּכְנוּפְיָאתָה דְאַרְמָאֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַפְרָם: ״עַרְכָּאוֹת״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: Ravina thought to deem valid by a group of gentiles [ arma’ei ]. Rafram said to him we learned: courts,
llm_translation: Ravina thought to the Akshurei in the Knufeyata of the Aramaeans, Raphram said to him: "Appraisals" we learned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי שְׁטָרָא פָּרְסָאָה, דְּמַסְרֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי סָהֲדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל – מַגְבִּינַן בֵּיהּ מִבְּנֵי חָרֵי.
