human_translation: Rava said: this Persian document [ shetara parsa’a ] that was transferred to in the presence of Jewish witnesses, can collect with it non-liened
llm_translation: Rava said: This document is Persian, for they conduct it with the testimony of Jewish witnesses - we establish it based on the sons of free men.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא יָדְעִי לְמִיקְרֵא? בִּדְיָדְעִי.
human_translation: But do not know to read where know
llm_translation: And this, does he not know the verse? By the verse.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בָּעֵינָא כְּתָב שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְזַיֵּיף, וְלֵיכָּא! בְּדַאֲפִיצָן. וְהָא בָּעֵינָא ״צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּחֲזִיר מֵעִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר בְּשִׁיטָה אַחֲרוֹנָה״, וְלֵיכָּא! בִּדְמַהְדַּר.
human_translation: But I require written that cannot be forged, and it is not in with gall. But I require that review the topic of the document in its last line, and it is not in where it returned
llm_translation: And this, I need a document that cannot be forged, and there isn't! In a hurry. And this, I need "he must return the matter of the document in the last line," and there isn't! In a roundabout way.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי נָמֵי! לֵית לֵיהּ קָלָא.
human_translation: If so, from liened as well, not publicity,
llm_translation: If so, from my servants only! He does not have a voice.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan:
llm_translation: Requested from him Reish Lakish from Rabbi Yochanan:

hebrew_text: עֵדִים הַחֲתוּמִין עַל הַגֵּט וּשְׁמוֹתָן כְּשֵׁמוֹת גּוֹיִם, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא בָּא לְיָדֵינוּ אֶלָּא לוֹקוּס וְלוּס, וְהִכְשַׁרְנוּ.
human_translation: witnesses who signed a bill of divorce and whose names are like the names of gentiles, what is said to him: There came before us only Lukos and Los, and we deemed valid
llm_translation: Witnesses who are sealed on the divorce document and their names are like the names of non-Jews, what is the ruling? He said to him: It did not come into our hands except for Lukus and Lus, and we validated it.

hebrew_text: וְדַוְקָא לוֹקוּס וְלוּס, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּמַסְּקִי בִּשְׁמָהָתַיְיהוּ, אֲבָל שְׁמָהָתָא אַחֲרִינֵי דִּשְׁכִיחִי יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּמַסְּקִי בִּשְׁמָהָתַיְיהוּ – לָא.
human_translation: And specifically Lukos and Los, as it is uncommon Jews who are called by these names. However, other names, which it is common Jews who are called by these names, no,
llm_translation: And specifically regarding Lukus and Lus, for it is not common for the Israelites to engage in their practices, but in other practices that are common for the Israelites to engage in – no.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: גִּיטִּין הַבָּאִים מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וְעֵדִים חֲתוּמִים עֲלֵיהֶם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשְּׁמוֹתֵיהֶן כִּשְׁמוֹת גּוֹיִם – כְּשֵׁירִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ שְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן כִּשְׁמוֹת גּוֹיִם.
human_translation: raised an objection to bills of divorce that come from a country overseas, and witnesses are signed upon them, even though the names are like the names of gentiles, they are valid, because the names of most Jews outside of Eretz are like the names of gentiles.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Divorce documents that come from the province of the sea and have signed witnesses on them, even though their names are like the names of gentiles - they are valid, because most of the Jewish people outside the land, their names are like the names of gentiles.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ שְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן כִּשְׁמוֹת גּוֹיִם.
human_translation: There as it teaches the reason Because the names of most Jews outside of Eretz are like the names of gentiles.
llm_translation: There, as it is taught in the reason: because the majority of Israel outside the land, their names like the names of the nations.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, כִּי מַתְנִיתָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ, וּפְשַׁט לֵיהּ מִמַּתְנִיתָא.
human_translation: And there are who say asked same in the baraita , and he resolved for him from the baraita ,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, when the Mishnah asks a question from it, and he answers it from the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר ״תֵּן גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי, וּשְׁטַר שִׁחְרוּר זֶה לְעַבְדִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחֲזוֹר בִּשְׁנֵיהֶן – יַחְזוֹר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: one who says Give this bill of divorce to my wife, or: this bill of manumission to my slave, if wishes to retract with regard to both of them, he can retract. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One who says, 'Give this bill of divorce to my wife, and this document of manumission to my slave,' if he wishes to retract both statements, he may do so. These are the words of Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים; לְפִי שֶׁזָּכִין לָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וְאֵין חָבִין לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו;
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: in bills of divorce but not in of manumission. because one can act in a person’s interest in his absence, But one can act to a person’s detriment only in his presence.
llm_translation: The sages say: In the matter of women's divorce documents, but not in the matter of slaves' manumission documents; because they are effective for a person not in his presence, and we only validate them in his presence.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאִם יִרְצֶה שֶׁלֹּא לָזוּן אֶת עַבְדּוֹ – רַשַּׁאי, וְשֶׁלֹּא לָזוּן אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ – אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי.
human_translation: as, if wishes not to sustain his slave he is allowed But not to sustain his wife, he is not allowed
llm_translation: If he wants not to sustain his slave - he is permitted, but if he wants not to sustain his wife - he is not permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: וַהֲרֵי הוּא פּוֹסֵל אֶת עַבְדּוֹ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהוּא פּוֹסֵל אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קִנְיָינוֹ.
human_translation: said to But as, disqualifies his slave from teruma just as disqualifies his wife said to him: because he is his acquisition.
llm_translation: He said to them: "And behold, he disqualifies his slave from terumah, just as he disqualifies his wife!" They said to him: "Because he is his acquisition."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ יָתֵיב רַב הוּנָא וְרַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, וְיָתֵיב רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְקָא מְנַמְנֵם, וְיָתֵיב רַב הוּנָא וְקָאָמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַבָּנַן, הַתּוֹפֵס לְבַעַל חוֹב, קָנָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef were sitting before Rabbi Yirmeya, and Rabbi Yirmeya was sitting and dozing And Rav Huna was sitting and saying: of the Rabbis conclude from that seizes on behalf of a creditor, acquires
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna and Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef were sitting before Rabbi Yirmeya, and Rabbi Yirmeya was sitting and dozing off. Rav Huna was sitting and saying: "Learn from this from the Rabbis, one who seizes the creditor, acquires."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף: וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים? אָמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef said to even in a case when is to the detriment of others, said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said to him: "Even in a place where one is obligated to others?" He said to him: "No."

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי אִיתְּעַר בְּהוּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דַּרְדְּקֵי! הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַתּוֹפֵס לְבַעַל חוֹב בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים – לֹא קָנָה. וְאִם תֹּאמַר: מִשְׁנָתֵינוּ!
human_translation: In the meantime Rabbi Yirmeya woke up, due to their He said to them: Children [ dardekei ], this is Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One who seizes of a creditor in a case where it is to the detriment of others does not acquire. And if you say the mishna
llm_translation: So now Rabbi Yirmeya woke up. He said to them: "Dardekei!" Thus said Rabbi Yochanan: One who seizes from the creditor in a place where he owes to others - has not acquired. And if you say: "From our Mishnah!"

hebrew_text: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״תְּנוּ״, כְּאוֹמֵר ״זְכוּ״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: anyone who says: Give is like one who says: Acquire
llm_translation: All who says "give," it is like saying "acquire" blood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַתּוֹפֵס לְבַעַל חוֹב בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים, בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבָּנַן. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁלִּיקֵּט אֶת הַפֵּאָה, וְאָמַר ״הֲרֵי זוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי עָנִי״, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמַר: זָכָה לוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִתְּנֶנּוּ לְעָנִי הַנִּמְצָא רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: one who seizes on behalf of a creditor in a case where it is to the detriment of others, we have arrived at the dispute between Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis. As we learned one who collected produce in the corner of the field, which is given to the poor [ pe’a ], and said: This for so-and-so, a poor person, Rabbi Eliezer said: He has acquired on his behalf, and the Rabbis say: he gives to poor person appears first
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: One who seizes property from a debtor in a place where he owes to others, we came to a dispute between Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis. For it was taught: One who gathers the corner of his field for the poor, and says, "This is for so-and-so poor person," Rabbi Eliezer said: he has acquired it, and the Sages say: it should be given to the poor person who is found first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: Ameimar said, and some say Rav Pappa
llm_translation: Said Amemar, and it was stated by Rav Papa:

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לָא הִיא; עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּמִיגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֵי מַפְקַר לְהוּ לְנִכְסֵיהּ, וְהָוֵי עָנִי וַחֲזֵי לֵיהּ – וּמִיגּוֹ דְּזָכֵי לֵיהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ זָכֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ; אֲבָל הָכָא, לָא.
human_translation: Perhaps is not so. Rabbi Eliezer states his opinion only there, since if desired, he declare his property ownerless and become a poor person, and fit for him And since acquired for himself, acquire for another However, here, not
llm_translation: Perhaps it is not so; until here did not say Rabbi Eliezer there, but that from the fact that if he wants to make it ownerless for his property, he will be poor and see it - and from the fact that if he merits it for himself, he merits it for his companions; but here, no.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם, אֶלָּא דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תְלַקֵּט לְעָנִי״ – לֹא תְלַקֵּט לוֹ לְעָנִי; אֲבָל הָכָא, לָא.
human_translation: The Rabbis state only there, as it is written: you shall not gather; for the poor You shall not gather for the poor, However, here, not
llm_translation: And until here not said the Rabbis there, rather as it is written: "Do not glean for the poor" - do not glean for him for the poor; but here, no.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הַאי ״לֹא תְלַקֵּט״ – מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְהַזְהִיר לְעָנִי עַל שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, this “You shall not gather,” what does he do with it? He requires it to warn a poor person with regard to his own
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer: This "Do not glean" - what does he do with it? He requires it to caution for the poor on his behalf.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאִם יִרְצֶה שֶׁלֹּא לָזוּן כּוּ׳: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ, יָכוֹל הָרַב לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד: ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ״?
human_translation: As, if wishes not to sustain Conclude from the master is able to say to slave: Work for me but I will not sustain you.
llm_translation: "If he wants not to provide sustenance, heard from her, can the master say to the servant: 'Do with me and I will not prostitute'?"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״צֵא מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיךָ לִמְזוֹנוֹתֶיךָ״.
human_translation: with what are we dealing here, where he said to Spend your earnings to sustain yourself.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For he said to him: "You shall eat the fruit of the labor of your hands."

hebrew_text: דִּכְווֹתַהּ גַּבֵּי אִשָּׁה – דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״?! אִשָּׁה אַמַּאי לָא? אִשָּׁה – בִּדְלָא סָפְקָא.
human_translation: in the corresponding with regard to a wife, that he said to her: Spend your earnings to sustain yourself? a wife, why not wife are not sufficient
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Dikvotah above a woman - who said to her: 'Go out, my handiwork, in my sustenance'?! A woman, why not? A woman - in a case of uncertainty."

hebrew_text: עֶבֶד נָמֵי בִּדְלָא סָפֵיק! עַבְדָּא דִּנְהוֹם כְּרֵסֵיהּ לָא שָׁוֵיא, לְמָרֵיהּ וּלְמָרְתֵיהּ לְמַאי מִיתְבְּעֵי?
human_translation: slave also are not sufficient A slave who is not worth the bread that he consumes, for what is he needed by his master or his mistress?
llm_translation: Slave named Nami in Bedla, doubtful! The slave who is in Nahum's care is not suitable, for what purpose is he needed by his master and mistress?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: עֶבֶד שֶׁגָּלָה לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט אֵין רַבּוֹ חַיָּיב לְזוּנוֹ, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו לְרַבּוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, יָכוֹל הָרַב לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ״! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמַר לוֹ: ״צֵא מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיךָ לִמְזוֹנוֹתֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Come hear a slave who was exiled to cities of refuge, his master is not required to sustain him. And not only that, but his earnings to his master. Conclude from a master can say to slave: Work for me but I will not sustain you, With what are we dealing here? where said to him: Spend your earnings to sustain yourself.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A slave who fled to the cities of refuge, his master is not obligated to support him, and furthermore, even if he performed work for his master. Learn from this, one might have thought that the master could say to the slave, "Do with me and I will not support you!" Here we are dealing with what? That he said to him, "Go out, the work of your hands is for your sustenance."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו אַמַּאי לְרַבּוֹ? לְהַעְדָּפָה.
human_translation: If so, why do his earnings to his master? to surplus
llm_translation: If so, his handiwork, why to his master? For preference.

hebrew_text: הַעֲדָפָה, פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, כֵּיוָן דְּכִי לֵית לֵיהּ לָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ, כִּי אִית לֵיהּ נָמֵי לָא לִישְׁקוֹל מִינֵּיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Isn’t obvious surplus lest you say that since, when he does not not give him when he has should also not take it. teaches us
llm_translation: The preference, it is obvious! What might you say, since when he does not have, he does not give to him, and when he does have, he also does not want to give from it, he is not giving to us.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״וָחָי״ – עָבֵיד לֵיהּ חִיּוּתָא טְפֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And what is different to cities of refuge, enter your mind to say he might live” act for him extra life, teaches us
llm_translation: "What is the difference with regard to cities of refuge? It is logical in your opinion, I say: 'And he shall live' - he made for him a greater livelihood, this is what we hear."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אֲבָל אִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּלְתָה לְעָרֵי מִקְלָט – בַּעְלָהּ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ; מִכְּלָל דְּלָא אֲמַר לַהּ, דְּאִי אֲמַר לַהּ, בַּעְלַהּ אַמַּאי חַיָּיב?
human_translation: But from that the latter clause teaches: However, a woman who was exiled to cities of refuge, her husband is obligated in her sustenance, by inference where he did not say to her: As, if he said to her, why is her husband obligated
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection from the latter clause: But if a woman was exiled to one of the cities of refuge, her husband is obligated to provide her sustenance. This implies that he did not say to her, for if he had said to her, why would her husband be obligated?

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּסֵיפָא דְּלָא אֲמַר לַהּ, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי דְּלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And from that the latter clause where he did not say to her, first clause also where he did not say to
llm_translation: And from the end that he did not say to her, the beginning also he did not say to her!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְאִשָּׁה בִּדְלָא סָפְקָה.
human_translation: Actually, where said to a woman when not sufficient
llm_translation: Forever he said to him, "And a woman in whom there is doubt."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְאִם אָמַר לָהּ ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״ – רַשַּׁאי, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא דְּלָא אֲמַר לַהּ! הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְאִם מַסְפֶּקֶת, וְאָמַר לַהּ: ״צְאִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַיִךְ״ – רַשַּׁאי.
human_translation: But from that the last clause teaches: And if said to her: Spend your earnings to sustain yourself, he is permitted it may be inferred that the first clause where he did not say to her. this is what is saying: And if suffice and he said to her: Spend your earnings to sustain yourself, it is permitted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what we learned in the latter part: And if he said to her, "Go out, my handiwork, with my sustenance" - he is permitted, from the inference of the first part that he did not say to her! This is what he is saying: And if she is doubtful, and he said to her, "Go out, my handiwork, with my sustenance" - he is permitted.

hebrew_text: מַסְפֶּקֶת, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״כׇּל כְּבוּדָּה בַת מֶלֶךְ פְּנִימָה״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: suffice, what of stating lest you say “All glorious is the king’s daughter within the palace” teaches us
llm_translation: Contemplating, what is meant to say? What you might say: "All the glory of the daughter of the king is within," is implied to us.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי – רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל הָעֶבֶד לוֹמַר לְרַבּוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת: ״אוֹ פַּרְנְסֵנִי, אוֹ הוֹצִיאֵנִי לְחֵירוּת״. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הָרְשׁוּת בְּיַד רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: Let us say subject of tanna’im , Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A slave can say to his master in years of famine: Either sustain me or emancipate me. And the Rabbis say: His master has permission to
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim - Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Can a slave say to his master in two forms of expression: "Either sustain me, or set me free"? And the sages say: The authority is in the hand of the master.

hebrew_text: מַאי, לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר: יָכוֹל, וּמָר סָבַר: אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל?
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree this that Sage, holds can And Sage, holds cannot
llm_translation: What, is it not in this that they disagree - for Master holds: he is able, and Master holds: he is not able?

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא?! הַאי ״אוֹ פַּרְנְסֵנִי אוֹ הוֹצִיאֵנִי לְחֵירוּת״?! ״אוֹ פַּרְנְסֵנִי אוֹ תֵּן לִי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי בְּפַרְנָסָתִי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! וְעוֹד: מַאי שְׁנָא בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת?
human_translation: And can you understand this Either sustain me or emancipate me, should have Either sustain me or give me my earnings for my sustenance. And furthermore, what is different about years of famine?
llm_translation: "And should it be created?! This one, 'Either sustain me or bring me out to freedom'?! 'Either sustain me or give me the work of my hands in my sustenance,' he demands! Furthermore: What is the difference between the two cases?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּאָמַר לוֹ ״צֵא מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיךָ לִמְזוֹנוֹתֶיךָ״, וּבִשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת לָא סָפֵק;
human_translation: Rather, with what are we dealing here? said to Spend your earnings to sustain yourself, and during years of famine, not suffice
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with what? - that he said to him, "Go out with the work of your hands for your sustenance," and in two containers there is no doubt.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: אוֹ פַּרְנְסֵנִי אוֹ הוֹצִיאֵנִי לְחֵירוּת, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּחָזוּ לִי אִינָשֵׁי וּמְרַחֲמִין עֲלַי. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מַאן דִּמְרַחֵם אַבְּנֵי חָרֵי, אַעֶבֶד נָמֵי רַחוֹמֵי מְרַחֵם.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds Either sustain me or emancipate me, so that people will see me and they will have mercy on me And the Rabbis hold those who have mercy on freemen will also have mercy on a slave.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: Either sustain me or release me to freedom, so that people may see me and have mercy on me. And the sages hold: Whoever has compassion on stones of the walls, will ultimately have compassion on the people of the world.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ, אוֹתוֹ הָעֶבֶד לֹוֶה וְאוֹכֵל, וְעוֹשֶׂה וּפוֹרֵעַ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, יָכוֹל הָרַב לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד: ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ״!
human_translation: Come hear that Rav said: one who consecrates the hands of his slave, that slave borrows and eats, and performs and repays Conclude from the master is able to say to slave: Work for me but I will not sustain you.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav said: One who consecrates the hand of his slave, that slave can then borrow and eat, and perform and annul. Learn from it, one might think the master can say to the slave: "Do with me and I will not prostitute you!"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּמַעֲלֶה לוֹ מְזוֹנוֹת. אִי הָכִי, לְמַאי
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where provides sustenance for him. If so, for what
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - with providing him with sustenance. If so, for what?

hebrew_text: לֹוֶה וְאוֹכֵל? לְהַעְדָּפָה.
human_translation: does he borrow and eat? to surplus
llm_translation: One who lends and eats? For contempt.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ הֶקְדֵּשׁ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא סַגִּי לָךְ בְּלָא הַעֲדָפָה, וְהַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי תִּיסְגֵּי לָךְ בְּלָא הַעֲדָפָה! הֶקְדֵּשׁ גּוּפֵיהּ נִיחָא לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלַשְׁבַּח עַבְדֵּיהּ.
human_translation: But let Temple say to him: Until now it was enough for you without a surplus; now too it should be enough for you without a surplus. It is preferable to Temple itself so that its slave will be enhanced
llm_translation: And say to him: Until now it is enough for you without preference, and now also it will be enough for you without preference! He himself is pleased with the sanctification, so that his servants may be praised.

hebrew_text: עוֹשֶׂה וּפוֹרֵעַ, קַמָּא קַמָּא קָדֵישׁ לֵיהּ! בְּפָחוֹת פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: performs and repays immediately becomes consecrated, of less than the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: One who does and annuls, each and every time sanctifies it! With less than less than equivalent to a perutah.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא; דְּאָמַר רַב: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ – אוֹתוֹ הָעֶבֶד עוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל, דְּאִי לָא עַבְדָּא מַאן פָּלַח לֵיהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable As Rav says: one who consecrates the hands of his slave, that slave works and eats, as, if not work who will work for him?
llm_translation: So it was taught: for Rav said: one who consecrates the hand of his slave - that slave himself performs and eats, for if it were not a slave, who would redeem him.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא הָךְ בְּמַעֲלֶה וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל, וְהָא בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַעֲלֶה, שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: Granted, if you say this where provides sustenance for him, and he cannot and this where does not provide is well,
llm_translation: If you say "this is the case when he ascends and is unable, but in a case where he does not ascend, it is fine."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ הָךְ בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַעֲלֶה, וְיָכוֹל, דְּאִי לָא עַבְדָּא מַאן פָּלַח לֵיהּ?! מַאן דְּבָעֵי נִיפְלְחֵיהּ!
human_translation: However, if you say this also where does not provide can As, if not work who will work for him? whoever desires work for him,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that it does not ascend, yet it is possible, for if it did not serve a purpose, who would have created it?! Who desires its fall!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, not conclude from cannot conclude from
llm_translation: Rather, no, its name, hear from it, he is not able! Hear from it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַקּוֹטֵעַ יַד עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – נוֹתֵן שִׁבְתּוֹ וּרְפוּאָתוֹ לְרַבּוֹ, וְאוֹתוֹ הָעֶבֶד נִיזּוֹן מִן הַצְּדָקָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, יָכוֹל הָרַב לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד: ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ״!
human_translation: Come hear as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One who severs the hand of another’s slave give his livelihood, and medical costs to his master. And that slave, sustained from charity. Conclude from the master is able to say to his slave: Work for me but I will not sustain you,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yochanan said: One who cuts off his fellow's hand - he gives his rest and healing to his master, and that slave is sustained from charity. Learn from it, the master can say to the slave: "Do with me and you will not be harmed!"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּמַעֲלֶה לוֹ מְזוֹנוֹת. אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי נִיזּוֹן מִן הַצְּדָקָה? לְהַעְדָּפָה.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where provides sustenance for him. If so, why is he sustained from charity? to surplus
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - with elevating his sustenance. If so, why does he benefit from charity? For preference.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״נִיזּוֹן״?! ״מִתְפַּרְנֵס״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ יָכוֹל! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: If so, Sustained It should have earns a living Rather, not conclude from can conclude from
llm_translation: So, "nizon"?! "Mitparnes" is what he needs! Rather, no, learn from it, you can! Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר מָר: נוֹתֵן שִׁבְתּוֹ וּרְפוּאָתוֹ לְרַבּוֹ. שִׁבְתּוֹ, פְּשִׁיטָא! רְפוּאָתוֹ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Master says He give livelihood and his medical costs to his master. livelihood, it is obvious it was necessary for his medical costs
llm_translation: The Master said: One should give his rest and healing to his master. His rest, it is obvious! His healing is what he needs.

hebrew_text: רְפוּאָתוֹ דִּידֵיהּ הִיא, דְּבָעֵי אִיתַּסּוֹיֵי בֵּהּ! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַמְדוּהּ לְחַמְשָׁא יוֹמֵי, וַעֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ סַמָּא חָרִיפָא וְאִתַּסִּי בִּתְלָתָא יוֹמֵי; מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: צַעֲרָא – דִּידֵיהּ הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: his medical costs belong to him, as he needs to be healed with it? No, necessary where estimated would heal in five days and they made a strong medicine for him, and he was healed in three days Lest you say: the pain to him, teaches us
llm_translation: His healing is in his hands, for they sought to heal him! It is not necessary, for they considered it for five days, and they applied to him a hot medicine and treated him for three days; what might you say: his pain - it is his, he is causing us to hear.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַרְנוּ לוֹ לְמֵאִיר: וַהֲלֹא זְכוּת הוּא לָעֶבֶד שֶׁיּוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי רַבּוֹ לְחֵירוּת! אָמַר לָנוּ: חוֹב הוּא לוֹ – שֶׁאִם הָיָה עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן, פּוֹסְלוֹ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה. אָמַרְנוּ לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא מָה אִם יִרְצֶה שֶׁלֹּא לְזוּנוֹ וְשֶׁלֹּא לְפַרְנְסוֹ, רַשַּׁאי!
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Elazar said: We said to Meir: But isn’t it in the interest of a slave to leave his master to freedom? He said to us: It is to his detriment, as if he were the slave of a priest, disqualifies him from teruma . We said to him: But what if wishes not to sustain him and not to provide him with a living? permitted
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Elazar said, we said to Meir: Is it not a merit for the slave who goes out from under the hand of his master to freedom? He said to us: He has a debt - for if he were a slave of a Kohen, he would disqualify him from partaking of the Terumah. We said to him: But what if he wishes neither for his sustenance nor for his livelihood, is he permitted?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָנוּ: וּמָה אִילּוּ עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן שֶׁבָּרַח, וְאֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן שֶׁמָּרְדָה עַל בַּעְלָהּ – הֲלֹא אוֹכְלִין בִּתְרוּמָה; וְזֶה – אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל. אֲבָל אִשָּׁה – חוֹב הוּא לָהּ, שֶׁכֵּן פֹּסְלָהּ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה וּמַפְסִידָהּ מִן הַמְּזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: said to us: And what if the slave of a priest, who fled or the wife of a priest, who rebelled against her husband, they not partake of teruma , But this may not partake But a woman, is to her detriment, as it disqualifies her from teruma and causes her to lose sustenance.
llm_translation: He said to us: And what if a slave of a Kohen ran away, and the wife of a Kohen rebelled against her husband - do they not eat Terumah; but this one - does not eat. But a woman - she has a debt, for she disqualifies herself from Terumah and causes herself to lose from sustenance.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ, וּמַאי קָא מַהְדַּר לְהוּ? הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: הֲשַׁבְתּוּנִי עַל הַמְּזוֹנוֹת, מַה תְּשִׁיבוּנִי עַל הַתְּרוּמָה?
human_translation: What did say to and what respond to them? this is what is saying You have answered me about sustenance, what will you answer me about teruma ?
llm_translation: What are they saying to him, and what is he responding to them? This is what he is saying to them: "You have wearied me with food, how will you weary me with tithes?"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימְרוּ: אִי בָּעֵי, זָרֵיק לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ; שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ וְעָרֵיק וְאָזֵיל לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And if you were to say if desires, he can throw the bill and disqualify him leaving and escaping and going out to the world.
llm_translation: And if you will say: If he wants, he can throw her a bill of divorce and render her ineligible; he should leave her and depart, and go away forever.

hebrew_text: ״וּמָה אִילּוּ עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן שֶׁבָּרַח וְאֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן שֶׁמָּרְדָה עַל בַּעְלָהּ – הֲלֹא אוֹכְלִים בִּתְרוּמָה; וְזֶה – אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל״ –
human_translation: And what be if slave of a priest, who fled or wife of a priest who rebelled against her husband, they not partake of teruma , But this may not partake
llm_translation: "And what if a slave of a Kohen ran away, and the wife of a Kohen rebelled against her husband - do they not eat from the Terumah? But this one - does not eat."

hebrew_text: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לְהוּ! אָמַר רָבָא: הַיְינוּ דְּקָא מַהְדְּרִי לֵיהּ בְּמַתְנִיתִין: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קִנְיָנוֹ. דְּאִי בָּעֵי, שָׁקֵיל אַרְבָּעָה זוּזֵי מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל וּפָסֵיל לֵיהּ כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: is saying well Rava said: This is what answered to him in the mishna: because he is his acquisition. As, if desires take four dinars from Israelite and he disqualifies anywhere that he is
llm_translation: Fairly he said to them! Rava said: This is what he meant to say in the Mishnah: Because it is his acquisition. For if he wants, he can take four zuz from any Jew and render it invalid wherever it may be.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי מֵאִיר – תִּינַח עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן, עֶבֶד יִשְׂרָאֵל מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּפְסִידוֹ מִשִּׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Meir, works out well slave of a priest slave of an Israelite, what can be said? Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: because causes him to lose of a Canaanite maidservant.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Meir - "Tinach" is a Kohen slave, what is the case for a Yisraelite slave? Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said: Because he causes him to lose from a Canaanite maidservant.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, הֲרֵי הוּא מַתִּירוֹ בְּבַת חוֹרִין! עַבְדָּא בְּהֶפְקֵירָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ – זִילָא לֵיהּ, שְׁכִיחָא לֵיהּ, פְּרִיצָה לֵיהּ.
human_translation: On the contrary, permitted for him with a free woman. a slave, of licentiousness is preferable for him. she is lowly to him, she is available for him, she is unrestricted for him.
llm_translation: The Great Rav, behold he permits it in a private domain! A lost item in ownerless property is pleasing to him - he goes to it, it is common to him, it is open to him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר ״תְּנוּ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי, שְׁטַר שִׁחְרוּר זֶה לְעַבְדִּי״, וּמֵת – לֹא יִתְּנוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה. ״תְּנוּ מָנֶה לְאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״, וּמֵת – יִתְּנוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: one who says: Give this bill of divorce to my wife, this bill of manumission to my slave, and dies, one does not give it after death. Give one hundred dinars to so-and-so, and died, one does give after death.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says, "Give this bill of divorce to my wife," or "Give this document of manumission to my slave," and then dies - they should not be given after his death. If one says, "Give a hundred coins to so-and-so," and then dies - they should be given after his death.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְרַב: וְהוּא שֶׁצְּבוּרִין וּמוּנָּחִין בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta says in the name of Rav: And this when are piled up and placed in a corner
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta said in the name of Rav: And this is when they are arranged and resting in the corner of the horn.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּבָרִיא, כִּי צְבוּרִין מַאי הָוֵי? הָא לָא מְשַׁךְ! וְאֶלָּא בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע, מַאי אִירְיָא צְבוּרִין? כִּי אֵין צְבוּרִין נָמֵי, דְּהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּדִבְרֵי שְׁכִיב מְרַע – כִּכְתוּבִים וְכִמְסוּרִין דָּמוּ!
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If we say with a healthy person when they are piled, what of it? did not pull Rather, with on his deathbed, why specifically piled? when not piled as well, as we maintain the statement of on his deathbed is considered as though it were written and delivered.
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say with a healthy person, what about when there are congregants? That is not common! Rather, we are dealing with a sick person. What is the law regarding congregants? Since there are no congregants here, for we hold like the words of a sick person - as it is written and as it has been transmitted!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד: לְעוֹלָם בְּבָרִיא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב – דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, תְּנֵהוּ לוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי״, בְּמַעֲמַד שְׁלָשְׁתָּן – קָנָה.
human_translation: Rav Zevid says: Actually, with a healthy person, and in accordance with Rav Huna Rav says. As Rav Huna says Rav says: I one hundred dinars in your possession; give it to so-and-so, in the presence of three acquired
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said: Always in a healthy state, and as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav - for Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: "Appoint it in your hand, give it to so-and-so," in the presence of both of them - it is acquired.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע, וּכְאִידַּךְ דְּרַב – דְּאָמַר רַב: שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי מִנְּכָסַי״; ״מָנֶה זֶה״ – נוֹתְנִין, ״מָנֶה״ סְתָם – אֵין נוֹתְנִין,
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Actually, with on his deathbed, and it is in accordance with another of Rav, as Rav says: on his deathbed who said: Give one hundred dinars to so-and-so from my property, this one hundred dinars, one gives One hundred dinars, without specification, one does not give
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Always in a state of lying down one may feed, and like the opinion of Rav who said: A lying down person who said "Give a hundred to so-and-so from my property," if he specified "this hundred," we give it; if he said "a hundred" without specification, we do not give it.

hebrew_text: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא מָנֶה קָבוּר קָאָמַר.
human_translation: We are concerned perhaps he spoke a buried one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: We are concerned that perhaps he meant a grave.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: לִקְבוּרָה לָא חָיְישִׁינַן. רַב פָּפָּא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב זְבִיד?
human_translation: And the halakha we are not concerned about a buried What is the reason Rav Pappa did not say in accordance with Rav Zevid
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the halakha is: we are not concerned about burial. Rav Papa: What is the reason? Did he not say like Rav Zebid?" English translation:

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַב פָּפָּא, כִּי אָמַר רַב – לָא שְׁנָא בְּמִלְוֶה, וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּפִקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa holds when Rav said is no different to a loan and is no different to a deposit,
llm_translation: Rav Papa holds, for Rav said - it is not different in a loan, and not different in a deposit.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב פָּפָּא? לָא מִיתּוֹקְמָא מַתְנִיתִין בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע. מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: ״הָאוֹמֵר תְּנוּ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי וּשְׁטַר שִׁחְרוּר זֶה לְעַבְדִּי״, וּמֵת – לֹא יִתְּנוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Zevid did not say in accordance with Rav Pappa? not establish the mishna to on his deathbed. From where from that it teaches: one who says: Give this bill of divorce to my wife, or: this bill of manumission to my slave, and dies, one should not give it after death.
llm_translation: Rav Zevid: What is the reason he did not say like Rav Papa? It is not established in the Mishnah in the context of a dying person. From where? Since it teaches: "One who says, 'Give this bill of divorce to my wife and this document of manumission to my slave,' and he dies - they should not be given after his death."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּמֵת, הָא מֵחַיִּים – נוֹתְנִין; טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר ״תְּנוּ״, הָא לֹא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״, אֵין נוֹתְנִין; וּשְׁכִיב מְרַע – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״, נוֹתְנִין.
human_translation: The reason that died. while alive one gives the reason he said: Give, but he did not say: Give, one does not give But on his deathbed, although he did not say: Give, one gives
llm_translation: Reason of death, this from life - we give; reason of saying "give," this not said "give," not give; and one lying ill - even though not said "give," give.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: הַיּוֹצֵא בְּקוֹלָר, וְאָמַר ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ. חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר, אַף הַמְפָרֵשׁ וְהַיּוֹצֵא בִּשְׁיָירָא.
human_translation: As we learned Initially would say: one who is taken out in a neck chain and said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, these should write and give They then said even to one who sets sail and one who departs in a caravan
llm_translation: We learned in the first teaching: One who goes out wearing a collar and says, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," - these should be written and given. They repeated to say, also one who is separated and goes out with a kerchief.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמְסוּכָּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even one who is dangerously ill
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even the one who is in a state of danger.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: וּמַאן נֵימָא לַן דְּמַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי הִיא? דִּלְמָא רַבָּנַן הִיא!
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this And who says to us that the mishna is Rabbi Shimon Shezuri? Perhaps it is the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Ashi: And who says to us that the one who taught is Rabbi Shimon Shezuri? Perhaps it is the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, תְּנֵהוּ לוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי״, בְּמַעֲמַד שְׁלָשְׁתָּן – קָנָה. אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתֵיהּ דְּרַב בְּפִקָּדוֹן, אֲבָל בְּמִלְוָה – לֹא.
human_translation: the itself. Rav Huna says Rav says: I one hundred dinars in your possession; give it to so-and-so, in the presence of three acquired Rava said: It stands to reason Rav’s statement with regard to a deposit, However, of a loan, no,
llm_translation: Body - Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: "Appoint for me in your hand, give it to so-and-so," in the presence of all three - it is acquired. Rava said: His statement makes sense in a case of a deposit, but not in a case of a loan.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֱלֹהִים! אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ בְּמִלְוָה. אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי: ״מִלְוָה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, תְּנֵהוּ לוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי״, בְּמַעֲמַד שְׁלָשְׁתָּן – קָנָה.
human_translation: But by God, Rav said even with regard to a loan. It was also stated Shmuel said in the name of Levi I have a loan in your possession, give it to so-and-so, in the presence of three acquired
llm_translation: "And God! Said Rav: Even in a loan. It was stated similarly, Shmuel said in the name of Levi: 'Give me a loan in your hand, give it to so-and-so,' in the presence of all three – it is acquired."

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: נַעֲשָׂה כְּאוֹמֵר לוֹ בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת: שַׁעְבַּדְנָא לָךְ לְדִידָךְ וּלְכֹל דְּאָתוּ מֵחֲמָתָךְ.
human_translation: And what is the reason Ameimar said: becomes like who says to at the time of the giving of the money, I am beholden to you and to anyone comes on your
llm_translation: And the reason? What is it? He said, Ameimar: We have done as he told us at the time of giving the money: We have acted for you and for all who come because of you.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הִקְנָה לַנּוֹלָדִים – דְּלָא הֲווֹ בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא קָנוּ?!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: If that is so, he transferred to those who will be born, were not when the money was given, also that do not acquire
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Amemar: Rather, from now on, acquire for the unborn - for they were not present at the time of the giving of the gifts, is it not so that they did not acquire?!

hebrew_text: דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר אָדָם מַקְנֶה דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם, הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְדָבָר שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּעוֹלָם, אֲבָל לְדָבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּעוֹלָם – לָא!
human_translation: As, even according to Rabbi Meir, who says a person can transfer an entity that has not come into the world, this statement to an entity, that has come into the world. However, to an entity that has not come into the world, not
llm_translation: Even according to Rabbi Meir, who says a person can acquire something that does not yet exist in the world, those words apply to something that will exist in the world, but for something that will not exist in the world - no!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi says
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said:

hebrew_text: בְּהַהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא מִשְׁתַּנְּיָא לֵיהּ בֵּין מִלְוָה יְשָׁנָה לְמִלְוָה חֲדָשָׁה, גָּמַר וּמְשַׁעְבֵּיד נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: With that benefit his changes from an old debt to a new debt, he fully pledges himself
llm_translation: In that pleasure that is changing to him between an old loan to a new loan, he finishes and burdens his soul.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הוּנָא מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחֶמְיָה לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, כְּגוֹן הָנֵי דְּבֵי בַּר אֶלְיָשִׁיב, דְּכָפְתִי וְשָׁקְלִי לְאַלְתַּר, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא קָנוּ?!
human_translation: Huna Mar, son of Rav Neḥemya, said to Rav Ashi: If that is so, where these of the house of bar Elyashiv? As, bind and take immediately So too, that they do not acquire
llm_translation: He said to him, Huna, son of Rav Nechemyah, to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, like those of the house of Bar Eliashiv, who would cover and take immediately, is it not so that they did not acquire?!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, אִם כֵּן נָתַתָּ דְּבָרֶיךָ לְשִׁיעוּרִין!
human_translation: And if you would say indeed if so you have rendered your statement subject to circumstances.
llm_translation: And if you say so, it is said: If so, you have given your words to the rulers!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: הָנֵי תְּלָת מִילֵּי שַׁוִּינְהוּ רַבָּנַן כְּהִלְכְתָא בְּלָא טַעְמָא: חֲדָא – הָא; וְאִידַּךְ – דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַכּוֹתֵב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לְאִשְׁתּוֹ – לֹא עֲשָׂאָהּ אֶלָּא אַפִּיטְרוֹפְּיָא; וְאִידַּךְ – דְּאָמַר רַב חֲנַנְיָא: הַמַּשִּׂיא אִשָּׁה לִבְנוֹ גָּדוֹל בַּבַּיִת – קְנָאוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Mar Zutra said: These three matters were instituted by the Sages as a halakha without a reason, One this And another that Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: One who writes all of his property to his wife rendered her only a steward [ eppitrofeya ], And another that Rav Ḥananya says: one who marries a woman to his eldest son, in house, acquired that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Mar Zutra said: Those three matters the Rabbis equated to the law without reason: One - this; and the other - for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who writes all his property to his wife - has not done anything except make her an apotropos; and the other - for Rav Chananya said: One who raises his wife's son in the house - is zealous.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַב אַחָא בַּרְדְּלָא: קַבָּא דְּמוֹרִיקָא אִית לִי גַּבָּךְ; יַהֲבֵיהּ לִפְלוֹנִי. בְּאַפֵּיהּ קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ דְּלָא הָדַרְנָא בִּי.
human_translation: Rav said to Rav Aḥa Bardela: I have a kav of saffron [ morika ] with you give it to so-and-so. I say to you in his presence that I will not retract
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Rav Acha bar Dala: "I have a kabba of myrrh; give it to so-and-so." I am standing before you with anger that you did not return it to me.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּאִי בָּעֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ, מָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ לֹא נִיתְּנוּ לַחֲזָרָה.
human_translation: by inference that if he wished to retract he could retract this is what said: these statements cannot be retracted,
llm_translation: From the principle that if one wants to enhance it, can he enhance it?! This is what he is saying: These matters were not given for review.

hebrew_text: הָא אָמַר רַב חֲדָא זִימְנָא; דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, תְּנֵהוּ לוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי״, בְּמַעֲמַד שְׁלָשְׁתָּן – קָנָה!
human_translation: But Rav said once. As Rav Huna says Rav says: I one hundred dinars in your possession, give it to so-and-so, in the presence of three acquired
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Ha amar Rav Ḥada zimna; de'amar Rav Huna amar Rav: 'Maneh li beyadkha, tenhu lo lifloni', bema'amad shlashtan - kana!" Translation: "Here is what Rav Ḥada once said; as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: 'Appoint for me in your possession, give it to so-and-so', in the presence of all three - it is acquired!"

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי מַתָּנָה מְרוּבָּה, אֲבָל מַתָּנָה מוּעֶטֶת לָא לִיבְעֵי בְּפָנָיו, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from that I would say this matter, a large gift. However, a small gift not need in the presence teaches us
llm_translation: If from there, I would say these words of gift are many, but a small gift does not require his presence, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ גִּינָּאֵי דַּעֲבֻיד חוּשְׁבָּנָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. פָּשׁ חֲמֵשׁ אִיסְתְּרֵי זוּזֵי גַּבֵּי חַד מִנַּיְיהוּ, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: ״יַהֲבִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ לְמָרֵי אַרְעָא״ – בְּאַפֵּי מָרֵי אַרְעָא, וּקְנֹה מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: certain gardeners who made a calculation to each other, remained with one of them five isterei zuzei said to him: Give to the owner of the land, in the presence of the owner of the land, and acquired from him.
llm_translation: Those are the gardens of the wealthy that were made by Hadadezer. Five hundred coins of gold were placed upon one of them, they said to him: "Give them as a gift to our master of the land" - in the presence of the master of the land, and acquire from him.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אֲזַל עֲבַד חוּשְׁבָּנָא בֵּין דִּילֵיהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ, לָא פָּשׁ גַּבֵּיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֶיעְבֵּיד לָךְ? חֲדָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. וְעוֹד, הָא קְנוֹ מִינָּךְ.
human_translation: Ultimately, went and performed a calculation on his own nothing had been left with him. He came before Rav Naḥman said to him: What can I do for you? first that Rav Huna said Rav said And additionally, he acquired from you.
llm_translation: At the end, Havd Havd Havd went between his doors to himself, not his back and not his hands. He came before Rav Nachman, he said to him: What should I do for you? One, as Rav Huna said, Rav said. And also, buy from me.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אַטּוּ הַאי, מִי קָאָמַר ״לָא יָהֲבִינָא״?! ״דְּלֵיכָּא גַּבַּאי״ קָאָמַר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, קִנְיָן בְּטָעוּת הוּא, וְכׇל קִנְיָן בְּטָעוּת חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Rava said to Is that to say said: I will not give? He said: Which is not in my possession, said to him: If so, it is an acquisition in error, and any acquisition in error reverts
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: Now this, who is saying "I did not understand"?! He is saying "there are no wise men"! He said to him: If so, acquisition by error it is, and all acquisition by error is void.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לוֹ״, אָמַר רַב: חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ; וְאִם בָּא לַחְזוֹר – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, אִם בָּא לַחְזוֹר – חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: It was stated Deliver one hundred dinars to so-and-so, as I owe him Rav says: bears responsibility for their But if seeks to retract he cannot retract And Shmuel says: Since bears responsibility for their if he seeks to retract he can retract
llm_translation: It was stated: "One who says, 'I owe a hundred to so-and-so,' Rab said: he is liable in his succession; and if he comes to retract – he does not retract. And Samuel said: Since he is liable in his succession, if he comes to retract – he retracts."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכִי״ דָּמֵי, וּמָר סָבַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״ דָּמֵי?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this as Sage, holds Deliver, is like Acquire, And Sage, holds Deliver, is not like Acquire,
llm_translation: Let us say in this case he disagrees - for Mar holds: "one who walks" is like "one who is innocent," and Master holds: "one who walks" is not like "one who is innocent"?

hebrew_text: לָא; דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכִי״ דָּמֵי, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – מָר סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִיגּוֹ. וּמָר סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן מִיגּוֹ.
human_translation: No; everyone agrees that Deliver, is like Acquire, and here, they disagree about this: Sage, holds we do not say since And Sage, holds we do say since
llm_translation: Not; all the world "goes" like "Zechi" of blood, and here in this case it is divided - one Sage holds: we do not say from here. And one Sage holds: we say from here.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: ״הוֹלֵךְ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לוֹ״; ״תֵּן מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לוֹ״; ״הוֹלֵךְ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי – פִּקָּדוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בְּיָדִי״; ״תֵּן מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי – פִּקָּדוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בְּיָדִי״ – חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, וְאִם בָּא לַחְזוֹר – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rav Deliver one hundred dinars to so-and-so, as I owe him Give one hundred dinars to so-and-so, as I owe him Deliver one hundred dinars to so-and-so, a deposit he has in my possession, Give one hundred dinars to so-and-so, a deposit he has in my possession, bears responsibility for their but if he seeks to retract he cannot retract.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav: "One who gives a deposit to so-and-so, 'I am liable to him'; 'Give a deposit to so-and-so, 'I am liable to him'; 'One who gives a deposit to so-and-so - a deposit that is in my possession'; 'Give a deposit to so-and-so - a deposit that is in my possession' - he is liable for its safekeeping, and if he comes to return it, he does not return."

hebrew_text: פִּקָּדוֹן, לֵימָא לֵיהּ: אֵין רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁיְּהֵא פִּקְדוֹנוֹ בְּיַד אַחֵר! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כְּשֶׁהוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן.
human_translation: a deposit let say to It is not the will that his deposit will be in the possession of another. Rabbi Zeira says: where is established a denier
llm_translation: The text reads: "Pikadon, let him say to him: his will that his deposit in the hand of another! Said Rabbi Zeira: when he is established as a guarantor."

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת הֲוָה לֵיהּ אֲשַׁרְתָּא דְּסַרְבָּלֵי בְּמָחוֹזָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא: בַּהֲדֵי דְּאָתֵית, אַיְיתִינְהוּ נִיהֲלִי. אֲזַל, יַהֲבִינְהוּ לֵיהּ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: נִיקְנֵי מִינָּךְ; אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִין.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet had a credit [ asharta ] of cloaks [ sarbelei ] in Meḥoza, said to Rav Yosef bar Ḥama: When you come bring me went brought to him. said to him: Let us make an acquisition He said to them: Yes.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet had a servant from the Sarbalai district. He said to Rav Yosef bar Ḥama: "When you come, bring them to me." He went, brought them to him. They said to him: "Acquire from your property." He said to them: "No."

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אִישְׁתְּמִיט לְהוּ. כִּי אֲתָא לְגַבֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר עֲבַדְתְּ, דְּלָא שַׁוִּית נַפְשָׁךְ ״עֶבֶד לֹוֶה לְאִישׁ מַלְוֶה״. לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: שַׁפִּיר עֲבַדְתְּ; ״עֶבֶד לֹוֶה לְאִישׁ מַלְוֶה״.
human_translation: Ultimately, he escaped them When came before said to him: You did well, as you did not render yourself “The borrower is a slave to the lender” another version You did well, “The borrower is a slave to the lender,”
llm_translation: At the end, he forgave him. When he came before him, he said to him: "You have done well, for you did not put your soul to shame, 'a borrower is a slave to the lender.'" In another place: "You have done well; 'a borrower is a slave to the lender.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַחַי בְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה הֲוָה לֵיהּ אִיסְפְּקָא דְכַסְפָּא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא,
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiya, had a silver vessel [ ispeka ] in Neharde’a.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahai son of Rabbi Yoshiyah had a purse of money in Nehardea.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ לְרַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בַּר רַבִּי יַנַּאי וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר כֵּיפַר: בַּהֲדֵי דְּאָתֵיתוּ, אַתְיוּהּ נִיהֲלִי. אֲזוּל, יַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אָמְרִי לְהוּ: נִקְנֵי מִינַּיְיכוּ; אָמְרִי לְהוּ: לָא. אָמְרִי לְהוּ: אַהְדְּרֵיהּ נִיהֲלַן.
human_translation: said to Rabbi Dostai bar Rabbi Yannai and to Rabbi Yosei bar Keifar: When you come bring to me. They went gave it to them. said to them: Let us perform acquisition with you, said to them: No; They said to them: return to us,
llm_translation: He said to them, to Rabbi Dostai son of Rabbi Yannai and to Rabbi Yosei son of Keifar: "As you have come, bring him in." He went, brought him in. They said to him: "Buy from us." He said to them: "No." They said to him: "Return him to us."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִין; רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר כֵּיפַר אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. הֲווֹ קָא מְצַעֲרוּ לֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מָר הֵיכִי קָא עָבֵיד! אֲמַר לְהוּ: טָב רְמוֹ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Yannai, said to them: Yes, Rabbi Yosei bar Keifar said to them: No, They tormented said to See, Master, what doing said to them: well; hit him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Yannai, said to them: No; Rabbi Yosei, son of Kefa, said to them: Yes. They were causing him distress, he said to them: See, Master, what is he doing! He said to them: It is better to throw him into the sea.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתוֹ לְגַבֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מָר, לָא מִיסָּתְיֵיהּ דְּלָא סַיְּיעַן, אֶלָּא אֲמַר לְהוּ נָמֵי ״טָב רְמוֹ לֵיהּ״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי תֶּיעְבֵּד הָכִי?
human_translation: When two came before said to him: See, Master, not only did not support me; rather, he said to them: well; hit him. said to Why did you do this?
llm_translation: When they came before him, he said to him: "See, sir, I did not help him, but I also said to them, 'Let the good be thrown to him!'" He said to him: "Why should it be done like this?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אוֹתָן בְּנֵי אָדָם – הֵן אַמָּה, וְכוֹבָעָן אַמָּהּ, וּמְדַבְּרִין מֵחֶצְיֵיהֶן, וּשְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן מְבוֹהָלִין: ׳אַרְדָּא׳ וְ׳אַרְטָא׳ וּ׳פִילֵי בְּרֵישׁ׳; אוֹמְרִין ״כְּפוֹתוּ״ – כּוֹפְתִין; אוֹמְרִין ״הֲרוֹגוּ״ – הוֹרְגִין; אִילּוּ הָרְגוּ אֶת דּוֹסְתַּאי, מִי נָתַן לְיַנַּאי אַבָּא בַּר כְּמוֹתִי.
human_translation: said to him: Those people they are a cubit, and their hats were a cubit, and they spoke from their midpoints, and their names were frightening: Arda and Arta and Pili Bereish. say to them: Restrain they would restrain say Kill they would kill. Had they killed Dostai, who would give Yannai, father, son like me?
llm_translation: He said to him: Those human beings - their height is a cubit, and their headgear is a cubit, and they speak from their half, and their names are confused: 'Arda' and 'Arta' and 'Filei Bereish'; they say "Kefutu" - they are bent; they say "Harugu" - they kill; if they killed Dostai, who gave to Yannai the father of Kmoti.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנֵי אָדָם הַלָּלוּ קְרוֹבִים לַמַּלְכוּת הֵן? אָמַר לֵיהּ: הֵן. יֵשׁ לָהֶן סוּסִים וּפְרָדִים שֶׁרָצִים אַחֲרֵיהֶן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, שַׁפִּיר עֲבַדְתְּ.
human_translation: said to him: Are these people close to the government? said to him: Yes. Do they have horses and mules that run after them, said to them: Yes. said to him: If so, you acted well,
llm_translation: He said to him: Are these human beings close to the kingdom? He said to him: Yes. Do they have horses and mules that run after them? He said to him: Yes. He said to him: If so, you have done well.

hebrew_text: ״הוֹלֵךְ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְהָלַךְ וּבִקְּשׁוֹ וְלֹא מְצָאוֹ – תָּנֵי חֲדָא: יַחְזְרוּ לַמְשַׁלֵּחַ; וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לְיוֹרְשֵׁי מִי שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּלְחוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: Deliver one hundred dinars to so-and-so, and went and searched but did not find him, is taught one should be returned to the sender. And it is taught another to the heirs of the one to whom it was sent.
llm_translation: "He goes to fulfill a debt to Ploni," and he went and searched for him but did not find him - one teaching: "They should return to the sender"; and another teaching: "To his heirs, those who inherited it from him."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכִי״, וּמָר סָבַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this, as Sage, holds Deliver, is like Acquire, And Sage, holds Deliver, is not like Acquire,
llm_translation: Let us say in this case he disagrees - for Mar holds: "halach" like "zekhi," and Mar holds: "halach" not like "zekhi"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״; וְלָא קַשְׁיָא – הָא בְּבָרִיא, הָא בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: everyone agrees Deliver, is not like Acquire, and not difficult: This with a healthy person that with on his deathbed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: The entirety of the world, "walking" is not like "sitting"; and it is not difficult - this one is when one is healthy, and this one is when one is sick.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע; הָא – דְּאִיתֵיהּ לִמְקַבֵּל בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת, הָא – דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לִמְקַבֵּל בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said: this and that with on his deathbed. this where the recipient was at the time of the giving of the money. That where the recipient was not at the time of the giving of the money,
llm_translation: Rav Zebid said: This and this in the case of a sick person; this - who has it to receive at the time of giving gifts, this - who does not have it to receive at the time of giving gifts.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בְּבָרִיא; הָא – דְּמִית מְקַבֵּל בְּחַיֵּי נוֹתֵן, הָא – דְּמִית נוֹתֵן בְּחַיֵּי מְקַבֵּל.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said This and that with a healthy person this where the recipient died in the lifetime of the giver, that where the giver died in the lifetime of the recipient.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This and this in a healthy state; this - where one acquires during the life of the giver, this - where one gives during the life of the receiver.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכִי״ תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״הוֹלֵךְ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְהָלַךְ וּבִקְּשׁוֹ וְלֹא מְצָאוֹ, יַחְזְרוּ לַמְשַׁלֵּחַ. מֵת מְשַׁלֵּחַ – רַבִּי נָתָן וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמְרוּ: יַחְזְרוּ לְיוֹרְשֵׁי מְשַׁלֵּחַ, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: לְיוֹרְשֵׁי מִי שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּלְחוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: Shall we say Deliver, is like Acquire, is tanna’im ? as it is taught Deliver one hundred dinars to so-and-so, and he went and searched for him but did not find him, should be returned to the sender. the sender died, Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Ya’akov said: should be returned to the heirs of the sender. And some say: the heirs of the one to whom it was sent.
llm_translation: Let us say, "walking" is like "acquiring," is it a teaching of the sages? For it was taught: "If one sends a hundred to so-and-so, and he went and sought him but did not find him, they should return to the sender. If the sender has died - Rabbi Nathan and Rabbi Yaakov said: they should return to the heirs of the sender, and some say: to the heirs of the one who was dispatched to.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ. וְכָאן אָמְרוּ: כֹּל מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה שָׁלִיחַ – יַעֲשֶׂה. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַנָּשִׂיא: עַל יָדִי הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וְאָמְרוּ: יַחְזְרוּ לְיוֹרְשֵׁי מְשַׁלֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi said in the name of Rabbi Ya’akov, who said in the name of Rabbi Meir: It is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead. And the Rabbis say: they should divide And here, they said: Whatever the agent wishes to do he may do. Rabbi Shimon HaNasi said: an incident under my and said should be returned to the heirs of the sender.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah the Prince said in the name of Rabbi Yaakov, who said in the name of Rabbi Meir: It is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased. And the sages say: Let them divide. And here they said: Whatever the agent desires - he should do. Rabbi Shimon the Prince said: Through me the matter was done, and they said: Let it return to the heirs of the sender.

hebrew_text: מַאי, לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״; וְרַבִּי נָתָן וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב נָמֵי – ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִית, לָא אָמְרִינַן ״מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת״; וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים – ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכִי״;
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree about this that the first tanna holds Deliver, is not like Acquire, And Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Ya’akov also Deliver, is not like Acquire, but even though died, one does not say: It is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead. And Some say, Deliver, is like Acquire.
llm_translation: What, is it not in this that they disagree? For it was taught in the first Tanna's opinion: "Walking" is not like "acquiring." And Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Yaakov say: "Walking" is not like "acquiring," and even though he resembles, we do not say, "It is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased." And some say: "Walking" is like "acquiring."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר – ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״, מִיהוּ, הֵיכָא דְּמִית, אָמְרִינַן מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת;
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi, said in the name of Rabbi Ya’akov, who said in the name of Rabbi Meir, Deliver, is not like Acquire. However, where died we say it is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah the Prince said in the name of Rabbi Yaakov who said in the name of Rabbi Meir - "walking" is not like "acquiring," however, in a case where it is similar, we say it is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ – מְסַפְּקָא לְהוּ; וְכָאן אָמְרוּ – שׁוּדָא עָדִיף; וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַנָּשִׂיא – מַעֲשֶׂה אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: They should divide it, they uncertain And Here they said, the discretion [ shuda ] is preferable And Rabbi Shimon HaNasi he came to teach us an incident
llm_translation: The sages say: "They shall divide" - it is a question for them; and here they said - the field is preferable; and Rabbi Shimon the President - a case came to teach us.

hebrew_text: לָא, בְּבָרִיא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי; וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע, וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבָּנַן קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: No; in a healthy person everyone agrees and with what are we dealing here? on his deathbed and they disagree in the dispute between Rabbi Elazar and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Not, in the healthy of all the world not they argue; and here in what we are dealing - in the case of lying sick, and in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis they argue.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַמְחַלֵּק נְכָסָיו עַל פִּיו, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד בָּרִיא וְאֶחָד מְסוּכָּן; נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת – נִקְנִין בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה, וְשֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת – אֵין נִקְנִין אֶלָּא בִּמְשִׁיכָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ נִקְנִין בַּאֲמִירָה.
human_translation: as we learned one who divides his property orally, Rabbi Elazar says: Both a healthy person and a dangerously ill person, property that serves as a guarantee, is acquired by money, through a document, or by taking possession. And that does not serve as a guarantee, can be acquired only through pulling. And the Rabbis say: this and that can be acquired through speech,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who divides his estate according to his own discretion, Rabbi Eliezer says: One heir healthy and one heir sick; estates that have successors – are acquired through money, contract, and possession, and estates that do not have successors – are acquired only through pulling the object towards oneself. And the Sages say: Both types of estates are acquired through verbal declaration.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִמָּן שֶׁל בְּנֵי רוֹכֵל שֶׁהָיְתָה חוֹלָה, וְאָמְרָה: ״תִּינָּתֵן
human_translation: They said to an incident with regard to the mother of the sons of Rokhel, who was ill, and she said: Give
llm_translation: They said to him: There was an incident with the mother-in-law of the sons of a merchant who was sick, and she said, "Let it be given."

hebrew_text: כְּבִינְתִּי לְבִתִּי, וְהִיא בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה״, וּמֵתָה, וְקִיְּימוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ! אָמַר לָהֶם: בְּנֵי רוֹכֵל תִּקְבְּרֵם אִמָּם.
human_translation: my brooch [ kevinati ] to my daughter, and twelve hundred dinars. And died, and the Sages fulfilled her statement. said to them the sons of Rokhel should be buried by their mother,
llm_translation: As my daughter understood, and she had twelve mana, and she died, and the sages upheld her words! He said to them: "The sons of merchants shall bury their mother."

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר; וְרַבִּי נָתָן וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב נָמֵי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִית, לָא אָמְרִינַן מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת; וְ״יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים״ – כְּרַבָּנַן;
human_translation: The first tanna in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, And Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Ya’akov also in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. even though died one does not say: It is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead. And Some say, in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: We learned in the first teaching like Rabbi Elazar; and Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Yaakov are considered like Rabbi Elazar - even though he is similar, we do not say it is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased; and "some say" - like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר – כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מִיהוּ הֵיכָא דְּמִית אָמְרִינַן מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת; וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ – מְסַפְּקָא לְהוּ; וְכָאן אָמְרוּ – שׁוּדָא עֲדִיף; וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַנָּשִׂיא – מַעֲשֶׂה אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi, said in the name of Rabbi Meir, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. However, where died we say: It is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead. And the Rabbis say: They should divide they uncertain And Here they said, the discretion is preferable. And Rabbi Shimon HaNasi came to teach us incident
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda the Prince said in the name of Rabbi Meir - like Rabbi Elazar, however, in a case where we say there is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased; and the sages say: let them divide - it is a doubt for them; and here they said - the testimony is preferable; and Rabbi Shimon the Prince - a case came to teach us.

hebrew_text: אִבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַנָּשִׂיא; נָשִׂיא הוּא, אוֹ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּנָשִׂיא קָאָמַר? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַנָּשִׂיא. וַעֲדַיִין תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ: נָשִׂיא הוּא, אוֹ דְּקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּנָשִׂיא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Is Rabbi Shimon HaNasi a Nasi , or that he spoke in the name of the Nasi ? Come hear that Rav Yosef, says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon HaNasi. But raise the dilemma: Is he a Nasi , or that he spoke in the name of the Nasi , shall stand
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Rabbi Shimon HaNasi; is he a prince, or is he called a prince because of his name? Come and hear, as Rav Yosef said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon HaNasi. And still you ask: Is he a prince, or is he called a prince because of his name? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַנָּשִׂיא. וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דִּבְרֵי שְׁכִיב מְרַע כִּכְתוּבִין וְכִמְסוּרִין דָּמוּ!
human_translation: the itself: Rav Yosef says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon HaNasi, But don’t we maintain the statement of on his deathbed is considered written and delivered?
llm_translation: The body - Rav Yosef said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon the Prince. But we have established the words of a dying person like written and transmitted!

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף מוֹקֵי לַהּ בְּבָרִיא. וְהָא לְיוֹרְשֵׁי מְשַׁלֵּחַ קָאָמַר, וְקַיְימָא לַן: מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת! תְּנִי: יַחְזְרוּ לִמְשַׁלֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef establishes with regard to a healthy person, But he said to the heirs of the sender, and we maintain it is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead, teach: Return to the sender,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef strikes her with a rod. And this is regarding heirs who send, as it is established for us: It is a commandment to fulfill the words of the deceased! Teach: They should return to the sender.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמֵּבִיא קַמָּא
llm_translation: We will return to you, the one who brings forward the first.

hebrew_text: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, וְאָמַר: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב אֲבָל לֹא בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״; ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם אֲבָל לֹא בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״; ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב כּוּלּוֹ וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם חֶצְיוֹ״; ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב חֶצְיוֹ וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם כּוּלּוֹ״ – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: one who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas and says: was written in my presence but it was not signed in my presence; It was signed in my presence but it was not written in my presence; All of it was written in my presence and half of it was signed in my presence, Half of it was written in my presence and all of it was signed in my presence, invalid.
llm_translation: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, and says: "Written in my presence but not signed in my presence"; "Signed in my presence but not written in my presence"; "Written in my presence entirely and signed in my presence halfway"; "Written in my presence halfway and signed in my presence entirely" – it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, פָּסוּל. שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, פָּסוּל; וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״, כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: one says: It was written in my presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence, invalid. two say: It was written in our presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence, invalid. And Rabbi Yehuda deems valid. one says: It was written in my presence, and two say: It was signed in our presence, valid.
llm_translation: One says, "written in our presence," and one says, "signed in our presence," invalid. Two say, "written in our presence," and one says, "signed in our presence," invalid; but Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid. One says, "written in our presence," and two say, "signed in our presence," valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא – הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״! אִי מֵהַהִיא הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: צָרִיךְ, וְאִי לָא אָמַר כָּשֵׁר; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I these further Didn’t it teach once, One who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas is required to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence? If from that I would say: required but if he did not say valid teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need this? This was taught to him once - one time: "One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, he must say, 'It was written and signed in my presence!'" If it was from that specific place, I would say: necessary, and if not, I would say: invalid; this is what we infer.

hebrew_text: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב חֶצְיוֹ וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם כּוּלּוֹ״, פָּסוּל. הֵי חֶצְיוֹ? אִלֵּימָא חֶצְיוֹ רִאשׁוֹן, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא כָּתַב בּוֹ אֶלָּא שִׁיטָה אַחַת לִשְׁמָהּ, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חֶצְיוֹ אַחֲרוֹן.
human_translation: Half of it was written in my presence and all of it was signed in my presence, invalid. which half If we say its first half but didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Even if wrote only one line of it for her sake, is no longer required Rather, Rav Ashi said: its latter half
llm_translation: "In My presence half was written, and in My presence it was sealed in its entirety," invalid. What is 'half'? If you say the first half, but didn't Rabbi Elazar say: Even if he only wrote one letter for its sake, he need not return! Rather, Rav Ashi said: The latter half."

hebrew_text: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב כּוּלּוֹ וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם חֶצְיוֹ״, פָּסוּל. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם מְעִידִים עַל חֲתִימַת יַד שֵׁנִי – פָּסוּל. מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: All of it was written in my presence and half of it was signed in my presence, invalid. Rav Ḥisda says: And even two testify to the signature second invalid. What is the reason
llm_translation: "In My presence it was written in its entirety, and in My presence it was sealed half of it," invalid. Rav Ḥisdah said: Even if two witnesses testify regarding the sealing of the second hand – invalid. What is the reason?"

hebrew_text: אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בְּקִיּוּם הַגֵּט, אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בְּתַקָּנַת חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: either entirely through the ratification of a bill of divorce, or it entirely via rabbinic decree
llm_translation: Or all of it in the validity of the divorce document, or all of it in the enactment of the Sages.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּאִילּוּ אָמַר חַד, כָּשֵׁר; הַשְׁתָּא דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי, פָּסוּל?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ
human_translation: Rava objects to this: Is there any which if one said valid, now that there are two invalid? Rather, Rava says: Even
llm_translation: Rava objects: Is there a case where if one said one thing, it is valid; but now that there are two things it is invalid?! Rather, Rava said: Even if...

hebrew_text: הוּא וְאַחֵר מְעִידִין עַל חֲתִימַת יַד שֵׁנִי – פָּסוּל. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָתוּ לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא, וְקָא נָפֵיק נְכֵי רִיבְעָא דְמָמוֹנָא אַפּוּמָּא דְּחַד סָהֲדָא.
human_translation: he, and another testify with regard to the signature of the second invalid. What is the reason will come to confuse it with the typical ratification of documents, And the money, minus a quarter, will be extracted based upon of one witness.
llm_translation: He and another testify on the second signature - invalid. What is the reason? They came to exchange in the establishment of worldly documents, and it turns out the wounds of money are equal to the testimony of one witness.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי, דְּאִילּוּ מַסֵּיק לֵיהּ אִיהוּ לְכוּלֵּיהּ דִּיבּוּרָא, כָּשֵׁר; הַשְׁתָּא דְּאִיכָּא חַד בַּהֲדֵיהּ, פָּסוּל?!
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this: Is there any which if he would complete his entire statement valid, now that there is one with him, invalid?
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Ashe: "Who is there that can bring a proof from this? For even if he establishes it for all matters of speech, it is valid; now that there is one against it, is it invalid?!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ אוֹמֵר ״אֲנִי הוּא עֵד שֵׁנִי״ – פָּסוּל. מַאי טַעְמָא? אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בְּקִיּוּם הַגֵּט, אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בְּתַקָּנַת חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi says even says: I am the second witness invalid. What is the reason It either entirely through the ratification of the bill of divorce, or it entirely via rabbinic decree,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: Even if one says, "I am the second witness," - it is invalid. What is the reason? Either entirely based on the fulfillment of the divorce document, or entirely based on the enactment of the Sages.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב כּוּלּוֹ, בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם חֶצְיוֹ״, פָּסוּל. אִידַּךְ חֶצְיוֹ הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּקָא מַסְהֵיד עֲלֵיהּ כְּלָל; הַשְׁתָּא אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, דְּהַאי קָמַסְהֵיד אַכּוּלַּהּ כְּתִיבָה וְהַאי קָמַסְהֵיד אַכּוּלַּהּ חֲתִימָה, פָּסוּל; חֶצְיוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: We learned All of it was written in my presence half of it was signed in my presence, invalid. What are the circumstances the other half of If we say that there is no who testifies about it at all, Now one says: It was written in my presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence, which this testifies with regard to all writing and that testifies with regard to all signing, invalid. half of it is it necessary
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "If it was written in front of him in its entirety, but signed in front of him only half of it, it is invalid." The Gemara asks: How is the case of its half? If you say that there is no part that is missing from it entirely; now, one says, "It was written in front of me," and one says, "It was signed in front of me," for this one testifies to the writing and this one testifies to the signing, it is invalid. Does it require its half?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אוֹ כִּדְרָבָא אוֹ כִּדְרַב אָשֵׁי,
human_translation: Rather, either in accordance with of Rava, or in accordance with of Rav Ashi,
llm_translation: Rather, either like Ravah or like Rav Ashi,

hebrew_text: וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: And to exclude of Rav Ḥisda,
llm_translation: And to appease from Rav Ḥisda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב חִסְדָּא: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב אֲבָל לֹא בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ לָמָּה לִי? אֶלָּא לֹא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי,
