human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to you: And according to your reasoning, why do I It was written in my presence but it was not signed in my presence, Rather, teaches Not this also that,
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Ḥisdah: And according to your reasoning, "Written before Me, but not sealed before Me," why do I need it? Rather, not this one, not that one, it is taught.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי לָא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: here too teaches Not this also that.
llm_translation: Here we say: "Lo zo af zo katanei."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גִּידּוּד חֲמִשָּׁה וּמְחִיצָה חֲמִשָּׁה – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בִּמְחִיצָה אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ בְּגִידּוּד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says, An embankment, five and partition five do not join only if it is entirely of a partition, or entirely of the embankment,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: If there is a wall of five handbreadths and a fence of five handbreadths - they do not combine, until it is either all in the wall or all in the fence.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ מָרִימָר: גִּידּוּד חֲמִשָּׁה וּמְחִיצָה חֲמִשָּׁה – מִצְטָרְפִין. וְהִלְכְתָא: מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: Mareimar taught: An embankment five and a partition five join And the halakha they join
llm_translation: Marimar expounded: A burning of five and a partition of five - they combine. And the halakha is: they combine.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי אִילְפָא: יָדַיִם – טְהוֹרוֹת לַחֲצָאִין, אוֹ אֵין טְהוֹרוֹת לַחֲצָאִין? הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָא מָשׁוּ בֵּי תְרֵי מֵרְבִיעִית, וְהָא תְּנַן: מֵרְבִיעִית נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם, לְאֶחָד וַאֲפִילּוּ לִשְׁנַיִם!
human_translation: Ilfa raised a dilemma: hands ritually pure in halves, or not ritually pure in halves? What are the circumstances If we say that two wash with quarter- but didn’t we learn With a quarter- one can wash the hands of one and even of two?
llm_translation: Inquiry of Ilfa: Are hands pure for Terumah, or are they not pure for Terumah? How so? If you say that they have touched a secondary source of impurity, but didn't we learn: For a secondary source of impurity, one may take for hands, for one, and even for two!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא דְּקָא מָשֵׁי חֲדָא חֲדָא יְדֵיהּ, וְהָתְנַן: הַנּוֹטֵל יָדוֹ אַחַת בִּנְטִילָה, וְאַחַת בִּשְׁטִיפָה, יָדָיו טְהוֹרוֹת!
human_translation: But rather, where washed his hands one by one, But didn’t we learn one who one hand by washing and one by immersing his hands are ritually pure?
llm_translation: And rather, he is rubbing one hand after another, and we learned: One who washes one hand with the ritual washing, and one hand with the rinsing, his hands are clean!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא דְּקָא מָשֵׁי פַּלְגָא פַּלְגָא דְּיָדֵיהּ, וְהָאָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: יָדַיִם – אֵין טְהוֹרוֹת לַחֲצָאִין! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא מַשְׁקֶה טוֹפֵחַ.
human_translation: But rather, where he washes his hand in two halves, But didn’t from the school of Rabbi Yannai say: Hands cannot ritually pure in halves? No, necessary where there is liquid moist
llm_translation: And rather, that he is placing half a half of his hands, and the House of Rabbi Yannai said: "Hands - they are not pure for Challah!" It is not necessary, for there is a liquid of a handful.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִיכָּא מַשְׁקֶה טוֹפֵחַ מַאי הָוֵי? וְהָתְנַן:
human_translation: And when there is liquid moist, what of it? But didn’t we learn
llm_translation: And when there is a drink of a "tofach," what is it? And we learned:

hebrew_text: הַנִּצּוֹק, וְהַקָּטַפְרֵס, וּמַשְׁקֶה טוֹפֵחַ – אֵינוֹ חִיבּוּר לֹא לְטוּמְאָה וְלֹא לְטׇהֳרָה!
human_translation: A stream and an incline [ katafres ], and liquid moist not connect, neither for ritual impurity nor for purity.
llm_translation: The squeezed, and the crushed, and the liquid of a fist - is not considered a connection neither for impurity nor for purity!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא טוֹפֵחַ לְהַטְפִּיחַ. הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: טוֹפֵחַ לְהַטְפִּיחַ – חִיבּוּר!
human_translation: No, necessary where there is moist to render moist. We learned this as well: moist to render moist, connects
llm_translation: Not necessary, for there is a handbreadth to clap. Here we learn: A handbreadth to clap - obligation!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לְעִנְיַן מִקְוָאוֹת, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דִּתְנַן: מִקְוֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה מְכוּוָּנוֹת, וְיָרְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְטָבְלוּ (שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּבַת אַחַת – טְהוֹרִים),
human_translation: Perhaps with regard to the issue of ritual baths, and is Rabbi Yehuda. As we learned a ritual bath that contains precisely forty se’a and two descended and immersed both of them at the same time they are ritually pure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Perhaps for the matter of mikvaot, and Rabbi Yehuda is it. For we learned: A mikveh that has forty se'ah of drawn water, and two descended and immersed (both of them at once - they are pure).

hebrew_text: בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – רִאשׁוֹן טָהוֹר, וְהַשֵּׁנִי טָמֵא.
human_translation: sequentially, first ritually pure, but the second impure,
llm_translation: In this, one after the other - the first is pure, and the second is impure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיוּ רַגְלָיו שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן נוֹגְעוֹת בַּמַּיִם – אַף הַשֵּׁנִי טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If first feet were touching the water the second also ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If the feet of the first animal touched the water - even the second animal is pure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ: הַבָּא רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בְּמַיִם שְׁאוּבִין, וְטָהוֹר שֶׁנָּפְלוּ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ וְעַל רוּבּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין מַיִם שְׁאוּבִין – טָמֵא; בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: חֶצְיוֹ בְּבִיאָה וְחֶצְיוֹ בִּנְפִילָה, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: They said one whose head and most of his enter drawn water and a ritually pure person whom three log drawn water fell on his head and most of his ritually impure. Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: half of by entering and half of him by fall what shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said, behold they said: one whose head and the majority of his body entered into drawn water, and pure water fell upon his head and the majority of his body, three lug of drawn water - he is impure; Rabbi Yirmeya inquired: if half of it is through immersion and half through pouring, what is the law? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ: בַּעַל קֶרִי חוֹלֶה, שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עָלָיו תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין מַיִם – טָהוֹר; בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: חֶצְיוֹ בִּטְבִילָה וְחֶצְיוֹ בִּנְתִינָה, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: They said a sick who experienced a seminal emission, who had nine kav of water poured over him, ritually pure. Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: half of him by immersion and half of him through pouring, what shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, behold they said: A Ba'al Keri who is sick, upon whom they poured nine kav of water - pure; Rav Papa asked: Half of it with immersion and half of it with pouring, what is the ruling? It shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין הַגֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם, אֲבָל גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם –
human_translation: one says: It was written in my presence, and one says: Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They taught only if the bill of divorce not produced by both of them However, bill of divorce produced by both of them,
llm_translation: One says, "Written in my presence," and one says, "Thus: Rab Shmuel bar Yehudah said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught that the bill of divorce does not leave the possession of both of them, but the bill of divorce does leave the possession of both of them –

hebrew_text: כָּשֵׁר. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, אֵין צְרִיכִין שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: valid. Apparently, holds two who brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas are not required to say: It was written in our presence and it was signed in our presence.
llm_translation: "Kasher. Alma kasavar shnayim shehevi'u get mi'medinat ha'yam, ein tzerikhin sheyomru: 'B'faneinu niktav u'b'faneinu nechtam.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – פָּסוּל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר;
human_translation: Abaye said to If that is so, the latter clause which teaches: two say: It was written in our presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence, invalid, and Rabbi Yehuda deems valid.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now on, the latter part of what is taught: Two say "it was written in our presence" and one says "it was signed in my presence" - it is invalid, and Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּאֵין הַגֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם, הָא גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם – מַכְשְׁרִי רַבָּנַן?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: The reason that the bill of divorce was not produced by both of them, bill of divorce was produced by both of them would the Rabbis deem valid? said to Yes,
llm_translation: Reason that the get does not emerge from beneath both of their hands, this get emerges from beneath both of their hands - the sages permit it?! He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אֵין גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי? מָר סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן דִּלְמָא אָתְיָא לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא – בְּעֵד אֶחָד; וּמָר סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: And where the bill of divorce was not produced by both of them, with regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds: decree lest will come to confuse with the typical ratification of documents. of one witness. And Sage, holds do not decree
llm_translation: And when a bill of divorce does not take effect from under the hands of both of them, what do they argue about? One Sage holds: We decree lest he come to exchange it for regular documents of the world - with one witness; and the other Sage holds: We do not decree.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא אָמְרִי לַהּ: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם – פָּסוּל. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, צְרִיכִין שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: Some say another version Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even a bill of divorce produced by both of them is invalid. Apparently, holds two brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas they are required to say: It was written in our presence and it was signed in our presence.
llm_translation: The other sages said to her: Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if a divorce document emerges from beneath both of them - it is invalid. This implies that he holds that two who brought a divorce document from the sea require that it be stated, "It was written before us and signed before us."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – פָּסוּל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר; אֲפִילּוּ גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם פָּסְלִי רַבָּנַן?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If that is so, the latter clause which teaches: two say: It was written in our presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence, invalid. And Rabbi Yehuda deems valid. even the bill of divorce was produced by both of them the Rabbis deem invalid? said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now on, the latter part that is taught: Two say "it was written in our presence" and one says "it was signed in my presence" - it is invalid, and Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid; even a bill of divorce that comes out from under both of them, do the Rabbis invalidate it?! He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין לִשְׁמָהּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֵדִים מְצוּיִין לְקַיְּימוֹ.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds because are not experts for her sake. And Sage, holds because there are no witnesses available to ratify it,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds: because they are not knowledgeable of its name, and the other Master holds: because there are no established witnesses for its fulfillment.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּרַבָּה וְרָבָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? לָא; רָבָא מְתָרֵץ כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא,
human_translation: shall we say of Rabba and Rava is tanna’im ? No, Rava resolves in accordance with the first version,
llm_translation: Let us say that Rava and Raba are both teachers? No; Raba interprets like the first Tanna.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה אָמַר לָךְ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – לְאַחַר שֶׁלָּמְדוּ;
human_translation: And Rabba said to you, that everyone we require for her sake. And with what are we dealing here? after they learned
llm_translation: Rabba said to you: "We require everything in the world for its own sake, and here, with what are we dealing? - After they have learned."

hebrew_text: וּבִגְזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַחְזוֹר הַדָּבָר לְקִלְקוּלוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר גָּזְרִינַן, וּמָר סָבַר לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: And they disagree with regard to decree lest the matter return to its corrupt state, As Sage, holds: decree And Sage, holds: do not decree
llm_translation: And in a decree lest the matter revert to its detriment, there is a disagreement - for Mar holds that we decree, and Master holds that we do not decree.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפְלוֹג נָמֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵישָׁא! הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר עוּלָּא: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: But let Rabbi Yehuda disagree also with regard to the first clause it was stated with regard to Ulla said: Rabbi Yehuda was in disagreement even with regard to the first clause.
llm_translation: And they disputed before Rabbi Yehuda at the beginning! It was said about him, Ulla said: Rabbi Yehuda was also a disputant in the beginning.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא לְעוּלָּא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר בְּזוֹ וְלֹא בְּאַחֶרֶת. מַאי, לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״?!
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raises an objection to Ulla Rabbi Yehuda deems valid in this but not in another What, is it not to exclude one says: It was written in my presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Oshaya said to Ulah: Rabbi Yehuda validates with this one and not with another. What is the reason? Is it not to exclude one who says, "It was written in my presence," and another who says, "It was signed in my presence"?!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם אֲבָל לֹא בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ – סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְלָא גָּזַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַחְזוֹר דָּבָר לְקִלְקוּלוֹ; דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאִחַלּוֹפֵי בְּקִיּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא, בְּעֵד אֶחָד – נָמֵי לָא גָּזַר; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No, to exclude It was signed in my presence but it was not written in my presence. enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Yehuda did not issue decree lest the matter return to its corrupt state, perhaps he also did not decree will come to confuse with the typical ratification of documents, with one witness. teaches us
llm_translation: Not to, to exclude "but in My presence he was sealed, but not in My presence it was written" - it is obvious in your opinion I say: since Rabbi Yehuda did not decree a decree lest a matter revert to its detriment; perhaps he will come to exchange in the fulfillment of worldly documents, in one case - yes, he did not decree; this is what we infer.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: It was also stated, Rav Yehuda says: two who brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas, we have arrived at the dispute Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: It was stated: Namely, Rav Yehudah said: Two individuals who brought a divorce document from the country of the sea, we came to the dispute of Rabbi Yehudah and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה חֲלַשׁ, עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּה, לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ. בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, צְרִיכִין שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״, אוֹ אֵין צְרִיכִין? אָמַר לָהֶם: אֵין צְרִיכִין – מָה אִילּוּ יֹאמְרוּ ״בְּפָנֵינוּ גֵּירְשָׁהּ״, מִי לָא מְהֵימְנִי?! אַדְּהָכִי, אֲתָא הָהוּא
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana was weak, Rav Yehuda and Rabba entered to him to inquire his they raised a dilemma before him: two who brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas, are they required to say: It was written in our presence and it was signed in our presence, or are they not required He said to them: They are not required What if they said: She was divorced in our presence, wouldn’t they be deemed credible? In the meantime, in came a certain
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah fell ill, Rav Yehudah and Rabbah came to visit him. They asked him: Two men who brought a divorce document from the country of the sea, do they need to say, "It was written and signed before us," or not? He said to them: They do not need to say it - if they were to say, "She was divorced before us," who would believe them?! Meanwhile, that person came.

hebrew_text: חַבְרָא, שְׁקַלָה לִשְׁרָגָא מִקַּמַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַר: רַחֲמָנָא! אוֹ בְּטוּלָּךְ, אוֹ בְּטוּלָּא דְּבַר עֵשָׂו.
human_translation: Persian priest [ ḥabbara ] took the lamp [ sheragga ] from before them. said: Merciful One! either in Your shadow or in the shadow of the descendants of Esau,
llm_translation: Companion, took to the lamp from before them. He said: Merciful One! Either in Your annulment, or in the annulment of the matter of Esau.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרוֹמָאֵי מְעַלּוּ מִפָּרְסָאֵי?! וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱלֹהִים הֵבִין דַּרְכָּהּ וְהוּא יָדַע אֶת מְקוֹמָהּ״? יוֹדֵעַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵין יְכוֹלִין לְקַבֵּל גְּזֵירַת רוֹמִיִּים, עָמַד וְהִגְלָה אוֹתָם לְבָבֶל.
human_translation: Is this to say that the Romans are preferable to the Persians? But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach: What which is written: “God understands its way and He knows its place” the Holy One, Blessed be He, knows with regard to the Jewish people that they are unable to accept Roman decrees, He arose and exiled them to Babylonia.
llm_translation: In the matter of the Romans, did they ascend from Persia?! And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya, what is the meaning of what is written: "God understands her way, and He knows her place"? The Holy One, blessed be He, knows regarding Israel that they are unable to accept the decrees of the Romans, so He stood up and exiled them to Babylon.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא; הָא מִקַּמֵּי דְּנֵיתוֹ חַבָּרֵי לְבָבֶל, הָא לְבָתַר דַּאֲתוֹ חַבָּרֵי לְבָבֶל.
human_translation: not difficult, this before the Persians reached Babylonia, That after the Persians reached Babylonia,
llm_translation: Not difficult; this is from before the colleagues of Bavel came, this is after the colleagues of Bavel came.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב״ וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״ – כָּשֵׁר: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁהַגֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יַד עֵד כְּתִיבָה, דְּנַעֲשׂוּ כִּשְׁנַיִם עַל זֶה וְכִשְׁנַיִם עַל זֶה; אֲבָל מִתַּחַת יְדֵי עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: one says: It was written in my presence, and two say: It was signed in our presence, valid. Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They taught only when the bill of divorce is produced by the witness writing, as they become as two for this and two for that However, was produced by signatory witnesses invalid.
llm_translation: One says, "Written in our presence," and two say, "Signed in our presence" - valid. Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught that a divorce document is valid when it is written under the supervision of a witness, as if two are involved in this and two are involved in that; but if it is under the supervision of witnesses for the signing - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, צְרִיכִין שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, רֵישָׁא דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – פָּסוּל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר; וַאֲפִילּוּ גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם – פָּסְלִי רַבָּנַן?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Apparently, holds two who brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas are required to say: It was written in our presence and it was signed in our presence, Rabbi Asi said to If that is so, the first clause which teaches: two say: It was written in our presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence, invalid, and Rabbi Yehuda deems valid? But the Rabbis invalidate even bill of divorce is produced by both of them? said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Does he indeed hold that two who bring a bill of divorce from overseas must say, "It was written in our presence and signed in our presence"? Rabbi Assi said to him: Rather, from now on, the beginning of the Mishnah should be taught as follows: If two say, "It was written in our presence," and one says, "It was signed in my presence," it is invalid according to the Rabbis, but Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid. And even if a bill of divorce emerges from under the hands of both of them, do the Rabbis disqualify it? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר, דַּאֲפִילּוּ גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה – כָּשֵׁר. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, אֵין צְרִיכִין שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: time found sitting and saying that even bill of divorce is produced by the signatory witnesses valid. Apparently, holds two who brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas, they are not required to say: It was written in our presence and it was signed in our presence.
llm_translation: Times he found that sitting and saying, that even a divorce document goes out from under the hands of the witnesses of the signature - it is valid. This implies that he holds: two who brought a divorce document from the sea region, do not need to say, "It was written and signed before us."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, רֵישָׁא דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – פָּסוּל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר; טַעְמָא דְּאֵין הַגֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם, הָא גֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם – מַכְשְׁרִי רַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said to him: However, if that is so, the first clause which teaches: two say: It was written in our presence, and one says: It was signed in my presence, invalid, and Rabbi Yehuda deems valid? The reason that the bill of divorce is not produced by both of them, bill of divorce is produced by both of them the Sages deem valid.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Assi: Rather, from now on, the beginning of the Mishnah states: Two say "it was written in our presence" and one says "it was signed in my presence" - it is invalid, and Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid; the reason being that the bill of divorce does not leave the control of both of them, but if the bill of divorce leaves the control of both of them - do the Rabbis deem it valid?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. וְהָא זִמְנִין לָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַן הָכִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָתֵד הִיא שֶׁלֹּא תָּמוּט.
human_translation: said to him: Yes. But time you did not say this to us. said to him: is a spike that will not move;
llm_translation: He said to him: No. But didn't you say to us like this at other times? He said to him: It is a peg that will not move.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִכְתַּב בַּיּוֹם וְנֶחְתַּם בַּיּוֹם; בַּלַּיְלָה וְנֶחְתַּם בַּלַּיְלָה; בַּלַּיְלָה וְנֶחְתַּם בַּיּוֹם – כָּשֵׁר. בַּיּוֹם וְנֶחְתַּם בַּלַּיְלָה – פָּסוּל; רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: was written during the day and signed on day; at night and signed on night; at night and signed on day, valid. during the day and signed on night, invalid, Rabbi Shimon deems valid.
llm_translation: It was taught: "Written during the day and signed during the day; written at night and signed at night; written at night and signed during the day - valid. Written during the day and signed at night - invalid." Rabbi Shimon deems it valid.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַגִּיטִּין שֶׁנִּכְתְּבוּ בַּיּוֹם וְנֶחְתְּמוּ בַּלַּיְלָה – פְּסוּלִין; חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים.
human_translation: As Rabbi Shimon would say: All documents that were written during the day and signed at night are invalid except for women’s bills of divorce.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Shimon used to say: All divorce documents that were written during the day and signed at night - are invalid; except for women's divorce documents.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה תִּיקְּנוּ זְמַן בְּגִיטִּין? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם בַּת אֲחוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: It was stated For what did institute a date on bills of divorce? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Due to the daughter of his sister.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Why did they establish a time limit for divorces? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because of his sister.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: due to produce
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: because of fruits.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? אָמַר לָךְ:
human_translation: What is the reason Reish Lakish did not say in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan? said to you:
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, what is the reason why he did not say like Rabbi Yochanan? He said to you:

hebrew_text: זְנוּת לָא שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: Adultery is infrequent,
llm_translation: Adultery is not common.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? קָסָבַר: יֵשׁ לְבַעַל פֵּירוֹת עַד שְׁעַת נְתִינָה.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say in accordance with Reish Lakish? he holds the produce belongs to the husband until the time of giving
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, what is the reason why he did not say like Reish Lakish? He holds: there is ownership of produce until the time of giving.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָא מַכְשַׁיר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – דְּמַכְשַׁיר?
human_translation: Granted, according to Reish Lakish, due to that Rabbi Shimon deems valid However, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the reason that Rabbi Shimon deems valid?
llm_translation: In truth, according to Reish Lakish, because of this Rabbi Shimon deems it valid. But according to Rabbi Yochanan, what is the reason that Rabbi Shimon deems it valid? Because it is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא קָאָמֵינָא, כִּי קָאָמֵינָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: I am not speaking in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, When I speak, in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: I am not speaking in accordance with the view of Rabbi Shimon, but rather in accordance with the view of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְרַבָּנַן; אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, this is between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis. However, according to Reish Lakish, what is there between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis?
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yochanan, that is where the difference lies between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis. But according to Reish Lakish, what is the difference between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: פֵּירֵי דְּמִשְּׁעַת כְּתִיבָה וְעַד שְׁעַת חֲתִימָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: between them produce from the time of writing until the time of signing.
llm_translation: The fruits from the time of writing until the time of sealing, there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ! דְּאִתְּמַר: מֵאֵימָתַי מוֹצִיאִין לְפֵירוֹת? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת כְּתִיבָה, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת נְתִינָה!
human_translation: But didn’t we hear say the opposite As it is stated From when does remove to produce? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From the time of writing and Reish Lakish said: From the time of giving
llm_translation: And the opposite we heard for them! For it was stated: From when do we bring out the fruits? Rabbi Yochanan said: From the time of writing, and Reish Lakish said: From the time of giving!

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: Reverse
llm_translation: Opposite.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: שְׁלֹשָׁה גִּיטִּין פְּסוּלִים, וְאִם נִיסַּת – הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר; מָה הוֹעִילוּ חֲכָמִים בְּתַקָּנָתָן? אַהֲנוֹ דִּלְכַתְּחִילָּה לָא תִּינָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Three bills of divorce are invalid, but if married the offspring is unflawed what did the Sages accomplish with their ordinance It is effective that she may not marry ab initio
llm_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Three gittin are invalid, and if one was married with them, the child is legitimate. What benefit did the sages have in enacting this law? So that a woman should not be taken away against her will.

hebrew_text: גַּזְיֵיהּ לִזְמַן דִּידֵיהּ, וְיַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְרַמַּאי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: cut out its date and gave it to her, what He said to him: We are not concerned about a deceiver.
llm_translation: His portion for his time, and he gave it to his wife, what? He said to him: "We are not concerned for a deceiver."

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב בּוֹ שָׁבוּעַ, שָׁנָה, חֹדֶשׁ, שַׁבָּת, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כָּשֵׁר. וּמָה הוֹעִילוּ חֲכָמִים בְּתַקָּנָתָן?
human_translation: written in seven- year, month, week, what He said to him: valid what did the Sages accomplish with their ordinance
llm_translation: It is written in it: week, year, month, Sabbath, what? He said to him: valid. And what benefit did the sages derive from their institution?

hebrew_text: אַהְנוֹ לְשָׁבוּעַ דְּקַמֵּיהּ וּלְשָׁבוּעַ דְּבָתְרֵיהּ. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, יוֹמָא גּוּפֵיהּ – מִי יָדְעִינַן אִי מִצַּפְרָא אִי מִפַּנְיָא?! אֶלָּא לְיוֹמָא דְּקַמֵּיהּ וּלְיוֹמָא דְּבָתְרֵיהּ; הָכָא נָמֵי, אַהְנִי לְשָׁבוּעַ דְּקַמֵּיהּ וּלְשָׁבוּעַ דְּבָתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: It helps for the seven-year period before it and the seven-year period after it. because if you do not say so, day itself, do we know if in the morning or in the evening? Rather, for the day before it and the day after it. Here also, is effective for the seven-year period before it and the seven-year period after it.
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "Here for a week of before him and for a week of after him. For if not so, the day itself - who will know if from the north or from the south?! Rather for the day of before him and for the day of after him; here also, here for a week of before him and for a week of after him."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: כַּתְבֵיהּ
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: he writes
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: "Its writings."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ בְּכִיסְתֵּיהּ – דְּאִי מִפַּיְּיסָהּ תִּיפַּיַּיס, מַאי?
human_translation: and puts it in his pocket that if she appeases [ mippayyesa ] he will be appeased, what
llm_translation: And he hid it in his garment - for if he would appease her, what is the outcome?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מַקְדֵּים אִינָשׁ פּוּרְעָנוּתָא לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: A person does not hasten a calamity on himself
llm_translation: He said to him: one does not bring punishment upon oneself.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: גִּיטִּין הַבָּאִים מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, דְּמִיכַּתְבִי בְּנִיסָן וְלָא מָטוּ עַד תִּשְׁרֵי – מָה הוֹעִילוּ חֲכָמִים בְּתַקָּנָתָם? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנְהוּ, קָלָא אִית לְהוּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: bills of divorce that come from a country overseas which are written, in Nisan, and they do not reach until Tishrei, what did the Sages accomplish with their ordinance He said to him: these public knowledge
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Gitin that come from the land of the sea, if they were written in Nissan and did not arrive until Tishrei - what benefit did the sages have in their enactment? He said to him: They have a light.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: מֵאֵימָתַי מוֹנִין לַגֵּט? רַב אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת נְתִינָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת כְּתִיבָה.
human_translation: It was stated: From when counting with regard to a bill of divorce? Rav says: From the time of giving and Shmuel says: From the time of writing
llm_translation: It was stated: From when do we count for a divorce document? Rav said: From the time of delivery, and Shmuel said: From the time of writing.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נָתָן בַּר הוֹשַׁעְיָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל, יֹאמְרוּ: שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּחָצֵר אַחַת – זוֹ אֲסוּרָה וְזוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: זוֹ זְמַן גִּיטָּהּ מוֹכִיחַ עָלֶיהָ, וְזוֹ זְמַן גִּיטָּהּ מוֹכִיחַ עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Hoshaya objects to this: According to Shmuel, will say: two women in one courtyard this is prohibited and that permitted Abaye said to him: this the date of her bill of divorce proves concerning her and that the date on her bill of divorce proves concerning her
llm_translation: Challenged him Rav Natan bar Hoshaya to Shmuel, saying: They say: Two women in one courtyard - this one is forbidden and this one is permitted! Abaye said to him: This one's time for divorce proves against her, and this one's time for divorce proves against her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְנִשְׁתַּהָה שָׁלִיחַ בַּדֶּרֶךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, כְּשֶׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ – צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים; וּלְגֵט יָשָׁן אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין, שֶׁהֲרֵי לֹא נִתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav, is taught in accordance with of Shmuel. is taught in accordance with of Rav one who sends a bill of divorce to his wife, and the agent tarries on the way for three months, once the bill of divorce reaches her hand she must wait three months And one need not be concerned that an outdated bill of divorce, because he was not secluded with her
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav, it was taught in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel. It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav: One who sends a bill of divorce to his wife, and the messenger delayed on the way for three months, when the bill of divorce reaches her hand - she must wait for three months. And for an old bill of divorce, we are not concerned, for he did not have private relations with her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּשְׁלִישׁ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: אַל תִּתְּנֵהוּ לָהּ אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, מִשֶּׁנְּתָנוֹ לָהּ – מוּתֶּרֶת לִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד; וּלְגֵט יָשָׁן אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין, שֶׁהֲרֵי לֹא נִתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Shmuel one who deposits a bill of divorce for his wife and says to him: Give it to her only after three months, once he gives it to her, she is permitted to marry immediately And one need not concerned that an outdated bill of divorce, as he was not secluded with her
llm_translation: It was taught in the presence of Shmuel: One who delivers a bill of divorce to his wife, and he says to him: Do not give it to her until after three months, from the moment he gives it to her - she is permitted to remarry immediately; and with an old bill of divorce, we are not concerned, for he did not become attached to her.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב פַּפֵּי וְרַב אָשֵׁי – עָבְדִי מִשְּׁעַת כְּתִיבָה, רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ – עָבְדִי מִשְּׁעַת נְתִינָה. וְהִלְכְתָא: מִשְּׁעַת כְּתִיבָה.
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Pappi and Rav Ashi would in practice from the time of writing, Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, would in practice from the time of giving. And the halakha from the time of writing.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana, Rav Pappai, and Rav Ashi - they worked from the time of writing. Rav Papa and Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yehoshua - they worked from the time of delivery. And the halakha is: from the time of writing.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: מֵאֵימָתַי כְּתוּבָּה מְשַׁמֶּטֶת?
human_translation: It was stated: From when a marriage contract canceled
llm_translation: It was stated: From when is a written document considered to be nullifying?

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: מִשֶּׁתִּפְגּוֹם – וְתִזְקוֹף. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: פָּגְמָה – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא זָקְפָה, זָקְפָה – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא פָּגְמָה.
human_translation: Rav says: from when collects partial payment and establishes And Shmuel says: she collects partial payment although she did not establish she established although she did not collect partial payment.
llm_translation: Rav said: If it was bent - it will straighten. And Shmuel said: If it was bent - even though it did not straighten, if it straightened - even though it was not bent.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: מֵאֵימָתַי כְּתוּבָּה מְשַׁמֶּטֶת? מִשֶּׁתִּפְגּוֹם וְתִזְקוֹף. פָּגְמָה וְלֹא זָקְפָה, זָקְפָה וְלֹא פָּגְמָה – אֵינָהּ מְשַׁמֶּטֶת, עַד שֶׁתִּפְגּוֹם וְתִזְקוֹף.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav, is taught in accordance with of Shmuel. is taught in accordance with of Rav: From when is a marriage contract canceled? From when she accepts partial payment and establishes she accepted partial payment but did not establish established but did not accept partial payment, it is not canceled until she accepts partial payment and establishes
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav, it was taught in the school of Shmuel. It was taught in the school of Rav: From when is a document considered valid for collection? From the time it is worn and folded. If it is worn but not folded, folded but not worn - it is not valid for collection until it is both worn and folded.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: אוֹנֶס, וּקְנָס, וּפִיתּוּי, וּכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה – שֶׁזְּקָפָן בְּמִלְוָה, מְשַׁמְּטִין; וְאִם לָאו – אֵין מְשַׁמְּטִין. מֵאֵימָתַי נִזְקָפִים בְּמִלְוָה? מִשְּׁעַת הַעֲמָדָה בַּדִּין.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Shmuel: rape; or fine or seduction; or a woman’s marriage contract was established as a loan, cancels it. And if not does not cancel them. From when have been established as a loan? From the time of standing trial,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Shmuel: Rape, fine, seduction, and a marriage contract of a woman - if they were established through a loan, they are annulled; but if not, they are not annulled. From when are they established through a loan? From the moment of standing in judgment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּתוּבָּה כְּמַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין דָּמְיָא – מָה מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין נִכְתָּבִין בַּיּוֹם וְנֶחְתָּמִין בַּלַּיְלָה, אַף כְּתוּבָּה נִכְתֶּבֶת בַּיּוֹם וְנֶחְתֶּמֶת בַּלַּיְלָה. כְּתוּבְּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אִיכְּתוּב בַּיּוֹם וְאִיחֲתוּם בַּלַּיְלָה; הֲוָה רַב הָתָם וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: Shmuel said: A marriage contract is like a court enactment. Just as court enactments may be written during the day and signed at night, so too, a marriage contract may be written during the day and signed at night. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav’s marriage contract was written during the day and signed at night, Rav was there and he did not say anything to
llm_translation: Samuel said: "A document is like the work of a court - just as the work of a court is written during the day and signed at night, so too a document is written during the day and signed at night. The documents of Rabbi Hiyya bar Rav were written during the day and signed at night; Rav was there and did not say anything immediately."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כִּשְׁמוּאֵל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ? עֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן הֲווֹ. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי צָדוֹק: לֹא שָׁנוּ, אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁאֵין עֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן, אֲבָל עֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Shall we say he holds in accordance with Shmuel? were engaged in that matter as it is taught Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Tzadok said: taught only when were not engaged in that matter, but were engaged in that matter valid.
llm_translation: Let us say, does Shmuel hold this opinion? They are engaged in that matter. For it was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok said: They did not teach except when they are not engaged in that matter, but when they are engaged in that matter – it is valid.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁיר: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? קָסָבַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו לְגָרְשָׁהּ, שׁוּב אֵין לוֹ פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon deems valid Rava said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? holds once has decided to divorce her, he no longer has the produce
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon permits. Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? He holds: Once one has set his eyes to divorce her, he no longer has any fruits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא הִכְשִׁיר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֶלָּא לְאַלְתַּר, אֲבָל מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים – לֹא;
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: Rabbi Shimon deems valid only immediately, However, from now, until ten days not
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Shimon only permitted for Altar, but from here until ten days - no.

hebrew_text: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא פִּיֵּיס. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים; אִם אִיתָא דְּפַיֵּיס – קָלָא אִית לַיהּ לְמִילְּתָא.
human_translation: we are concerned perhaps he appeased And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even from now until ten days if it is so he appeased the matter public knowledge,
llm_translation: We are concerned that perhaps he will appease. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even from here until ten days; if it comes that he appeases - he has a light matter.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר לַעֲשָׂרָה ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״; אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנַיִם מִשּׁוּם עֵדִים, וְכוּלָּם מִשּׁוּם תְּנַאי. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כּוּלָּם מִשּׁוּם עֵדִים.
human_translation: It was stated says to ten Write a bill of divorce for my wife, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Two as witnesses, and all of them due to stipulation And Reish Lakish says: All of them as witnesses.
llm_translation: It was stated: He said to ten, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife." Rabbi Yochanan said: Two for the sake of witnesses, and all of them for the sake of the Mishnah. And Reish Lakish said: All of them for the sake of witnesses.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״כּוּלְּכֶם״; וְהָא תְּנַן, אָמַר לַעֲשָׂרָה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב וּשְׁנַיִם חוֹתְמִין! אֶלָּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ ״כּוּלְּכֶם״.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say he did not say to them: All of you, didn’t we learn one said to ten Write a bill of divorce for my wife, one write, and two sign, Rather, when he said to them: All of you
llm_translation: How are they similar? If you say it is because he did not say to them, "all of you," but didn't we learn that he said to ten, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife" - one writes and two sign! Rather, he said to them, "all of you."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ – דַּחֲתוּם בֵּי תְרֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ בְּיוֹמֵיהּ, וְאִינָךְ מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים. מַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם תְּנַאי – כָּשֵׁר; וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם עֵדִים – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: What between There is between them where two of them signed on that day and the rest from now until ten days the one who says due to the stipulation, valid, And the one who says due to witnesses, invalid
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them - that they were sealed by two different types on his days, and not from here until ten days. One who says in the name of the Tannaim - it is valid; and one who says in the name of witnesses - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶם קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם תְּנַאי – כָּשֵׁר; לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם עֵדִים – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: Alternatively, where one of these is found a relative or disqualified According to the one who says due to the stipulation, valid According to the one who says due to witnesses, invalid,
llm_translation: אִי נָמֵי – like for example, if one of them is found to be close or disqualified. According to the one who says it is due to a teaching – it is valid; according to the one who says it is due to witnesses – it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: אִי חֲתִים בִּתְחִילָּה קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל; אָמְרִי לָהּ כָּשֵׁר, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ פָּסוּל. אָמְרִי לָהּ כָּשֵׁר – תְּנַאי הוּא; אָמְרִי לַהּ פָּסוּל – אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בִּשְׁטָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: if a relative or disqualified signed at the beginning, some say valid and some say invalid. Some say valid is a stipulation. Some say invalid will come to confuse it with typical documents,
llm_translation: If sealed at the beginning, whether it is close or invalid; some say it is valid, and some say it is invalid. Some say it is valid - it is a dispute of the Tannaim; some say it is invalid - it comes to exchange in the documents of the world.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ לַעֲשָׂרָה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״; חֲתוּם בֵּי תְרֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ בְּיוֹמֵיהּ, וְאִינָךְ – מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: a certain person who said to ten Write a bill of divorce for my wife. Two of them signed that day and the others from now until ten days He came before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to him:
llm_translation: That one who said to ten: "Write a bill of divorce for my wife"; signed by two witnesses in his presence, and you are not - from here until ten days. He came before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, he said to him:

hebrew_text: כְּדַאי הוּא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לִסְמוֹךְ עָלָיו בִּשְׁעַת הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon, is worthy of being relied upon in exigent circumstances.
llm_translation: It is worthy Rabbi Shimon to rely on him in a time of distress.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא הִכְשִׁיר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֶלָּא לְאַלְתַּר, אֲבָל מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים – לָא! בְּהַהִיא, כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t Reish Lakish say: Rabbi Shimon deemed valid only immediately, but from now until ten days, no. With regard to that holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Shimon only permitted for immediate use, but from here until ten days - no! In that case, like Rabbi Yochanan holds.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנַיִם מִשּׁוּם עֵדִים, וְכוּלָּן מִשּׁוּם תְּנַאי! בְּהָהִיא, כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Two as witnesses, and all of them due to stipulation? With regard to this, he holds in accordance with Reish Lakish
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Yochanan: Two for the sake of witnesses, and all of them for the sake of the Tannaim! In that case, Reish Lakish agrees with him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּכֹּל כּוֹתְבִים – בִּדְיוֹ, בְּסַם, בְּסִיקְרָא, וּבְקוֹמוֹס, וּבְקַנְקַנְתּוֹם, וּבְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא שֶׁל קַיָּימָא. אֵין כּוֹתְבִין לֹא בְּמַשְׁקִין, וְלֹא בְּמֵי פֵירוֹת, וְלֹא בְּכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: One may write with any With deyo , with paint [ sam ], with sikra , with komos , with kankantom or with anything that permanent one may not write with liquids, nor with fruit juice, nor with anything not permanent
llm_translation: They taught: In everything one may write - with ink, with dye, with pigment, and with gum, and with a reed pen, and with anything that is lasting. One may not write with liquids, nor with fruit juices, nor with anything that does not last.

hebrew_text: עַל הַכֹּל כּוֹתְבִין – עַל הֶעָלֶה שֶׁל זַיִת; וְעַל הַקֶּרֶן שֶׁל פָּרָה – וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ אֶת הַפָּרָה; עַל יָד שֶׁל עֶבֶד – וְנוֹתֵן לָהּ אֶת הָעֶבֶד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין לֹא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים, וְלֹא עַל הָאוֹכָלִים.
human_translation: one may write on anything, on an olive leaf, or on the horn of a cow. And he gives her the cow. on the hand of a slave, and he gives her the slave. Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: One may not write on any living thing, nor on food.
llm_translation: Regarding everything, they write - on the leaf of an olive tree; and on the horn of a cow - and one gives it to her the cow; by the hand of a slave - and one gives it to her the slave. Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: One does not write on anything that has a living spirit, nor on those who eat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דְּיוֹ – דְּיוֹתָא. סַם – סַמָּא. סִיקְרָא – אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: סְקַרְתָּא שְׁמַהּ. קוֹמוֹס – קוֹמָא. קַנְקַנְתּוֹם – אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חַרְתָּא דְאוּשְׁכָּפֵי.
human_translation: Deyo deyota , Sam samma , sikra , Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Its name sikreta , Komos , kuma kankantom , Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Shmuel said: black used by cobblers,
llm_translation: Gemar diyo - deyota. Sam - sammah. Sikra - amar Rabba bar bar Ḥana: Sekarta shemah. Qomos - qoma. Qankantom - amar Rabba bar bar Ḥana amar Shemu'el: Ḥarta de'ushkapei.

hebrew_text: וּבְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִתְקַיֵּים וְכוּ׳: לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי הָא דְתָנֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כְּתָבוֹ בְּמֵי טַרְיָא וְאַפְצָא – כָּשֵׁר. תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כְּתָבוֹ בַּאֲבָר, בִּשְׁחוֹר וּבְשִׁיחוֹר – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: with anything permanent to add what? To add what Rabbi Ḥanina taught: he wrote it with mei teriya or gallnuts [ aftza ] valid, Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: he wrote it with lead, with coals, or with black paint valid.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And in every matter that is fulfilled, etc.: For what? To include what? To include that which Rabbi Chanina taught: If one wrote with the waters of Teriya and gall-nut - it is valid. Rabbi Chiya taught: If one wrote with ink, with black and with green - it is valid."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַמַּעֲבִיר דְּיוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי סִיקְרָא, בַּשַּׁבָּת; רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם: אַחַת מִשּׁוּם כּוֹתֵב, וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם מוֹחֵק. דְּיוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי דְּיוֹ, סִיקְרָא עַל גַּבֵּי סִיקְרָא – פָּטוּר. סִיקְרָא עַל גַּבֵּי דְּיוֹ – אָמְרִי לַהּ: חַיָּיב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It was stated one who passes ink over red dye on Shabbat, Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say liable two One due to writing and one due to erasing ink on top of ink, red dye on top of red dye, exempt, red dye on top of ink, some say liable and some say exempt.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who transfers ink onto a slate on Shabbat; Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said - he is liable for two transgressions: one for writing, and one for erasing. If ink on top of ink, or slate on top of slate - he is exempt. If slate on top of ink - some say he is liable, and some say he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לַהּ חַיָּיב – מוֹחֵק הוּא. אָמְרִי לַהּ פָּטוּר – מְקַלְקֵל הוּא.
human_translation: Some say liable it is erasing, Some say exempt he is destroying
llm_translation: They said to her "Chayav" - he is erasing. They said to her "Patuhr" - he is damaging.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֵדִים שֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִים לַחְתּוֹם; מַהוּ שֶׁיִּכְתְּבוּ לָהֶם בְּסִיקְרָא, וְיַחְתְּמוּ כְּתָב עֶלְיוֹן? כְּתָב, אוֹ אֵינוֹ כְּתָב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ כְּתָב.
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: witnesses who do not know how to sign what is be written for them with red dye, will sign the upper writing, writing, or is it not writing? He said to him: It is not writing.
llm_translation: Requested of him Reish Lakish from Rabbi Yochanan: Witnesses who do not know how to sign; what should be written for them in a document, and they sign with an upper script? Script, or not script? He said to him: Not script.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וַהֲלֹא לִימַּדְתָּנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, כְּתָב עֶלְיוֹן – כְּתָב לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָנוּ מְדַמִּין נַעֲשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה?!
human_translation: said to him: Didn’t our master, teach us upper writing writing with regard to Shabbat? said to him: And because we compare shall we perform an action
llm_translation: He said to him: But did our teacher not teach us, "Write on it - for the purpose of Shabbat"? He said to him: Just because we think, should we actually do it?!

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: עֵדִים שֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִים לַחְתּוֹם; רַב אָמַר: מְקָרְעִין לָהֶם נְיָיר חָלָק, וּמְמַלְּאִים אֶת הַקְּרָעִים דְּיוֹ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בַּאֲבָר.
human_translation: It was stated witnesses who do not know to sign? Rav says: One tears blank paper for them, fill in the gaps ink And Shmuel says: with lead,
llm_translation: It was stated: Witnesses who do not know how to sign; Rav said: Tear for them a divided paper, and fill in the tears for them. And Shmuel said: With a limb.

hebrew_text: בַּאֲבָר סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כְּתָבוֹ בַּאֲבָר, בִּשְׁחוֹר וּבְשִׁיחוֹר – כָּשֵׁר! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא – בַּאֲבָרָא, הָא – בְּמַיָּא דַאֲבָרָא.
human_translation: enter your mind with lead? But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach: he wrote it with lead, with coals, or black paint, valid? not difficult: This, with lead That, using lead water,
llm_translation: In the matter of your opinion?! And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: If he wrote it in the limb, in black ink and with ink – it is valid! It is not difficult: this – in the limb, this – in the water of the limb.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: בְּמֵי מֵילִין. וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כְּתָבוֹ בְּמֵי טַרְיָא וְאַפְצָא – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: with gall water mei milin But didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina teach he wrote with mei teriya or gallnuts valid?
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: In mei melin. And Rabbi Chanina taught: If he wrote it in mei tarya and aphtza - it is valid!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲפִיץ, הָא דְּלָא אֲפִיץ; שֶׁאֵין מֵי מֵילִין עַל גַּבֵּי מֵי מֵילִין.
human_translation: not difficult. This with gallnuts. That not with gallnuts. because gall water is not on top of gall water,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who spreads, this one who does not spread; for waters of waters do not rest upon waters of waters.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בְּרוֹק. וְכֵן אוֹרִי לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְפָפָּא תּוֹרָאָה: בְּרוֹק. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּגִיטִּין, אֲבָל בִּשְׁטָרוֹת – לָא,
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: with saliva And so Rav Pappa instructed Pappa the ox herder, with saliva This matter, to bills of divorce, However, for documents, not
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "Barok." And so Rav Papa explained to Papa Torah: "Barok." These matters apply to Gitin, but not to Shtarot.

hebrew_text: דְּהָהוּא דַּעֲבַד עוֹבָדָא בִּשְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת, וְנַגְּדֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא.
human_translation: that a certain person who performed an action in other documents, Rav Kahana he be flogged
llm_translation: The one who was doing work with other documents, and in front of him was Rav Kahana.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: עֵדִים שֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִין לַחְתּוֹם, מְקָרְעִין לָהֶן נְיָיר חָלָק וּמְמַלְּאִים אֶת הַקְּרָעִים דְּיוֹ.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav: witnesses who do not know to sign, one tears a blank paper for them, fill the gaps ink.
llm_translation: It was taught in the presence of Rav: Witnesses who do not know how to sign, tear for them a piece of paper and fill in the tears for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים; אֲבָל בְּשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁטָרוֹת, אִם יוֹדְעִין לִקְרוֹת וְלַחְתּוֹם – חוֹתְמִין, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין חוֹתְמִין.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? For bills of divorce. However, for of manumission and all other documents, if know to read and to sign, they sign, and if not they do not sign.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what are these matters said? In bills of divorce for women; but in manumission documents of slaves and all other documents, if they know how to read and write - they may sign, but if not - they may not sign.

hebrew_text: קְרִיָּיה מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמַהּ? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: עֵדִים שֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִין לִקְרוֹת – קוֹרִין לִפְנֵיהֶם וְחוֹתְמִים, וְשֶׁאֵין יוֹדְעִין לַחְתּוֹם כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים; אֲבָל שִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁטָרוֹת, אִם יוֹדְעִין לִקְרוֹת וְלַחְתּוֹם – חוֹתְמִין, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין חוֹתְמִין.
human_translation: reading, who mentioned anything about it? is incomplete, and this it is teaching: witnesses who do not know to read, one reads in their presence and they sign. And where they do not know to sign, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? For bills of divorce. However, for of manumission and all other documents, if know to read and to sign, they sign, and if not they do not sign.
llm_translation: The reading, who remembers its name? Hasors from Hissra, and thus it was taught: Witnesses who do not know how to read - they read before them and sign, and if they do not know how to sign - they do not sign. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? In bills of divorce; but in manumission documents and all other contracts, if they know how to read and sign - they sign, and if not - they do not sign.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲגוּנוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: What is the reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, so that the daughters of Israel should not be deserted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: What is the reason for the ruling of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? So that the daughters of Israel should not be braided.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְרַב גַּמָּדָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: אֵין הֲלָכָה. וְאֶלָּא כְּמַאן, כְּרַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: Rava says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rav Gamda said in the name of Rava: The halakha is not Rather, in accordance with whose in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rav Gammada in the name of Rava said: There is no halakha. Rather, according to whom, according to the Rabbis?!

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָהוּא דַּעֲבַד עוֹבָדָא בִּשְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת, וְנַגְּדֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא! תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַקְּרִיאָה.
human_translation: But wasn’t a certain person who performed an action, in other documents Rav Kahana he be flogged interpreted with regard to reading,
llm_translation: And that one who was doing business with promissory notes, and Rav Kahana was against him! Translate it, I will read it.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה מִיצְטַעַר קָרֵי וְחָתֵים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּלָּא: לָא צְרִיכַתְּ, דְּהָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מָרָא דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – קָרוּ קַמֵּיהּ וְחָתֵים, וְרַב נַחְמָן – קָרוּ קַמֵּיהּ סָפְרֵי דַּיָּינֵי וְחָתֵים. וְדַוְוקָא רַב נַחְמָן וְסָפְרֵי דַּיָּינֵי, דְּאִית לְהוּ אֵימְתָא, אֲבָל רַב נַחְמָן וְסָפְרֵי אַחֲרִינֵי, סָפְרֵי דַּיָּינֵי וְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא – לָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda took great pains read and sign Ulla said to him: It is not necessary for you as would read in the presence of Rabbi Elazar the master, of Eretz Yisrael, and he would sign; and the court scribes would read before Rav Naḥman and he would sign; And specifically Rav Naḥman and the court scribes, as they had fear However, Rav Naḥman and other scribes, the court scribes and another person, no;
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah would read and seal. Ulla said to him: You are not required to do so, for Rabbi Elazar, the master of the Land of Israel, would read and seal, and Rav Nachman would read before the scribes of the winepress and seal. And specifically Rav Nachman and the scribes of the winepress, who have a set time, but Rav Nachman and other scribes, the scribes of the winepress and another person, do not.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא, כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי לְקַמֵּיהּ שְׁטָרָא פָּרְסָאָה דַּעֲבִיד בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, מַקְרֵי לְהוּ לִשְׁנֵי גוֹיִם זֶה שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי זֶה בְּמֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ, וּמַגְבֵּי בֵּיהּ מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי.
human_translation: When documents Persian that were produced in gentile courts came before Rav Pappa, have it be read by two gentiles, each one not in the presence of the other speak offhandedly, he would collect with it from liened
llm_translation: Rav Papa, when he would come before him a document of a Persian, who made evaluations of non-Jews, he would read it to them to two non-Jews, not in front of each other, accurately, and he would collect from the servants.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אָמַר לִי רַב הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן, הָכִי אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַאי שְׁטָרָא פָּרְסָאָה דַּחֲתִימִי עֲלֵיהּ סָהֲדִי יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַגְבֵּינַן בֵּיהּ מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Rav Huna bar Natan said to me so said Ameimar: this Persian document, on which Jews are signed as witnesses, collect with it, from liened
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Rav Huna son of Nathan told me, thus said Amemar: This document that is signed by Jewish witnesses, we establish it based on the testimony of the servants.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא יָדְעִי לְמִיקְרֵי! בִּדְיָדְעִי. וְהָא בָּעֵינַן כְּתָב שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהִזְדַּיֵּיף, וְלֵיכָּא! בְּדַאֲפִיצָן. וְהָא בָּעֵינַן ״צָרִיךְ לַחֲזוֹר מֵעִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר בְּשִׁיטָה אַחֲרוֹנָה״, וְלֵיכָּא! בִּדְמַהְדַּר.
human_translation: But they don’t know how to read, when they know But don’t we require a writing that cannot be forged; and it is not in with gall. But we require to recap the topic of the document in its last line; and it is not in where recapped
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And this one did not know how to read! By knowing. And this one we require a document that cannot be forged, and there is none! By forging. And this one we require 'he must return from the matter of the document with the last opinion,' and there is none! By reversing."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – דְּכׇל לָשׁוֹן כָּשֵׁר?! תְּנֵינָא: גֵּט שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ עִבְרִית וְעֵדָיו יְוָנִית, יְוָנִית וְעֵדָיו עִבְרִית – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: But what is he teaching us, that any language valid? We learned a bill of divorce that he wrote Hebrew and its witnesses Greek, Greek and its witnesses Hebrew, valid.
llm_translation: And rather what is it teaching us – that every language is valid?! We learned: A bill of divorce that he wrote in Hebrew and its witnesses in Greek, in Greek and its witnesses in Hebrew – it is valid!

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּגִיטִּין, אֲבָל בִּשְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת – לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: if from that I would say: This statement for bills of divorce, However, for other documents, no. teaches us
llm_translation: If from that, I would say: those words in bills of divorce, but in other documents - no, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נָתַן לָהּ נְיָיר חָלָק, וְאָמַר לַהּ: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ״ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת; חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא בְּמֵי מֵילִין כְּתָבוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: gave a blank paper and said to her: This is hereby your bill of divorce, she is divorced. We are concerned perhaps he wrote it with gall water,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: He gave her a document of divorce, and said to her: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce" - she is divorced; we are concerned perhaps he wrote it in water.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּךְ״; וּנְטָלַתּוּ וּזְרָקַתּוּ לַיָּם, אוֹ לָאוּר, אוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר הָאָבֵד; וְחָזַר וְאָמַר: ״שְׁטַר פַּסִּים הוּא״, ״שְׁטַר אֲמָנָה הוּא״ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, וְלֹא כׇּל הֵימֶנּוּ לְאוֹסְרָהּ.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection This is hereby your bill of divorce, and she took it and threw it into the sea, or into a fire, or into anything that destroys and he later said: it is a document of appeasement shetar passim It is a document of trust, she is divorced. And he does not have to make her forbidden
llm_translation: Challenger: "Here is your bill of divorce"; and she took it and threw it into the sea, or into the fire, or into anything that will destroy it; and he came back and said: "It is a document of debts," "It is a document of trust" - she is divorced, and not everyone agrees with him to prohibit her.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא כְּתָב, הָא לֵיכָּא כְּתָב – לָא! כִּי קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּבָדְקִינַן לֵיהּ בְּמַיָּא דְנָרָא; אִי פָּלֵיט – פָּלֵיט, וְאִי לָא פָּלֵיט – לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: The reason has writing, but not writing, no, When Shmuel said where we check with a colored liquid maya denara If expels it expels And if it does not expel is nothing
llm_translation: Reason for which there is a writing, here there is no writing - no! For Shmuel said, that we examine it with the water of a lamp; if it floats - it floats, and if it does not float - it is nothing.

hebrew_text: וְכִי פָּלֵיט מַאי הָוֵי? הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּפָלֵיט! שְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי, ״חָיְישִׁינַן״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And if expels what of it? that now it expels even Shmuel said We are concerned,
llm_translation: And when a fugitive, what is it? The present time is that of a fugitive! Also Samuel said, "We are concerned."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אֲמַר לִי אַמֵּימָר, הָכִי אָמַר מָרִימָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב דִּימִי: הָנֵי בֵּי תְרֵי דְּיָהֵיב גִּיטָּא קַמַּיְיהוּ, צְרִיכִי לְמִיקְרְיֵיהּ. מֵיתִיבִי: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּךְ״; וּנְטָלַתּוּ וּזְרָקַתּוּ לַיָּם, אוֹ לָאוּר, אוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר הָאָבֵד; וְחָזַר וְאָמַר ״שְׁטַר פַּסִּים הוּא״, ״שְׁטַר אֲמָנָה הוּא״ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, וְלֹא כׇל הֵימֶנּוּ לְאוֹסְרָהּ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ צְרִיכִי לְמִיקְרְיֵיהּ, בָּתַר דְּקַרְיוּהּ מִי מָצֵי אָמַר לַהּ הָכִי?!
human_translation: Ravina said: Ameimar said to me so said Mareimar in the name of Rav Dimi: These two that the bill of divorce was given in their presence are required to read it. raises an objection This is hereby your bill of divorce, and she took it and threw it into the sea, or into a fire, or into anything that destroys and he later said: it is a document of appeasement, it is a document of trust; she is divorced, and he does not have to make her forbidden And if you say need to read is able to say this to her after they read it?
llm_translation: Ravina said: Amemar told me, so said Marimar in the name of Rav Dimi: Those two men who presented a bill of divorce before them, it is necessary to call her the woman by name. It was asked: "Here is your bill of divorce," and you take it and throw it into the sea, or into the fire, or into anything that will destroy it; and he the husband goes back and says, "It is a document of debts," "It is a document of trust" - she is divorced, and not everyone believes him to prohibit her. And if you say it is necessary to call her by name, after he has called her by name, who can say to her otherwise?!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּבָתַר דְּקַרְיוּהּ עַיְּילֵיהּ לְבֵי יְדֵיהּ וְאַפְּקֵיהּ, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: חַלּוֹפֵי חַלְּפֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No, necessary where after they read it, placed it under his arm, took it out, Lest you say he switched it teaches us
llm_translation: Not necessary, for after they read it, they take it to the house of their hands and examine it. What might you say? "Its changes have changed," this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּזְרַק לָהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ לְבֵינֵי דַנֵּי, אִשְׁתְּכַח מְזוּזְתָּא. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְזוּזְתָּא בֵּינֵי דַנֵּי לָא שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: a certain man who threw a bill of divorce to his wife, among the barrels, a mezuza was found Rav Naḥman said: A mezuza is infrequently among the barrels,
llm_translation: That man who threw a bill of divorce to his wife between the judges, found a mezuzah. Rav Nachman said: A mezuzah is not commonly found between judges.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח חֲדָא, אֲבָל שְׁנַיִם שְׁלֹשָׁה – מִדְּהָא הֲוַאי, הָא נָמֵי הֲוַאי; וְגִיטָּא – אֵימוֹר עַכְבָּרִים שַׁקְלוּהּ.
human_translation: And this statement when one was found. However, two three as this, was this was also and the bill of divorce, say mice took it,
llm_translation: And these matters that one finds one, but two or three - for one it is, for two or three it is; and the document - say the mice have taken it.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּעָל לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא, שְׁקַל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה יְהַב לָהּ לִדְבֵיתְהוּ, וַאֲמַר לַהּ: הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ. אֲמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לְמַאי לֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ? אִי מִשּׁוּם מֵי מֵילִין – אֵין מֵי מֵילִין עַל גַּבֵּי מֵי מֵילִין;
human_translation: a certain man who entered the synagogue, took a Torah scroll, gave it to his wife. And he said to her: This is your bill of divorce. Rav Yosef said: For what to be concerned for it? If due to gall water, gall water is not on top of gall water.
llm_translation: That man who came to the synagogue, took a Torah scroll and gave it to his wife, and said to her: "Here is your bill of divorce." Rav Yosef said: "What does he have to worry about her? If it is because of the waters of suspicion - the waters of suspicion do not rest on top of other waters of suspicion."

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם כְּרִיתוּת דְּאִית בַּהּ – הָא בָּעֵינָא ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ – לִשְׁמָהּ, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: If due to severance that there are in it is required, “And he writes her.” for her sake, and not
llm_translation: If it is due to the prohibition of cutting off that is in it - this is what I need: "and he shall write for her" - for her name, and not.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, לֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא אַקְדֵּים וִיהַב לֵיהּ זוּזָא לְסָפְרָא מֵעִיקָּרָא; הָא בָּעֵינַן ״שִׁינָּה שְׁמוֹ וּשְׁמָהּ, שֵׁם עִירוֹ וְשֵׁם עִירָהּ״, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: And if you would say to be concerned perhaps he first gave a dinar to the scribe at the outset, isn’t there a need changed his name or her name, the name of his city or the name of her city, and not
llm_translation: And if you will say, perhaps he will be concerned that maybe I will precede and give him money for the book from the outset; we require "his name and her name, the name of his city and the name of her city," and it is not so.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? שֶׁאֵין מֵי מֵילִין עַל גַּבֵּי מֵי מֵילִין.
human_translation: But what is Rav Yosef teaching us gall water is not on top of gall water.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef, what is he teaching us? That waters of different kinds do not mix with one another.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גֵּט שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, וְהֶעֱבִיר עָלָיו קוּלְמוֹס לִשְׁמָהּ, בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: a bill of divorce was written not for her sake, and passed over it a reed for her sake, we have arrived at the dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A bill of divorce that was written not for its sake, and he passed over it to its sake, we come to the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה צָרִיךְ לִכְתּוֹב אֶת הַשֵּׁם, וְנִתְכַּוֵּין לִכְתּוֹב ״יְהוּדָה״ וְטָעָה וְלֹא הֵטִיל בּוֹ דָּלֶת, מַעֲבִיר עָלָיו קוּלְמוֹס וּמְקַדְּשׁוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַשֵּׁם מִן הַמּוּבְחָר.
human_translation: As it is taught that he needed to write the name and intended to write Yehuda, but he made a mistake and did not place a dalet in he should pass over it with a reed and sanctifies it the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: the name not in the optimal manner.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one intended to write the name "Yehudah" and made a mistake and did not insert the letter dalet, he may pass a sponge over it and sanctify it, according to the words of Rabbi Yehudah. But the Sages say: The name is not from the chosen ones.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: דִּילְמָא לָא הִיא; עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם, דְּבָעֵינָא זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ, וְלֵיכָּא; אֲבָל הָכָא לָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Perhaps is not so, the Rabbis say only there, because it is required “This is my God, and I will glorify Him” and not But here, no
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Perhaps it is not so; until here the Rabbis did not say there, for I desire this and its counterpart, and it is not so; but here, no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: יָכֵילְנָא לְמִיפְסְלִינְהוּ (לְכוּלֵּי) [לְכוּלְּהוּ] גִּיטֵּי דְּעָלְמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״וְכָתַב״, וְהָכָא אִיהִי קָא כָּתְבָה לֵיהּ; וְדִילְמָא אַקְנוֹיֵי אַקְנוֹ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: I am able to invalidate all the bills of divorce in the world. Rava said to him: What is the reason If we say: because it is written “And he writes and here, she writes for him, but perhaps the Sages transferred to him,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: We are able to disqualify them all the documents of the entire world. Rava said to him: What is the reason? If you say because it is written "and he shall write," here he is writing it; but perhaps the Rabbis will acquire it for him?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַן״, וְהָכָא לָא יָהֵיב לַהּ מִידֵּי?! דִּלְמָא נְתִינַת גֵּט הִיא! תֵּדַע, דִּשְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: כְּתָבוֹ עַל אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: But rather, because it is written: “And gives” and here he doesn’t give her anything Perhaps the giving of the bill of divorce is Know sent from there, he wrote on items from which benefit is forbidden, valid.
llm_translation: And rather, because it is written: "and he shall give," and here he did not give it to her immediately?! Perhaps it is a conditional giving of a bill of divorce! You should know that they sent from there: if he writes on prohibited matters of benefit - it is valid.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: כְּתָבוֹ עַל אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה – כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״עַל הֶעָלֶה שֶׁל זַיִת״! דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי עָלֶה שֶׁל זַיִת, דַּחֲזֵי לְאִיצְטְרוֹפֵי.
human_translation: the itself: sent from there, he wrote on items from which benefit is forbidden, valid. Rav Ashi said: We, too, learn on an olive leaf, Perhaps an olive leaf is different, it can combine
llm_translation: Body - send from there: wrote on forbidden pleasures - valid. Rav Ashe said: We also learned: "On the leaf of an olive tree"! Perhaps it is different with the leaf of an olive tree, as it is fit for wrapping.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כְּתָבוֹ עַל אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה – כָּשֵׁר. נְפַק לֵוִי, דַּרְשַׁהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי, וְלָא קַלְּסוּהּ. מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּים, וְקַלְּסוּהּ. אַלְמָא הִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi says: wrote on items from which benefit is forbidden, valid. Levi went out expounded this in the name Rabbi and they did not praise him. in the name of the majority, and they praised him. Apparently, the halakha is in accordance with
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: If one wrote on items of benefit - it is valid. Levi derived it in the name of Rabbi, and they did not accept it. In the name of the Sages, and they accepted it. Therefore, the halakha is in accordance with his view.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכָתַב״ – וְלֹא חָקַק. לְמֵימְרָא דַּחֲקִיקָה לָאו כְּתִיבָה הִיא?! וּרְמִינְהוּ: עֶבֶד שֶׁיָּצָא בִּכְתָב שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי טַבְלָא, וּפִינְקָס, יָצָא לְחֵירוּת. אֲבָל לֹא בִּכְתָב שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי כִּיפָּא וְאַנְדּוּכְתַּרִי!
human_translation: The Sages taught “And he writes and not chisel Is this to say that chiseling is not writing? And raises a contradiction a slave is emancipated written on a slate [ tavla ] tablet [ pinekas ], he goes free. However, he does not through writing on a cap or an embroidered adornment.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And he wrote" - but did not engrave. Is it to say that engraving is not considered writing?! And they asked: If a slave who went out with a document on a tablet and a signet ring, he is freed. But not with a document on a scroll or a diadem!

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לָא קַשְׁיָא – הָא דְּחַק תּוֹכוֹת, הָא דְּחַק יְרֵיכוֹת.
human_translation: Ulla said Rabbi Elazar said: not difficult. This when chiseled surrounding This when he chiseled the parts
llm_translation: Said Ula, said Rabbi Elazar: Not difficult - this one that squeezed its intestines, this one that squeezed its thighs.

hebrew_text: וְתוֹכוֹת – לָא?! וּרְמִינְהוּ: לֹא הָיָה כְּתָבוֹ שׁוֹקֵעַ, אֶלָּא בּוֹלֵט – כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב. וְהָא דִּינְרֵי זָהָב תּוֹכוֹת הֵן!
human_translation: And surrounding not And raises a contradiction The writing was not embedded, rather, it protruded like gold dinars. And isn’t gold dinars surrounding
llm_translation: "And its insides - not?! And they raised a contradiction: His writing was not sinking, but protruding - like golden dinars. And as for golden dinars, their insides are protruding!"

hebrew_text: כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב, וְלֹא כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב. כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב – דְּבוֹלֵט; וְלֹא כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב – דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם תּוֹכוֹת, הָכָא יְרֵיכוֹת.
human_translation: like gold dinars not like gold dinars. like gold dinars protrudes, but not like gold dinars as there, surrounding Here, the parts
llm_translation: As the dinars of gold, and not as the dinars of gold. As the dinars of gold - that they protrude; and not as the dinars of gold - for even though there they are hollow, here they are solid.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: רוּשְׁמָא – מִיחְרָץ חֲרִיץ, אוֹ כַּנּוֹפֵי מְכַנֵּיף? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִיחְרָץ חֲרִיץ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: press carve out or does it compress He said to him: carves out
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "Rushma - is it from the word 'michratz' (a type of vessel) or from the word 'mekhanef' (a type of garment)?" He said to him: "From the word 'michratz'."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: לֹא הָיָה כְּתָבוֹ שׁוֹקֵעַ, אֶלָּא בּוֹלֵט כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִיחְרָץ חֲרִיץ –
human_translation: He raised an objection to his The writing was not embedded, rather, it protruded like gold dinars. And if it enters your mind carves out
