llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: His handwriting was not sunken, but protruding like golden dinars. And if you think otherwise, a scratch will be made -

hebrew_text: הָא בָּעֵינָא ״מִכְתַּב״, וְלֵיכָּא! כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב, וְלֹא כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב. כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב – דְּבוֹלֵט; וְלֹא כְּדִינְרֵי זָהָב – דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם, מִגַּוַּאי; וְהָכָא – מֵאַבָּרַאי.
human_translation: isn’t there a need a writing, and there is no like gold dinars not like gold dinars. like gold dinars that protrudes. But not like gold dinars as there, from the inside, and here, from the outside,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "I need 'a document,' but it is not available! Like golden dinars, but not like golden dinars. Like golden dinars - it protrudes; and not like golden dinars - for even there, it is from the treasury; but here - from my limbs."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: כָּתַב לָהּ גֵּט עַל טַס שֶׁל זָהָב, וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הִתְקַבְּלִי גִּיטִּיךְ וְהִתְקַבְּלִי כְּתוּבָּתִךְ״, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִתְקַבְּלָה גִּיטָּהּ וְנִתְקַבְּלָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: wrote for her a bill of divorce on a plate [ tas ] of gold and said to her: Receive your bill of divorce and receive your marriage contract what is said to him: Her bill of divorce has been received and her marriage contract has been received.
llm_translation: Rava asked a question from Rav Nachman: He wrote for her a bill of divorce on a golden tablet, and said to her: "Receive your divorce and receive your document." What is the ruling? He said to him: Her divorce was accepted, and her document was accepted.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: ״הִתְקַבְּלִי גִּיטִּיךְ, וְהַשְּׁאָר לִכְתוּבָּתִךָ״ – נִתְקַבְּלָה גִּיטָּהּ, וְהַשְּׁאָר לִכְתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: raised an objection to his Receive your bill of divorce, and the remainder for your marriage contract, her bill of divorce has been received and the remainder for her marriage contract.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: "Accept your bill of divorce, and the rest should be written in your document" - Her bill of divorce was accepted, and the rest should be written in her document.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא שְׁאָר, הָא לֵיכָּא שְׁאָר – לֹא!
human_translation: the reason that there is remainder there is not remainder no,
llm_translation: Reason for there being leaven, here there is no leaven - no!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁאָר; וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא שְׁאָר, אִי אָמַר לַהּ – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: The same is true although there is no remainder And teaches us this: Although there is remainder if he said to her yes, If not no,
llm_translation: He is the same even though there is no other; and this is what he is teaching us - that even though there is another, if he says to her "no," whether yes or no.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אַוֵּירָא דִמְגִילְּתָא הוּא.
human_translation: What is the reason the margin of the scroll,
llm_translation: What is the reason? It is the atmosphere of the scroll.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ וְהַנְּיָיר שֶׁלִּי״ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתַּחְזִירִי לִי אֶת הַנְּיָיר״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Behold this is your bill of divorce, the paper is mine, she is not divorced, on the condition that you return the paper to me, she is divorced.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Here is your bill of divorce and my document" - she is not divorced. "On the condition that you return to me the document" - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: בֵּין שִׁיטָה לְשִׁיטָה וּבֵין תֵּיבָה לְתֵיבָה, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: between each line or between each word what shall stand
llm_translation: Question of Rav Papa: Between one row and another row, and between one box and another box, what is the ruling? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ ״דְּסֵפֶר״ אֶחָד אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה סְפָרִים! לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּמְעוֹרֶה.
human_translation: Let him derive the Merciful One speaks one scroll and not two or three scrolls. No, necessary intertwined,
llm_translation: And it should be derived from the word "sefer" one, said the Merciful One, and not two or three books! It is not necessary, for it is clarified.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הָיוּ מוּחְזָקִים בְּעֶבֶד שֶׁהוּא שֶׁלּוֹ – וְגֵט כָּתוּב עַל יָדוֹ, וַהֲרֵי הוּא יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדָהּ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: had a presumption that a slave was his, and the bill of divorce written on hand; and emerges from her possession, what is
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama inquired: If they were holding onto a slave that belongs to him, and a bill of divorce is written on his hand, and he is thereby leaving from beneath her hand, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן אַקְנוֹיֵי אַקְנִי לַהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא, הוּא מִנַּפְשֵׁיהּ עָיֵיל?
human_translation: Do we say that transferred to Or perhaps he, entered on his own,
llm_translation: Who said "I will acquire the acquisitions for her," or perhaps, he is coming of his own accord?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דִּכְתָב שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהִזְדַּיֵּיף הוּא! וּלְרָבָא, קַשְׁיָא מַתְנִיתִין ״עַל הַיָּד שֶׁל עֶבֶד״!
human_translation: Rava said: And let derive that is writing that can be forged, But according to Rava, the mishna difficult, on a slave’s hand.
llm_translation: Rava said: And let him go out and see that it is written that he can be appraised! And to Rava, a contradiction from the Mishnah "on the hand of a slave"!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מַתְנִיתִין לְרָבָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, בְּעֵדֵי מְסִירָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא. אֶלָּא לְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, the mishna not difficult for Rava, with witnesses who observe the transmission of a legal document. And it is Rabbi Elazar, However, for Rami bar Ḥama difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, the Mishnah to Rava is not difficult, regarding the witnesses of divorce, and it is Rabbi Elazar. Rather, it is difficult for Ramei bar Hama!

hebrew_text: לְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא – בִּכְתוֹבֶת קַעֲקַע. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, מַתְנִיתִין (לְרָבָא) נָמֵי לָא תִּיקְשֵׁי – בִּכְתוֹבֶת קַעֲקַע.
human_translation: According to Rami bar Ḥama also not difficult, with regard to written as a tattoo, Now that you have arrived at this, the mishna, will not difficult either, with regard to it was written as a tattoo.
llm_translation: To Ramai son of Hama, it is not difficult - in the written text it is engraved. Now that you have come to this, the Mishnah does not present difficulty - in the written text it is engraved.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַגּוֹדְרוֹת, אֵין לָהֶן חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: what was about Come hear that Reish Lakish says: With regard to livestock, there is no presumption
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding it? Come and hear, as Reish Lakish said: "Hedges do not have a presumption of ownership."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הָיוּ מוּחְזָקִין בְּטַבְלָא שֶׁהִיא שֶׁלָּהּ – וְגֵט כָּתוּב עָלֶיהָ; וַהֲרֵי הִיא יוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן אַקְנוֹיֵי אַקְנִיתַהּ לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא (אִשָּׁה) לָא יָדְעָה לְאַקְנוֹיֵי?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises dilemma: had a presumption that a slate was hers, and a bill of divorce was written on it, and emerges from his possession, what is Do we say that she transferred the ownership to him, Or perhaps does not understand to transfer
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama inquired: If they were holding onto her ritual immersion, and a bill of divorce was written on it; and behold, she emerged from under his hand, what is the law? Do we say, "We acquired it for him," or perhaps the woman did not know to acquire it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: אַף הוּא הֵעִיד עַל כְּפָר קָטָן שֶׁהָיָה בְּצַד יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, וְהָיָה בּוֹ זָקֵן אֶחָד, וְהָיָה מַלְוֶה לְכׇל בְּנֵי הַכְּפָר, וְכוֹתֵב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ וַאֲחֵרִים חוֹתְמִים, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים וְהִכְשִׁירוּהוּ. וְאַמַּאי? הָא בָּעֵינָא ״סֵפֶר מִקְנָה״, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear Even he, testified about a small village that was adjacent to Jerusalem, and there was an old man there who would lend to all the residents of the village. And he would write in his handwriting and others sign. And the incident came before the Sages and they deemed it valid. And why Isn’t there a need deed of purchase” and not
llm_translation: Abaye said, "Come and hear: He also testified about a small village that was beside Jerusalem, and there was an elder in it, and he would lend to all the inhabitants of the village, and he would write with his own hand, and others would sign, and the matter came before the sages, and they approved it. And why? Because I need a 'document of acquisition,' and there isn't one!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן אַקְנוֹיֵי מַקְנֵה לְהוּ!
human_translation: Rather, is it not because we say transferred to them
llm_translation: Rather, no, because we say the acquisition of the seller is effective for them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא
human_translation: Rava said: And what difficulty? Perhaps
llm_translation: Rava said: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps

hebrew_text: זָקֵן שָׁאנֵי, דְּיָדַע לְאַקְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: old man is different, as he understands to transfer
llm_translation: Elder who repeats, for he knows to acquire.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מֵהָכָא – עָרֵב הַיּוֹצֵא לְאַחַר חִיתּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת, גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין!
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: from here: a guarantor emerged after the note was signed, collect from unsold property.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: From here - one who guarantees after the sealing of the documents, collects from the free property!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא גַּבְרָא שָׁאנֵי, דְּיָדַע לְאַקְנוֹיֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מֵהָכָא – אִשָּׁה כּוֹתֶבֶת אֶת גִּיטָּהּ, וְהָאִישׁ כּוֹתֵב אֶת שׁוֹבָרוֹ, שֶׁאֵין קִיּוּם הַגֵּט אֶלָּא בְּחוֹתְמָיו.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is the difficulty Perhaps a man is different, that understands to transfer Rather, Rav Ashi said: from here A woman may write her bill of divorce a man may write his receipt as the ratification of a bill of divorce is only through its signatories,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: What is the difficulty? Perhaps the man is different, as he knows how to write! Rather, Rav Ashe said: From here - a woman writes her bill of divorce, and the man writes his receipt, for the validity of the divorce depends only on his signatures.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כָּתַב לָהּ גֵּט, וּנְתָנוֹ בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ, וְכָתַב לָהּ שְׁטַר מַתָּנָה עָלָיו – קְנָאַתְהוּ, וּמִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava says: he wrote her a bill of divorce and placed it in the hand of his slave, and he wrote her a deed of gift with regard to she acquired and she is divorced by the
llm_translation: Rava said: He wrote for her a bill of divorce, and he gave it into the hand of his slave, and he wrote for her a gift document upon it - she acquires it, and she is divorced through it.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? חָצֵר מְהַלֶּכֶת הִיא, וְחָצֵר מְהַלֶּכֶת לֹא קָנָה! וְכִי תֵּימָא בְּעוֹמֵד, וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מְהַלֵּךְ לֹא קָנָה, עוֹמֵד וְיוֹשֵׁב לֹא קָנָה! וְהִלְכְתָא – בְּכָפוּת.
human_translation: And why is a mobile courtyard, and a mobile courtyard does not acquire And if you would say to a standing, but didn’t Rava say: Anything that does not acquire when moving does not acquire standing or sitting. And the halakha in bound
llm_translation: And why? A courtyard that is walking, and a courtyard that is walking did not acquire! And if you will say while standing, but Rava said: Anyone who, even if walking, did not acquire, standing and sitting did not acquire! And the halakha is according to the stringent opinion.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: כָּתַב לָהּ גֵּט וּנְתָנוֹ בַּחֲצֵרוֹ, וְכָתַב לָהּ שְׁטַר מַתָּנָה עָלָיו – קְנָאַתְהוּ, וּמִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rava says: he wrote her a bill of divorce and placed it in his courtyard, and he wrote a deed of gift with regard to she has acquired and is divorced by the
llm_translation: And Rava said: He wrote for her a bill of divorce and gave it to her in his courtyard, and he wrote for her a gift document upon it - she acquires it, and she is divorced through it.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן עֶבֶד, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: דַּוְקָא עֶבֶד, אֲבָל חָצֵר – לִיגְזַר, מִשּׁוּם חֲצֵרָהּ הַבָּאָה לְאַחַר מִכָּאן;
human_translation: And necessary as had he taught us a slave, I would say specifically a slave, but a courtyard to enact a decree due to her courtyard that comes afterward.
llm_translation: "And it is necessary; for if we were to hear 'eved (slave), I would say: specifically a slave, but a chatzer (courtyard) – let it be decreed, because of its courtyard that comes after it."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן חָצֵר, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דַּוְקָא חָצֵר, אֲבָל עֶבֶד – לִיגְזַר כָּפוּת אַטּוּ שֶׁאֵינוֹ כָּפוּת; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And had taught us a courtyard, I would say specifically a courtyard, but a slave to decree a bound due to an unbound teaches us
llm_translation: And if we were to hear "chatzer," I would say specifically "chatzer," but "eved" - it is decreed like a palm branch, whether it is a palm branch or not; this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִכְּדֵי חָצֵר מֵהֵיכָא אִיתְרַבַּי? מִ״יָּדָהּ״;
human_translation: Abaye said Now, from where was a courtyard included? from her hand”
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where is it derived that a courtyard is considered part of one's domain? From "miyadah."

hebrew_text: מַה יָדָהּ דְּאִיתַהּ בֵּין מִדַּעְתַּהּ וּבֵין בְּעַל כּוּרְחַהּ, אַף חֲצֵרָהּ דְּאִיתַהּ בֵּין מִדַּעְתַּהּ וּבֵין בְּעַל כּוּרְחַהּ; וְהָא מַתָּנָה – מִדַּעְתַּהּ אִיתַהּ, בְּעַל כּוּרְחַהּ לֵיתַהּ!
human_translation: Just as her hand, that it whether with her consent or against her will, so too, her courtyard, that it whether with her consent or against her will. And a gift, it is with her consent, it is not against her will.
llm_translation: The hand that is in between her knowledge and her husband's knowledge, her courtyard that is in between her knowledge and her husband's knowledge; and regarding a gift - if it is from her knowledge, her husband has no claim to it!

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: וְהָא שְׁלִיחוּת לְקַבָּלָה, דְּמִדַּעְתַּהּ אִיתַהּ בְּעַל כּוּרְחַהּ לֵיתַהּ, וְקָא הָוֵי שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה!
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi objects to But agency for receipt which with her consent, not against her will. he is an agent for receipt.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei objects to her: But the agency is for acceptance, for with her knowledge there is no one else, and it is considered an agency for acceptance!

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי – אַטּוּ שְׁלִיחוּת מִ״יָּדָהּ״ אִיתְרַבַּי?! מִ״וְּשִׁלַּח וְשִׁלְּחָהּ״ אִיתְרַבַּי!
human_translation: And Abaye Is that to say agency is included from “her hand”? is included And he sent [ veshillaḥ ]. “And sends her out [ veshilleḥa ]”
llm_translation: And Abbaye - now, the agency of "from her hand" is more common?! From "and he sent and sent her" is more common!

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: שְׁלִיחוּת לְקַבָּלָה נָמֵי אַשְׁכְּחַן בְּעַל כּוּרְחַהּ, שֶׁכֵּן אָב מְקַבֵּל גֵּט לְבִתּוֹ קְטַנָּה בְּעַל כּוֹרְחָהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say We also have found agency for receipt against her will. As a father can receive a bill of divorce for his minor daughter against her will.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The agency for receiving a bill of divorce is indeed found in the husband of Kurcha, for thus a father may receive a bill of divorce for his minor daughter in the husband of Kurcha.

hebrew_text: עַל הֶעָלֶה שֶׁל זַיִת וְכוּ׳: בִּשְׁלָמָא יָד דְּעֶבֶד
human_translation: on an olive leaf, Granted, the hand of a slave,
llm_translation: On the leaf of an olive tree, etc.: In truth, the hand of a slave.

hebrew_text: לָא אֶפְשָׁר לְמִקְצְיַיהּ, אֶלָּא קֶרֶן שֶׁל פָּרָה – לִיקְצְיַיהּ וְלִיתְּבַהּ לָהּ!
human_translation: it is not possible to cut it off, But the horn of a cow, let him cut it off and give it to her.
llm_translation: It is not possible to end it, but the horn of a cow - to end it and to sit it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכָתַב״ – ״וְנָתַן לַהּ״, מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּסָּר אֶלָּא כְּתִיבָה וּנְתִינָה; יָצָא זֶה – שֶׁמְחוּסָּר כְּתִיבָה, קְצִיצָה וּנְתִינָה.
human_translation: The verse states: “And he writes and gives it her something when it is lacking only writing and giving, excluding this, which is lacking writing, cutting, and giving.
llm_translation: The verse says: "and he shall write" - "and give it to her," one who lacks only writing and giving; this one has fulfilled the requirement of writing, cutting, and giving.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? דְּתַנְיָא: ״סֵפֶר״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא סֵפֶר, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״סֵפֶר״? מָה סֵפֶר – דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֶל; אַף כׇּל דָּבָר – שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוּחַ חַיִּים וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֶל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei HaGelili’s As it is taught a scroll I have only a scroll from where to include all objects The verse states: “And he writes her,” in any case, If so, what is the verse states “scroll”? Just as a scroll is neither alive nor food, so too, any object that is neither alive nor food.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says, etc.: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei HaGalili's opinion? For it was taught: "sefer" - I have only "sefer," how do I know to include everything? The Torah teaches: "and he shall write for her" - from every place. If so, why does the Torah say "sefer"? What is a sefer - a thing that does not have a living spirit, and does not eat; so too, everything - that does not have a living spirit and does not eat.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן – אִי כְּתִיב ״בְּסֵפֶר״, כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ; הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״סֵפֶר״ – לִסְפִירַת דְּבָרִים הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, If were written: in the scroll [ besefer ], as you said, Now that it is written: “Scroll [ sefer ],” it comes to account of the matters [ sefirat devarim ]
llm_translation: The Sages - if it were written "in a book," as you said; the difference when it is written "a book" - for the counting of words it comes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״וְכָתַב״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ ״בִּכְתִיבָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, וְאֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בְּכֶסֶף״ – סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, אַקֵּישׁ יְצִיאָה לַהֲוָיָיהּ: מָה הֲוָיָיה בְּכֶסֶף, אַף יְצִיאָה נָמֵי בְּכֶסֶף; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this “And he writes For them, is required is divorced via writing, and she is not divorced via money. enter your mind to say: I should juxtapose leaving to becoming just as becoming is with money, so too, leaving also with money. teaches us:
llm_translation: The sages, this "and he shall write," what does it do for him? They require it for "in writing she is divorced, and she is not divorced with money" - is it really your opinion that I would say, I would establish a comparison: just as divorce is effected with money, so too divorce is also effected with money; this is what they are teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ – נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״סֵּפֶר כְּרִיתוּת״ – סֵפֶר כּוֹרְתָהּ, וְאֵין דָּבָר אַחֵר כּוֹרְתָהּ.
human_translation: And the other He derives it from “scroll of severance,” a scroll, severs her and nothing else severs her
llm_translation: And the other one - it emerges for him from the "Book of Cutting" - the book cuts it, and there is nothing else that cuts it.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ – מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ ״דָּבָר הַכּוֹרֵת בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ״, כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן״; ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלְכִי לְבֵית אָבִיךְ״; ״לְעוֹלָם״ – אֵין זֶה כְּרִיתוּת. ״עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ – הֲרֵי זֶה כְּרִיתוּת.
human_translation: And the other For them, is required a matter that severs between him and her, as it is taught This is your bill of divorce, on the condition that you will not drink wine, on condition that you will never go to your father’s house, that is not severance, until thirty days that is severance.
llm_translation: The other one - he requires of her "a matter that causes a separation between him and her," as it was taught: "Here is your divorce on condition that you do not drink wine"; "on condition that you do not go to your father's house"; "forever" - this is not a cutting off. "Until thirty days" - this is a cutting off.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ – מִ״כָּרֵת–כְּרִיתוּת״.
human_translation: And the other From karet , keritut .
llm_translation: And the other opinion - from "kareit" - excision.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ – ״כָּרֵת–כְּרִיתוּת״ לָא דָּרְשִׁי.
human_translation: And the other, They do not derive karet keritut .
llm_translation: And the other opinion - "karet - k'ritut" did not expound.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין כּוֹתְבִין בִּמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע. כְּתָבוֹ בִּמְחוּבָּר, תְּלָשׁוֹ וַחֲתָמוֹ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – כָּשֵׁר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹסֵל, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתִיבָתוֹ וַחֲתִימָתוֹ בְּתָלוּשׁ.
human_translation: One may not write on attached to the ground. one wrote it on attached detached it, signed it, and gave it to her, valid. Rabbi Yehuda deems invalid unless its writing and its signing detached.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not write on a surface that is connected to the ground. If one wrote on such a surface, if he erased it, sealed it, and gave it to her, it is valid. Rabbi Yehuda disqualifies it until its writing and sealing are detached.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין לֹא עַל הַנְּיָיר הַמָּחוּק וְלֹא עַל הַדִּיפְתְּרָא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לְהִזְדַּיֵּיף. וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: One may not write on erased paper or on unfinished leather diftera because can be forged. And the Rabbis deem valid
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: One does not write neither on erased paper nor on parchment, because it can be erased. But the sages permit it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כְּתָבוֹ עַל הַמְחוּבָּר?! וְהָאָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא ״אֵין כּוֹתְבִין״! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְהוּא שֶׁשִּׁיֵּיר מְקוֹם הַתּוֹרֶף.
human_translation: one wrote it on attached But didn’t you say the first clause one may not write Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: is when one left a place for the essential
llm_translation: Gemara: He wrote on the connected scroll?! But didn't you say at the beginning, "We do not write"! Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: And this is where the Torah scroll remains.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: וְהוּא שֶׁשִּׁיֵּיר מְקוֹם הַתּוֹרֶף. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁשִּׁיֵּיר מְקוֹם הַתּוֹרֶף – וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: And so Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: And this is where he left a place for the essential And so Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And this is when he left a place for the essential And is Rabbi Elazar, who says: Witnesses of the transmission effect
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Elazar, said Rabbi Oshaya: And he who leaves a place of filth. And so said Rabbah bar bar Hana, said Rabbi Yochanan: And he who leaves a place of filth - and Rabbi Elazar is the one who said: "Witnesses of removal, I have cut."

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין טוֹפֶס שֶׁמָּא יִכְתּוֹב תּוֹרֶף. כְּתָבוֹ לַטּוֹפֶס וּתְלָשׁוֹ, כְּתָבוֹ לַתּוֹרֶף וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And this is what is saying: One may not write standard lest he write essential he wrote the standard and then detached it, wrote the essential and gave it to her, valid.
llm_translation: And thus he said: One does not write a document lest it be erased. If he wrote it for the document and it got lost, if he wrote it for the eraser and gave it to her - it is valid.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״חָתְמוּ״ שָׁנִינוּ; וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא דְּאָמַר עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: we learned they signed it, it is Rabbi Meir, says the signatory witnesses effect
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "They sealed," as we have learned; and Rabbi Meir is the one who said, "Witnesses of a seal are like a contract."

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין תּוֹרֶף, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַחְתּוֹם. כְּתָבוֹ לַתּוֹרֶף, תְּלָשׁוֹ, חֲתָמוֹ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And this is what is saying: One may not write the essential decree, lest he have sign he wrote the essential detached it, had it signed, and gave it to her, valid.
llm_translation: And thus he said: One does not write a promissory note, a decree lest he might seal it. If he wrote it for a promissory note, let him tear it, seal it, and give it to her - it is valid.

hebrew_text: כְּתָבוֹ עַל חֶרֶס שֶׁל עָצִיץ נָקוּב – כָּשֵׁר, דְּשָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ. עַל עָלֶה שֶׁל עָצִיץ נָקוּב; אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כָּשֵׁר, וְרָבָא אָמַר: פָּסוּל. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר כָּשֵׁר –
human_translation: he wrote on the clay of a perforated pot [ atzitz ], valid, as he take and give it to her. on a leaf of a perforated pot, Abaye says: valid. And Rava says: invalid. Abaye says valid
llm_translation: He wrote on a shard of a broken pot - it is valid, as long as he smooths it and gives it a handle. On a leaf of a broken pot; Abbaye said: it is valid, and Rava said: it is invalid. Abbaye said it is valid -

hebrew_text: דְּשָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ. רָבָא אָמַר פָּסוּל – גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִקְטוֹם.
human_translation: as he take and give it to her. Rava says invalid. a decree lest one detach
llm_translation: He examined it and gave it to him to handle. Rava said: It is invalid - a decree lest he cut it.

hebrew_text: עָצִיץ שֶׁל אֶחָד וּזְרָעִים שֶׁל אַחֵר; מָכַר בַּעַל עָצִיץ לְבַעַל זְרָעִים – כֵּיוָן שֶׁמָּשַׁךְ, קָנָה. מָכַר בַּעַל זְרָעִים לְבַעַל עָצִיץ – לֹא קָנָה עַד שֶׁיַּחְזִיק בִּזְרָעִים.
human_translation: a pot belongs to one and the plants belong to another owner of pot sold to owner of plants, once pulled he has acquired owner of plants sold to owner of pot, does not acquire until he takes possession of the plants
llm_translation: A flowerpot of one and seeds of another; if the owner of the flowerpot sold it to the owner of the seeds - once he pulls, he acquires. If the owner of the seeds sold it to the owner of the flowerpot - he does not acquire until he holds onto the seeds.

hebrew_text: עָצִיץ וּזְרָעִים שֶׁל אֶחָד, וּמְכָרָן לְאַחֵר; הֶחְזִיק בִּזְרָעִים – קָנָה עָצִיץ. וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת נִקְנִין עִם נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת – בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה.
human_translation: the pot and plants belong to one and he sold them to another took possession of the plants he acquired the pot And this is that we learned Property that does not serve as a guarantee, can be acquired with property that serves as a guarantee, through money, or with a document, or by taking possession.
llm_translation: A flowerpot and seeds of one, and he sold them to another; he held onto the seeds - he acquired the flowerpot. And this is what we learned: Properties that have no succession can be acquired together with properties that have succession - with money, with a document, and with possession.

hebrew_text: הֶחְזִיק בְּעָצִיץ – אַף עָצִיץ לֹא קָנָה, עַד שֶׁיַּחְזִיק בִּזְרָעִים.
human_translation: took possession of the pot, he does not even acquire the pot, until he takes possession of the plants.
llm_translation: He held onto the flowerpot - he did not acquire the flowerpot until he held onto the seeds.

hebrew_text: נִקְבּוֹ בָּאָרֶץ וְנוֹפוֹ בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בָּתַר נִקְבּוֹ אָזְלִינַן. רָבָא אָמַר: בָּתַר נוֹפוֹ אָזְלִינַן.
human_translation: its perforation was in Eretz but its branches outside of Eretz Abaye said: We follow its perforation, Rava said: We follow its branches,
llm_translation: "They were punctured in the land and its sapling is outside the land? Abbaye said: After it was punctured, we go. Rava said: After its sapling, we go."

hebrew_text: בִּדְאַשְׁרוּשׁ, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי – בִּדְלָא אַשְׁרוּשׁ.
human_translation: In where took root everyone agrees When they disagree, with regard to where it did not take root.
llm_translation: In D'ashrush, everyone in the world does not argue. When they do argue, it is because they do not agree.

hebrew_text: וּבִדְאַשְׁרוּשׁ לָא פְּלִיגִי?! וְהָתְנַן: שְׁתֵּי גִּינּוֹת זוֹ עַל גַּב זוֹ, וְיָרָק בֵּינְתַיִם, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל עֶלְיוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל תַּחְתּוֹן!
human_translation: And do they not disagree with regard to where it took root? But didn’t we learn two gardens one above the other, and leafy vegetables between them Rabbi Meir says: belong to upper Rabbi Yehuda says: belong lower
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And in D'ashrush did they not argue?! And we learned: Two gardens, one on top of the other, with vegetables in between, Rabbi Meir says: the upper one. Rabbi Yehuda says: the lower one!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא – אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מָה אִם יִרְצֶה עֶלְיוֹן לִיטּוֹל אֶת עֲפָרוֹ, אֵין כָּאן יָרָק!
human_translation: There, the reason as is taught Rabbi Meir said: What if upper would wish to take his earth? there are no vegetables,
llm_translation: There, as it is taught in the reason - Rabbi Meir said: What if the Almighty desires to take His dust, there is no greenery here!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מָה אִם יִרְצֶה הַתַּחְתּוֹן לְמַלּאוֹת אֶת גִּנָּתוֹ עָפָר, אֵין כָּאן יָרָק!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: What if lower would wish to fill his garden earth? there are no vegetables,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda: What if the groom wishes to fill his garden with dirt, there is no greenery here!

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, בִּדְאַשְׁרוּשׁ לָא פְּלִיגִי?! וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אִילָן – מִקְצָתוֹ בָּאָרֶץ וּמִקְצָתוֹ בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ; טֶבֶל וְחוּלִּין מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַגָּדֵל בְּחִיּוּב – חַיָּיב, וְהַגָּדֵל בִּפְטוּר – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: But still, do they not disagree with regard to where took root? But isn’t it taught a tree, part of it in Eretz and part of it outside of Eretz untithed produce and non-sacred produce are mixed together the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: growing in an obligation obligated. And growing in exemption exempt.
llm_translation: And once, in that they do not argue in the case of Asherush?! And it was taught: A tree - some of it in the ground and some of it outside the ground; Tevel and Hullin are mixed with each other, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If it grows by obligation - it is obligated, and if it grows by exemption - it is exempt.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, מִקְצָת נוֹפוֹ בָּאָרֶץ וּמִקְצָת נוֹפוֹ בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ?
human_translation: What, is it not where some of its branches are in Eretz and some of its branches are outside of Eretz
llm_translation: What is the reason that some of his property is in the land and some of his property is outside the land?

hebrew_text: לֹא; מִקְצָת שׇׁרָשִׁין בָּאָרֶץ וּמִקְצָת שׇׁרָשִׁין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. וּמַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? דְּמַפְסִיק צוּנְמָא.
human_translation: No, some of the roots in Eretz and some of the roots outside of Eretz And what is the reasoning of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? a rock divides
llm_translation: Not; some roots in the ground and some roots outside the ground. And what is the reason for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? That it interrupts the flow.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? דְּהָדְרִי עׇרְבִי.
human_translation: what is the reasoning of Rabbi as they then become mixed
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi? Because he reconsidered.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: אַוֵּירָא מְבַלְבֵּל, וּמָר סָבַר: הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds: The air mixes and Sage, holds: This stands alone and this stands alone.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds: the air confuses, and the other Master holds: this one stands for his argument and this one stands for his argument.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַסִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא, שְׁלֹשָׁה עוֹרוֹת הֵן: מַצָּה, חִיפָּה וְדִיפְתְּרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: There are three hides, Matza , ḥifa , and diftera .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: It was said by Rabbi Chiya bar Assi in the name of Ulah, there are three types of skins: matzah, chifah, and diftera.

hebrew_text: מַצָּה – כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ, דְּלָא מְלִיחַ וּדְלָא קְמִיחַ וּדְלָא אֲפִיץ. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לְהוֹצָאַת שַׁבָּת. וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּרוֹ? כִּדְקָתָנֵי רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: כְּדֵי לָצוּר מִשְׁקָל קְטַנָּה. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי רִיבְעָא דְרִיבְעָא דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא.
human_translation: Matza , as per its plain meaning, not salted, and not treated with flour, and not treated with gallnuts. For what halakha for carries out Shabbat. And how much is the measure As Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yehuda teaches: equivalent to wrap a small weight. And how Abaye said: A quarter of a quarter of Pumbedita.
llm_translation: Matzah - as its name implies, that it is not salted, and not leavened, and not thick. For what purpose? For the removal of Shabbat. And what is its minimum quantity? As it was taught by Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah: enough to form a small weight. And how much is that? Abaye said: the quarter of a quarter of a Pumbedita.

hebrew_text: חִיפָּה – דִּמְלִיחַ, וְלָא קְמִיחַ וְלָא אֲפִיץ. לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא? לְהוֹצָאַת שַׁבָּת. וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּרוֹ? כְּדִתְנַן: עוֹר – כְּדֵי לַעֲשׂוֹת קָמֵיעַ.
human_translation: Ḥifa that is salted, and not treated with flour, and not treated with gallnuts. For what halakha for carries out Shabbat. And how much is the measure As we learned hide equivalent to make an amulet.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Hipah - dimlich, v'lo kemich v'lo apitz. L'mai hilcheta? L'hotza'at Shabbat. V'kama shiuro? K'deitan: or - k'dei la'asot kameia. English translation: Hipah - salted, not pickled and not spiced. For what purpose? For the removal of Shabbat. And what is the measure? As we learned: skin - enough to make a kameia.

hebrew_text: דִּיפְתְּרָא – דִּמְלִיחַ וּקְמִיחַ, וְלָא אֲפִיץ. לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא? לְהוֹצָאַת שַׁבָּת. וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּרוֹ? כְּדֵי לִכְתּוֹב עָלָיו אֶת הַגֵּט.
human_translation: Diftera that is salted, and treated with flour, and not treated with gallnuts. For what halakha for carries out Shabbat. And how much is the measure equivalent to on which a bill of divorce is written.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Diftera - dimlichah u'kemichah, v'lo apitz. L'mai hilkhta? L'hotza'at Shabbat. V'kama shiuro? K'dei lichtov alav et haget. English translation: Diftera - a plaster made of salt and wax, but not of pitch. For what purpose? For taking out on Shabbat. And what is the required amount? Enough to write a divorce document on it.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין: מַאן חֲכָמִים? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר:
human_translation: the Rabbis deem valid Who are Rabbis? Rabbi Elazar said:
llm_translation: The sages validate. Who are the sages? Rabbi Elazar said:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Elazar, who says: Witnesses of the transmission effect
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, he, said: Witnesses of removal, I have cut.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִכְשִׁיר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֶלָּא לְאַלְתַּר, אֲבָל מִכָּאן עַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים – לָא; חָיְישִׁינַן דִּילְמָא הֲוָה בֵּיהּ תְּנָאָה וְזַיֵּיפְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Elazar deemed valid only immediately However, from now until ten days, not We are concerned perhaps had a stipulation and she forged it
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Elazar only permitted for immediate use, but from here until ten days - no; we are concerned that perhaps there was a mistake in it and it was forged.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִכָּאן עַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים; דְּאִם אִיתָא דַּהֲוָה בֵּיהּ תְּנַאי – מִידְכָּר דְּכִירִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even from now until ten days if it is so that it had a stipulation, will remember
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even from here until ten days; for if it is stated that there was a dispute - it is immediately remembered as a known matter.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִכְשִׁיר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֶלָּא בְּגִיטִּין, אֲבָל בִּשְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת – לָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּנְתַתָּם בִּכְלִי חָרֶשׂ לְמַעַן יַעַמְדוּ יָמִים רַבִּים״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Elazar deemed valid only with regard to bills of divorce but not for other documents, as it is written “And put them in an earthen vessel; so that they will remain many days”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Elazar only permitted with regards to bills of divorce, but with other documents - no, as it is written: "And you shall put them in an earthenware vessel, that they may endure many days."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁטָרוֹת. וְהָכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יַעַמְדוּ יָמִים רַבִּים״! הָתָם עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even in documents. But isn’t it written: “So that they will remain many days”? There teaches us good advice,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even in documents. And it is written: "So that they may stand for many days"! There, it is referring to good advice that we hear.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לִכְתּוֹב אֶת הַגֵּט, אֲפִילּוּ חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן. הָאִשָּׁה כּוֹתֶבֶת אֶת גִּיטָּהּ, וְהָאִישׁ כּוֹתֵב אֶת שׁוֹבָרוֹ. שֶׁאֵין קִיּוּם הַגֵּט אֶלָּא בְּחוֹתְמָיו.
human_translation: Anyone is qualified to write a bill of divorce, even a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor. a woman may write her bill of divorce And a man may write his receipt, the ratification of a bill of divorce is only through its signatories,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All are fit to write a bill of divorce, even a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor. The woman writes her own divorce document, and the man writes his receipt. For the bill of divorce is only valid with their signatures.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָא לָאו בְּנֵי דֵּיעָה נִינְהוּ! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא:
human_translation: But They are not competent, Rav Huna says:
llm_translation: Gemara: "And isn't this case not pertaining to the sons of knowledge! Rav Huna said:"

hebrew_text: וְהוּא שֶׁהָיָה גָּדוֹל עוֹמֵד עַל גַּבָּיו.
human_translation: And that there was an adult standing over him.
llm_translation: And he who was great stood on his back.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גּוֹי – וְיִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹמֵד עַל גַּבָּיו, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּכָשֵׁר?! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: גּוֹי פָּסוּל! גּוֹי, לְדַעְתֵּיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ עָבֵד.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to him: If that is so, a gentile, and a Jew stands over him also that valid? And if you would say that also but isn’t it taught A gentile is disqualified A gentile acts his own will.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman: Rather, from now on, a Gentile - and a Jew standing on his back, is it thus valid?! And if you will say, is it thus valid, yet it was taught: A Gentile is disqualified! A Gentile, according to his own understanding, he serves himself.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרִי; דְּמִדְּקָא פָּסֵיל לֵיהּ לְגוֹי לְעִנְיַן הֲבָאָה, מִכְּלָל דִּלְעִנְיַן כְּתִיבָה – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman then said: What I said is not correct, from the fact disqualifies a gentile with regard to the bringing by inference qualified with regard to writing,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar Rav Nachman: Lav milta hi da'amari; d'midaka pasel lei l'goy l'inyan havaha, mik'lal dil'inyan k'tivah - kasher. English translation: Hadr said Rav Nachman: It is not a matter that they said; since it is disqualified for a non-Jew for the purpose of acquisition, from the general principle of writing - it is valid.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: גּוֹי פָּסוּל! הַהִיא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי, וּבָעֵינַן כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ; וְהָא וַדַּאי גּוֹי אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָעָבֵיד.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught a gentile is disqualified That is Rabbi Elazar, who says: Witnesses of the transmission effect we need writing for her sake, and certainly a gentile acts his own will
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught: A non-Jew is disqualified! That is Rabbi Elazar, as he said: I have cut off witnesses of divorce, and we require the writing to be for her sake; and this is certainly a non-Jew, for she is concerned for her own soul.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֲפִילּוּ מְצָאוֹ בְּאַשְׁפָּה, חֲתָמוֹ, וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabbi Meir would have said: Even if found in the garbage he had it signed and he gave it to her, valid,
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Rabbi Meir says: Even if one finds it in the garbage, sealed, and gives it to her - it is valid.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ – לִשְׁמָהּ; מַאי, לָאו כְּתִיבַת הַגֵּט?! לֹא, חֲתִימַת עֵדִים.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: “And he writes her,” for her sake. What, is it not writing of the bill of divorce, No, signing of the witnesses.
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "And he shall write for her" - for her name; What is this, is it not like the writing of a bill of divorce?! No, it is the signing of witnesses.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא: כׇּל גֵּט שֶׁנִּכְתַּב שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם אִשָּׁה – פָּסוּל! אֵימָא: שֶׁנֶּחְתַּם שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם אִשָּׁה – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: Rava raised objection to him Any bill of divorce that was not written for the sake of woman invalid. Say that was not signed for the sake of woman invalid.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him, Rava: Any bill of divorce that was written not for the sake of any woman - invalid! I might say: If it was signed not for the sake of any woman - invalid.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹתְבוֹ – כְּאִילּוּ כּוֹתְבוֹ לִשְׁמָהּ. מַאי, לָאו כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹתְבוֹ לַתּוֹרֶף לִשְׁמָהּ – כְּאִילּוּ כּוֹתְבוֹ לַטּוֹפֶס לִשְׁמָהּ?!
human_translation: raised objection to him When he writes it, as though he writes it for her sake, What, it is not when he writes the essential for her sake, is it as though he writes the standard for her sake?
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: When he writes it - as if he writes it for its own sake. What, is it not when he writes it for the purpose of its own repair - as if he writes it for the purpose of its own destruction?!

hebrew_text: לֹא; כְּשֶׁהוּא חוֹתְמוֹ לִשְׁמָהּ – כְּאִילּוּ כּוֹתְבוֹ לִשְׁמָהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָנֵי מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: No, where he sign it for her sake; it is as though he wrote it for her sake. And if you wish, say: Who is these baraitot They are Rabbi Elazar, who said: Witnesses of the transmission effect
llm_translation: Not; when he signs for her name - as if he wrote for her name. And if you will say: Are these Mishnaic teachings mine? It is Rabbi Elazar, as he said: Witnesses of removal, I have cut.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְהוּא שֶׁשִּׁיֵּיר מְקוֹם הַתּוֹרֶף. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי חַגָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁשִּׁיֵּיר מְקוֹם הַתּוֹרֶף, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel And when he left the essential And so Rabbi Ḥagga says in the name of Ulla: And when he left the essential and Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: And he who leaves over a place of refuse. And so said Rabbi Ḥagga from the name of Ulah: And he who leaves over a place of refuse, and Rabbi Elazar said.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵינָהּ תּוֹרָה. מַאי ״אֵינָהּ תּוֹרָה״? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: כָּאן הוֹדִיעֲךָ שֶׁאֵין כֹּחַ לִשְׁמָהּ; וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zerika says Rabbi Yoḥanan It is not Torah. What It is not Torah? Rabbi Abba says: Here informs you that there is no force for her sake, And it is Rabbi Meir, says: Signatory witnesses effect
llm_translation: Rabbi Zerika said Rabbi Yochanan: It is not Torah. What is "It is not Torah"? Rabbi Abba said: Here he informed you that there is no strength to it; and Rabbi Meir it is, as he said: "Witnesses of a signature I have cut."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא! אָמוֹרָאֵי נִינְהוּ וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan said is Rabbi Elazar? They are amora’im and with regard to Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: And he said, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is Rabbi Elazar! They are the Amoraim, and in the school of Rabbi Yoḥanan.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לְהָבִיא אֶת הַגֵּט, חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה, וְקָטָן, וְסוֹמֵא, וְגוֹי.
human_translation: Anyone is fit to bring a bill of divorce except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, or a blind person, or a gentile.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: everything is fit to bring a bill of divorce, except for a deaf-mute, a mentally incompetent person, a minor, a blind person, and a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: קִיבֵּל הַקָּטָן וְהִגְדִּיל; חֵרֵשׁ וְנִתְפַּקֵּחַ; סוֹמֵא וְנִתְפַּתֵּחַ; שׁוֹטֶה וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה; גּוֹי וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: a minor received and reached majority, a deaf-mute and became able to hear, blind and became able to see, an imbecile and became competent, a gentile and converted, unfit
llm_translation: The minor accepted and grew; the deaf-mute and opened; the blind and opened; the insane and regained sanity; a gentile and converted - disqualified.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל פִּקֵּחַ וְנִתְחָרֵשׁ וְחָזַר וְנִתְפַּקֵּחַ; פָּתוּחַ וְנִסְתַּמֵּא וְחָזַר וְנִתְפַּתֵּחַ; שָׁפוּי וְנִשְׁתַּטָּה וְחָזַר וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה – כָּשֵׁר. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְסוֹפוֹ בְּדַעַת – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: However, able to hear, and became a deaf-mute, and again became able to hear; he was able to see, and became blind, and again became able to see; competent, and became an imbecile, and again became competent, fit This is the principle: Anyone who is competent in the beginning and in the end fit,
llm_translation: But if one was able to see and then became blind, and then regained his sight; or if one was deaf and then became able to hear, and then lost his hearing again; or if one was mute and then became able to speak, and then became mute again - he is fit. This is the principle: anything whose beginning and end are with knowledge - is fit.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן – דְּלָאו בְּנֵי דֵּיעָה נִינְהוּ; גּוֹי נָמֵי – דְּלָאו בַּר הֶיתֵּירָא הוּא; אֶלָּא סוֹמֵא, אַמַּאי לָא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מִמִּי נוֹטְלוֹ וּלְמִי נוֹתְנוֹ.
human_translation: Granted, a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor they are not competent, a gentile also as he is not subject to permit But why isn’t a blind person Rav Sheshet says: Because he does not know from whom he takes it and to whom he gives it,
llm_translation: Gemara: In truth, a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor - they are not considered of discerning mind; a non-Jew, however - he is not a son of the permitted one; rather, a blind person, why not? Rav Sheshet said: Because he does not know from whom he takes and to whom he gives.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: הֵיאַךְ סוֹמֵא מוּתָּר בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ? הֵיאַךְ בְּנֵי אָדָם מוּתָּרִים בִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם בַּלַּיְלָה? אֶלָּא בִּטְבִיעוּת עֵינָא דְּקָלָא, הָכָא נָמֵי בִּטְבִיעוּת עֵינָא דְּקָלָא!
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this: how is a blind man permitted to his wife? how are people permitted to their wives at night? Rather, through voice recognition [ teviut eina dekala ]. Here too, through voice recognition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Yosef challenges her: How is a blind person permitted with his wife? How are people permitted with their wives at night? Rather, with the dipping of a light eye, here too with the dipping of a light eye!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָכָא בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ עָסְקִינַן; דְּבָעֵי לְמֵימַר: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, וְלָא מָצֵי לְמֵימַר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef says: Here we are dealing with outside of Eretz where needs to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, and cannot say
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Here we are dealing with a case in the public domain; for one wants to say: "Written on my face and sealed on my face," and one cannot say.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, פָּתוּחַ וְנִסְתַּמֵּא, דְּמָצֵי אָמַר, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּכָשֵׁר?! וְהָא קָתָנֵי: פָּתוּחַ וְנִסְתַּמֵּא וְחָזַר וְנִתְפַּתֵּחַ, כָּשֵׁר – חָזַר וְנִתְפַּתֵּחַ, אִין; לֹא חָזַר וְנִתְפַּתֵּחַ, לֹא!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: However, if that is so, is able to see and becomes blind, who can say: also fit But it is taught he was able to see, and became blind, and again became able to see, fit he again became able to see, yes, he did not again become able to see, no,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now on, open and closed, for he finds, he said, so it is fitting?! But it is taught: open and closed and then reopened, fitting - if it reopened, fitting; if it did not reopen, not fitting!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא חָזַר וְנִתְפַּתֵּחַ; וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָתָנֵי שָׁפוּי וְנִשְׁתַּטָּה וְחָזַר וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה – טַעְמָא דְּחָזַר וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה, הָא לֹא חָזַר וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה – לָא; תְּנָא נָמֵי פָּתוּחַ וְנִסְתַּמֵּא וְחָזַר וְנִתְפַּתֵּחַ.
human_translation: the same is true, that although he did not again become able to see And Since teaches competent, and became an imbecile, and again became competent the reason that he again became competent, but if he did not again become competent, not also teaches one who was able to see became blind and again became able to see.
llm_translation: The same applies even though it did not return and open; and since it was taught that it was closed and opened and then returned and closed - the reason it returned and closed, this is not the case when it did not return and close; a Tanna similarly taught that it was open and closed and then returned and opened.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי – דְּקָתָנֵי, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְסוֹפוֹ בְּדַעַת – כָּשֵׁר; וְלָא קָתָנֵי: כׇּל שֶׁתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְסוֹפוֹ בְּכַשְׁרוּת – כָּשֵׁר; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: is also precise, as it teaches this is the principle: Anyone who is competent in the beginning and in the end fit, and it does not teach: Anyone who is fit in the beginning and the end fit. Learn from
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Precisely stated - for it is taught, this is the principle: anything whose beginning and end are with intent - is valid; and it does not teach: anything whose beginning and end are with validity - is valid; infer from it.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבִּי אַמֵּי: עֶבֶד, מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּעָשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גֵּט אִשָּׁה מִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִדְּקָא פָּסֵיל לֵיהּ לְגוֹי,
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rabbi Ami: a slave, what is Can he be made an agent to receive a woman’s bill of divorce from the hand of her husband? He said to them: From disqualified a gentile,
llm_translation: He asked from Rabbi Ammi: A slave, what should a messenger do to receive a bill of divorce from her husband's hand? He said to them: Since a non-Jew is invalid for her,

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּעֶבֶד כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רַב אַסִּי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הָעֶבֶד נַעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גֵּט לְאִשָּׁה מִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּתוֹרַת גִּיטִּין וְקִדּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: by inference a slave is fit. Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A slave cannot become an agent to receive a bill of divorce for a woman from the hand of her husband, because he is not in the halakhot of divorce and betrothal,
llm_translation: From the principle that a slave is valid. Rav Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: A slave cannot be appointed as an agent to receive a bill of divorce for a woman from her husband's hand, because he is not under the laws of divorce and betrothal.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: טַעְמָא בְּמִילְּתָא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ, הָא בְּמִילְּתָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ – כָּשֵׁר?!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar objects to this The reason pertains to a matter whose he is not but for a matter whose he is fit
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rabbi Elazar: Reason in a matter that does not have it, but in a matter that does have it - valid?!

hebrew_text: וְהָא גּוֹי וְהָא כּוּתִי; דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בְּתוֹרַת תְּרוּמָה דְּנַפְשַׁיְיהוּ, דִּתְנַן: הַגּוֹי וְהַכּוּתִי שֶׁתָּרְמוּ מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם – תְּרוּמָתָם תְּרוּמָה; וּתְנַן: גּוֹי שֶׁתָּרַם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲפִילּוּ בִּרְשׁוּת – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה!
human_translation: But a gentile and a Samaritan, who are in the halakhot of teruma with regard to their own as we learned a gentile and a Samaritan that separated from their own their teruma is considered teruma . And we learned a gentile who separated teruma from a Jew’s even with permission his teruma is not teruma .
llm_translation: And this one, the Gentile, and this one, the Cuthean; for they are included in the law of terumah for themselves, as we learned: "The Gentile and the Cuthean who contribute from their own - their terumah is terumah." And we learned: "A Gentile who contributes from that of an Israelite, even with permission - his terumah is not terumah!"

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: (אַתֶּם) ״גַּם אַתֶּם״ – מָה אַתֶּם יִשְׂרָאֵל, אַף שְׁלוּחֲכֶם יִשְׂרָאֵל?!
human_translation: What is the reason Is it not because it is written “you” “So you also Just as you, are Jews, so too, your agents Jews.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Not because it is written: "You too" - just as you are Israel, so too your messenger is Israel?!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לֹא; מָה אַתֶּם בְּנֵי בְּרִית, אַף שְׁלוּחֲכֶם בְּנֵי בְּרִית.
human_translation: from the school of Rabbi Yannai say: No, Just as you, are members of the covenant, so too, your agents members of the covenant.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: No; just as you are sons of the covenant, so too your messengers are sons of the covenant.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הָעֶבֶד נַעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גֵּט אִשָּׁה מִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּתוֹרַת גִּיטִּין וְקִידּוּשִׁין, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ שִׁפְחָה וּוְלָדֵךְ בֶּן חוֹרִין״, אִם הָיְתָה עוּבָּרָה – זָכְתָה לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A slave cannot become an agent to receive a bill of divorce for a woman from the hand of her husband, because he is not in the halakhot of divorce and betrothal. And although we learned: Behold you are a maidservant and your child is a freeman, if she was pregnant she acquired for
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: A slave cannot be appointed as an agent to receive a woman's bill of divorce from her husband, because he is not knowledgeable in the laws of divorce and betrothal, even though we have learned: "Behold, you are a maidservant and your offspring are free," if she was impregnated - she acquires it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם הָיְתָה עוּבָּרָה זָכְתָה לוֹ״? כִּי אֲתָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תַּרְתֵּי אָמַר: נִרְאִים דְּבָרִים שֶׁהָעֶבֶד מְקַבֵּל גֵּט לַחֲבֵירוֹ – מִיָּד רַבּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא מִיַּד רַבּוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: What If she was pregnant she acquired for When Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda came, he said: Rabbi Yoḥanan said two It appears that a slave can receive a bill of manumission for his fellow from the hand of his fellow’s master, but not from the hand of his own master
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "if she was pregnant, she is entitled to it"? When Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah came, he said, Rabbi Yochanan said two things: It appears that when a slave receives a bill of divorce for his fellow, it is immediately his fellow's master, but not immediately his own master.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לְחָשְׁךָ אָדָם לוֹמַר: זוֹ הֲלָכָה שְׁנוּיָה – אִם הָיְתָה עוּבָּרָה, זָכְתָה לוֹ! אֱמוֹר לוֹ: שְׁנֵי גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר פֵּירְשׁוּ אֶת הַדָּבָר – רַבִּי זֵירָא, וְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק.
human_translation: And if a person will whisper to you, saying: This a halakha was taught If was pregnant she acquired for say to him two greats of the generation explained the matter, Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak.
llm_translation: And if to darken you a person to say: this is a halakhah that is changed - if it was transgressed, she has earned it! Say to him: Two greats of the generation explained the matter - Rabbi Zeira, and Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak.

hebrew_text: חַד אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: הַמְשַׁחְרֵר חֲצִי עַבְדּוֹ – קָנָה; וְחַד אָמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי בְּהָא? קָסָבַר: עוּבָּר יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא, וְנַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁהִקְנָה לָהּ אֶחָד מֵאֵבָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: One said: whose is this? It is Rabbi who says: one who emancipates half of his slave, acquires and one said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi for this He holds: A fetus is its mother’s thigh, and it is as though transferred one of her limbs to her.
llm_translation: One said: Is this a statement of Rabbi? For Rabbi said: One who frees half of his slave - acquires him. And one said: What is the reason for Rabbi in this? He holds: The thigh of his mother passed through him, and he becomes as one who acquired one of her limbs.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַף הַנָּשִׁים שֶׁאֵינָן נֶאֱמָנוֹת לוֹמַר ״מֵת בַּעְלָהּ״, נֶאֱמָנוֹת לְהָבִיא אֶת גִּיטָּהּ – חֲמוֹתָהּ, וּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ, וְצָרָתָהּ, וִיבִמְתָּהּ, וּבַת בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: Even the women who are not deemed credible to say: Her husband died, are deemed credible to bring her bill of divorce. Her mother-in-law; and her mother-in-law’s daughter; and her rival wife, and her yevama , and her husband’s daughter.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Even women who are not trusted to say "her husband is dead" are trusted to bring her divorce document - her mother-in-law, her daughter-in-law, her co-wife, her rival wife, and her husband's daughter.

hebrew_text: מָה בֵּין גֵּט לְמִיתָה? שֶׁהַכְּתָב מוֹכִיחַ. הָאִשָּׁה עַצְמָהּ מְבִיאָה אֶת גִּיטָּהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁהִיא צְרִיכָה לוֹמַר: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: What is between a bill of divorce and death, that the writing proves the woman herself may bring her bill of divorce, provided that she is required to state It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence,
llm_translation: What is the difference between a divorce document (get) and a death certificate? The writing proves it. The woman herself brings her divorce document, but she must specifically say: "It was written in my presence and signed in my presence."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱמָנוֹת לוֹמַר ״מֵת בַּעְלָהּ״, כָּךְ אֵין נֶאֱמָנוֹת לְהָבִיא גִּיטָּהּ! אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא – כָּאן בָּאָרֶץ, כָּאן בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Just as are not deemed credible to say: Her husband died, so too, they are not deemed credible to bring her bill of divorce. Rav Yosef said: not difficult. Here, in Eretz There, to outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, and it was taught: Just as she is not believed to say 'her husband is dead,' so too she is not believed to bring her divorce document!" Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult - here in the land, here outside the land."

hebrew_text: בָּאָרֶץ – דְּלָאו אַדִּיבּוּרַהּ דִּידַהּ קָא סָמְכִינַן, מְהֵימְנָא; בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – דְּאַדִּיבּוּרַהּ דִּידַהּ קָא סָמְכִינַן, לָא מְהֵימְנָא.
human_translation: in Eretz where, we do not rely on her statement deemed credible in outside of Eretz where we rely on her statement she is not deemed credible,
llm_translation: In the land - because we rely on its own speech, we trust; outside the land - because we rely on its own speech, we do not trust.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַדְּרַבָּה, אִיפְּכָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא! בָּאָרֶץ, דְּאִי אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעַר – מַשְׁגְּחִינַן בֵּיהּ, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר לְקִלְקוּלָא קָא מִיכַּוְּונָה, לָא מְהֵימְנָא; בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, דְּאִי אָתֵי בַּעַל מְעַרְעַר – לָא מַשְׁגְּחִינַן בֵּיהּ, מְהֵימְנָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: On the contrary, the opposite is reasonable, In Eretz where if husband come and contest we pay attention to him where it could be said intends to harm she is not deemed credible. outside of Eretz where if husband come and contest we not pay attention to him, deemed credible,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: The opposite seems more reasonable! In the land, because if a destructive force comes - we supervise it, for there is room to say that it is being directed towards destruction, we do not trust it; outside the land, because if a destructive force comes - we do not supervise it, we trust it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִשָּׁה נֶאֱמֶנֶת לְהָבִיא גִּיטָּהּ – מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה נָשִׁים שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֵין נֶאֱמָנוֹת לוֹמַר ״מֵת בַּעְלָהּ״ – נֶאֱמָנוֹת לְהָבִיא גִּיטָּהּ; הִיא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמֶנֶת לוֹמַר ״מֵת בַּעְלָהּ״ – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמֶנֶת לְהָבִיא גִּיטָּהּ?!
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Abaye Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: A woman is deemed credible to bring her bill of divorce through an a fortiori Just as women whom the Sages said: are not deemed credible to say: Her husband died, are deemed credible to bring her bill of divorce, who is deemed credible to say her husband died, is it not right that she is deemed credible to bring her bill of divorce?
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Abaye: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: A faithful woman to bring her divorce - from a fortiori reasoning. And just as women whom the Sages said are not believed to say "her husband is dead" are believed to bring her divorce; she, who is believed to say "her husband is dead" - it is not logical that she is believed to bring her divorce?!

hebrew_text: וּמִמָּקוֹם שֶׁבָּאתָ, מָה לְהַלָּן צְרִיכוֹת שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנֵינוּ נֶחְתַּם״, אַף הִיא צְרִיכָה שֶׁתֹּאמַר: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: And from the place that you came, Just as there, must say: It was written in our presence and it was signed in our presence, so too, she must say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence.
llm_translation: And from the place that you came, what there they need to say: "In our presence it was written, and in our presence it was sealed," she too needs to say: "In my presence it was written, and in my presence it was sealed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: הָאִשָּׁה עַצְמָהּ מְבִיאָה גִּיטָּהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא צְרִיכָה לוֹמַר כּוּ׳; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The mishna is also precisely as it teaches: The woman herself may bring her bill of divorce, provided that she is required to say: Learn from
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: "A woman brings her own divorce document," provided that she needs to say the following: "Hear from me."

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף, רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, מְצִיעֲתָא בָּאָרֶץ?! אִין; רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, מְצִיעֲתָא בָּאָרֶץ.
human_translation: But Rav Yosef, the first clause and the last clause in outside of Eretz the middle clause: in Eretz Yes, the first clause and the last clause in outside of Eretz the middle clause in Eretz
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, the beginning and the end, in the open field, does it take effect in the land?! No; the beginning and the end, in the open field, does it take effect in the land.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: מָה בֵּין גֵּט לְמִיתָה – שֶׁהַכְּתָב מוֹכִיחַ; וְלָא קָתָנֵי: שֶׁהַכְּתָב וּפֶה מוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: From where From that it teaches What is between a bill of divorce and death, that the writing proves that the writing and statement prove
llm_translation: From where? From what is it derived? From what is taught: What is the difference between a divorce document (get) and death - that the writing proves; and it does not teach: that the writing and the mouth prove.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה עַצְמָהּ מְבִיאָה וְכוּ׳: אִשָּׁה, מִכִּי מָטֵי גִּיטָּהּ לְיָדָהּ אִיגָּרַשָׁה לַהּ! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בְּאוֹמֵר ״לֹא תִּתְגָּרְשִׁי בּוֹ אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין פְּלוֹנִי״. סוֹף סוֹף, כִּי מָטְיָא הָתָם – אִיגָּרַשָׁה!
human_translation: the woman herself may bring woman, once her bill of divorce reaches her hand, she is divorced. Rav Huna says: to one who says You will be divorced through it only in the presence of such and such court, Ultimately, once she arrives there, she is divorced through it,
llm_translation: The woman herself brings and so on: A woman, when she gives her divorce document into her hand, she is divorced! Rav Huna said: By saying "You shall not divorce him except in the presence of such and such court." Ultimately, when it comes to it there - she is divorced!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: דְּאָמַר לַהּ: כִּי מָטֵית הָתָם, אַתְנְחֵיהּ אַאַרְעָא וְשִׁקְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ said in the name of Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika: where he said to her: When you arrive there, place on the ground and take it.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Acha son of Rava Ika: who said to him: "When you go there, place it on the ground and weigh it."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הֲוָה לֵיהּ: ״טְלִי גִּיטִּיךְ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע״, וְאָמַר רָבָא: ״טְלִי גִּיטִּיךְ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם!
human_translation: If that is so, isn’t it Take your bill of divorce from off the ground, and Rava says: Take your bill of divorce from off the ground, he said nothing.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, he had: "Take your bill from upon the ground," and Rava said: "Take your bill from upon the ground" - he did not say anything!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֱוַי שָׁלִיחַ לְהוֹלָכָה עַד דְּמָטְיַת הָתָם, וְכִי מָטְיַת הָתָם הֱוַי שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה, וְקַבִּלִי אַתְּ גִּיטִּיךְ.
human_translation: Rather, where he said to Be agent for delivery until you arrive there. And when you arrive there, be agent for receipt, and receive your bill of divorce
llm_translation: Rather, he said to her: Be an emissary to deliver the bill of divorce until you reach there. And when you reach there, be an emissary to receive it, and receive your bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לֹא חָזְרָה שְׁלִיחוּת אֵצֶל הַבַּעַל! דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֱוַי שָׁלִיחַ לְהוֹלָכָה עַד דְּמָטְיַת הָתָם, וְכִי מָטְיַת הָתָם שַׁוַּי שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה.
human_translation: But the agency has not returned to the husband. said to her: Be an agent for delivery until you arrive there, and when you arrive there, appoint an agent for receipt
llm_translation: And this, did not return the agency to the husband! For he said to her: Be an agent for divorce until the place there, and when you reach there, appoint an agent for receiving.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גִּיטָּהּ מִיָּד שְׁלִיחַ בַּעְלָהּ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גִּיטָּהּ מִיָּד שְׁלִיחַ בַּעֲלָהּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said: A woman can appoint an agent to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of the agent of her husband, However, according to the one who says: A woman cannot appoint an agent to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of the agent of her husband, what can be said?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for the one who says: A woman appoints a messenger to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband's messenger. But according to the one who says: A woman does not appoint a messenger to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband's messenger, what can be said?"

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא בִּזָּיוֹן דְּבַעַל, וְהָכָא בַּעַל לָא קָפֵיד.
human_translation: What is the reason Because there is degradation of the husband And here the husband is not particular
llm_translation: Reason what - because there is disgrace of Baal, and here Baal does not care.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: מִשּׁוּם בִּזָּיוֹן דְּבַעַל; אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: מִשּׁוּם חֲצֵרָהּ הַבָּאָה לְאַחַר מִיכָּן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said: due to degradation of the husband. But according to the one who says due to her courtyard that comes afterward, what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said: due to the disgrace of her husband; rather than for the one who said: due to her courtyard that comes after this, what can be said?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֱוַי שָׁלִיחַ לְהוֹלָכָה עַד דְּמָטְיַת הָתָם, וְכִי מָטְיַת הָתָם שַׁוַּי שָׁלִיחַ לְהוֹלָכָה, וְקַבִּלִי אַתְּ גִּיטִּיךְ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: when he said to her: Be an agent for delivery until you arrive there, and when you arrive there, appoint agent for delivery, and receive your bill of divorce from him.
llm_translation: He said to her: Be an emissary to deliver the bill of divorce until the place of the mat. And when you reach the place of the mat, appoint another emissary to deliver it, and receive your bill of divorce from him.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֱוַי שָׁלִיחַ לְהוֹלָכָה עַד דְּמָטְיַת הָתָם, וְכִי מָטְיַת הָתָם אֵימַר קַמֵּי בֵּי דִינָא ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, וּמְשַׁוֵּי בֵּי דִּינָא שָׁלִיחַ, וְלִיתְּבוּהּ נִיהֲלִיךְ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say he said to her: Be an agent for delivery until you arrive there, and when you arrive there, say before the court: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, and you should appoint the court as an agent, and they will give to you.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that he said to her: Be an emissary to go until you reach there, and when you reach there, say before the court, "In my presence it was written and in my presence it was signed," and establish a court emissary, and let it be conducted properly.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט
llm_translation: We will return to you, the one who brings a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: כׇּל גֵּט שֶׁנִּכְתַּב שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם אִשָּׁה, פָּסוּל. כֵּיצַד, הָיָה עוֹבֵר בַּשּׁוּק וְשָׁמַע קוֹל סוֹפְרִים מַקְרִין: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מְגָרֵשׁ אֶת פְּלוֹנִית מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, וְאָמַר: זֶה שְׁמִי וְזֶה שֵׁם אִשְׁתִּי; פָּסוּל לְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Any bill of divorce that was not written for the sake of woman invalid. How so? was passing through the marketplace and heard the sound of scribes dictating man so-and-so divorces so-and-so from the place such and such; and said: This is my name and that is the name of my wife, unfit to divorce with it,
llm_translation: Any get that was written not for the sake of a woman, is invalid. How so? If one was passing through the marketplace and heard the voice of scribes proclaiming, "So-and-so is divorcing so-and-so from such-and-such place," and he said, "This is my name and this is the name of my wife," it is invalid to divorce with it.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר מִיכֵּן – כָּתַב לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִמְלַךְ, מְצָאוֹ בֶּן עִירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: שְׁמִי כְּשִׁמְךָ וְשֵׁם אִשְׁתִּי כְּשֵׁם אִשְׁתְּךָ; פָּסוּל לְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Moreover, wrote to divorce his wife but reconsidered, a resident of his town found him and said to him: My name is as your name, and my wife’s name is as your wife’s name, unfit to divorce with it.
llm_translation: "More than this - he wrote to divorce his wife and he became king, his son found him in his city and said to him: 'My name is like your name, and the name of my wife is like the name of your wife'; he is disqualified to divorce with him."

hebrew_text: יָתֵר מִיכֵּן – הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים וּשְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן שָׁווֹת, כָּתַב לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה – לֹא יְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה.
human_translation: Moreover, one had two wives and their names were identical, wrote to divorce the older he may not divorce the younger with it.
llm_translation: "More than this - he had two women and their names were equal, he wrote to divorce the older - he shall not divorce the younger in it."

hebrew_text: יָתֵר מִיכֵּן – אָמַר לְלַבְלָר: ״כְּתוֹב, לְאֵיזוֹ שֶׁאֶרְצֶה אֲגָרֵשׁ״ – פָּסוּל לְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Moreover, he said to the scribe: Write for whichever that I will want I will divorce unfit to divorce with it.
llm_translation: "More than this - he said to Lablar: 'It is written, 'To which land shall I drive out?'' - invalid to drive out with it."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כָּתַב לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִמְלַךְ וְכוּ׳: וְאֶלָּא רֵישָׁא בְּמַאי?
human_translation: wrote to divorce his wife but reconsidered, But with what first clause
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Gemar wrote to divorce his wife and he became sick, etc." And rather the beginning, with what? (

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּסוֹפְרִין הָעֲשׂוּיִין לְהִתְלַמֵּד עָסְקִינַן. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי ״סוֹפְרִין מַקְרִין״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״סוֹפְרִין קוֹרְאִין״; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: We are dealing with scribes who are practicing Rav Ashi said: is also precise, as it teaches: Scribes dictating, and it does not teach: Scribes reading learn from
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: In the scribes who are fit to study we are engaged. Rav Ashe said: It is specifically stated, "scribes read," and it is not stated, "scribes recite"; infer from it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״יָתֵר מִיכֵּן״? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לֹא זֶה – שֶׁנִּכְתַּב שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם גֵּירוּשִׁין; אֶלָּא אַף זֶה – שֶׁנִּכְתַּב לְשׁוּם גֵּירוּשִׁין, פָּסוּל.
human_translation: What Moreover? The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught not this which was not written for the sake of divorce, but even that which was written for the sake of divorce unfit
llm_translation: What is "more than this"? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Not this - that was written not for the sake of divorce; rather even this - that was written for the sake of divorce, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא זֶה – שֶׁנִּכְתַּב שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם גֵּירוּשִׁין דִּידֵיהּ; אֶלָּא אַף זֶה – שֶׁנִּכְתַּב לְשׁוּם גֵּירוּשִׁין דִּידֵיהּ, פָּסוּל. וְלֹא זֶה – שֶׁלֹּא נִכְתַּב לְשׁוּם גֵּירוּשִׁין הָא; אֶלָּא אַף זֶה – שֶׁנִּכְתַּב לְשׁוּם גֵּירוּשִׁין הָא, פָּסוּל.
human_translation: And not this which was not written for the sake of his own divorce, but even that which was written for the sake of his own divorce, unfit And not this which was not written for the sake of this divorce, but even that which was written for this divorce, unfit
llm_translation: "And not this - that was written not for the sake of its own divorce; rather even this - that was written for the sake of its own divorce, it is invalid. And not this - that was not written for the sake of its own divorce; rather even this - that was written for the sake of its own divorce, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי כְּתַב ״וְנָתַן סֵפֶר כְּרִיתוּת בְּיָדָהּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְמַעוֹטֵי הַאיְךְ קַמָּא, דְּלָא עֲבִיד לְשׁוּם כְּרִיתוּת; אֲבָל כָּתַב לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִמְלַךְ, דַּעֲבִיד לְשׁוּם כְּרִיתוּת – אֵימָא כָּשֵׁר; כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְכָתַב״.
human_translation: What is the reason If written And he gives a scroll of severance in her hand, I would say to exclude this first where it was done not for the sake of severance, however, wrote to divorce his wife but reconsidered, where done for the sake of severance, say valid the Merciful One writes “And he writes,”
llm_translation: What is the reason? If it had written "and he shall give a bill of divorce into her hand," I would have said to exclude cases where he did not actually perform a divorce; but if he wrote to divorce his wife and he became ill, which would result in a divorce - I would say it is valid; the Merciful One wrote: "and he shall write."

hebrew_text: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְכָתַב״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְמַעוֹטֵי הַאי, דְּלָא אִיהוּ קָא כָתֵיב לַהּ; אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, דְּאִיהוּ קָא כָתֵיב לַהּ – אֵימָא כָּשֵׁר; כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״לָהּ״ – לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: If the Merciful One written And he writes, I would say to exclude this where was not the one who wrote it; but has two wives that is writing it, say valid the Merciful One writes for her,” for the sake of
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "and he shall write," I would have said it is to exclude this case, for he himself is not writing it; but if he has two wives, for he himself is writing it for her - say it is valid; the Merciful One wrote "to her" - for her sake.

hebrew_text: וְסֵיפָא לְמָה לִי? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – דְּאֵין בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: And why do I the last clause This teaches us that there is no clarification,
llm_translation: And the latter part, why do I need it? This is teaching us that there is no free choice.

hebrew_text: כָּתַב לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה – לֹא יְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה: קְטַנָּה הוּא דְּלָא מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ בֵּיהּ, הָא גְּדוֹלָה – מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: wrote to divorce the older may not divorce the younger with it, It is the younger whom he is not able to divorce with it, but he is able to divorce the older with it,
llm_translation: He wrote to divorce the elder - he may not divorce the younger in it: It is the younger that he cannot divorce in it, but the elder - he can divorce in it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן הַדָּרִין בְּעִיר אַחַת – מוֹצִיאִין שְׁטַר חוֹב עַל אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Rava said: That is to say two Yosef ben Shimon, who live in one city, can present a promissory note others,
llm_translation: Rava said: This means, two Yosefs son of Shimon who reside in one city - they may produce a promissory note against others.
