hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, רֵישָׁא דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁמִי כְּשִׁמְךָ – פָּסוּל לְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ; שֵׁנִי הוּא דְּלָא מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ בֵּיהּ, הָא רִאשׁוֹן מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ בֵּיהּ?! וְהָא אָמְרִינַן: ״וְלֹא אַחֵר יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיא עֲלֵיהֶן שְׁטַר חוֹב״!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If that is so, the earlier clause that teaches My name is as your name, unfit to divorce with it, second is who is not able to divorce with it, but first is able to divorce with it But didn’t we say and another cannot present a promissory note to them,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Rather, from now on, the beginning of the Mishnah states: "My name is like your name" - invalid to divorce with it; the second one is that if he cannot divorce with it, can the first one divorce with it?! And we say: "And no one else can produce a promissory note against them"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר? בְּעֵדֵי מְסִירָה, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא;
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say in witnesses who observe the transmission And this Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: Rather what do you have to say? With regard to witnesses of removal, and Rabbi Elazar it is.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי – בְּעֵדֵי מְסִירָה, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא.
human_translation: Here too, in witnesses who observe the transmission And this Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Here it is stated - in the case of a divorce document, and Rabbi Elazar is the one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: כּוּלָּן פּוֹסְלִין בִּכְהוּנָּה, חוּץ מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אַף רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: Rav says: All disqualify into priesthood, except for the first And Shmuel says: Even first disqualifies
llm_translation: Rav said: All of them disqualify for the priesthood, except for the first. And Shmuel said: Even the first also disqualifies.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנוּ חֲכָמִים ״גֵּט פָּסוּל״ – פָּסוּל וּפוֹסֵל. ״חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה״ – פְּסוּלָה, וּפוֹסַלְתָּהּ מִן הָאַחִין.
human_translation: And Shmuel follows his reasoning, as Shmuel says: Any place where the Sages taught An invalid bill of divorce, invalid and disqualifies An invalid ḥalitza , invalid and disqualifies from the brothers.
llm_translation: And it was established according to the reasoning of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: "In any place where the sages changed the ruling to 'a flawed bill of divorce,' it is flawed and disqualifies. 'A flawed halitzah' - it is flawed, and you have disqualified it from the brothers."

hebrew_text: בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׂמֹאל וְלַיְלָה – פְּסוּלוֹת וּפוֹסְלוֹת,
human_translation: In the West, they say in the name of Rabbi Elazar: left or night, invalid, and disqualify
llm_translation: In the west they say in the name of Rabbi Elazar: "Left-handed and nighttime - disqualifying and disqualifying."

hebrew_text: קָטָן וְאַנְפִּילְיָא – פְּסוּלוֹת וְאֵין פּוֹסְלוֹת.
human_translation: a minor, or a soft shoe made of cloth [ anpileya ] invalid, and they do not disqualify
llm_translation: Minor and Anpiliya - disqualified and not disqualifying.

hebrew_text: זְעֵירִי אָמַר: כּוּלָּן אֵין פּוֹסְלִין, חוּץ מִן הָאַחֲרוֹן.
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: any does not disqualify except the final
llm_translation: Zeiri said: all of them do not disqualify, except for the last one.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כּוּלָּן אֵין פּוֹסְלִין, חוּץ מִן הָאַחֲרוֹן. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף אַחֲרוֹן נָמֵי אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: And similarly, Rav Asi says: any does not disqualify except the final But Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even the final does not disqualify as well,
llm_translation: And so said Rav Assi: all of them do not disqualify, except for the last one. And Rabbi Yochanan said: even the last one also does not disqualify.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ – לָקוֹחוֹת הֵן, וּמַחְזִירִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּיּוֹבֵל.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning. As Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Brothers who divided are purchasers and they must return to each other in the Jubilee
llm_translation: And it was established, Rabbi Yochanan according to his reasoning - as Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: The brothers who divided - they are considered as purchasers, and they return to each other in the Jubilee.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאֵין בְּרֵירָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵינַן ״לַהּ״– לִשְׁמָהּ; אֲבָל הָתָם, מֶכֶר – הוּא דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לִיהְדַּר בְּיוֹבֵל, אֲבָל יְרוּשָּׁה וּמַתָּנָה – לָא.
human_translation: And necessary as, if it were stated with regard to this with regard to this Rabbi Yoḥanan said that there is no clarification because we require for her” for her sake; but there, It is a sale that the Merciful One states that it will be returned in the Jubilee but an inheritance and a gift not
llm_translation: The need is; for if it was stated in this case, in this case Rabbi Yochanan is saying there is no free choice, because we require "for her" - for her sake; but there, a sale - that is what the Merciful One said should revert in the Jubilee year, but inheritance and gift - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שָׂדֶה, מִשּׁוּם דִּלְחוּמְרָא; אִי נָמֵי, כַּתְּחִילָּה; אֲבָל הָכָא – אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if he taught us a field, due to that as a stringency, Alternatively, as initially, but here, say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say "field," because of its stringency; if so, at the outset; but here - say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא מֵרַב יְהוּדָה: אָמַר לְלַבְלָר: ״כְּתוֹב לְאֵיזוֹ שֶׁתֵּצֵא בַּפֶּתַח תְּחִילָּה״, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: יָתֵר מִיכֵּן, אָמַר לְלַבְלָר ״כְּתוֹב לְאֵיזוֹ שֶׁאֶרְצֶה אֲגָרֵשׁ״ – פָּסוּל לְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ, אַלְמָא אֵין בְּרֵירָה!
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya asked of Rav Yehuda: said to a scribe: Write for whichever emerges the entrance first, what is said to him: You learned it Moreover, said to the scribe: Write for whichever that I will want I will divorce unfit to divorce with it. Apparently, there is no clarification.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rav Hoshaya asked a question of Rav Yehuda: He said to Lavlar, "It is written, 'To which she will go out the door first,' what is the ruling?" He said to him, "Teach it: From here on, he said to Lavlar, 'It is written, to which I desire to divorce,' - it is invalid to divorce with it, implying there is no choice!"

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, הָאוֹמֵר לְבָנָיו: ״הֲרֵינִי שׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל מִי שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה מִכֶּם רִאשׁוֹן לִירוּשָׁלַיִם״; כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנַס רִאשׁוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ – זָכָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ, וּמְזַכֶּה אֶת אֶחָיו עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: raised an objection to one who says to his children: I am slaughtering the Paschal offering on behalf of whichever of you goes up first to Jerusalem, once first has entered his head and the majority of his he has acquired his portion and acquires his brothers with him
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: One who says to his sons, "Behold, I will slaughter the Passover sacrifice for the one among you who will ascend first to Jerusalem," once the first one enters, his head and the majority of his body - he has acquired his portion, and he acquires for his brothers with him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרִי, מָה עִנְיַן פְּסָחִים אֵצֶל גִּיטִּין? הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּדֵי לְזָרְזָן בְּמִצְוֹת!
human_translation: said to him: Hoshaya, my son, what do Paschal offerings have to do with bills of divorce? Wasn’t it stated concerning this Rabbi Yoḥanan says: in order to galvanize them, in mitzvot.
llm_translation: He said to him: Hoshaya the son of Uri, what is the connection of Pesach to Gitin? It was said about him, Rabbi Yochanan said: In order to hasten them in the commandments!

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנַס רִאשׁוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ – זָכָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ, וּמְזַכֶּה אֶת אֶחָיו עִמּוֹ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּאַמְנִינְהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא – שַׁפִּיר; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּלָא אַמְנִינְהוּ, לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה מִי קָמִיתְמְנוּ?! וְהָתְנַן: נִמְנִין, וּמוֹשְׁכִין יְדֵיהֶן מִמֶּנּוּ, עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט!
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches: Once first has entered his head and the majority of his he has acquired his portion and acquires his brothers with him Granted, if you say that registered them initially, well But if you say that he did not register them can they be registered after the slaughter Didn’t we learn be registered and withdraw themselves from until it is slaughtered,
llm_translation: Accurately stated, as it was taught: Once the first one enters, his head and the majority of his body - he acquires his portion, and he acquires a portion for his brothers with him. If you say it is because we trust them from the outset - it is fine; but if you say we do not trust them, after the slaughter, who will establish it?! And we learned: They are counted, and they extend their hands from it until it is slaughtered!

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מַעֲשֶׂה, וְקָדְמוּ בָּנוֹת לַבָּנִים, וְנִמְצְאוּ בָּנוֹת זְרִיזוֹת וּבָנִים שְׁפָלִים.
human_translation: That is also taught an incident and the daughters preceded the sons. And the daughters were found enthusiastic, the sons lazy.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said: A case occurred, and the daughters preceded the sons, and it was found that the daughters were diligent and the sons were lazy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קָא בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים, וְקָא פָשֵׁיט לֵיהּ תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ, וַהֲדַר מוֹתֵיב לֵיהּ תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים!
human_translation: Abaye said: asks him makes dependent on the decision of others, but he resolves it makes dependent on his own decision. And then raised an objection to him one makes dependent on the decision of others.
llm_translation: Abaye said: He seeks to rely on the opinion of others, and he is then persuaded to rely on his own opinion, and then he again seeks to rely on the opinion of others!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא, דְּמַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה – לָא שְׁנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ וְלָא שְׁנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים, אִית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה, וּמַאן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה – לָא שְׁנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ וְלָא שְׁנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים, לֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה!
human_translation: Rava said: What is the difficulty Perhaps that one who accepts clarification, is no different makes it dependent on his own decision, and is no different makes it dependent on the decision of others. he accepts clarification. And one who does not accept clarification, is no different makes it dependent on his own decision, and is no different makes it dependent on the decision of others. he does not accept clarification.
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the question? Perhaps, one who has free will – it does not matter if he decides on his own or if he decides based on others, he has free will. And one who does not have free will – it does not matter if he decides on his own or if he decides based on others, he does not have free will!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לְרָבָא: וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ לֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה, וְתוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים אִית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה!
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said to Rava: But Rabbi Yehuda, where makes it dependent on his own decision, he does not accept clarification, but makes it dependent on the decision of others, he accepts clarification?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Mesharshaya to Rava: But Rabbi Yehuda, who relies on his own opinion, does not have free choice, and one who relies on the opinion of others does have free choice!

hebrew_text: תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ לֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה – דְּתַנְיָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ יַיִן מִבֵּין הַכּוּתִים, אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי לוּגִּין שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לְהַפְרִישׁ – הֲרֵי הֵן תְּרוּמָה; עֲשָׂרָה מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן; תִּשְׁעָה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי;
human_translation: makes it dependent on his own decision, does not accept clarification, as it is taught one who purchases wine from among the Samaritans, says: Two log that I will separate in the future are teruma , ten first tithe; nine second tithe.
llm_translation: He who suspends the wine in his own knowledge, does not have choice - as it was taught: One who takes wine from among the Kutim, he says: "Two logim that I am destined to separate - behold they are terumah; ten ma'aser rishon; nine ma'aser sheni."

hebrew_text: וּמֵיחֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה מִיָּד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: And he deconsecrates and drink immediately, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: And one may wait and drink immediately, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit.

hebrew_text: תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים אִית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה – דִּתְנַן: מָה הִיא בְּאוֹתָן הַיָּמִים?
human_translation: makes dependent on the decision of others, accepts clarification, as we learned What in those days
llm_translation: Hanging on the knowledge of others, he has free choice - as we learned: What is the law regarding in those days?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְכׇל דְּבָרֶיהָ, וּלְכִי מָיֵית הָוֵי גִּיטָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: She is like a married woman with regard to all of her matters, and when he will die, it is a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Behold, she is like a married woman in all her matters, and if you die, she shall be divorced."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לְרָבָא: הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּתוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ לֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה, וְתוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים אִית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה!
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said to Rava: But Rabbi Shimon, where makes dependent on his own decision, does not accept clarification, but makes it dependent on the decision of others, he accepts clarification?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Mesharshaya to Rava: "This is Rabbi Shimon, who relies on his own opinion does not have free choice, and one who relies on the opinion of others does have free choice!"

hebrew_text: תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ לֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים אִית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה – דְּתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵינִי בּוֹעֲלִיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה אַבָּא״; אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא רָצָה הָאָב – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: רָצָה הָאָב – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת,
human_translation: makes dependent on his own decision, does not accept clarification. that which we said one makes dependent on the decision of others, accepts clarification, as it is taught I am engaging in sexual intercourse with you on the condition that father will desire even if the father did not desire she is betrothed Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: the father desires she is betrothed,
llm_translation: Hanging by his own knowledge, does not have free choice - this that we said. Hanging by the knowledge of others, has free choice - as it was taught: "Behold, I am betrothing you to me on the condition that my father will consent." Even though the father did not consent - she is betrothed. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: If the father consented - she is betrothed.

hebrew_text: לֹא רָצָה הָאָב – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: the father does not desire she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: The father does not desire - she is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּין לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֵּין לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן; לָא שְׁנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ וְלָא שְׁנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים – אִית לְהוּ בְּרֵירָה;
human_translation: said to Whether to Rabbi Yehuda whether to Rabbi Shimon, is no different makes dependent on his own decision, and it is no different makes it dependent on the decision of others; they accept clarification.
llm_translation: He said to him: Whether for Rabbi Yehuda or for Rabbi Shimon; it makes no difference if one relies on his own knowledge or if one relies on the knowledge of others - there is free choice.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם – כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁמָּא יִבָּקַע הַנּוֹד, וְנִמְצָא זֶה שׁוֹתֶה טְבָלִים לְמַפְרֵעַ? אָמַר לָהֶם: לִכְשֶׁיִּבָּקַע.
human_translation: And there, reason as teaches: said to Rabbi Meir: Don’t you concede perhaps the wineskin will burst and this will have been found retroactively drinking untithed produce? said to them: When it bursts,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And there - as it was taught in the reasoning, they said to Rabbi Meir: If you admit that perhaps the vessel will break, and this one will be found drinking untithed produce? He said to them: When it breaks."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכּוֹתֵב טוֹפְסֵי גִּיטִּין, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּנִּיחַ מְקוֹם הָאִישׁ, וּמְקוֹם הָאִשָּׁה, וּמְקוֹם הַזְּמַן.
human_translation: who writes the standard [ tofes ] of bills of divorce he must leave place of the man, and place of the woman, and place for the date.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who writes a bill of divorce must leave space for the man's name, the woman's name, and the time of the divorce.

hebrew_text: שְׁטָרֵי מִלְוָה – צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּנִּיחַ מְקוֹם הַמִּלְוָה, מְקוֹם הַלֹּוֶה, מְקוֹם הַמָּעוֹת, מְקוֹם הַזְּמַן.
human_translation: loan documents, he must leave place of the lender, place of the borrower, place of the money place of the date.
llm_translation: Document of loan - needs that he should place the place of the loan, the place of the borrower, the place of the money, the place of the time.

hebrew_text: שְׁטָרֵי מִקָּח – צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּנִּיחַ מְקוֹם הַלּוֹקֵחַ, וּמְקוֹם הַמּוֹכֵר, מָקוֹם הַמָּעוֹת, מְקוֹם הַשָּׂדֶה, וּמְקוֹם הַזְּמַן; מִפְּנֵי הַתַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: documents of sale he must leave place of the purchaser, and place of the seller, place of the money place of the field and place of the date due to the ordinance,
llm_translation: Contracts of sale - one must place the location of the buyer, and the location of the seller, the place of the money, the place of the field, and the place of the time; because of the enactment.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹסֵל בְּכוּלָּן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַכְשִׁיר בְּכוּלָּן חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ – לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda invalidates all of Rabbi Elazar deems all of them valid except for bills of divorce, as it is stated “And he writes for her” for her sake.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda disqualifies all of them. Rabbi Elazar validates all of them except for women's bills of divorce, as it is stated, "and he shall write for her" - for her sake.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּנִּיחַ אַף מְקוֹם ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מוּתֶּרֶת לְכׇל אָדָם״; וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי, וּבָעֵינַן כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: must also leave place of: You are hereby permitted to any man. And is Rabbi Elazar, who says: Witnesses of the transmission effect and we require writing for her sake.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One must also leave space for "Behold, you are permitted to every man"; and Rabbi Elazar said: Witnesses of divorce I have cut off, and we require a written document for its sake.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא;
human_translation: And necessary
llm_translation: And it is necessary.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהַהִיא הוּא דְּאִיכָּא לְאוֹקֹמַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּקָתָנֵי ״אֵין כּוֹתְבִין״ וְקָתָנֵי ״כִּתְבוּ״;
human_translation: As, if taught us this first it is that that can be interpreted in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as that teaches: One may not write and it teaches one wrote it
llm_translation: If we were to hear that case before us, in that situation where there is no one to establish it like Rabbi Elazar, for it is taught "do not write" and it is taught "write";

hebrew_text: אֲבָל סֵיפָא, דְּקָתָנֵי ״שֶׁאֵין קִיּוּם הַגֵּט אֶלָּא בְּחוֹתְמָיו״, אֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: However, the latter clause which teaches the ratification of a bill of divorce is only through its signatories, say this is Rabbi Meir, who said: Signatory witnesses effect
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But the latter clause, which teaches "the validity of a bill of divorce depends only on its signatures," let us say it is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, for he said: "Witnesses of the signature are like the ones who cut the document."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהַהִיא, הָהִיא נָמֵי אִיכָּא לְאוֹקֹמַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר; אֲבָל הָא, אֵימָא מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הָוֵי – רֵישָׁא לָאו רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us with regard to that That can also be interpreted in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, but this say: Since the last clause is Rabbi Elazar, the first clause not Rabbi Elazar. necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear about that, that one is like Rabbi Elazar; but this one, let us say from the end, Rabbi Elazar is not at the beginning; necessary.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי הַתַּקָּנָה: מַאי תַּקָּנָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת סוֹפֵר; וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי; וּבְדִין הוּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ טוֹפֶס נָמֵי לָא לִכְתּוֹב, וּמִשּׁוּם תַּקָּנַת סוֹפְרִים שָׁרוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: due to the ordinance. what ordinance Rabbi Yonatan says: Due to the ordinance of a scribe, And it is Rabbi Elazar, who says: Witnesses of the transmission effect And by right it that would not write even standard but due to the ordinance of scribes, the Sages permitted
llm_translation: Because of the enactment: What is the enactment? Rabbi Yonatan said: Because of the enactment of the scribe; and Rabbi Elazar it is, for he said: I have cut off the testimony of delivery; and it is in a case where even a document is not written, and due to the enactment of the scribes the Rabbis permitted it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹסֵל בְּכוּלָּן – גָּזַר טוֹפֶס אַטּוּ תּוֹרֶף, גָּזַר שְׁטָרוֹת אַטּוּ גִּיטִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda invalidates all of decreed standard due to essential [ toref ] he decreed documents, due to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah disqualifies all of them - he decreed a document, yet a torn one is invalid; he decreed bills of divorce, yet a torn one is valid.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַכְשִׁיר בְּכוּלָּן חוּץ מִגִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים – טוֹפֶס אַטּוּ תּוֹרֶף גָּזַר, שְׁטָרוֹת אַטּוּ גִּיטִּין לָא גָּזַר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar deems all of them valid except for bills of divorce. decreed standard due to essential he did not decree documents, due to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar permits all of them except for women's bills of divorce - he decreed a document that is torn invalid, but bills of divorce he did not decree invalid.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״: וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיב ״לָהּ״ – אַתּוֹרֶף הוּא דִּכְתִיב!
human_translation: as it is stated “And he writes for her” But when it is written: for her,” about essential that it is written,
llm_translation: As it is stated: "and he shall write for her." But is it not written "to her"? - This is a refutation of what is written!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ – לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, say because it is stated “And he writes for her,” for her sake.
llm_translation: Rather say: Because it is stated "and he shall write for her" - for her sake.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אַדְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר! תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: difficult, of Rabbi Elazar and of Rabbi Elazar two tanna’im , and with regard to of Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Elazar! Two Mishnaic teachings and the opinion of Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שַׁבְּתַי אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: מִשּׁוּם קְטָטָה; וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי,
human_translation: Rabbi Shabbetai Ḥizkiyya says: due to a quarrel, and it is Rabbi Meir, who says: Signatory witnesses effect
llm_translation: Rabbi Shabbetai said: Hezekiah: because of a stain; and Rabbi Meir it is, as he said: witnesses of sealing I have cut.

hebrew_text: וּבְדִין הוּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ תּוֹרֶף נָמֵי לִכְתּוֹב; וְזִמְנִין דְּשָׁמְעָה לֵיהּ לְסוֹפֵר דְּקָא כָתֵיב, וְסָבְרָה אִיהוּ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, וְהָוֵה לַהּ קְטָטָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: And by right it that to write even essential as well. But sometimes who hears the scribe who is writing and she thinks that told him and she will have a quarrel with him.
llm_translation: And in judgment it is that even if the ox gores a deaf person, it is written; and at times when he hears the scribe who is writing, and he thinks that he is saying to him, and there is a dispute between them.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּנַת עֲגוּנוֹת; אָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Avimi due to a remedy for deserted wives. Some say Rabbi Meir, and some say Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Avimi: Due to the enactment of roofs; they said to him Rabbi Meir, and they said to him Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר – דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי, וּבְדִין הוּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ תּוֹרֶף נָמֵי לִכְתּוֹב; וְזִמְנִין דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ קְטָטָה בַּהֲדַהּ, וְרָתַח עֲלַהּ וְזָרֵיק לֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ, וּמְעַגֵּן וּמוֹתֵיב לַהּ.
human_translation: Some say Rabbi Meir, who said: Signatory witnesses effect and by right it that to write, even essential as well. But sometimes when has a quarrel with and becomes angry with her, and he throw to her and desert and leave her
llm_translation: They said to him, Rabbi Meir - for he said: Witnesses of a signature I have cut, and in a case where even the Torah itself would be torn to write; and at times when there is a dispute between them, and he becomes angry and throws it away, and he protects and establishes it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – דְּאָמַר: עֵידֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי, וּבְדִין הוּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ טוֹפֶס נָמֵי לָא לִכְתּוֹב; וְזִמְנִין דְּבָעֵי לְמֵיזַל לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְלָא אַשְׁכַּח סָפְרָא, וְשָׁבֵיק לַהּ וְאָזֵיל, וּמְעַגֵּן וּמוֹתֵיב לַהּ.
human_translation: Some say Rabbi Elazar, who said: Witnesses of the transmission effect and by right it that not to write even standard as well, But sometimes needs to travel to a country overseas, and he will not find a scribe and he will abandon her and go and desert and leave her
llm_translation: They said to him, Rabbi Elazar - for he said: Witnesses of removal I have cut, and in a case where even a document is not written; and there are times when one wants to go to the country of the sea and does not find a book, so he leaves it and goes, and he protects and establishes it.

hebrew_text: וּמְקוֹם הַזְּמַן: קָפָסֵיק וְתָנֵי; לָא שְׁנָא מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין, וְלָא שְׁנָא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין.
human_translation: and a place for the date. categorically teaches is no different from the marriage, and it is no different from the betrothal.
llm_translation: Place of the designated time: Capsaic and he taught; not different from the betrothed, and not different from the betrothed.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין; בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם בַּת אֲחוֹתוֹ – אִיכָּא, בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם פֵּירֵי – אִיכָּא;
human_translation: Granted, from the marriage, Whether according to the one who said due to the daughter of his sister, there is whether according to the one who said due to produce, there is
llm_translation: In peace from the Nisuin; whether according to the one who says because of his sister - there is, whether according to the one who says because of produce - there is.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין; בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם בַּת אֲחוֹתוֹ – אִיכָּא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם פֵּירֵי, אֲרוּסָה מִי אִית לַהּ פֵּירֵי?!
human_translation: But from the betrothal, granted, according to the one who said due to the daughter of his sister, there is But according to the one who said due to produce, does a betrothed woman have produce?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, from the betrothed; Granted, according to the one who said it is because of his sister – there is a basis, but according to the one who said it is because of the fruits, does a betrothed woman have fruits?! English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: הָא מִילְּתָא שְׁמַעִית מִינֵּיהּ דְּעוּלָּא דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּנַת וָלָד, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי נִיהוּ. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁמְעִיתַהּ לְהָא דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לַאֲרוּסָתִי, לִכְשֶׁאֶכְנְסֶנָּה אֲגָרְשֶׁנָּה״, אֵינוֹ גֵּט. וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: מָה טַעַם? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ: גִּיטָּהּ קוֹדֵם לִבְנָהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ: גִּיטָּהּ קוֹדֵם לִבְנָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Amram said: I heard this matter from Ulla, who said for the benefit of child, and I did not know what this is. Once I heard that which is taught one who says: Write a bill of divorce for my betrothed, as when I will bring her in I will divorce her it is not a bill of divorce. And Ulla said: What reason decree lest they say her bill of divorce precedes her son, Here too, decree lest they say her bill of divorce precedes her son.
llm_translation: Rav Amram said: This matter I heard from the heretics who say in the name of Takanat V'lad, and I do not know what it is. Once you have heard this that is taught: One who says, "Write a bill of divorce for my betrothed, so that when I marry her, I will divorce her," it is not a valid bill of divorce. And Ula said: What is the reason? It is a decree lest people say, "Her divorce preceded her marriage." Here too, it is a decree lest people say, "Her divorce preceded her marriage."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר שֵׁילָא, אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא סָבָא, אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. קָרֵי רַב עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: טוּבְיָנָא דְּחַכִּימֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rabbi Abba bar Sheila says Rav Hamnuna Sava says Rav Adda bar Ahava says Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Elazar Rav proclaimed about Rabbi Elazar: the most gratified of Sages,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi Abba bar Sheilah said, Rav Hamnuna the Elder said, Rav Adda bar Ahava said, Rav said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer. Rav would call him: "The wise scholar of the sages."

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת נָמֵי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הַאי אַשַּׁרְתָּא דְּדַיָּינֵי, דְּמִיכַּתְבָה מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיסָהֲדֵי סָהֲדִי אַחֲתִימַת יְדַיְיהוּ – פְּסוּלָה; אַלְמָא מִיחְזֵי כְּשִׁיקְרָא, הָכָא נָמֵי מִיחְזֵי כְּשִׁיקְרָא!
human_translation: And even with regard to other documents as well, But didn’t Rav Pappi say in the name of Rava: this ratification of judges, that was written before the witnesses had testified about their signatures invalid, Apparently appearance of falsehood, Here too, appearance of a falsehood.
llm_translation: And even in other documents, is it not so?! And Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: This promissory note of the judges, if it was written before they had completed their testimony – it is invalid; which means it appears as a lie, here too it appears as a lie!

hebrew_text: וְלֵיתַהּ, מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן – דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֲפִילּוּ מְצָאוֹ בְּאַשְׁפָּה, חֲתָמוֹ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – כָּשֵׁר. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן לָא פְּלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אֶלָּא בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים, דְּבָעֵינַן כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ, אֲבָל בִּשְׁאָר שְׁטָרוֹת – לָא.
human_translation: And is not because of Rav Naḥman. As Rav Naḥman said: Rabbi Meir, would say: Even found in the garbage, he had it signed and gave it to valid, And even the Rabbis disagree with of Rabbi Meir only with regard to bills of divorce, that we require writing for her sake; but with regard to other documents, not
llm_translation: And there is no disagreement from Rav Nachman - for Rav Nachman said, Rabbi Meir used to say: Even if one finds it in the garbage, if he seals it and gives it to her, it is valid. And even the Rabbis do not argue with Rabbi Meir except in the case of women's bills of divorce, where we require the writing to be for her sake, but in other documents - no.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁטָר שֶׁלָּוָה בּוֹ וּפְרָעוֹ – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וְלֹוֶה בּוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר נִמְחַל שִׁעְבּוּדוֹ. טַעְמָא דְּנִמְחַל שִׁעְבּוּדוֹ, אֲבָל מִשּׁוּם שִׁיקְרָא – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: that Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: note with which one borrowed and repaid he may not borrow money again with it. that its lien has already been forgiven. The reason that its lien has been forgiven, But as appearance of falsehood, we are not concerned.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: A loan document in which the borrower has paid off the debt - he cannot return and borrow with it, as his obligation has already been forgiven. The reason for the forgiveness of his obligation, but due to falsehood - we are not concerned. English translation: Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: A loan document in which the borrower has paid off the debt - he cannot return and borrow with it, as his obligation has already been forgiven. The reason for the forgiveness of his obligation, but due to falsehood - we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט וְאָבַד הֵימֶנּוּ; מְצָאוֹ לְאַלְתַּר – כָּשֵׁר, וְאִם לָאו – פָּסוּל. מְצָאוֹ בַּחֲפִיסָה אוֹ בִּדְלוֹסְקָמָא, אִם מַכִּירוֹ – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: who brings a bill of divorce and it lost from him, finds it immediately valid. But if not, invalid, he found it in a ḥafisa or in a deluskema if he recognizes valid.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who brings a bill of divorce and it gets lost; if he finds it immediately - it is valid, but if not - it is invalid. If he finds it in a bundle or in a purse, if he recognizes it - it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: מָצָא גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים, דְּיָיתֵיקֵי, מַתָּנוֹת וְשׁוֹבָרִין, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יַחֲזִיר – שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר כְּתוּבִין הָיוּ, וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן שֶׁלֹּא לִיתְּנָן. הָא אָמַר ״תְּנו״ּ – נוֹתְנִין; וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction one found bills of divorce, or of manumission, wills [ dayetikei ], gifts, or receipts, this should not return as I say they were written and reconsidered about them that he would not give them. But said: Give one gives and even a long time
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a dilemma: If one found bills of divorce of women and manumission documents of slaves, that they are verified, gifts and deeds, behold, he shall not return them - for I say, they were written, and authority was given over them not to return them. But didn't he say "give" - we give; and even to appoint a majority!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשַּׁיָּירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת, כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין הַשַּׁיָּירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba said: not difficult. Here, with regard to a place where caravans are found, There, with regard to a place where caravans are not found,
llm_translation: Rabba said, it is not difficult: here in a place where the alleys are common, here in a place where the alleys are not common.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשַּׁיָּירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת – וְהוּא שֶׁהוּחְזְקוּ שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן בְּעִיר אַחַת.
human_translation: And even in a place where caravans are found, but is where it has been established two Yosef ben Shimon, in one town.
llm_translation: And even in a place where the remnants are found - and this is when it was established that two Yosefs, sons of Shimon, are in one city.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּה אַדְּרַבָּה: דְּהָהוּא גִּיטָּא דְּאִישְׁתְּכַח בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, וַהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״בִּשְׁוִירֵי מָתָא דְּעַל רָכִיס נַהֲרָא״, וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לִשְׁנֵי שְׁוִירֵי;
human_translation: As, if you do not say so, difficulty of Rabba and of Rabba. As a certain bill of divorce that was found, the court of Rav Huna, and was written in it In Sheviri the city, which is on the Rakhis River. And Rav Huna said: One is concerned about two Sheviri,
llm_translation: If you do not say so, the difficulty of Rabba to Rabbah is this: The bill of divorce of a woman was found in the court of Rav Huna, and it was written on it, "In the barley fields of the city on the bank of the river." And Rav Huna said: We are concerned about two barley fields.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּה: פּוֹק וְעַיֵּין בָּהּ, דִּלְאוּרְתָּא בָּעֵי לַהּ מִינָּךְ רַב הוּנָא. נְפַק, דַּק וְאַשְׁכַּח – דִּתְנַן: כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין – הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said to Rabba, Go out and examine this as Rav Huna ask you about it at night. went out, examined and discovered As we learned One should return all court enactments,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said to Rabba: Go out and investigate, for perhaps Rav Huna requires it. He went out, investigated, and found – as we learned: Any action of the court – this one shall return.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּכִמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשַּׁיָּירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת דָּמֵי, וְקָא פָּשֵׁיט יַחְזִיר; אַלְמָא, אִי הוּחְזְקוּ שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן בְּעִיר אַחַת – אִין, וְאִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: But isn’t the court of Rav Huna comparable to a place where caravans are found, And resolved one should return Apparently if it is established two Yosef ben Shimon in one town, yes, but if not, no
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And this is the case in the court of Rav Huna, that in a place where the oxen are commonly found, the defendant is liable, and he must return the stolen item; hence, if it is not established that there are two Joseph sons of Shimon in one city - the defendant is not liable, and if it is established - he is not liable."

hebrew_text: עֲבַד רַבָּה עוֹבָדָא בְּהָהוּא גִּיטָּא, דְּאִישְׁתְּכַח בֵּי כִיתָּנָא בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, כִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי בְּדוּכְתָּא הֵיכָא דְּתָרוּ כִּיתָּנָא, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּהוּחְזְקוּ – דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָן שְׁיָירָתָא; וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי בְּדוּכְתָּא דִּמְזַבְּנִי כִּיתָּנָא, וְהוּא שֶׁלֹּא הוּחְזְקוּ, וּשְׁכִיחָן שַׁיָּירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba performed an action, with regard to a certain bill of divorce that was found in the flax house in Pumbedita, in accordance with his halakha . there are who say in the place where soaked flax, and although it was established where caravans are not found. And there are who say in a place where sold flax, and it was not established and caravans are found.
llm_translation: Rabba performed a certain task with that document, and he found it in the house of a tailor in the market. Some say: In a place where they are accustomed to place documents, even though they are not found, they are presumed to be left there; and some say: In a place where they are not accustomed to place documents, and it was not found, they are presumed to have been lost.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא רָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין אַבָּרַיְיתָא, וּמְשַׁנֵּי. תְּנַן: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט וְאָבַד הֵימֶנּוּ, אִם מְצָאוֹ לְאַלְתַּר – כָּשֵׁר, וְאִם לָאו – פָּסוּל. וּרְמִינְהוּ: מָצָא גֵּט אִשָּׁה בַּשּׁוּק, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – יַחְזִיר לְאִשָּׁה, אֵין הַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה. הָא
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a contradiction the mishna and a baraita and answers We learned who brings a bill of divorce and it lost from him, if he finds it immediately valid. And if not, invalid. And raises a contradiction found a woman’s bill of divorce in the marketplace, when the husband admits return to the woman. the husband does not admit not return not to this and not to this But
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a contradiction between two Baraitot and reconciles them. We learned: One who brings a bill of divorce and it gets lost, if it is found immediately - it is valid, and if not - it is invalid. And we asked: If a bill of divorce is found in the marketplace, at a time when the husband admits - he should return it to his wife, if the husband does not admit - he should not return it to either this one or that one. This is the question.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה מִיהַת – יַחְזִיר לָאִשָּׁה, וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה! וּמְשַׁנֵּי: כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשַּׁיָּירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת, כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין הַשַּׁיָּירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת.
human_translation: when the husband admits in any event return to the woman, and even if a long time And answers: Here, with regard to a place where caravans are found; there, with regard to a place where caravans are not found.
llm_translation: In a time when the husband admits from himself - he shall return to the woman, even to a greater extent! And it was taught: Here in a place where the bridal chambers are found, here in a place where the bridal chambers are not found.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי וְהוּא שֶׁהוּחְזְקוּ הוּא דְּלָא לַיהְדַּר, וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַבָּה; וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הוּחְזְקוּ לָא לַיהְדַּר, וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבָּה.
human_translation: There are who say And this is when it is established that that it should not be returned, and this is of Rabba. And there are who say: even though it is not established it should not be returned, and disagrees with of Rabba.
llm_translation: There is one who says that if they were established, he should not dwell, and that is Rabah; and there is one who says that even though they were not established, he should not dwell, and this is a dispute of Rabah.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּרַבָּה לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, מַתְנִיתִין אַלִּימָא לֵיהּ לְאַקְשׁוֹיֵי; אֶלָּא רַבִּי זֵירָא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבָּה?
human_translation: Granted that Rabba did not say like Rabbi Zeira he a stronger to raise a difficulty the mishna But what is the reason Rabbi Zeira did not say like Rabba
llm_translation: In the case of Rabba, he did not say like Rabbi Zeira, the Mishnah should be given to him to resolve; rather Rabbi Zeira, what is the reason he did not say like Rabba?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ, מִי קָתָנֵי: אִם אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – נוֹתְנִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה? דִּלְמָא אִם אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ נוֹתְנִין כִּדְקַיְימָא לַן – לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: said to you: Does teach if he said: Give one gives and even a long time Perhaps If he said: Give one gives as we maintain immediately,
llm_translation: He said to you, who is the one who teaches: if he said "give" - we give, even to a majority? Perhaps if he said "give" we give as we established for ourselves - immediately.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר, כְּגוֹן דְּקָאָמְרִי עֵדִים: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא חָתַמְנוּ אֶלָּא עַל גֵּט אֶחָד שֶׁל יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: where witnesses say: We have never signed a bill of divorce of Yosef ben Shimon other than one,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said, as they say witnesses: "We have never signed except on one bill of divorce of Yosef ben Shimon."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אִיתְרְמִי שְׁמָא כִּשְׁמָא וְעֵדִים כְּעֵדִים קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If that is so, what of stating lest you say one should be concerned perhaps it happened the names are identical to the names and witnesses are identical to witnesses teaches us
llm_translation: If so, what is there to say? Perhaps one might be concerned that maybe the name of Shema is like Shema and witnesses are like witnesses, and it is heard by us.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, כְּגוֹן דְּקָאָמַר: נֶקֶב יֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּצַד אוֹת פְּלוֹנִית, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ סִימָן מוּבְהָק. וְדַוְקָא בְּצַד אוֹת פְּלוֹנִית, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ סִימָן מוּבְהָק, אֲבָל: נֶקֶב בְּעָלְמָא, לָא;
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: where says: There is a hole in next to such and such a letter, as this is a clear-cut distinguishing mark for him. And specifically next to such and such a letter, as that is a clear-cut distinguishing mark for him. But only a hole not
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, for example, as he said: There is a hole in it on the side of a certain letter, which serves as a clear sign for it. And specifically on the side of a certain letter, which serves as a clear sign for it, but a hole in general, no.

hebrew_text: מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ סִימָנִין אִי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אִי דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: is uncertain whether distinguishing marks by Torah law if by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: It is in doubt to him signs either of biblical or rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אִירְכַס לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, אֲמַר: אִי סִימָנָא – אִית לִי בְּגַוֵּיהּ, אִי טְבִיעוּת – עֵינָא אִית לִי בְּגַוֵּיהּ. אַהְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר: לָא יָדַעְנָא אִי מִשּׁוּם סִימָנָא אַהְדְּרוּהּ – וְקָסָבְרִי סִימָנִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אִי מִשּׁוּם טְבִיעוּת עֵינָא – וְדַוְקָא צוּרְבָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל אִינָשׁ בְּעָלְמָא לָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana lost the bill of divorce in the study hall. He said: If a distinguishing mark, I have for it. If visual recognition, I have for it. They returned to him. He said I do not know if they returned it due to the distinguishing mark and they hold that distinguishing marks by Torah law, if it was due to visual recognition, and specifically Torah scholars [ tzurva miderabbanan ] but an ordinary man not
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana hosted a wedding feast in the study hall. He said: If it is a sign - I have it in her, if it is modesty - I have it in her. He reconsidered. He said: We do not know whether because of a sign we reconsider - and you may think that signs are from the Torah, or because of modesty we reconsider - and specifically the modesty of the Sages, but an ordinary person, no.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו – פָּסוּל: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְאַלְתַּר? רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: שֶׁשָּׁהָה כְּדֵי שֶׁתַּעֲבוֹר שְׁיָירָא וְתִשְׁרֶה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא אָדָם עוֹמֵד וְרוֹאֶה שֶׁלֹּא עָבַר שָׁם אָדָם. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: שֶׁלֹּא שָׁהָה אָדָם שָׁם. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִכְתּוֹב אֶת הַגֵּט. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִקְרוֹתוֹ. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: כְּדֵי לְכוֹתְבוֹ וְלִקְרוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: but if not, invalid. The Sages taught: What is not immediately? Rabbi Natan says: when a delay equivalent for a caravan to pass and camp Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: as there will be a person stands and sees that no person passed there. And some say as no person stopped there. Rabbi says: equivalent to write the bill of divorce. Rabbi Yitzḥak says: equivalent to read it. Others say: equivalent to write it and to read it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if not - invalid. The Rabbis taught: What is considered not immediate? Rabbi Nathan says: That he delayed in order for the leftover to pass and settle. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: In order for a person to stand and see that no one passed there. And some say: That a person did not delay there. Rabbi says: In order to write the bill of divorce. Rabbi Yitzchak says: In order to read it. Others say: In order to write it and read it.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ שָׁהָה, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ סִימָנִין – מְעִידִים עָלָיו; דְּאָמְרִי: נֶקֶב יֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּצַד אוֹת פְּלוֹנִית. וְאֵין מְעִידִין עַל סִימָנֵי הַגּוּף; דְּאָמְרִי: אָרוֹךְ וְגוּץ.
human_translation: And even a delay and has distinguishing marks on it, attest to it when they say: It has a hole next to such and such a letter. And one may not testify with regard to distinguishing marks of the itself, where they say: long or short,
llm_translation: Even if he delayed, and it has distinguishing marks - they testify about him; for they say: "There is a hole in it on the side of a certain letter." And they do not testify about bodily marks; for they say: "Tall and strong."

hebrew_text: מְצָאוֹ קָשׁוּר בְּכִיס, בְּאַרְנָקִי וּבְטַבַּעַת,
human_translation: tied in a pouch in a purse [ arnaki ], or in a ring,
llm_translation: He found it tied in a pocket, in a purse, and in a ring.

hebrew_text: אוֹ שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ בֵּין כֵּלָיו; אֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: or where he found it among his utensils even a long time valid.
llm_translation: Or that he found it between his kidneys; even to appoint a majority - it is valid.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, הֲלָכָה: שֶׁלֹּא שָׁהָה אָדָם שָׁם. רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל, הֲלָכָה: שֶׁלֹּא עָבַר אָדָם שָׁם.
human_translation: It was stated Rav Yehuda Shmuel says: halakha as no person stopped there. Rabba bar bar Ḥana Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel says: halakha as no person passed there.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, the halakha is: a person did not dwell there. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel said, the halakha is: a person did not pass through there.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מָר הֲלָכָה כְּמָר, וּמָר הֲלָכָה כְּמָר! מִשּׁוּם דְּאָפְכִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Let Sage, say halakha is in accordance with Sage, and Sage, halakha is in accordance with Sage, Because who reverse
llm_translation: Let us say, "Master, the halakha is like Master, and Master, the halakha is like Master!" Because he turned to them.

hebrew_text: מְצָאוֹ בַּחֲפִיסָה אוֹ בִּדְלוֹסְקָמָא: מַאי ״חֲפִיסָה״? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: חֵמֶת קְטַנָּה. מַאי ״דְּלוֹסְקָמָא״? טְלִיקָא דְסָבֵי.
human_translation: found in a ḥafisa or in a deluskema , What ḥafisa ? Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: a small flask. What deluskema ? a purse [ telika ] of the elderly.
llm_translation: They found it in a heap or in a pit: What is a "heap"? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: A small chamber pot. What is a "pit"? A basket of dyers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט, וְהִנִּיחוֹ זָקֵן אוֹ חוֹלֶה – נוֹתֵן לָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים.
human_translation: who brings a bill of divorce and he had left elderly or sick, gives her based on presumption that is alive,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who brings a bill of divorce, and a elder or an ill person left it - he gives it to her with the presumption that it is valid.

hebrew_text: בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל הַנְּשׂוּאָה לְכֹהֵן, וְהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים. הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ חַטָּאתוֹ מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם – מַקְרִיבִין אוֹתָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים.
human_translation: an Israelite woman who is married to a priest and her husband went to a country overseas, she may partake of teruma based on presumption that is alive. one who sends his sin offering from a country overseas, offer it based on presumption that is alive.
llm_translation: Daughter of Israel who is married to a Kohen, and her husband went to the province of the sea - she eats Terumah with the presumption that he is alive. If he sends his sin offering from the province of the sea - they offer it with the presumption that he is alive.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא זָקֵן שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לִגְבוּרוֹת; וְחוֹלֶה – שֶׁרוֹב חוֹלִים לְחַיִּים; אֲבָל זָקֵן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לִגְבוּרוֹת, וְגוֹסֵס – שֶׁרוֹב גּוֹסְסִין לְמִיתָה; לָא.
human_translation: Rava says: They taught only an elderly man who has not reached strength, and sick person, as majority of sick to live But an elderly man who had reached strength, or moribund, as the majority of moribund to die, not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rava: They taught not except an elder who has not reached his strength; and a sick person - for most sick people recover; but an elder who has reached his strength, and a leper - for most lepers die; no.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט וְהִנִּיחוֹ זָקֵן – אֲפִילּוּ בֶּן מֵאָה שָׁנָה, נוֹתֵן לָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to who brings a bill of divorce and left old, even one hundred years old, he gives to based on presumption that is alive. a conclusive refutation,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye said: One who brings a bill of divorce and leaves it with an elderly person—even if the woman is one hundred years old, he gives it to her with the presumption that he is fulfilling his obligation! This is a refutation.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיפְּלִיג – אִיפְּלִיג.
human_translation: And if you wish, say since that reached an exceptionally reached an exceptionally
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: since he has reached a conclusion - he has reached a conclusion.

hebrew_text: רָמֵי לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה, תְּנַן: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט, וְהִנִּיחוֹ זָקֵן אוֹ חוֹלֶה – נוֹתֵן לָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים. וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ״ – שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם לְמִיתָתוֹ, אֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה מִיָּד!
human_translation: Abaye raises a contradiction before Rabba: We learned who brings a bill of divorce and left elderly or sick, gives her based on presumption that is alive. And raise a contradiction This is your bill of divorce one hour prior to my death, it is immediately prohibited for her to partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: Ramei leih Abbayei leRabah, tenan: hammevi get, vehinicho zaken o choleh – noten lah bechezkat shehu kayam. Ureminhu: "harei zeh gitich" – sha'ah achas kodem lemitato, asurah le'echol bitrumah miyad!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּרוּמָה אַגִּיטִּין קָא רָמֵית?! תְּרוּמָה אֶפְשָׁר, גֵּט לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: said to him: you raise a contradiction teruma to bills of divorce? teruma , possible a bill of divorce it is not possible
llm_translation: He said to him: "You are raising a question about Terumah and Gitin?! Terumah is possible, a Get is not possible."

hebrew_text: וְרָמֵי תְּרוּמָה אַתְּרוּמָה; תְּנַן: בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל הַנְּשׂוּאָה לְכֹהֵן, וְהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction teruma to teruma We learned an Israelite woman who is married to a priest and her husband went to a country overseas, she may partake of teruma based on presumption that is alive.
llm_translation: And they said: "Terumah is Terumah." We learned in a Mishnah: If a Jewish woman who is married to a Kohen, and her husband goes to a province overseas - she may eat Terumah with the presumption that he is alive and well.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ״ – שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם מִיתָתוֹ, אֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה מִיָּד!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction This is your bill of divorce one hour prior to my death, it is immediately prohibited for her to partake of teruma
llm_translation: And they asked: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce" - one hour before his death, she is immediately forbidden to eat from the terumah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יִצְחָק: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֲסָרָהּ עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם מִיתָתוֹ. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: מִמַּאי דְּאִיהוּ מָיֵית בְּרֵישָׁא? דִּלְמָא אִיהִי מָיְיתָא בְּרֵישָׁא!
human_translation: Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzḥak, said: is different there, as he rendered her forbidden to himself one hour prior to his death, Rav Pappa objects to this From where that he will die first Perhaps she will die first,
llm_translation: Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzchak, said: It is different there, for he prohibited her upon himself one hour before his death. Rav Papa objected to him: From what did he die in the first place? Perhaps she caused his death in the first place!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר – דְּלָא חָיֵישׁ לְמִיתָה, הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said not difficult: This Rabbi Meir, who is not concerned about death. That Rabbi Yehuda, who is concerned about death.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, it is not difficult: for Rabbi Meir, who is not concerned for death, and for Rabbi Yehuda, who is concerned for death.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַלּוֹקֵחַ יַיִן מִבֵּין הַכּוּתִים, אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי לוּגִּין שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לְהַפְרִישׁ – הֲרֵי הֵן תְּרוּמָה; עֲשָׂרָה – מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן; תִּשְׁעָה – מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי; וּמֵיחֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה מִיָּד – דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: As we learned one who purchases wine from among the Samaritans, he says: Two log that I will separate in the future are teruma , ten first tithe; nine second tithe. And he deconsecrates and drink immediately, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: One who takes wine from among the Samaritans, he says: "Two log measures that I am going to separate – behold, they are terumah; ten – they are the first tithe; nine – the second tithe; and if he waits and immediately drinks – these are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר:
human_translation: Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא מֵת לָא חָיְישִׁינַן, שֶׁמָּא יָמוּת חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: We are not concerned perhaps he died, we are concerned perhaps he will die
llm_translation: Perhaps he died, we are not concerned, perhaps he will die, we are concerned.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה לְרָבָא: וְהָא נוֹד דִּכְשֶׁמָּא יָמוּת הוּא, וּפְלִיגִי! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה מִדִּסְקַרְתָּא: שָׁאנֵי נוֹד דְּאֶפְשָׁר דְּמָסַר לֵיהּ לְשׁוֹמֵר.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Rava: But wineskin which is similar perhaps he will die, and disagree. Rav Yehuda of Diskarta said: A wineskin is different, as it is possible to give it to a watchman
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Matna to Rava: "But isn't it known that when he dies, they will dispute!" Rav Yehuda said from Diskarta: "The case of Nod is different, as it is possible that he handed it over to a guardian."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: עָרְבָיךְ עָרְבָא צְרִיךְ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁמָּא מֵת – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן, שֶׁמָּא יָמוּת – תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya objects to this Your guarantor needs a guarantor, Rather, Rava said: we are not concerned perhaps he died, perhaps he will die, is tanna’im .
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya objects to her: Your evening is in the evening, it is necessary! Rather, Rava said: Perhaps he died - we are not concerned, perhaps he will die - it is a Mishnaic teaching.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ חַטָּאתוֹ מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וְכוּ׳: וְהָא בָּעֵינָא סְמִיכָה! אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּקׇרְבַּן נָשִׁים. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בְּחַטַּאת הָעוֹף.
human_translation: one who sends his sin-offering from a country overseas, But doesn’t require placing hands Rav Yosef says: with regard to the offering of women, Rav Pappa says: with regard to a bird a sin-offering,
llm_translation: The one who sends his sin offering from the province of the sea, etc. And is it not necessary to have proximity! Rav Yosef said: In the offering of women. Rav Papa said: In the sin offering of birds.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גֵּט – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר, אֲבָל תְּרוּמָה דְּאֶפְשָׁר – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And necessary as, if it taught us a bill of divorce, due to not possible But teruma , where possible say not
llm_translation: "And it is necessary; for if we were to hear a case of a divorce - because it is impossible, but regarding terumah, which is possible - I might say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן תְּרוּמָה – דְּזִמְנִין דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר; אֲבָל חַטַּאת הָעוֹף – מִסְּפֵיקָא לָא לֵיעוּל חוּלִּין לָעֲזָרָה, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if it taught us teruma , that times that not possible But a bird a sin-offering, for uncertainty one should not bring non-sacred into the courtyard. necessary
llm_translation: "And if we were to hear about Terumah - for there are times when it is not possible; but the sin offering of a bird - from doubt it is not necessary to bring it to the Azarah, it is needed."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פַּרְטָא לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְקִיְּימוּ אֶת דְּבָרָיו: עַל עִיר שֶׁהִקִּיפָהּ כַּרְקוֹם, וְעַל הַסְּפִינָה הַמּוּטְרֶפֶת בַּיָּם, וְעַל הַיּוֹצֵא לִידּוֹן – שֶׁהֵן בְּחֶזְקַת קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Perata said three statements before the Sages and they upheld his statements: concerning a town that was surrounded a camp of besiegers [ karkom ]; and concerning the a ship that is cast about in the sea; and concerning one who is going out to be judged that they are presumed to be alive.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Three things did Rabbi Elazar ben Parta say before the sages, and they upheld his words: concerning a city surrounded by a wall, concerning a ship that is adrift at sea, and concerning one who goes out to be judged - they are presumed to be established."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עִיר שֶׁכְּבָשָׁהּ כַּרְקוֹם, וּסְפִינָה שֶׁאָבְדָה בַּיָּם, וְהַיּוֹצֵא לֵיהָרֵג – נוֹתְנִין עֲלֵיהֶן חוּמְרֵי חַיִּים וְחוּמְרֵי מֵתִים – בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן, וּבַת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: However, a town that was conquered a camp of besiegers; and a ship that was lost at sea; and one who is going out to be executed one applies to them the stringencies of living and the stringencies of dead. An Israelite woman to a priest or a daughter of a priest to an Israelite may not partake of teruma .
llm_translation: But a city that was conquered like Jericho, and a ship that was lost at sea, and one who goes out to be killed - we impose upon them the stringencies of the living and the stringencies of the dead - a daughter of Israel to a Kohen, and a daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite, may not eat of the terumah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל; אֲבָל בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, כֵּיוָן דִּגְמִיר לֵיהּ דִּינָא לִקְטָלָא – מִיקְטָל קָטְלִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: They taught only in a Jewish court, but in a court of the nations of the world, once he is sentenced to death, he is killed
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yosef said: They only taught this regarding the court of Israel; but in the court of the nations of the world, once they have learned the law to kill, they may kill.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם נָמֵי, דִּמְקַבְּלִי שׁוּחְדָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי שָׁקְלִי – מִקַּמֵּי דְּלַחְתּוֹם פּוּרְסִי שְׁנָמַג; לְבָתַר דְּמִיחְתַּם פּוּרְסִי שְׁנָמַג – לָא שָׁקְלִי.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: a court of the nations of the world as well, as they accept bribes. said to him: When they take before the verdict [ puresei shenmag ] has been sealed; after the verdict has been sealed, they do not take
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: The court of the nations of the world is trustworthy, as they accept bribery! He said to him: When you take – before you seal the document, it is torn; after you seal the document, it is not torn.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ אֶת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי עֵדָיו״ – הֲרֵי זֶה יֵהָרֵג! דִּלְמָא בּוֹרֵחַ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection Any place where two arise and say: We testify about so-and-so that his judgment was finalized in the court of so-and-so, and so-and-so and so-and-so his witnesses, this should be killed. Perhaps one who flees is different,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: Any place where two stand and say, "We testify concerning so-and-so that his judgment was completed in the court of so-and-so, and so-and-so and so-and-so are his witnesses" - behold, this one shall be put to death! Perhaps he is a fleeing pursuer.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁמַע מִבֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מֵת״; ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי נֶהֱרָג״ – יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. מֵקוֹמֶנְטָרִיסִין שֶׁל גּוֹיִם ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מֵת״; ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי נֶהֱרַג״ – אַל יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear: heard from a Jewish court that they were saying: man so-and-so died, man so-and-so was killed, his wife to marry. from a gentile judicial registrar [ komentirisin ]: man so-and-so died, man so-and-so was killed, not his wife to marry.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Hear from the court of Israel that used to say, "So-and-so man is dead"; "So-and-so man is killed" - they may marry his wife. From the watchmen of the nations, "So-and-so man is dead"; "So-and-so man is killed" - they may not marry his wife.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״מֵת״, וּמַאי ״נֶהֱרַג״? אִילֵימָא ״מֵת״ – מֵת מַמָּשׁ, וְ״נֶהֱרַג״ – נֶהֱרַג מַמָּשׁ; דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי גּוֹיִם, אַמַּאי אַל יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ? הָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּכֹל מֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ הֵימוֹנֵי מְהֵימְנִי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: What Died, and what Was killed? If we say Died, actually died, and: Was killed, was actually killed, that concerning the gentiles a similar manner, why not his wife to marry? Don’t we maintain that any speaks offhandedly, deemed him credible?
llm_translation: What is "dead," and what is "killed"? If you say "dead" - dead literally, and "killed" - killed literally; since they are similar to Gentiles, why should he not marry his wife? This is what we hold: anyone who engages in idle chatter, his faith is not trusted.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו ״מֵת״ – יוֹצֵא לָמוּת, ״נֶהֱרַג״ – יוֹצֵא לֵיהָרֵג? וְקָתָנֵי: בְּבֵית דִּין יִשְׂרָאֵל יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ!
human_translation: Rather, is it not Died, going out to die, Was killed, going out to be executed. And teaches in a Jewish court his wife to marry,
llm_translation: Rather, is it not that "meit" - he goes out to die, "neherag" - he goes out to be killed? And it is taught: In the court of Israel, they shall cause his wife to drink!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם מֵת מַמָּשׁ וְנֶהֱרַג מַמָּשׁ, וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי גּוֹיִם אַמַּאי לָא, וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּכֹל מֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ הֵימוֹנֵי מְהֵימְנִי; הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמִילְּתָא דְּלָא שָׁיְיכִי בָּהּ, אֲבָל בְּמִילְּתָא דְּשָׁיְיכִי בַּהּ, עָבְדִי לְאַחְזוֹקֵי שִׁיקְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Actually, actually died, and actually was killed. And that which you said: that concerning the gentiles a similar manner, why not Don’t we maintain that any speaks offhandedly, deemed him credible? this applies in a matter that is not relevant to but in a matter that is relevant to common for them to reinforce their false
llm_translation: Forever dead literally and killed literally, and you say: when he was beaten by non-Jews why not, and this is established for us that all who divert from the truth, their faith is not trusted; those matters that are not relevant to it, but those matters that are relevant to it, they do to strengthen their falsehoods.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם,
human_translation: There are who say Rav Yosef said: They taught only in a court of the nations of the world;
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yosef said: They only taught this in the court of the nations of the world,

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, כֵּיוָן דִּנְפַק לֵיהּ דִּינָא לִקְטָלָא – קָטְלִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: but in a Jewish court, once his verdict to be executed has emerged, they execute him.
llm_translation: But in the court of Israel, once the judgment has been reached to kill - they kill him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר דְּחָזוּ לֵיהּ זְכוּתָא! כִּי חָזוּ לֵיהּ זְכוּתָא – מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיגְמַר דִּינָא, בָּתַר גְּמַר דִּינָא – תּוּ לָא חָזוּ לֵיהּ זְכוּתָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: a Jewish court as well, it is possible that see acquit him sees acquit him, before the verdict; after the verdict not further see acquit him,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: The court of Israel is reliable, perhaps they will see merit in it! If they see merit in it - before they conclude the judgment, after they conclude the judgment - they will not see merit in it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיֹאמְרוּ ״מְעִידִים אָנוּ אֶת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי עֵדָיו״ – הֲרֵי זֶה יֵהָרֵג! דִּלְמָא בּוֹרֵחַ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Let us say supports Any place where two arise and say: We testify about so-and-so that his verdict was finalized in the court of so-and-so, and so-and-so and so-and-so his witnesses, this should be killed. Perhaps one who flees is different,
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: Any place that two stand and say, "We testify that the judgment of so-and-so has been completed in the court of so-and-so, and so-and-so and so-and-so are his witnesses" – behold, this one shall be killed! Perhaps he is a fleeing pursuer.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁמַע מִבֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מֵת״; ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי נֶהֱרָג״ – יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. מִקּוֹמֶנְטָרִיסִים שֶׁל גּוֹיִם ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מֵת״; ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי נֶהֱרַג״ – אַל יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear: heard from a Jewish court that they were saying: man so-and-so died, man so-and-so was killed, his wife to marry. from a gentile judicial registrar: man so-and-so died, man so-and-so was killed, not his wife to marry.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: One who hears from the court of Israel saying, "So-and-so man has died," or "So-and-so man has been killed," they should inform his wife. From the watchmen of the nations, if they say, "So-and-so man has died," or "So-and-so man has been killed," they should not inform his wife.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״מֵת״ וּמַאי ״נֶהֱרַג״? אִילֵימָא ״מֵת״ – מַמָּשׁ, וְ״נֶהֱרַג״ – מַמָּשׁ; דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי גּוֹיִם, אַמַּאי אַל יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ? הָא קַיְימָא לַן, כֹּל מֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ הֵימוֹנֵי מְהֵימְנִי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: What Died, and what Was killed? If we say actually died, and actually was killed, that concerning the gentiles a similar manner, why not his wife to marry? Don’t we maintain that any speaks offhandedly, deemed him credible?
llm_translation: What is "died" and what is "killed"? If you say "died" - literally, and "killed" - literally; since they are similar to non-Jews, why should they not marry his wife? This is our established principle, anyone who diverts from his straightforwardness, his faithfulness is diverted from him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו ״מֵת״ – יוֹצֵא לָמוּת, וְ״נֶהֱרַג״ – יוֹצֵא לֵיהָרֵג? וְקָתָנֵי: בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל יַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ!
human_translation: Rather, is it not Died, going out to die, and Was killed, going out to be executed. And teaches: in a Jewish court his wife to marry,
llm_translation: Rather, is it not that "meit" - he goes out to die, and "neherag" - he goes out to be killed? And it is taught: In the court of Israel, they shall cause his wife to drink!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם מֵת מַמָּשׁ וְנֶהֱרַג מַמָּשׁ; דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי גּוֹיִם אַמַּאי לָא, וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּכֹל מֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ הֵימוֹנֵי מְהֵימְנִי – הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמִילְּתָא דְּלָא שָׁיְיכִי בַּהּ, אֲבָל בְּמִילְּתָא דְּשָׁיְיכִי בַּהּ, עָבְדִי לְאַחְזוֹקֵי שִׁקְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Actually, actually died, and was actually killed; that concerning the gentiles a similar manner, why not Don’t we maintain that any speaks offhandedly, deemed him credible? this applies in a matter that is not relevant to but in a matter that is relevant to common for them to reinforce their false
llm_translation: Forever dead literally and killed literally; when he was beaten by non-Jews why not, and this is established for us that all who divert from the straightforward path, their faith is not trusted - those words in a matter that is not relevant to them, but in a matter that is relevant to them, they fabricate their lies.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְחָלָה – הֲרֵי זֶה מְשַׁלְּחוֹ בְּיַד אַחֵר. וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״טוֹל לִי הֵימֶנָּה חֵפֶץ פְּלוֹנִי״ – לֹא יְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ בְּיַד אַחֵר, שֶׁאֵין רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁיְּהֵא פִּקְדוֹנוֹ בְּיַד אַחֵר.
human_translation: who brings a bill of divorce in Eretz Yisrael, and became sick, this send it in the possession of another But if said to take for me such and such an item from her he may not send it in the possession of another that it is not desire that his deposit be in the possession of another
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who brings a bill of divorce in the land of Israel, and he fell ill - he may send it through another. But if he said to him: "Take from it a certain object for me" - he may not send it through another, for his intention is that his deposit should be in the hands of another.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: ״חָלָה״ תְּנַן. פְּשִׁיטָא, ״חָלָה״ קָתָנֵי! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא הוּא הַדִּין אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא חָלָה, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי ״חָלָה״ אוֹרְחָא דְּמִילְּתָא קָתָנֵי; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: We learned became sick; is obvious, as teaches became sick. Lest you say the same is true, even though did not become sick, and that teaches he became sick teaches the matter in the manner in which it teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav Kahana: "Challah" we learned. Obviously, "Challah" it teaches! What might you say? It is the same even though it did not become "Challah," and this that it teaches "Challah" it teaches the common practice; it informs us.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״הוֹלֵךְ״ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא חָלָה נָמֵי! וְאִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״אַתְּ הוֹלֵךְ״ – אֲפִילּוּ חָלָה נָמֵי לָא! וְאִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֲפִילּוּ חָלָה נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If where said to Deliver even though did not become sick, also And if where he said to You, deliver even he became sick, he also may not And if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, even he became sick also may not
llm_translation: "How are the cases similar? If he said to her, 'You may go,' even though she did not become ill, she may still go! But if he said to her, 'You may go,' even if she became ill, she may not go! And if it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, even if she became ill, she may not go!"

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״הוֹלֵךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי זֶה מְשַׁלְּחוֹ בְּיַד אַחֵר. ״אַתְּ הוֹלֵךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ בְּיַד אַחֵר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ – אֵין הַשָּׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: As it is taught Deliver this bill of divorce to my wife, this may send it in the possession of another You, deliver this bill of divorce to my wife, this may not send it in the possession of another Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Whether like this or like that, the agent may not designate another agent.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "He says, 'Go, deliver this bill of divorce to my wife' - this constitutes sending it through another's hand. 'You go, deliver this bill of divorce to my wife' - this does not constitute sending it through another's hand." Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Whether in this case or in that case, the agent does not act as an agent.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא ״הוֹלֵךְ״, וְהוּא דְּחָלָה; וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא ״אַתְּ הוֹלֵךְ״, וְחָלָה שָׁאנֵי; וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, וְחָלָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: If you wish, say Deliver And this when became sick. And if you wish, say You deliver, but one who became sick is different, And if you wish, say is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, But became sick is different,
llm_translation: If you wish, say "he is walking," and he became ill; and if you wish, say "you are walking," and the law is different; and if you wish, say "it is Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel," and the law is different.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְחָלָה – הֲרֵי זֶה מְשַׁלְּחוֹ בְּיַד אַחֵר. וּרְמִינְהוּ, אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״; אוֹ לִשְׁלֹשָׁה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט וּתְנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ. אִינְהוּ אִין, אֲבָל שָׁלִיחַ לָא!
human_translation: We learned who brings a bill of divorce in Eretz Yisrael, and became sick, this send it in the possession of another And raises a contradiction said to two Give a bill of divorce to my wife, or to three Write a bill of divorce and give to my wife, these should write and give They yes, but an agent not
llm_translation: We learned: One who brings a bill of divorce in the land of Israel, and he fell ill - behold, he sends it through another. And they raised a dilemma: He said to two, "Give a bill of divorce to my wife"; or to three: "Write a bill of divorce and give it to my wife" - behold, these shall be written and given. They said no, but a messenger is not!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם בִּזָּיוֹן דְּבַעַל, הָכָא בַּעַל לָא קָפֵיד.
human_translation: Abaye said: There, what is the reason due to degradation of the husband, here, husband is not particular
llm_translation: Abbaye said: There, what is the reason? Because of the disgrace of the husband. Here, the husband is not particular.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם דְּמִילֵּי נִינְהוּ, וּמִילֵּי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: Rava said: because that are words, and directives cannot be delegated to an agent,
llm_translation: Rava said: Because they are matters of circumcision, and matters of circumcision are not entrusted to an agent.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שְׁלִיחַ מַתָּנָה; וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל – רַב אָמַר: מַתָּנָה אֵינָהּ כְּגֵט. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מַתָּנָה הֲרֵי הִיא כְּגֵט.
human_translation: What is between between them an agent a gift, and to the dispute of Rav and Shmuel. Rav says: gift is not like a bill of divorce, And Shmuel says: gift is like a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? The difference between them is a gift of acquisition; and in the dispute between Rav and Shmuel - Rav said: A gift is not like a divorce document. And Shmuel said: A gift is indeed like a divorce document.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ ״טוֹל לִי הֵימֶנָּה חֵפֶץ פְּלוֹנִי״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי: אֵין הַשּׁוֹאֵל רַשַּׁאי לְהַשְׁאִיל, וְאֵין הַשּׂוֹכֵר רַשַּׁאי לְהַשְׂכִּיר.
human_translation: But if said to take for me such and such an item from her, Reish Lakish says: Here, Rabbi taught a borrower is not allowed to lend and a renter is not allowed to rent out
llm_translation: "If he said to him, 'Take for me this object belonging to so-and-so,' Reish Lakish said: Here Rabbi changed the ruling: The borrower is not permitted to lend, and the renter is not permitted to rent."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן יוֹדְעִים אוֹתָהּ! אֶלָּא זִימְנִין דְּגִיטָּא נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי – דְּנַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ ״אַל תְּגָרְשָׁהּ אֶלָּא בַּבַּיִת״, וְגֵירְשָׁהּ בָּעֲלִיָּיה; ״אַל תְּגָרְשָׁהּ אֶלָּא בְּיָמִין״, וְגֵירְשָׁהּ בִּשְׂמֹאל.
