human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Even schoolchildren know this but sometimes that the bill of divorce is also not because becomes as one that was said to him: Divorce her only in the house, and he divorced her in the attic; Divorce her only with right and he divorced her with left
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan: This, even the young children of the schoolhouse know! Rather, sometimes a document is not valid - for it is made as if one said to him "Do not divorce her except in the house," and he divorced her in the courtyard; "Do not divorce her except by day," and he divorced her at night.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, הֵיכָא דְּנָפְקָה לְאַפֵּיהּ וְיָהֲבָה לֵיהּ חֵפֶץ, וַהֲדַר שָׁקְלָה מִינֵּיהּ גִּיטָּא; כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּגִיטָּא – גִּיטָּא מְעַלְּיָא הָוֵי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי הֵיכָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Everyone when that went out to him and gave him the item and then took the bill of divorce from him, everyone agrees that the bill of divorce is a proper bill of divorce. When they disagree when said to
llm_translation: The whole world, where she went out to her father's house and he gave her a dowry, and then he took back the document of divorce from her; the whole world agrees that with regard to the document of divorce - the document of divorce is superior. When do they disagree? Where he said to her:

hebrew_text: שְׁקוֹל מִינַּהּ חֵפֶץ וַהֲדַר הַב לַהּ גִּיטָּא; וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וִיהַב לַהּ גִּיטָּא, וַהֲדַר שְׁקַל מִינַּהּ חֵפֶץ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן פּוֹסֵל בּוֹ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בִּשְׁלוּחוֹ, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַכְשִׁיר בִּשְׁלוּחוֹ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בּוֹ.
human_translation: Take an item from her and then give her the bill of divorce, and he went and gave her the bill of divorce and then took the item from her. Rabbi Yoḥanan invalidates by and all the more so by agent. And Reish Lakish deems valid by agent, and all the more so by himself.
llm_translation: Weigh her, desire, and adorn her with a bill of divorce; and he went and gave her a bill of divorce, and then weighed her, desire. Rabbi Yochanan disqualifies it, and certainly in its sending, and Reish Lakish validates it in its sending, and certainly in it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, וְחָלָה – עוֹשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ בְּבֵית דִּין וּמְשַׁלְּחוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר לִפְנֵיהֶם: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״; וְאֵין שָׁלִיחַ אַחֲרוֹן צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר: שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין אֲנִי.
human_translation: who is bringing a bill of divorce from a country overseas, and he became sick he appoints another agent in court and sends him. And says before It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, And the final agent does not need to say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence. Rather, he says: I am an agent of the court.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, and it becomes lost – he appoints a messenger in the court, and sends him, and he says before them: "It was written in my presence and signed in my presence." And the last messenger does not need to say, "It was written in my presence and signed in my presence," but rather he says: "I am the messenger of the court."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לַאֲבִימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבִּי אֲבָהו,ּ שָׁלִיחַ דְּשָׁלִיחַ מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ, אוֹ לָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לְכוּ, מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״אֵין הַשָּׁלִיחַ הָאַחֲרוֹן״, מִכְלָל דִּמְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ;
human_translation: The Sages said to Avimei, son of Rabbi Abbahu: Raise dilemma before Rabbi Abbahu: Can an agent of agent appoint agent, or not? He said to them: You should not raise this dilemma. From that teaches: The final agent does not by inference that can appoint an agent,
llm_translation: Gemara: The sages said to Avimi, son of the son of Rabbi Avahu: Does one need his consent from Rabbi Avahu, the agent of an agent is considered as the agent himself, or not? He said to them: Does it not require you, as it is taught: "The last agent is not considered," which implies that the agent of an agent is considered as the agent himself.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לְכוּ: כִּי מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ – בְּבֵית דִּין, אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הָא לָא מִבַּעְיָא לַן, מִדְּקָתָנֵי: אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר ״שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין אֲנִי״.
human_translation: Rather, when you raise the dilemma, When appoints agent, in court, or even while not in court? They said to him: We do not raise this dilemma, from that it teaches: Rather, he says: I am an agent of the court,
llm_translation: Rather, when you ask: When appointing a messenger - in a court, or even not in a court? They said to him: This is not necessary for us, as it is taught: Rather, one should say, "I am a messenger of the court."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַתְנֵי הָכִי: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לַאֲבִימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שָׁלִיחַ דְּשָׁלִיחַ, כִּי מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ – בְּבֵית דִּין, אוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak teach like this: The Sages said to Avimei, son of Rabbi Abbahu: Raise dilemma before Rabbi Abbahu: agent of agent appoints agent, in court, or even while not in court?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak teaches thus: The sages said to Avimi, son of the son of Rabbi Avahu, inquire from him, Rabbi Avahu: A messenger of a messenger, when he appoints a messenger - in a court, or not in a court?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְתִיבְּעֵי לְכוּ אִי מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ בְּעָלְמָא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הָא לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן, דִּתְנַן: ״אֵין הַשָּׁלִיחַ הָאַחֲרוֹן״, מִכְּלָל דְּשָׁלִיחַ מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ; אֶלָּא כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן – בְּבֵית דִּין, אוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לְכוּ, דְּקָתָנֵי: אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר ״שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין אֲנִי״.
human_translation: He said to them: And you should raise the dilemma whether generally can appoint agent. They said to him: We do not raise this dilemma, as we learned The final agent does not by inference that can appoint an agent. Rather, when the dilemma was raised to us, in court, or while not in court. He said to them: You should also not raise this dilemma, as teaches: Rather, he says: I am an agent of the court,
llm_translation: He said to them: And do you require that one appoints a messenger in the world? They said to him: No, we do not require that, as we learned: "The last messenger," which implies that a messenger appoints another messenger; rather, what you are asking is whether it is required in a court or not in a court? He said to them: Indeed, you do not require that, as it is taught: Rather, one should say, "I am a messenger of the court."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: שָׁלִיחַ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, עוֹשֶׂה כַּמָּה שְׁלוּחִין. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִם מֵת רִאשׁוֹן – בָּטְלוּ כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Rabba says: An agent in Eretz Yisrael can appoint several agents, Rav Ashi says: If first died, they are all canceled,
llm_translation: Rabba said: A messenger in the land of Israel, he performs many missions. Rav Ashe said: If the first one dies - all of them are annulled.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא דְּאַבָּא, דְּקַטְנוּתָא הִיא! אִילּוּ מֵת בַּעַל, מִידֵּי מְשָׁשָׁא אִית בְּהוּ?! כּוּלְּהוּ מִכֹּחַ מַאן קָאָתוּ – מִכֹּחַ דְּבַעַל קָאָתוּ; אִיתֵיהּ לְבַעַל – אִיתַנְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ, לֵיתֵיהּ לְבַעַל – לֵיתַנְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: This of father is of his youth, if husband dies, is there is any significance to them? All of them, from whose authority do they come They come from the husband’s authority. husband is they are all husband is not they are all not
llm_translation: Master Bar Rav Ashei said: "This matter of the father, it is a small matter! If the husband dies, is there not immediately someone else to engage with her?! All of them come from the power of the one who comes – they come from the power of the husband; if she belongs to the husband – he gives them all, if she belongs to the one who comes – he gives them all to him."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּשַׁדַּר לַהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ, אֲמַר שָׁלִיחַ: לָא יָדַעְנָא לַהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל יַהֲבֵיהּ לְאַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי, דְּאִיהוּ יָדַע לַהּ, וְלֵיזִיל וְלִיתְּבֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ. אֲתָא וְלָא אַשְׁכַּח לְאַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, וְיָתֵיב רַב סָפְרָא גַּבַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מְסוֹר מִילָּךְ קַמֵּי דִּידַן, דְּכִי יֵיתֵי אַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי נִיתְּבִינֵיהּ לֵיהּ, וְלֵיזִיל וְלִיתְּבִינֵיהּ לַהּ.
human_translation: a certain man who sent a bill of divorce to his wife The agent said: I do not know her. said to him: Go give to Abba bar Minyumi, as he knows her, and he will go and give it to her. came and did not find Abba bar Minyumi, He found Rabbi Abbahu and Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, and Rav Safra was sitting among them. said to him: Transfer your words, before us, as when Abba bar Minyumi comes, we will give to him, and he will go and give it to her.
llm_translation: That man who sent a get to his wife, the messenger said: "I do not know her." He said to him: "Go give it to Abba bar Minyumei, for he knows her, and he will go and deliver it to her." He came and did not find Abba bar Minyumei. He found Rabbi Avahu, Rabbi Chanina bar Papa, and Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, and Rav Safra was sitting before them. They said to him: "Hand over your words before us, for when Abba bar Minyumei comes, we will explain it to him, and he will go and explain it to her."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב סָפְרָא: וְהָא שְׁלִיחַ שֶׁלֹּא נִיתַּן לְגֵירוּשִׁין הוּא! אִיכְּסוּפוּ.
human_translation: Rav Safra said to them: But isn’t he an agent who is not granted to divorce, were embarrassed
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Safra: "But the agent who was not given for divorces, he is! Be cautious."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: קַפְּחִינְהוּ רַב סָפְרָא לִתְלָתָא רַבָּנַן סְמִוכֵי. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּמַאי קַפְּחִינְהוּ? מִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״אַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי וְלָא אַתְּ״?!
human_translation: Rava said: Rav Safra struck [ kappeḥinhu ] to three ordained Sages, Rav Ashi said: With what did he strike them? did say to the Abba bar Minyumi and not you?
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav Safra grabbed them, three rabbis sitting close. Rav Ashi said: With what did he grab them? Who said to him, "Abba bar Minyomei and not you"?!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: קַפְּחִינְהוּ רַב סָפְרָא לִתְלָתָא רַבָּנַן סְמִוכֵי, בְּטָעוּתָא. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי טָעוּתָא? מַאי קָא אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״אַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי״ – וְלָא אַתְּ!
human_translation: There are who say Rava said: Rav Safra struck three ordained Sages mistakenly. Rav Ashi said: What the mistake? what did say to Abba bar Minyumi and not you
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rava said: Rav Safra rebuked three rabbis who were sitting close together, in error. Rav Ashi said: What is the error? What was he saying to them: "Father, son of Minyomi" - but it is not you!

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּשַׁדַּר לָהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשָׁלִיחַ: לָא תִּיתְּבֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ עַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין. אִתְּנִיס בְּגוֹ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין.
human_translation: a certain man who sent a bill of divorce to his wife He said to the agent: Do not give to her until thirty days Circumstances within thirty days that were beyond control,
llm_translation: That man who sent a get to his wife, said to the messenger: Do not sit her until thirty days. He tried to delay it for thirty days.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אָמַר רָבָא: חָלָה טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲנִוס, הַאי נָמֵי [הָא אֲנִיס] (אָנוּס הוּא). אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְסוֹר מִילָּךְ קַמֵּי דִּידַן, דִּלְבָתַר תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין מְשַׁוֵּינַן שָׁלִיחַ, וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: וְהָא שָׁלִיחַ שֶׁלֹּא נִיתַּן לְגֵירוּשִׁין הוּא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: כֵּיוָן דִּלְבָתַר תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ, כְּשָׁלִיחַ שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְגֵירוּשִׁין הוּא.
human_translation: came before Rava Rava said: What is the reason became sick because he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control, this as well, he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control. said to Transfer your words, before us that after thirty days we will appoint an agent and he will give to her. The Sages said to Rava: But isn’t he an agent who is not granted to divorce, He said to them: Since that after thirty days he is able to divorce he is considered an agent who is granted to divorce.
llm_translation: He came before Rava, Rava said: The taste of the illness, what is it - because it is due to coercion, this one is also this is coercion. He said to him: Hand over your staff before us, for after thirty days we appoint a messenger, and he gave it to him. The Rabbis said to Rava: But a messenger that was not given for divorce, he is! He said to them: Since after thirty days he can divorce, he is like a messenger that was given for divorce.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא פִּיֵּיס! מִי לָא תְּנַן: ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו – אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: But let there be a concern perhaps was mollified Didn’t we learn from now if I do not arrive from now until twelve months and he died within twelve months, this is a bill of divorce?
llm_translation: And to be concerned lest he appease! Who taught it: "From now - if I do not return from here until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - this is a divorce document.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: וְנֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא פִּיֵּיס! וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, הָכִי אָמַר אַבָּא מָרִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: בְּאוֹמֵר ״נֶאֱמֶנֶת עָלַי לוֹמַר שֶׁלֹּא בָּאתִי״!
human_translation: And we discussed And let there be a concern perhaps was mollified And Rabba bar Rav Huna said: This my father, my master, said in the name of Rav: where says: is deemed credible to say that I did not arrive.
llm_translation: We were in it: and suspect lest he appease! And Rabba bar Rav Huna said, thus said Abba Mari in the name of Rav: by saying "I am believed to say that I did not come"!

hebrew_text: אִיכְּסִיף. לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דַּאֲרוּסָה הֲוַאי. אָמַר רָבָא: אִם אָמְרוּ בִּנְשׂוּאָה – יֹאמְרוּ בַּאֲרוּסָה?!
human_translation: was embarrassed Ultimately, the matter was revealed that was betrothed Rava said: If they said with regard to a married woman would they say with regard to a betrothed woman,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ikhsif. Le'sof igalai milta de'arusah hava'i. Amar Rava: Im amru bin'su'ah - yomru ba'arusah?!" English translation: "He was embarrassed. At the end, the matter of the betrothal was revealed. Rava said: If they said it in marriage - should they say it in betrothal?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָא וַדַּאי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן –
human_translation: Rava said: We certainly raise this dilemma:
llm_translation: Rava said: "This is certainly what he is asking us -"

hebrew_text: כִּי מְשַׁוּוּ בֵּית דִּין שָׁלִיחַ; בְּפָנָיו, אוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו? הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: בֵּין בְּפָנָיו בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו. שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: בֵּין בְּפָנָיו בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: When the court appoints agent, in presence of or not in his presence? He then resolves it: either in his presence or not in his presence. they sent from there, either in the presence or not in his presence.
llm_translation: When the court appoints a messenger; in his presence, or not in his presence? Come and hear: Whether in his presence or not in his presence. They sent from there: Whether in his presence or not in his presence.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר: אִי לָא אָתֵינָא עַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין – לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. אֲתָא וּפַסְקֵיהּ מַבָּרָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי״, ״חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי״. אֲמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ מַתְיָא.
human_translation: a certain who said If I do not arrive until thirty days let this be a bill of divorce. He came but he was prevented by the ferry He said to See that I have arrived, see that I have arrived. Shmuel said: is not considered an arrival,
llm_translation: That one who said: If I do not come within thirty days - let it be a divorce. He came and he cut a fig. He said to them: "See that he has come," "See that he has come." Samuel said: His name is Matya.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי לָא [מְ]פַיֵּיסְנָא לַהּ עַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין – לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. אֲזַל פַּיְּיסַהּ, וְלָא אִיפַּיַּיסָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִי יְהַב לַהּ תַּרְקַבָּא דְּדִינָרֵי וְלָא אִיפַּיַּיסָא?!
human_translation: a certain who said to If I do not appease within thirty days, let this be a bill of divorce. He went appease her, but she was not appeased. Rav Yosef said: Did he give her vessel [ tarkeva ] of dinars but she was not appeased?
llm_translation: That one who said to her: If we do not reconcile with her within thirty days - let it be a divorce. He went and reconciled with her, and did not divorce her. Rav Yosef said: Who gave her a purse of dinars and did not divorce her?!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִידֵּי תַּרְקַבָּא דְּדִינָרֵי בָּעֵי לְמִיתַּב לַהּ?! הָא פַּיְּיסַהּ, וְלָא אִיפַּיַּיסָא.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Yosef said: Did he need to give her a vessel of dinars he appease her, but she was not appeased.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yosef said: From the purse of dinars he wants to sit with her?! She appeased him, but he was not appeased.

hebrew_text: הָא – כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ אוֹנֶס בְּגִיטִּין, הָא – כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין אוֹנֶס בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: This according to the one who says: Circumstances beyond control have with regard to bills of divorce. This according to the one who says: Circumstances beyond control no with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: The one who says there is oness in gittin, is like the one who says there is no oness in gittin.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּלְוֶה מָעוֹת אֶת הַכֹּהֵן וְאֶת הַלֵּוִי וְאֶת הֶעָנִי, לִהְיוֹת מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן מֵחֶלְקָן; מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהֵן קַיָּימִין, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ שֶׁמָּא מֵת הַכֹּהֵן אוֹ הַלֵּוִי, אוֹ הֶעֱשִׁיר הֶעָנִי.
human_translation: one who lends money to a priest, or to a Levite, or to a poor person, he will separate their portion on the basis of that he may separate on the basis of that with the presumption that they are alive, and he need not be concerned perhaps the priest or the Levite died or the poor person became rich
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who lends money to a Kohen, a Levi, or a poor person, in order to separate from their portion, should separate from them with the presumption that they are still alive, and should not be concerned that perhaps the Kohen, Levi, or wealthy poor person has died.

hebrew_text: מֵתוּ – צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת מִן הַיּוֹרְשִׁים; אִם הִלְווֹן בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת מִן הַיּוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: they died, he must obtain permission from the heirs if he lent to in the presence of the court he does not need to obtain permission from the heirs.
llm_translation: The deceased - one must take permission from the heirs; if there is a loan in front of the court - one does not need to take permission from the heirs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אָתוּ לִידֵיהּ?!
human_translation: And even though did not come into their possession?
llm_translation: "Gam v'af al gav de'la atu liydeih?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: בְּמַכָּרֵי כְּהוּנָּה וּלְוִיָּה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בִּמְזַכֶּה לָהֶם עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים. עוּלָּא אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עָשׂוּ אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ זוֹכֶה כְּזוֹכֶה.
human_translation: Rav says: with regard to associates of the priesthood and the Levites, And Shmuel says: with regard to has acquire through others, Ulla said: whose is this It is Rabbi Yosei, who says rendered one who does not acquire like one who acquires.
llm_translation: Rav said: In the case of the sellers of the priesthood and Levites. And Shmuel said: In the case of those who acquire it for them through others. Ulla said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Yosei, who said: They did it for one who is not eligible as for one who is eligible.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ כְּרַב לָא אָמְרִי – בְּמַכָּרֵי לָא קָתָנֵי. כִּשְׁמוּאֵל לָא קָאָמְרִי – בִּמְזַכֶּה לָא קָתָנֵי. כְּעוּלָּא נָמֵי לָא אָמְרִי – כִּיחִידָאָה לָא מוֹקְמִינַן.
human_translation: All do not state in accordance with Rav, does not teach with regard to associates do not state in accordance with Shmuel does not teach with regard to has acquire through others. also do not state in accordance with Ulla we do not establish in accordance an individual
llm_translation: All of them like Rav did not say - in sellers it is not taught. Like Shmuel did not say - in buyers it is not taught. Like Ula the son of Naḥmeini did not say - for an individual we do not establish.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּלְוֶה מָעוֹת אֶת הַכֹּהֵן וְאֶת הַלֵּוִי וְאֶת הֶעָנִי, לִהְיוֹת מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן מֵחֶלְקָן, מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהֵן קַיָּימִין;
human_translation: The Sages taught one who lends money to a priest, or to a Levite, or to a poor person he will separate their portion on the basis of that he may separate on the basis of that with the presumption that they are alive.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who lends money to a Kohen, a Levi, or a poor person, in order to separate from their portion, he separates from them with the presumption that they are still in existence.

hebrew_text: וּפוֹסֵק עִמָּהֶן כְּשַׁעַר הַזּוֹל; וְאֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם רִבִּית; וְאֵין שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ;
human_translation: And he may contract with them according to the low rate, And this is not subject to interest, And the Sabbatical does not cancel
llm_translation: And he arbitrates with them like the rate of the zuz; and it does not have any interest; and the seventh year releases it.

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּא לַחֲזוֹר – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר. נִתְיָיאֲשׁוּ הַבְּעָלִים – אֵין מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶם, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישִׁין עַל הָאָבוּד.
human_translation: And if seeks to renege he may not renege. the owner despaired he may not separate on the basis of that because one may not separate on the basis of lost.
llm_translation: If he comes to retract - he does not retract. If the owners despaired - he does not separate from them, because we do not separate for the lost.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: פּוֹסֵק עִמָּהֶם כְּשַׁעַר הַזּוֹל – פְּשִׁיטָא! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא פָּסַק – כְּמִי שֶׁפָּסַק דָּמֵי.
human_translation: The Master said: He may contract with them according to the low rate. Isn’t obvious? This teaches us even though he did not contract considered like one who did contract
llm_translation: Master said: He decides with them like the gate of the Zohar - obvious! This is what he is teaching us, even though he did not decide - it is as if he decided the money.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם רִבִּית – מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּכִי לֵית לֵיהּ – לָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ, כִּי אִית לֵיהּ נָמֵי – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם רִבִּית.
human_translation: And this is not subject to interest. What is the reason Since, when has no he does not give when has also is not subject to interest.
llm_translation: And there is no interest in it - what is the reason? Since when there is none - he does not give it, but if there is also - there is no interest in it.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ – דְּלָא קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ ״לֹא יִגּוֹשׂ״.
human_translation: And the Sabbatical does not cancel is that concerning this one cannot read “He shall not exact
llm_translation: And the seventh year does not release it - for we do not read in it "he shall not oppress."

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּא לַחְזוֹר, אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר – אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בְּכֹהֵן; אֲבָל כֹּהֵן בְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, אִם בָּא לַחְזוֹר – חוֹזֵר. דִּתְנַן: נָתַן לוֹ מָעוֹת וְלֹא מָשַׁךְ הֵימֶנּוּ פֵּירוֹת – יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: And if seeks to renege he cannot renege. Rav Pappa said: They taught only a homeowner, with a priest. However, a priest with a homeowner, if he seeks to renege, he may renege. As we learned gave money but did not pull produce, can renege
llm_translation: If he comes to retract, he does not retract - Rav Papa said: They only taught this regarding the homeowner with a Kohen; but a Kohen with a homeowner, if he comes to retract, he may retract. As we learned: If he gave him money and did not draw produce from him - he is able to retract with it.

hebrew_text: נִתְיָיאֲשׁוּ הַבְּעָלִים אֵין מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישִׁין עַל הָאָבוּד – פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲקוּן; מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא אֲקַנְתָּא מִילְּתָא הִיא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: the owner despaired he may not separate on the basis of that because one may not separate on the basis of lost. Isn’t obvious, No, necessary where produced stalks Lest you say growth of stalks is matter, teaches us
llm_translation: The owners despaired, they do not separate for them, because they do not separate for the lost - obvious! Not necessary, for it is established; lest you say it is an acquired matter, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הַמַּלְוֶה מָעוֹת אֶת הַכֹּהֵן וְאֶת הַלֵּוִי בְּבֵית דִּין, וָמֵתוּ – מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן בְּחֶזְקַת אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט. וְאֶת הֶעָנִי בְּבֵית דִּין, וָמֵת – מַפְרִישׁ עָלָיו בְּחֶזְקַת עֲנִיֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל. רַבִּי אַחַי אוֹמֵר: בְּחֶזְקַת עֲנִיֵּי עוֹלָם.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: one who lends money to a priest or to a Levite in court and they died he separates on the basis of that with the presumption that tribe And to a poor person in court, and died separates on the basis of that with the presumption the poor of the Jewish people Rabbi Aḥai says: with the presumption the poor of the world
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: One who lends money to a Kohen or Levi in court, and they die - he separates the debt upon them with the presumption of that tribe. And one who lends to a poor person in court, and they die - he separates the debt upon him with the presumption of the poor of Israel. Rabbi Achai says: He separates it with the presumption of the eternal poor.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: What is between
llm_translation: What is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ עֲנִיֵּי כוּתִיִּים.
human_translation: between them poor Samaritans.
llm_translation: There is a difference between them, the poor of the Kutim.

hebrew_text: הֶעֱשִׁיר הֶעָנִי – אֵין מַפְרִישׁ עָלָיו, וְזָכָה הַלָּה בְּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: the poor person became wealthy may no separate based on his and acquires in his possession.
llm_translation: The rich the poor - not separates upon him, and merited the curse in what that in his hand.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, מַאי שְׁנָא לְמִיתָה דַּעֲבוּד תַּקַּנְתָּא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לַעֲשִׁירוּת דְּלָא עֲבוּד תַּקַּנְתָּא? מִיתָה שְׁכִיחָא, עֲשִׁירוּת לָא שְׁכִיחָא. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: חַבְרָךְ מִית – אַשַּׁר, אִיתְעַשַּׁר – לָא תְּאַשַּׁר.
human_translation: And the Sages, what is different about death, that they instituted an ordinance and what is different about wealth, that they did not institute an ordinance? Death is common, wealth is not common, Rav Pappa said: This that people say: your friend died, believe became wealthy, do not believe
llm_translation: The sages, what is the difference regarding death which is a matter of divine decree, and what is the difference regarding wealth which is not a matter of divine decree? Death is common, wealth is not common. Rav Papa said, this is what people say: "When your friend dies - be silent, when he becomes wealthy - do not be silent."

hebrew_text: מֵת – צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת וְכוּ׳: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: יוֹרְשִׁין שֶׁיָּרְשׁוּ. וּמִי אִיכָּא יוֹרְשִׁין דְּלָא יָרְתִי?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁיָּרְשׁוּ קַרְקַע, וְלֹא שֶׁיָּרְשׁוּ כְּסָפִים.
human_translation: died, needs to obtain permission is taught Rabbi says heirs who inherited. And are there heirs who do not inherit? Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: who inherited land, and not who inherited money,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Meit - tzarich litol reshut v'chul: tanya, Rabbi omer: yorshin sheyarshu. Umi ikka yorshin d'la yarati?! Ela amar Rabbi Yochanan: sheyarshu karka, v'lo sheyarshu kesafim." English translation: "One who dies - requires permission, etc.: It was taught, Rabbi says: The heirs inherit what they inherit. But are there heirs who do not inherit?! Rather Rabbi Yochanan said: They inherit land, but they do not inherit money."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: הִנִּיחַ מְלֹא מַחַט – גּוֹבֶה מְלֹא מַחַט. מְלֹא קַרְדּוֹם – גּוֹבֶה מְלֹא קַרְדּוֹם. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ הִנִּיחַ מְלֹא מַחַט – גּוֹבֶה מְלֹא קַרְדּוֹם;
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: left to fill a needle, collects, a full needle to fill an ax, collects a full ax And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even left to fill a needle, collects a full ax
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan said: If one left a full measure of a barleycorn - he is liable for a full measure of a barleycorn. A full measure of a carob bean - he is liable for a full measure of a carob bean. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if he left a full measure of a barleycorn - he is liable for a full measure of a carob bean.

hebrew_text: וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה דְּקַטִּינָא דְאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: And this is like the incident the small of Abaye.
llm_translation: And like the incident of the small jug of Abaye.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאָמַר לְלֵוִי: ״מַעֲשֵׂר יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּיָדִי״, אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לִתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁבּוֹ. ״כּוֹר מַעֲשֵׂר יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ – חוֹשְׁשִׁין לִתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁבּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught an Israelite who said to a Levite: There is tithe of yours in my possession one is not concerned about teruma of the tithe that is in it, There is a kor of tithe of yours in my possession, one is concerned about teruma of the tithe that is in it.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If a Israelite said to a Levite, "You have a tithe in my possession," we are not concerned about the separation of the tithe within it. If he said, "You have a heap of tithe in my possession," we are concerned about the separation of the tithe within it.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאָמַר לְלֵוִי ״מַעֲשֵׂר יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּיָדִי, וְהֵילָךְ דָּמָיו״, אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא עֲשָׂאוֹ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר. ״כּוֹר מַעֲשֵׂר יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּיָדִי, וְהֵילָךְ דָּמָיו״, חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא עֲשָׂאוֹ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: What is saying? Abaye said: This is what it is saying: an Israelite who said to a Levite: There is tithe of yours in my possession, and here is money it, one is not concerned perhaps converted teruma of the tithe for elsewhere. There is a kor of tithe of yours in my possession, and here is money it, one is concerned perhaps he converted it teruma of the tithe for elsewhere.
llm_translation: What is he saying? Abaye said, thus he is saying: If a Israel said to Levi, "You have a tithe in my possession, and its value is yours," we are not concerned that perhaps he designated it as a terumah tithe in another place. "You have a pit of tithe in my possession, and its value is yours," we are concerned that perhaps he designated it as a terumah tithe in another place.

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ בְּרַשִּׁיעֵי עָסְקִינַן, דְּשָׁקְלִי דְּמֵי וּמְשַׁוּוּ לֵיהּ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר?!
human_translation: Is that to say we are dealing with wicked who take money and convert it teruma of the tithe?
llm_translation: Now we are dealing with the wicked tax collectors, who took money and equated it with the tithe offering?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאָמַר לְבֶן לֵוִי ״מַעֲשֵׂר לְאָבִיךְ בְּיָדִי, הֵילָךְ דָּמָיו״, אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא עֲשָׂאוֹ אָבִיו תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר. ״כּוֹר מַעֲשֵׂר לְאָבִיךְ בְּיָדִי, וְהֵילָךְ דָּמָיו״, חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא עֲשָׂאוֹ אָבִיו תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Mesharshiyya, son of Rav Idi, said this is what is saying: an Israelite who said to the son of a Levite: tithe of your father’s in my possession, here is money it, not concerned perhaps his father converted it teruma of the tithe for elsewhere, a kor of tithe of your father’s in my possession, and here is money it; is concerned perhaps his father converted it teruma of the tithe for elsewhere,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Mesharshya son of Rav Idi said thus: Israel who said to the son of Levi, "A tithe for your father is in my hand, go, its value," we are not concerned that perhaps his father made his tithe a contribution for another place. "A pit for your father's tithe is in my hand, go, its value," we are concerned that perhaps his father made his tithe a contribution for another place.

hebrew_text: וְכִי נֶחְשְׁדוּ חֲבֵרִים לִתְרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַמּוּקָּף?!
human_translation: And are ḥaverim , suspected of separating that is not situated near
llm_translation: And if friends were suspected of not contributing from the circumference?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: בֶּן יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאָמַר לְלֵוִי ״כָּךְ אָמַר לִי אַבָּא: מַעֲשֵׂר לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ אוֹ ״מַעֲשֵׂר לְאָבִיךְ בְּיָדִי״ – חוֹשְׁשִׁין לִתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁבּוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא קִיץ לָא הֲוָה מְתַקֵּן לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. ״כּוֹר מַעֲשֵׂר לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ אוֹ ״כּוֹר מַעֲשֵׂר לְאָבִיךְ בְּיָדִי״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לִתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁבּוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּקִיץ תַּקּוֹנֵי תַּקְּנֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: This is what is saying: the son of an Israelite who said to a Levite: This is what my father told me, tithe of yours in my possession, or tithe of your father’s in my possession, is concerned about teruma of the tithe that is in it Since it is not a set the homeowner would not have rendered fit for him a kor of tithe of yours in my possession, or a kor of tithe of your father’s in my possession, not concerned about teruma of the tithe that is in it. Since it is a set the homeowner rendered fit
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said, thus he is saying: A son of Israel who said to Levi, "So my father said to me: 'Tithe for yourself in my hand' or 'Tithe for your father in my hand' - we are concerned about the tithe offering within it, since the homeowner did not designate it. 'Measure out a tithe for yourself in my hand' or 'Measure out a tithe for your father in my hand' - we are not concerned about the tithe offering within it, since the homeowner has designated it.

hebrew_text: וְכִי יֵשׁ לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת לִתְרוֹם תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר?! אִין, אַבָּא אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן גַּמְלָא הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אַבָּא אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן גַּמְלָא אוֹמֵר: ״וְנֶחְשַׁב לָכֶם תְּרוּמַתְכֶם״ –
human_translation: And does the homeowner have permission to separate teruma of the tithe Yes; is Abba Elazar ben Gamla. As it is taught Abba Elazar ben Gamla says: “And the gift that you set apart [ terumatkhem ] shall be reckoned to you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Does the homeowner have the authority to separate the tithe of the tithe?! No, Abba Elazar ben Gamla it is. As it was taught, Abba Elazar ben Gamla says: "And it shall be counted to you as your tithe" -

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁתֵּי תְּרוּמוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר: אַחַת תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר; כְּשֵׁם שֶׁתְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה נִיטֶּלֶת בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה, כָּךְ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר נִיטֶּלֶת בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה; וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת לִתְרוֹם תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה, כָּךְ יֵשׁ לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת לִתְרוֹם תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: The verse speaks of two terumot one standard teruma and one teruma of the tithe. Just as standard teruma is taken by estimate, and by thought, so too, teruma of the tithe may be taken by estimate and by thought. And just as the homeowner has permission, to separate standard teruma , so too, the homeowner has permission to separate teruma of the tithe.
llm_translation: In two terumot the Scripture speaks: one terumah gedolah and one terumat ma'aser; just as terumah gedolah is taken with estimation and intention, so too terumat ma'aser is taken with estimation and intention; and just as the homeowner has the authority to give terumah gedolah, so too the homeowner has the authority to give terumat ma'aser.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּנִּיחַ פֵּירוֹת, לִהְיוֹת מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן תְּרוּמָה וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת; מָעוֹת, לִהְיוֹת מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי – מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהֵן קַיָּימִין. אִם אָבְדוּ – הֲרֵי זֶה חוֹשֵׁשׁ מֵעֵת לְעֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: one who sets aside produce he will separate terumot and tithes with it, money he will separate second tithe with it, separate with them, based on the presumption that are extant. If they were lost, he must be concerned from the time until the time, the statement of Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who leaves fruits unattended, in order to separate terumah and tithes from them; coins, in order to separate from them the second tithe - one separates from them with the presumption that they are still intact. If they are lost - he is concerned from time to time, the words of Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הַיַּיִן – בְּקִידּוּם שֶׁל מוֹצָאֵי הַחַג, וּבְהוֹצָאַת סְמָדַר, וּבִשְׁעַת כְּנִיסַת מַיִם בְּבוֹסֶר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One checks the wine at three times When the east wind at the conclusion of the festival and when the grape buds emerge and at the time water enters the unripe grape.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In three stages one examines the wine - at the outset of the Festival's conclusion, and during the removal of the Seder plate, and at the time of water entering the winepress.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי מֵעֵת לְעֵת? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מֵעֵת לְעֵת שֶׁל בְּדִיקָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי:
human_translation: What From the time until the time? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: from the time checked until the time Rabbi Elazar ben Antigonus says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yannai:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is "from time to time"? Rabbi Yochanan said: From time to time of examination. Rabbi Elazar ben Antigonus says in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Yannai:

hebrew_text: מֵעֵת לְעֵת שֶׁל הַנָּחָה.
human_translation: from the time set aside until the time
llm_translation: From time to time of the rest.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אִם אָבְדוּ – הֲרֵי זֶה חוֹשֵׁשׁ מֵעֵת לְעֵת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מֵעֵת לְעֵת שֶׁל בְּדִיקָה – שַׁפִּיר;
human_translation: We learned If they were lost, he must be concerned from the time until the time. Granted, according to the one who said from the time checked until the time well,
llm_translation: We learned: If they got lost - behold, this one is concerned from time to time. Granted, according to the one who says from time to time of inspection - it is fine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מֵעֵת לְעֵת שֶׁל הַנָּחָה – הַאי ״מֵעֵת לְעֵת״?! ״עַד מֵעֵת לְעֵת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But according to the one who said from the time set aside until the time this From the time until the time, should have until from the time to the time difficult
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says "from time to time of rest" - this "from time to time"?! "Until from time to time" is required for it! It is difficult.

hebrew_text: דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: חֲלוּקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵירָיו עַל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – דִּתְנַן: מִקְוֶה שֶׁנִּמְדַּד וְנִמְצָא חָסֵר; כׇּל טְהָרוֹת שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל גַּבָּיו לְמַפְרֵעַ – בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – טְמֵאוֹת.
human_translation: the statement of Rabbi Elazar. Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Elazar’s colleagues disagree with him, as we learned a ritual bath which was measured and found deficient all pure items that had been rendered in it, retroactive whether in the private domain or in the public domain, are impure.
llm_translation: The words of Rabbi Elazar: Rabbi Elazar said: His colleagues disagreed with Rabbi Elazar - as we learned: If a mikveh that was measured is found to be lacking; all purifications that were performed on his account are retroactively invalidated - whether in private domain or in public domain - they are impure.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא דַּחֲלוּקִין! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מַאי ״לְמַפְרֵעַ״ – מֵעֵת לְעֵת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is obvious that disagree lest you say what retroactive from the time until the time teaches us
llm_translation: The straightforward conclusion of the dispute! What might you say: What does "to rebel" mean - from time to time, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים כּוּ׳: תָּנָא: בְּקִידּוּם שֶׁל מוֹצָאֵי הַחַג שֶׁל תְּקוּפָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: at three times taught: when the east wind blows at the conclusion of the festival in season
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, in three chapters (Kiddushin 6): It was taught: In the early hours of the Festival of the Equinox.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים מוֹכְרִין אֶת הַתְּבוּאָה – לִפְנֵי הַזֶּרַע, וּבִשְׁעַת הַזֶּרַע, וּבִפְרוֹס הַפֶּסַח. וּבִשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים מוֹכְרִין אֶת הַיַּיִן – בִּפְרוֹס הַפֶּסַח, וּבִפְרוֹס עֲצֶרֶת, וּבִפְרוֹס הַחַג. וְשֶׁמֶן – מֵעֲצֶרֶת וְאֵילָךְ. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב פָּפָּא: לְשׁוּתָּפִין. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, מַאי? אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל יוֹמָא פִּירְקֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says at three times one sells the grain: Before the sowing, and during the time of the sowing, and before the Passover. And at three times one sells the wine: Before the Passover, and before Shavuot , and before the festival And oil from Shavuot and onward. With regard to what halakha Rava said, and some say Rav Pappa with regard to partners, From this forward, what Rava said: Every day is its time
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: In three periods one may sell produce - before planting, at the time of planting, and at the time of the Pesach festival. And in three periods one may sell wine - at the time of the Pesach festival, at the time of Shavuot, and at the time of Sukkot. And oil - from Shavuot onwards. For what purpose? Rava said, and some say Rav Papa: For partnership. From here onwards, what? Rava said: Every day is its own portion.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי כִּזְרוֹחַ הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וַיְמַן אֱלֹהִים רוּחַ קָדִים חֲרִישִׁית״ – מַאי ״חֲרִישִׁית״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמְּנַשֶּׁבֶת, עוֹשֶׂה תְּלָמִים תְּלָמִים בַּיָּם.
human_translation: “And it came to pass, when the sun arose, that God prepared a vehement [ ḥarishit ] east wind” What “ ḥarishit ”? Rav Yehuda says: at the time that blows, it forms many furrows in the sea,
llm_translation: "And it was like the appearance of the vision of the sun, and God set a wind from the east, a drying wind." - What is "drying"? Rav Yehudah said: At the time when it is calm, it makes furrows in the sea.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתַּךְ הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ עַל רֹאשׁ יוֹנָה וַיִּתְעַלָּף״?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמְּנַשֶּׁבֶת, מְשַׁתֶּקֶת כׇּל הָרוּחוֹת מִפָּנֶיהָ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר בְּגָדֶיךָ חַמִּים בְּהַשְׁקִט אֶרֶץ מִדָּרוֹם״. אָמַר רַבִּי תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵימָתַי בְּגָדֶיךָ חַמִּים? בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהִשְׁקִיט אֶרֶץ מִדָּרוֹם. שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמְּנַשֶּׁבֶת מְשַׁתֶּקֶת כׇּל הָרוּחוֹת מִפָּנֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabba said to him: If that is so, that which is written “And the sun beat upon the head of Jonah and he fainted” Rather, Rabba says: At the time that it blows, it silences all the winds before it. And this is as it is written: “You whose garments are hot, when the earth is still by reason of the south wind” Rabbi Taḥalifa bar Rav Ḥisda says Rav Ḥisda says When are your garments hot, when the earth is still by reason of the south wind, as at the time that blows, it silences all the winds before it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba: If so, is that what is written: "And the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, and he fainted"? Rather, Rabba said: At the moment when she is at rest, all the winds are silenced before her. And that is what is written: "When your garments are warm, when the earth is still from the south wind." Rabbi Tahalifa son of Rav Hisda said, Rav Hisda said: When are your garments warm? When the earth is still from the south wind. For at the moment when she is at rest, all the winds are silenced before her.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא הֲווֹ יָתְבִי. חָלֵיף וְאָזֵיל גְּנִיבָא עֲלַיְיהוּ, אֲמַר חַד לְחַבְרֵיהּ: נֵיקוּם מִקַּמֵּיהּ, דְּבַר אוֹרְיָין הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: מִקַּמֵּי פָּלְגָאָה נֵיקוּם?! אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אִיהוּ לְגַבַּיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּמַאי עָסְקִיתוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בְּרוּחוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda were sitting, Geneiva passed by them. One said to the other: Let us stand before him, as he is a son of Torah. The other said to him: Shall we stand before a quarrelsome In the meantime, came to them said to them: With what were you dealing They said to him: with winds.
llm_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Hisda were sitting. A thief passed by them, and one said to his friend: "Let us take revenge from him, for he is a descendant of the cursed Canaan." The other replied: "Shall we take revenge from descendants of the Flood?" Meanwhile, the thief came back to them, and he said to them: "What were you discussing?" They replied: "With spirits."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא, אָמַר רַב: אַרְבַּע רוּחוֹת מְנַשְּׁבוֹת בְּכׇל יוֹם, וְרוּחַ צְפוֹנִית מְנַשֶּׁבֶת עִם כּוּלָּן; שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא כֵּן, אֵין הָעוֹלָם מִתְקַיֵּים אֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת. וְרוּחַ דְּרוֹמִית קָשָׁה מִכּוּלָּן, וְאִלְמָלֵא בֶּן נֵץ מַעֲמִידָהּ, מַחְרֶבֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מִפָּנֶיהָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲמִבִּינָתְךָ יַאֲבֶר נֵץ יִפְרֹשׂ כְּנָפָיו לְתֵימָן״.
human_translation: He said to them: This is what Rav Ḥanan bar Rava says Rav says: Four winds blow on each day, and the north wind blows with each of as, if this were not so the world would not survive even one hour. And the south wind is harsher than all of them, and were it not Ben Netz, stops it destroy the entire world before it, as it is stated: “Does the hawk [ netz ] soar by your wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?”
llm_translation: He said to them: So said Rav Hanan son of Rava, said Rav: Four winds blow every day, and the northern wind blows with all of them; for if not, the world would not be sustained even for a single hour. And the southern wind is the harshest of all, and if not for the son of Nes, it would destroy the entire world before it, as it is stated: "Does the hawk soar by your wisdom and stretch its wings toward the south?"

hebrew_text: רָבָא וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק הֲווֹ יָתְבִי; הֲוָה חָלֵיף וְאָזֵיל רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּיָתֵיב בְּגוּהַרְקָא דְּדַהֲבָא וּפְרִיס עֲלֵיהּ סַרְבָּלָא דְכַרָּתֵי. רָבָא אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ, רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לָא אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ. אָמַר: דִּלְמָא מֵאִינָשֵׁי דְּבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא נִינְהוּ; רָבָא צָרִיךְ לְהוּ, אֲנָא לָא צְרִיכְנָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rava and Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak were sitting, Rav Naḥman bar Ya’akov was passing while sitting on a gilt carriage [ goharka ] and a green cloak [ sarbela ] spread over him. Rava went to him, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak did not go to him. He said: Perhaps they are members of the house of the Exilarch. Rava needs them, I do not need them.
llm_translation: Rava and Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak were sitting. Rav Nachman bar Yaakov was walking back and forth, sitting in a golden legged chair with a footstool of Karatei stones placed upon it. Rava went to greet him, but Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak did not go to greet him. He said: Perhaps they are important people from the Exilarch's house; Rava needs them, but I do not need them.

hebrew_text: כְּדַחֲזָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יַעֲקֹב הֲוָה, אָזֵיל לְגַבֵּיהּ. גַּלִּי לִדְרָעֵיהּ, אֲמַר: שַׁדְיָא נָשֵׁיב! אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי אָמַר רַב: אִשָּׁה מַפֶּלֶת בּוֹ; וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מַרְגָּלִית שֶׁבַּיָּם מַרְקֶבֶת בּוֹ; רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִשָּׁה מַסְרַחַת בּוֹ.
human_translation: When he saw that it was Rav Naḥman bar Ya’akov, he went to him. uncovered his arm said: Shadya is blowing. Rava says this is Rav says A woman miscarries in its And Shmuel says: Even a pearl [ margalit ] that is in the sea decomposes in its Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even the semen that is in a woman’s womb putrefies in its
llm_translation: As Rav Nachman bar Yaakov saw, he went after him. He uncovered his feet, and said: "A demon has returned!" Rava said, so said Rav: A woman causes him to stumble; and Shmuel said: Even a mermaid in the sea causes him to rot; Rabbi Yochanan said: Even a seminal emission in a woman's womb causes him to decay.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, וּשְׁלׇשְׁתָּן מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״כִּי הוּא בֵּין אַחִים יַפְרִיא יָבוֹא קָדִים רוּחַ ה׳ מִמִּדְבָּר עוֹלֶה וְיֵבוֹשׁ מְקוֹרוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. ״יֵבוֹשׁ מְקוֹרוֹ״ – זוֹ מְקוֹרָהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה. ״וְיֶחֱרַב מַעְיָינוֹ״ – זֶה שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִשָּׁה. ״הוּא יִשְׁסֶה אוֹצַר כׇּל כְּלִי חֶמְדָּה״ – זוֹ מַרְגָּלִית שֶׁבַּיָּם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, said And the three of them derived from one verse, “For though he be fruitful among the reed-plants, an east wind shall come, the wind of the Lord coming up from the wilderness, and his spring shall become dry, “His spring shall become dry,” this a woman’s womb. “And his fountain shall be dried up,” this semen that is in a woman’s womb. “He shall spoil the treasure of all precious vessels,” this a pearl in the sea.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, and three verses they expounded: "For between brothers he will be fruitful, a wind from the Lord will come, rising from the wilderness, and his source will dry up, etc." "His source will dry up" - this is the source of a woman. "And his spring will be destroyed" - this is the emission of seed within a woman. "He will plunder the treasure of all precious vessels" - this is the pearl in the sea.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: עָדֵי סוּרָאָה הוּא, דְּדָיְיקִי קְרָאֵי! מַאי ״כִּי הוּא בֵּין אַחִים יַפְרִיא״? אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ
human_translation: Rava says: This is from Sura, as they are precise verses. What “Though he be fruitful [ yafri ] among the reed-plants”? Rava said: Even
llm_translation: Rava said: It is the boundaries of Surah, for it is precise in its verses! What is "for he shall separate"? Rava said: Even

hebrew_text: שׁוּפְתָּא בְּקוֹפִינָא דְמָרָא – רָפְיָא. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ סִיכְּתָא בְּדַפְנָא – רָפְיָא. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ קַנְיָא בְּכוּפְתָּא – רָפְיָא.
human_translation: the handle in the hole [ kofina ] of the hoe [ mara ] becomes loose [ rafya ], Rav Yosef said: Even the peg into the wall becomes loose. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Even the reed into the basket becomes loose.
llm_translation: The edge of the basket of the master - it is invalid. Rav Yosef said: Even if a knife is in the basket - it is invalid. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Even if a reed is in the basket - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כׇּל גֵּט
llm_translation: We will return to you all the get.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהִגִּיעַ בַּשָּׁלִיחַ אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁלַח אַחֲרָיו שָׁלִיחַ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״גֵּט שֶׁנָּתַתִּי לְךָ, בָּטֵל הוּא״ – הֲרֵי זֶה בָּטֵל. קִידֵּם אֵצֶל אִשְׁתּוֹ אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁלַח אֶצְלָהּ שָׁלִיחַ, וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״גֵּט שֶׁשָּׁלַחְתִּי לִךְ, בָּטֵל הוּא״ – הֲרֵי זֶה בָּטֵל. אִם מִשֶּׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ – שׁוּב אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְבַטְּלוֹ.
human_translation: one who sends a bill of divorce to his wife and he reached the agent, or where he sent agent after him, and he said to The bill of divorce that I gave you, it is void, this is hereby void. his wife before or where he sent an agent to her, and he said, to The bill of divorce that I sent to you, it is void, this is hereby void. if once the bill of divorce had entered her possession, he can no longer render it void,
llm_translation: The one who sends a bill of divorce to his wife, and it reached the messenger or one who he sent after him as a messenger, and he said to him: "The bill of divorce that I gave you, it is nullified" – behold, it is nullified. If he preceded to his wife or he sent the messenger to her, and he said to her: "The bill of divorce that I sent to you, it is nullified" – behold, it is nullified. If the bill of divorce reached her hand – he cannot nullify it again.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה בֵּית דִּין מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר וּמְבַטְּלוֹ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ עוֹשִׂין כֵּן, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: initially, would convene a court elsewhere and render void Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that one should not do this, for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: In the first place, there was a court making from another place and nullifying it, Rabban Gamliel the Elder established that they should not do so, because of the order of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״הִגִּיעוֹ״ לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא ״הִגִּיעַ״ – וַאֲפִילּוּ מִמֵּילָא, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן לְצַעוֹרַהּ הוּא דְּקָא מִיכַּוֵּין.
human_translation: does not teach: He reached him; rather: He reached and even incidentally, And we do not say he intends to vex
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar 'higia' la katanei, ela 'higia' – va'afilu mimmela, ve'lo amrinan le'tzaorah hu de'ka michavein." English translation: "It is not taught 'he reached,' rather 'he reached' – even from afar, and we do not say that he is intent on the small bird."

hebrew_text: ״אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁלַח אַחֲרָיו שָׁלִיחַ״ – לְמָה לִי? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לָא אַלִּימָא שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ דְּבָתְרָא מִשְּׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ דְּקַמָּא – דִּלְבַטְּלֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I or where he sent agent after him? lest you say the agency of the latter, is not stronger than the agency of the former, that nullify teaches us
llm_translation: "Or that he sent after him a messenger" - Why do I need it? What might you say: Do not say that his sending after him is greater than his sending before him - that it would annul it, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: ״קָדַם הוּא אֵצֶל אִשְׁתּוֹ״ – לְמָה לִי? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי לָא אָמְרִינַן לְצַעוֹרַהּ קָא מִיכַּוֵּין – הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְשָׁלִיחַ, אֲבָל לְדִידַהּ וַדַּאי לְצַעוֹרַהּ קָא מִיכַּוֵּין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I his wife before lest you say when we don’t say intends to vex her this matter applies to the agent however, to her, he certainly intends to vex her, teaches us
llm_translation: "He preceded by his wife" - Why do I need this? What might you say: Because we did not say 'for his messenger he is preparing,' but certainly for his wife he is preparing, it is clear to us.

hebrew_text: ״אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁלַח אֶצְלָהּ שָׁלִיחַ״ – לְמָה לִי? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִיהוּ הוּא דְּלָא טָרַח אַדַּעְתָּא לְצַעוֹרַהּ, אֲבָל שָׁלִיחַ, דְּלָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ כִּי טָרַח – וַדַּאי לְצַעוֹרַהּ קָא מִיכַּוֵּין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I Or where he sent an agent to her, lest you say he would not exert with the intent to vex her, however, agent, as does not care he exerts certainly intends to vex her teaches us
llm_translation: "Or that he sent a messenger to her" - Why do I need this? What might you say: He is the one who did not bother to know her, but a messenger, who did not care if he bothered - surely he is focused on her, he is attentive to us.

hebrew_text: אִם מִשֶּׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְבַטְּלוֹ. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּמַהְדַּר עֲלֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא לְבַטּוֹלֵי; מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִיגַּלַּאי מִלְּתָא לְמַפְרֵעַ דְּבַטּוֹלֵי בַּטְּלֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If once the bill of divorce had entered her possession, he can no longer render it void, Isn’t obvious? No, necessary where he was going around searching for from the beginning to render it void Lest you say: it has become clear retroactively that he rendered it void teaches us
llm_translation: If the get reached her hand - he cannot annul it. It is obvious! It is not necessary for him to dwell upon it from the outset to annul it; lest you say: once the matter is revealed to the one who seeks to annul it, he will annul it, we have learned.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בָּטֵל הוּא״; ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי בּוֹ״ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין. ״פָּסוּל הוּא״; ״אֵינוֹ גֵּט״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: It is void [ batel hu ], I do not desire it, his statement takes effect It is invalid, It is not a bill of divorce, he said nothing,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "He is null"; "if it is possible in him" - his words stand. "He is disqualified"; "it is not a bill of divorce" - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּ״בָטֵל״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּלִבְּטִיל מַשְׁמַע?! וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אַיְבוּ, אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת; וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מְקַבֵּל מַתָּנָה, שֶׁאָמַר לְאַחַר שֶׁבָּאתָה מַתָּנָה לְיָדוֹ: ״מַתָּנָה זוֹ מְבוּטֶּלֶת״; ״תִּיבַּטֵּל״; ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי בָּהּ״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. ״בְּטֵלָה הִיא״; ״אֵינָהּ מַתָּנָה״ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין. אַלְמָא ״בָּטֵל״ מֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע!
human_translation: Is this to say that Batel , is a formulation that means: Let it become void, But didn’t Rabba bar Aivu say Rav Sheshet said, and some say Rabba bar Avuh says: one who receives a gift, who, after the gift had entered his possession, said: This gift is rendered void; Let it become void; I do not desire it, he said nothing. It is void [ betela he ], It is not a gift, his statement is effective, Apparently, Batel , means from the beginning,
llm_translation: In the matter of "nullifying" for the sake of nullification, does it imply nullification of significance?! And Rabba bar Avuha said in the name of Rav Sheshet; and some say he said in the name of Rabba bar Aivu: One may accept a gift, for he said to another after the gift came into his possession: "This gift is nullified"; "Let it be nullified"; "I have no interest in it" – he did not say anything. "It is nullified"; "It is not a gift" – his words stand. Therefore, it is evident that "nullifying" implies nullification from the outset!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״בָּטֵל״
human_translation: Abaye said: Batel ,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Batel."

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי לְשׁוֹנוֹת מַשְׁמַע – מַשְׁמַע דְּבָטֵל, וּמַשְׁמַע דְּלִיבְּטִיל. גַּבֵּי גֵּט לִישָּׁנָא דְּמַהֲנֵי בֵּיהּ קָאָמַר, גַּבֵּי מַתָּנָה לִישָּׁנָא דְּמַהֲנֵי בַּהּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: has two meanings, It means that void and it means that it will become void With regard to a bill of divorce, he stated the formulation that is effective with regard to it, With regard to a gift, he stated the formulation that is effective with regard to it,
llm_translation: Two languages imply - implies that it is nullified, and implies that it is not nullified. Regarding a bill of divorce, what is he saying about it, regarding a gift, what is he saying about it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, נְקִיטִינַן: שְׁלִיחַ מַתָּנָה הֲרֵי הוּא כִּשְׁלִיחַ הַגֵּט; נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said we have a tradition: An agent a gift is like an agent a bill of divorce. The practical difference that Take it is not considered as Acquire
llm_translation: Abaye said, we take: an agent of a gift, behold he is like an agent of a divorce document; it has emerged from her to "the recipient" not like "the rights" of money.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק דִּתְלֵי וְקָאֵי בְּעִיבְרָא דְּדַשָּׁא, וְקָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: ״בָּטֵל״ מַהוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Ravina found Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak as he was leaning on the bar of a door and was considering dilemma: What is void, shall stand
llm_translation: Ravina found Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak sitting between the rows in the study hall of Dasha, and he asked him: "What is the meaning of 'batel'?" This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: ״גֵּט זֶה לֹא יוֹעִיל״; ״לֹא יַתִּיר״; ״לֹא יַעֲזִיב״; ״לֹא יְשַׁלַּח״; ״לֹא יְגָרֵשׁ״; ״יְהֵא חֶרֶס״; ״יְהֵא כְּחֶרֶס״ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says, and some say it was taught in a baraita , This bill of divorce shall not be effective, shall not release, shall not cause to leave, shall not send away, shall not divorce, shall be pottery, shall be like pottery, his statement is effective,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, and some say it was taught in a baraita: "This bill of divorce shall not be effective"; "It shall not permit"; "It shall not abandon"; "It shall not send away"; "It shall not divorce"; "Let it be like pottery"; "Let it be as pottery" - his words stand.

hebrew_text: ״אֵינוֹ מוֹעִיל״; ״אֵינוֹ מַתִּיר״; ״אֵינוֹ מַעֲזִיב״; ״אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּחַ״; ״אֵינוֹ מְגָרֵשׁ״; ״חֶרֶס הוּא״; ״כְּחֶרֶס הוּא״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: has no effect, does not release, does not cause to leave, does not send away, does not divorce, it is pottery, it is like pottery, he said nothing.
llm_translation: "Does not benefit"; "Does not permit"; "Does not abandon"; "Does not release"; "Does not divorce"; "It is earthenware"; "Like earthenware" - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״הֲרֵי הוּא חֶרֶס״, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵ״הֲרֵי הוּא הֶקְדֵּשׁ״; ״הֲרֵי הוּא הֶפְקֵר״?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is It is hereby pottery? Ravina said to Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, and some say Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: what is different from It is hereby consecrated It is hereby ownerless
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "Behold it is earthenware vessel," what is it? Ravina said to Rav Acha, son of Rava, and some say Rav Acha, son of Rava said to Rav Ashe: What is the difference between "behold it is consecrated" and "behold it is ownerless"?

hebrew_text: חוֹזֵר וּמְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: חוֹזֵר וּמְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ; וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: go back and divorce with it, or may he not go back and divorce with it, Rav Naḥman says: He may go back and divorce with it, and Rav Sheshet says: He may not go back and divorce with it. And the halakha is in accordance with of Rav Naḥman,
llm_translation: He returns and divorces in it, or does he not return and divorce in it? Rav Nachman said: He returns and divorces in it; and Rav Sheshet said: He does not return and divorce in it. And the halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav Nachman.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: חוֹזֶרֶת.
human_translation: Is that so? But don’t we maintain the halakha is in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: can retract
llm_translation: I?! And this is consistent with the ruling of Rabbi Yochanan, who said: "It returns."

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם – דִּיבּוּר וְדִיבּוּר הוּא, אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר; וְהָכָא – נְהִי דְּבַטְּלֵיהּ לִשְׁלִיחוּתָא דְּשָׁלִיחַ, גִּיטָּא גּוּפֵיהּ מִי קָא בָטֵיל?
human_translation: How can be compared? There, it is speech and speech speech comes and nullifies speech, But here, though that rendered void the agency of the agent, does render void the bill of divorce itself?
llm_translation: So now?! There - speech and speech it is, comes speech and nullifies speech; and here - is it possible to nullify the bill of divorce itself through the agency of the agent?

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה. אִיתְּמַר, בִּפְנֵי כַּמָּה הוּא מְבַטְּלוֹ? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם; רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: initially would convene It was stated: in the presence of how many must he render it void? Rav Naḥman says: in the presence of two Rav Sheshet says: in the presence of three
llm_translation: In the beginning, he would do. It was stated: before how many is he nullifying it? Rav Nachman said: before two; Rav Sheshet said: before three.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה – ״בֵּית דִּין״ קָתָנֵי. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם – לְבֵי תְרֵי נָמֵי ״בֵּית דִּין״ קָרֵי לְהוּ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּתְנַן: ״מוֹסְרַנִי לִפְנֵיכֶם
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said in the presence of three teaches court, And Rav Naḥman said in the presence of two two are also called a court, Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say As we learned I transfer in your presence,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said in the presence of three - "Beit Din" is taught. And Rav Nachman said in the presence of two - to two people "Beit Din" is called. Rav Nachman said: How do I know this? As we learned: "He delivered me before you."

hebrew_text: פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי הַדַּיָּינִין שֶׁבְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: so-and-so and so-and-so the judges, in such and such a place,
llm_translation: Ploni and Almoni the judges in the place of Ploni.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת – אַטּוּ תַּנָּא כִּי רוֹכְלָא לִיחְשֹׁיב וְלֵיזִיל?!
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet Is that to say that the tanna should have continued counting like a peddler?
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet - did the Tanna really say that a merchant should calculate and go out?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּתְנַן: הַדַּיָּינִים חוֹתְמִין לְמַטָּה, אוֹ הָעֵדִים. מַאי, לָאו דַּיָּינִים דֻּומְיָא דְּעֵדִים – מָה עֵדִים שְׁנַיִם, אַף דַּיָּינִים נָמֵי שְׁנַיִם? וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת – מִידֵּי אִירְיָא?! הָא כִּדְאִיתָא, וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say As we learned The judges sign below or the witnesses What, is it not judges are similar to witnesses? Just as two witnesses, so too, also two judges. And Rav Sheshet Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this to her? For it was taught: The judges sign below, or the witnesses. What, are not the judges similar to the witnesses - just as witnesses are two, so too judges are also two? And Rav Sheshet - from the house of the blind?! This one as it was taught, and this one as it was taught.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא דַּיָּינִים, לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא עֵדִים? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּלָא שְׁנָא כָּתוּב בִּלְשׁוֹן דַּיָּינִים וְחָתְמִי עֵדִים, וְלָא שְׁנָא כָּתוּב בִּלְשׁוֹן עֵדִים וְחָתְמִי דַּיָּינִים.
human_translation: Why do I to teach judges, why do I to teach witnesses This teaches us that is no difference is written in the terminology of judges and witnesses sign and is no difference is written in the terminology of witnesses and judges sign
llm_translation: Why do I need the testimony of wine, why do I need the testimony of witnesses? This teaches us that it does not differ whether it is written in the language of wine and signed by witnesses, or whether it is written in the language of witnesses and signed by wine.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם: מַאי ״מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם״? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת מַמְזֵרִים. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת עֲגוּנוֹת.
human_translation: for the betterment of the world. What for the betterment of the world? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: for the benefit of children born from an adulterous relationship [ mamzerim ], Reish Lakish says: For the betterment of deserted wives,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Because of the rectification of the world: What is 'because of the rectification of the world'? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because of the rectification of mamzerim. Reish Lakish said: Because of the rectification of agunot."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת מַמְזֵרִים – סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם; וּבֵי תְרֵי לֵית לְהוּ קָלָא; וְהִיא לָא שָׁמְעָה וְלָא יָדְעָה וְאָזְלָה וּמִינַּסְבָא, וְאִיכָּא מַמְזֵרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan, says for the betterment of mamzerim , holds in accordance with Rav Naḥman, who says in the presence of two And two people do not publicity, she does not hear And she does not know she will go and marry, and there are mamzerim
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Because of the improvement of mamzerim - he holds like Rav Nachman, who said in the presence of two; and in the case of two, there is no light; and she did not hear and did not know and went and committed adultery, and there are mamzerim.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת עֲגוּנוֹת – סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, דְּאָמַר בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה; וּבֵי תְלָתָא אִית לְהוּ קָלָא; וְשָׁמְעָה וְיָדְעָה וְלָא מִינַּסְבָא; וְתַקָּנַת עֲגוּנוֹת הוּא דְּאִיכָּא.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, says for the betterment of deserted wives, holds in accordance with Rav Sheshet, who says: in the presence of three And since three publicity, she does hear and know and she would not marry but there is betterment of deserted wives,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Due to the fixing of the corners - he thought like Rav Sheshet, who said in the presence of three; and in the house of three there is a voice; and she heard and knew and did not flee; and the fixing of the corners is what there is.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּטְּלוֹ – מְבוּטָּל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לֹא לְבַטְּלוֹ וְלֹא לְהוֹסִיף עַל תְּנָאוֹ, שֶׁאִם כֵּן, מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה?
human_translation: The Sages taught: he rendered it void, is rendered void; the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He is unable to render it void, and cannot add on to his condition as if so, what advantage does the court have,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If it was nullified, it is nullified, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He cannot neither nullify it nor add to his stipulation, for if so, what power does the court have?

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בָּטֵל גִּיטָּא, וּמִשּׁוּם ״מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה״, שָׁרֵינַן אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְעָלְמָא? אִין, כׇּל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ – אַדַּעְתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאַפְקְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקִידּוּשִׁין מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And is there anything that by Torah law renders the bill of divorce void and due to What advantage does the court have, we permit a married woman to anyone? Yes, anyone who betroths betroths upon the will of the Sages, and the Sages expropriated his betrothal from him
llm_translation: And is there anyone who can nullify a bill of divorce from the Torah? And because of "What power does the court have?" we permit a woman to marry anyone? No, anyone who sanctifies - the consent of the Rabbis sanctifies, and the Rabbis separate her for her sanctifications.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תִּינַח דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּכַסְפָּא, קַדֵּישׁ בְּבִיאָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן לִבְעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: works out well where he betrothed with money, he betrothed by means of sexual intercourse what is there to say? The Sages declared his sexual intercourse licentious sexual intercourse,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "If one sanctified with money, sanctified with intercourse, what is there to say?" The Rabbis have compared his intercourse to the intercourse of promiscuity.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אָמַר לַעֲשָׂרָה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל זֶה שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי זֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל אֶלָּא זֶה בִּפְנֵי זֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: said to ten Write a bill of divorce for my wife, he can render void this not before that the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He can render void only this is before that
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: He said to ten, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," he can annul this not in the presence of this, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He can only annul this in the presence of this.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בְּעֵדוּת שֶׁבָּטְלָה מִקְצָתָהּ בָּטְלָה כּוּלָּהּ קָמִיפַּלְגִי; רַבִּי סָבַר: עֵדוּת שֶׁבָּטְלָה מִקְצָתָהּ
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? They disagree with regard to testimony that was partially invalidated is entirely invalidated. Rabbi holds: Testimony that was partially invalidated
llm_translation: With what did he argue? With the testimony that if part of it is nullified, all of it is nullified; Rabbi holds: if part of it is nullified.

hebrew_text: לֹא בָּטְלָה כּוּלָּהּ; וְאִי אָזְלִי הָנָךְ כָּתְבִי וְיָהֲבִי – לִיכְתְּבוּ וְלִיתְּבוּ;
human_translation: is not entirely invalidated; and if these go write and give let them write and give
llm_translation: The entire Torah has not been nullified; and if they the letters were to go there, to be written and to be given - they should be written and they should be given.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: עֵדוּת שֶׁבָּטְלָה מִקְצָתָהּ בָּטְלָה כּוּלָּהּ; וְהָנָךְ לָא יָדְעִי, וְאָזְלִי וְכָתְבִי וְיָהֲבִי; וְשָׁרוּ אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: Testimony that was partially invalidated is entirely invalidated. And those do not know And go and write and give and they permit a married woman to anyone.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: If part of the testimony is nullified, all of it is nullified; and there, I did not know, so I went, wrote, and gave; and the wife of a man may remarry.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עֵדוּת שֶׁבָּטְלָה מִקְצָתָהּ לֹא בָּטְלָה כּוּלָּהּ; וְהָכָא, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – קָסָבַר: מִלְּתָא דְּמִתְעַבְדָא בְּאַפֵּי עַשְׂרָה – צְרִיכָא בֵּי עַשְׂרָה לְמִישְׁלְפַהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone testimony that was partially invalidated is not entirely invalidated; and here, this is the reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel He holds a matter that is performed in the presence of ten requires of ten to revoke it.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The entire world, its testimony, if part of it is nullified, it is not all nullified; and here, that is the reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel - he holds: a matter that is dependent on the agreement of ten requires the presence of ten to annul it.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״כּוּלְּכֶם״, מַהוּ? טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: עֵדוּת שֶׁבָּטְלָה מִקְצָתָהּ בָּטְלָה כּוּלָּהּ – וְהָנֵי, כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ ״כּוּלְּכֶם״, לָא מָצוּ כָּתְבִי וְיָהֲבִי;
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before All of you what is reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel because he holds testimony that was partially invalidated is entirely invalidated, And these since he said to them All of you are not able write and give
llm_translation: He asked them: "All of you," what is it? The reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, because he holds: If part of the testimony is nullified, all of it is nullified - and these, since he said to them "all of you," they did not find a scribe to write and give.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא, טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: כֹּל מִלְּתָא דְּמִתְעַבְדָא בְּאַפֵּי בֵּי עַשְׂרָה, צְרִיכָא בֵּי עַשְׂרָה לְמִישְׁלְפַהּ – וְהִילְכָּךְ, אֲפִילּוּ ״כּוּלְּכֶם״ נָמֵי?
human_translation: Or perhaps the reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel because he holds a matter that is performed in the presence of ten requires of ten to revoke it. And therefore, even All of you as well.
llm_translation: Or perhaps, the reason for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel's opinion is because he holds: any matter that is dependent on the decision of a group of ten requires the consent of the entire group of ten – and therefore, even "all of you" as well?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל זֶה שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי זֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל אֶלָּא זֶה בִּפְנֵי זֶה. וְהָא שְׁנַיִם, דְּכִי ״כוּלְּכֶם״ דָּמוּ, וּפְלִיגִי!
human_translation: Come hear one said to two Give a bill of divorce to my wife, he can render void this not before that the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He can render void only this is before that But two are equivalent to: All of you, And disagree,
llm_translation: Come and hear: he said to two, "Give a bill of divorce to my wife," he can annul this not in the presence of this, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He can only annul this in the presence of this. And these two, for "all of you" they are similar, and they disagree!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִי בְּעֵדֵי כְתִיבָה – הָכִי נָמֵי; הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בְּעֵדֵי הוֹלָכָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: If witnesses of writing indeed here we are dealing with witnesses of delivery
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: If it is written with witnesses - so it is true; here, what are we dealing with? Witnesses of divorce.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִיסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמַר לָזֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְלָזֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל זֶה שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי זֶה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּעֵדֵי הוֹלָכָה – שַׁפִּיר; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּעֵדֵי כְתִיבָה, מִי מִצְטָרְפִי?! הָא אָמַר מָר: אֵין עֵדוּתָן מִצְטָרֶפֶת, עַד שֶׁיִּרְאוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד! דִּלְמָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: This too, stands to reason, as the latter clause teaches: one said to this on his own and to that on his own, he can nullify this not before that Granted, if you say to witnesses of delivery well, However, if you say to witnesses of writing, can they combine together But doesn’t the Master say: The testimony of does not combine together until the two of them see as one, Perhaps he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa,
llm_translation: So it was thought to be established, as it is taught in the conclusion: He said to this one by himself, and to that one by himself – he can annul this one without being in the presence of that one. If you say it is in the case of witnesses of walking – it is fine; but if you say it is in the case of witnesses of writing, do they join together?! But didn't the Master say: Their testimonies only join together when they see each other as one! Perhaps like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha, he agrees.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: שְׁמַעִית מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא תַּרְתֵּי – חֲדָא כְּרַבִּי, וַחֲדָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל; וְלָא יָדַעְנָא הֵי כְּרַבִּי וְהֵי כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda said: I heard from Rabbi Abba two one in accordance with Rabbi and one in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and I do not know which is in accordance with Rabbi and which is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
