llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah: I heard two teachings from the mouth of Rabbi Abba - one like Rabbi, and one like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel; and we do not know whether it should be like Rabbi or like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: נִיחְזֵי אֲנַן – דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה וְעָשָׂה רַבִּי כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי פַּרְטָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פַּרְטָא בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי פַּרְטָא הַגָּדוֹל: אִם כֵּן, מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה? וְחָזַר רַבִּי וְעָשָׂה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Let us see as when Rav Dimi came he said: an incident and Rabbi acted in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis. Rabbi Perata, son of Rabbi Elazar ben Perata son of the son of Rabbi Perata the Great, said before If so, what advantage does the court have? And Rabbi reversed and acted in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Let us see, for when Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi acted in accordance with the words of the Sages. Rabbi Parta, the son of Rabbi Elazar ben Parta, the grandson of Rabbi Parta the Great, said before him: If so, what power does the court have? And Rabbi reconsidered and acted like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּהָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הָךְ כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: And from that this in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, that in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: And from the fact that like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, he struck like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה דְּמִן אוּשָׁא סָבַר, חֲדָא כְּרַבִּי וַחֲדָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: חַמְשָׁה סָבֵי הֲוֵינַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה דְּמִן אוּשָׁא, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא קַמֵּיהּ, וְאַשְׁקְלֵיהּ גִּיטָּא עַל כּוּרְחֵיהּ. אֲמַר לַן: זִילוּ אִטַּמּוּרוּ וּכְתֻבוּ לַהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoshiya from Usha also holds one is in accordance with Rabbi and one is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. As Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: We were five elders before Rabbi Yoshiya from Usha. A certain man came before him, and extracted a bill of divorce from him against his will. said to us: Go hide and write for her
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yoshiyah from Usha thought, one like Rabbi and one like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. For Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: We were five students standing before Rabbi Yoshiyah from Usha, a certain man came before him, and placed a document on his lap. He said to us: Go, sign and give it to him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כְּרַבִּי, כִּי מִיטַּמְּרִי מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ;
human_translation: And if it enters your mind in accordance with Rabbi if they hide, what of it? Rather, learn from it he holds in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel,
llm_translation: And if it should enter your mind like Rabbi, when it becomes mixed, what is it? Rather, learn from it like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אִידַּךְ נָמֵי כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, לְמָה לְהוּ אִטַּמּוֹרֵי? לִיבַּדְּרוּ אִיבַּדּוֹרֵי! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ – חֲדָא כְּרַבִּי, וַחֲדָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind the other also in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, why would they need to hide? Let them scatter, Rather, learn from it one in accordance with Rabbi and one in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind to say the other opinion is also like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, why do they need to be sealed? Let them be examined! Rather, learn from it - one like Rabbi, and one like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן. וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן ״מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה״?! וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: And Rava says Rav Naḥman halakha in accordance with Rabbi in both But doesn’t Rav Naḥman the court have an advantage? But doesn’t Rav Naḥman say Shmuel says,
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: The halakha is like Rabbi in both cases. And Rav Nachman does not have the following objection: "What is the strength of the court beautiful?!" And Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel:

hebrew_text: יְתוֹמִין שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחֲלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי אֲבִיהֶן, בֵּית דִּין מַעֲמִידִין לָהֶן אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, וּבוֹרְרִים לָהֶן חֵלֶק יָפֶה. הִגְדִּילוּ – יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת. וְרַב נַחְמָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: הִגְדִּילוּ – אֵין יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת; דְּאִם כֵּן, מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה?
human_translation: orphans who came to divide their father’s property, the court appoints a steward apotropos for them, and they select for them, a fine portion. have grown up, can protest And Rav Naḥman said his own When they have grown up, they cannot protest, for if so, what advantage the court have?
llm_translation: Orphans who come to divide their father's estate, the court appoints for them an apotropos, and they choose for them a good portion. If they grow up - they are able to protest. And Rav Nachman said: If they grow up - they are not able to protest; for if so, what power does the court have?

hebrew_text: הָתָם מָמוֹנָא, הָכָא אִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: There, monetary matters, Here, prohibition,
llm_translation: There, it is money, here, it is prohibition.

hebrew_text: גִּידּוּל בַּר רְעִילַאי שַׁדַּר לַהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ; אֲזַל שְׁלִיחָא, אַשְׁכְּחַהּ דַּהֲוָה יָתְבָה וְנָוְולָה, אֲמַר לַהּ: הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִיל הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא, וְתָא לִמְחַר. אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ. פְּתַח וַאֲמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״.
human_translation: Giddul bar Re’ilai sent a bill of divorce to his wife. The agent went found that she was sitting and weaving navla He said to her: This is your bill of divorce. She said to him: At least go from here now and come tomorrow went to and told him opened and said: Blessed is He Who is good and does good,
llm_translation: Gidul son of Reilai sent a get to his wife; the messenger went, found her sitting and weaving, he said to her: "Here is your get." She said to him: "Go now from here, and come back tomorrow." He went back to him and said to him. He opened and said: "Blessed is the One who is good and does good."

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״, וְלָא בָּטֵל גִּיטָּא. רָבָא אָמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״, וּבָטֵל גִּיטָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said Blessed is He Who is good and does good, but the bill of divorce is not rendered void Rava said Blessed is He Who is good and does good, and the bill of divorce is rendered void.
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Blessed is the One who is good and does good," and the divorce document is not annulled. Rava said: "Blessed is the One who is good and does good," and the divorce document is annulled.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בְּגִלּוּי דַעְתָּא בְּגִיטָּא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּאַבָּיֵי סָבַר: גִּלּוּי דַעְתָּא בְּגִיטָּא לָאו מִלְּתָא הִיא, וְרָבָא סָבַר: גִּלּוּי דַעְתָּא בְּגִיטָּא מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? They disagree in disclosure of intent with regard to a bill of divorce, As Abaye holds: Disclosure of intent with regard to a bill of divorce is not a matter and Rava holds: Disclosure of intent with regard to a bill of divorce is matter,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? They disagree regarding the explicit intention in a bill of divorce - for Abbaye holds: explicit intention in a bill of divorce is not a significant matter, and Rava holds: explicit intention in a bill of divorce is a significant matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אַשְׁקְלֵיהּ גִּיטָּא לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ לְסָהֲדִי: הָכִי אָמַר לְכוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת – לְבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא. וְאַצְרְכֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת גִּיטָּא אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say where Rav Sheshet extracted a bill of divorce from a certain man against his will, and said to the witnesses: This Rav Sheshet said to you: Let the bill of divorce be rendered void, and Rav Sheshet required him another bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this to her? That Rav Sheshet gave her a bill of divorce to that man, her husband, and he said to the witnesses: So said Rav Sheshet to you - to annul the bill of divorce. And Rav Sheshet needed another bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי – אַטּוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מְבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא דְּאִינָשֵׁי הֲוָה?! אִיהוּ בַּטְּלַהּ; וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ הָכִי, מִשּׁוּם דָּפְנוֹיֵ[י].
human_translation: And Abaye Is that to say Rav Sheshet would render void the bills of divorce of people? rendered void And why he told them this, due to lashes
llm_translation: Abaye - Did Rav Sheshet really annul a bill of divorce of regular people?! He annulled it; and what he said to them was like this, because of the disgrace.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אַשְׁקְלֵיהּ גִּיטָּא לְחַתְנֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בִּירָאָה, וּבַטְּלֵיהּ; תְּנָא אַשְׁקְלֵיהּ, וּבַטְּלֵיהּ; הֲדַר תְּנָא וְאַשְׁקְלֵיהּ עַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ לְסָהֲדִי: אוֹתִיבוּ קָרֵי בְּאוּנַּיְכוּ וּכְתוּבוּ לֵיהּ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ גִּלּוּי דַעְתָּא בְּגִיטָּא מִילְּתָא הִיא, הָא חָזוּ לֵיהּ דְּקָא רָהֵיט בָּתְרַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say where Rav Yehuda extracted a bill of divorce from the son-in-law of Rabbi Yirmeya Bira’a, and rendered void. again extracted and rendered void. returned again extracted against his will, and said to the witnesses: Place gourd in your ears and write for him, And if it enters your mind disclosure of intent with regard to bills of divorce is a matter, the witnesses see that he is running after them
llm_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say this to her? That Rav Yehudah weighed out a Get to the groom of Rabbi Yirmiyah with fear, and he annulled it; a Tanna weighed it out, and he annulled it; he then weighed it out and annulled it on his lap, and he said to the witnesses: Sit down and write it for him. And if it enters your mind that the intention in the Get is a revealed matter, behold, they saw that he was trembling after both of them!

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא – הַאי דְּקָא רָהֵיט בָּתְרַיְיהוּ, דְּאָמַר לְהוּ: אַשּׁוּר הַבוּ לַהּ הַיָּיא, כִּי הֵיכָא דְּמִשְׁלַם צַעֲרָא דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא.
human_translation: And Rava this, that he is running after them, that to say to them: Make haste ashur give her speedily hayya in order to end the pain of that man,
llm_translation: Rava - this one who was reclining between them, for he said to them: "Bring the wine to him, for wherever that man pays the pain of that person."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּהָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי לָא אָתֵינָא עַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין, לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. אֲתָא, וּפַסְקֵיהּ מַבָּרָא; אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי, חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי״; וַאֲמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ מַתְיָא.
human_translation: And Abaye said From where do I say where a certain who said to If I do not arrive until thirty days let this be a bill of divorce. He came but was prevented by the ferry He said to See that I have arrived, see that I have arrived, and Shmuel said: is not considered an arrival,
llm_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say this to her? Because that one who said to them: If I do not come within thirty days, let it be a divorce. He came, and the time passed; he said to them: "See, he has come, see, he has come." And Samuel said: His name is not Matya.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא – אַטּוּ הָתָם לְבַטּוֹלֵי גִּיטָּא בָּעֵי?! הָתָם לְקַיּוֹמֵי תְּנָאֵיהּ קָא בָעֵי, וְהָא לָא אִיקַּיַּים תְּנָאֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rava is that to say there he desires to render the bill of divorce void? There, he desires to fulfill his stipulation, and he did not fulfill his condition,
llm_translation: Rava - now there, for the purpose of nullifying a bill of divorce, does he require it?! There, for the fulfillment of his teachings, he requires it, but here, he does not fulfill his teachings.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי לָא נָסֵיבְנָא עַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין – לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. כִּי מְטוֹ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא טָרַחְנָא.
human_translation: a certain who said to If I do not marry up to thirty days, will be a bill of divorce. When thirty days arrived, he said to them: I took the trouble
llm_translation: That one who said to them: If we do not marry within thirty days - let it be a divorce. When thirty days passed, he said to them: We have made an effort.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ? אִי מִשּׁוּם אוּנְסָא – אֵין אוֹנֶס בְּגִיטִּין. אִי מִשּׁוּם גַּלּוֹיֵי דַּעְתָּא בְּגִיטָּא – פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא הוּא.
human_translation: With regard to what be concerned If because circumstances beyond his control unavoidable circumstances no with regard to bills of divorce? If due to disclosure of intent with regard to bills of divorce, this is a dispute of Abaye and Rava,
llm_translation: Regarding what is she suspected? If due to coercion - there is no coercion in divorces. If due to lack of mental capacity in the divorce document - this is a dispute between Abbaye and Rava.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי לָא נָסֵיבְנָא לְרֵישׁ יַרְחָא דַּאֲדָר, לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. כִּי מְטָא רֵישׁ יַרְחָא דַּאֲדָר, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא לְרֵישׁ יַרְחָא דְנִיסָן אֲמַרִי. לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ? אִי מִשּׁוּם אוֹנֶס – אֵין אוֹנֶס בְּגִיטִּין. אִי מִשּׁוּם גַּלּוֹיֵי דַּעְתָּא – פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא.
human_translation: a certain who said to If I do not marry by the New Moon of Adar will be a bill of divorce. When the New Moon of Adar arrived, he said to them: I said by the New Moon of Nisan. With regard to what be concerned? If because circumstances beyond his control unavoidable circumstances no with regard to bills of divorce? If due to disclosure of intent this is a dispute of Abaye and Rava,
llm_translation: That one who said to them: If we do not get married at the beginning of the month of Adar, let it be a divorce. When it came to the beginning of the month of Adar, he said to them: I meant the beginning of the month of Nissan. What is the concern for him? If it is due to coercion - there is no coercion in divorces. If it is due to a revelation of his mind - it is a dispute between Abbaye and Rava.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּנַחְמָן; וְהִלְכְתָא כְּנַחְמָן;
human_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with Naḥman, And the halakha is in accordance with Naḥman,
llm_translation: The law follows Nachman; the law follows Nachman.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּנַחְמָנִי.
human_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with Naḥmani,
llm_translation: And the halakha is according to Nahmanides.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיָה מְשַׁנֶּה שְׁמוֹ וּשְׁמָהּ, שֵׁם עִירוֹ וְשֵׁם עִירָהּ. הִתְקִין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁיְּהֵא כּוֹתֵב: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וְכׇל שׁוּם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ״, ״אִשָּׁה פְּלוֹנִית וְכׇל שׁוּם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ״ – מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Initially, would change his name and her name, the name of his city and the name of her city. Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that should write man so-and-so, and any name that he has, woman so-and-so, and any name that she has. for the betterment of the world,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Initially, he would mention his name and her name, the name of his city and the name of her city. Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that one should write: "So-and-so, son of So-and-so, and any name he has," "So-and-so, daughter of So-and-so, and any name she has" - for the betterment of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי מְדִינַת הַיָּם לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בְּנֵי אָדָם הַבָּאִים מִשָּׁם לְכָאן, שְׁמוֹ יוֹסֵף – וְקוֹרְאִין לוֹ יוֹחָנָן; יוֹחָנָן – וְקוֹרְאִין לוֹ יוֹסֵף, הֵיאַךְ מְגָרְשִׁין נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן? עָמַד רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְהִתְקִין שֶׁיְּהוּ כּוֹתְבִין: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וְכׇל שׁוּם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ״, ״אִשָּׁה פְּלוֹנִית וְכׇל שׁוּם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ״ – מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וְהוּא דְּאִתַּחְזַק בִּתְרֵי שְׁמֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: רַבִּי מָרִי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר קָיְימִי כְּווֹתָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: The residents of a country overseas sent to Rabban Gamliel: people who come from there, to here, whose name is Yosef but they call him Yoḥanan, Yoḥanan, but they call him Yosef, how do they divorce their wives? Rabban Gamliel arose and instituted that they should write: man so-and-so, and any name that he has, woman so-and-so, and any name that she has, for the betterment of the world. Rav Ashi said: And this when he is known by two names. Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: Rabbi Mari and Rabbi Elazar hold in accordance with your
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, "Send to the people of the coastal region to Rabban Gamliel: When people come from there to here, his name is Yosef - and they call him Yochanan; Yochanan - and they call him Yosef, how do they divorce their wives?" Rabban Gamliel stood up and instituted that they should write: 'So-and-so and any name he has,' 'So-and-so woman and any name she has' - for the betterment of the world. Rav Ashi said: And this is what is established in two heavens. Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: Rabbi Mari and Rabbi Elazar uphold your words.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים – אַחַת בִּיהוּדָה וְאַחַת בַּגָּלִיל; וְלוֹ שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת – אֶחָד בִּיהוּדָה וְאֶחָד בַּגָּלִיל; וְגֵרַשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה בִּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה, וְאֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁבַּגָּלִיל בִּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁבַּגָּלִיל – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, עַד שֶׁיְּגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה בִּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה – וְשֵׁם דְּגָלִיל עִמּוֹ; וְאֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁבַּגָּלִיל בִּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁבַּגָּלִיל – וְשֵׁם דִּיהוּדָה עִמּוֹ. יָצָא לְמָקוֹם אַחֵר, וְגֵרַשׁ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Ashi: has two wives, one in Judea and one in the Galilee; and he has two names, one in Judea and one in the Galilee; and he divorces his wife who is in Judea with name that in Judea, and his wife who is in the Galilee with name that in the Galilee, neither is divorced until he divorces his wife who is in Judea with the name that in Judea and name of the Galilee to it, and his wife who is in the Galilee with the name in the Galilee and name of Judea to it. he leaves to a different place, and divorces with one of she is divorced.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ashi: If a man had two wives - one in Judea and one in the Galilee; and he had two names - one in Judea and one in the Galilee; and he divorced his wife in Judea with his name in Judea, and his wife in the Galilee with his name in the Galilee - she is not divorced until he divorces his wife in Judea with his name in Judea - and the name of the Galilee is with him; and his wife in the Galilee with his name in the Galilee - and the name of Judea is with him. If he went to another place, and divorced one of them - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ שֵׁם דְּגָלִיל עִמּוֹ! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ – הָא דְּאִתַּחְזַק, הָא דְּלָא אֶתַּחְזַק; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t you say name of the Galilee to it? Rather, learn from it This where he is known this where he is not known Conclude from it
llm_translation: And the saying, "the name of Degalil is with him!" Rather, infer from it - this one who is established, this one who is not established; infer from it.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּהֲווֹ קָרוּ לַהּ מִרְיָם, וּפוּרְתָּא שָׂרָה. אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: מִרְיָם וְכֹל שׁוּם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ, וְלָא שָׂרָה וְכֹל שׁוּם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ.
human_translation: a certain who called Miriam, and a few Sara; of Neharde’a said: Miriam, and any name that she has, and not Sara, and any name that she has,
llm_translation: That one who was called Mary, and the other one was called Sarah. The Nehardeans said: Mary and all that belongs to her, but not Sarah and all that belongs to her.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין אַלְמָנָה נִפְרַעַת מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים, אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. נִמְנְעוּ מִלְּהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ; הִתְקִין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן, שֶׁתְּהֵא נוֹדֶרֶת לַיְּתוֹמִים כֹּל מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצוּ, וְגוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: A widow can collect from the property of orphans only by an oath refrained from administering an oath to her, Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that she should take, for the orphans, any vow that wished and collects her marriage contract.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A widow is not reimbursed from the property of orphans except through an oath. They are prevented from swearing her; Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that she should be bound by a vow to the orphans for whatever they desire, and its collection is according to its written terms.

hebrew_text: הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִין עַל הַגֵּט, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. וְהִלֵּל הִתְקִין פְּרוֹזְבּוּל, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: The witnesses sign on the bill of divorce, for the betterment of the world, And Hillel instituted a document that prevents the Sabbatical from abrogating an outstanding debt [ prosbol ] for the betterment of the world,
llm_translation: The witnesses sign on the bill of divorce, for the betterment of the world. Hillel instituted the prozbul, for the betterment of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אִירְיָא אַלְמָנָה, אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נָמֵי; דְּהָא קַיְימָא לַן – הַבָּא לִיפָּרַע מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין, לֹא יִפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה! אַלְמָנָה אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא:
human_translation: Why specifically a widow? everyone, as we maintain who comes to collect from the property of orphans can collect only by an oath. was necessary for a widow, enter your mind to say:
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the definition of a widow, even if the whole world is considered? For we have a tradition - one who comes to collect from the property of orphans, may only collect through a pledge! A widow needs it, do you think I would say otherwise.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא אַקִּילוּ רַבָּנַן גַּבַּהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Due to desirability the Sages were lenient with her, teaches us
llm_translation: Due to favoritism, the Rabbis were lenient with him, as it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: נִמְנְעוּ מִלְּהַשְׁבִּיעָהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא – דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא; וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת, שֶׁהִפְקִיד דִּינַר זָהָב אֵצֶל אַלְמָנָה; וְהִנִּיחַתּוּ בְּכַד שֶׁל קֶמַח, וַאֲפָאַתּוּ בְּפַת, וּנְתָנַתּוּ לְעָנִי;
human_translation: refrained from administering an oath to her. What is the reason If we say because of Rav Kahana, as Rav Kahana says, and some say Rav Yehuda says Rav says: an incident involving a person during years of famine who deposited a gold dinar with a widow, and she placed in a jug of flour and baked it in bread and gave to a poor man.
llm_translation: They were prevented from swearing her: What is the reason? If you say it is because of Rav Kahana - for Rav Kahana said; and some say he said in the name of Rav Yehudah, Rav said: There was an incident with one man in two cities, who entrusted a golden dinar to a widow; and he placed it in a jar of flour, baked it into bread, and gave it to a poor person.

hebrew_text: לְיָמִים בָּא בַּעַל הַדִּינָר, וַאֲמַר לַהּ: הָבִי לִי דִּינָרִי. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: יְהַנֶּה סַם הַמָּוֶת בְּאֶחָד מִבָּנֶיהָ שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ אִשָּׁה, אִם נֶהֱנֵיתִי מִדִּינָרְךָ כְּלוּם! אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים מוּעָטִין עַד שֶׁמֵּת אֶחָד מִבָּנֶיהָ; וּכְשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים בַּדָּבָר, אָמְרוּ: מָה מִי שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע בֶּאֱמֶת – כָּךְ, הַנִּשְׁבָּע עַל שֶׁקֶר – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: After a period of time, the owner of the dinar came and said to her: Give me my dinar. She said to him: May poison benefit, one of the children of that woman, if I derived any benefit from your dinar. It was said: Not a few days until one of her children died, and when the Sages heard of matter, they said: If one who takes an oath truthfully this one who takes an oath falsely, all the more so.
llm_translation: Days passed, the creditor came, and said to her: "Give me my dinar." She said to him: "Let the angel of death take one of her sons, if I have benefited from your dinar at all!" They said: "There were not few days until one of her sons died; and when the sages heard about it, they said: 'Just as one who swears truthfully - so too, one who swears falsely - all the more so.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא אִיעֲנַשָׁה? דְּאִישְׁתָּרַשׁ לַהּ מְקוֹם דִּינָר.
human_translation: What is the reason she was punished Because she benefited ishtarshi from the place of the dinar,
llm_translation: What is the reason she was punished? Because she occupied a place worth a dinar.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״מִי שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע בֶּאֱמֶת״? כְּמִי שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע בֶּאֱמֶת.
human_translation: what One who takes an oath truthfully? like one who took an oath truthfully,
llm_translation: "And what is 'one who swears truthfully'? Like one who swears truthfully."

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא, מַאי אִירְיָא אַלְמָנָה? אֲפִילּוּ גְּרוּשָׁה נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא אַלְמָנָה, אֲבָל גְּרוּשָׁה מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ?
human_translation: If due to this why specifically a widow? Even a divorcée as well. Why Rabbi Zeira say Shmuel says: They taught only a widow; however, a divorcée, administer an oath to her?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If due to this, what is called a widow? Even a divorcee also! Why did Rabbi Zeira say, Shmuel said: They only taught regarding a widow, but a divorcee, do we also swear her?

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה שָׁאנֵי; דִּבְהָהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא טָרְחָה קַמֵּי דְּיַתְמֵי, אָתְיָא לְאוֹרוֹיֵי הֶיתֵּרָא.
human_translation: A widow is different, due to the benefit the efforts for the orphans, she will rationalize and permit
llm_translation: Widow who repeats; for that pleasure that she is seeking before she marries, comes to her more.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ, לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין, אֲבָל חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין – מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב לָא מַגְבֵּי כְּתוּבָּה לְאַרְמַלְתָּא! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: Rav and Shmuel who both say they taught only in court, However, outside of court, administer an oath to her. Is that so? But Rav does not collect a marriage contract for a widow difficult,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: Rav and Shmuel, both of them said, they only made this statement in the case of a court, but outside of a court, one may swear her. Is it not so? But Rav does not require a written document for a widow! This is difficult.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי. בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי – אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין, אֲבָל חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין – מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ. וְרַב אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין נָמֵי אֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: In Sura they taught like this, in Neharde’a they taught like this: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says they taught only in court; however, outside of court administer an oath to her. And Rav says: Even outside of court as well, do not administer an oath to her.
llm_translation: In Sura they taught thus: In Nehardea they taught thus - Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only made this distinction in a court, but outside of a court, they may administer an oath to her. And Rav said: Even outside of a court, they do not administer an oath to her.

hebrew_text: רַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ – דְּרַב לָא מַגְבֵּי כְּתוּבָּה לְאַרְמַלְתָּא. וְלִיאַדְּרַהּ וְלַיגְבְּיַיהּ! בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב קִילִי נִדְרֵי.
human_translation: Rav to his reasoning, as Rav does not collect a marriage contract for a widow Let him administer a vow and collect In Rav’s time vows were lightly,
llm_translation: Rav according to his reasoning - for Rav does not establish a Scriptural verse for Aramalta. And to honor her and to elevate her! In the case of Rav, vows are considered serious.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לַהּ: מָה אֶעֱבֵיד לִיךְ, דְּרַב לָא מַגְבֵּי כְּתוּבָּה לְאַרְמַלְתָּא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא – אֶלָּא דִּלְמָא נָקֵיטְנָא מִידֵּי מִכְּתוּבָּתִי, חַי ה׳ צְבָאוֹת אִם נֶהֱנֵיתִי מִכְּתוּבָּתִי כְּלוּם! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מוֹדֶה רַב בְּקוֹפֶצֶת.
human_translation: a certain who came before Rav Huna He said to her: What can I do for you, as Rav does not collect a marriage contract for a widow. said to him: Isn’t the reason only perhaps I took some of my marriage contract? as the Lord of Hosts lives that I did not any benefit from my marriage contract. Rav Huna says: Rav concedes with regard to one who leaps
llm_translation: That one who came before Rav Huna, he said to her: "What shall I do for you, for Rav does not accept a document from an Aramean?" She said to him: "It is a tradition from Sinai - rather, perhaps we have taken it from my own document, 'As the Lord of hosts lives, if I have benefited from my own document, may it be as nothing!' Rav Huna said: Rav concedes in the case of a leap."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לַהּ: מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד לִיךְ, דְּרַב לָא מַגְבֵּי כְּתוּבָּה לְאַרְמַלְתָּא, וְאַבָּא מָרִי לָא מַגְבֵּי כְּתוּבָּה לְאַרְמַלְתָּא.
human_translation: a certain who came before Rabba bar Rav Huna He said to her: What can I do for you, as Rav does not collect a marriage contract for a widow, and my father, my master, does not collect a marriage contract for a widow?
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabba bar Rav Huna, he said to her: What shall I do for you, for Rav does not accept a teaching in Aramaic, and Abba Mari does not accept a teaching in Aramaic.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: הַב לִי מְזוֹנֵי. אֲמַר לַהּ: מְזוֹנֵי נָמֵי לֵית לִיךְ; דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַתּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ בְּבֵית דִּין – אֵין לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: She said to him: provide sustenance me He said to her: You also do not have sustenance, as Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: One who demands her marriage contract in court has no sustenance
llm_translation: He said to her: "Bring me sustenance." She said to him: "I do not have sustenance for you," for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "A woman whose marriage contract is in the possession of the court is not entitled to sustenance."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אַפְכוּהּ לְכוּרְסְיֵהּ, כְּבֵי תְּרֵי עָבְדַתְּ לִי! הַפְכוּהּ לְכוּרְסְיֵהּ וְתָרְצוּהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא אִיפְּרַק מֵחוּלְשָׁא.
human_translation: said to May his chair be overturned, he ruled for me in accordance with two he overturned his chair and stood it and even so, he was not saved from weakness
llm_translation: She said to him: "Turn it into a chair, like two servants have done for me!" Turn it into a chair and you will be satisfied, yet even so, I will not be relieved from weakness.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִרְמְיָה בִּירָאָה: אַדְּרַהּ בְּבֵית דִּין, וְאַשְׁבְּעַהּ חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין, וְלֵיתֵי קָלָא וְלִיפּוֹל בְּאוּדְנִי, דְּבָעֵינָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאֶעֱבֵיד בָּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, said to Rav Yirmeya Bira’a: administer a vow in court and administer an oath outside of court, let the report be received in my ears as I desire to perform an action,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah to Rav Yirmeya with awe: Honor in the court, and swear outside the court, and let him come lightly and fall in the furnace, for I want to see how he will act with it in practice.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא אַלְמָנָה, אֲבָל גְּרוּשָׁה – מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Zeira says Shmuel says: They taught only a widow; however, a divorcée, administer an oath to her.
llm_translation: Body - Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this regarding a widow, but a divorced woman - we make her take an oath.

hebrew_text: וּגְרוּשָׁה דְּאַדְּרַהּ לָא?! וְהָא שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: ״אֵיךְ פְּלוֹנִיתָא בַּת פְּלוֹנִי קַבִּילַת גִּיטָּא מִן יְדָא דְּאַחָא בַּר הִידְיָא דְּמִתְקְרֵי ״אַיָּה מָרִי״; וּנְדַרַת וַאֲסַרַת פֵּירוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם עֲלַהּ דְּלָא קַבִּילַת מִכְּתוּבְּתַהּ אֶלָּא גְּלוּפְקְרָא אֶחָד, וְסֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים אֶחָד, וְסֵפֶר אִיּוֹב, וּמִמְשָׁלוֹת בְּלוֹאִים;
human_translation: administered a vow a divorcée not But didn’t they send from there, How so-and-so, the daughter of so-and-so, received a bill of divorce from the hand of Aḥa bar Hidya, who is called Ayya Mari, and she took a vow and prohibited the produce of the world to herself, that she did not receive from her marriage contract anything other than one coat gelofkera and one book of Psalms, and a book of Job, and Proverbs, worn out.
llm_translation: And the divorce document of Adrahl not?! But they sent from there: "How so-and-so, daughter of so-and-so, received a bill of divorce from the hand of Acha bar Hidya who is called 'Ayah Mari'; and she vowed and prohibited all the fruits of the world upon herself that she would not receive from her husband except one glove, and one book of Psalms, and the book of Job, and the Proverbs of the Ignorant."

hebrew_text: וְשַׁמְנוּם בַּחֲמִשָּׁה מָנֶה; לִכְשֶׁתָּבֹא לְיֶדְכֶם הַגְבּוּהָ אֶת הַשְּׁאָר״. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָהוּא, גֵּט יְבָמִין הֲוָה.
human_translation: And we appraised them, is five hundred dinars. When she comes to you collect the rest for her Rav Ashi said: That was a levirate bill of divorce
llm_translation: And they assessed them at five maneh; when the high price comes to your hand, deduct the rest." Rav Ashe said: That one was a yibum bill.

hebrew_text: הִתְקִין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁתְּהֵא נוֹדֶרֶת כּוּ׳: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁלֹּא נִיסֵּת, אֲבָל נִיסֵּת – אֵין מַדִּירִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that she should take, any vow Rav Huna says: They taught only she did not marry however, she married they do not administer a vow to her.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that a vow should be annulled. Rav Huna said: They only taught this regarding when one has not experienced the consequences of the vow, but if one has experienced the consequences, we do not annul it.

hebrew_text: נִיסֵּת מַאי טַעְמָא – דְּמֵיפַר לַהּ בַּעַל; כִּי לֹא נִיסֵּת נָמֵי, לְכִי מִנַּסְבָא מֵיפַר לַהּ בַּעַל! אֵין הַבַּעַל מֵיפֵר בְּקוֹדְמִין.
human_translation: What is the reason married that her husband will nullify when she is not married also that when she will marry her husband will nullify the husband does not to nullify with regard to prior
llm_translation: The text reads: "Nisset, what is the reason? - Because the husband is appeased by it; for if he were not appeased, then from the beginning the husband would not be appeased! The husband does not appease in advance."

hebrew_text: וְנֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אָזְלָה לְגַבֵּי חָכָם וְשָׁרֵי לַהּ! קָסָבַר צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵט אֶת הַנֶּדֶר.
human_translation: But let us be concerned that perhaps she will go to a halakhic authority and he will dissolve for her. holds must detail the vow
llm_translation: And a suspicion that perhaps she went to a sage and he permitted it! He holds that one must specify the vow.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ נִיסֵּת. נִיסֵּת, וַדַּאי מֵיפַר לַהּ בַּעַל! דְּמַדְּרִינַן לַהּ בָּרַבִּים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Even she married she married, husband will certainly nullify that we, administer the vow in public,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Even if she was married. If she was married, surely her husband will divorce her! As we find regarding her in public.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נִיסֵּת – גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אִם נָדְרָה. מַאי, לָאו נָדְרָה הַשְׁתָּא? לָא, דִּנְדַרָה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection she married she collects her marriage contract if she has taken a vow. What, is it not she takes a vow now, No, when she took a vow initially,
llm_translation: Challenger: "If she was tested - her height is written if she vowed." What, is it not that she vowed now? No, that she vowed from the outset.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: נִיסֵּת – נוֹדֶרֶת וְגוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: נֶדֶר שֶׁהוּדַּר בָּרַבִּים – יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה; וְאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught she married she takes a vow and collects her marriage contract. This is tanna’im , as there is one who says: A vow that was taken in public has nullification And there is one who says: does not have nullification.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "Nisset - she vowed, and her obligation is written!" It is a teaching, for there is one who says: "A vow made in public - has a way out," and there is one who says: "There is no way out."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵט אֶת הַנֶּדֶר, אוֹ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ; רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before need to detail the vow, or does he not need Rav Naḥman says: He does not need Rav Pappa says: He needs
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: Is it necessary to specify the vow, or is it not necessary? Rav Nachman said: It is not necessary; Rav Papa said: It is necessary.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ – דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ צָרִיךְ, זִימְנִין דְּגָיֵיז לֵיהּ לְדִיבּוּרֵיהּ, וְחָכָם מַאי דְּשָׁמַע מֵיפַר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says he does not need as if you say he needs sometimes will cut short his statement and the halakhic authority dissolves what he hears
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: He does not need - for if you say he needs, sometimes he will be caught in his words, and a wise man, what he hears, he will negate.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר צָרִיךְ – מִשּׁוּם מִילְּתָא דְּאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says he needs because a matter that prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is necessary - because of the matter of prohibition.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַנּוֹשֵׂא נָשִׁים בַּעֲבֵירָה – פָּסוּל, עַד שֶׁיִּדּוֹר הֲנָאָה. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: נוֹדֵר וְעוֹבֵד, יוֹרֵד וּמְגָרֵשׁ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵט אֶת הַנֶּדֶר, לֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא אָזֵיל לְגַבֵּי חָכָם וְשָׁרֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: We learned who marries women in transgression disqualified until he takes a vow benefit And it is taught with regard to this: He takes a vow and serves He descends and divorces And if you say he does not need to detail the vow, let us be concerned lest he go to a halakhic authority and dissolve for him.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who marries women in transgression - disqualified, until he repents. And it was taught in a Braita: One who vows and fulfills, descends and divorces. And if you say he does not need to specify the vow, we are concerned lest he go to a Sage and he permits it!

hebrew_text: דְּמַדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ בְּרַבִּים. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נֶדֶר שֶׁהוּדַּר בְּרַבִּים – אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה; אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: that we administer the vow in public. This works out well according to the one who says a vow that was taken in public has no nullification but according to the one who says it has nullification, what can be said?
llm_translation: We instruct him in public. It is preferable according to the one who says a vow made in public - he does not have annulment; rather according to the one who says he has annulment, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: דְּמַדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ עַל דַּעַת רַבִּים – דְּאָמַר אַמֵּימָר, הִלְכְתָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נֶדֶר שֶׁהוּדַּר בְּרַבִּים יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה, עַל דַּעַת רַבִּים – אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה.
human_translation: that we administer the vow to on the consent of the public, As Ameimar said, halakha Even according to the one who says a vow that was taken in public has nullification, on the consent of the public, has no nullification.
llm_translation: We instruct him according to the opinion of the majority - as Amemar said, the halakha: even according to the one who says a vow that was made in public has a way out, according to the opinion of the majority - he has no way out.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת, אֲבָל לִדְבַר מִצְוָה – יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה. כִּי הָהוּא מַקְרֵי דַּרְדְּקֵי דְּאַדְּרֵיהּ רַב אַחָא עַל דַּעַת רַבִּים, דַּהֲוָה פָּשַׁע בְּיָנוֹקֵי; וְאַהְדְּרֵיהּ רָבִינָא, דְּלָא אִישְׁתְּכַח דְּדָיֵיק כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And this matter applies to an optional matter, but to a matter of a mitzva, it has nullification. like a certain teacher of children, whom Rav Aḥa administered a vow on the consent of the public as he was negligent with regard to the children And Ravina reinstated him, as they did not find who was as meticulous as he
llm_translation: These are matters regarding permission, but regarding a commandment - it has a solution. For that incident of the Dardekei, which Rav Acha permitted against the opinion of the majority, as it would have been a transgression with young children; and Ravina permitted it, as it was not found to be exactly like his case.

hebrew_text: וְהָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִין עַל הַגֵּט מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם: מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם?! דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָתוֹב בַּסֵּפֶר וְחָתוֹם״!
human_translation: And the witnesses sign the bill of divorce for the betterment of the world. for the betterment of the world? It is by Torah law as it is written: “And subscribe the deeds, and sign
llm_translation: The witnesses sign on the bill of divorce because of the betterment of the world: Because of the betterment of the world?! It is from the Torah, as it is written: "And it shall be written in a document and signed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לָא צְרִיכָא – לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי; תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם – דְּזִמְנִין דְּמָיְיתִי סָהֲדִי, אִי נָמֵי זִימְנִין דְּאָזְלִי לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: Rabba said: No, necessary according to Rabbi Elazar, who says: Witnesses of the transmission effect the Sages instituted signatory witnesses for the betterment of the world, as sometimes that the witnesses die, or sometimes that they go overseas,
llm_translation: Rabba said: It is not necessary – for Rabbi Elazar said: Witnesses of delivery I have cut off; the Rabbis instituted witnesses of sealing, because of the order of the world – for sometimes I might suspect the witnesses, or rather, sometimes they might go to a maritime province.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא עֵדִים מְפָרְשִׁין שְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן בְּגִיטִּין – מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: You even say according to Rabbi Meir, They instituted that the witnesses must specify their names on bills of divorce for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Even if you were to say it is according to Rabbi Meir, they instituted that witnesses should clarify their names in divorce documents - for the betterment of the world.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיָה כּוֹתֵב ״אֲנִי פְּלוֹנִי חָתַמְתִּי עֵד״; אִם כְּתַב יָדוֹ יוֹצֵא מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר – כָּשֵׁר, וְאִם לָאו – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: As it is taught At first, would write I, so-and-so, signed a witness, if signature is produced from elsewhere, valid, but if not, invalid
llm_translation: As it was taught: Initially, one would write, "I, so-and-so, have signed as a witness." If he wrote it with his own hand from a different place - it is valid, but if not - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: תַּקָּנָה גְּדוֹלָה הִתְקִינוּ, שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מְפָרְשִׁין שְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן בְּגִיטִּין – מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel said: They instituted a great ordinance that must specify their names on bills of divorce, for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel said: A great enactment they enacted, that their names should be clarified in the bills of divorce - for the betterment of the world.

hebrew_text: וּבְסִימָנָא לָא?! וְהָא רַב צָיֵיר כְּוָרָא; וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא צָיֵיר חֲרוּתָא; רַב חִסְדָּא סָמֶךְ; וְרַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא עַיִן; רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא צָיֵיר מָכוּתָא! שָׁאנֵי רַבָּנַן, דִּבְקִיאִין סִימָנַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But not with mark? But Rav drew a fish and Rabbi Ḥanina drew a palm branch ḥaruta Rav Ḥisda samekh , and Rav Hoshaya ayin ; Rabba bar Rav Huna drew a sail makota The Sages are different, as well versed in their marks.
llm_translation: And with a sign, not?! But Rav Zayir drew like a line; and Rabbi Chanina drew a circle; Rav Chisda leaned; and Rav Hoshaya looked; Rabbah bar Rav Huna drew a hammer! The Rabbis differ, for they are particular about their signs.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא בְּמַאי אַפְקְעִינְהוּ? בְּדִיסְקֵי.
human_translation: Initially, with what did they publicize in letters,
llm_translation: Originally, with what did he take them out? With baskets.

hebrew_text: הִלֵּל הִתְקִין פְּרוֹסְבּוּל וְכוּ׳: תְּנַן הָתָם, פְּרוֹסְבּוּל אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט. זֶה אֶחָד מִן הַדְּבָרִים שֶׁהִתְקִין הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן; שֶׁרָאָה אֶת הָעָם שֶׁנִּמְנְעוּ מִלְּהַלְווֹת זֶה אֶת זֶה, וְעָבְרוּ עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה ״הִשָּׁמֶר לְךָ פֶּן יִהְיֶה דָבָר עִם לְבָבְךָ בְלִיַּעַל וְגוֹ׳״, עָמַד וְהִתְקִין פְּרוֹסְבּוּל.
human_translation: Hillel instituted a document that prevents the Sabbatical from abrogating an outstanding debt [ prosbol ]. We learned there a prosbol , does not abrogate This is one of the matters that Hillel the Elder instituted because he saw that the nation were refraining from lending to one another and they violated that which is written in the Torah: “Beware that there be not a base thought in your heart, He arose and instituted prosbol
llm_translation: Hillel established the Prozbul, etc. We learned there, the Prozbul does not cancel debts. This is one of the things that Hillel the Elder established; when he saw the people refraining from lending to one another, and they transgressed what is written in the Torah, "Beware lest there be a base thought in your heart, etc." (Deuteronomy 15:9), he arose and established the Prozbul.

hebrew_text: וְזֶה הוּא גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל פְּרוֹסְבּוּל: ״מוֹסְרַנִי לָכֶם פְּלוֹנִי [וּפְלוֹנִי] דַּיָּינִין שֶׁבְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, שֶׁכׇּל חוֹב שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי אֵצֶל פְּלוֹנִי, שֶׁאֶגְבֶּנּוּ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֶרְצֶה״. וְהַדַּיָּינִים חוֹתְמִים לְמַטָּה, אוֹ הָעֵדִים.
human_translation: And this is the essence of the prosbol : I transfer to you, so-and-so judges, who are in such and such a place, that I will collect any debt that I am owed by so-and-so whenever I wish, And the judges or the witnesses sign below,
llm_translation: This is the body of the contract of Prosbol: "So-and-so and so-and-so has obligated me in the place of so-and-so, for any debt that I have with so-and-so, that I may collect it whenever I desire." And the judges sign below, or the witnesses.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְשַׁמְּטָא שְׁבִיעִית, וְהִתְקִין הִלֵּל דְּלָא מְשַׁמְּטָא?! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בַּשְּׁבִיעִית בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, וְרַבִּי הִיא –
human_translation: But is there anything where by Torah law the Sabbatical cancels but Hillel instituted that it does not cancel Abaye said: to the Sabbatical in the present, it is Rabbi
llm_translation: And who is it that it is necessary to infer from the Torah that the seventh year is released, and Hillel established that it is not released?! Abaye said: In the seventh year in this time, and it is Rabbi -

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וְזֶה דְּבַר הַשְּׁמִיטָּה שָׁמוֹט״ – בִּשְׁתֵּי שְׁמִיטוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר: אַחַת שְׁמִיטַּת קַרְקַע וְאַחַת שְׁמִיטַּת כְּסָפִים. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט קַרְקַע – אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט כְּסָפִים, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט קַרְקַע, אִי אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט כְּסָפִים.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi says: “And this is the manner of the abrogation: He shall abrogate” The verse speaks of two abrogation: One the release of land and one abrogation of monetary At a time when you release land, you abrogate monetary at a time when you do not release land, you do not abrogate monetary
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, "And this is the matter of the Shemittah release - 'Shamot'" - in two Shemittah cycles the Scripture speaks: one is the Shemittah of the land and one is the Shemittah of money. When you are releasing the land - you are releasing the money, when you are not releasing the land, you are not releasing the money.

hebrew_text: וְתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן דִּתְשַׁמֵּט, זֵכֶר לַשְּׁבִיעִית; רָאָה הִלֵּל שֶׁנִּמְנְעוּ הָעָם מִלְּהַלְווֹת זֶה אֶת זֶה, עָמַד וְהִתְקִין פְּרוֹסְבּוּל.
human_translation: And the Sages instituted that will abrogate remembrance of the Sabbatical Hillel saw that the nation refrained from lending to each other he arose and instituted prosbol .
llm_translation: The sages established the Shemittah year as a remembrance; Hillel saw that people refrained from lending to one another, so he instituted the institution of Prozbul.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא מְשַׁמְּטָא שְׁבִיעִית, וְתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן דִּתְשַׁמֵּט?!
human_translation: But is there anything where by Torah law the Sabbatical does not cancel and the Sages instituted that it will cancel?
llm_translation: And who is it that there is from the hands of those who are of the Torah that the seventh year is not released, and the sages have established that it should be released?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה הוּא. רָבָא אָמַר: הֶפְקֵר בֵּית דִּין – הֶפְקֵר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן שֶׁהֶפְקֵר בֵּית דִּין – הֶפְקֵר? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָבוֹא לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת הַיָּמִים כַּעֲצַת הַשָּׂרִים וְהַזְּקֵנִים, יׇחֳרַם כׇּל רְכוּשׁוֹ וְהוּא יִבָּדֵל מִקְּהַל הַגּוֹלָה״.
human_translation: Abaye says: it is sit and not do Rava says: property ownerless the court ownerless. As Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From where that property ownerless the court ownerless? As it is stated: “And whoever did not come within three days according to the counsel of the princes and the Elders, all of his property shall be forfeited, and he shall be separated from the congregation of the captivity”
llm_translation: Abaye said: Sit and do not do it. Rava said: If the court declares it ownerless, it is ownerless. As Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we derive that if the court declares it ownerless, it is ownerless? As it is stated: "And all that does not come within three days, by the counsel of the officials and the elders, shall have all his property forfeited, and he himself separated from the congregation of the exile."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״אֵלֶּה הַנְּחָלוֹת אֲשֶׁר נִחֲלוּ אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן וְרָאשֵׁי הָאָבוֹת וְגוֹ׳״. וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן רָאשִׁים אֵצֶל אָבוֹת? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אָבוֹת מַנְחִילִין אֶת בְּנֵיהֶם כֹּל מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצוּ, אַף רָאשִׁים מַנְחִילִין הָעָם כֹּל מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: from here: “These are the inheritances, which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers’ houses distributed for inheritance” What do the heads have to do with the fathers? to tell you: Just as fathers transmit anything that they wish to their children, so too, heads transmit to the people anything that they wish.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said, from here: "These are the inheritances that Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers' houses, etc." And what is the relevance of "heads" with regard to "fathers"? To tell you: Just as fathers bequeath to their sons whatever they desire, so too the heads bequeath to the people whatever they desire.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כִּי הִתְקִין הִלֵּל פְּרוֹסְבּוּל – לְדָרֵיהּ הוּא דְּתַקֵּין, אוֹ דִלְמָא לְדָרֵי עָלְמָא נָמֵי תַּקֵּין?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before When Hillel instituted prosbol , for his generation that he instituted or perhaps institute also for all generations?
llm_translation: He sought to say to them: When Hillel established the Prozbul - was it for his generation that he established it, or perhaps for all generations did he establish it?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְבַטּוֹלֵיהּ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְדָרֵיהּ הוּא דְּתַקֵּין – מְבַטְּלִינַן לֵיהּ; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְדָרֵי עָלְמָא נָמֵי תַּקֵּין, הָא אֵין בֵּית דִּין יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל דִּבְרֵי בֵּית דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן גָּדוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ בְּחׇכְמָה וּבְמִנְיָן. מַאי?
human_translation: What difference is there to nullifying If you say for his generation that he instituted we can nullify it But if you say he instituted also for all generations, a court can nullify the action of another court only if it is greater than it in wisdom and in number. What,
llm_translation: For what purpose does it emerge? To nullify it. If you say it is to establish for its generation - we nullify it; rather, if you say it is to establish for all generations, then a court cannot nullify the words of another court, unless it is greater than it in wisdom and number. What?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לָא כָּתְבִינַן פְּרוֹסְבּוּל אֶלָּא אִי בְּבֵי דִינָא דְּסוּרָא אִי בְּבֵי דִינָא דִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לְדָרֵי עָלְמָא נָמֵי תַּקֵּין, בִּשְׁאָר בֵּי דִינָא נָמֵי לִכְתְּבוּ!
human_translation: Come hear that Shmuel said: We write a prosbol only in the court of Sura or in the court of Neharde’a, And if it enters your mind he instituted also for all generations, let them write a prosbol in the other courts as well.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Shmuel said: We do not write a promissory note except either in the court of Sura or in the court of Nehardea. And if it should enter your mind to establish it in other courts of the world, in the rest of the courts write it!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא כִּי תַּקֵּין הִלֵּל לְדָרֵי עָלְמָא – כְּגוֹן בֵּי דִינָא דִּידֵיהּ, וּכְרַב אַמֵּי וְרַב אַסִּי, דְּאַלִּימֵי לְאַפְקוֹעֵי מָמוֹנָא; אֲבָל לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא – לָא.
human_translation: Perhaps when Hillel instituted for all generations, such as his court, and like Rav Ami and Rav Asi, as they have the power to remove money However, for all not
llm_translation: Perhaps when Hillel established for future generations - such as his own court, and like Rav Ammi and Rav Assi, who were diligent in collecting money; but for everyone else - no.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָא פְּרוֹסְבֻּלָא – עוּלְבָּנָא דְּדַיָּינֵי הוּא; אִי אֲיַישַּׁר חַיִל אֲבַטְּלִינֵּיהּ. אֲבַטְּלִינֵּיהּ?! וְהָא אֵין בֵּית דִּין יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל דִּבְרֵי בֵּית דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן גָּדוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ בְּחָכְמָה וּבְמִנְיָן! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם אֲיַישֵּׁר חַיִל יוֹתֵר מֵהִלֵּל, אֲבַטְּלִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear that Shmuel said: This prosbol is an ulbena of the judges; if my strength increases I will nullify it. I will nullify it? But isn’t a court can nullify the action of another court only if it is greater than it in wisdom and in number? this is what he said: If my strength increases greater than Hillel, I will nullify
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Shmuel said: The Prozbul is the document of the court; if one has the power, he may annul it. He may annul it?! But a court cannot annul the words of another court unless it is greater than it in wisdom and number! This is what he is saying: If one has more power than Hillel, he may annul it.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֲקַיְּימִנֵּהּ. אֲקַיְּימִנֵּהּ?! הָא מִיקַּיַּים וְקָאֵי! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵימָא בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא כָּתוּב כְּכָתוּב דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: I will uphold I will uphold it? Isn’t upheld and standing? This is what he said: I will say something about it, that even though was not written, it is considered as though it was written.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: I will establish it. I will establish it?! But it is already established and standing! This is what he meant to say: Say regarding it a matter, that even though it is not written as written, it is considered as written.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַאי עוּלְבָּנָא – לִישָּׁנָא דְחוּצְפָּא הוּא, אוֹ לִישָּׁנָא דְנִיחוּתָא הוּא? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: עֲלוּבָה כַּלָּה שֶׁזִּינְּתָה בְּקֶרֶב חוּפָּתָהּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before This ulbena a term of insolence, or a term of convenience, Come hear that Ulla said Insolent [ aluva ] is the bride who is promiscuous under her wedding canopy.
llm_translation: He asked them: Is this 'ulbana - for the sake of impudence, or for the sake of relaxation? Come and hear, for Ulla said: A bride is like a 'ulvah who adorned herself in her bridal chamber.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרַהּ דְּבַת שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי קְרָא? ״עַד שֶׁהַמֶּלֶךְ בִּמְסִבּוֹ נִרְדִּי נָתַן רֵיחוֹ״. אָמַר רָבָא: עֲדַיִין חַבִּיבוּתָא הוּא גַּבַּן, דִּכְתִיב ״נָתַן״, וְלָא כְּתִיב ״הִסְרִיחַ״.
human_translation: Rav Mari, son of Shmuel’s daughter, says: What is the verse “While the king sat at his table, my spikenard sent forth its fragrance” Rava says: the affection is still upon us, as it is written “sent forth and is not written: It reeked.
llm_translation: Rav Mari, son of Raha of the house of Shmuel, said: What is the verse? "Until the king was at his table, my spikenard sent forth its fragrance." Rava said: It is still a matter of endearment, for it is written "sent forth," and not written "made stink."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַנֶּעֱלָבִין וְאֵינָן עוֹלְבִים, שׁוֹמְעִין חֶרְפָּתָן וְאֵין מְשִׁיבִין, עוֹשִׂין מֵאַהֲבָה וּשְׂמֵחִין בְּיִסּוּרִין, עֲלֵיהֶן הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְאוֹהֲבָיו כְּצֵאת הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ בִּגְבוּרָתוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Those who are insulted [ ne’elavin ] but do not insult who hear their shame but do not respond, who act out of love and are joyful in suffering, about them the verse states: “And they that love Him are as the sun going forth in its might”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Those who are insulted but do not insult in return, hear their disgrace but do not respond, act out of love and rejoice in suffering, concerning them the Scripture says: "And his lovers are like the sun when it comes out in full strength."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״פְּרוֹסְבּוּל״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: פְּרוֹס בּוּלֵי וּבוּטֵי.
human_translation: What prosbol ? Rav Ḥisda said: An ordinance [ pros ] of bulei and butei .
llm_translation: What is "Perosbul"? Rav Hisda said: "Peros" in the cities and "Bulei" in the fields.

hebrew_text: בּוּלֵי – אֵלּוּ עֲשִׁירִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׁבַרְתִּי אֶת גְּאוֹן עוּזְּכֶם״, וְתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אֵלּוּ בּוּלָאוֹת שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה. בּוּטֵי – אֵלּוּ הָעֲנִיִּים, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַעֲבֵט תַּעֲבִיטֶנּוּ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְלָעוֹזָא: מַאי פְּרוֹסְבּוּל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוּרְסָא דְמִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Bulei , these are wealthy, as it is written: “And I will break the pride of your power” and Rav Yosef taught These are the bula’ot , of Judea. Butei , these are the poor, as it is written: you shall lend him [ ha’avet ta’avitenu ] Rava said to a foreigner What prosbol ? He said to him: institution [ pursa ] of a matter.
llm_translation: Bulei - these are the wealthy, as it is written: "And I will break the pride of your power." And Rav Yosef taught: these are the wealthy of Judea. Butei - these are the poor, as it is written: "You shall surely open your hand." Rava said to Rav Oza: What is the meaning of "Perosbulei"? He said to him: It is the explanation of the matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יְתוֹמִין, אֵין צְרִיכִין פְּרוֹסְבּוּל. וְכֵן תָּנֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: יְתוֹמִין אֵין צְרִיכִין פְּרוֹסְבּוּל, דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּבֵית דִּינוֹ אֲבִיהֶן שֶׁל יְתוֹמִין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Orphans do not require a prosbol And similarly, Rami bar Ḥama taught Orphans do not require a prosbol , as Rabban Gamliel and his court, the fathers of orphans,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Orphans, do not require a guardian. And similarly, it was taught by Ramei bar Chama: Orphans do not require a guardian, because Rabban Gamliel and his court are the guardians of orphans.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין פְּרוֹסְבּוּל אֶלָּא עַל הַקַּרְקַע. אִם אֵין לוֹ – מְזַכֵּהוּ בְּתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ כׇּל שֶׁהוּ. וְכַמָּה כׇּל שֶׁהוּ? אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ קֶלַח שֶׁל כְּרוּב. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ הִשְׁאִילוֹ מָקוֹם לְתַנּוּר וּלְכִירַיִם – כּוֹתְבִין עָלָיו פְּרוֹסְבּוּל.
human_translation: We learned there One may write a prosbol only on land. If has no transfers any amount of his own field to him And how much any amount? Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: Even a stalk of cabbage Rav Yehuda says: Even he lent him a place for an oven and a stove, one write a prosbol on
llm_translation: We learned there: One may only write a promissory note on the ground. If one does not have ground, he may acquire it with anything he possesses. And how much is considered "anything he possesses"? Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: Even a leaf of a gourd. Rav Yehudah said: Even if he rented out space for an oven or a stove - one may write a promissory note on it.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָתָנֵי הִלֵּל: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין פְּרוֹסְבּוּל אֶלָּא עַל עָצִיץ נָקוּב בִּלְבָד. נָקוּב – אִין, שֶׁאֵינוֹ נָקוּב – לָא;
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Hillel teach One writes a prosbol only on merely a perforated pot a perforated can that is not perforated cannot
llm_translation: I?! And it was taught by Hillel: One may only write a promissory note on a perforated potsherd alone. Perforated - yes, not perforated - no.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? וְהָא אִיכָּא מְקוֹמוֹ! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּמַנַּח אַסִּיכֵּי.
human_translation: why but isn’t there place No, necessary where is resting on stakes
llm_translation: "Why? But there is a place for it! It is not necessary, as it is set aside."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי מַקְנֵי לֵיהּ גִּידְמָא דְּדִיקְלָא, וּכְתַב עֲלֵיהּ פְּרוֹסְבּוּל. רַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי מָסְרִי מִילַּיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן מְסַר מִילֵּי לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא; אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צְרִיכְנָא מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא צְרִיכַתְּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi he would transfer a stump of a palm tree and he wrote a prosbol on this. The Sages of the school of Rav Ashi would transfer their matters, to each other Rabbi Yonatan transferred a matter to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba. said to him: Do I need anything else? He said to him: You do not need
llm_translation: Rav Ashi acquired for him a palm branch, and wrote on it a promissory note. The sages of the house of Rav Ashi handed over their matters to Hadadei. Rabbi Yonatan handed over his matters to Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba; he said to him: Do you need it from someone else? He said to him: No, you do not need it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין לוֹ קַרְקַע, וְלֶעָרֵב יֵשׁ לוֹ קַרְקַע – כּוֹתְבִין עָלָיו פְּרוֹסְבּוּל. לוֹ וְלֶעָרֵב אֵין לָהֶן קַרְקַע, וְלַחַיָּיב לוֹ יֵשׁ לוֹ קַרְקַע – כּוֹתְבִין עָלָיו פְּרוֹסְבּוּל, מִדְּרַבִּי נָתָן –
human_translation: The Sages taught: has no land but the guarantor has land one writes a prosbol on he and the guarantor have no land, but who is obligated to has land, one writes a prosbol on from of Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If he does not have a courtyard, but the neighbor has a courtyard, he writes a partnership agreement with him. If he and the neighbor do not have a courtyard, but the obligation is upon him, he writes a partnership agreement with him, from Rabbi Nathan -

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵרוֹ מָנֶה, וַחֲבֵרוֹ בַּחֲבֵרוֹ, מִנַּיִן שֶׁמּוֹצִיאִין מִזֶּה וְנוֹתְנִין לָזֶה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן לַאֲשֶׁר אָשַׁם לוֹ״.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Natan says: From where when one lends one hundred dinars to his friend, and friend to his friend, that appropriates from this one, and gives it to that one, The verse states “And gives it to him in respect of whom he has been guilty”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Natan says: From where do we learn that one can appoint on behalf of his friend, and his friend can appoint on behalf of his friend? From where do we learn that one can take from this and give to that? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall give it to the one whom he is guilty."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַשְּׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמֶּטֶת אֶת הַמִּלְוָה, בֵּין בִּשְׁטָר בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁטָר. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בִּשְׁטָר – שְׁטָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים, שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁטָר – שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים; כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן מִלְוֶה עַל פֶּה.
human_translation: We learned there The Sabbatical abrogates debt both with note and without note. Rav and Shmuel who both say: with note, note that contains a property guarantee; without note, that does not contain a property guarantee. All the more so, a loan by oral
llm_translation: We learned there: The seventh year cancels debts, whether the loan was with a document or without a document. Rav and Shmuel both say: With a document - a document that has collateral, without a document - a document that does not have collateral; all the more so is this the case for a verbal loan.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בִּשְׁטָר – שְׁטָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים, שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁטָר – מִלְוֶה עַל פֶּה. אֲבָל שְׁטָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish who both say: with a note note that does not contain a property guarantee, without note a loan by oral However, does not abrogate note that contains a property guarantee,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish both said: With a document - a document that does not have collateral, with no document - a loan is given on trust. But a document that has collateral - it is not canceled.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: שְׁטַר חוֹב – מְשַׁמֵּט, וְאִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט. תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: סִיֵּים לוֹ שָׂדֶה אַחַת בְּהַלְווֹאָתוֹ, אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ כָּתַב: ״כׇּל נְכָסַיי אַחְרָאִין וְעַרְבָאִין לָךְ״ – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: abrogates a promissory note, but if contains a property guarantee does not abrogate it. it is taught another specified one field for his loan, it is not canceled. And not only that, but even he wrote: All of my property is pledged and guaranteed to you, does not abrogate it,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: A promissory note for a debt - it is collectible, but if it includes other assets - it is not collectible. Another teaching: If he designated one field for his loan, it is not collectible. Moreover, even if he wrote, "All my other assets and guarantors are for you," it is not collectible.

hebrew_text: קָרִיבֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא שְׁטָרָא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁמֵּט אוֹ אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט. שַׁבְקֵיהּ, וַאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁמֵּט.
human_translation: The relative of Rabbi Asi had a certain note that had a property guarantee written in it. He came before Rabbi Asi said to him: abrogate or not abrogate He said to him: does not abrogate He left and came before Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: It does abrogate
llm_translation: The close associates of Rabbi Assi had a certain document in which it was written: "Succession of assets." He came before Rabbi Assi, who said to him: "Is it being annulled or not?" He replied: "It is not being annulled." He left it and came before Rabbi Yochanan, who said to him: "It is being annulled."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא רַבִּי אַסִּי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁמֵּט אוֹ אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁמֵּט. וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָנוּ מְדַמִּין, נַעֲשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָתַנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּמָר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא הָהִיא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת – כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi came before Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: abrogate or not abrogate He said to him: It does abrogate But wasn’t it Master who said does not abrogate said to him: Because we think we perform an action said to him: But isn’t it taught in in accordance with of Master? He said to him: Perhaps that is Beit Shammai, who say A note that stands to be collected is considered as though it has been collected,
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi came before Rabbi Yochanan, he said to him: Does he release or does he not release? He said to him: He releases. But didn't the Master say he does not release? He said to him: Just because we suspect, should we act on it? He said to him: But it is taught according to the opinion of the Master! He said to him: Perhaps that is the opinion of Beit Shammai, who say: A promissory note that is standing to be collected is considered as if the money itself.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ מָעוֹת עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, וְהַמּוֹסֵר שְׁטָרוֹתָיו לְבֵית דִין – אֵין מְשַׁמְּטִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא מוֹסֵר שְׁטָרוֹתָיו לְבֵית דִּין – דְּתָפְסִי לְהוּ בֵּי דִינָא. אֶלָּא מַלְוֶה עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: We learned there one who lends money to another on collateral, and one who transfers his notes to a court, is not canceled. Granted, one transfers his notes to a court, as court seizes But what is the reason one who lends on collateral?
llm_translation: We learned there: One who lends money to his fellow with interest on the collateral, and hands over his promissory notes to the court - they do not release the collateral. Granted, if he hands over his promissory notes to the court - for they are in the hands of the court. But lending with interest on the collateral, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּתָפֵס לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הִלְוָהוּ וְדָר בַּחֲצֵרוֹ – דְּתָפֵיס לֵיהּ, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מְשַׁמֵּט?!
human_translation: Rava said: Due to has seized Abaye said to him: If that is so, loaned money to and lives in his courtyard since seizes also does not abrogate
llm_translation: Rava said: Because he caught him. Abaye said to him: Rather, from now on, lend to him and let him live in his courtyard - so that he will catch him, is this not also a form of guaranteeing the loan?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי מַשְׁכּוֹן, דְּקָנֵי לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְךָ תִּהְיֶה צְדָקָה״ – אִם אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה, צְדָקָה מִנַּיִן? מִכָּאן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן.
human_translation: said to him: Collateral is different, as acquires it from of Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From where that a creditor acquires collateral As it is stated “And it shall be righteousness for you” If does not acquire from where righteousness From here that a creditor acquires the collateral.
llm_translation: He said to him: The case of a pledge is different, for it is acquired from Rabbi Yitzchak - for Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we know that a creditor who acquires a pledge? As it is stated: "And righteousness will be to you" - if he does not acquire, from where does righteousness come? Hence, a creditor acquires a pledge.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם:
human_translation: We learned there
llm_translation: We have learned there:

hebrew_text: הַמַּחֲזִיר חוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ בַּשְּׁבִיעִית – צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר לוֹ: ״מְשַׁמֵּט אֲנִי״; וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״אַף עַל פִּי כֵן״, יְקַבֵּל הֵימֶנּוּ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזֶה דְּבַר הַשְּׁמִטָּה״.
human_translation: one who repays a debt to his friend during the Sabbatical must say to him: I abrogate but if said to him: Nevertheless, he may accept it from him, as it is stated: “And this is the manner [ devar ] of the abrogation”
llm_translation: The one who returns a debt to his fellow in the seventh year - he must say to him: "I am remitting it"; and if he says to him: "Nevertheless," he should accept it from him. As it is stated: "And this is the matter of remission."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: וְתָלֵי לֵיהּ עַד דְּאָמַר הָכִי. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁהוּא נוֹתֵן לוֹ, אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ: ״בְּחוֹבִי אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָךְ״, אֶלָּא יֹאמַר לוֹ: ״שֶׁלִּי הֵן, וּבְמַתָּנָה אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָךְ״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּלֵי לֵיהּ נָמֵי עַד דְּאָמַר הָכִי.
human_translation: Rabba said: And to lift up to him until says this, Abaye raised an objection to When gives he should not say to him: I give to you my debt; rather, he should say to him: This is my and I give it to you as a gift. said to him: lift up to him as well, until says this,
llm_translation: Rabba said: And he should hang it until he says thus. Abaye raised an objection: When he gives it to him, he should not say to him, "I am giving it to you as a loan," but rather he should say to him, "It is mine, and as a gift I am giving it to you!" He said to him: Hang it before him until he says thus.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא בַּר מָרְתָּא, דְּהוּא אַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי, הֲוָה מַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ רַבָּה זוּזֵי. אַיְיתִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בִּשְׁבִיעִית, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁמֵּט אֲנִי. שַׁקְלִינְהוּ וַאֲזַל. אֲתָא אַבָּיֵי, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה עֲצִיב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי עֲצִיב מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Abba bar Marta, who is Abba bar Minyumi, from whom Rabba was collect a debt. He brought it to him in the Sabbatical said to him: I abrogate took and left. Abaye came found that he was sad. said to him: Why is Master sad? said to him: This was the incident
llm_translation: Abba bar Marta, who is Abba bar Minyomei, was hosting Rabba Zuzai. He brought him a dish on Shabbat, and he said to him: "I am removing it." He took it and left. Abbaye came, found him to be sad, and said to him: "Why are you sad, master?" He said to him: "This is what happened."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמְטֵית לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְמָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי אֲמַר לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״מְשַׁמֵּט אֲנִי״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וַאֲמַרְתְּ לֵיהּ ״אַף עַל פִּי כֵן״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאִי אֲמַרְתְּ לֵיהּ ״אַף עַל פִּי כֵן״, הֲוָה שַׁקְלִינְהוּ מִינָּךְ; הַשְׁתָּא מִיהַת אַמְטִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וְאֵימָא לֵיהּ ״אַף עַל פִּי כֵן״. אֲזַל אַמְטִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״אַף עַל פִּי כֵן״. שַׁקְלִינְהוּ מִינֵּיהּ, אָמַר: לָא הֲוָה בֵּיהּ דַּעְתָּא בְּהַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: went to said to him: Did you bring the money to Master? He said to him: Yes. said to him: And what did he say to you? He said to him I abrogate said to him: And did you say to him: Nevertheless, said to him: No. said to him: But if you had said to him: Nevertheless, he would have taken it from you. Now, in any event, bring it to him and say to him: Nevertheless, went brought to and said to him: Nevertheless, took it from him. said: This Torah scholar was not knowledgeable from the beginning,
llm_translation: He went to meet him, he said to him: Did you give money to the master? He said to him: No. He said to him: And what did he say to you? He said to him: "I am a creditor." He said to him: And did you also say to him "nevertheless"? He said to him: No. He said to him: And if you had said to him "nevertheless," he would have taken it from you; now go and give it to him, and say to him "nevertheless." He went and gave it to him, and said to him "nevertheless." He took it from him, and said: He did not have the intention in the first place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר: ״פְּרוֹסְבּוּל הָיָה בְּיָדִי, וְאָבַד מִמֶּנִּי״. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן פְּרוֹסְבּוּל, לָא שָׁבֵיק הֶיתֵּירָא וְאָכֵיל אִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav Naḥman says: A person is deemed credible to say: I had a prosbol and I lost it, What is the reason Since the Sages instituted prosbol one does not leave aside a permitted and eat a forbidden
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Nachman: A person is trustworthy to say, "Porsovol was in my possession, and it got lost from me." What is the reason? Since the Rabbis established Porsovol, he did not neglect the prohibition and ate the forbidden food.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִידֵּי פְּרוֹסְבּוּל הָיָה לְךָ וְאָבַד? כְּגוֹן זֶה, ״פְּתַח פִּיךָ לָאִלֵּם״ הוּא.
human_translation: When they would come before Rav he say to Did you have any prosbol and it was lost? this is where “Open your mouth for the mute”
llm_translation: When they came before Rav, he said to him: "Because of the negligence of Parosbul you had a loss? For example, this, 'Open your mouth for the mute' it is.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְכֵן בַּעַל חוֹב שֶׁמּוֹצִיא שְׁטַר חוֹב, וְאֵין עִמּוֹ פְּרוֹסְבּוּל – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ.
human_translation: Didn’t we learn And similarly, a creditor who presents a promissory note unaccompanied by a prosbol , these may not be collected.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: And similarly, a Baal Chov (creditor) who produces a promissory note of debt, and there is no witness with him - these shall not collect.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא – דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹצִיא שְׁטַר חוֹב – צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא עִמּוֹ פְּרוֹסְבּוּל. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught one who presents a promissory note he must a prosbol with it and the Rabbis say: He does not need
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: One who produces a promissory note of debt - it is necessary that he have with him a witness. And the Sages say: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֶבֶד שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּה וּפְדָאוּהוּ, אִם לְשׁוּם עֶבֶד – יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד; אִם לְשׁוּם בֶּן חוֹרִין – לֹא יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד.
human_translation: slave that was captured, and redeemed him, if to be a slave he will be a slave. If to be a freeman he will not be a slave. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Both in this and in that he will be a slave.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A slave who was captured and then redeemed, if it was for the sake of being a slave - he shall be enslaved; if it was for the sake of being a free man - he shall not be enslaved. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In either case, he shall be enslaved.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ, לְשׁוּם בֶּן חוֹרִין – אַמַּאי לָא יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד? אֶלָּא לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ, לְשׁוּם עֶבֶד – אַמַּאי יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד?
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If we say before despairing to be a freeman, why he will not be a slave? Rather, after despairing to be a slave, why will he be a slave?
llm_translation: We are dealing with a case of a stolen animal. If we say it was before Ye'ush (despair), for the sake of a free man - why should it not be returned? Rather, if it was after Ye'ush, for the sake of a slave - why should it be returned?
