hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ, וּלְשׁוּם עֶבֶד – יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד לְרַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן, לְשׁוּם בֶּן חוֹרִין – לֹא יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד לֹא לְרַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא לְרַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי; לְרַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי לָא, דְּהָא לְשׁוּם בֶּן חוֹרִין פַּרְקֵיהּ, לְרַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי לָא, דִּילְמָא מִמַּנְעִי וְלָא פָּרְקִי.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, before despairing to be a slave, he will be a slave to his first master. to be a freeman, he will not be a slave, neither to his first master nor to his second master, not to his second master because he redeemed him as a freeman also not to his first master lest refrain from redeeming
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always in front of Ye'ush, and for the sake of a slave - he should be subservient to his first master, but for the sake of a free man - he should not be subservient neither to his first master nor to his second master; not to his second master, because for the sake of a free man he has separated himself, but to his first master, perhaps he will retract and not separate himself.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד – קָסָבַר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּצְוָה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, כָּךְ מִצְוָה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת הָעֲבָדִים.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Both in this and in that he will be a slave He holds just as it is a mitzva to redeem freemen, so it is a mitzva to redeem slaves,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Whether this or that, one should be redeemed." He holds: Just as it is a commandment to redeem free men, so too it is a commandment to redeem slaves.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ, וּלְשׁוּם עֶבֶד – יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד לְרַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי, לְשׁוּם בֶּן חוֹרִין – לֹא יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד לֹא לְרַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא לְרַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי; לְרַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי לָא, דְּהָא לְשׁוּם בֶּן חוֹרִין פַּרְקֵיהּ, לְרַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי לָא, דְּהָא לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, after despairing And to be a slave he will be a slave to his second master, to be a freeman he will not be a slave, neither to his first master nor to his second master. not to his second master as he redeemed him as a freeman. also not to his first master, as was after despairing
llm_translation: Rava said: Always after despair, and for the sake of a slave - let him serve his second master, for the sake of a free man - he should not serve neither his first master nor his second master; for his second master, no, because for the sake of a free man he has broken off his relationship, but for his first master, yes, because after despair it was.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד – כִּדְחִזְקִיָּה, דְּאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד? שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הוֹלֵךְ וּמַפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לִגְיָיסוֹת, וּמַפְקִיעַ עַצְמוֹ מִיָּד רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Both in this and in that he will be a slave. in accordance with of Ḥizkiyya, as Ḥizkiyya said: For what they say both in this and in that he will be a slave? so that each and every should not go and hand himself over to troops, and release himself from the possession of his master.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Whether this way or that way one should conduct oneself - like Hezekiah, as Hezekiah said: Why did they say one should conduct oneself this way or that way? So that each and every one should not go and throw himself into factions, and remove himself immediately from his master."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר לָהֶן רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּצְוָה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, כָּךְ מִצְוָה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת הָעֲבָדִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי – דְּאָמַר לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ, הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר ״כְּשֵׁם״;
human_translation: raises an objection Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to them: Just as it is a mitzva to redeem freemen, so it is a mitzva to redeem slaves. Granted, according to Abaye as he said before despairing This is that he said: Just as,
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to them: Just as it is a commandment to redeem free men, so too it is a commandment to redeem slaves. It is understandable according to Abbaye - for he said in the presence of Ye'ush, that is what he meant by "Just as."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ, הַאי ״כְּשֵׁם״?! מִשּׁוּם דְּחִזְקִיָּה הוּא!
human_translation: However, according to Rava, who said after despairing, this just as is because of Ḥizkiyya.
llm_translation: Rather, to Rava - who said after despair, this "like"?! Because it is from Hezekiah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָא הָוֵי יָדַע מַאי קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: אִי לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ קָאָמְרִיתוּ – הַיְינוּ ״כְּשֵׁם״; אִי לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ קָאָמְרִיתוּ – כִּדְחִזְקִיָּה.
human_translation: Rava said to you: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel did not know what the Rabbis said, and this is what he said to them: If you say before despairing, this is just as If you say after despairing, in accordance with of Ḥizkiyya.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel did not know what the sages were saying, and thus he said to them: If you are saying it before despair - that is "like"; if you are saying it after despair - like Hezekiah.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ, וּלְרַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי; רַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי מִמַּאן קָנֵי לֵיהּ – מִשַּׁבַּאי, שַׁבַּאי גּוּפֵיהּ מִי קָנֵי לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: And according to Rava, who said after despairing and to his second master, second master, from whom did he acquire from the captor, did captor himself acquire
llm_translation: And to Rava - who said after despair, and to his teacher the second; from whom does his teacher the second acquire it - from Shabbai, does Shabbai himself acquire it?!

hebrew_text: אִין; קָנֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעֲשֶׂה יָדָיו – דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִנַּיִן לְגוֹי, שֶׁקָּנָה אֶת הַגּוֹי לְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְגַם מִבְּנֵי הַתּוֹשָׁבִים הַגָּרִים עִמָּכֶם מֵהֶם תִּקְנוּ״ – אַתֶּם קוֹנִים מֵהֶם,
human_translation: Yes, he acquired with regard to his labor, as Reish Lakish says: From where that a gentile can acquire gentile with regard to his labor? As it is stated: “Moreover, of the children of the strangers who sojourn among you, of them you may acquire” you, acquire from them,
llm_translation: He does not acquire it for the work of his hands - as Reish Lakish said: From where do we derive that a non-Jew can acquire a Jew for the work of his hands? As it is stated: "And also from the children of the residents who live among you, from them you shall acquire" - you acquire from them.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הֵם קוֹנִים מִכֶּם, וְלֹא הֵם קוֹנִים זֶה מִזֶּה. יָכוֹל לֹא יִקְנוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה? יָכוֹל לֹא יִקְנוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה?! הָאָמְרַתְּ: לֹא הֵם קוֹנִים זֶה מִזֶּה! הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְלֹא הֵם קוֹנִים זֶה מִזֶּה לְגוּפוֹ.
human_translation: but cannot acquire of you, and they cannot acquire each other might they shall not acquire each other. might they shall not acquire each other; didn’t you say they cannot acquire each other? this is what he said: cannot acquire each other with regard to himself.
llm_translation: And not they acquire from you, and not they acquire this from this. Can not they acquire this from this? Can not they acquire this from this?! You said: Not they acquire this from this! Thus it is stated: And not they acquire this from this for itself.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יִקְנוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה לְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו? אָמַרְתָּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר: גּוֹי – יִשְׂרָאֵל, קוֹנֶה; גּוֹי – גּוֹי, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: might they shall not acquire each other for his labor. You can say an a fortiori a gentile acquire a Jew all the more so not a gentile a gentile?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yachol lo yiknu ze et ze l'ma'aseh yadav? Amarta kal va'chomer: goy - Yisrael, koneh; goy - goy, lo kol sheken?!" English translation: "Is it possible that one should not acquire from another through his own handiwork? You said a fortiori: a non-Jew - a Jew, acquires; a non-Jew - a non-Jew, all the more so?!"

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּכַסְפָּא, אֲבָל בַּחֲזָקָה – לָא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב טָהֲרוּ בְּסִיחוֹן.
human_translation: But I say this applies via money. However, via possession, not Rav Pappa says Ammon and Moab became purified through Sihon.
llm_translation: And why? These matters with money, but with presumption - no! Rav Papa said: Ammon and Moab were purified by Sichon.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן גּוֹי – גּוֹי; גּוֹי – יִשְׂרָאֵל, מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁבְּ מִמֶּנּוּ שֶׁבִי״.
human_translation: We found a gentile a gentile from where do we a gentile a Jew As it is written: and took of them captive”
llm_translation: I found a non-Jew - a non-Jew; a non-Jew - an Israelite, from where? As it is written: "And he took captive from it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֶבֶד שֶׁבָּרַח מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִים – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁכּוֹפִין אֶת רַבּוֹ וְכוֹתֵב לוֹ גֵּט שִׁיחְרוּר.
human_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A slave who escaped from prison is emancipated. And moreover, his master is forced to write him a bill of manumission
llm_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A slave who escaped from the house of confinement - he goes out to freedom, and not only that, but they force his master and write for him a bill of emancipation.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד; וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמִשְׁנָתֵנוּ – הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, חוּץ מֵעָרֵב וְצַיְדָן וּרְאָיָה אַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: We learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says Both in this and in that he will be a slave. And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Every place where Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught in our mishna, the halakha is in accordance with his except for guarantor, and Tzaidan, and evidence final
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "In this case and in that case, one may perform the action." And Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "In any place where Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel changed in our Mishnah – the halakha follows his opinion, except for Eruv, Tzaydan, and the last sighting."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי, מוֹקֵי לַהּ לְהַאי – לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ, וְהַאי – לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ.
human_translation: Granted, according to Abaye, he establishes before despair. And this after despair.
llm_translation: In peace to Abbaye, he said to her this - before despair, and this - after despair.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן!
human_translation: However, according to Rava, who said after despair a difficulty. of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: Rather, to Rava - who said after despair, the difficulty of Rabbi Yochanan is greater than Rabbi Yochanan!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דְּחִזְקִיָּה; בּוֹרֵחַ שָׁאנֵי – הַשְׁתָּא לִקְטָלָא מְסַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אַפּוֹלֵי אַפֵּיל נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִגְיָיסוֹת?!
human_translation: Rava said to you: What is the reason because of Ḥizkiyya, escapes is different, now to give himself over to death he will throw himself into troops?
llm_translation: Rava said to you: The reason is - because of Hezekiah; one who flees - now he is delivering his soul to be killed, even if he falls he should rather deliver his soul to idolatry?!

hebrew_text: אַמְתֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל אִשְׁתְּבַאי. פַּרְקוּהָ לְשׁוּם אַמְהֻתָא, וְשַׁדְּרוּהָ לֵיהּ. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: אֲנַן – כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סְבִירָא לַן, אַתְּ – אִי נָמֵי כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לָךְ, אֲנַן לְשׁוּם אַמְהֻתָא פָּרְקִינַן לַהּ (נִיהֲלַהּ).
human_translation: The maidservant of Master Shmuel was taken captive. redeemed her to be a maidservant and sent her to him. They sent him We hold in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, Even if you hold in accordance with the Rabbis we redeemed her to be a maidservant,
llm_translation: His mother, the wife of Mar Samuel, was sitting. They tore her garment for her, and they sent to her: "We - like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, believe, you - if you also believe like Rabban, we will tear it for you."

hebrew_text: וְאִינְהוּ סְבוּר – לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ הֲוָה, וְלָא הִיא – לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ הֲוָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל – לָא מִיבַּעְיָא דְּאִשְׁתַּעְבּוֹדֵי לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד בַּהּ, אֶלָּא גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא נָמֵי לָא אַצְרְכָה.
human_translation: And they thought was before despair, but is not so. It was after despair, and Shmuel it is not necessary that he did not enslave her. But also, he did not require her a bill of manumission,
llm_translation: They thought - before Yeush was, and it is not - after Yeush was, and Shmuel - does not require service, does not serve with it, rather, a bill of freedom is also not necessary.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁיחְרוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל עֶבֶד אִישׁ מִקְנַת כָּסֶף״ – ״עֶבֶד אִישׁ״ וְלֹא ״עֶבֶד אִשָּׁה״?! אֶלָּא עֶבֶד שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְרַבּוֹ עָלָיו – קָרוּי עֶבֶד; שֶׁאֵין לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְרַבּוֹ עָלָיו – אֵין קָרוּי עֶבֶד.
human_translation: Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel says: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated, and he does not require a bill of manumission. which is stated: “But every slave man that is bought for money” a slave a man, and not to a woman slave? Rather, a slave whose master has authority over him, is called a slave, whose master does not have authority over him, is not called a slave
llm_translation: Samuel according to his reasoning, as Samuel said: One who emancipates his slave - he goes out to freedom, and does not require a bill of manumission, as it is stated: "And every slave that is a man's possession" - "slave of a man" and not "slave of a woman"?! Rather, a slave who has the option to be under his master's authority is called a slave; one who does not have the option to be under his master's authority is not called a slave.

hebrew_text: אַמְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זוּטְרָא אִישְׁתְּבַאי, פַּרְקַהּ הָהוּא תַּרְמוֹדָאָה לְשׁוּם אִיתְּתָא. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ: אִי יָאוּת עָבְדַתְּ, שַׁדַּר לַהּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא.
human_translation: The maidservant of Rabbi Abba bar Zutra was taken captive. A certain tarmoda’a redeemed her to be wife. sent to If you act correctly, send her a bill of manumission.
llm_translation: The maidservant of Rabbi Abba bar Zutra the Ish Tibai, her cow trampled a certain field belonging to a woman. They sent to him: If you have done well, send her a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּמָצוּ פָּרְקִי לַהּ, לְמָה לִי גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא? אִי דְּלָא מָצוּ פָּרְקִי לַהּ, כִּי שַׁדַּר לַהּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If where are able to redeem her, why do I a bill of manumission? If where they are unable to redeem her, when he sends her a bill of manumission, what of it?
llm_translation: "How are the circumstances? If they found a torn document for her, why do I need a bill of divorce of freedom? If they did not find a torn document for her, when he sends her a bill of divorce of freedom, what is the status?"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּמָצוּ פָּרְקִי לַהּ; וְכֵיוָן דִּמְשַׁדַּר לָהּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא, חַבּוֹרֵי מִחַבְּרִי אַהֲדָדֵי, וּפָרְקִי לַהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא מָצוּ פָּרְקִי לַהּ, וְכֵיוָן דִּמְשַׁדַּר לַהּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא, מִיתַּזְלָא בְּאַפֵּיהּ, וּמְפָרֵיק לַהּ.
human_translation: Actually, where they are able to redeem her And since he sends her a bill of manumission, will join together and redeem her, And if you wish, say Actually, where they are unable to redeem her, And once he sends her a bill of manumission, she will be disrespected in the eyes and he will allow her to be redeemed.
llm_translation: Always they find a chapter for her; and once they send to her a bill of divorce of freedom, friends from friends unite, and a chapter for her. And if you wish, say: Always they do not find a chapter for her, and once they send to her a bill of divorce of freedom, she becomes angry, and breaks it for her.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר מָר: חֲבִיבָה לָהֶן בְּהֶמְתָּן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מִנְּשׁוֹתֵיהֶן! הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּצִינְעָא, אֲבָל בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא זִילָא בְּהוּ מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: But didn’t the Master say: The animals of Jews are more beloved than their wives? This statement applies in private; however, in public, the matter is disrespected,
llm_translation: And the Master said: "They are more beloved to them, the livestock of Israel, than their wives!" These matters are in private, but in public go with the matter.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אַמְתָּא דַּהֲוָת בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, דַּהֲווֹ קָא מְעַבְּדִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי אִיסּוּרָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אִי לָאו דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַמְשַׁחְרֵר עַבְדּוֹ עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה; הֲוָה כָּיֵיפְנָא לֵיהּ לְמָרַהּ, וְכָתֵיב לַהּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא. רָבִינָא אָמַר: כִּי הָא מוֹדֶה רַב יְהוּדָה, מִשּׁוּם מִילְּתָא דְאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: a certain maidservant in Pumbedita with whom people were performing prohibited acts, Abaye said: If not that Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says anyone who emancipates his slave violates a positive I would force her master, and he would write her a bill of manumission, Ravina said: like that, Rav Yehuda concedes due to the prohibited matter
llm_translation: That certain truth that was in Pumbedita, where they were engaging in forbidden activities. Abaye said, if not for what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Anyone who frees his slave transgresses a positive commandment; we would have turned him over to the authorities, yet it is written for him a document of freedom. Ravina said: For this Rav Yehudah concedes, due to the matter of the prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי – מִשּׁוּם אִיסּוּרָא לָא?! הָאָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁחֶצְיָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין,
human_translation: And Abaye cannot due to a prohibition Didn’t Rav Ḥanina bar Rav Ketina say Rav Yitzḥak says: an incident involving a woman a half-maidservant half-free woman,
llm_translation: Abaye - because of prohibition not?! For Rav Chanina bar Rav Katina said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident with a woman, half of her was a maidservant and half was a free woman,

hebrew_text: וְכָפוּ אֶת רַבָּהּ וַעֲשָׂאָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין, וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִנְהַג הֶפְקֵר נָהֲגוּ בָּהּ!
human_translation: and forced her master and he made her a free woman. And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said They took liberties with her,
llm_translation: And they bent over Rabah and made her a free woman, and Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: They have practiced the custom of hefker with her!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם לָא לְעֶבֶד חַזְיָא וְלָא לְבֶן חוֹרִין חַזְיָא, הָכָא אֶפְשָׁר דִּמְיַחֵד לַהּ לְעַבְדֵּיהּ, וּמְנַטַּר לַהּ.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, she is not fit for a slave and she is not fit for a freeman. Here, it is possible to assign her to his slave, and will guard her
llm_translation: So now?! There, not for the slave of Hazya and not for the free son of Hazya, here it is possible that he is marrying her to his slaves, and he is providing for her.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַמְשַׁחְרֵר עַבְדּוֹ עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְעוֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבוֹדוּ״.
human_translation: the itself Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Anyone who emancipates his slave violates a positive mitzva, as it is stated: “Of them may you take your bondmen forever”
llm_translation: Body - Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Anyone who frees his slave transgresses a positive commandment, as it is stated: "You shall serve them forever."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁנִּכְנַס בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְלֹא מָצָא עֲשָׂרָה, וְשִׁחְרֵר עַבְדּוֹ וְהִשְׁלִימוֹ לַעֲשָׂרָה! מִצְוָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection an incident involving Rabbi Eliezer, who entered a synagogue and he did not find ten and he emancipated his slave and had him complete ten. a mitzva, is different.
llm_translation: Challenger: There is a teaching: It happened with Rabbi Eliezer that he entered the synagogue and did not find ten, so he freed his slave and completed the ten! The commandment is different.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לְעוֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבוֹדוּ״ – רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה. וְדִילְמָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר לַהּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר רְשׁוּת!
human_translation: The Sages taught: “Of them may you take your bondmen forever,” optional; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: an obligation. But perhaps Rabbi Eliezer holds in accordance with the one who says optional.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "You shall always serve them" - permission, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: obligation. And perhaps Rabbi Eliezer holds like the one who says permission!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ; דְּתַנְיָא בְּהֶדְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.
human_translation: cannot enter your mind as it is taught explicitly Rabbi Eliezer says: an obligation.
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ; דְּתַנְיָא בְּהֶדְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה." English translation: "It did not come up to your mind; as it was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Eliezer says: 'An obligation.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: בְּהָנֵי תְּלָת מִילֵּי, נָחֲתִי בַּעֲלֵי בָתִּים מִנִּכְסֵיהוֹן: דְּמַפְּקִי עַבְדַיְיהוּ לְחֵירוּתָא, וּדְסָיְירִי נִכְסַיְיהוּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא, וּדְקָבְעִי סְעוּדְתַּיְיהוּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא בְּעִידָּן בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁתֵּי מִשְׁפָּחוֹת הָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, אַחַת קָבְעָה סְעוּדָּתָהּ בְּשַׁבָּת וְאַחַת קָבְעָה סְעוּדָּתָהּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וּשְׁתֵּיהֶן נֶעְקְרוּ.
human_translation: Rabba said: With these three matters homeowners become impoverished: That they emancipate their slaves; and that they inspect their property on Shabbat; and that they set their meals on Shabbat at the time of the study hall, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There were two families in Jerusalem, one set its meal on Shabbat and one set its meal on the eve of Shabbat, and both of them were uprooted.
llm_translation: Rabba said: With regard to three matters, the homeowners were negligent: for they would send out their servants to freedom, and they would inspect their properties on Shabbat, and they would establish their meals on Shabbat during the time of the study hall. For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: There were two families in Jerusalem, one would establish its meal on Shabbat and one would establish its meal on Friday evening, and both were uprooted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ עַבְדּוֹ, יָצָא לְחֵירוּת. מַאי טַעְמָא? גּוּפֵיהּ – לָא קַדִּישׁ; לִדְמֵי – לָא קָאָמַר; דְּלֶיהְוֵי ״עַם קָדוֹשׁ״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rabba says Rav says: one who consecrates his slave, is emancipated. What is the reason He did not consecrate himself, with regard to his monetary did not say that he said should be sacred nation,
llm_translation: Rabba said in the name of Rav: One who consecrates his slave, he goes out to freedom. What is the reason? His body - he did not consecrate; his value - he did not say. For he said "a holy people" (Deuteronomy 14:2), he meant.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ, יָצָא לְחֵירוּת. מַאן דְּאָמַר מַקְדִּישׁ – כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן מַפְקִיר; מַאן דְּאָמַר מַפְקִיר – אֲבָל מַקְדִּישׁ לָא, דִּלְמָא לִדְמֵי קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef Rav says: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated. the one who says one who consecrates all the more so one who renounces ownership. the one who says one who renounces ownership but one who consecrates not perhaps he said with regard to his monetary
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said in the name of Rav: One who emancipates his slave, he has gone out to freedom. Whoever says "he consecrates" - all the more so if he emancipates; whoever says "he emancipates" - but consecrates not, perhaps he meant to say something similar.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: צָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁיחְרוּר, אוֹ לֹא צָרִיךְ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה, יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before require a bill of manumission, or does he not require Come hear that Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin says Rav says: both this and that is emancipated but requires a bill of manumission.
llm_translation: He asked them: Does one need a bill of emancipation or not? Come and hear, for Rav Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rav: Whether this one or that one, he has gone out to freedom, and he needs a bill of emancipation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: וּמוֹתְבִינַן אַשְּׁמַעְתִּין – הַמַּקְדִּישׁ נְכָסָיו וְהָיוּ בָּהֶן עֲבָדִים, אֵין הַגִּזְבָּרִין רַשָּׁאִין לְהוֹצִיאָן לְחֵירוּת; אֲבָל מוֹכְרִין אוֹתָן לַאֲחֵרִים, וַאֲחֵרִים מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן לְחֵירוּת. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, אַף הוּא – נוֹתֵן דְּמֵי עַצְמוֹ וְיוֹצֵא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוֹכְרוֹ לוֹ! מַתְנִיתָא קָא רָמֵית עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב?! רַב תַּנָּא הוּא, וּפָלֵיג.
human_translation: Rabba said: And we raise an objection to our halakha one who consecrates his possessions, and among them were slaves, treasurers are not allowed to emancipate them. However, they may sell to others, and others emancipate them. Rabbi says: I say even himself can give his own monetary value and is emancipated, due to that it is as if sold him to himself. you raise an objection to Rav a baraita ? Rav is a tanna , and, dispute
llm_translation: Rabah said: And we have learned: one who consecrates his property and there are slaves among them, the tax collectors are not permitted to take them out to freedom; but if he sells them to others, others may take them out to freedom. Rabbi says: I say, even he himself - he gives his own money and goes out, because he is like selling himself to him! You have raised a contradiction against Rav from a Mishnah?! He is a Tanna, and he disputes.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אַךְ כׇּל חֵרֶם וְגוֹ׳ מֵאָדָם״ – אֵלּוּ עֲבָדָיו וְשִׁפְחוֹתָיו הַכְּנַעֲנִים! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּאָמַר לִדְמֵי.
human_translation: Come hear: “Notwithstanding, no dedicated thing “Of man”; these are his Canaanite slaves and maidservants. With what are we dealing here? where said with regard to their monetary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'Only every devoted thing etc.' - these are his Canaanite slaves and maidservants! Here, what are we dealing with - that he said 'to blood'."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אִידַּךְ נָמֵי דְּאָמַר לִדְמֵי!
human_translation: If that is so, the other also where one said with regard to his monetary
llm_translation: If so, the other one also said similarly!

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״אֵין הַגִּזְבָּרִים רַשָּׁאִין לְהוֹצִיאָן לְחֵירוּת״ – גִּזְבָּרִים מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ?
human_translation: If that is so, treasurers gizbarim are not allowed to emancipate them. treasurers; what are they doing
llm_translation: Thus, "The Gazbarim are not permitted to be taken out to freedom" - What is the work of the Gazbarim?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ – ״אֲבָל מוֹכְרִין אוֹתָן לַאֲחֵרִים, וַאֲחֵרִים מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן לְחֵירוּת״ – אֲחֵרִים מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? וְתוּ – ״רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, אַף הוּא – נוֹתֵן דְּמֵי עַצְמוֹ וְיוֹצֵא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוֹכְרוֹ לוֹ״ – וְאִי לִדְמֵי, מַאי ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוֹכְרוֹ לוֹ״?
human_translation: And furthermore, However, they may sell to others, and others emancipate them. Others; what are they doing And furthermore, Rabbi says: I say even himself can give his own monetary value and is emancipated, due to that it is as if sold him to himself. And if with regard to his monetary what Due to that it is as if sold him to himself?
llm_translation: "And furthermore - 'But they may sell them to others, and others may release them for freedom' - what do others do with them? And furthermore - 'Rabbi says: I say, even he - he gives his own money and releases, because he is like his seller to him' - and if not with his own money, what is 'because he is like his seller to him'?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ עַבְדּוֹ – עוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל, שֶׁלֹּא הִקְדִּישׁ אֶלָּא דָּמָיו!
human_translation: Come hear: one who consecrates his slave, works and is sustained as consecrated only his monetary
llm_translation: "Come and hear: One who sanctifies his slave - he performs and eats, for he only sanctified his value!"

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אָדָם מוֹצִיא דְּבָרָיו לְבַטָּלָה.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who says: A person does not make a statement for naught.
llm_translation: This is the statement - Rabbi Meir it is, as he said: "A person does not bring forth his words to nullity."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְכֵן הוּא, שֶׁהִקְדִּישׁ עַצְמוֹ – עוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל, שֶׁלֹּא הִקְדִּישׁ אֶלָּא דָּמָיו. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא – שַׁפִּיר;
human_translation: This too stands to reason, as it teaches in the latter clause And so too, who consecrated himself works and is sustained as he consecrated only his monetary Granted, if you say is Rabbi Meir, well.
llm_translation: Thus it is reasonable to conclude, as it is taught in the latter part: "And similarly, one who consecrated himself - he may perform and eat, for he only consecrated his value. If you say it is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Meir - it is well."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבָּנַן הִיא, בִּשְׁלָמָא עַבְדּוֹ – לִדְמֵי קָאֵי, אֶלָּא אִיהוּ – לִדְמֵי קָאֵי?!
human_translation: Rather, if you say it is the Rabbis, granted, his slave his slave exists for monetary However, he exist for monetary
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis, it is understandable if it is his servant - for the purpose of standing in his place, but if it is he himself - for the purpose of standing in his place?!

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי – הַמַּקְדִּישׁ עַבְדּוֹ, אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מוֹעֲלִין בִּשְׂעָרוֹ. מַאי, לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר: קָדוֹשׁ; וּמָר סָבַר: לָא קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . one who consecrates his slave, is no misuse Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One misuses of his hair. What, is it not that they disagree about this as Sage, holds consecrated, and Sage, holds not consecrated?
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim - one who consecrates his slave, we do not challenge him. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: we challenge his hair. What is this? Is it not in this that they are disagreeing - for one Master holds: holy, and the other Master holds: not holy?

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! הַאי ״מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ״ וְ״אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ״?! הַאי ״קָדוֹשׁ״ וְ״אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And you understand these One misuses and: is no misuse They should have these Consecrated, and: Not consecrated,
llm_translation: And is it possible?! This one "trespasses against it" and "does not trespass against it"?! This one "is holy" and "is not holy" requires it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קָדוֹשׁ, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר: עַבְדָּא כִּמְקַרְקְעֵי דָּמֵי; וּמָר סָבַר: כְּמִטַּלְטְלִי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, everyone consecrated, And here they disagree about this, as Sage, holds a slave considered equivalent to land, And Sage, holds considered equivalent to movable property,
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world is holy, and here in this case they argue - for Master holds: a slave is like scattered dust; and Master holds: like a dangling fetus.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַדְּמִיפַּלְגִי בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, לִיפַּלְגוּ בְּגוּפוֹ!
human_translation: If that is so, instead of disagreeing with regard to hair let them disagree with regard to himself
llm_translation: If so, let him divide in his hair, so that they may divide in his body!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עַבְדָּא כִּמְקַרְקְעֵי דָּמֵי, וְהָכָא בִּשְׂעָרוֹ הָעוֹמֵד לִיגָּזֵז קָמִיפַּלְגִי – מָר סָבַר: כְּגָזוּז דָּמֵי; וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו כְּגָזוּז דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, everyone a slave considered equivalent to land, And here they disagree with regard to his hair that is ready to be cut, Sage, holds is considered as cut And Sage, holds is not considered as cut.
llm_translation: Rather, in all the world, a servant is like the dust of the earth, and here, in his hair, standing to be shaken off, he falls. Master A thinks: "It is like shaking off dust." And Master B thinks: "It is not like shaking off dust."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי – כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי? דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵם כַּקַּרְקַע וְאֵינָן כַּקַּרְקַע, וְאֵין חֲכָמִים מוֹדִים לוֹ. כֵּיצַד? ״עֶשֶׂר גְּפָנִים טְעוּנוֹת מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵינָן אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב; וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע הֲרֵי הוּא כַּקַּרְקַע.
human_translation: Let us say these tanna’im are parallel those tanna’im , as we learned Rabbi Meir says: There are things that are like land but are not like land but the Rabbis do not admit to him How so? I gave you ten grapevines laden and the other one says: They are only five Rabbi Meir obligates And the Rabbis say: anything attached to the ground is like the ground
llm_translation: Let's say these Tannaim - like Tannaim? For we learned, Rabbi Meir says: There are things that are like the ground and are not like the ground, and the sages do not agree with him. How so? "Ten grapevines I have given you," and Halah says: "They are only five" - Rabbi Meir obligates, and the sages say: Anything attached to the ground is considered like the ground.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: עֲנָבִים הָעוֹמְדוֹת לִיבָּצֵר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ; דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין; וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָאו כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says between them grapes that are ready to be harvested, as Rabbi Meir holds they are considered like harvested, And the Rabbis hold they are not considered like harvested,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Grapes that are standing for the purpose of being pressed, is there a difference between them? For Rabbi Meir holds: They are considered as pressed. And the Rabbis hold: They are not considered as pressed.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר – עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם, אֶלָּא בַּעֲנָבִים – דְּכַמָּה דְּקָיְימָן מִיכְחָשׁ כְּחִישִׁי; אֲבָל הָכָא – כַּמָּה דְּקָאֵי אַשְׁבּוֹחֵי מַשְׁבַּח.
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Meir states only there, with regard to grapes, since the longer they remain become withered However, here, the longer it remains it improves,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Meir - until here Rabbi Meir did not say there, but regarding grapes - as much as they are established, they are considered weak; but here - as much as they are standing, they are praised.

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לְהַאי שְׁמַעְתָּא דְרַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַר רַב הָכִי? וְהוּא – לָא אָמַר הָכִי?! וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר!
human_translation: When Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef ascended he stated this halakha of Rav, before Rabbi Yoḥanan. said to him Rav say so? But didn’t say so? But didn’t Ulla say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated but requires a bill of manumission.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef ascended, he said to this teaching of Rav before Rav Yochanan. He said to him: Did Rav really say this? But he did not say this?! And didn't Ula say that Rabbi Yochanan said: One who emancipates his slave goes out to freedom, and he requires a bill of emancipation!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַר רַב כְּווֹתִי? וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לָא סַיְּימוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא אָמַר רַב צָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר?! וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ – דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר.
human_translation: this is what he said to him: Did Rav say in accordance with my And there are who say did not conclude before said to And didn’t Rav say that requires a bill of manumission? And Rabbi Yoḥanan to his reasoning, as Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated but requires a bill of manumission.
llm_translation: So did he say to him: Rav said, "Is there a case where they did not complete it before him?" He said to him: "But did not Rav say, 'One needs a bill of emancipation'?" And Rabbi Yochanan according to his reasoning - for Ula said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "One who releases his slave achieves his freedom, and a bill of emancipation is necessary."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁיחְרוּר.
human_translation: the itself: Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated but requires a bill of manumission
llm_translation: Body - Ulla said Rabbi Yochanan said: One who emancipates his slave - he goes out to freedom, and requires a document of emancipation.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְעוּלָּא: גֵּר שֶׁמֵּת וּבִזְבְּזוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל נְכָסָיו, וְהָיוּ בָּהֶן עֲבָדִים – בֵּין גְּדוֹלִים וּבֵין קְטַנִּים, קָנוּ עַצְמָן בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלִים – קָנוּ עַצְמָן בְּנֵי חוֹרִין; קְטַנִּים – כׇּל הַמַּחְזִיק בָּהֶן, זָכָה בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Ulla a convert died and Jews plundered his property, and among were slaves, whether adults or minors, they acquire themselves freemen, Abba Shaul says: Adult acquire themselves freemen. minor anyone who takes possession of them acquires them.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Abba to Ula: A convert who died and his property was wasted by Israel, and there were slaves among them - whether adults or minors, they acquired themselves as free men. Abba Saul says: Adults - they acquired themselves as free men; minors - anyone who holds onto them, acquires them.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מִי כָּתַב גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר לְאֵלּוּ?
human_translation: But who wrote a bill of manumission for those
llm_translation: And who wrote a bill of emancipation for these?

hebrew_text: אָמַר: דָּמֵי הַאי מִדְּרַבָּנַן כִּדְלָא גָּמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי שְׁמַעְתָּא. וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, קָסָבַר עוּלָּא: עַבְדּוֹ דְּגֵר כִּי אִשְׁתּוֹ – מָה אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשְׁתַּלַּחַת בְּלֹא גֵּט, אַף עֲבָדָיו מִשְׁתַּלְּחִים בְּלֹא גֵּט.
human_translation: said This of the Rabbis, is like a person who has not studied halakha . And what is the reason Rav Naḥman said Ulla holds A slave of a convert is comparable to his wife Just as his wife is freed without a bill of divorce, so too, his slaves are freed without a bill
llm_translation: He said: The value of this case according to the Rabbis is as if the people did not hear. And the reason is what? Rav Nachman said, Ulla holds: A slave of a convert, when his wife - just as his wife departs without a divorce document, so too his slaves depart without a divorce document.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אוֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם לָרֶשֶׁת אֲחוּזָּה״.
human_translation: If so, even a Jew as well, The verse states “And you may make them an inheritance for your children after you, to hold for a possession”
llm_translation: Thus, even if Israel alone! Said the verse: "And you shall inherit them for your children after you, to inherit as a possession."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ וָמֵת – נָמֵי; אַלְּמָה אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ וָמֵת – אוֹתוֹ הָעֶבֶד אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה? דְּאַמֵּימָר קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: If so, one who renounces ownership of his slave and dies, as well, Why did Ameimar say one who renounces ownership of his slave and dies, no remedy for that slave of Ameimar a difficulty
llm_translation: If so, one who emancipates his slave and he dies - he is liable; why did Amemar say: one who emancipates his slave and he dies - that slave does not have redemption? For Amemar's statement is difficult.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי:
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Shaul Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi, said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halacha is like Abba Shaul. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi:

hebrew_text: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ, אוֹ מִכְּלָלָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ? מַאי כְּלָלָא? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אָמְרוּ לִפְנֵי רַבִּי: אָמַר ״נִתְיָיאַשְׁתִּי מִפְּלוֹנִי עַבְדִּי״, מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: Did you hear it explicitly or did you hear it by inference, What inference As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says they said before Rabbi says: I have despaired of so-and-so, my slave, what He said to them: I say has no remedy other via a bill
llm_translation: In explanation, do you hear, or from the general principle do you hear? What is the general principle? As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, they said before Rabbi: One said, "I have despaired of collecting from so-and-so my servant," what is the ruling? He said to them: I say, he has no claim except with a document.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? גָּמַר ״לָהּ״–״לָהּ״ מֵאִשָּׁה – מָה אִשָּׁה בִּשְׁטָר, אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi He derived “to her [ lah ],” from “for her [ lah ],” a wife: Just as a wife via a bill so too, a slave also via a bill
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the reason for Rabbi's statement? He derived "to her" - "to her" from a woman - just as a woman is in a document, so too a slave is equivalent to a woman in a document.

hebrew_text: וְקָא דָיְיקַתְּ מִינַּהּ, כְּאִשָּׁה – מָה אִשָּׁה אִיסּוּרָא וְלָא מָמוֹנָא, אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי אִיסּוּרָא וְלָא מָמוֹנָא.
human_translation: You and deduced from this comparable to a wife. Just as a wife a prohibition but not a monetary so too, a slave also a prohibition but not a monetary
llm_translation: And she is similar to her, like a woman - what is a woman? Prohibition and not monetary, so too a slave is similar, prohibition and not monetary.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִכְּלָלָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדְּרַבָּה! דּוֹק מִינַּהּ לְאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא: מָה אִשָּׁה – בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה בֵּין קְטַנָּה, אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי – בֵּין גָּדוֹל בֵּין קָטָן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לִי.
human_translation: And if by inference, what said to him: on the contrary, deduce from this to the other side Just as a wife whether an adult or a minor, so too, a slave also whether an adult or a minor, He said to him: I heard explicitly
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if from the general principle, what is it? He said to him: Adrabah! Extract from it another issue: Just as a woman - whether she is an adult or a minor, so too a non-Jewish slave - whether he is an adult or a minor! He said to him: Explain it to me. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ, אוֹ מִכְּלָלָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ? מַאי כְּלָלָא? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אָמְרוּ לִפְנֵי רַבִּי: ״נִתְיָיאַשְׁתִּי מִפְּלוֹנִי עַבְדִּי״, מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan The halakha is not in accordance with Abba Shaul. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba: Did you hear it explicitly or did you hear it by inference? What inference For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says they said before Rabbi says: I have despaired of so-and-so, my slave, what He said to them: I say has no remedy other via a bill
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha is not like Abba Shaul. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: Do you have a clear explanation, or do you have it as a general principle? What is a general principle? As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, they said before Rabbi: "I have despaired of so-and-so my servant," what is the ruling? He said to them: I say, he has no acquisition except through a document.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? גָּמַר ״לָהּ״–״לָהּ״ מֵאִשָּׁה – מָה אִשָּׁה בִּשְׁטָר, אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi He derived “to her,” from “for her,” a wife. Just as a wife via a bill so too, a slave also via a bill
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the reason for Rabbi's statement? He derived "to her" - "to her" from a woman - just as a woman in a document, so too a slave is equivalent to a woman in a document.

hebrew_text: וְקָא דָיְיקַתְּ מִינַּהּ, כְּאִשָּׁה – מָה אִשָּׁה בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה בֵּין קְטַנָּה, אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי בֵּין גָּדוֹל בֵּין קָטָן.
human_translation: You and deduced from this comparable a wife. Just as a wife whether an adult or a minor, so too, a slave also whether an adult or a minor,
llm_translation: And she is sufficient from it, like a woman - what is a woman, whether adult or minor, so too a slave, whether adult or minor.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִכְּלָלָא מַאי? אַדְּרַבָּה! דּוֹק מִינַּהּ לְהָךְ גִּיסָא: מָה אִשָּׁה – אִיסּוּרָא וְלָא מָמוֹנָא, אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי – אִיסּוּרָא וְלָא מָמוֹנָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לִי.
human_translation: And if by inference, what on the contrary, deduce from this to the other side Just as a wife a prohibition and not a monetary so too, a slave also a prohibition and not a monetary He said to him: I heard explicitly
llm_translation: And if from the general principle, what? Certainly! He turned aside to strike a blow: Just as a woman - it is a matter of prohibition and not of monetary value, so too a slave who is similar - it is a matter of prohibition and not of monetary value! He said to him: Explain it to me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, אָמַר לָהֶם: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁטָר. וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, אַף הוּא – נוֹתֵן דְּמֵי עַצְמוֹ וְיוֹצֵא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוֹכְרוֹ לוֹ!
human_translation: The Master said said to them: I say has no remedy other via a bill But isn’t it taught Rabbi says: I say even himself can give his own monetary value and is emancipated, due to that it is as if sold him to himself.
llm_translation: Master said, he said to them: saying I, he has no acquisition except with a document. And it was taught, Rabbi says: saying I, even he - he gives his own money and leaves, because he is like his seller to him!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אוֹ בְּכֶסֶף אוֹ בִּשְׁטָר; וְהַאי – פְּקַע לֵיהּ כַּסְפֵּיהּ. וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהַאי תַּנָּא –
human_translation: This is what he is saying: either via money or via a bill And this his monetary is abrogated, And to exclude of this tanna
llm_translation: So it is saying: either with money or with a document; and this one - he should pay her the amount of her money. And to refute this, we learned in a Mishnah -

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: יָכוֹל יְהֵא כֶּסֶף גּוֹמֵר בָּהּ, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁשְּׁטָר גּוֹמֵר בָּהּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהׇפְדֵּה לֹא נִפְדָּתָה״ –
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: might money completes just as a bill completes her The verse states, and not at all redeemed,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: Is it possible that the money should complete it, as a document completes it? The verse teaches: "But she has not been redeemed" -

hebrew_text: אוֹרְעָה כָּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כֻּולָּהּ לְ״לֹא חוּפָּשָׁה״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: שְׁטָר גּוֹמֵר בָּהּ, וְאֵין הַכֶּסֶף גּוֹמֵר בָּהּ.
human_translation: The entire portion is linked to, “nor was freedom to say to you: A bill completes her and money does not complete her
llm_translation: The entire portion is considered as if it were "without free will," to tell you: the document completes it, but the money does not complete it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וְרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama says Rav Naḥman says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And Rav Yosef bar Ḥama says Rabbi Yoḥanan The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Ramei son of Hama said, Rav Nachman said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon. And Rav Yosef son of Hama said, Rabbi Yochanan said: The halakha is not according to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא בַּר שְׁאֵילְתָא, דַּהֲוָה קָאֵי אַפִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי תְפִלָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנִי אוֹמֵר – אֵין הֲלָכָה; וְרַבָּנַן דַּאֲתוֹ מִמָּחוֹזָא אָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה;
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak found Rava bar She’eilta when he was standing at the entrance to a house of prayer. He said to him, halakha or halakha not He said to him: I say halakha not and the Rabbis who came from Meḥoza say Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Naḥman: halakha
llm_translation: He found Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak to Rava bar She'ila, who was standing at the entrance of the house of prayer. He said to him: Is it a Halacha or is it not a Halacha? He said to him: I say - it is not a Halacha; and the Rabbis who came from the district said, Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Nachman: It is a Halacha.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אֲתַאי לְסוּרָא, אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לִי אִיזִי, גּוּפָא דְעוֹבָדָא הֵיכִי הֲוָה? אֲמַר לִי: דְּהַהִיא אַמְתָּא דַּהֲוָה מָרַהּ שְׁכִיב מְרַע, אָתְיָא בָּכְיָא קַמֵּיהּ, אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: עַד אֵימַת תִּשְׁתַּעְבֵּיד וְתֵיזִיל הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא? שְׁקַל כּוּמְתֵּיהּ שְׁדָא בַּהּ, אֲמַר לַהּ: זִיל קְנִי הָא וּקְנִי נַפְשִׁיךְ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: And when I came to Sura, I found Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin, I said to him: Tell me, my friend [ izi ], the incident itself. What happened, He said to me that a certain maidservant whose master was on his deathbed. She came crying before him said to him: Until when will that woman, continue to be subjugated? He took his hat kumtei threw it to her, said to her: Go acquire this and acquire yourself They came before Rav Naḥman he said to them: He did nothing.
llm_translation: When he came to Sura, he found Rabbi Hiyya bar Avin. They said to him: "Why did you come to me?" He said to me: "The maidservant who was in charge of the work came crying before him, and said to him: 'How long will you allow that woman to mistreat me?' He took off his cloak, threw it on her, and said to her: 'Go and acquire this and acquire yourself.' They came before Rav Nachman, and he said to them: 'He did nothing wrong.'"

hebrew_text: מַאן דַּחֲזָא, סָבַר מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן; וְלָא הִיא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כֵּלָיו שֶׁל מַקְנֶה.
human_translation: One who saw thought because that the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, But is not so. Rather, because this was the items of the one who transfers ownership,
llm_translation: The one who sees, holds it according to Rabbi Shimon; but it is not so, rather because it is like a vessel of acquisition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַחִיתַאי, אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא סָבָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַשְׁיָאן, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וְלָא הִיא, אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Aḥittai says Rav Hamnuna the Elder says Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Ashyan says Rav Huna says Rav Hamnuna says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And is not so, halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel bar Aḥitai, said Rav Hamnuna the Elder, said Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Ashyaan, said Rav Huna, said Rav Hamnuna: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon. And it is not, the halakha is not like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אָמַר רַבִּי: עֶבֶד שֶׁנָּשָׂא אֶת בַּת חוֹרִין בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ –
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rabbi Ḥanina says Rav Ashi says Rabbi says: a slave who marries a free woman in the presence of his master,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira, said Rabbi Hanina, said Rav Ashi, said Rabbi: A slave who marries a free woman in the presence of his master -

hebrew_text: יָצָא לְחֵירוּת. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כָּל כָּךְ יֵשׁ בְּיָדְךָ?! וַאֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה: הַכּוֹתֵב שְׁטַר אֵירוּסִין לְשִׁפְחָתוֹ, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת!
human_translation: he is emancipated. Rabbi Yoḥanan said to You possess such but I teach one who writes a document of betrothal for his maidservant, Rabbi Meir says: She is betrothed, and the Rabbis say: She is not betrothed,
llm_translation: He went out to freedom. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: Do you have so much in your possession?! And I differ: One who writes a marriage contract for his maidservant, Rabbi Meir says: She is sanctified, and the Sages say: She is not sanctified!

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא – כְּשֶׁרַבּוֹ הִנִּיחַ לוֹ תְּפִילִּין; הָכָא נָמֵי – כְּשֶׁרַבּוֹ הִשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: as that Rabba bar Rav Sheila says where master placed phylacteries on him, here too, where master provided a wife for him,
llm_translation: As Rabba son of Rav Sheilah said - when he became wealthy, he put on tefillin; here too - when he became wealthy, he married a woman.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דִּלְעַבְדֵּיהּ – לָא מִעֲבַד לֵיהּ אִיסּוּרָא, וְאִיהוּ – עָבֵד אִיסּוּרָא?!
human_translation: Is there anything where for his slave he would not violate a prohibition, but he violate the prohibition,
llm_translation: And is there anyone who can prevent him from doing what he wants? He does not heed the prohibition, yet he enforces the prohibition?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּאָמַר לָהּ: ״צְאִי בּוֹ וְהִתְקַדְּשִׁי בּוֹ״; רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: יֵשׁ בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן שִׁחְרוּר, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה לְשׁוֹן שִׁחְרוּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: With what are we dealing here? where he said to Become emancipated with this and become betrothed with this. Rabbi Meir holds that this formulation contains a formulation of emancipation And the Rabbis hold: This formulation is not a formulation of emancipation.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Here, what are we dealing with? - That he said to her: "Go out with it and sanctify yourself with it." Rabbi Meir holds: In this language there is a language of freedom, and the Rabbis hold: In this language there is no language of freedom.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עֶבֶד שֶׁהִנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת. מֵיתִיבִי: לָוָה הֵימֶנּוּ רַבּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ רַבּוֹ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, אוֹ שֶׁהִנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁקָּרָא שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יָצָא לְחֵירוּת!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: A slave who dons phylacteries in the presence of his master is emancipated, raises an objection master borrowed from him; or if his master appointed him as a steward or if donned phylacteries in the presence of his master; or if he read three verses in the synagogue in the presence of his master, this is not emancipated.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A slave who placed tefillin before his master - he has gone out to freedom. The students asked: Whether his master lent him to someone else, or his master made him an apotropos, or he placed tefillin before his master, or he read three verses in the synagogue before his master, he has not gone out to freedom!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: כְּשֶׁרַבּוֹ הִנִּיחַ לוֹ תְּפִילִּין.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheila says: where master placed phylacteries on him.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheilah said: When he became wealthy, he put on tefillin.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי שֶׁאָמַר בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָתוֹ ״פְּלוֹנִית שִׁפְחָתִי אַל יִשְׁתַּעְבְּדוּ בָּהּ לְאַחַר מוֹתִי״ – כּוֹפִין אֶת הַיּוֹרְשִׁים וְכוֹתְבִין לָהּ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר. אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי: רַבִּי, אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁבָּנֶיהָ עֲבָדִים?
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who says at the moment of his death: so-and-so, my maidservant, should not treat her as a slave after my death, compels the heirs and they write for her a bill of manumission. Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi said before him: My teacher, don’t you admit that her children are slaves?
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who said at the time of his death, "So-and-so, my maidservant, should not be enslaved after my death," - we force the heirs and write for her a bill of emancipation. Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi said before him: Rabbi, do you agree that her sons are slaves?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי שֶׁאָמַר בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָתוֹ ״פְּלוֹנִית שִׁפְחָתִי קוֹרַת רוּחַ עָשְׂתָה לִי; יֵעָשֶׂה לָהּ קוֹרַת רוּחַ״ – כּוֹפִין אֶת הַיּוֹרְשִׁין וְעוֹשִׂין לָהּ קוֹרַת רוּחַ. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִצְוָה לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הַמֵּת.
human_translation: When Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who says at the moment of his death: So-and-so, my maidservant, gave me satisfaction one should do for her satisfaction, compels the heirs to give her satisfaction, What is the reason It is a mitzva to fulfill the statement of the dead.
llm_translation: When Rav Shmuel, son of Yehuda, came, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who said at the time of his death, "So-and-so, my maidservant, has been a source of comfort to me; let comfort be provided for her" - we compel the heirs and provide comfort for her. What is the reason? It is a mitzvah to fulfill the words of the deceased.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ – אוֹתוֹ עֶבֶד אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? גּוּפֵיהּ לָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ – אִיסּוּרָא הוּא דְּאִיכָּא גַּבֵּיהּ, וְאִיסּוּרָא לָא מָצֵי מַקְנֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ameimar says: one who renounces ownership of his slave, no remedy for that slave, What is the reason himself does not belong to there is the prohibition in and cannot transfer ownership of the prohibition to
llm_translation: Amemar said: One who emancipates his slave - that same slave does not have acquisition. What is the reason? Because he does not acquire himself - it is a prohibition that exists against him, and a prohibition does not enable acquisition for him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״צָרִיךְ״ – וְאֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But didn’t Ulla say Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin Rav says: Both this and that is emancipated but requires a bill of manumission? said to him: he requires but no remedy for him,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Amemar: And didn't Ula say that Rabbi Yochanan said, and Rav Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rav: Both this one and this one have gone out to freedom, and a document of emancipation is required! He said to him: "Required" – and he does not have a legal acquisition.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ וָמֵת – אוֹתוֹ הָעֶבֶד אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? גּוּפֵיהּ לָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ – אִיסּוּרָא הוּא דְּאִיכָּא גַּבֵּיהּ, וְאִיסּוּרָא לִבְרֵיהּ לָא מוֹרֵית. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן!
human_translation: There are who say Ameimar says: one who renounces ownership of his slave and dies, no remedy for that slave What is the reason himself does not belong to there is the prohibition in and cannot bequeath the prohibition to his son. Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan says
llm_translation: There are those who say, Amemar said: One who emancipates his slave and he dies - that slave does not have redemption. What is the reason? He did not acquire him for himself - it is a prohibition that exists for him, but the prohibition does not extend to his son. Rav Ashi said to Amemar: But when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said!

hebrew_text: דְּרַב דִּימִי טָעוּתָא הִיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טָעוּתָא – דְּלָא אַמְרַהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן שִׁחְרוּר; הָא אַמְרַהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן שִׁחְרוּר – הָכִי נָמֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כִּדְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לִי.
human_translation: of Rav Dimi is erroneous, He said to him: What erroneous that did not state this using a formulation of emancipation, but he stated this using a formulation of emancipation, indeed He said to him: I hold in accordance with of Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda,
llm_translation: Rav Dimi made a mistake. He said to him: What is the mistake? - That she did not say it in the language of emancipation; but she did say it in the language of emancipation - so it is indeed! He said to him: I, like Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah, hold this opinion.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דִּסְקַרְתָּא דְּעַבְדֵי דְּאִזְדַּבַּן לְגוֹי. כְּלוֹ מָרְווֹתָא בָּתְרָאֵי, אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ אַהְדַּרוּ אַבְּנֵי מָרְווֹתָא קַמָּאֵי, וְיִכְתְּבוּ לְכוּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵרוּתָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבִינָא, וְהָאָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ וָמֵת – אוֹתוֹ הָעֶבֶד אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה!
human_translation: a certain city diskarta of slaves that was sold to gentiles. their final masters died, came before Ravina He said to them: Go and return to the children of your first masters and write for you bills of manumission The Rabbis said to Ravina: But didn’t Ameimar say one who renounces ownership of his slave and dies, no remedy for that slave?
llm_translation: That one who inspected the barrels of wine belonging to a non-Jew. When he found worms inside, he came before Ravina and said to them: "Go, return the barrels of wine before him, and have them write for you a bill of emancipation." The Rabbis said to Ravina, and as Amemar said: "One who emancipates his slave and he dies - that slave has no redemption!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא כְּרַב דִּימִי סְבִירָא לִי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דְּרַב דִּימִי טָעוּתָא הִיא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי טָעוּתָא – דְּלָא אַמְרַהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן שִׁחְרוּר; הָא אַמְרַהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן שִׁחְרוּר – הָכִי נָמֵי! וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרָבִינָא.
human_translation: said to them: I hold in accordance with Rav Dimi, They, said to him: which Rav Dimi is erroneous. He said to them: What erroneous that he did not state this using a formulation of emancipation, but he stated this using a formulation of emancipation, indeed And the halakha is in accordance with Ravina,
llm_translation: He said to them: I, like Rav Dimi, think. They said to him: Rav Dimi made a mistake! He said to them: What is the mistake? - That she did not say it in the language of freedom; but she did say it in the language of freedom - so it is indeed! And the halakha is like Ravina.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא עַבְדָּא דְּבֵי תְרֵי, קָם חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ וְשַׁחְרְרֵיהּ לְפַלְגֵיהּ, אֲמַר אִידַּךְ: הַשְׁתָּא שָׁמְעִי בִּי רַבָּנַן וּמַפְסְדוּ לֵיהּ מִינַּאי; אֲזַל אַקְנְיֵיהּ לִבְנוֹ קָטָן.
human_translation: a certain slave who to two One of them arose and emancipated his half The other said: Now the rabbis will hear and they will cause me to lose him, He went transferred ownership to his minor son,
llm_translation: That slave of the house of two, one of them got up and freed him to half, said the other: "Now listen to me, sages, and they will cause him damage; he went and bought him a small house."

hebrew_text: שַׁלְחַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה כֵּן יֵעָשֶׂה לּוֹ, גְּמוּלוֹ יָשִׁיב לוֹ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ״ – אֲנַן קִים לַן בְּיָנוֹקָא דִּמְקָרְבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּי זוּזֵי; מוֹקְמִינַן לֵיהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס,
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, sent before Rav Pappa He sent to him As he has done, so shall it be done to him, his dealing shall return upon his own head We know that a child is attracted to money. We appoint a steward for
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, sent a message to Rav Papa, saying to him: "As he has done, so shall be done to him; his recompense shall be returned upon his own head." We stand with the child who is approaching the age of understanding, placing before him an apotropos.

hebrew_text: וּמְקַרְקֵישׁ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי, וְכָתֵב לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא עַל שְׁמֵיהּ.
human_translation: and should jingle the dinars him. and they should write him a bill of emancipation in his name.
llm_translation: And he checked for him coins, and wrote for him a bill of emancipation in his name.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, הָאוֹמֵר: ״עָשִׂיתִי פְּלוֹנִי עַבְדִּי בֶּן חוֹרִין״; ״עָשׂוּי בֶּן חוֹרִין״; ״הֲרֵי הוּא בֶּן חוֹרִין״ – הֲרֵי הוּא בֶּן חוֹרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who says: I made so-and-so my slave a freeman, was made a freeman, Behold he is a freeman, he is a freeman
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who says, "I have made so-and-so my slave, who is a free man," "he is made a free man," "behold, he is a free man" - behold, he is a free man.

hebrew_text: ״אֶעֱשֶׂנּוּ בֶּן חוֹרִין״ – רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: קָנָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא קָנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְכוּלָּן – בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: I will make him a freeman, Rabbi says: acquired and the Rabbis say: He not acquired Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And all of these in a document
llm_translation: "‘I will make him a free man’ – Rabbi says: he acquired, and the Sages say: he did not acquire. Rabbi Yochanan said: And all of them - with a document."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, הָאוֹמֵר: ״נָתַתִּי שָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית לִפְלוֹנִי״; ״נְתוּנָה לִפְלוֹנִי״; ״הֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁלּוֹ״ – הֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁלּוֹ. ״אֶתְּנֶנָּה לִפְלוֹנִי״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: קָנָה; וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא קָנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְכוּלָּן – בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: the Sages taught one who says: I gave such and such a field to so-and-so given to so-and-so; Behold it is his, it belongs to I will give it to so-and-so, Rabbi Meir says: acquired And the Rabbis say: He not acquired Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And all of these in a document
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who says, "I have given a certain field to so-and-so," "it is given to so-and-so," "behold, it is his" - it is his. "I will give it to so-and-so" - Rabbi Meir says: he has acquired it; and the Sages say: he has not acquired it. Rabbi Yochanan said: and all of them - with a document.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, הָאוֹמֵר: ״עָשִׂיתִי פְּלוֹנִי עַבְדִּי בֶּן חוֹרִין״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא עֲשָׂאַנִי״ – חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא זִיכָּה לוֹ עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר. ״כָּתַבְתִּי וְנָתַתִּי לוֹ״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כָּתַב לִי וְלֹא נָתַן לִי״ – הוֹדָאַת בַּעַל דִּין כְּמֵאָה עֵדִים דָּמֵי.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who says: I made so-and-so my slave a freeman, and says: He did not make me we are concerned perhaps transferred to him through another I wrote and I gave to him and says: He did not write for me and he did not give me the admission of a litigant is similar to one hundred witnesses.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who says, "I have made so-and-so my slave, a free man," and he (the alleged slave) says, "He did not make me (his slave)," we are concerned perhaps he acquired him through another person. If one says, "I have written and given (it) to him," and he (the recipient) says, "He did not write for me nor give to me," the admission of the defendant is as weighty as a hundred witnesses.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר: ״נָתַתִּי שָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא נָתַן לִי״ – חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא זִיכָּה לוֹ עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר. ״כָּתַבְתִּי וְנָתַתִּי לוֹ״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כָּתַב וְלֹא נָתַן לִי״ – הוֹדָאַת בַּעַל דִּין כְּמֵאָה עֵדִים דָּמֵי.
human_translation: one who says: I gave such and such a field to so-and-so, and says: He did not give me we are concerned that perhaps he transferred to him through another I wrote and gave to him and says: He did not write and did not give me the admission of a litigant is similar to one hundred witnesses.
llm_translation: The one who says, "I have given a certain field to so-and-so," and he says, "He did not give it to me" - we are concerned that perhaps he acquired it through someone else. "I have written and given it to him," and he says, "He did not write or give it to me" - the admission of the defendant is as weighty as a hundred witnesses.

hebrew_text: מִי אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת? רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: נוֹתֵן אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת; וְרַבָּה אָמַר: מְשַׁלְּשִׁין אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: who consumes the produce Rav Ḥisda says: giver consumes the produce, and Rabba says: The produce is deposited with a third party
llm_translation: Who eats the fruits? Rav Ḥisdah said: one who gives eats the fruits; and Rabbah said: they divide the fruits into thirds.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא בְּאַבָּא, הָא בִּבְרָא.
human_translation: And they do not disagree. This to the father, That to the son
llm_translation: And not argue: this in Abba, this in Bra.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֶבֶד שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ רַבּוֹ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי לַאֲחֵרִים, וְשִׁיחְרְרוֹ – שׁוּרַת הַדִּין אֵין הָעֶבֶד חַיָּיב כְּלוּם; אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם, כּוֹפִין אֶת רַבּוֹ וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין, וְכוֹתֵב שְׁטָר עַל דָּמָיו. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב, אֶלָּא מְשַׁחְרֵר.
human_translation: a slave whose master set him aside as designated repayment apoteiki to other and he emancipated him, according to the letter of the law the slave bears no However, for the betterment of the world, his master is forced to make him a freeman, and writes note for his value Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He does not write he only emancipates
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A slave whom his master appointed as a craftsman for others, and then the master emancipated him - the law is that the slave is not liable for anything. Rather, for the betterment of the world, they compel his master to make him a free man, and he writes a document for his value. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He does not write a document, rather he emancipates him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ עֶבֶד שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ רַבּוֹ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי וְשִׁיחְרְרוֹ: מִי שִׁחְרְרוֹ? אָמַר רַב: רַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן. שׁוּרַת הַדִּין אֵין הָעֶבֶד חַיָּיב כְּלוּם לְרַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי –
human_translation: a slave whose master set him aside as designated repayment to other and emancipated him. Who emancipated him? Rav said: His first master According to the letter of the law, the slave is not obligated to his second master at all.
llm_translation: Gemara: A slave that his master made him Apotiki and emancipated him. Who emancipated him? Rav said: His first master. The principle of law is that the slave is not obligated at all to his second master -

hebrew_text: כִּדְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, חָמֵץ וְשִׁחְרוּר – מַפְקִיעִין מִידֵי שִׁיעְבּוּד; אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁמָּא יִמְצָאֶנּוּ בַּשּׁוּק
human_translation: in accordance with of Rava, as Rava says: Consecration leavened bread and emancipation abrogate lien However, for the betterment of the world, lest will find in the market
llm_translation: Like Rava, for Rava said: One who consecrates chametz and a slave - we remove them from the hands of servitude; rather, for the betterment of the world, lest one find it in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: וְיֹאמַר לוֹ: ״עַבְדִּי אָתָּה״ – כּוֹפִין אֶת רַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי, וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין, וְכוֹתֵב עֶבֶד שְׁטָר עַל דָּמָיו. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין הָעֶבֶד כּוֹתֵב אֶלָּא מְשַׁחְרֵר כּוֹתֵב.
human_translation: and will say to him: You are my slave, forces his second master, and makes him a freeman, and the slave writes note for his value, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The slave does not write Rather, who emancipated writes
llm_translation: And he shall say to him: "You are my servant" - they compel his master to release him, and he makes him a free man, and writes a document of servitude on his own blood. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The slave only writes after being freed.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בְּמַזִּיק שִׁיעְבּוּדוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ קָא מִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר חַיָּיב, וּמָר סָבַר פָּטוּר.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? They disagree with regard to one who causes damage his friend’s lien, as Sage, holds liable And Sage, holds exempt.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? They disagree regarding the damage caused by one's animal. One Master holds liable, and the other Master holds exempt.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: הַמַּזִּיק שִׁיעְבּוּדוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: It was also stated one who causes damage his friend’s lien, we have arrived at the dispute Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis,
llm_translation: It was stated: The one causing damage, his liability for his fellow's property, we come to the dispute of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: מִי שִׁיחְרְרוֹ – רַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי. שׁוּרַת הַדִּין אֵין הָעֶבֶד חַיָּיב כְּלוּם בְּמִצְוֹת; אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם – שֶׁהֲרֵי יָצָא עָלָיו שֵׁם בֶּן חוֹרִין, כּוֹפִין אֶת רַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין, וְכוֹתֵב שְׁטָר עַל דָּמָיו. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב, אֶלָּא מְשַׁחְרֵר כּוֹתֵב.
human_translation: Ulla said Who emancipated him? His second master, According to the letter of the law, the slave is not at all obligated in mitzvot However, for the betterment of the world, since a rumor has spread about him a freeman his first master is forced to make him a freeman, and writes note for his value Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: does not write Rather, the one who emancipates, writes
llm_translation: Ulla said: One who frees his slave - his master is secondary. The principle of the law is that the slave is not obligated at all in commandments; rather, it is for the betterment of the world - for once the name of "free man" has been conferred upon him, his original master is compelled to make him a free man, and writes a document for his freedom. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He does not write, rather he frees and then writes.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בְּהֶיזֵּק שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיכָּר קָמִיפַּלְגִי – מָר סָבַר: שְׁמֵיהּ הֶיזֵּק, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ הֶיזֵּק.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? They disagree with regard to damage that is not evident, Sage, holds is termed damage. And Sage, holds is not termed damage,
llm_translation: With what do they argue? With regard to an unrecognized damage. One Master holds: its name is "Hezek," and the other Master holds: its name is not "Hezek."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב? אָמַר לָךְ: שֵׁנִי – ״רַבּוֹ״ קָרֵית לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: What is the reason Ulla did not say in accordance with Rav said to you: you call the second His master,
llm_translation: Ula, what is the reason why he did not say like Rav? He said to you: Repeat - did you read it as "his master"?!

hebrew_text: וְרַב, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּעוּלָּא? אָמַר לָךְ: שֵׁנִי – ״מְשַׁחְרֵר״ קָרֵית לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav did not say in accordance with Ulla said to you: you call the second One who emancipates,
llm_translation: Rav, what is the reason he did not say like Ulla? He said to you: repeat - "freeing" you called it?!

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָעוֹשָׂה שָׂדֵהוּ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי לַאֲחֵרִים, וּשְׁטָפָהּ נָהָר; אַמֵּי שַׁפִּיר נָאֶה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִשְּׁאָר נְכָסִים; וַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: גּוֹבֶה מִשְּׁאָר נְכָסִים.
human_translation: It was stated one who sets aside his field as designated repayment for others and a river flooded Ami Shappir Na’e, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: does not collect from other property, And Shmuel’s father said: He collects from other property.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who makes his field available to others for grazing, and a river floods it; Rabbi Yochanan said: It is not considered superior to other properties. And the father of Shmuel said: It is considered superior to other properties.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִשּׁוּם דְּאַמֵּי שַׁפִּיר נָאֶה הוּא, אוֹמֵר שְׁמַעְתָּא דְּלָא שַׁפִּירָן?! תְּתַרְגַּם שְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא יְהֵא לְךָ פֵּרָעוֹן אֶלָּא מִזּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Because Ami is beautiful [ shappir na’e ], he say halakhot that are not beautiful Interpret his halakha where said to you will have payment only from this
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Because Ammi said, "It is beautiful and fitting," should one say, "Have you not heard that it is beautiful?" Translate his statement, for he said to him, "You shall have no other ransom except for this."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הָעוֹשָׂה שָׂדֵהוּ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי לְאַחֵר, וּשְׁטָפָהּ נָהָר – גּוֹבֶה מִשְּׁאָר נְכָסִים. וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״לֹא יְהֵא לְךָ פֵּרָעוֹן אֶלָּא מִזּוֹ״ – אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִשְּׁאָר נְכָסִים.
human_translation: This is also taught one who sets aside his field as designated repayment for another and a river flooded collects from other property. But if said to You will have payment only from this he does not collect from other property.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Nami the Elder said: One who makes his field into embankments for another, and he irrigates it with a river - he is entitled to collect from the rest of the properties. But if the owner said to him, "You shall only collect from this," - he is not entitled to collect from the rest of the properties.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הָעוֹשֶׂה שָׂדֵהוּ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי לְבַעַל חוֹב וְלִכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה – גּוֹבִין מִשְּׁאָר נְכָסִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה מִשְּׁאָר נְכָסִים, אִשָּׁה אֵינָהּ גּוֹבָה מִשְּׁאָר נְכָסִים – שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה לְחַזֵּר עַל בָּתֵּי דִינִין.
