llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: We can derive from a baraita: One who sells his slave to outside the land - he goes out to freedom, and he requires a bill of emancipation from his master a second time. Learn from it that his master acquires him a second time, and does not sell him; and did Shmuel say there that she is not sold - and the money returns.

hebrew_text: וְרַב עָנָן – בָּרַיְיתָא לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ;
human_translation: And Rav Anan, the baraita was not known to him,
llm_translation: And Rav Anan - the baraita does not agree with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִדִּשְׁמוּאֵל – מִמַּאי דְּאֵינָהּ מְכוּרָה וּמָעוֹת חוֹזְרִין, דִּילְמָא אֵינָהּ מְכוּרָה וּמָעוֹת מַתָּנָה נִינְהוּ – מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמְּקַדֵּשׁ אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ, רַב אָמַר: מָעוֹת – חוֹזְרִין, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מָעוֹת מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: And if from of Shmuel, From where that it is not sold, and the money is returned? Perhaps it is not sold and the money is a gift, just as it is in one who betroths his sister. As was stated one who betroths his sister, Rav said: The money is returned, and Shmuel said: money a gift,
llm_translation: If from Shmuel - from what is it that it is not considered a purchase, yet the coins are returned, for perhaps it is not a purchase but rather a gift? - because it is something that sanctifies his sister, as it was stated: "He who sanctifies his sister," Rav said: the coins are returned, and Shmuel said: the coins are a gift.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי חָזֵית דְּקָנְסִינַן לְלוֹקֵחַ? נִקְנְסֵיהּ לְמוֹכֵר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו עַכְבְּרָא גַּנָּב אֶלָּא חוֹרָא גַּנָּב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו עַכְבְּרָא, חוֹרָא מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: What did you see that we apply the penalty to the purchaser, we should apply the penalty to the seller, said to him: not the mouse steals, but the hole steals. if not the mouse, from where the hole
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: What do you see that we penalize the buyer? Penalize the seller! He said to him: It is not the mouse that steals, but the hole that steals. He said to him: If not the mouse, how does the hole steal for him?

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא, הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא אִיסּוּרָא הָתָם קָנְסִינַן.
human_translation: It stands to reason anywhere that the forbidden is, there we penalize.
llm_translation: Formed, where there is a prohibition, there we penalize.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא עַבְדָּא דַּעֲרַק מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ. אֲזַל מָרֵיהּ אַבָּתְרֵיהּ, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִכְתּוֹב לָךְ שְׁטָרָא אַדְּמֵיהּ, וּכְתוֹב לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא. וְאִי לָא, מַפְקַעְנָא לֵיהּ מִינָּךְ מִדְּרַבִּי אַחַי בְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: a certain slave who fled from outside of Eretz to Eretz His master followed him came before Rabbi Ami. said to We will write a note for his value for you, and you write a bill of manumission for him. And if not I will remove him from you based on of Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: That slave who ran away from outside the land to the land. His master went after him, came before Rabbi Ammi, and said to him: "Write a document for her freedom, and write for her a bill of emancipation." And if not, I will exempt you from the obligation of Rabbi Ahai son of Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יֵשְׁבוּ בְּאַרְצְךָ פֶּן יַחֲטִיאוּ אוֹתְךָ לִי״ – יָכוֹל בְּגוֹי שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תַסְגִּיר עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדוֹנָיו אֲשֶׁר יִנָּצֵל אֵלֶיךָ מֵעִם אֲדוֹנָיו״, מַאי תַּקָּנָתוֹ? ״עִמְּךָ יֵשֵׁב בְּקִרְבְּךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: As it is taught “They shall not dwell in your land lest they make you to sin against Me, might the verse is speaking of a gentile who accepted upon himself not to idol worship, the verse states: “You shall not deliver to his master a slave who escaped to you from his master” What remedy? “He shall dwell with you in your midst”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "They shall not dwell in your land, lest they cause you to sin against Me" - one might have thought that this refers to a gentile who accepted upon himself not to engage in idol worship. The verse is speaking about a foreigner who dwells among you. The Torah teaches us: "You shall not deliver a slave to his master who has sought refuge with you from his master." What is the reason for this? "He shall dwell with you in your midst, etc."

hebrew_text: וְקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: הַאי ״מֵעִם אֲדוֹנָיו״?! ״מֵעִם אָבִיו״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: בְּמוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: And difficult for Rabbi Yoshiya: This “From his master,” it should have From his father, Rather, Rabbi Yoshiya says: The verse is speaking of one who sells his slave to outside of Eretz
llm_translation: The question was difficult for Rabbi Yoshiyah: "From his master"?! It should have said "from his father"! Rather, Rabbi Yoshiyah said: In the case of one who sells his slave to outside the land, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: וְקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַחַי בְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: הַאי ״אֲשֶׁר יִנָּצֵל אֵלֶיךָ״?! ״אֲשֶׁר יִנָּצֵל מֵעִמְּךָ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אַחַי בְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: בְּעֶבֶד שֶׁבָּרַח מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: And difficult for Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiya: this “Who escaped to you,” it should have Who escaped from you. Rather, Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiya, said: The verse is speaking of a slave who escaped from outside of Eretz to Eretz
llm_translation: The difficulty was for Rabbi Ahai son of Rabbi Yoshiyah: This "that he may escape to you"?! "That he may escape from you" - what does he need it for! Rather, Rabbi Ahai son of Rabbi Yoshiyah said: Regarding a slave who fled from one land to another, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״לֹא תַסְגִּיר עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדוֹנָיו״ – רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּלוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד עַל מְנָת לְשַׁחְרְרוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ הָכִי: ״לִכְשֶׁאֶקָּחֲךָ, הֲרֵי עַצְמְךָ קָנוּי לְךָ מֵעַכְשָׁיו״.
human_translation: is taught another “You shall not deliver to his master a slave” Rabbi says: The verse is speaking of one who acquires a slave in order to emancipate him. What are the circumstances Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: when he wrote to like this: When I will purchase you, you are hereby acquired to yourself from now.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "You shall not hand over a slave to his master" - Rabbi says: in the case of one who acquires a slave with the intention of freeing him, the verse speaks. How so? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: For it is written to him thus: "When I have taken you, behold, you are acquired for yourself from now."

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא עֲרַק לֵיהּ עַבְדָּא לְבֵי כוּתָאֵי, שְׁלַח לְהוּ: [אַ]הְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלִי. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: ״לֹא תַסְגִּיר עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדוֹנָיו״. שְׁלַח לְהוּ: וְכֵן תַּעֲשֶׂה לַחֲמוֹרוֹ וְכֵן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְשִׂמְלָתוֹ וְכֵן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְכׇל אֲבֵידַת אָחִיךָ״. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַסְגִּיר עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדוֹנָיו״, שְׁלַח לְהוּ: הַהוּא, בְּעֶבֶד שֶׁבָּרַח מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ, וְכִדְרַבִּי אַחַי בְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda’s slave escaped to Bei Kutai, He sent to Return him to me. They sent to him: “You shall not deliver to his master a slave,” He sent to them: and so you shall do for his donkey and so you shall do for his garment and so you shall do for anything your brother has lost” They sent to him But isn’t it written: “You shall not deliver to his master a slave”? sent to them: That to a slave who escaped from outside of Eretz to Eretz and in accordance with of Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiya,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda sent his servant to the villages of the Kutaeans, they sent to him: "Return him, he is a thief." They sent to him: "You shall not hand over a slave to his master." He sent to them: "Likewise shall you do with his donkey, likewise shall you do with his garment, and likewise shall you do with any lost item of your brother." They sent to him: "And it is written: 'You shall not hand over a slave to his master.'" He sent to them: That case was regarding a slave who fled from one country to another, as Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiyah, explained.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא דִּשְׁלַח לְהוּ כִּדְרַבִּי אַחַי בְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה? מִשּׁוּם דְּמַשְׁמַע לְהוּ קְרָאֵי.
human_translation: And what is different that send to them in accordance with of Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiya, Because that is understand the verse.
llm_translation: And what is the difference that he sent to them like Rabbi Ahai son of Rabbi Yoshiyah? Because it is implied to them from the verses.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אִירְכַס לֵיהּ חֲמָרָא בֵּי כוּתָאֵי, שְׁלַח לְהוּ: שַׁדְּרוּהּ לִי. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: שְׁלַח סִימָנָא. שְׁלַח לְהוּ: דְּחִיוּוֹרָא כְּרֵיסֵיהּ. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּנַחְמָנִי אַתְּ, לָא הֲוָה מְשַׁדַּרְנָא לֵיהּ נִיהֲלָךְ; אַטּוּ כּוּלֵּי חֲמָרֵי לָאו כְּרֵיסַיְיהוּ חִיוָּורֵי נִינְהוּ?!
human_translation: Abaye lost a donkey Bei Kutai. He sent to them: Send it to me. They sent to him: Send a distinguishing mark He sent to them: That its belly is white. They sent to him: If not that you are Naḥmani, we would not send it to you. Is that to say bellies of all donkeys aren’t white?
llm_translation: Abaye encountered wine at the house of the Kutaeans, he sent to them: "Send it to me." They sent to him: "Send a sign." He sent to them: "He has a black eye." They sent to him: "If you are not consoled, we would not have sent it to you to drink; are all Kutaeans not black-eyed?!"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין פּוֹדִין אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיִין יָתֵר עַל כְּדֵי דְּמֵיהֶן, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. וְאֵין מַבְרִיחִין אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיִין, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת הַשְּׁבוּיִין.
human_translation: The captives are not redeemed more than their value, for the betterment of the world; and one may not aid the captives escape for the betterment of the world, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: For the betterment of the captives,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: We do not redeem captives for more than their worth, because of the mending of the world. And we do not ransom captives, because of the mending of the world. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Because of the improvement of captives.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַאי ״מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם״ – מִשּׁוּם דּוּחְקָא דְצִבּוּרָא הוּא, אוֹ דִילְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא לִגְרְבוּ וְלַיְיתוֹ טְפֵי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before this For the betterment of the world, it due to the pressure of the community? Or perhaps because that they will not seize and bring additional
llm_translation: Gemara inquires: Does he require it for the reason of "for the betterment of the world" - because it is a pressing need of the community, or perhaps because they should not become arrogant and neglect the poor?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּלֵוִי בַּר דַּרְגָּא פַּרְקַהּ לִבְרַתֵּיהּ בִּתְלֵיסַר אַלְפֵי דִּינְרֵי זָהָב.
human_translation: Come hear that Levi bar Darga redeemed his daughter with thirteen thousand gold dinars.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: Levi the son of Darga redeemed his daughter with thirteen thousand gold dinars."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּמַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּבִרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים עֲבַד? דִּילְמָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים עֲבַד.
human_translation: Abaye said: And who told us that he acted in accordance with the wishes of the Sages? Perhaps he acted against the wishes of the Sages,
llm_translation: Abaye said: And who will say to us that he acted with the consent of the sages? Perhaps he acted without the consent of the sages.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַבְרִיחִין אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיִין מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת שְׁבוּיִין: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא חַד.
human_translation: And one may not aid the captives escape for the betterment of the world. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: For the betterment of captives. What is between There is between them when there is only one
llm_translation: And we do not ransom captives because of the welfare of the world. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Because of the welfare of captives. What is the difference between them? There is only one difference.

hebrew_text: בְּנָתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בָּחֲשָׁן קִדְרָא בִּידַיְיהוּ. קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַב עִילִישׁ, כְּתִיב: ״אָדָם אֶחָד מֵאֶלֶף מָצָאתִי וְאִשָּׁה בְכׇל אֵלֶּה לֹא מָצָאתִי״, הָא אִיכָּא בְּנָתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן! גְּרַמָא לְהוּ מִילְּתָא וְאִשְׁתַּבְיָין, וְאִישְׁתְּבִאי אִיהוּ נָמֵי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman’s daughters would stir a pot with their hands, Rav Ilish had a difficulty is written: “A man one of a thousand I have found, and a woman among all those have I not found” Aren’t there Rav Naḥman’s daughters, These words caused them to be taken captive, and was also taken captive with them.
llm_translation: The daughters of Rav Nachman wore a KIDRA on their heads. Rav Eilish found it difficult, as it is written: "One man among a thousand I found, but a woman among all these I have not found." But are there not the daughters of Rav Nachman! This caused them distress, and they sat down and deliberated, and they concluded that he was mistaken in his assessment.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה יָתֵיב גַּבֵּיהּ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא, דַּהֲוָה יָדַע בְּלִישָּׁנָא דְצִיפּוֹרֵי. אֲתָא עוֹרְבָא וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי קָאָמַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עִילִישׁ בְּרַח, עִילִישׁ בְּרַח״. אָמַר: עוֹרְבָא שַׁקָּרָא הוּא וְלָא סָמֵיכְנָא עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: One day a certain man was sitting with him who knew the language of birds. A raven came and called to said to What is saying? He said to him Ilish, escape; Ilish, escape. said: It is a lying raven, and I do not rely on it.
llm_translation: One day, there was sitting on his shoulder that man, who knew the language of birds. A raven came and called to him. He said to him: What is it saying? He said to him: "Ilis barach, Ilis barach." He said: The raven is a liar and we do not rely on it.

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא יוֹנָה וְקָא קָרְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי קָאָמְרָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עִילִישׁ בְּרַח, עִילִישׁ בְּרַח״. אָמַר: כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּיוֹנָה מְתִילָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִתְרְחִישׁ לִי נִיסָּא. אָמַר: אֵיזִיל אֶחְזֵי בְּנָתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אִי קָיְימָן בְּהֵימָנוּתַיְיהוּ – אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ.
human_translation: In the meantime, a dove came and was calling said to What is it saying? He said to him Ilish, escape; Ilish, escape. said: The Congregation of Israel is compared to a dove; conclude from a miracle will happen for me, said: I will go I will see Rav Naḥman’s daughters. If they remained in their faith I will return them
llm_translation: So, thereupon, came Yonah and he was reading. He said to him: What is she saying? He said to him: "Elisha, son of Rach, Elisha, son of Rach." He said: The congregation of Israel is like a fluttering dove, I have a tradition from her that a miracle will happen to me. He said: I will go and see the daughters of Rav Nachman, if they are faithful to their husbands - I will return to them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: נְשֵׁי, כׇּל מִילֵּי דְּאִית לְהוּ סָדְרָן לַהֲדָדֵי בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא. שַׁמְעִינְהוּ דְּקָאָמְרָן: עָדֵי גּוּבְרִין וּנְהַרְדָּעֵי גּוּבְרִין, לֵימָא לְהוּ לְשָׁבוֹיַיְהוּ דְּלִירַחֲקִינְהוּ מֵהָכָא, דְּלָא לֵיתוֹ אִינָשִׁין וְלִישְׁמְעִי וְלִיפְרְקִינַן.
human_translation: He said: Women tell all of their matters to each other in the bathroom, He heard them saying: These our husbands, and the men of Neharde’a our husbands. We should tell our captors to distance us from here so that our husbands should not come and hear and redeem us,
llm_translation: He said: The women, all matters that they have in order to adorn themselves with in the bathroom. Listen to what they are saying: Until the masters of the house and the masters of the courtyard, let them say to their attendants to distance them from here, so that people do not come and see and be embarrassed.

hebrew_text: קָם, עֲרַק, אֲתָא אִיהוּ וְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא. לְדִידֵיהּ אִיתְרְחִישׁ לֵיהּ נִיסָּא עֲבַר בְּמַבָּרָא, וְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא אַשְׁכְּחוּהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ. כִּי הָדְרָן וְאָתָן, אֲמַר: הֲווֹ קָא בָחֲשָׁן קִידְרָא בִּכְשָׁפִים.
human_translation: arose escaped. He and that man came A miracle happened for him he crossed on a ferry, and found that man and killed him. When were returned and they came said: They would stir the pot with witchcraft,
llm_translation: He arose, fled, he came, he and that man. According to him, a miracle occurred for him, he passed through the sea, and that man found her and killed her. When they returned, they said: "They were searching for a pot of magic in the breastplate."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵין לוֹקְחִין סְפָרִים, תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת מִן הַגּוֹיִם יוֹתֵר עַל כְּדֵי דְמֵיהֶן,
human_translation: And scrolls, phylacteries, or mezuzot are not purchased from the gentiles more than their value,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And one may not purchase books, phylacteries, and mezuzot from Gentiles for more than their value."

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: for the betterment of the world,
llm_translation: Because of the repair of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב בּוּדְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: יָתֵר עַל כְּדֵי דְמֵיהֶן הוּא דְּאֵין לוֹקְחִין, הָא בִּכְדֵי דְמֵיהֶן – לוֹקְחִין; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּמְצָא בְּיַד גּוֹי – קוֹרִין בּוֹ? דִּילְמָא לִגְנוֹז.
human_translation: Rav Budya said to Rav Ashi It is more than their value one may not purchase them; however, for their value, one may purchase them. learn from a Torah scroll that is found in the possession of a gentile, one can read it Perhaps to inter
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Budya said to Rav Ashi: "If it is more than the value of their blood, they do not acquire it; but if it is the value of their blood, they acquire it. Can one read from a Torah scroll found in the possession of a non-Jew? Perhaps it was hidden."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, נָקְטִינַן: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ מִין – יִשָּׂרֵף, כְּתָבוֹ גּוֹי – יִגָּנֵז. נִמְצָא בְּיַד מִין – יִגָּנֵז. נִמְצָא בְּיַד גּוֹי – אָמְרִי לַהּ יִגָּנֵז, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ קוֹרִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: We have a tradition a Torah scroll that was written by a heretic should be burned; written by a gentile should be interred; found in the possession of a heretic, should be interred. found in the possession of a gentile, some say should be interred and some say one may read it.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, we have learned: A Torah scroll written by a heretic - should be burned, if written by a non-Jew - should be buried. If found in the possession of a heretic - should be buried. If found in the possession of a non-Jew - some say it should be buried, and some say it may be read from.

hebrew_text: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ גּוֹי – תָּנֵי חֲדָא: יִשָּׂרֵף, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: יִגָּנֵז, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: קוֹרִין בּוֹ!
human_translation: a Torah scroll that was written by a gentile, it is taught one should be burned, and it is taught another should be interred, and it is taught another One may read it.
llm_translation: The Book of Torah that a non-Jew wrote - one teaching: it shall be burned, and another teaching: it shall be buried, and another teaching: it shall be read!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּתַנְיָא ״יִשָּׂרֵף״ – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: סְתָם מַחְשֶׁבֶת גּוֹי לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: not difficult: That which is taught should be burned, is Rabbi Eliezer, who says: The unspecified intentions of a gentile are for idol worship,
llm_translation: Not difficult, this that it was taught "shall be burned" - Rabbi Eliezer it is, for he said: The general thought of a gentile is for idol worship.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּתַנְיָא ״יִגָּנֵז״ – הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא, דְּתָנֵי רַב הַמְנוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מִפַּשְׁרוּנְיָא: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, תְּפִלִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת שֶׁכְּתָבָן מִין, וּמָסוֹר, גּוֹי, וְעֶבֶד, אִשָּׁה, וְקָטָן, וְכוּתִי, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל מְשׁוּמָּד – פְּסוּלִין; שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּקְשַׁרְתָּם״–״וּכְתַבְתָּם״ – כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בִּקְשִׁירָה יֶשְׁנוֹ בִּכְתִיבָה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּקְשִׁירָה אֵינוֹ בִּכְתִיבָה.
human_translation: And that which is taught it should be interred, is this tanna , as Rav Hamnuna, son of Rava of Pashronya, taught: A Torah scroll, phylacteries, or mezuzot that were written by a heretic or an informer, a gentile or a slave, a woman or a minor, or a Samaritan or a Jewish apostate, are unfit, as it is stated: “And you shall bind them and you shall write them Anyone who is in binding is in write but anyone who is not in binding is not in write
llm_translation: The one who taught "Yignez" - this Tanna is the one who teaches, as Rav Hamnuna, son of Rava, from Pashrunya, taught: A Torah scroll, phylacteries, and mezuzot that were written by a heretic, a Samaritan, a slave, a woman, a minor, a Cuthean, or an apostate Israelite - are invalid; as it is stated: "And you shall bind them" - "And you shall write them" - anything that is fit for binding is fit for writing, and anything that is not fit for binding is not fit for writing.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּתַנְיָא ״קוֹרִין בּוֹ״ – הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: לוֹקְחִין סְפָרִים מִן הַגּוֹיִם בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כְּתוּבִין כְּהִלְכָתָן. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּגוֹי אֶחָד בְּצַיְדָּן שֶׁהָיָה כּוֹתֵב סְפָרִים, וְהִתִּיר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לִיקַּח מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: And that which is taught one may read it, that this tanna , as it is taught One may purchase scrolls from gentiles in any location, provided that they are written in accordance with their halakhot . And an incident involving a gentile in Tzaidan who would write scrolls, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permitted to purchase from him.
llm_translation: And this that it was taught "we read in it" - this Tanna is, as it was taught: One may acquire books from the Gentiles in every place, provided that they are written according to their laws. And there was an incident with a certain Gentile in Tzaidan who used to write books, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permitted taking from him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – עִיבּוּד לִשְׁמָן בָּעֵי, כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָן לָא בָּעֵי?!
human_translation: And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel require preparation for their sake, he does not require writing for their sake?
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel - Ivud for oil is needed, writing for oil is not needed?!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: צִיפָּן זָהָב אוֹ שֶׁטָּלָה עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה – פְּסוּלוֹת. עוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה – כְּשֵׁרוֹת, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא עִיבְּדָן לִשְׁמָן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה – פְּסוּלוֹת, עַד שֶׁיְּעַבְּדֵן לִשְׁמָן.
human_translation: As it is taught coated them with gold or patched them skin of a non-kosher animal, they are unfit. skin of a kosher animal, they are fit, and even though he did not prepare them, for their sake, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even skin of a kosher animal they are unfit, until he prepares them for their sake.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If gold was plated or a non-kosher animal hide was spread upon them, they are disqualified. If a kosher animal hide was spread upon them, they are valid, even though they were not tanned for their oil. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even a kosher animal hide renders them disqualified until they are tanned for their oil.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּגֵר שֶׁחָזַר לְסוֹרוֹ. לְסוֹרוֹ?! כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ מִין! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שֶׁחוֹזֵר לְסוֹרוֹ מִשּׁוּם יִרְאָה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel says: a convert who returned to his corrupt ways [ suro ] to his corrupt ways all the more so as he is a heretic. Rav Ashi says: that he returned to his corrupt ways due to fear,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel said: concerning a convert who returns to his former ways. To his former ways?! All the more so that he is considered a heretic! Rav Ashe said: he returns to his former ways out of fear.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲלִין בִּדְמֵיהֶן, עַד כְּדֵי טַרְפָּעִיק. מַאי טַרְפָּעִיק? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אִיסְתֵּירָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One may increase their value up to a terapa’ik . What terapa’ik ? Rav Sheshet said: istera ,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: They may increase with their value, up to the amount of a Terpa'ik. What is a Terpa'ik? Rav Sheshet said: A coin.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא טַיַּיעְתָּא דְּאַיְיתַי חַיְיתָא דִתְפִילֵּי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. אֲמַר לַהּ: יָהֲבַתְּ לִי רֵישׁ רֵישׁ בְּתַמְרֵי? אִימַּלְיָא זִיהֲרָא, שְׁקַלָא שְׁדָתִינְהוּ בְּנַהֲרָא. אֲמַר: לָא אִבְּעַי לִי לְזַלְזוֹלִינְהוּ בְּאַפַּהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי.
human_translation: a certain Arab merchant woman [ taya’ata ] who brought a sack [ ḥayeta ] of phylacteries in front of Abaye. He said to her: you give me each pair for a date? She became full of anger, took threw them into the river said I should not have denigrated so much in her presence,
llm_translation: That particular incident where a certain wild animal came before Abaye. He said to it: "Did you give me two heads of dates?" It emitted a bright light, took them and threw them into the river. He said: "I did not want to degrade them by throwing them into the oven of this one."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע – לֹא יַחְזִיר. מִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר – לֹא יַחְזִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁיָּדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים – לֹא יַחְזִיר, וְשֶׁלֹּא יָדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים – יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: who divorces his wife due to bad reputation, may not remarry due to a vow he may not remarry Rabbi Yehuda says: any vow that the public was aware of, he may not remarry but that the public was not aware of, he may remarry
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who divorces his wife due to a bad name - he shall not return her. Due to a vow - he shall not return her. Rabbi Yehuda says: Any vow that many are aware of - he shall not return, and that which many are not aware of - he shall return.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁצָּרִיךְ חֲקִירַת חָכָם – לֹא יַחְזִיר, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ חֲקִירַת חָכָם – יַחְזִיר. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא אָסְרוּ זֶה אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי זֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: any vow that requires investigation by a halakhic authority, he may not remarry but that does not require investigation by a halakhic authority, he may remarry Rabbi Elazar said: They prohibited this only due to that
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Any vow that requires investigation by a sage - do not annul it, and one that does not require investigation by a sage - annul it. Rabbi Elazar said: They only forbade this because of that.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַיְדָּן, בְּאֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ: ״קֻוֽנָּם אִם אֵינִי מְגָרְשִׁיךְ״, וְגֵרְשָׁהּ, וְהִתִּירוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים שֶׁיַּחְזִירֶנָּה, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: an incident in Tzaidan involving one who said to his wife: konam , if I do not divorce you, and he divorced her; and the Sages permitted him to remarry for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: There was an incident in Tzaydan, where a man said to his wife, "You are hereby divorced," and he divorced her. The sages permitted him to remarry her, for the betterment of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וְהוּא שֶׁאָמַר לָהּ: ״מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע אֲנִי מוֹצִיאֵךְ״;
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: And is when he said to her I am removing you due to your bad reputation,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: And he said to her, "Because of the evil name, I am sending you out."

hebrew_text: ״מִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר אֲנִי מוֹצִיאֵךְ״ – קָסָבַר: טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם קִלְקוּלָא; אִי אָמַר לַהּ הָכִי – מָצֵי מְקַלְקֵל לַהּ, וְאִי לָא – לָא מָצֵי מְקַלְקֵל לַהּ.
human_translation: I am removing you due to a vow. holds: What is the reason due to harm if he said to her this he will be able to cause harm to her, but if not he will not be able to cause harm to her,
llm_translation: "Because of a vow, I am releasing you" - he holds: what is the reason? Because of disgrace; if he says to her thus - he finds himself disgracing her, and if not - he does not find himself disgracing her.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר לָהּ: ״הֱוִי יוֹדַעַת שֶׁמִּשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע אֲנִי מוֹצִיאֵךְ וּמִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר אֲנִי מוֹצִיאֵךְ״ – קָסָבַר: טַעְמָא מַאי – כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל פְּרוּצוֹת בַּעֲרָיוֹת וּבִנְדָרִים; הִלְכָּךְ צָרִיךְ לְמֵימַר לַהּ הָכִי.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: He must say to her: Be aware that I am removing you due to bad reputation, or: I am removing you due to a vow. holds: What is the reason So that Jewish women will not be promiscuous with regard to forbidden relations or vows. Therefore he must say this to her:
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: It is necessary to say to her, "Be aware that I am divorcing you because of a bad name, and I am divorcing you because of a vow." He holds: What is the reason? - So that the daughters of Israel will not be promiscuous in matters of forbidden relationships and vows; therefore, one must say to her thus.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא, וְתַנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with the first version and is taught in accordance with the latter version.
llm_translation: It was taught in the first clause, and it was taught in the latter clause.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא – אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ הַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע לֹא יַחְזִיר, וּמִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר לֹא יַחְזִיר? שֶׁמָּא תֵּלֵךְ וְתִנָּשֵׂא לְאַחֵר, וְנִמְצְאוּ דְּבָרִים בַּדָּאִין, וְיֹאמַר: ״אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁכֵּן הוּא, אֲפִילּוּ אִם הָיוּ נוֹתְנִים לִי מֵאָה מָנֶה – לֹא הָיִיתִי מְגָרְשָׁהּ״; וְנִמְצָא גֵּט בָּטֵל וּבָנֶיהָ מַמְזֵרִין; לְפִיכָךְ אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ, שֶׁהַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע – לֹא יַחְזִיר, וּמִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר – לֹא יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with the first version: Rabbi Meir said: For what did they say who divorces his wife due to bad reputation may not remarry and a vow may not remarry Perhaps she will go and marry another and the matter will be found fabricated, and he will say: If I would have known that it is like this, even if they would have given me one hundred one hundred dinars I would not have divorced her; and bill of divorce found void, and her children mamzerim . Therefore, one says to him Be aware that who divorces his wife due to bad reputation may not remarry and due to a vow may not remarry
llm_translation: It was taught in the first clause: Rabbi Meir said: For what reason did they say that one who divorces his wife due to a bad name should not take her back, and due to a vow should not take her back? Lest she go and marry another, and matters be found in the interim, and he would say: "If I had known this would happen, even if they were to give me a hundred mana - I would not have divorced her"; and a divorce would be nullified, and her children would be considered illegitimate. Therefore, they say to him: Be aware, that one who divorces his wife due to a bad name - should not take her back, and due to a vow - should not take her back.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּלִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָא – אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ הַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע לֹא יַחְזִיר, וּמִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר לֹא יַחְזִיר? שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל פְּרוּצוֹת בַּעֲרָיוֹת וּבִנְדָרִים. לְפִיכָךְ אוֹמְרִים לוֹ, אֱמוֹר לָהּ: ״הָוֵי יוֹדַעַת שֶׁמִּשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע אֲנִי מוֹצִיאֵךְ וּמִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר אֲנִי מוֹצִיאֵךְ״.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with the latter version: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: For what did they say that who divorces his wife due to bad reputation may not remarry and a vow may not remarry Jewish women will not be licentious with regard to forbidden relations or with regard to vows. Therefore, one says to him Say to her: Be aware that I am removing you due to bad reputation, or: I am removing you due to a vow.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Klishana Batra" - Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei said: For what reason did they say that one who divorces his wife should not take her back due to a bad name, and due to a vow he should not take her back? Because the daughters of Israel should not be promiscuous in their cities and with vows. Therefore, they say to him, say to her: "Be aware that it is due to a bad name that I am divorcing you, and it is due to a vow that I am divorcing you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁיֵּדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים – לֹא יַחְזִיר, וְשֶׁלֹּא יָדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים – יַחְזִיר: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא הִכּוּם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי נִשְׁבְּעוּ לָהֶם נְשִׂיאֵי הָעֵדָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: any vow that the public was aware of, he may not remarry but that the public was not aware of, he may remarry Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? As it is written “And the children of Israel did not strike them, for the leaders of the congregation swore to them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Any vow that is known by many - should not be annulled, and that which is not known by many - should be annulled. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehudah's opinion? As it is written: "But the leaders of the congregation swore to them" (Numbers 21:18).

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: הָתָם, מִי חָלָה שְׁבוּעָה עִילָּוַיְיהוּ כְּלָל?! כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַרוּ לְהוּ: ״מֵאֶרֶץ רְחוֹקָה בָּאנוּ״ – וְלֹא בָּאוּ, לָא חָיְילָה שְׁבוּעָה עִילָּוַיְיהוּ כְּלָל; וְהַאי דְּלָא קַטְלִינְהוּ – מִשּׁוּם קְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, There, did the oath take effect with regard to them at all? Since said to them: “We came from a far country” and they did not come the oath did not take effect with regard to at all, And this, that did not kill due to the sanctity of God’s name.
llm_translation: The sages said: There, who became ill a week before their appointed time in general?! Since they said to them: "We have come from a distant land" - and they did not come, their appointed time was not at all valid; and this one who did not kill them - it was out of respect for the sanctity of the Name.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה רַבִּים? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה, רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: And how many public Rav Naḥman says: Three Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Ten
llm_translation: And how many is "many"? Rav Nachman said three, Rabbi Yitzchak said ten.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה, ״יָמִים״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״רַבִּים״ – שְׁלֹשָׁה. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר עֲשָׂרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדָה״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Three, “days” two, “many” three Rabbi Yitzḥak says: ten as it is written congregation
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said three, "days" - two, "many" - three. Rabbi Yitzchak said ten, as it is written: "congregation."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁצָּרִיךְ וְכוּ׳: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָסְרוּ ״צָרִיךְ״ אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי ״שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: any vow that requires is taught Rabbi Elazar says: They prohibited requires only due to that does not require
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Every vow that requires, etc. It was taught: Rabbi Elazar says: They did not prohibit "requires" except because "it is not required."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: אָדָם רוֹצֶה, שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין;
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: A man desires, that his wife should be disgraced in court.
llm_translation: With what did he disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: A man prefers that his wife be shamed in court.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר: אֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁתִּתְבַּזֶּה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar holds: A man does not desire that his wife should be disgraced in court.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar holds: a person does not want his wife to be humiliated in court.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַיְדָּן וְכוּ׳: מַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָתָנֵי מַעֲשֶׂה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: an incident in Tzaidan What teach that teach incident?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda: There was an incident in Tzaydan, etc. What is the meaning of the Mishnah that teaches the incident?

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – כְּשֶׁנָּדְרָה הִיא, אֲבָל נָדַר אִיהוּ – יַחְזִיר; וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּצַיְדָּן, בְּאֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ: ״קוּנָּם אִם אֵינִי מְגָרְשִׁיךְ״, וְגֵירְשָׁהּ, וְהִתִּירוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים שֶׁיַּחְזִירֶנָּה – מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: is incomplete and this is what it is teaching: In what is this statement said? When she took a vow, However, he took a vow, he may remarry And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: also an incident in Tzaidan involving one that said to his wife: konam if I do not divorce you, and he divorced her; and the Sages permitted him to remarry her, for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei michasra ve'hachi katanei: Bameh devarim amurim - keshenadra hi, aval nadar ihu - yachzir; ve'amar Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda: Ma'aseh namei betzaydan, be'echad she'amar leishto: 'Kunam im eini megarshech,' ve'gershah, ve'hittiru lo chachamim sheyachzirenah - mipnei tikkun ha'olam."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״קֻוֽנָּם״? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, בְּאוֹמֵר: ״יֵאָסְרוּ כׇּל פֵּירוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם עָלַי אִם אֵינִי מְגָרְשָׁהּ״.
human_translation: What Konam , Rav Huna said when he says: All the produce that is in the world will become forbidden to me if I do not divorce you.
llm_translation: What is "kunnam"? Rav Huna said, by saying: "All fruits in the world shall be forbidden to me if I do not divorce her."

hebrew_text: וְהִתִּירוּ לוֹ שֶׁיַּחְזִירֶנָּה: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא לִיגְזוֹר מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי נָתָן – דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: הַנּוֹדֵר – כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה, וְהַמְקַיְּימוֹ – כְּאִילּוּ הִקְרִיב עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And they permitted him to remarry her. It is obvious lest you say: Let us decree due to of Rabbi Natan. As it is taught Rabbi Natan said: One who vows, as if he built altar And one who fulfills it is as if he sacrificed an offering on this it teaches us
llm_translation: And they permitted him to return it. Obvious! What might you say, to decree because of Rabbi Natan? For it was taught: Rabbi Natan says: One who vows is as if he built an altar, and one who fulfills it is as if he offered a sacrifice upon it; this teaches us.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם: מַאי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם אִיכָּא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: for the betterment of the world. What betterment of the world is there Rav Sheshet said: to the first clause
llm_translation: Due to the rectification of the world: What is the rectification of the world? There is. Rav Sheshet said: The beginning.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אַסֵּיפָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין בָּזוֹ מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, to the latter clause and this is what it taught: This is not for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always conclude with the following teaching: "Do not despise anyone, for the sake of the mending of the world."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אַיְלוֹנִית, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא יַחְזִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: one who divorces his wife because a sexually underdeveloped woman ailonit Rabbi Yehuda says: He may not remarry and the Rabbis say: He may remarry
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who divorces his wife on account of being an illicit child of a Eilonit, Rabbi Yehuda says: He shall not take her back. And the Sages say: He shall take her back.

hebrew_text: נִישֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר וְהָיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים הֵימֶנּוּ, וְהִיא תּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ; אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אוֹמֵר לַהּ: שְׁתִיקוּתִיךְ יָפָה מִדִּיבּוּרִיךְ.
human_translation: married another and had children from him, and she is demanding her marriage contract Rabbi Yehuda said he say to her: Your silence is preferable to your speech,
llm_translation: She was married to another and had children from him, and she demands her marriage contract; Rabbi Yehuda said, he says to her: "Your silence is more beautiful than your speech."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה חָיֵישׁ לְקִלְקוּלָא, וְרַבָּנַן לָא חָיְישִׁי לְקִלְקוּלָא?! וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ!
human_translation: Is this to say that Rabbi Yehuda is concerned about harm, and the Rabbis are not concerned about harm? But didn’t we learn they the opposite?
llm_translation: Gemara: Regarding the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, he is concerned for leniency, and the Rabbis are not concerned for leniency?! But the opposite we have heard!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רַע – לֹא יַחְזִיר, וּמִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר – לֹא יַחְזִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל נֶדֶר שֶׁיָּדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים – לֹא יַחְזִיר, וְשֶׁלֹּא יָדְעוּ בּוֹ רַבִּים – יַחְזִיר. אַלְמָא [רַבָּנַן חָיְישִׁי לְקִלְקוּלָא], וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא חָיֵישׁ לְקִלְקוּלָא!
human_translation: As we learned who divorces his wife due to bad reputation may not remarry And due to a vow he may not remarry Rabbi Yehuda says: any vow that the public was aware of, he may not remarry but that the public was not aware of, he may remarry Apparently, the Rabbis are concerned about harm, and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned about harm,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who divorces his wife due to a bad name - he shall not return her, and due to a vow - he shall not return her. Rabbi Yehuda says: Any vow that many are aware of - he shall not return her, and that which many are not aware of - he shall return her. This implies the Rabbis are concerned about causing a desecration, and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned about causing a desecration!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: Shmuel said: Reverse
llm_translation: Said Samuel: Eifoh.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: נִישֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר וְהָיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים הֵימֶנּוּ, וְהִיא תּוֹבַעַת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ; אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אוֹמֵר לָהּ: ״שְׁתִיקוּתִיךְ יָפָה מִדִּיבּוּרִיךְ״ – מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה חָיֵישׁ לְקִלְקוּלָא! הָא נָמֵי אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: But from that it teaches in the last clause married another and had children from him, and she is demanding her marriage contract Rabbi Yehuda said he say to her: Your silence is preferable to your speech, by inference that Rabbi Yehuda is concerned about harm. Here too, reverse
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection from the latter clause: "She was married to another man, and she had children from him, and she demands her marriage contract." Rabbi Yehuda said to her: "Your silence is preferable to your speech" - from the principle that Rabbi Yehuda is concerned about potential leniency! This is indeed a valid objection.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּהָהִיא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – בְּצָרִיךְ סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, do not reverse and Rabbi Yehuda in that he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and he holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. In requires he holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar In does not require he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always do not turn over, and Rabbi Yehuda in that case thought like Rabbi Meir and thought like Rabbi Eliezer - when it is necessary he thought like Rabbi Eliezer, when it is not necessary he thought like Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא, דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא?!
human_translation: Rava said: difficult of Rabbi Yehuda with of Rabbi Yehuda not difficult of the Rabbis with of the Rabbis
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding Rabbi Yehuda, is Rabbi Yehuda difficult? Regarding the Rabbis, are the Rabbis not difficult?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא – כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן. דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא, מַאן חֲכָמִים – רַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: בָּעֵינַן תְּנַאי כָּפוּל, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בִּדְלָא כַּפְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: not difficult of Rabbi Yehuda with of Rabbi Yehuda as we answered. not difficult of the Rabbis with of the Rabbis who the Rabbis Rabbi Meir, who said: We require a compound condition And with what are we dealing here? a situation where he did not compound his condition,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: concerning Rabbi Yehuda, it is not difficult - as we have explained. Concerning the Rabbis, it is not difficult. Who are the sages? Rabbi Meir, who said: we require a repeated teaching, and here we are dealing with what was not repeated to its teachers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹכֵר אֶת עַצְמוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו לַגּוֹיִם – אֵין פּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל פּוֹדִין אֶת הַבָּנִים לְאַחַר מִיתַת אֲבִיהֶן.
human_translation: one who sells himself and his children to gentiles, he is not redeemed, but the children are redeemed after their father’s death,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who sells himself and his sons to Gentiles - he is not redeemed, but his sons are redeemed after the death of their father.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: וְהוּא שֶׁמָּכַר וְשָׁנָה וְשִׁילֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Asi says: And this when he sold and repeated a second time and repeated a third time.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Assi said: And this is referring to one who sold, and changed, and appraised.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בְּנֵי בֵּי מִיכְסֵי, דְּיָזְפִי זוּזֵי מִגּוֹיִם וְלָא הֲוָה לְהוּ לְמִפְרְעִינְהוּ. אָתוּ וְקָא גָרְבִי לְהוּ, אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי אֶיעְבֵּיד לְכוּ, דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹכֵר אֶת עַצְמוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו לַגּוֹיִם – אֵין פּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: those residents of Bei Mikhsi who borrowed money from gentiles, and they did not have to repay them. came and seized them They came before Rav Huna said to them: What can I do for you, as we learned one who sells himself and his children to gentiles, he is not redeemed.
llm_translation: Those are the sons of the descendants of Micsi, who collected money from the nations but did not have the means to repay them. They came and sought advice from Rav Huna. He said to them: What should I do for you, as we have learned: One who sells himself and his sons to the nations - we do not redeem him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: לִימַּדְתַּנִי רַבֵּינוּ, וְהוּא שֶׁמָּכַר וְשָׁנָה וְשִׁילֵּשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִרְגָּל רְגִילִי דְּעָבְדִי הָכִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Our master taught me: And this when he sold and repeated a second time, and repeated a third time, said to him: These do this habitually,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Abba: You taught me, our teacher, and he sold and changed and trifled! He said to him: Those spies are accustomed to doing so.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין נַפְשֵׁיהּ לְלוּדָאֵי. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: A certain man sold himself to gladiators [ luda’ei ]. He came before Rabbi Ami said to him:
llm_translation: That man who sells himself to idolaters. He came before Rabbi Ammi, he said to him:

hebrew_text: פִּירְקַן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנַן: הַמּוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו לַגּוֹיִם – אֵין פּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל פּוֹדִין אֶת הַבָּנִים – מִשּׁוּם קִלְקוּלָא, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא קְטָלָא.
human_translation: Redeem me. said to him: We learned one who sells himself and his children to gentiles, he is not redeemed. However, his children are redeemed due to the harm and all the more so here, where there is death,
llm_translation: Section! He said to him: We learned: One who sells himself and his sons to the Gentiles - he is not redeemed, but his sons are redeemed - due to disgrace, and certainly here where there is danger.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי: הַאי יִשְׂרָאֵל מוּמָר הוּא, דְּקָא חָזוּ לֵיהּ דְּקָאָכֵיל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֵימָא לְתֵיאָבוֹן הוּא דְּקָאָכֵיל.
human_translation: The Sages said to Rabbi Ami: This is a Jewish apostate, as they saw him when he was eating animal carcasses and animals with a wound that will cause them to die within twelve months [ tereifot ]. He said to them: Say he was eating due to appetite,
llm_translation: The sages said to Rabbi Ammi: This Israelite is a heretic, for they have seen him eating neveilah and tereifah! He said to them: Perhaps he is a glutton who eats.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא זִמְנִין דְּאִיכָּא הֶיתֵּירָא וְאִיסּוּרָא קַמֵּיהּ, וְשָׁבֵיק הֶיתֵּירָא וְאָכֵיל אִיסּוּרָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל, לָא קָא שָׁבְקִי לִי דְּאֶפְרְקִינָּךְ.
human_translation: They said to him: But times when there are permitted and forbidden before him, and he sets aside the permitted and eats the forbidden said to Go, they do not allow me to redeem you.
llm_translation: They said to him: But in a case where there is both permission and prohibition before him, and he leaves the permission and eats the prohibition! He said to them: Go, for I did not leave you to separate from you.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ זַבֵּין נַפְשֵׁיהּ לְלוּדָאֵי, שְׁקַל בַּהֲדֵיהּ חַיְיתָא וְגֻלְגֻּלְתָּא, אֲמַר: גְּמִירִי דְּיוֹמָא בָּתְרָא כֹּל דְּבָעֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ עָבְדִי לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵיחוּל אַדְּמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish sold himself to gladiators. He took a bag and a round stone with him. He said: a tradition that the final day they do for him anything that he requests of them, so that he would forgive of his blood.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish zabbeyn nafsheih leLuda'ei, shekal bahadeih chayita ve'gulgulta, amar: gemiri deyoma batra kol deva'ei minnaiyehu avdi lei, ki heichi delichul admeih.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא בָּתְרָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי נִיחָא לָךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: בָּעֵינָא אֶקְמְטִינְכוּ וְאוֹתְבִינְכוּ, וְכֹל חַד מִינַּיְיכוּ אֶמְחְיֵהּ חַיְיתָא וּפַלְגָא. קַמְטִינְהוּ וְאוֹתְבִינְהוּ, כֹּל חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ כַּד מַחְיֵיהּ חַד חַיְיתָא נְפַק נִשְׁמְתֵיהּ. חַרְקִינֵּיהּ לְשִׁינֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַחוֹכֵי קָא מְחַיְּיכַתְּ בִּי? אַכַּתִּי פָּשׁ לָךְ גַּבַּי פַּלְגָא דְּחַיְיתָא. קַטְלִינְהוּ כּוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: On the final day they said to him: What is amenable to you? He said to them: I want to tie you and have you sit, and I will strike each one of you one and a half He tied them and had each one of them sit. When he struck one strike died, gritted his teeth said to Are you laughing at me? You still half of a strike remaining me, He killed them all,
llm_translation: Day after the festival, they said to him: "What is pleasing to you?" He said to them: "I want to gather you and understand you, and each one of you I will give half a living creature." He gathered them and understood them, each one of them as he gathered one living creature, his soul departed. He ground them into teeth, he said to them: "Why are you trying to kill me? I have already given you half of a living creature." He killed all of them.

hebrew_text: נְפַק וַאֲתָא, יָתֵיב קָאָכֵיל וְשָׁתֵי. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה: לָא בָּעֵית מִידֵּי לְמִזְגֵּא עֲלֵיהּ? אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, כְּרֵיסִי כָּרִי. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ שְׁבַק קַבָּא דְמוֹרִיקָא, קְרָא אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ: ״וְעָזְבוּ לַאֲחֵרִים חֵילָם״.
human_translation: He left and came he was sitting, eating, and drinking, His daughter said to him: You don’t want something to lie upon? He said to her: My daughter, my belly is my pillow, When he died he left a kav of saffron he recited about himself: “And they leave their wealth for others”
llm_translation: He went out and came, sat, ate, and drank. His daughter said to him: Did you not need to mix wine for him? He said to her: My daughter, his vessel is full. When his soul was at ease, he left a drop of myrrh, he himself recited: "And they abandoned their strength to others."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹכֵר אֶת שָׂדֵהוּ לְגוֹי – לוֹקֵחַ וּמֵבִיא מִמֶּנּוּ בִּכּוּרִים, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: One who sells his field to a gentile must purchase and bring first fruits from for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who sells his field to a gentile - the buyer must bring first fruits from it, due to the rectification of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין קִנְיָן לְגוֹי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהַפְקִיעַ מִידֵּי מַעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לִי הָאָרֶץ״ – לִי קְדוּשַּׁת הָאָרֶץ; אֲבָל יֵשׁ קִנְיָן לְגוֹי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לַחְפּוֹר בָּהּ בּוֹרוֹת שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁמַיִם לַה׳ וְהָאָרֶץ נָתַן לִבְנֵי אָדָם״.
human_translation: Rabba says: Even though a gentile has no acquisition in Eretz Yisrael to abrogation from tithe as it is stated: “For the land is Mine” The sanctity of the land is Mine, a gentile does have, however, acquisition in Eretz Yisrael to dig pits, ditches, and caves as it is stated: “The heavens are the heavens of the Lord; but the earth has He given to the children of men”
llm_translation: Gemara said Rabbah: Even though there is no acquisition for a non-Jew in the land of Israel to exempt produce from the obligation of tithing, as it is stated: "For the land is Mine" - meaning the holiness of the land is Mine; but there is acquisition for a non-Jew in the land of Israel to dig pits, ditches, and caves in it, as it is stated: "The heavens are the heavens of the Lord, but the earth He has given to the sons of man."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ קִנְיָן לְגוֹי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהַפְקִיעַ מִידֵי מַעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דְּגָנְךָ״ – וְלֹא דְּגַן גּוֹי; אֲבָל אֵין קִנְיָן לְגוֹי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לַחְפּוֹר בָּהּ בּוֹרוֹת שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לַה׳ הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Even though a gentile has acquisition in Eretz Yisrael to abrogation from tithe as it is stated your grain” and not the grain of a gentile; a gentile does not have, however, acquisition in Eretz Yisrael to dig pits, ditches, and caves, as it is stated: “The earth is the Lord’s”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even though a non-Jew has ownership in the land of Israel to exempt himself from tithing, as it is stated: "Your grain" - and not the grain of a non-Jew; however, a non-Jew does not have ownership in the land of Israel to dig pits, ditches, and caves in it, as it is stated: "The land belongs to the Lord."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: ״דְּגָנְךָ״ – וְלֹא דְּגַן גּוֹי, וּמָר סָבַר: דִּיגּוּנְךָ, וְלֹא דִּיגּוּן גּוֹי.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds “your grain” but not the grain of a gentile. And Sage, holds your accumulation into a pile, and not the accumulation into a pile a gentile,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master holds: "Your grain" - not the grain of a gentile, and Master holds: "Your fish" - not the fish of a gentile.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּתְנַן: הַלֶּקֶט וְהַשִּׁכְחָה וְהַפֵּאָה שֶׁל גּוֹי – חַיָּיבִין בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִפְקִיר.
human_translation: Rabba said: From where do I say As we learned the gleanings and the forgotten and the produce in the corner of the field, which is given to the poor [ pe’a ], of a gentile, obligated to tithe unless rendered them ownerless.
llm_translation: Rabba said: From where do I say this to her? For it was taught: The gleanings, the forgotten sheaves, and the corner of the field of a gentile - are obligated in tithing, unless he declared them ownerless.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְלַיקְּטִינְהוּ גּוֹי – ״אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִפְקִיר״?! הָא מַפְקְרִי וְקָיְימִי! אֶלָּא לָאו דְּגוֹי – וְלַקְּטִינְהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל;
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say of a Jew, and a gentile collected them Unless he rendered them ownerless? But they are already ownerless, Rather, is it not of a gentile, and a Jew gathered them.
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If you say that the produce belongs to Israel and a non-Jew gathered it - 'Rather, unless it was declared ownerless'?! But it was declared ownerless and still remains in the possession of the non-Jew! Rather, it is a case not of a non-Jew - and still Israel gathered it."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּהִפְקִיר, הָא לֹא הִפְקִיר – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: The reason because rendered it ownerless, but he did not render it ownerless, obligated
llm_translation: Reason of hefker, this not hefker - liable!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְלַקְּטִינְהוּ גּוֹי, וּדְקָא אָמְרַתְּ: הָא מַפְקְרִי וְקָיְימִי, נְהִי דְּמַפְקְרִי אַדַּעְתָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אַדַּעְתָּא דְגוֹי מִי מַפְקְרִי?!
human_translation: No, actually of a Jew, and a gentile collected them. And that which you said: But they are already ownerless, Let it be that he rendered them ownerless with the intent that a Jew did he render them ownerless with the intent that a gentile
llm_translation: Not, forever of Israel and to gather them nation, and that said: this ownerless and established, so when ownerless knowledge of Israel, knowledge of nation who ownerless?!

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלָּקַח שָׂדֶה מִגּוֹי עַד שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיאָה שְׁלִישׁ, וְחָזַר וּמְכָרָהּ לוֹ מִשֶּׁהֵבִיאָה שְׁלִישׁ – חַיֶּיבֶת בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְחַיְּיבָה. נִתְחַיְּיבָה – אִין, לֹא נִתְחַיְּיבָה – לָא!
human_translation: Come hear a Jew who acquired a field from a gentile before reached a third and he then sold it to after reached a third obligated to tithe because already became obligated became obligated yes, did not become obligated no,
llm_translation: Listen: If a Jew acquired a field from a non-Jew, until he brings a third of it, and then he goes back and sells it to him after he brought a third - it is obligated in tithing, for it was already obligated. If it was already obligated - yes, if it was not already obligated - no!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּסוּרְיָא, וְקָסָבַר: כִּיבּוּשׁ יָחִיד לָא שְׁמֵיהּ כִּיבּוּשׁ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? in Syria, and holds the conquest of an individual is not called a conquest.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - in Suria, and he holds: the embarrassment of an individual is not called embarrassment.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי שֶׁלָּקְחוּ שָׂדֶה בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת –
human_translation: Come hear a Jew and a gentile who purchased a field in partnership,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Israel and a non-Jew who acquired a field in partnership -

hebrew_text: טֶבֶל וְחוּלִּין מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל גּוֹי – פָּטוּר, וְשֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: untithed produce and non-sacred mixed together; the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: of the gentile is exempt and of the Jew is obligated.
llm_translation: Tevul and Chulin are mixed with each other, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: That of a gentile - exempt, and that of an Israelite - obligated.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא דְּמָר סָבַר ״יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה״. וּמַר סָבַר ״אֵין בְּרֵירָה״; אֲבָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא – יֵשׁ קִנְיָן לְגוֹי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהַפְקִיעַ מִיַּד מַעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: They disagree only with regard to That Sage, holds there is clarification, And Sage, holds there is no clarification, However, everyone agrees a gentile has acquisition in Eretz Yisrael to abrogation from tithe
llm_translation: Until here, they do not argue except that Mar holds "there is free will" and Mar holds "there is no free will"; but the universal principle is that there is acquisition for a non-Jew in the land of Israel to exempt from tithe!

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי בְּסוּרְיָא; וְקָסָבַר כִּיבּוּשׁ יָחִיד לָא שְׁמֵיהּ כִּיבּוּשׁ.
human_translation: Here, also, in Syria, and he holds the conquest of an individual is not called a conquest,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here it is stated in Suria; and he holds that the embarrassment of an individual is not called embarrassment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין, תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ לְגוֹי – לוֹקֵחַ וּמֵבִיא בִּיכּוּרִים מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם. מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם – אִין, מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא – לָא!
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said: Come hear One who sells his field to a gentile must purchase and bring first fruits from for the betterment of the world. For the betterment of the world, yes, by Torah law, no,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin said: Come and hear: One who sells his field to a gentile - he buys and brings first fruits due to the rectification of the world. Due to the rectification of the world - yes, from the Torah - no!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁתֵּי תַּקָּנוֹת הֲווֹ – מֵעִיקָּרָא הֲווֹ מַיְיתִי מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא; כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא מִקְּרִי וּמְזַבְּנִי, דְּסָבְרִי בִּקְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ קָיְימָן, תַּקִּינוּ לְהוּ דְּלָא לַיְתוֹ;
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: There were two ordinances Initially, would bring by Torah law, Once saw that would sell their land when they had the opportunity, because retains its sanctity, they instituted for that they should not bring
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: There were two enactments - initially they were brought from the Torah; but once they saw that people were treating them lightly and selling them, they established them so that they would not be brought.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּמַאן דְּלָא סַגִּי לֵיהּ – מְזַבֵּן, וְקָא מִשְׁתַּקְּעָן בְּיַד גּוֹיִם, הֲדַר תַּקִּינוּ לְהוּ דְּלַיְתוֹ.
human_translation: Once saw that those who were not able would sell and would remain in the possession of the gentiles they went back and instituted that they should bring
llm_translation: When they saw that someone who does not suffice for him - he sells, and they are becoming established in the hands of the nations, they then arranged for them to not come to an end.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ לְפֵירוֹת, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא.
human_translation: It was stated: one who sells his field for produce, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: brings and recites Reish Lakish says: brings he does not recite
llm_translation: It was stated: One who sells his field with its fruits, Rabbi Yochanan said: he brings and reads. Reish Lakish said: he brings but does not read.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא – קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא – קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת לָאו כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says he brings and recites acquisition of its produce is considered like acquisition of the item itself. Reish Lakish says he brings and does not recite because acquisition of its produce is not considered like acquisition of the item itself.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who brings fruit and reads a blessing - the acquisition of the fruits is like the acquisition of the body itself. Reish Lakish said: One who brings fruit but does not read a blessing - the acquisition of the fruits is not like the acquisition of the body itself.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״וּלְבֵיתְךָ״ – מְלַמֵּד, שֶׁאָדָם מֵבִיא בִּיכּוּרֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְקוֹרֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish and to your house” teaches that a man brings his wife’s first fruits, and he recites
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "And to your house" - teaches that a person should bring his wife's menstrual cloths and read.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב ״וּלְבֵיתֶךָ״.
human_translation: said to him: It is different there, as it is written “And to your house,”
llm_translation: He said to him: It is different there, as it is written "and to your house."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״וּלְבֵיתֶךָ״ – מְלַמֵּד, שֶׁאָדָם מֵבִיא בִּיכּוּרֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ וְקוֹרֵא – הָתָם הוּא דִכְתִיב ״וּלְבֵיתֶךָ״, אֲבָל בְּעָלְמָא – לָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טַעְמָא דִּידִי נָמֵי מֵהָכָא קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: And there are who say Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan “And to your house,” teaches that a man brings his wife’s first fruits, and he recites There, it is as it is written “And to your house”; but generally, no, said to him: I also state my reason from here,
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "And to your house" - teaches that a person brings the firstfruits of his wife and reads. There it is written "and to your house," but generally - no! He said to him: The reason is also derived from here.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הָיָה בָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּבִיכּוּרֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּיָדוֹ, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ – מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא. מֵתָה – אִין, לֹא מֵתָה – לָא!
human_translation: raised an objection to he was traveling on the road and the first fruits of his wife’s were in his possession, and he heard that his wife died, he brings and recites she died, yes, she did not die, no,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: If one was coming on the road and the marriage contract of his wife was in his hand, and he heard that his wife had died - he brings and reads. If she died - no, if she did not die - yes!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא מֵתָה; וּמֵתָה אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ – סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא לִיגְזוֹר מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא –
human_translation: The same is true that even though she did not die but was necessary for she died, it might enter your mind to say that there should be decree due to of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina
llm_translation: The same applies even though she did not die; and if she died, it is necessary for him - It is obvious in your opinion that I would say to cut it off because of Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina -

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: בְּצָרָן, וְשִׁגְּרָן בְּיַד שָׁלִיחַ, וּמֵת שָׁלִיחַ בַּדֶּרֶךְ – מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״–״וְהֵבֵאתָ״ – עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא לְקִיחָה וַהֲבָאָה בְּאֶחָד; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: harvested and sent them in the possession an agent, and the agent died on the way, brings but does not recite as it is stated: “And you shall take…and you shall bring” until the taking and bringing will be by one teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: In Tzaran, and in Shiggran by the hand of a messenger, and if the messenger dies on the way - one brings it but does not read, as it is stated: "And you shall take" - "and you shall bring" - until both taking and bringing are done by one; this is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: הַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ
human_translation: And follow their reasoning As it was stated One who sells his field
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons, for it was said: "The seller of his field..."

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַיּוֹבֵל נוֹהֵג, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא.
human_translation: in time when the Jubilee is practiced, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: brings and recites Reish Lakish says: brings but does not recite
llm_translation: In a time when the Jubilee is practiced, Rabbi Yochanan said: one brings and reads. Reish Lakish said: one brings but does not read.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא – קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא – קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת לָאו כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says brings and recites acquisition of its produce is considered like acquisition of the item itself. Reish Lakish says brings but does not recite acquisition of its produce is not considered like acquisition of the item itself.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, "One who brings produce and reads a declaration - the acquisition of the fruits is like the acquisition of the body itself." Reish Lakish said, "One who brings produce but does not read a declaration - the acquisition of the fruits is not like the acquisition of the body itself."

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָהִיא, בְּהָהִיא קָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּכִי קָא נָחֵית – אַדַּעְתָּא דְפֵירָא קָא נָחֵית; אֲבָל בְּהָךְ – דְּאַדַּעְתָּא דְגוּפֵיהּ קָא נָחֵית, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: And necessary Because if it was stated in that in that that Reish Lakish says since when descended he descended with the intention of the produce, but in this when he descended with the intention itself, say he concedes to Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: "And it is necessary. For if it was stated in that case, in that case Reish Lakish is saying, that when he arrives - the knowledge of the pit he arrives; but in this case - that he arrives with his own knowledge, say that Rabbi Yochanan agrees with him."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if it was stated in this in this Rabbi Yoḥanan says but in that say he concedes to Reish Lakish necessary
llm_translation: And if it was stated in this one, in this one Rabbi Yochanan said, but in that one why not say that Reish Lakish agrees with him; necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַקּוֹנֶה אִילָן וְקַרְקָעוֹ – מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין הַיּוֹבֵל נוֹהֵג.
human_translation: Come hear One who acquires a tree and its land brings and recites With what are we dealing here in time when the Jubilee is not practiced,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who acquires a tree along with its soil - he brings and reads! Here, what are we dealing with - when the Jubilee year is not in effect.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַקּוֹנֶה שְׁנֵי אִילָנוֹת בְּתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא. הָא שְׁלֹשָׁה – מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא! הָכָא נָמֵי בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין הַיּוֹבֵל נוֹהֵג.
human_translation: Come hear One who acquires two trees in another’s field brings but does not recite But three brings and recites Here too, in time when the Jubilee is not practiced.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who acquires two trees within his friend's field - he brings firstfruits and does not recite the declaration. But if there are three trees - he brings firstfruits and recites the declaration! Here we are dealing also with a case where the Jubilee year is not in practice.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּיּוֹבֵל שֵׁנִי, אֲבָל בְּיּוֹבֵל רִאשׁוֹן – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא, דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא סְמַךְ דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ; לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּיוֹבֵל רִאשׁוֹן, הָא בְּיוֹבֵל שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And now that Rav Ḥisda said: dispute during the second Jubilee, but during the first Jubilee, everyone agrees he brings and recites as they did not yet rely not difficult: This, during the first Jubilee. That, during the second Jubilee.
llm_translation: At this time when Rav Ḥisda said: Dispute regarding the second Jubilee, but regarding the first Jubilee – the words of everyone bring and read, for I did not rely on their opinion; it is not difficult: this is regarding the first Jubilee, this is regarding the second Jubilee.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: מִנַּיִן לַלּוֹקֵחַ שָׂדֶה מֵאָבִיו, וְהִקְדִּישָׁהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת אָבִיו – מִנַּיִין שֶׁתְּהֵא לְפָנָיו כִּשְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה?
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . From where that one who purchases a field from his father and consecrated it, and afterward his father died, from where that it should be before him like an ancestral field,
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: From where do we derive that one who acquires a field from his father, consecrates it, and then his father dies - from where do we derive that it should be before him like an inherited field?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם אֶת שְׂדֵה מִקְנָתוֹ אֲשֶׁר לֹא מִשְּׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּתוֹ״ – שָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לִהְיוֹת שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה, יָצְתָה זוֹ שֶׁרְאוּיָה לִהְיוֹת שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: The verse states: if a field which he has bought, which is not of the field of his ancestral field” a field that is not fit to be an ancestral field, This is excluded, as it is fit to be an ancestral field, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "If he acquires a field that is not from his ancestral field" - a field that is not fitting to be an ancestral field, this is one that is fitting to be an ancestral field, the words of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לַלּוֹקֵחַ שָׂדֶה מֵאָבִיו וּמֵת אָבִיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְדִּישָׁהּ, מִנַּיִין שֶׁתְּהֵא לְפָנָיו כִּשְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם אֶת שְׂדֵה מִקְנָתוֹ אֲשֶׁר לֹא מִשְּׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּתוֹ״ – שָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה, יָצְתָה זוֹ שֶׁהִיא שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה. וְאִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מֵת אָבִיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְדִּישָׁהּ – לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: From where that one who purchases a field from his father and his father died, and afterward he consecrated it, from where that it should be before him like an ancestral field, The verse states: if a field which he has bought, which is not of the field of his ancestral field.” a field that is not an ancestral field, This is excluded, as it is an ancestral field, while according to Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, a verse is not required his father died, and he consecrated it afterward,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: From where do we derive that if one buys a field from his father, and his father dies, and only afterwards he consecrates it, how do we know that it should be considered before him like an ancestral field? The verse teaches us: "If he acquired the field which is not from his ancestral field" - a field that is not his ancestral field, this one has emerged as his ancestral field. But according to Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, if his father dies and only afterwards he consecrates it, a verse is not necessary.

hebrew_text: מַאי, לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי? דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי, וּבְהָא – בְּמִיתַת אָבִיו הוּא דְּלָא יָרֵית וְלָא מִידֵּי, וְהִלְכָּךְ מֵת אָבִיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְדִּישָׁהּ – צְרִיךְ קְרָא;
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree about this, as Rabbi Meir holds: acquisition of its produce is considered like acquisition of the item itself, and in this it is that he inherits nothing when his father dies, and therefore, his father died and he consecrated it afterward, a verse is necessary
llm_translation: What, is he not arguing about this? For Rabbi Meir holds: The acquisition of fruits is like the acquisition of the body itself, and in this case – it is in the death of his father that he did not inherit, and not immediately, and therefore, his father died and afterwards he consecrated her – a verse is needed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבְרִי: קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת לָאו כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי, וּבְהָא – בְּמִיתַת אָבִיו הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּקָא יָרֵית, וְהִלְכָּךְ מֵת אָבִיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקְדִּישָׁהּ – לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא; וְכִי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא – לְהִקְדִּישָׁהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת אָבִיו הוּא דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon hold acquisition of its produce is not considered like acquisition of the item itself, and in this with the death of his father he now inherits and therefore his father died and he consecrated afterward, a verse is not necessary And when a verse was necessary, for he consecrated and his father died afterward that it was necessary.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon hold: The acquisition of produce is not like the acquisition of the body, and in this case - at the time of his father's death he was throwing the produce, and therefore if his father died and afterwards he consecrated it - a verse is not necessary; and if a verse is necessary - it is for consecrating it and afterwards his father died, that is when a verse is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ, בְּעָלְמָא קָסָבְרִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי. וְהָכָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן קְרָא אַשְׁכַּחוּ וּדְרוּשׁ – לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״אִם אֶת שְׂדֵה מִקְנָתוֹ אֲשֶׁר לֹא אֲחוּזָּתוֹ״; מַאי ״מִשְּׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּתוֹ״? שָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לִהְיוֹת שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה – יָצְתָה זוֹ, שֶׁרְאוּיָה לִהְיוֹת שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Actually, I say to you in general Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon hold acquisition of its produce is considered like acquisition of the item itself, And here, Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon found verse and expounded let the Merciful One write if a field which he has bought, which is not his ancestral field. What “Of his ancestral field” A field that is not fit to be an ancestral field, This is excluded, as it is fit to be an ancestral field,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Always say to yourself, in the world, Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon hold that the acquisition of produce is like the acquisition of the body. And here, Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon found a verse and interpreted it - to write that the Merciful One said, "If he acquires a field that is not his possession." What is "from a field that is his possession"? A field that is not fit to be a possession field - this one has gone out, which is fit to be a possession field.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי לָאו דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי, לֹא מָצָא יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ – לָקוֹחוֹת הֵן, וּמַחְזִירִין זֶה לָזֶה בְּיוֹבֵל;
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: If not that Rabbi Yoḥanan said acquisition of its produce is considered like acquisition of the item itself, he would not find his hands or his feet in the study hall, As Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Brothers who divided are purchasers and they must return to each other in the Jubilee
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: If not for what Rabbi Yochanan said, the acquisition of fruits would be like the acquisition of the body, he did not find his hands and feet in the study hall.
