For Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Brothers who divided - they are like buyers, and they return to each other in the Jubilee.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לָאו כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי, לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ דְּמַיְיתֵי בִּיכּוּרִים אֶלָּא חַד בַּר חַד עַד יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind is not like acquisition of the item itself, you will find that brings first fruits only an only the son of an only to Joshua, son of Nun.
llm_translation: And if it should enter your mind that it is not like the acquisition of the body, you should not forget that it is similar to the examination of the kidneys, but one by one, until Joshua the son of Nun!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: קְרָא וּמַתְנִיתָא מְסַיְּיעִי לֵיהּ לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. קְרָא –
human_translation: Rava said: A verse and a baraita support Reish Lakish. A verse,
llm_translation: Rava said: A verse and a Mishnah support Reish Lakish. The verse -

hebrew_text: ״בְּמִסְפַּר שְׁנֵי תְבוּאוֹת יִמְכׇּר לָךְ״.
human_translation: “According to the number of years of the crops he shall sell to you”
llm_translation: "In the count of two produce he shall sell to you."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתָא – דְּתַנְיָא: בְּכוֹר נוֹטֵל פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּשָׂדֶה הַחוֹזֶרֶת לְאָבִיו בְּיוֹבֵל.
human_translation: A baraita as it is taught: A firstborn son takes a double in a field that returns to his father in the Jubilee
llm_translation: Mishnah - as it was taught: The firstborn takes double in the field that returns to his father in the Jubilee.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, נָקְטִינַן: בַּעַל בְּנִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ צָרִיךְ הַרְשָׁאָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition a husband requires authorization with regard to his wife’s property,
llm_translation: Abbaye said, we have learned: A husband regarding the property of his wife requires permission.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא נָחֵית אַפֵּירֵי, אֲבָל נָחֵית אַפֵּירֵי, מִיגּוֹ דְּמִשְׁתַּעֵי דִּינָא אַפֵּירֵי – מִשְׁתַּעֵי דִּינָא אַגּוּפָא.
human_translation: And we said only when did not go down concerning the produce, But he went down concerning the produce, since speaks about the law concerning the produce, he speaks about the law concerning the itself,
llm_translation: And we did not say except that he did not reach the Afirei, but if he reached the Afirei, since the law is confused, the Afirei is confused.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ
llm_translation: The sender will return to you.

hebrew_text: הַנִּיזָּקִין שָׁמִין לָהֶן בְּעִידִּית, וּבַעַל חוֹב בְּבֵינוֹנִית, וּכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה בְּזִיבּוּרִית. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה בְּבֵינוֹנִית.
human_translation: appraises land of superior quality [ iddit ] for payment to injured And a creditor from intermediate-quality land. And a woman’s marriage contract from inferior-quality land. Rabbi Meir says: marriage contract also from intermediate-quality land.
llm_translation: The damaged ones assess for themselves in the presence of witnesses, and the debtor in a medium court, and a woman's document in a clear script. Rabbi Meir says: Even a woman's document in a medium court.

hebrew_text: אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ נְכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵן זִיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: is not collected from liened property when has unsold property, even inferior-quality land.
llm_translation: We are not collected from slaves in a place where there are free assets, even if they are Zibburit.

hebrew_text: אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: can be collected from the property of the orphans only from inferior-quality land.
llm_translation: We are not exacted from the property of orphans except from the movable property.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין לַאֲכִילַת פֵּירוֹת, וְלִשְׁבַח קַרְקָעוֹת,
human_translation: does not appropriate for the consumption of produce or for the enhanced value of land.
llm_translation: One does not bring out for the eating of fruits, and for the praise of the soil,

hebrew_text: וְלִמְזוֹן הָאִשָּׁה וְהַבָּנוֹת – מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִין, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And for the sustenance of wife and daughters from liened property. for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: "And for the sustenance of the woman and the daughters - from the assets of the slaves, due to the betterment of the world."

hebrew_text: וְהַמּוֹצֵא מְצִיאָה – לֹא יִשָּׁבַע, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And one who finds a lost item not take an oath for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: "And one who finds a lost object - shall not swear, because of the repair of the world."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם?! דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ וּמֵיטַב כַּרְמוֹ יְשַׁלֵּם״!
human_translation: for the betterment of the world? is by Torah law, as it is written “Of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he pay”
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it permissible to destroy due to the improvement of the world?! It is derived from the Torah, as it is written: "From the best of his field and the best of his vineyard he shall pay."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא צְרִיכָא אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בִּדְנִיזָּק שָׁיְימִינַן; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם שָׁיְימִינַן בִּדְמַזִּיק.
human_translation: Abaye said: is necessary only according to Rabbi Yishmael, said by Torah law we appraise of the injured teaches us for the betterment of the world we appraise of the one who caused the damage.
llm_translation: Abaye said: We only need this statement for Rabbi Yishmael, for he said that from the Torah, in a case of damage, we evaluate the damage; he informs us that we do so due to the improvement of the world, we evaluate the damage in a case of damage.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? דְּתַנְיָא: ״מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ וּמֵיטַב כַּרְמוֹ יְשַׁלֵּם״ – מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ שֶׁל נִיזָּק, וּמֵיטַב כַּרְמוֹ שֶׁל נִיזָּק, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַגְבּוֹת לַנִּיזָּקִין מִן הָעִידִּית, וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: What Rabbi Yishmael as it is taught “Of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he pay,” the best quality of the field of the injured and the best quality of the vineyard of the injured the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: The verse comes only to injured to collect from superior-quality land And an a fortiori Temple
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Yishmael? For it was taught: "From the best of his field and from the best of his vineyard he shall pay" - "From the best of his field" refers to the damage caused, and "from the best of his vineyard" refers to the damage caused, these are the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: The Scripture only came to include the damaged ones from the uncultivated field, and it is a fortiori to include consecrated property.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָכַל שְׁמֵנָה – מְשַׁלֵּם שְׁמֵנָה; אָכַל כְּחוּשָׁה – מְשַׁלֵּם שְׁמֵנָה?! אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכְלָה עֲרוּגָה בֵּין הָעֲרוּגוֹת, וְלָא יָדְעִינַן אִי כְּחוּשָׁה אָכַל אִי שְׁמֵנָה אָכַל, דִּמְשַׁלֵּם לֵיהּ מִמֵּיטַב.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yishmael, ate a rich must pay a rich ate a poor pays a rich Rav Idi bar Avin said: With what are we dealing here? where ate garden bed among garden beds, and we do not know whether it ate a poor or it ate a rich pays the best quality
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yishmael, if he ate fat - he pays fat; if he ate lean - he pays fat?! Rav Idi bar Avin said: What are we dealing with here - for example, if he ate a mixture among mixtures, and we do not know whether he ate lean or fat, he must pay him the best.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִילּוּ יָדְעִינַן דִּכְחוּשָׁה אָכַל – מְשַׁלֵּם כְּחוּשָׁה; הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן – מְשַׁלֵּם שְׁמֵנָה?! הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵרוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב:
human_translation: Rava said: If we would know that ate a poor pay a poor Now that we do not know he pay a rich the burden of proof falls on the claimant. Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said:
llm_translation: Rava said: If we know that he ate the damage - he pays for the damage; now that we do not know - he pays double?! The burden of proof rests upon the one who seeks to extract payment from his fellow! Rather, Rav Acha bar Yaakov said:

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה עִידִּית דְּנִיזָּק כְּזִיבּוּרִית דְּמַזִּיק; רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: בִּדְנִיזָּק שָׁיְימִינַן, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: בִּדְמַזִּיק שָׁיְימִינַן.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where, the superior-quality land the injured was equal to the inferior-quality land the one who caused the damage, Rabbi Yishmael holds: We appraise of the injured And Rabbi Akiva holds: We appraise of the one who caused the damage
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For example, when the witness was like a glass vessel that breaks; Rabbi Yishmael holds: we are concerned with the breaking, and Rabbi Akiva holds: we are concerned with the damage.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? נֶאֶמְרָה ״שָׂדֶה״ לְמַטָּה, וְנֶאֶמְרָה ״שָׂדֶה״ לְמַעְלָה; מָה שָׂדֶה הָאֲמוּרָה לְמַעְלָה – דְּנִיזָּק, אַף שָׂדֶה הָאֲמוּרָה לְמַטָּה – דְּנִיזָּק.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? “field” is stated below, And “field” is stated above, Just as field which is stated above the injured so too, the field stated below the injured
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yishmael's opinion? It is stated "field" below, and it is stated "field" above; just as the field mentioned above is damaged, so too the field mentioned below is damaged.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ יְשַׁלֵּם״ – דְּהַאיְךְ דְּקָא מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva holds: “Of the best of his own field shall he pay,” of who is paying,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: "From the best of his field he shall pay" - for he is paying.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אַהֲנַי גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה וְאַהֲנִי קְרָא; אַהֲנַי גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה – לִכְדַאֲמַרַן. אַהֲנִי קְרָא – דְּאִי אִית לֵיהּ לְמַזִּיק עִידִּית וְזִיבּוּרִית, וְזִיבּוּרִית דִּידֵיהּ לָא שָׁוְיָא כְּעִידִּית דְּנִיזָּק – דִּמְשַׁלֵּם לֵיהּ מִמֵּיטַב.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael verbal analogy is effective, and the verse is effective. The verbal analogy is effective, as we said. the verse is effective, that if the one who caused the damage has superior-quality land and inferior-quality land, and his inferior-quality land is not as good as the superior-quality land the injured the one who caused the damage pays from best
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said: This decree is similar and this verse is similar; this decree is similar - as we said. This verse is similar - for if it has both a monetary and physical damage, and his physical damage is not similar to his monetary damage - he compensates him from the best.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַגְבּוֹת לַנִּיזָּקִין מִן הָעִידִּית, וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The verse comes only to injured to collect from superior-quality land And an a fortiori Temple
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The Scripture came only to include the injured party from the monetary penalty, and a fortiori to sanctify.

hebrew_text: מַאי קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ? אִילֵימָא דְּנַגְחֵיהּ תּוֹרָא דִידַן לְתוֹרָא דְהֶקְדֵּשׁ, ״שׁוֹר רֵעֵהוּ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא – וְלֹא שׁוֹר שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ!
human_translation: What a fortiori to consecrated If we say our ox, gored an ox that is consecrated the Merciful One states: another’s ox” but not an ox that is consecrated
llm_translation: What is the logical argument for sanctifying it? If you say that our Torah pushes away the Torah of sanctification, "his neighbor's ox" the Merciful One said - and not the ox of sanctification!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי מָנֶה לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת״, דְּאָתֵי גִּזְבָּר וְשָׁקֵיל מֵעִידִּית.
human_translation: Rather, to one who says: It is upon me one hundred dinars for Temple maintenance, treasurer comes and collects from superior-quality land.
llm_translation: Rather, one should say, "Behold, upon me is a maneh for inspecting the house," for then the tax collector will come and take from the witness.

hebrew_text: לֹא יְהֵא אֶלָּא בַּעַל חוֹב, וּבַעַל חוֹב דִּינוֹ בְּבֵינוֹנִית! וְכִי תֵּימָא: קָסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בַּעַל חוֹב שָׁקֵיל בְּעִידִּית כְּנִיזָּקִין, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁכֵּן יִפָּה כֹּחוֹ בְּנִיזָּקִין, תֹּאמַר בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁכֵּן הוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ בְּנִיזָּקִין!
human_translation: should not creditor, and, halakha of a creditor is from intermediate-quality land. And if you would say Rabbi Akiva holds a creditor collect from superior-quality land like payment for damages, can be refuted If creditor because enhanced his power with regard to payment for damages, can you say Temple weakened its power with regard to payment for damages,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Let there only be a creditor, and the creditor's judgment is in equity! And if you will say: Rabbi Akiva holds that a creditor takes collateral like damages, there is room to refute: What about a creditor, whose strength is indeed greater in damages, you would say in regard to consecrated property, that his strength is greater in damages!"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּנַגְחֵיהּ תּוֹרָא דִידַן לְתוֹרָא דְהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא – דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹר שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁנָּגַח לְשׁוֹר שֶׁל הֶדְיוֹט – פָּטוּר, וְשֶׁל הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁנָּגַח לְשׁוֹר שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – בֵּין תָּם וּבֵין מוּעָד, מְשַׁלֵּם נֶזֶק שָׁלֵם.
human_translation: Actually, where our ox gored an ox that is consecrated and Rabbi Akiva holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: an ox that is consecrated gored an ox belonging to a common person, exempt belonging to a common person gored an ox that is consecrated whether an innocuous tam ], or a forewarned muad ], pays full damage.
llm_translation: Forever, the ox of our Torah should push against the ox of the Sanctuary, and Rabbi Akiva holds like Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya - as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: If the ox of the Sanctuary gores the ox of a commoner - it is exempt, and if the ox of a commoner gores the ox of the Sanctuary - whether it is tam (unblemished) or mu'ad (habitual), it pays full damages.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מִמַּאי דִּבְעִידִּית דְּנִיזָּק כְּזִיבּוּרִית דְּמַזִּיק פְּלִיגִי? דִּלְמָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בִּדְנִיזָּק שָׁיְימִינַן, וְהָכָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא וְרַבָּנַן קָמִיפַּלְגִי –
human_translation: If so, from where disagree about the superior-quality land the injured is equal to the inferior-quality land the one who caused the damage, Perhaps everyone, agrees we appraise of the injured and here they disagree with regard to dispute between Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: If so, from what does it emerge that in the case of a nidit that is damaged like a ziborit that causes harm they disagree? Perhaps in all other cases we would agree that we evaluate based on the damage, but here they disagree in the dispute between Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא, וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: As Rabbi Akiva holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya, And Rabbi Yishmael holds in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds like Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya, and Rabbi Yishmael holds like the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מַאי ״לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב״? וְעוֹד, מַאי ״קַל וָחוֹמֶר לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ״? וְעוֹד, הָא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי,
human_translation: If it is so what The verse comes only And furthermore, what And an a fortiori consecrated And furthermore, didn’t Rav Ashi say:
llm_translation: "If so, what is 'the verse did not come'?" And furthermore, what is 'a fortiori for sanctification'? And furthermore, Rav Ashe said,

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא בְּהֶדְיָא: ״מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ וּמֵיטַב כַּרְמוֹ יְשַׁלֵּם״ – מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ שֶׁל נִיזָּק, וּמֵיטַב כַּרְמוֹ שֶׁל נִיזָּק, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ שֶׁל מַזִּיק, וּמֵיטַב כַּרְמוֹ שֶׁל מַזִּיק.
human_translation: taught explicitly “Of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he pay” the best of the fields of the injured and the best of the vineyards of the injured the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: the best of the fields of the one who caused the damage, and the best of the vineyards of the one who caused the damage.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "From the best of his field and the best of his vineyard he shall pay" - "the best of his field" refers to the field of the injured party, and "the best of his vineyard" refers to the vineyard of the injured party, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: "the best of his field" refers to the field of the one causing damage, and "the best of his vineyard" refers to the vineyard of the one causing damage.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בִּדְמַזִּיק שָׁיְימִינַן; וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא – דְּדָרֵישׁ טַעְמָא דִּקְרָא, וּמָה טַעַם קָאָמַר – מָה טַעַם הַנִּיזָּקִין שָׁמִין לָהֶן בְּעִידִּית? מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, the mishna is Rabbi Akiva, who said: By Torah law, we appraise of the one who caused the damage. And it is Rabbi Shimon, who expounds the reason the verse And is saying: What is the reason What is the reason appraises land of superior quality for payment to injured for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always the Mishnah is according to Rabbi Akiva, as he said from the Torah in the case of one who damages we assess; and it is according to Rabbi Shimon, as he expounds the reason of the verse, and what is the reason he says - what is the reason that the injured parties are heard in court? Because of the mending of the world.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ הַנִּיזָּקִין שָׁמִין לָהֶן בְּעִידִּית? מִפְּנֵי הַגַּזְלָנִים וּמִפְּנֵי הַחַמְסָנִין, כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאמַר אָדָם: לָמָה אֲנִי גּוֹזֵל וְלָמָה אֲנִי חוֹמֵס? לְמָחָר בֵּית דִּין יוֹרְדִין לִנְכָסַי וְנוֹטְלִין שָׂדֶה נָאָה שֶׁלִּי, וְסוֹמְכִים עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״מֵיטַב שָׂדֵהוּ וּמֵיטַב כַּרְמוֹ יְשַׁלֵּם״; לְפִיכָךְ אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיזָּקִין – שָׁמִין לָהֶן בְּעִידִּית.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Shimon said: For what did say appraises land of superior quality for payment to injured due to the robbers and due to those who take by force [ ḥamsanin ]. So that a person will say: Why should I rob and why should I take by force? Tomorrow the court will come down to my property and take my finest field And rely on what is written in the Torah: “Of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he pay” Consequently, they said appraises land of superior quality for payment to injured
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Shimon said: Why did the injured parties listen to their case in the courtyard? Because of the robbers and because of the violent ones, so that a person will say: Why should I steal and why should I commit violence? The next day, the court descends to the estates and takes a beautiful field of mine, relying on what is written in the Torah: "He shall pay the best of his field and the best of his vineyard." Therefore, they said: The injured parties - they listen to their case in the courtyard.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ בַּעַל חוֹב בְּבֵינוֹנִית? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִרְאֶה אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ שָׂדֶה נָאָה וְדִירָה נָאָה, וְיֹאמַר: אֶקְפּוֹץ וְאַלְוֶנּוּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁאֶגְבֶּנּוּ בְּחוֹבִי; לְפִיכָךְ אָמְרוּ: בַּעַל חוֹב בְּבֵינוֹנִית.
human_translation: For what did say that a creditor from intermediate-quality land? so that a person should not see another’s fine field or fine house and say: I will jump and lend so that I will collect for my debt, Therefore, said a creditor from intermediate-quality land,
llm_translation: Because of what did the Baal Chov in Beinonit say? In order that a person should not see his fellow's field as beautiful and his dwelling as beautiful, and say: "I will jump over and acquire it," in order that he should collect it as a debt; therefore they said: Baal Chov in Beinonit.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, יְהֵא בְּזִיבּוּרִית! אִם כֵּן – אַתָּה נוֹעֵל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לוֹוִין.
human_translation: If it is so should be from inferior-quality land. If so, you would be locking the door before borrowers,
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, let it be in Zibburit! If so, you are locking the door in front of the wolves.

hebrew_text: כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה – בְּזִיבּוּרִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בְּבֵינוֹנִית. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה בְּזִיבּוּרִית? שֶׁיּוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁהָאִישׁ רוֹצֶה לִישָּׂא, הָאִשָּׁה רוֹצָה לִינָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: a woman’s marriage contract from inferior-quality land; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: from intermediate-quality land. Rabbi Shimon said: For what did say that a woman’s marriage contract from inferior-quality land? because more than a man wants to marry a woman wants to become married
llm_translation: The text reads: "The writing of a woman - in Zibburit, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: in Beinonit. Rabbi Shimon said: Why did they say the writing of a woman in Zibburit? Because more than what the man wants to marry, the woman wants to be married."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: אִשָּׁה יוֹצְאָה לִרְצוֹנָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא לִרְצוֹנָהּ, וְהָאִישׁ אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיאָהּ אֶלָּא לִרְצוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Alternatively, a woman is sent out with her consent or without her consent, but a man sends out only with his consent.
llm_translation: Another matter: A woman goes out at her will, and not at her will, and the man only takes her out according to his will.

hebrew_text: מַאי דָּבָר אַחֵר? וְכִי תֵּימָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּכִי מַפֵּיק לַהּ אִיהוּ – תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן כְּתוּבָּה מִינֵּיהּ; כִּי נָפְקָא אִיהִי נָמֵי – לִיתַקְּנִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן כְּתוּבָּה מִינַּהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: אִשָּׁה יוֹצְאָה לִרְצוֹנָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא לִרְצוֹנָהּ, וְהָאִישׁ אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא אֶלָּא לִרְצוֹנוֹ – אֶפְשָׁר דִּמְשַׁהֵי לַהּ בְּגִיטָּא.
human_translation: What an alternative And if you would say just as when divorces the Sages instituted a marriage contract for her from him, when she leaves him they should similarly institute a marriage contract for him from her; come hear: A woman is sent out with her consent or without her consent, but a man sends out only with his consent. possible to keep her waiting for a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: What is the other matter? And if you say, how can he divorce her? - The Rabbis established for her a written document; when she goes out, let the Rabbis establish for her a written document? Come and hear: A woman can go out willingly or unwillingly, but a man can only divorce willingly - it is possible that he can divorce her with a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה בְּזִיבּוּרִית. אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא מִיַּתְמֵי, אֲבָל מִינֵּיהּ דִּידֵיהּ – בְּבֵינוֹנִית.
human_translation: a woman’s marriage contract from inferior-quality land. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said: We said only from orphans But from himself, from intermediate-quality land.
llm_translation: Written a woman in Zibburit. Said Mar Zutra son of Rav Nachman: We only said from Yatmei, but his types - in Beinonit.

hebrew_text: מִיַּתְמֵי?! מַאי אִירְיָא כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה? אֲפִילּוּ כֹּל מִילֵּי נָמֵי, דְּהָא תְּנַן: אֵין נִפְרָעִים מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית! אֶלָּא לָאו מִינֵּיהּ?
human_translation: from orphans, why specifically a woman’s marriage contract? Even all matters, also as didn’t we learn can be collected from the property of the orphans only from inferior-quality land. Rather, is it not from himself?
llm_translation: Who is the author of this statement?! What is meant by the term "a woman"? Even all similar matters, for we learned: They are not exacted from the property of orphans except from the storehouse! But is it not from his own?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם מִיַּתְמֵי, וּכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ – סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא, אַקִּילוּ רַבָּנַן גַּבַּהּ; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Actually, from orphans And it was necessary for a woman’s marriage contract. it could enter your mind to say the Sages were lenient with her for the sake of desirability, teaches us
llm_translation: Always from the south, and a written document is necessary for a woman - I say: Because of grace, the Rabbis were lenient; they heard for us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה – בְּבֵינוֹנִית. מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא מִיַּתְמֵי, לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הָא דִּתְנַן: אֵין נִפְרָעִים מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית?! אֶלָּא לָאו מִינֵּיהּ? מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי בְּזִיבּוּרִית!
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear Rabbi Meir says: a woman’s marriage contract from intermediate-quality land. From whom If we say from orphans, Does Rabbi Meir not agree with that which we learned can be collected from the property of the orphans only from inferior-quality land? Rather, is it not from himself? by inference that the Rabbis hold from inferior-quality land,
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear, Rabbi Meir says: The marriage contract of a woman - in an intermediate state. From whom? If you say from Yatmei, Rabbi Meir does not hold like this that we learned: We do not collect from the property of orphans except from the Zibburit?! Rather, is it not from his own opinion? From the general principle, the Rabbis hold in the Zibburit!

hebrew_text: לָא; לְעוֹלָם מִיַּתְמֵי, וְשָׁאנֵי כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה – מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא.
human_translation: No, actually from orphans And a woman’s marriage contract is different for the sake of desirability;
llm_translation: Not; always from the right, and the difference is written a woman - because of grace.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: הַנִּיזָּקִין שָׁמִין לָהֶן בְּעִידִּית, וּבַעַל חוֹב – בְּבֵינוֹנִית, וּכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה – בְּזִיבּוּרִית. מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא מִיַּתְמֵי, מַאי אִירְיָא כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה? אֲפִילּוּ כֹּל הָנֵי נָמֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו מִינֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear appraises land of superior quality for payment to injured And a creditor from intermediate-quality land. And a woman’s marriage contract from inferior-quality land. From whom If we say from orphans, why specifically a woman’s marriage contract? Even all of these, also Rather, is it not from himself,
llm_translation: Abaye said, come and hear: The damaged property is appraised in the open, and the debtor - in private, and a woman's document - in a public place. From whom? If you say from her husband, what is the meaning of a woman's document? Even all these cases are included! Rather, is it not from her?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה עָרֵב לְנִזְקֵי בְנוֹ, לְבַעַל חוֹב בְּנוֹ וְלִכְתוּבַּת כַּלָּתוֹ;
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: With what are we dealing here? where became a guarantor for his son’s damages, for his son’s creditor, and for his daughter-in-law’s marriage contract,
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when an erev was made for the benefit of his son, for the creditor of his son, and for the wife of his son.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי כִּי דִינֵיהּ, וְהַאי כִּי דִינֵיהּ; נִיזָּקִין וּבַעַל חוֹב, דְּמֵחַיִּים גָּבוּ, אִיהוּ נָמֵי כִּי מַגְבֵּי – כְּמֵחַיִּים מַגְבֵּי. כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה, דִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה גָּבְיָא, וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה מִמַּאן גָּבְיָא – מִיַּתְמֵי; אִיהוּ נָמֵי כִּי מַגְבֵּי – כִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה מַגְבֵּי.
human_translation: And this in accordance with its halakha and this in accordance with its halakha . an injured and a creditor collect while they are alive, when pays he too pays as though were alive. a woman’s marriage contract is after death, and after death from whom does she collect? From the orphans. when pays he too pays as though after death.
llm_translation: This one, when its laws, and this one, when its laws; the injured party and the debtor, since he is alive, he is like one who collects - like one who collects. The marriage contract, that after death it is collected, and after death from whom it is collected - it is uncertain; he is like one who collects - like one who collects after death.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּעָרֵב דִּכְתוּבָּה לֹא מִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד! בְּקַבְּלָן.
human_translation: But let him derive the guarantor does not become responsible with an unconditional guarantor,
llm_translation: And it shall go out to him the evening that it is written not will be accepted! In their acceptance.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: קַבְּלָן, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵית לֵיהּ נִכְסֵי לְלֹוֶה – מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד, שַׁפִּיר; אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִי אִית לֵיהּ – מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד, אִי לֵית לֵיהּ – לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says an unconditional guarantor becomes responsible even if the borrower does not have property well But according to the one who says if has becomes responsible, if does not have does not become responsible, what is there to say
llm_translation: The one who says: "Accept them," even though he does not have property to lend - it is effective; but the one who says: "If he has property - it is effective, if he does not have property - it is not effective," what can be said?

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּדַהֲווֹ לֵיהּ וְאִישְׁתְּדוּף.
human_translation: If you wish, say where had but it was blighted.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Let him be swallowed up and disappear.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כֹּל לְגַבֵּי בְּרֵיהּ, שַׁעְבּוֹדֵי מְשַׁעְבַּד נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish say: anything relating to his son, pledge himself
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "Everything in comparison to its creator, the works of the servant are subservient to himself."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: עָרֵב דִּכְתוּבָּה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד;
human_translation: was stated everyone agrees a guarantor a marriage contract does not become responsible
llm_translation: It was stated: "The evening of the written law - the words of everyone are not binding."

hebrew_text: קַבְּלָן דְּבַעַל חוֹב – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד; עָרֵב דְּבַעַל חוֹב, וְקַבְּלָן דִּכְתוּבָּה – פְּלִיגִי; אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵית לֵיהּ נִכְסֵי לְלֹוֶה – מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד, וְאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִי אִית לֵיהּ – מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד, אִי לֵית לֵיהּ – לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד.
human_translation: Everyone agrees that an unconditional guarantor for a creditor becomes responsible disagree A guarantor for a creditor and an unconditional guarantor for a marriage contract. There is one who says: Although the borrower does not have property becomes responsible And there is one who says: If has becomes responsible; if he does not have he does not become responsible.
llm_translation: Received from Baal Hov - the words of everyone are effective; if Baal Hov mixed, and received as written - they disagree; there is for one who says: even though he does not have property to lend - it is effective, and there is for one who says: if he has - it is effective, if he does not have - it is not effective.

hebrew_text: וְהִילְכְתָא: בְּכוּלְּהוּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵית לֵיהּ – מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד; בַּר מֵעָרֵב דִּכְתוּבָּה, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית לֵיהּ – לָא מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד.
human_translation: And the halakha In all of although does not have becomes responsible except in guarantor for a marriage contract, as even if has does not become responsible
llm_translation: The Gemara: In all cases, even though it is not available - it is utilized; with the exception of the evening meal which is written, even though it is available - it is not utilized.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? מִצְוָה הוּא דַּעֲבַד, וְלָא מִידֵּי חַסְּרַהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason is performing a mitzva And does not lose
llm_translation: What is the reason? It is a commandment that he performed, and not from something lacking.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: תָּא שְׁמַע מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּתַקַּנְתִּין – יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁהָאִישׁ רוֹצֶה לִישָּׂא, אִשָּׁה רוֹצָה לִינָּשֵׂא. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִיַּתְמֵי, הַאי מִשּׁוּם דְּיַתְמֵי הוּא! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּמָר זוּטְרָא תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Ravina said: Come hear from the beginning of our ordinance: more than a man wants to marry a woman wants to become married And if it enters your mind from orphans, this because they are orphans, The refutation of Mar Zutra is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Come and hear from the outset of our enactments - more than what a man wants to marry, a woman wants to be married. And if you think otherwise, this is because he wants to be married! The preference of Mar Zutra is the preference.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: שְׁטַר חוֹב הַיּוֹצֵא עַל הַיְּתוֹמִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ שֶׁבַח, אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said in the name of Rav Naḥman: a promissory note is presented to orphans although an enhancement is written in it, can collect only from inferior-quality land.
llm_translation: Master Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said in the name of Rav Nachman: A promissory note issued for orphans, even though it contains words of praise, is collected only from the verbal agreement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תִּדַּע – דְּבַעַל חוֹב דִּינֵיהּ בְּבֵינוֹנִית, וּמִיַּתְמֵי בְּזִיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: Abaye said: Know as halakha a creditor from intermediate-quality land, but from orphans from inferior-quality land.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Know that when it comes to a creditor, his laws are in moderation, but when it comes to a debtor, they are strict.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בַּעַל חוֹב דִּינֵיהּ מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בְּזִיבּוּרִית! כִּדְעוּלָּא – דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, בַּעַל חוֹב בְּזִיבּוּרִית, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּחוּץ תַּעֲמֹד וְהָאִישׁ וְגוֹ׳״ – מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ לְהוֹצִיא, פָּחוּת שֶׁבַּכֵּלִים; וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ בַּעַל חוֹב בְּבֵינוֹנִית? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּנְעוֹל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לֹוִין – וְגַבֵּי יַתְמֵי אוֹקְמוּהּ רַבָּנַן אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא;
human_translation: Rava said to him: How can be compared? By Torah law, halakha a creditor from inferior-quality land, in accordance with of Ulla, as Ulla says: By Torah law, a creditor from inferior-quality land, as it is stated: “You shall stand outside, and the man What would a man ordinarily take out The least of vessels. And for what reason did say a creditor from intermediate-quality land? So as not to lock the door before borrowers, And with regard to orphans, the Sages left as in the Torah.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Is this so?! The creditor, his legal rights are from the Torah in a clear manner! As it is taught – as Ula said: A matter of Torah, the creditor in a clear manner, as it is stated: "Outside you shall stand, and the man, etc." – just as it is the way of a man to bring out, the least of all utensils; and why did they say the creditor in an intermediate manner? In order that the door should not be locked in the face of the guests – and the Sages established it from the Torah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּדִינֵיהּ מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בְּעִידִּית, אֲפִילּוּ מִיַּתְמֵי נָמֵי בְּעִידִּית!
human_translation: But here, since by Torah law the halakha from superior-quality land he should also from superior-quality land even from orphans.
llm_translation: Rather here, since his judgment is based on the Torah with witnesses, even if he is from the greatest of the nations with witnesses!

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא, וְהָתָנֵי אַבְרָם חוֹזָאָה: אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵן נִיזָּקִין. וְהָא נִיזָּקִין – דִּינָן מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בְּעִידִּית!
human_translation: And according to Rava, Didn’t Avram Ḥoza’a teach can be collected from the property of the orphans only from inferior-quality land? And even injured But isn’t by Torah law halakha injured from superior-quality land?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Rava, and it was taught by Avram Hozaya: We do not exact payment from the property of orphans except from the Zibburit, even if they are damaged. And if they are damaged - their judgment is from the Torah with a witness!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה עִידִּית דְּנִיזָּק כְּזִיבּוּרִית דְּמַזִּיק;
human_translation: With what are we dealing here where superior-quality land of the injured is equal to inferior-quality land of the one who caused the damage,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For example, when a witness was like the sting of a hornet that causes harm.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בִּדְנִיזָּק שָׁיְימִינַן, וּמִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן בִּדְמַזִּיק – וְגַבֵּי יַתְמֵי אוֹקְמוּהּ רַבָּנַן אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael, who says: By Torah law we appraise of the injured And for the betterment of the world, the Sages instituted of the one who caused the damage, But with regard to orphans, the Sages left as in the Torah;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, that is, said: From the Torah, with regards to damages, we establish the right of the injured party, and due to the improvement of the world, the Rabbis established the law of damages - and regarding orphans, the Rabbis established the law in accordance with the Torah.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָיוֹתָאָה: אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵן עִידִּית. מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ הֵן עִידִּית״? לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתִיב עִידִּית בִּשְׁטָרָא?!
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Eliezer Nayota’a teach can be collected from the property of the orphans only from inferior-quality land, even if it is superior-quality land? What Even if it is superior-quality land? Is it not Although superior-quality land is written in the note,
llm_translation: I?! And it was taught by Rabbi Eliezer the Nazirite: We do not exact payment from the property of orphans except from the Zibburit, even if they are witnesses. What does "even if they are witnesses" mean? Is it not written "witnesses" in the document?!

hebrew_text: לָא; מַאי ״עִידִּית״ – שְׁפַאי עִידִּית, כִּדְרָבָא –
human_translation: No, what superior-quality land? strips of superior-quality land as of Rava.
llm_translation: Not; what is "Ididit" - Shefai Ididit, as Ravah -

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הִזִּיק זִיבּוּרִית – גּוֹבֶה מִן הָעִידִּית. שְׁפַאי עִידִּית, גּוֹבֶה מִן הַבֵּינוֹנִית. וְגַבֵּי יַתְמֵי אוֹקְמוּהּ רַבָּנַן אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: As Rava says: one damaged inferior-quality land, collects from superior-quality land. strips of superior-quality land collects from intermediate-quality land, With regard to orphans, the Sages left in the Torah,
llm_translation: Rava said: If the discharge is yellow - it is high from the vaginal canal. If it is white, it is high from the intermediate. And regarding the blood of a virgin, the Rabbis established it as a Biblical matter.

hebrew_text: אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין אֶלָּא מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית: בָּעֵי רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי: ״יְתוֹמִים״ שֶׁאָמְרוּ – קְטַנִּים, אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ גְּדוֹלִים? תַּקַּנְתָּא הִיא דַּעֲבוּד רַבָּנַן גַּבֵּי יַתְמֵי – לִקְטַנִּים עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן, לִגְדוֹלִים לָא עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן;
human_translation: can be collected from the property of the orphans only from inferior-quality land. Rav Aḥadevoi bar Ami raised a dilemma orphans of which they spoke minors or even adults? this an ordinance that the Sages instituted for orphans, the Sages instituted for minors they did not institute for adults?
llm_translation: We do not exact payment from the property of orphans except from the movable property. Rav Achadboi son of Ammi asked: "When they say 'orphans,' do they mean minors, or even adults?" It is a regulation of the Sages regarding the orphans - for minors, it is a regulation of the Sages, but for adults, it is not a regulation of the Sages.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מַסֵּיק אַדַּעְתָּא דְּמַלְוֶה דְּמִית לֹוֶה וְנָפְלִי נִכְסֵי קַמֵּי יַתְמֵי; דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ נוֹעֵל דֶּלֶת; הִלְכָּךְ אֲפִילּוּ גְּדוֹלִים נָמֵי?
human_translation: Or, perhaps since it does not enter the mind of the creditor the borrower die and property will fall to the orphans. As that this would lock the door Therefore, also adult
llm_translation: Or perhaps - because he does not pay attention to the mind of the lender, and the collateral falls before him; for he has a door bolt; therefore, even great people are considered negligent?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי אַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא: יְתוֹמִין שֶׁאָמְרוּ – גְּדוֹלִים, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר קְטַנִּים.
human_translation: Come hear what Abaye the Elder taught: the orphans of which spoke, adults, and needless to say minors.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Abaye teaches a tradition: Orphans, as it was said - "great," and needless to say "small."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן שְׁבוּעָה – דְּגָדוֹל בְּמִילֵּי דַּאֲבוּהּ כְּקָטָן דָּמֵי; אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן זִיבּוּרִית – לָא.
human_translation: But perhaps this statement applies only to the matter of an oath. because an adult is considered like a minor with regard to matters, But with regard to inferior-quality land, no,
llm_translation: And perhaps these matters regarding an oath - for in matters of monetary claims, the great is considered like the small; but in matters of impurity - no.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא:
human_translation: And the halakha
llm_translation: And the halakha:

hebrew_text: יְתוֹמִין שֶׁאָמְרוּ – גְּדוֹלִים, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר קְטַנִּים; בֵּין לִשְׁבוּעָה בֵּין לְזִיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: the orphans of which spoke, adults, and needless to say minors, whether with regard to an oath, whether with regard to inferior-quality land.
llm_translation: Orphans that they said - adults, and not need to say minors; whether for an oath or for a monetary claim.

hebrew_text: אֵין נִפְרָעִין מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. בָּעֵי רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי: בְּמַתָּנָה הֵיאַךְ?
human_translation: is not collected from liened property when has unsold property, even Rav Aḥadevoi bar Ami raised a dilemma: What with regard to a gift?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: We do not collect from encumbered properties in a place where there are free men. Rav Achadboi son of Ammi asked: How is it in the case of a gift? English translation:

hebrew_text: תַּקַּנְתָּא הוּא דַּעֲבוּד רַבָּנַן – מִשּׁוּם פְּסֵידָא דְלָקוֹחוֹת, אֲבָל מַתָּנָה, דְּלֵיכָּא פְּסֵידָא דְלָקוֹחוֹת – לָא; אוֹ דִלְמָא מַתָּנָה נָמֵי, אִי לָאו דְּאִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה מִינֵּיהּ – לָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מַתָּנָה, וְהִלְכָּךְ כִּי פְּסֵידָא דְלָקוֹחוֹת דָּמֵי?
human_translation: an ordinance that the Sages instituted due to the loss of the buyers, But a gift, where there is no loss to the buyers, not Or perhaps a gift as well, as, were it not for benefit from he would not have given the gift. And therefore is considered like the loss to buyers
llm_translation: It is a Takanata of the Rabbis - because of the loss of purchases, but a gift, where there is no loss of purchases - no; or perhaps even a gift, if there is no benefit from it - he did not give it as a gift, and therefore is it considered as a loss of purchases?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע, שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁאָמַר: ״תְּנוּ מָאתַיִם זוּז לִפְלוֹנִי, ושְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת לִפְלוֹנִי, וְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת לִפְלוֹנִי״ – אֵין אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם בִּשְׁטָר זָכָה; לְפִיכָךְ, יָצָא עָלָיו שְׁטַר חוֹב – גּוֹבֶה מִכּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: Come hear a person on his deathbed said: Give two hundred dinars to so-and-so, and three hundred to so-and-so, and four hundred to so-and-so, does not say whoever appears first in the deed acquires Therefore, a promissory note emerged against collects from all of them.
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Kashisha, son of Rav Chisda, to Rav Ashe: Come, hear. A creditor who said, "Give two hundred zuz to so-and-so, and three hundred to so-and-so, and four hundred to so-and-so" - we do not say: whoever is first in the document acquires. Therefore, if a creditor produces a promissory note against him, he collects from all of them.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם אָמַר: ״תְּנוּ מָאתַיִם זוּז לִפְלוֹנִי, וְאַחֲרָיו לִפְלוֹנִי, וְאַחֲרָיו לִפְלוֹנִי״ – אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם בִּשְׁטָר זָכָה. לְפִיכָךְ, יָצָא עָלָיו שְׁטַר חוֹב – גּוֹבֶה מִן הָאַחֲרוֹן. אֵין לוֹ – גּוֹבֶה מִשֶּׁלְּפָנָיו. אֵין לוֹ – גּוֹבֶה מִשֶּׁלִּפְנֵי פָנָיו.
human_translation: But said: Give two hundred dinars to so-and-so, and after him to so-and-so, and after him to so-and-so, says: Anyone who appears first in the deed acquires Therefore, a promissory note emerged against him, collects from the last he does not have he collects from the previous he does not have he collects from before the previous
llm_translation: But if he said, "Give two hundred zuz to so-and-so, and after him to so-and-so, and after him to so-and-so" - they say: whoever is first in the document acquires. Therefore, if a debt document was issued against him - he collects from the last one. If he does not have it - he collects from the one before him. If he does not have it - he collects from the one before the one before him.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקַמָּא בֵּינוֹנִית וּבָתְרָא זִיבּוּרִית – מִזִּיבּוּרִית גָּבֵי, מִבֵּינוֹנִית לָא גָּבֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, בְּמַתָּנָה נָמֵי עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: And even if to the first intermediate-quality land and the last inferior-quality land. collects from inferior-quality land, he does not collect from the intermediate-quality land Conclude from the Sages also instituted ordinance in a gift,
llm_translation: And even though the first one is Binonit and the latter one is Zibburit - from Zibburit it is considered, from Binonit it is not considered. Learn from it, in a gift the Rabbis established a remedy.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּבַעַל חוֹב. וְהָא ״תְּנוּ״ קָאָמַר! ״תְּנוּ״ בְּחוֹבִי.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with creditors. But didn’t say: Give Give for my debt.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - with a creditor. But isn't it stated "give"? It means "give" in terms of debts.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְזֵי שְׁטָרָא דְּמַאן קָדֵים! דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁטָרָא. וְהָא ״כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם בִּשְׁטָר״ קָאָמַר! בִּשְׁטָר פְּקַדְתָּא.
human_translation: But let us see whose note first, where there is no note, But didn’t it say Whoever appears first in the deed? the testamentary deed
llm_translation: And to Yehzei, the document of whom precedes! For there is no document. And this is what "Whoever precedes in a document" is saying! In the document you have entrusted.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ מַתָּנָה נָמֵי. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא – מַאי ״גּוֹבֶה מִן הָאַחֲרוֹן״? אֵין נִפְסָד אֶלָּא אַחֲרוֹן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: also a gift, and not difficult, what He collects from the last only the last loses,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Even a gift also. And it is not difficult - what is "the height from the last"? Only the last is not diminished.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּשָׁווּ כּוּלְּהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: where all are equal
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: that they all agreed to Hadadezer.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין לַאֲכִילַת פֵּירוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין כְּתוּבִין.
human_translation: does not appropriate for the consumption of produce. What is the reason Ulla says Reish Lakish says: because is not written
llm_translation: They do not bring out for the eating of fruits. What is the reason? Ulla said, Resh Lakish said: Because it is not written.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְעוּלָּא: וְהָא מְזוֹן הָאִשָּׁה וְהַבָּנוֹת, דִּכְמַאן דִּכְתִיבִי דָּמוּ, וְקָתָנֵי: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין!
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Ulla: But isn’t the sustenance of wife and daughters considered as if it were written, and teaches: cannot collected
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Abba to Ulai: And the sustenance of the woman and the daughters, as it is written "their blood," and it teaches: we do not extract!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, מֵעִיקָּרָא הָכִי אִתַּקּוּן – כְּתוּבִין הֵן אֵצֶל בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, וְאֵין כְּתוּבִין הֵן אֵצֶל מְשׁוּעְבָּדִין.
human_translation: said to him: There, instituted like this from the outset: It is written with regard to unsold but it is not written with regard to liened
llm_translation: He said to him: There, from the outset, thus it was established - they are written by free men, and they are not written by slaves.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין כְּתוּבִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַב אַסִּי: וְהָא מְזוֹן הָאִשָּׁה וְהַבָּנוֹת, דִּכְמַאן דִּכְתִיבִי דָּמוּ, וְקָתָנֵי: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵעִיקָּרָא הָכִי אִתַּקּוּן – כְּתוּבִין הֵן אֵצֶל בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, וְאֵין כְּתוּבִין הֵן אֵצֶל מְשׁוּעְבָּדִין.
human_translation: And similarly, Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says because is not written Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Asi: But isn’t the sustenance of wife and daughters considered as if it were written and teaches: cannot collected said to him: instituted like this from the outset: is written with regard to unsold but it is not written with regard to liened
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: Because they are not written. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Assi: But the sustenance of the woman and the daughters, from where do we know that their blood is like that of menstrual blood, and it teaches: They do not emit! He said to him: Originally, this is how it was established - they are written by free men, and they are not written by slaves.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין קְצוּבִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says because is not a fixed
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Because they are not fixed.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא – קְצוּבִין וּכְתוּבִין בָּעֵי,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to Rabbi Ḥanina, necessary a fixed and written?
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: To Rabbi Chanina - he requires cut and written documents.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִּלְמָא קְצוּבִין, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן כְּתוּבִים?
human_translation: Or perhaps, a fixed even if it is not written?
llm_translation: Or perhaps they are fixed, even though they are not written?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאִיתְּמַר: מִי שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ שְׁתֵּי בָּנוֹת וּבֵן, וְקָדְמָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְנָטְלָה עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיקָה שְׁנִיָּה לִגְבּוֹת עַד שֶׁמֵּת הַבֵּן.
human_translation: Come hear was stated, one who died and left two daughters and a son, and the first went ahead and took one-tenth of the estate but the second did not manage to collect before the son died.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for it was stated: If one died and left behind two daughters and a son, and the firstborn daughter preceded and took possession of the estate, and the second daughter did not have enough to collect until the son died.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנִיָּה וִיתְּרָה. וְאָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, גְּדוֹלָה מִזּוֹ אָמְרוּ: מוֹצִיאִין לְפַרְנָסָה וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין לִמְזוֹנוֹת; וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ שְׁנִיָּה וִיתְּרָה?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The second forfeited And Rabbi Ḥanina said to him: they say more than this, dowry can be appropriated but sustenance cannot be appropriated And you say second forfeited
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Sh'niya v'Yit'ra." And Rabbi Chanina said to him, "Greater than this they said: 'They provide for sustenance but do not provide for maintenance,' and you say 'Sh'niya v'Yit'ra'?!

hebrew_text: וְהָא פַּרְנָסָה – דְּמִיקָץ קַיְיצָא, מִיכְתָּב לָא כְּתִיבָא; וְקָא מוֹצִיאָה!
human_translation: But isn’t dowry a fixed it is not written? And it can be appropriated
llm_translation: And the Parnasah - since it is like a thorn, it is not written in the Scripture; and it brings forth!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי פַּרְנָסָה, כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לַהּ קָלָא, כְּמַאן דִּכְתִיבָא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: A dowry is different, since it publicity. is considered as if it were written.
llm_translation: The duties of a provider are different, since she has a voice, like one who is written about in the verse.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ: מֵתוּ – בְּנוֹתֵיהֶן נִזּוֹנוֹת מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין,
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ raised an objection died, their daughters, are sustained from unsold property
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Manoah raises an objection: "If they die - their daughters are sustained from the property of free men."

hebrew_text: וְהִיא נִזּוֹנֶת מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כְּבַעֲלַת חוֹב!
human_translation: But is sustained from liened property due to that her like a creditor,
llm_translation: And she is sustained from the property of slaves - because she is like a creditor!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where acquired from his possession,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - With what he acquired from his hand.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בָּנוֹת נָמֵי! בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ לָזוֹ, וְלֹא קָנוּ לָזוֹ.
human_translation: If that is so, daughters as well where acquired on behalf of this but did not acquire on behalf of
llm_translation: Thusly, the daughters of Na'ami! For they acquired for this one, and did not acquire for this one.

hebrew_text: מַאי פַּסְקָא? בַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ, דַּהֲוַאי בִּשְׁעַת קִנְיָן – מַהֲנֵי לַהּ קִנְיָן; בִּתּוֹ, דְּלָא הֲוַאי בִּשְׁעַת קִנְיָן – לָא מַהֲנֵי לָהּ קִנְיַן.
human_translation: What the decision his wife’s daughter who was at the time of the acquisition, the acquisition is effective for her. his daughter who was not at the time of the acquisition, the acquisition is not effective for her.
llm_translation: What is the ruling? His wife's daughter, who was present at the time of acquisition - the acquisition is effective for her; his daughter, who was not present at the time of acquisition - the acquisition is not effective for her.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דַּהֲווֹ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בִּשְׁעַת קִנְיָן – וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי, דְּגָרְשַׁהּ וְאַהְדְּרַהּ?!
human_translation: Are we not dealing where both of them were at the time of the acquisition? And what are the circumstances? where he divorced her and remarried her,
llm_translation: We are dealing with a case where they were both involved at the time of acquisition - and how is it comparable, that he divorced her and then remarried her?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בִּתּוֹ – דְּבִתְנַאי בֵּית דִּין קָאָכְלָה, לָא מַהֲנֵי לַהּ קִנְיַן; בַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ – דְּלָאו בִּתְנַאי בֵּית דִּין קָאָכְלָה, מַהֲנֵי לַהּ קִנְיָן.
human_translation: Rather, his daughter, who eats, based on a stipulation of the court, the acquisition is not effective for her, his wife’s daughter, not on a stipulation of the court, the acquisition is effective for her
llm_translation: Rather, with regard to his daughter - if the court of Beit Din ate, it does not acquire for her; with regard to his wife's daughter - if the court of Beit Din did not eat, it acquires for her.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מִיגְרָע גָּרְעָה?! אֶלָּא בִּתּוֹ – כֵּיוָן דְּבִתְנַאי בֵּית דִּין קָאָכְלָה, אֵימַר צְרָרֵי אַתְפְּסַהּ.
human_translation: But is inferior Rather, his daughter, since his daughter eats based on a stipulation of the court, say he gave her money
llm_translation: "And when did she diminish, she diminished?! Rather, his daughter - since Bitnai's court ate, it is said, 'You have ensnared the cords.'"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן: אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁקָּדַם מִקָּחוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי לְשִׁבְחוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן;
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Natan said: When when the purchase of the second preceded the enhancements by the first
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Nathan said: When? - At the time when the purchase of the second precedes the praise of the first.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל קָדַם שִׁבְחוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן לְמִקָּחוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים. אַלְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קָדֵים הוּא!
human_translation: But the enhancements by the first preceded the acquisition of the second he can collect from liened property Apparently, because did not precede
llm_translation: But the praise of the first precedes the purchase of the second - the height of acquired property. This implies that he is not preferred!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין לַאֲכִילַת פֵּירוֹת, וְלִשְׁבַח קַרְקָעוֹת, וְלִמְזוֹן אִשָּׁה וְהַבָּנוֹת – מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם; לְפִי שֶׁאֵין כְּתוּבִין.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught does not appropriate from liened property for the consumption of produce or for the enhanced value of land or for the sustenance of wife and daughters. for the betterment of the world, because are not written
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: One may not take out on Shabbat for the purpose of eating fruits, for praising the ground, or for providing food for a woman and her daughters - from assets that are obligated, for the sake of the world's order; because they are not written in the Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְכִי מָה תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם יֵשׁ בָּזוֹ? וַהֲלֹא אֵין קְצוּבִין!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: And what betterment of the world is there in this, But isn’t they are not a fixed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: "And what is the rectification of the world dependent upon? Are there not fixed times!"

hebrew_text: וְהַמּוֹצֵא מְצִיאָה לֹא יִשָּׁבַע. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: ״שְׁנֵי כִּיסִין קְשׁוּרִין מָצָאתָ לִי״; וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא מָצָאתִי אֶלָּא אֶחָד״ – נִשְׁבָּע. ״שְׁנֵי שְׁוָורִים קְשׁוּרִין מָצָאתָ לִי״; וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא הָיָה אֶלָּא אֶחָד״ – אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע.
human_translation: And one who finds a lost item not take an oath Rabbi Yitzḥak says: You found two pouches tied to me, and the other says: I found only one takes an oath, You found two oxen tied to me, and the other says: There was only one not take an oath.
llm_translation: The one who finds a lost object shall not swear. Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Two tied purses I found"; and the claimant says: "I found only one" - he swears. "Two tied oxen I found"; and the claimant says: "There was only one" - he does not swear.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? שְׁווֹרִין מִנַּתְחִי מֵהֲדָדֵי, כִּיסִין לָא מִנַּתְחִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason oxen become detached from each other. pouches do not become detached from each other.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Oxen from Hadadezer are equal, but goats are not from Hadadezer.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁנֵי שְׁווֹרִין קְשׁוּרִין מָצָאתָ״; וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״מָצָאתִי וְהֶחְזַרְתִּי לָךְ אֶחָד מֵהֶן״ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע.
human_translation: You found two tied oxen, and the other says: I found but I returned one of them to you, takes an oath.
llm_translation: "Two oxen tied together you found"; and the Halacha says: "I found and returned to you one of them" - this one is obligated to take an oath.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק – לֵית לֵיהּ ״הַמּוֹצֵא מְצִיאָה לָא יִשָּׁבַע – מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם״?!
human_translation: But does Rabbi Yitzḥak not accept one who finds a lost item is not take an oath, for the betterment of the world?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak - does not have it, "One who finds a lost object should not swear - due to the improvement of the world"?!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר, כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב – דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם נִשְׁבָּע עַל טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ. כֵּיצַד? ״מָנֶה לְאָבִיךְ בְּיָדִי, וְהֶאֱכַלְתִּיו פְּרָס״ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע. וְזֶה הוּא שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּע עַל טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: stated in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: times when a person takes an oath about his own claim. How so? One hundred dinars of your father’s was in my possession, And I paid him part [ peras ] he takes an oath And this is where takes an oath about his own claim.
llm_translation: He said, as Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said - as it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Sometimes a person swears on his own claim. How so? "I will feed your father with my hand, and I fed him half" - this is a sworn oath. And this is what he swore on his own claim.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה, וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: But the Rabbis say: is only as someone who is returning a lost item, and he is exempt
llm_translation: The sages say: It is only like returning a lost item, and he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב – לֵית לֵיהּ: ״מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה – פָּטוּר״?! אָמַר רַב: בְּטוֹעֲנוֹ קָטָן.
human_translation: But does Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov not maintain someone who returns a lost item is exempt Rav says: where minor claims from him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - does not have it: "One who returns a lost item - is exempt"?! Rav said: when he loads a minor.

hebrew_text: קָטָן, מִידֵּי מְשָׁשָׁא אִית בֵּיהּ?! וְהָתְנַן: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל טַעֲנַת חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן!
human_translation: a minor have any substance? But didn’t we learn One does not take an oath to the claim of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor,
llm_translation: Child, from where does he have discernment?! And we learned in a Mishnah: One does not take an oath regarding the claim of a deaf person, an imbecile, or a minor!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״קָטָן״ – גָּדוֹל; וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״קָטָן״? דִּלְגַבֵּי מִילֵּי דְאָבִיו, קָטָן הוּא.
human_translation: which minor an adult And why does call him a minor, as with regard to his father’s affairs he is a minor.
llm_translation: What is "small" - big; and why is it called "small"? Because compared to the words of his father, he is small.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ?! טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים הוּא! טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים, וְהוֹדָאַת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: If that is so, his own claim? It is the claim of others, the claim of others, his own admission
llm_translation: Thus, is it so, he accuses himself?! He accuses others! He accuses others, and admits his own guilt.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ טַעֲנָתָא נָמֵי, טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים וְהוֹדָאַת עַצְמוֹ נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא בִּדְרַבָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּאָמַר רַבָּה, מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: מוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה – יִשָּׁבַע? חֲזָקָה – אֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו בִּפְנֵי בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ;
human_translation: All claims are also the claim of others and own admission. Rather, disagree with regard to Rabba, as Rabba says: For what reason did the Torah say admits to part of the claim takes an oath presumption that a person would not be so brazen before his creditor
llm_translation: The entire claim is before us, the claim of others and his own admission! Rather, Rabba raised an objection - for Rabba said, why did the Torah say: "If someone partially admits to the claim - he shall swear? If it is a strong claim - no one dares to confront his creditor."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי, בְּכוּלֵּיהּ בָּעֵי לְמִכְפְּרֵיהּ לֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּלָא כַּפְרֵיהּ – מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו בִּפְנֵי בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ; וּבְכוּלֵּיהּ בָּעֵי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּלָא אוֹדִי לֵיהּ – אִישְׁתְּמוֹטֵי הוּא דְּקָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט לֵיהּ – סָבַר: עַד דְּהָווּ לִי זוּזֵי וּפָרַעְנָא לֵיהּ; וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: רְמִי שְׁבוּעָה עִילָּוֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ בְּכוּלֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And this want to deny all of it, and he does not deny it is because a person would not be so brazen before his creditor. And want to admit all to him. And that he did not admit to him he was evading he thinks: until I have money, and I will repay him the Merciful One states: Impose an oath on in order to admit all to
llm_translation: This one, in all of it, requires atonement for him, and this one, that does not require atonement - because a person does not brazenly confront his creditor; and this one, in all of it, requires to be appeased, and this one, that does not require to be appeased - it is a matter of appeasement, for he is appeasing him - he thought: until I have money and can pay him; and the Merciful One said: he should swear to him, so that he will be appeased in all of it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: לָא שְׁנָא בּוֹ וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּבְנוֹ – אֵינוֹ מֵעֵיז, וְהִילְכָּךְ לָאו מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הוּא; וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: בּוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מֵעֵיז, אֲבָל בִּבְנוֹ מֵעֵיז, וּמִדְּלֹא מֵעֵיז – מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov holds there is no difference between himself and son, would not be so brazen Therefore, is not someone who is returning a lost item. And the Rabbis hold he would not be so brazen himself, but his son he would be brazen And since he was not so brazen he is someone returning a lost item,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov holds: Not different in him and not different in his son - he does not return, and therefore he does not return a lost item; and the Rabbis hold: In him he does not return, but in his son he returns, and if he does not return - he returns a lost item.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יְתוֹמִין שֶׁסָּמְכוּ אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, אוֹ שֶׁמִּינָּה לָהֶן אֲבִיהֶן אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס – חַיָּיב לְעַשֵּׂר פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶם.
human_translation: orphans who are living with a homeowner or if their father appointed a steward [ apotropos ] for them, is obligated to tithe their produce.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Orphans who were supported by the master of the house, or if their father appointed a steward for them - he is obligated to tithe their fruits.

hebrew_text: אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס שֶׁמִּינָּהוּ אֲבִי יְתוֹמִים, יִשָּׁבַע. מִינּוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין – לֹא יִשָּׁבַע. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: חִילּוּף הַדְּבָרִים.
human_translation: a steward who was appointed by the orphans’ father, he takes an oath the court appointed him he is not take an oath. Abba Shaul says: The matters are reversed.
llm_translation: Apotropos, who is also known as Avi Yetomim, shall swear. His swearing before a court - he shall not swear. Abba Shaul says: "Exchange of words."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא שׁוּתָּפִין; ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא אֲרִיסִין; ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא אַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין, וְלֹא הַתּוֹרֵם אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ!
human_translation: raises a contradiction “You” but not partners, “You” but not sharecroppers. “You” but not stewards, but not one who separates teruma from that is not his.
llm_translation: Gemara and we raised a contradiction: "You" - and not partners; "You" - and not renters; "You" - and not caretakers, and not one who appoints someone who is not his own!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לְהַאֲכִיל, כָּאן לְהַנִּיחַ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said not difficult: Here to feed There to put aside
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said, it is not difficult: here for feeding, here for resting.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הָאַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין תּוֹרְמִין וּמְעַשְּׂרִין – לְהַאֲכִיל וְלֹא לְהַנִּיחַ. וּמוֹכְרִין לָהֶן בְּהֵמָה, עֲבָדִים וּשְׁפָחוֹת, בָּתִּים, שָׂדוֹת וּכְרָמִים – לְהַאֲכִיל, אֲבָל לֹא לְהַנִּיחַ. וּמוֹכְרִין לָהֶן פֵּירוֹת, יֵינוֹת, שְׁמָנִים וּסְלָתוֹת – לְהַאֲכִיל אֲבָל לֹא לְהַנִּיחַ.
human_translation: And it is taught Stewards can separate teruma and tithes to feed but not to put aside. And may sell for them Cattle, male and female slaves, houses, fields, and vineyards, to feed but not to put aside And they may sell produce, wine, oil, and flour for them to feed but not to put aside
llm_translation: And it was taught: The "apotropin" provide and tithe - for feeding and not for leaving. And they sell to them cattle, slaves and maidservants, houses, fields, and vineyards - for feeding, but not for leaving. And they sell to them fruits, wines, oils, and flours - for feeding but not for leaving.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹשִׂין לָהֶן לוּלָב וַעֲרָבָה וְסוּכָּה וְצִיצִית, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה; לְאֵיתוֹיֵי שׁוֹפָר. וְלוֹקְחִין לָהֶם סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה; לְאֵתוֹיֵי מְגִילָּה.
human_translation: And make for the A lulav , a willow branch, a sukka , ritual fringes, and any item that involves a fixed to include a shofar . And they may purchase a Torah scroll, phylacteries, mezuzot , and any item that involves a fixed to include a Megilla,
llm_translation: And they make for them a lulav, and willow, and sukkah, and tzitzit, and anything that has a set time; for the fulfillment of the shofar. And they take for them a Torah scroll, tefillin, and mezuzot, and anything that has a set time; for the fulfillment of the Megillah.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין פּוֹסְקִין עֲלֵיהֶם צְדָקָה, וְאֵין פּוֹדִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַשְּׁבוּיִין, וְלֹא כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה; לְאֵתוֹיֵי תַּנְחוּמֵי אֲבֵלִים.
human_translation: But may not undertake charity on behalf of and they may not redeem captives on their behalf Nor anything that does not involve a fixed to include comfort mourners.
llm_translation: And we do not collect charity on their behalf, and we do not redeem captives for them, and not everything that does not have a fixed measure; to bring comfort to mourners.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין רַשָּׁאִין לָדוּן – לָחוּב וְלִזְכּוֹת – בְּנִכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים. לִזְכּוֹת – אַמַּאי לָא? אֶלָּא ״לָחוּב עַל מְנָת לִזְכּוֹת״ בְּנִכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים.
human_translation: And stewards are not permitted to involve in litigation, to accept an obligation or to secure gain for the property of the orphans. Why not to secure gain? Rather, to accept obligation in order to secure gain for the property of the orphan.
llm_translation: And not appointed judges to judge - for liability and for merit - in the properties of orphans. For merit - why not? Rather, "for liability in order to merit" in the properties of orphans.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין רַשָּׁאִין לִמְכּוֹר בְּרָחוֹק וְלִגְאוֹל בְּקָרוֹב; בְּרָעָה וְלִגְאוֹל בְּיָפָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּדִלְמָא מִשְׁתַּדְּפִין.
human_translation: And stewards are not permitted to sell in a distant and redeem in a nearby a bad redeem a good What is the reason that perhaps will become blighted,
llm_translation: And not redeemers permitted to sell from afar and to redeem from nearby; in ugliness and to redeem in beauty. What is the reason? Perhaps they will intermingle.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין רַשָּׁאִין לִמְכּוֹר שָׂדוֹת – וְלִיקַּח עֲבָדִים, אֲבָל מוֹכְרִין עֲבָדִים – וְלוֹקְחִין בָּהֶן שָׂדוֹת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא לִמְכּוֹר עֲבָדִים וְלִיקַּח שָׂדוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּלְמָא לָא מְשַׁפְּיָין.
human_translation: And stewards are not permitted to sell fields and to purchase slaves. But they may sell slaves and their to purchase fields, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: may not even sell slaves and to purchase fields. What is the reason Perhaps is not secure [ meshappeyan ],
llm_translation: "And not permitted to sell fields - but to buy slaves, however selling slaves - and acquiring fields with them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Also not to sell slaves and buy fields. What is the reason? Perhaps they do not improve."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין רַשָּׁאִין לְהוֹצִיא עֲבָדִים לְחֵירוּת; אֲבָל מוֹכְרִין אוֹתָן לַאֲחֵרִים, וַאֲחֵרִים מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן לְחֵירוּת. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי, אַף הוּא – נוֹתֵן דְּמֵי עַצְמוֹ וְיוֹצֵא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמוֹכְרוֹ לוֹ;
human_translation: And stewards are not permitted to free slaves But they may sell them to others, and others may free them. Rabbi says: I say even he, may give his own monetary value and go due to that it is as if sold to
llm_translation: "And not redeeming, the wicked are permitted to release slaves to freedom; but they may sell them to others, and others may release them to freedom. Rabbi says: I say, even he - he gives his own money and goes out, because he is like his seller to him."

hebrew_text: וְצָרִיךְ לְחַשֵּׁב עִמָּהֶן בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. אֵין עוֹשִׂין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים וּקְטַנִּים, וְאִם מִינָּן אֲבִי יְתוֹמִין – הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: And calculate with in the end, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He is not required does not appoint women, slaves, or minors as stewards, but if the father of the orphans appointed them he has permission
llm_translation: And it is necessary to reckon with them in the end. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is not necessary. Women, slaves, and minors do not serve as agents, but if among them is an orphan's father - the authority is in his hand.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דַּהֲוָה קָא מְזַבֵּין אַרְעָתָא וְזָבֵין עַבְדֵי, וְלָא שַׁבְקֵיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אַחְווֹ לֵיהּ בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ ״אֲנִי לַהֲרוֹס וְאַתָּה לִבְנוֹת?!״ אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא אַשְׁגַּח, אֲמַר: דִּבְרֵי חֲלוֹמוֹת לֹא מַעֲלִין וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: a certain steward who was in Rabbi Meir’s neighborhood who was selling land and purchasing slaves and Rabbi Meir did not allow him They showed him in his dream I wish to destroy and you build? Even so, paid no heed said: Words dreams do not bring up and do not take down;
llm_translation: That Apotropos who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Meir, who was selling land and buying slaves, and Rabbi Meir did not stop him. He saw him in his dream saying, "I am to destroy and you to build?!" Even so, he did not pay attention, saying: The words of dreams do not ascend and do not descend.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בֵּי תְרֵי דְּאִיגָּרִי בְּהוּ שָׂטָן, דְּכֹל בֵּי שִׁמְשֵׁי הֲווֹ קָא מִינְּצוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אִיקְּלַע רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְהָתָם, עַכְּבִינְהוּ תְּלָתָא בֵּי שִׁמְשֵׁי, עַד דַּעֲבַד לְהוּ שְׁלָמָא. שַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּקָאָמַר: וַוי, דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא מִבֵּיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: There were two who, incited by Satan, would argue with each other every at twilight. Rabbi Meir happened to He stopped them three at twilight, until he made peace between them. He heard say: Woe, that Rabbi Meir removed that man, from his house.
llm_translation: Those two sons of the dyers were in the habit of consorting with Satan, for all the sons of the ministers were engaged in the company of harlots. Rabbi Meir happened to go there, and he made three sons of ministers into good men. His name was mentioned as saying: "Woe to the man whom Rabbi Meir has taken out of his house."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דַּהֲוָה קָא מְזַבֵּין אַרְעָא וְזָבֵין תּוֹרֵי, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי; סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִיָּמַי לֹא קָרִיתִי לְאִשְׁתִּי ״אִשְׁתִּי״ וּלְשׁוֹרִי ״שׁוֹרִי״, אֶלָּא לְאִשְׁתִּי ״בֵּיתִי״, וּלְשׁוֹרִי ״שָׂדִי״.
human_translation: a certain steward who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi who was selling land and buying oxen and he did not say anything to holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: In all my days, I did not call my wife: My wife, nor my ox: My ox. Rather, my wife: My home, my ox: My field,
llm_translation: That Apotropos who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, who was selling land and buying oxen, and he did not say to him anything; he thought to himself like Rabbi Yosei - as it was taught, Rabbi Yosei said: "Throughout my life, I have not called my wife 'my wife' and my ox 'my ox,' but rather my wife 'my home,' and my ox 'my field.'"

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ יַתְמֵי דַּהֲווֹ סְמִיכִי גַּבֵּי הָהִיא סָבְתָּא. הֲוָה לְהוּ תּוֹרְתָּא, שְׁקַלָה וְזַבֵּינְתַּהּ נִיהֲלַיְיהוּ. אֲתוֹ קְרוֹבִים לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי עֲבִידְתַּהּ דִּמְזַבְּנָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״יְתוֹמִים שֶׁסָּמְכוּ אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: certain orphans who lived with an old woman had an ox, she took it and sold it on their behalf. Relatives came before Rav Naḥman said to him: What is she doing selling said to them: We learned orphans are living with a homeowner,
llm_translation: Behold, those disciples who were sitting in proximity to that elder. They had a teaching, they took it and examined it. Some relatives of Rav Nachman came before him, they said to him: "What is the service that she performs that she sells?" He said to them: "Orphans who are supported by the master of the house." We learned.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיַּיקַּר! בִּרְשׁוּתָא דְלוֹקֵחַ אִיַּיקַּר. וְהָא לָא נְקִיטִי דְּמֵי!
human_translation: But didn’t increase in value, increased in value while in the possession of the buyer, But they did not receive money,
llm_translation: And this is the case! In the domain of one who acquires, it is considered acquired. But this is not taken as a proof!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִם כֵּן, הַיְינוּ דְּרַב חֲנִילַאי בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל – דְּאָמַר רַב חֲנִילַאי בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נִכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין הֲרֵי הֵן כְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְלָא מִקְּנֵי אֶלָּא בְּכַסְפָּא.
human_translation: said to them: If so, this is Rav Ḥanilai bar Idi says Shmuel says, Rav Ḥanilai bar Idi says Shmuel says: Orphans’ property is like consecrated and is acquired only with money.
llm_translation: He said to them: If so, this is what Rav Chanilai son of Idi said in the name of Shmuel - for Rav Chanilai son of Idi said in the name of Shmuel: The properties of orphans are considered consecrated, and can only be acquired with money.

hebrew_text: חַמְרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא עוּקְבָא יַתְמָא – מַשְׁכוּהּ בְּאַרְבְּעָה אַרְבְּעָה, וְאִיַּיקַּר וְקָם בְּשִׁיתָּא שִׁיתָּא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַיְינוּ דְּרַב חֲנִילַאי בַּר אִידִי – דְּאָמַר רַב חֲנִילַאי בַּר אִידִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נִכְסֵי יְתוֹמִין הֲרֵי הֵן כְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְלָא מִקְּנֵי אֶלָּא בְּכַסְפָּא.
human_translation: the wine of Rabbana Ukva the orphan pulled it on four But it increased in value and stood at six came before Rav Naḥman He said to them: This is Rav Ḥanilai bar Idi as Rav Ḥanilai bar Idi says Shmuel says: Orphans’ property is like consecrated and is acquired only with money.
llm_translation: The donkey of Ravna Ukva Yatma - pull it with four by four, and if it falls and gets up with six by six. He came before Rav Nachman, he said to them: This is the same as Rav Chanilai son of Idi - for Rav Chanilai son of Idi said in the name of Shmuel: The properties of orphans are considered as consecrated property, and they are not acquired except with money.
