He went and said to the Caesar: The Jews are rebelling against you! He said to him: Who says so? He said to him: Send him an offering, and see if they bring it close to him.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל שַׁדַּר בִּידֵיהּ עִגְלָא תִּלְתָּא. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָתֵי שְׁדָא בֵּיהּ מוּמָא בְּנִיב שְׂפָתַיִם, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּדוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן – דּוּכְתָּא דִּלְדִידַן הָוֵה מוּמָא, וּלְדִידְהוּ לָאו מוּמָא הוּא.
human_translation: went and sent with him three-year-old calf. While was coming he made a blemish on upper lip. And some say on eyelids, a place where according to us, is a blemish, but according to them, is not a blemish.
llm_translation: He went with it in his hands a calf three years. While he was standing, a blemish was found on its lip, and they said to him with precision of the eyes - the blemish that is for us is a blemish, but for them it is not a blemish.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר רַבָּנַן לְקָרוֹבֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם שְׁלוֹם מַלְכוּת. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה בֶּן אַבְקוּלָס: יֹאמְרוּ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין קְרֵיבִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ! סְבוּר לְמִיקְטְלֵיהּ דְּלָא לֵיזִיל וְלֵימָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה: יֹאמְרוּ מֵטִיל מוּם בַּקֳּדָשִׁים יֵהָרֵג!
human_translation: the Sages thought to sacrifice due to peace government. Rabbi Zekharya ben Avkolas said to them: will say blemished may be sacrificed on the altar. thought to kill him so that he would not go and speak Rabbi Zekharya said to them: will say one who makes a blemish on sacrificial is to be killed.
llm_translation: The sages thought to bring him close for the sake of the peace of the kingdom. Rabbi Zechariah ben Avkulas said to them: Let those with blemishes offer sacrifices on the altar! They thought to kill him so that he would not go and say. Rabbi Zechariah said to them: Let those who cause a blemish in the holy things be put to death!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עִנְוְותָנוּתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה בֶּן אַבְקוּלָס, הֶחְרִיבָה אֶת בֵּיתֵנוּ, וְשָׂרְפָה אֶת הֵיכָלֵנוּ, וְהִגְלְתָנוּ מֵאַרְצֵנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The humility of Rabbi Zekharya ben Avkolas destroyed our Temple, burned our Sanctuary, and exiled us from our land.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The humility of Rabbi Zechariah ben Avkulas destroyed our house, and burned our Temple, and exiled us from our land.

hebrew_text: שַׁדַּר עִלָּוַיְיהוּ לְנֵירוֹן קֵיסָר. כִּי קָאָתֵי; שְׁדָא גִּירָא לְמִזְרָח – אֲתָא נְפַל בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. לְמַעֲרָב – אֲתָא נְפַל בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. לְאַרְבַּע רוּחוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם – אֲתָא נְפַל בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: sent Nero Caesar against When he came He shot an arrow to the east came fell in Jerusalem. to the west it fell in Jerusalem. in four directions of the heavens, fell in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: He sent to Caesar's lamp. When he came; a demon from the east - he fell in Jerusalem. From the west - he fell in Jerusalem. From the four winds of heaven - he fell in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא: פְּסוֹק לִי פְּסוּקָיךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַתִּי אֶת נִקְמָתִי בֶּאֱדוֹם בְּיַד עַמִּי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר: קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא בָּעֵי לַחֲרוֹבֵי בֵּיתֵיהּ, וּבָעֵי לְכַפּוֹרֵי יְדֵיהּ בְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא. עֲרַק וַאֲזַל וְאִיגַּיַּיר, וּנְפַק מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: He said to a child: Tell me a verse He said to him “And I will lay My vengeance upon Edom by the hand of My people Israel” said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, wishes to destroy His Temple, and He wishes to wipe his hands with that man, he fled became a convert, and Rabbi Meir descended from him.
llm_translation: He said to him, to Yannoka: "Divide for me your verses." He said to him: "And I will put my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel, etc." He said: The Holy One, blessed be He, desires the destruction of His house, and desires to cleanse His hands with that man. He fled, went away, and converted, and Rabbi Meir departed from him.

hebrew_text: שַׁדְּרֵיהּ עִילָּוַיְיהוּ לְאַסְפַּסְיָינוּס קֵיסָר. אֲתָא, צָר עֲלַהּ תְּלָת שְׁנֵי. הֲווֹ בַּהּ הָנְהוּ תְּלָתָא עַתִּירֵי: נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן, וּבֶן כַּלְבָּא שָׂבוּעַ, וּבֶן צִיצִית הַכֶּסֶת. נַקְדִּימוֹן בֶּן גּוּרְיוֹן – שֶׁנָּקְדָה לוֹ חַמָּה בַּעֲבוּרוֹ. בֶּן כַּלְבָּא שָׂבוּעַ, שֶׁכׇּל הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵיתוֹ כְּשֶׁהוּא רָעֵב כְּכֶלֶב, יוֹצֵא כְּשֶׁהוּא שָׂבֵעַ. בֶּן צִיצִית הַכֶּסֶת – שֶׁהָיְתָה צִיצָתוֹ נִגְרֶרֶת עַל גַּבֵּי כְּסָתוֹת. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: שֶׁהָיְתָה כִּסְתּוֹ מוּטֶּלֶת בֵּין גְּדוֹלֵי רוֹמִי.
human_translation: sent Vespasian Caesar against He came laid siege three years. There were in these three wealthy people: Nakdimon ben Guryon, ben Kalba Savua, and ben Tzitzit HaKesat. Nakdimon ben Guryon because the sun shined [ nakad ] on his behalf, Ben Kalba Savua because anyone who entered his house when he was hungry as a dog [ kelev ] would leave satiated [ save’a ]. Ben Tzitzit HaKesat his ritual fringes [ tzitzit ] dragged on blankets [ keset ], There are who say that his seat [ kiseh ] was found among the nobles of Rome,
llm_translation: His attendants sent him to Aspasianus Caesar. He came, a difficulty arose for him for three years. There were three advocates for him: Nakdimon ben Gurion, Ben Kalba Savua, and Ben Tzitzit Hakesset. Nakdimon ben Gurion - because the sun shone for him. Ben Kalba Savua, for anyone who entered his house hungry like a dog, left satiated like a dog. Ben Tzitzit Hakesset - because his tzitzit would drag on his garments. Some say: his garment was spread among the great of Rome.

hebrew_text: חַד אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא זָיֵינָּא לְהוּ בְּחִיטֵּי וּשְׂעָרֵי, וְחַד אֲמַר לְהוּ: בִּדְחַמְרָא וּבִדְמִלְחָא וּמִשְׁחָא, וְחַד אֲמַר לְהוּ: בִּדְצִיבֵי. וְשַׁבַּחוּ רַבָּנַן לִדְצִיבֵי, דְּרַב חִסְדָּא כֹּל אַקְלִידֵי הֲוָה מָסַר לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ, בַּר מִדְּצִיבֵי. דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֲכַלְבָּא דְחִיטֵּי בָּעֵי שִׁיתִּין אֲכַלְבֵּי דְצִיבֵי. הֲוָה לְהוּ לְמֵיזַן עֶשְׂרִים וְחַד שַׁתָּא.
human_translation: One said to I will feed with wheat and barley. And one said to with wine, salt, and oil. And one said to with wood. And the Sages gave praise to he wood, As Rav Ḥisda would give all of the keys [ aklidei ] to his servant, except to for wood, As Rav Ḥisda said: One storehouse [ akhleva ] of wheat requires sixty storehouses of wood had to sustain for twenty-one years.
llm_translation: One said to them: I prepare for them with wheat and barley, and one said to them: with beer and wine and oil, and one said to them: with olives. And the Rabbis praised the olives, for Rav Ḥisda would entrust all his keys to the keeper of the olives. As Rav Ḥisda said: The dog of the wheat wants sixty measures, the dog of the olives wants only twenty-one measures.

hebrew_text: הֲווֹ בְּהוּ הָנְהוּ בִּרְיוֹנֵי, אֲמַרוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן: נִיפּוֹק וְנַעֲבֵיד שְׁלָמָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. לָא שַׁבְקִינְהוּ. אֲמַרוּ לְהוּ: נִיפּוֹק וְנַעֲבֵיד קְרָבָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, אֲמַרוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן: לָא מִסְתַּיְּיעָא מִילְּתָא. קָמוּ קְלֹנְהוּ לְהָנְהוּ אַמְבָּרֵי דְּחִיטֵּי וּשְׂעָרֵי, וַהֲוָה כַּפְנָא.
human_translation: There were certain zealots among The Sages said to them: Let us go out and make peace with did not allow them said to Let us go out and engage in battle against the Sages said to them: You will not be successful. arose and burned these storehouses [ ambarei ] of wheat and barley, and there was famine.
llm_translation: They were sitting at a meal, the Sages said to them: Let us go out and bring a peace offering with them. They did not agree. They said to them: Let us go out and bring a burnt offering with them. The Sages said to them: The matter is not feasible. They arose and blamed them for the barley and the hair, and it was like a slap.

hebrew_text: מָרְתָּא בַּת בַּיְיתּוֹס עַתִּירְתָּא דִּירוּשָׁלַיִם הַוְיָא. שַׁדַּרְתֵּהּ לִשְׁלוּחַה,ּ וַאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי סְמִידָא. אַדַּאֲזַל אִיזְדַּבַּן. אֲתָא אֲמַר לַהּ: סְמִידָא לֵיכָּא, חִיוָּרְתָּא אִיכָּא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי. אַדַּאֲזַל אִיזְדַּבַּן. אֲתָא וַאֲמַר לַהּ: חִיוָּרְתָּא לֵיכָּא, גּוּשְׁקְרָא אִיכָּא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי. אַדַּאֲזַל אִזְדַּבַּן. אֲתָא וַאֲמַר לַהּ: גּוּשְׁקְרָא לֵיכָּא, קִימְחָא דִשְׂעָרֵי אִיכָּא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי. אַדַּאֲזַל אִיזְדַּבַּן.
human_translation: Marta bat Baitos was wealthy women of Jerusalem. She sent her agent and said to him: Go bring me fine flour [ semida ]. By the time he went, was sold. He came said to her: There is no fine flour, there is flour. She said to him: Go bring me By the time he went, was sold. He came and said to her: There is no flour, there is coarse flour [ gushkera ]. She said to him: Go bring me By the time he went, was sold. He came and said to her: There is no coarse flour, there is barley flour. She said to him: Go bring me by the time he went, was sold.
llm_translation: Martha, the daughter of Bayitos, a wealthy woman from Jerusalem, sent her servant to the market, saying to him: "Go bring me some fine flour." He went and bought it. He came and said to her: "There is no fine flour, but there is wheat flour." She said to him: "Go bring it to me." He went and bought it. He came and said to her: "There is no wheat flour, but there is barley flour." She said to him: "Go bring it to me." He went and bought it.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה שְׁלִיפָא מְסָאנָא, אֲמַרָה: אִיפּוֹק וְאֶחְזֵי אִי מַשְׁכַּחְנָא מִידֵּי לְמֵיכַל. אִיתִיב לַהּ פַּרְתָּא בְּכַרְעַאּ, וּמִתָה.
human_translation: She had removed her shoes, she said: I will go out and see if I can find something to eat. dung, stuck to her foot, and, she died.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He was a merchant of linen garments, she said: 'Go out and see if we have forgotten anything from the meal.' A cow kicked her with its hind leg, and she died."

hebrew_text: קָרֵי עֲלַהּ רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: ״הָרַכָּה בְךָ וְהָעֲנוּגָּה אֲשֶׁר לֹא נִסְּתָה כַף רַגְלָהּ״. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: גְּרוֹגֶרֶת דְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אֲכַלָה, וְאִיתְּנִיסָא וּמִתָה. דְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק יְתֵיב אַרְבְּעִין שְׁנִין בְּתַעֲנִיתָא דְּלָא לֵיחָרֵב יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, כִּי הֲוָה אָכֵיל מִידֵּי הֲוָה מִיתְחֲזֵי מֵאַבָּרַאי. וְכִי הֲוָה בָּרֵיא, מַיְיתִי לֵיהּ גְּרוֹגְרוֹת, מָיֵיץ מַיַּיְהוּ וְשָׁדֵי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai read concerning her “The tender and delicate woman among you who would not adventure to set the sole of her foot There are who say she ate a fig of Rabbi Tzadok, and became disgusted and died. Rabbi Tzadok observed fasts forty years, that Jerusalem would not be destroyed. that when he would eat something it was visible from the outside And when he would eat they would bring him figs he would suck out their liquid and cast away.
llm_translation: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai read: "The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not venture to set the sole of her foot upon the ground" (Deuteronomy 28:56). Some say: The daughter of Rabbi Tzadok ate a fig, became ill, and died. Rabbi Tzadok fasted for forty years so that Jerusalem would not be destroyed, for whenever he would eat, it would be seen in his limbs. And when he was healthy, they would bring him figs, he would dip them in water, and eat them.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה קָא נִיחָא נַפְשַׁהּ, אַפִּיקְתֵּהּ לְכֹל דַּהֲבַהּ וְכַסְפַּהּ שְׁדֵיתֵיהּ בְּשׁוּקָא, אֲמַרָה: הַאי לְמַאי מִיבְּעֵי לִי! וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּסְפָּם בְּחוּצוֹת יַשְׁלִיכוּ״.
human_translation: as she was dying, she took out all of gold and silver threw it in the marketplace. She said: Why do I need this? And this is as it is written: “They shall cast their silver in the streets
llm_translation: When her soul was content, she took out all her gold and silver jewelry, spread them out in the marketplace, and said, "For what do I need this?" This is what is written: "Their silver they will cast in the streets" (Ezekiel 7:19).

hebrew_text: אַבָּא סִקְרָא – רֵישׁ בִּרְיוֹנֵי דִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי הֲוָה. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: תָּא בְּצִינְעָא לְגַבַּאי. אֲתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד אֵימַת עָבְדִיתוּ הָכִי, וְקָטְלִיתוּ לֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא בְּכַפְנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֶיעֱבֵיד, דְּאִי אָמֵינָא לְהוּ מִידֵּי קָטְלוּ לִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי לִי תַּקַּנְתָּא לְדִידִי דְּאֶיפּוֹק, אֶפְשָׁר דְּהָוֵי הַצָּלָה פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: Abba Sikkara was the leader of the zealots [ biryonei ] of Jerusalem the son of the sister of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai. sent to him: Come to me in secret. He came, said to him: Until when will you do this and kill everyone through starvation? said to him: What can I do, for if I say something to them they will kill me. said to him: Show me a method that I will leave possible that there will be small salvation.
llm_translation: Abba Sikra - the head of the brigands of Jerusalem, was the son of one of the disciples of Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai. He sent to him: "Come to the inn at Gabbai." He came. He said to him: "How long will you do this, and cause the world to be destroyed by your hand?" He said to him: "What can I do, for if I tell them, they will kill me!" He said to him: "Show me a way out that I may escape, perhaps there will be a complete salvation."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְקוֹט נַפְשָׁךְ בִּקְצִירֵי, וְלֵיתוֹ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא וְלִישַׁיְּילוּ בָּךְ, וְאַיְיתִי מִידֵּי סַרְיָא וְאַגְנִי גַּבָּךְ, וְלֵימְרוּ דְּנָח נַפְשָׁךְ. וְלִיעַיְּילוּ בָּךְ תַּלְמִידָךְ וְלָא לֵיעוּל בָּךְ אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא, דְּלָא לַרְגְּשׁוּן בָּךְ דְּקַלִּיל אַתְּ, דְּאִינְהוּ יָדְעִי דְּחַיָּיא קַלִּיל מִמִּיתָא.
human_translation: said to him: Pretend to be sick, and have everyone come and ask bring something putrid and place it near you, so that will say that you have died And have your students enter and let no one else come in so that not notice that you are light. As know that a living is lighter than a dead
llm_translation: He said to him: "Take care of yourself during the harvest season, and do not rely on the whole world to support you. And if they bring you a sack of barley and a jug of wine, let them say that your soul is content. Let your students rely on you, and not others, for they will not be able to support you, as you are considered light in their eyes, for they know that life is lighter than death."

hebrew_text: עָבֵיד הָכִי. נִכְנַס בּוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִצַּד אֶחָד, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מִצַּד אַחֵר. כִּי מְטוֹ לְפִיתְחָא, בְּעוֹ לְמִדְקְרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: יֹאמְרוּ: רַבָּן דָּקְרוּ! בְּעוֹ לְמִדְחֲפֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: יֹאמְרוּ: רַבָּן דָּחֲפוּ! פְּתַחוּ לֵיהּ בָּבָא, נְפַק.
human_translation: did this. Rabbi Eliezer entered from one side and Rabbi Yehoshua from the other side When they arrived at the entrance wanted to pierce him said to them: will say they pierce their teacher. wanted to push him said to them: They will say they push their teacher. opened the gate he was taken out.
llm_translation: He did so. Rabbi Eliezer entered from one side, and Rabbi Yehoshua from the other side. When they reached the entrance, they wanted to pierce it. He said to them: Let them say, "The master has pierced!" They wanted to push it. He said to them: Let them say, "The master has pushed!" They opened the door for him, and he went out.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא לְהָתָם, אֲמַר: שְׁלָמָא עֲלָךְ מַלְכָּא, שְׁלָמָא עֲלָךְ מַלְכָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִיחַיְּיבַתְּ תְּרֵי (קְטָלָא) [קָטְלִי], חֲדָא דְּלָאו מַלְכָּא אֲנָא וְקָא קָרֵית לִי מַלְכָּא, וְתוּ אִי מַלְכָּא אֲנָא עַד הָאִידָּנָא אַמַּאי לָא אָתֵית לְגַבַּאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ לָאו מַלְכָּא אֲנָא,
human_translation: When reached there, he said: Greetings to you, the king; greetings to you, the king. said to him: You are liable for two death penalties, one I am not a king and you call me king, and furthermore, if I am a king, why didn’t you come to me until now? said to him: what you said I am not a king,
llm_translation: When he arrived there, he said, "Peace upon you, O king, peace upon you, O king." He said to him, "You are obligated to pay two (katala), one who is not a king I am, and you are calling me king, and if I am not a king, why have you not come to greet me until now?" He said to him, "When you said 'I am not a king,'

hebrew_text: אִיבְרָא מַלְכָּא אַתְּ; דְּאִי לָאו מַלְכָּא אַתְּ לָא מִימַּסְרָא יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בִּידָךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַלְּבָנוֹן בְּאַדִּיר יִפּוֹל״ – וְאֵין ״אַדִּיר״ אֶלָּא מֶלֶךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה אַדִּירוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וְגוֹ׳״; וְאֵין ״לְבָנוֹן״ אֶלָּא בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָהָר הַטּוֹב הַזֶּה וְהַלְּבָנוֹן״. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: אִי מַלְכָּא אֲנָא, אַמַּאי לָא קָאָתֵית לְגַבַּאי עַד הָאִידָּנָא – בִּרְיוֹנֵי דְּאִית בַּן לָא שָׁבְקִינַן.
human_translation: in truth, you are a king, As if you are not a king, Jerusalem will not be handed over into your hand, as it is written: “And the Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one” And “mighty one” only a king, as it is written: “And their mighty one shall be of themselves, And “Lebanon” only the Temple, as it is stated: “That good mountain and the Lebanon” And what you said If I am a king why didn’t you come to me until now, there are zealots among us did not allow us
llm_translation: You are a daughter of a king; for if you are not a daughter of a king, Jerusalem would not have been delivered into your hand, as it is written: "And the lofty Lebanon shall fall" - and "lofty" refers only to a king, as it is written: "And his lofty one shall be from him, etc." And "Lebanon" refers only to the Temple, as it is said: "This good mountain and Lebanon." And what you are saying is: If I am a king, why have I not come to my estate until now - it is because of the disputes that are among us.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ חָבִית שֶׁל דְּבַשׁ וּדְרָקוֹן כָּרוּךְ עָלֶיהָ, לֹא הָיוּ שׁוֹבְרִין אֶת הֶחָבִית בִּשְׁבִיל דְּרָקוֹן? אִישְׁתִּיק. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: ״מֵשִׁיב חֲכָמִים אָחוֹר וְדַעְתָּם יְסַכֵּל״, אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ: שָׁקְלִינַן צְבָתָא וְשָׁקְלִינַן לֵיהּ לִדְרָקוֹן וְקָטְלִינַן לֵיהּ, וְחָבִיתָא שָׁבְקִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: said to him: If a barrel of honey and a snake [ derakon ] is wrapped around it, wouldn’t they break the barrel in order to the snake? was silent Rav Yosef read about him, and some say Rabbi Akiva Who turns wise men backward and makes their knowledge foolish” should have said to we take tongs, remove the snake, and kill it, and we leave the barrel
llm_translation: He said to him: If a barrel of honey and a dragon were tied together, would they not break the barrel because of the dragon? He remained silent. Rav Yosef read upon it, and it is taught: "He who answers a matter before he hears it, it is folly and shame to him." He wanted to say to him: We took a stick and struck the dragon with it and killed it, and we left the barrel for it.

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי, אֲתָא פְּרֵיסְתְּקָא עֲלֵיהּ מֵרוֹמִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קוּם, דְּמִית לֵיהּ קֵיסָר, וְאָמְרִי הָנְהוּ חֲשִׁיבֵי דְּרוֹמִי לְאוֹתֹיבָךָ בְּרֵישָׁא. הֲוָה סָיֵים חַד (מסאני) [מְסָאנֵיהּ]. בְּעָא לְמִסְיְימֵהּ לְאַחֲרִינָא, לָא עָיֵיל. בְּעָא לְמִישְׁלְפֵיהּ לְאִידַּךְ, לָא נְפַק. אֲמַר: מַאי הַאי?
human_translation: In the meantime, a messenger [ feristaka ] arrived from Rome, said to him: Rise, for the emperor has died, and the noblemen of Rome plan to appoint you as leader was wearing one shoe, he tried to put on the other one, it would not go on He tried to remove the other it would not come off. He said: What is this?
llm_translation: So, a messenger came down from Rome and said to him: "Get up, for Caesar has likened you to himself, and those important men from Rome have said to love you first. He had finished one (measure). He wanted to finish it for another, but it did not come. He wanted to pour it into another vessel, but it did not come out. He said: What is this?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תִּצְטַעַר, שְׁמוּעָה טוֹבָה אַתְיָא לָךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁמוּעָה טוֹבָה תְּדַשֶּׁן עָצֶם״. אֶלָּא מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לֵיתֵי אִינִישׁ דְּלָא מְיַתְּבָא דַּעְתָּךְ מִינֵּיהּ, וְלַחֲלֹיף קַמָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרוּחַ נְכֵאָה תְּיַבֶּשׁ גָּרֶם״. עֲבַד הָכִי, עֲיַיל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמֵאַחַר דְּחָכְמִיתוּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי, עַד הָאִידָּנָא אַמַּאי לָא אָתֵיתוּ לְגַבַּאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא אֲמַרִי לָךְ?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא נָמֵי אֲמַרִי לָךְ!
human_translation: said to him: Be not distressed good tidings have reached you, as it is written: “Good tidings make the bone fat” But what is the remedy? said to him: Have someone with whom you are displeased come and pass before you, as it is written: “A broken spirit dries the bones” He did this, and went on said to him: Since you are so wise, why didn’t you come to me until now? said to him: But didn’t I tell you? said to him: I also told you
llm_translation: He said to him: Do not be distressed, good news is coming to you, as it is written: "Good news refreshes the bones." But what is its benefit? A person should come who will sharpen your understanding, and will challenge you, as it is written: "A broken spirit dries up the bones." He did so, and he came. He said to him: And since all the wise men have passed away, why have you not come to me until now? He said to him: Did I not tell you?! He said to him: I also told you!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵיזָל אָזֵילְנָא, וְאִינָשׁ אַחֲרִינָא מְשַׁדַּרְנָא; אֶלָּא בָּעֵי מִינַּאי מִידֵּי דְּאֶתֵּן לָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תֵּן לִי יַבְנֶה וַחֲכָמֶיהָ, וְשׁוּשִׁילְתָּא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְאָסְווֹתָא דְּמַסַּיִין לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי צָדוֹק. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: ״מֵשִׁיב חֲכָמִים אָחוֹר וְדַעְתָּם יְסַכֵּל״, אִיבְּעִי לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ: לִשְׁבְּקִינְהוּ הָדָא זִימְנָא.
human_translation: said to I will be going and I will send someone else But ask something of me that I give you. said to him: Give me Yavne and its Sages and the dynasty of Rabban Gamliel and doctors to heal Rabbi Tzadok. Rav Yosef read about him, and some say Rabbi Akiva Who turns wise men backward and makes their knowledge foolish” he should have said to him to leave this time.
llm_translation: He said to him: "I am going, and another person will send to you; but I want my reward from you." He said to him: "Give me Yavneh and its sages, and the chain of Rabban Gamliel, and the wedding feast of Rabbi Tzadok." Rav Yosef called him out on this, and Rabbi Akiva said: "He who turns wise men backward and makes their knowledge foolish." He wanted to say to him: "Leave this matter for another time."

hebrew_text: וְהוּא סָבַר: דִּלְמָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא עָבֵיד, וְהַצָּלָה פּוּרְתָּא נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: And He maintained might not do that much and there would not be even a small salvation.
llm_translation: And he holds: perhaps not everyone does this, and salvation will not come about solely through this.

hebrew_text: אָסְווֹתָא דְּמַסַּיִין לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי צָדוֹק – מַאי הִיא? יוֹמָא קַמָּא אַשְׁקְיוּהּ מַיָּא דְפָארֵי, לִמְחַר מַיָּא דְסִיפּוּקָא, לִמְחַר מַיָּא דְקִימְחָא, עַד דִּרְוַוח מְיעֵיהּ פּוּרְתָּא פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: What doctors to heal Rabbi Tzadok? The first day they gave him water to drink bran [ parei ]. The next water flour mixed with bran [ sipuka ]. The following day water flour. his stomach to broaden little by little.
llm_translation: The question that they asked Rabbi Tzadok - what is it? On the first day, they gave him water of barley, on the next day water of doubt, on the next day water of flour, until his face shone like the light of the moon.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל שַׁדַּרֵיהּ לְטִיטוּס. ״וְאָמַר אֵי אֱלֹהֵימוֹ צוּר חָסָיוּ בוֹ״ – זֶה טִיטוּס הָרָשָׁע שֶׁחֵירַף וְגִידֵּף כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה.
human_translation: went sent Titus “And he shall say: Where is their God, their rock in whom they trusted?” This is the wicked Titus, who insulted and blasphemed God on High.
llm_translation: He went to Titus. "And he said, 'Where is their God, the Rock in whom they sought refuge?'" - This is Titus the wicked who blasphemed and scorned the Almighty.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה? תָּפַשׂ זוֹנָה בְּיָדוֹ וְנִכְנַס לְבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, וְהִצִּיעַ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְעָבַר עָלֶיהָ עֲבֵירָה. וְנָטַל סַיִיף וְגִידֵּר אֶת הַפָּרוֹכֶת, וְנַעֲשָׂה נֵס וְהָיָה דָּם מְבַצְבֵּץ וְיוֹצֵא, וּכְסָבוּר הָרַג אֶת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שָׁאֲגוּ צוֹרְרֶיךָ בְּקֶרֶב מוֹעֲדֶיךָ שָׂמוּ אוֹתוֹתָם אוֹתוֹת״.
human_translation: What did do He took a prostitute with his hand, and entered the Holy of Holies He spread out a Torah scroll and committed a sin, on it. he took a sword and cut into the curtain And a miracle was performed and blood spurted forth. he thought he had killed himself. As it is stated: “Your enemies roar in the midst of Your meeting place; they have set up their own signs for signs”
llm_translation: "What did he do? He seized a prostitute in his hand and entered the Holy of Holies, and offered a Torah scroll and committed a sin with her. And he took a sword and slashed the curtain, and a miracle occurred and blood spurted and emerged, and he thought he killed himself, as it is said: 'Your adversaries have roared in the midst of Your meeting place; they set up their own signs as signs.'"

hebrew_text: אַבָּא חָנָן אוֹמֵר: ״מִי כָמוֹךָ חֲסִין יָהּ״ – מִי כָמוֹךָ חָסִין וְקָשֶׁה, שֶׁאַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ נִיאוּצוֹ וְגִידּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע, וְשׁוֹתֵק. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״מִי כָּמֹכָה בָּאֵלִים ה׳״ – מִי כָּמוֹכָה בָּאִלְּמִים.
human_translation: Abba Ḥanan says: “Who is strong like You, O Lord?” Who is strong and indurate like You, as You hear the abuse and the blasphemy of that wicked man and remain silent. the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “Who is like You, O Lord, among the gods [ elim ]” Who is like You among the mute [ ilmim ],
llm_translation: Abba Hanan says: "Who is like You, O Lord, among the mighty?" - Who is like You, mighty and harsh, that You hear the scorn and blasphemy of that wicked one, and remain silent. The school of Rabbi Ishmael taught: "Who is like You among the gods, O Lord?" - Who is like You among the mighty ones.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה? נָטַל אֶת הַפָּרוֹכֶת וַעֲשָׂאוֹ כְּמִין גַּרְגּוּתְנִי, וְהֵבִיא כׇּל כֵּלִים שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ וְהִנִּיחָן בָּהֶן, וְהוֹשִׁיבָן בִּסְפִינָה לֵילֵךְ לְהִשְׁתַּבֵּחַ בְּעִירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְכֵן רָאִיתִי רְשָׁעִים קְבוּרִים וָבָאוּ, וּמִמְּקוֹם קָדוֹשׁ יְהַלֵּכוּ, וְיִשְׁתַּכְּחוּ בָעִיר אֲשֶׁר כֵּן עָשׂוּ״ – אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״קְבוּרִים״ אֶלָּא ״קְבוּצִים״; אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״וְיִשְׁתַּכְּחוּ״ אֶלָּא ״וְיִשְׁתַּבְּחוּ״.
human_translation: What do? He took the curtain and formed it like a large basket, and brought all of the vessels of the Temple and placed them in it. And he put them on a ship to go and be praised in his city as it is stated: “And so I saw the wicked buried, and come to their rest; but those that had done right were gone from the holy place, and were forgotten in the city; ” Do not read as “buried [ kevurim ].” Rather, collected [ kevutzim ]. do not read as “and were forgotten [ veyishtakeḥu ].” Rather, And they were praised [ veyishtabeḥu ].
llm_translation: What did he do? He took the curtain and made it like a type of boat, and he brought all the vessels of the Temple and placed them in it, and he sat them in a ship to go and revel in his city, as it is said: "And so I saw the wicked buried, and they came, and from the holy place they went, and they were praised in the city which they did so" - do not read "buried" but "gathered"; do not read "and they were praised" but "and they reveled".

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, קְבוּרִים מַמָּשׁ – דַּאֲפִילּוּ מִילֵּי דְּמִטַּמְּרָן, אִיגַּלְיָין לְהוֹן.
human_translation: There are who say actually buried. even items that had been buried were revealed to them,
llm_translation: There are some who say, buried literally - for even the words they speak are revealed to them.

hebrew_text: עָמַד עָלָיו נַחְשׁוֹל שֶׁבַּיָּם לְטוֹבְעוֹ, אָמַר: כִּמְדוּמֶּה אֲנִי שֶׁאֱלֹהֵיהֶם שֶׁל אֵלּוּ, אֵין גְּבוּרָתוֹ אֶלָּא בַּמַּיִם; בָּא פַּרְעֹה – טְבָעוֹ בַּמַּיִם, בָּא סִיסְרָא – טְבָעוֹ בַּמַּיִם; אַף הוּא עוֹמֵד עָלַי לְטוֹבְעֵנִי בַּמַּיִם. אִם גִּבּוֹר הוּא, יַעֲלֶה לַיַּבָּשָׁה וְיַעֲשֶׂה עִמִּי מִלְחָמָה! יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: רָשָׁע בֶּן רָשָׁע בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל עֵשָׂו הָרָשָׁע, בְּרִיָּה קַלָּה יֵשׁ לִי בְּעוֹלָמִי, וְיַתּוּשׁ שְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: at sea a wave rose up against him to drown him. said: It seems to me that their God, has power only in water. Pharaoh rose He drowned him in water. Sisera rose He drowned him in water. too, He has risen up against me to drown me in water. If He is mighty, let Him go up on dry land and wage war against me. A Divine Voice issued forth and said to him: Wicked one, son of a wicked one, grandson of Esau the wicked, I have a lowly creature in My world and it is called a gnat.
llm_translation: He stood over him the copper serpent in the sea to drown him, he said: "I am like their God of these, his might is only in the water; Pharaoh came - he drowned in the water, Sisera came - he drowned in the water; he also stands over me to drown me in the water. If he is mighty, let him come up to the dry land and make war with me! A heavenly voice came out and said to him: "Wicked, son of a wicked, son of his wicked, Esau's descendant, I have a light creature in my world, and her name is Yatush."

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי קָרֵי לַהּ ״בְּרִיָּה קַלָּה״? דְּמַעֲלָנָא אִית לַהּ, וּמַפְּקָנָא לֵית לַהּ.
human_translation: Why is it called a lowly creature? because it has an entrance but it does not have an exit
llm_translation: "Why is she called 'a light creation'? Because we ascend to her, but she does not ascend to us."

hebrew_text: עֲלֵה לַיַּבָּשָׁה וְתַעֲשֶׂה עִמָּהּ מִלְחָמָה. עָלָה לַיַּבָּשָׁה, בָּא יַתּוּשׁ וְנִכְנַס בְּחוֹטְמוֹ, וְנִקֵּר בְּמוֹחוֹ שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים. יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא חָלֵיף אַבָּבָא דְּבֵי נַפָּחָא, שְׁמַע קָל אַרְזַפְתָּא, אִישְׁתִּיק; אֲמַר: אִיכָּא תַּקַּנְתָּא. כֹּל יוֹמָא מַיְיתוּ נַפָּחָא וּמָחוּ קַמֵּיה. לְגוֹי – יָהֵיב לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע זוּזֵי, יִשְׂרָאֵל – אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִיסָּתְיָיךְ דְּקָא חָזֵית בְּסָנְאָךְ. עַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין עֲבַד הָכִי; מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, כֵּיוָן דְּדָשׁ, דָּשׁ.
human_translation: Go up on dry land and make war with it. He went up on dry land, a gnat came, entered his nostril, and picked at his brain for seven years. one day he passed by the gate of a blacksmith’s shop. heard the sound of a hammer was silent said: there is a remedy Every day they would bring a blacksmith who hammered before him. He would give four dinars to a gentile to a Jew he would say: It is enough for you that you see your enemy He did this for thirty days From that forward, since became accustomed it became accustomed
llm_translation: Go up to the dry land and make war with it. He went up to the dry land, the weasel came and entered through its nostril, and pierced its brain for seven years. One day a wind blew at the gate of the house of Nappakha, he heard the sound of a cedar, he was silent; he said: there is a remedy. Every day they brought Nappakha and stood him up. To a gentile - he gave him four coins, to an Israelite - he said to him: I am amazed that you saw in your basket. He did so for thirty days; from then on, once it has threshed, it has threshed.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן עֲרוּבָא: אֲנִי הָיִיתִי בֵּין גְּדוֹלֵי רוֹמִי, וּכְשֶׁמֵּת פָּצְעוּ אֶת מוֹחוֹ, וּמָצְאוּ בּוֹ כְּצִפּוֹר דְּרוֹר מִשְׁקַל שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: כְּגוֹזָל בֶּן שָׁנָה – מִשְׁקַל שְׁנֵי לִיטְרִין.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Pineḥas ben Arova said: I was among the noblemen of Rome, and when died they split open his head and found the size of a sparrow weighing two sela . It was taught in baraita : like year-old pigeon weighing two litra .
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Pinchas ben Aruba said: I was among the elders of Rome, and when he died, they found in his brain the size of a dove's egg weighing two sela. In a Baraita it was taught: Like a one-year-old fledgling - weighing two litrins.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן, פִּיו שֶׁל נְחוֹשֶׁת וְצִפּוֹרְנָיו שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל. כִּי הֲוָה קָא מָיֵית, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לִיקְלְיוּהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא וּבַדַּרוּ לְקִיטְמֵיהּ אַשַּׁב יַמִּי, דְּלָא לַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ אֱלָהָא דִיהוּדָאֵי וְלוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּדִינָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition its mouth of copper and its claws were iron. When was dying, he said to Burn that man, and scatter his ashes across the seven seas, so that the God of the Jews should not find me and stand me for judgment.
llm_translation: Abaye said: We have learned that his mouth is of copper and his nails are of iron. When he was about to die, he said to them: "Bury him in that man's grave and place a hair of a goat in his mouth, so that the God of the Jews will not forget him and will raise him in judgment."

hebrew_text: אוּנְקְלוֹס בַּר קְלוֹנִיקוּס בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּטִיטוּס הֲוָה. בָּעֵי לְאִיגַּיּוֹרֵי, אֲזַל אַסְּקֵיהּ לְטִיטוּס בִּנְגִידָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲשִׁיב בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל. מַהוּ לְאִידַּבּוֹקֵי בְּהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִילַּיְיהוּ נְפִישִׁין, וְלָא מָצֵית לְקַיּוֹמִינְהוּ. זִיל אִיגָּרִי בְּהוּ בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא וְהָוֵית רֵישָׁא, דִּכְתִיב: ״הָיוּ צָרֶיהָ לְרֹאשׁ וְגוֹ׳״ – כׇּל הַמֵּיצַר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּמַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Onkelos bar Kalonikos, the son of Titus’s sister, wanted to convert He went raised Titus through necromancy, said to him: Who is important in that world said to him: The Jewish people. Should I attach to them said to him: Their commandments are numerous, and you will not be able to fulfill them. Go battle against them in that world, and you will become the chief, as it is written: “Her adversaries [ tzareha ] have become the chief” Anyone who distresses [ meitzer ] Israel will become the chief. said to him: What is the punishment of that man, said to him:
llm_translation: Onkelos, son of Kalonikos, son of his father Titus, was. He wanted to convert. He went and asked Titus the Caesar, he said to him: Who is considered important in that world? He said to him: Israel. What should one do to be loved by them? He said to him: Their matters are numerous, and you will not find a way to establish them. Go and afflict them in that world, and you will be a leader, as it is written: "They shall be her adversaries, etc." - whoever afflicts Israel becomes a leader. He said to him: What is the judgment of that man in water? He said to him:

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי דִּפְסַיק אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ – כֹּל יוֹמָא מְכַנְּשִׁי לֵיהּ לְקִיטְמֵיהּ וְדָיְינִי לֵיהּ, וְקָלוּ לֵיהּ וּמְבַדְּרוּ [לֵיהּ] אַשַּׁב יַמֵּי.
human_translation: That which he decreed against himself, Every day his ashes are gathered, and they judge him, and they burn him, and they scatter him over the seven seas.
llm_translation: With what did he cut himself? - Every day they would bring him to his bundle, and they would judge him, and they would beat him and investigate his deeds.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל אַסְּקֵיהּ לְבִלְעָם בִּנְגִידָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲשִׁיב בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל. מַהוּ לְאִידַּבּוֹקֵי בְּהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא תִדְרוֹשׁ שְׁלוֹמָם וְטוֹבָתָם כׇּל הַיָּמִים״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּמַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע רוֹתַחַת.
human_translation: went and raised Balaam through necromancy. He said to him: Who is important in that world said to him: The Jewish people. Should I attach to them said to him: You shall not seek their peace or their welfare all the days said to him: What is the punishment of that man, said to him: in boiling semen,
llm_translation: He went to Bilam the Elder, he said to him: Who is considered important in that world? He said to him: Israel. What should one do to engage with them? He said to him: "Do not seek their peace or welfare all your days." He said to him: What is the judgment of that man in what matter? He said to him: With a boiling seed emission.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל אַסְּקֵיהּ בִּנְגִידָא לְיֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲשִׁיב בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל. מַהוּ לְאִדַּבּוֹקֵי בְּהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טוֹבָתָם דְּרוֹשׁ, רָעָתָם לֹא תִּדְרוֹשׁ, כׇּל הַנּוֹגֵעַ בָּהֶן כְּאִילּוּ נוֹגֵעַ בְּבָבַת עֵינוֹ.
human_translation: went raised Jesus the Nazarene through necromancy. said to him: Who is important in that world said to him: The Jewish people. Should I attach to them said to him: Their welfare you shall seek, their misfortune you shall not seek, anyone who touches them is as if he were touching the apple of his eye
llm_translation: He went to ask Yeshu the Nazarene, he said to him: Who is considered important in that world? He said to him: Israel. What should be done with them? He said to him: Seek their welfare, do not seek their harm, whoever touches them is as if he touches the apple of his eye.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּמַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּצוֹאָה רוֹתַחַת. דְּאָמַר מָר: כׇּל הַמַּלְעִיג עַל דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים נִידּוֹן בְּצוֹאָה רוֹתַחַת. תָּא חֲזִי מָה בֵּין פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לִנְבִיאֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: said to him: What is the punishment of that man, said to him: with boiling excrement. As the Master said: Anyone who mocks the words of the Sages will be sentenced to boiling excrement. Come see the difference between the sinners of Israel and the prophets of the nations of the world.
llm_translation: He said to him: By what means were the judgments of that man? He said to him: By boiling excrement. As the Master said: Anyone who scoffs at the words of the sages is judged by boiling excrement. Come and see the difference between the sinners of Israel and the prophets of the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה גָּדוֹל(ה) כֹּחָהּ שֶׁל בּוּשָׁה, שֶׁהֲרֵי סִיַּיע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת בַּר קַמְצָא, וְהֶחְרִיב אֶת בֵּיתוֹ, וְשָׂרַף אֶת הֵיכָלוֹ.
human_translation: is taught: Rabbi Elazar says: Come and see how great is the power of shame, for the Holy One, Blessed be He, assisted bar Kamtza, and He destroyed His Temple and burned His Sanctuary.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar said, "Come and see how great is the power of shame, for behold, the Holy One, blessed be He, helped Bar Kamtza and destroyed his house, and burned His Temple."

hebrew_text: אַתַּרְנְגוֹלָא וְאַתַּרְנְגוֹלְתָּא חֲרִיב טוּר מַלְכָּא: דַּהֲווֹ נְהִיגִי כִּי הֲווֹ מַפְּקִי חַתְנָא וְכַלְּתָא, מַפְּקִי קַמַּיְיהוּ תַּרְנְגוֹלָא וְתַרְנְגוֹלְתָּא, כְּלוֹמַר: פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ כְּתַרְנְגוֹלִים.
human_translation: the King’s Mountain [ Tur Malka ] was destroyed on account of a rooster and a hen. It was customary that when they would lead a bride and groom they would take out a rooster and a hen before them, to say Be fruitful and multiply like chickens.
llm_translation: The place of the rooster and the place of the hen were destroyed by the king's mountain. For they used to conduct themselves when the groom and the bride were departing, they would go out before them, the rooster and the hen, as if to say: "Be fruitful and multiply like roosters."

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא חָלֵיף גּוּנְדָּא דְרוֹמָאֵי, שַׁקְלִינְהוּ מִינַּיְיהוּ. נְפַלוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ מְחוֹנְהוּ. אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְקֵיסָר: מְרַדוּ בָּךְ יְהוּדָאֵי! אֲתָא עֲלַיְיהוּ. הֲוָה בְּהוּ הָהוּא בַּר דָּרוֹמָא, דַּהֲוָה קָפֵיץ מִילָא וְקָטֵיל בְּהוּ. שַׁקְלֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְתָאגֵיהּ וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ אַאַרְעָא. אֲמַר: רִיבּוֹנֵיהּ דְּעָלְמָא כּוּלֵּיהּ, אִי נִיחָא לָךְ, לָא תִּמְסְרֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא – לְדִידֵיהּ וּלְמַלְכוּתֵיהּ, בִּידֵיהּ דְּחַד גַּבְרָא!
human_translation: One day a troop [ gunda ] of Roman passed by and took from them. fell upon them and beat them. came and said to the emperor: The Jews have rebelled against you. came against them there was a certain man bar Deroma who could jump a mil , and he killed The emperor took his crown and set it on the ground He said: Master of the Universe, if it is pleasing to You, do not give over that man, and his kingdom into the hands of one man.
llm_translation: One day, there was a Roman officer passing through the streets of Rome; they took him from among them. They fell upon him and beat him. They came and said to the Caesar: "The Jews are rebelling against you!" He came upon them. There was in that place a certain man from Rome, who was quick to speak and quick to act. The Caesar took him to his counsel and appointed him as a ruler. He said: "All the rulers of the world, if it is pleasing to you, do not hand him over to that man - for his own sake and for his kingdom, in the hands of one man!"

hebrew_text: אַכְשְׁלֵיהּ פּוּמֵּיהּ לְבַר דָּרוֹמָא, וַאֲמַר: ״הֲלֹא אַתָּה אֱלֹהִים זְנַחְתָּנוּ וְלֹא תֵצֵא אֱלֹהִים בְּצִבְאוֹתֵינוּ״. דָּוִד נָמֵי אָמַר הָכִי! דָּוִד אַתְמוֹהֵי קָא מַתְמַהּ.
human_translation: his mouth caused bar Deroma to stumble, as he uttered “Have You not rejected us, O God, so that You go not forth, O God, with our hosts?” David also say this? David uttered as a question,
llm_translation: He stumbled his mouth to the son of Daroma, and said: "Have you not, God, rejected us and will not God go out with our armies?" David himself said thus! David's companions are astonished.

hebrew_text: עָל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, אֲתָא דְּרָקוֹנָא שַׁמְטֵיהּ לְכַרְכְּשֵׁיהּ וְנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲמַר: הוֹאִיל וְאִיתְרְחִישׁ לִי נִיסָּא, הָא זִימְנָא אֶישְׁבְּקִינְהוּ. שַׁבְקִינְהוּ וַאֲזַל. אִיזְדְּקוּר וַאֲכַלוּ וּשְׁתוֹ, וְאַדְלִיקוּ שְׁרָגֵי, עַד דְּאִיתְחֲזִי בִּלְיוֹנָא דְגוּשְׁפַּנְקָא בְּרָחוֹק מִילָא. אֲמַר: מִיחְדָּא קָא חָדוּ בִּי יְהוּדָאֵי! הֲדַר אֲתָא עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: He entered an outhouse, a snake came eviscerated him, and he died. said: Since a miracle was performed for me, I will let be this time He let them be and went They leapt ate, drank, and lit candles that the image [ bilyona ] on a seal [ gushpanka ] was visible from a distance of a mil . said: The Jews are rejoicing over me. he went back came against them.
llm_translation: Regarding the privy, a demon came and removed his excrement and rested. He said: Since a miracle has occurred for me, this time I will wait for him. He waited and left. They checked and ate and drank, and lit torches until they could see the shadow of the demon in the distance. He said: A Jew has prevailed against me! He then came upon them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: תְּלָת מְאָה אַלְפֵי שְׁלִיפֵי סַיְיפָא עֲיַילוּ לְטוּר מַלְכָּא, וּקְטַלוּ בַּהּ תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי וּתְלָתָא לֵילָווֹתָא; וּבְהָךְ גִּיסָא הִלּוּלֵי וְחִנְגֵי, וְלָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי הָנֵי בְּהָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Asi says: Three hundred thousand men with drawn swords entered the King’s Mountain and massacred for three days and three nights. And on side weddings and festivities and they did not know about each other,
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said: Three hundred thousand swordsmen of the rear guard went to encircle the king, and they killed him in three days and three nights; and with that, they rejoiced and celebrated, but they did not know these with those.

hebrew_text: ״בִּלַּע ה׳ וְלֹא חָמַל אֵת כׇּל נְאוֹת יַעֲקֹב״ – כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵלּוּ שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא עֲיָירוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ לְיַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ בְּהַר הַמֶּלֶךְ. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא עֲיָירוֹת הָיוּ לוֹ לְיַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ בְּהַר הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת הָיוּ בָּהּ כְּיוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם, חוּץ מִשָּׁלֹשׁ שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהֶן כִּפְלַיִם כְּיוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: “The Lord has swallowed up without pity all the habitations of Jacob” when Ravin came he Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This six hundred thousand cities King Yannai had in the King’s Mountain. Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: King Yannai had six hundred thousand cities in the King’s Mountain, and each of them as those who left Egypt, except for three was double those who left Egypt.
llm_translation: "The Lord swallowed up and did not spare all the pleasant places of Jacob" - When Ravin came, Rabbi Yohanan said: These are the sixty myriads of cities that the King Yanai had in the Mountain of the King. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: There were sixty myriads of cities that the King Yanai had in the Mountain of the King, and each one of them was like those who came out of Egypt, except for three in which there were double the number of those who came out of Egypt.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן: כְּפַר בִּישׁ, כְּפַר שַׁיחֲלַיִים, כְּפַר דִּכְרַיָּא. כְּפַר בִּישׁ – דְּלָא יָהֲבִי בֵּיתָא לְאוּשְׁפִּיזָא. כְּפַר שַׁיחֲלַיִים – שֶׁהָיְתָה פַּרְנָסָתָן מִן שַׁחֲלַיִים. כְּפַר דִּכְרַיָּא – אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁהָיוּ נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן יוֹלְדוֹת זְכָרִים תְּחִלָּה, וְיוֹלְדוֹת נְקֵבָה בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה, וּפוֹסְקוֹת.
human_translation: These those Kefar Bish, Kefar Shiḥalayim, and Kefar Dikhrayya. Kefar Bish, would not open houses to guests. Kefar Shiḥalayim their livelihood was from cress [ shaḥalayim ]. Kefar Dikhrayya, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Their women would first give birth to boys, and afterward give birth to girls, and they would stop
llm_translation: These are they: Kefar Bish, Kefar Shaichalayim, Kefar Dikraya. Kefar Bish - who did not give a house to the tax collector. Kefar Shaichalayim - whose livelihood was from Shaichalayim. Kefar Dikraya - Rabbi Yochanan said: Their women used to give birth to males first, and females later, and then they stopped.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הָהוּא אַתְרָא, וַאֲפִילּוּ שִׁיתִּין רִיבְּווֹתָא קְנֵי לָא מַחְזֵיק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שַׁקּוֹרֵי מְשַׁקְּרִיתוּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אֶרֶץ צְבִי״ כְּתִיב בַּהּ, מָה צְבִי זֶה – אֵין עוֹרוֹ מַחֲזִיק אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ, אַף אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – בִּזְמַן שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין עָלֶיהָ רָוְוחָא, וּבִזְמַן שֶׁאֵין יוֹשְׁבִין עָלֶיהָ גָּמְדָא.
human_translation: Ulla said: I myself saw that place, and it could not hold even six hundred thousand reeds, A certain heretic said to Rabbi Ḥanina: You lie said to him: With regard to it is written: Land of the deer Just as the skin of a deer cannot hold its flesh, so too, Eretz Yisrael, when it is settled, it expands, but when it is not settled, it contracts.
llm_translation: Ula said: According to my opinion, that place appears to me, and even if you place six hundred disputes, it does not hold. That person said to Rabbi Chanina: "You are reading falsely!" He said to him: "A land of beauty" is written in it, just as this beauty, its skin does not hold its flesh, so too the land of Israel - when people dwell upon it, it flourishes, and when they do not dwell upon it, it becomes desolate.

hebrew_text: רַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בַּר חִלְקִיָּה וְרַב חִלְקִיָּה בַּר טוֹבִיָּה וְרַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא הָווּ יָתְבִי גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי, אָמְרִי: אִי אִיכָּא דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא מִכְּפַר סְכַנְיָא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם, לֵימָא.
human_translation: Rav Minyumi bar Ḥilkiya, Rav Ḥilkiya bar Toviya, and Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya were sitting together. They said: If there is someone who has heard anything about Kefar Sekhanya of Egypt, let him relate
llm_translation: Rav Minyumei son of Chilkiya and Rav Chilkiya son of Toviya and Rav Huna son of Chiya were sitting together. They said: If there is someone who heard a matter from the village of Kapar Sekhanya of Egypt, let him say.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ וַאֲמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָרוּס וַאֲרוּסָתוֹ שֶׁנִּשְׁבּוּ לְבֵין הַגּוֹיִם, וְהִשִּׂיאוּם זֶה לָזֶה. אָמְרָה לוֹ: ״בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, אַל תִּגַּע בִּי, שֶׁאֵין לִי כְּתוּבָּה מִמְּךָ״, וְלֹא נָגַע בָּהּ עַד יוֹם מוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: One of them began and said: an incident involving a betrothed man and woman who were taken captive by gentiles and married them off to each other. said to Please do not touch me, as I do not have a marriage contract from you, And until his death did not touch
llm_translation: He opened with one of his arguments and said: There was an incident involving a betrothed man and his betrothed woman who were captured among the nations, and they were brought to each other. She said to him, "I beg of you, do not touch me, for I have no marriage contract from you," and he did not touch her until his death.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁמֵּת, אָמְרָה לָהֶן: סִיפְדוּ לָזֶה, שֶׁפִּטְפֵּט בְּיִצְרוֹ יוֹתֵר מִיּוֹסֵף; דְּאִילּוּ בְּיוֹסֵף לָא הֲוָה אֶלָּא חֲדָא שַׁעְתָּא, וְהַאי כֹּל יוֹמָא וְיוֹמָא. וְאִילּוּ יוֹסֵף לָאו בַּחֲדָא מִטָּה, וְהַאי בַּחֲדָא מִטָּה. וְאִילּוּ יוֹסֵף לָאו אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהָא אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: And when he died said to Eulogize this who conquered [ shepitpet ] his passion [ beyitzro ] more than Joseph. As Joseph it was only for a short time whereas this each and every day. Joseph not in one bed whereas this in one bed Joseph not his wife, whereas this his wife,
llm_translation: And when she died, she said to them: Eulogize for this one, for he was more temperamental in his nature than Joseph; for if with Joseph it was only one moment, this one was every day. And if Joseph was not on the same bed, this one was on the same bed. And if Joseph was not his wife, this one was his wife.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח אִידַּךְ וַאֲמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה וְעָמְדוּ אַרְבָּעִים מוֹדִיּוֹת בְּדִינָר; נֶחְסַר הַשַּׁעַר מוֹדְיָא אַחַת, וּבָדְקוּ, וּמָצְאוּ אָב וּבְנוֹ שֶׁבָּאוּ עַל נַעֲרָה מְאוֹרָסָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים; וֶהֱבִיאוּם לְבֵית דִּין וּסְקָלוּם, וְחָזַר הַשַּׁעַר לִמְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: Another began and said: It once happened that forty se’a stood at one dinar. the rate went down one se’a [ modeya ], And they checked and they found a father and son who had engaged in sexual intercourse with a betrothed young woman on Yom Kippur. They brought to court and stoned them, and the rate returned to its level.
llm_translation: He opened the other side and said: A case, and forty Modiyot stood in a dinar; the gate was missing one Modiya, and they checked, and found a father and his son who came upon a betrothed maiden on Yom Kippur; and they brought them to the court and stoned them, and the gate returned to its place.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח אִידַּךְ וַאֲמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְגָרְשָׁהּ, וְהָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה. מָה עָשָׂה? הָלַךְ וְזִימֵּן אֶת שׁוֹשְׁבִינָיו וְהֶאֱכִילָן וְהִשְׁקָן, שִׁיכְּרָן וְהִשְׁכִּיבָן עַל מִיטָּה אַחַת, וְהֵבִיא לוֹבֶן בֵּיצָה וְהִטִּיל בֵּינֵיהֶן, וְהֶעֱמִיד לָהֶן עֵדִים, וּבָא לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: another began and said: an incident involving a man who set his eyes upon his wife to divorce her, but her marriage contract was large What did he do? He went and invited his friends, gave them food and drink, made them drunk, and lay in one bed. He brought the white of an egg, and placed it between them. He stood witnesses over them and went to court
llm_translation: He opened his statement and said: There was an incident with one man who wanted to divorce his wife, and her marriage contract was extensive. What did he do? He went and invited his friends, fed and gave them to drink, made them recognize her, and had them lie with her on one bed. He brought a cooked egg and placed it between them, and he established witnesses for them, and he went to the court.

hebrew_text: הָיָה שָׁם זָקֵן אֶחָד מִתַּלְמִידֵי שַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן, וּבָבָא בֶּן בּוּטָא שְׁמוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶן, כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִשַּׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן: לוֹבֶן בֵּיצָה סוֹלֵד מִן הָאוּר, וְשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע דּוֹחָה מִן הָאוּר. בָּדְקוּ וּמָצְאוּ כִּדְבָרָיו, וֶהֱבִיאוּהוּ לְבֵית דִּין וְהִלְקוּהוּ, וְהִגְבּוּהוּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: A certain Elder of the disciples of Shammai the Elder was there, and Bava ben Buta his name. He said to them: This is I received from Shammai the Elder: Egg white contracts by fire, whereas semen is absorbed by the fire. They checked and found in accordance with his statement They brought to court, administered lashes to him, and made him pay marriage contract
llm_translation: There was a certain elder there, one of the disciples of Shammai the Elder, and his name was Baba ben Buta. He said to them, "This is what I have received as tradition from Shammai the Elder: The white of an egg is absorbed from the light, and the emission of seed pushes away from the light." They examined and found it to be as he had said, and they brought him to the court and they flogged him, and they fulfilled his written statement from him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: וּמֵאַחַר דַּהֲווֹ צַדִּיקִים כּוּלֵּי הַאי, מַאי טַעְמָא אִיעֲנוּשׁ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אִיאַבּוּל עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׂמְחוּ אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַם וְגִילוּ בָהּ כׇּל אוֹהֲבֶיהָ, שִׂישׂוּ אִתָּהּ מָשׂוֹשׂ כׇּל הַמִּתְאַבְּלִים עָלֶיהָ״.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: But since were so righteous, what is the reason that they were punished said to him: because they did not mourn for Jerusalem, as it is written: “Rejoice with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all you that love her, rejoice with joy with her, all you that did mourn for her”
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: And after they were all righteous, what is the reason for punishment? He said to him: Because they did not mourn over Jerusalem, as it is written: "Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad with her, all who love her; rejoice with her in joy, all who mourn for her."

hebrew_text: אַשָּׁקָא דְרִיסְפַּק חֲרִיב בֵּיתֵּר: דַּהֲווֹ נְהִיגִי כִּי הֲוָה מִתְיְלִיד יָנוֹקָא – שָׁתְלִי אַרְזָא, יָנוֹקְתָּא – שָׁתְלִי תּוּרְנִיתָא; וְכִי הֲווֹ מִינַּסְבִי, קָיְיצִי לְהוּ וְעָבְדִי גְּנָנָא. יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא חָלְפָא בְּרַתֵּיה דְּקֵיסָר, אִתְּבַר שָׁקָא דְרִיסְפַּק. קַצּוּ אַרְזָא וְעַיִּילוּ לַהּ. אֲתוֹ נְפוּל עֲלַיְיהוּ מְחוֹנְהוּ. אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְקֵיסָר: מְרַדוּ בָּךְ יְהוּדָאֵי! אֲתָא עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Beitar was destroyed on account of a shaft from a carriage. it was customary when a boy was born they would plant a cedar a girl would plant a cypress [ tornita ]. And when they would marry they would cut and construct canopy One day the emperor’s daughter passed by the shaft of the carriage broke. chopped down a cedar and brought it to her. came fell upon them and beat them. came said to the emperor: The Jews have rebelled against you. came against them
llm_translation: Spring of Rispak, the house of Beitir was destroyed. They used to have a custom: when a boy was born - they would plant a cedar tree, when a girl was born - they would plant a cypress tree. And when they would get married, they would cut down the trees and make a canopy. One day, the daughter of the Caesar passed by their house, the cedar tree broke. They cut down the cedar tree and brought it to her. She fell off her horse. They said to the Caesar: "The Jews are rebelling against you!" He came upon them.

hebrew_text: ״גָּדַע בׇּחֳרִי אַף כֹּל קֶרֶן יִשְׂרָאֵל״ – אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵלּוּ שְׁמוֹנִים [אֶלֶף] קַרְנֵי מִלְחָמָה שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לִכְרַךְ בֵּיתֵּר בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁלְּכָדוּהָ, וְהָרְגוּ בָּהּ אֲנָשִׁים וְנָשִׁים וָטַף, עַד שֶׁהָלַךְ דָּמָן וְנָפַל לַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר קְרוֹבָה הָיְתָה? רְחוֹקָה הָיְתָה מִיל.
human_translation: “He has cut off in His fierce anger all the horn of Israel” Rabbi Zeira says Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: These are the eighty thousand battle trumpets who entered the city of Beitar when took it and killed men, women, and children until their blood flowed into the Great Sea. Lest you say was close it was a mil away.
llm_translation: "Cut down in his prime, even all the horns of Israel" - Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rabbi Abahu who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: These are the eighty thousand horns of war that entered the city of Bethar at the time of its capture, and they killed therein men, women, and children, until their blood flowed and reached the great sea. Lest you say it was close by? It was far away by a mil.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי נְחָלִים יֵשׁ בְּבִקְעַת יָדַיִם, אֶחָד מוֹשֵׁךְ אֵילָךְ, וְאֶחָד מוֹשֵׁךְ אֵילָךְ, וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים שְׁנֵי חֲלָקִים מַיִם וְאֶחָד דָּם. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים בָּצְרוּ גּוֹיִם אֶת כַּרְמֵיהֶן מִדָּמָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּלֹא זֶבֶל.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: There are two rivers in the Yadayim Valley one flowing one way and one flowing the other way. And the Sages estimated two parts water to one part blood. it was taught in a baraita : For seven years the gentiles harvested their vineyards with the blood of Israel without fertilizer.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: There are two rivers in the valley of Yadin, one flowing this way and one flowing that way, and the sages estimated that two parts are water and one part is blood. In a baraita it was taught: For seven years the nations besieged their vineyards with the blood of Israel, without manure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה, סָח לִי זָקֵן אֶחָד מֵאַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם: בְּבִקְעָה זוֹ הָרַג נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב טַבָּחִים מָאתַיִם וְאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה רִבּוֹא, וּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם הָרַג תִּשְׁעִים וְאַרְבַּע רִבּוֹא עַל אֶבֶן אַחַת, עַד שֶׁהָלַךְ דָּמָן וְנָגַע בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל זְכַרְיָה, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדָמִים בְּדָמִים נָגְעוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: An old man from the inhabitants of Jerusalem related to me: In this valley Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard killed 211,000 And in Jerusalem he killed 94,000 on one stone, until the blood flowed and touched the blood of Zechariah to fulfill what is stated: “And blood touches blood”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Avin said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said, "I have heard from an elder of the people of Jerusalem: In this valley Nebuzaradan, the chief slaughterer, killed two hundred and eleven thousand, and in Jerusalem he killed ninety-four thousand on one stone, until his blood mingled with the blood of Zechariah, to fulfill what is said: 'And bloods touched bloods.'"

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לִדְמֵיהּ דִּזְכַרְיָה דַּהֲוָה קָא מִרְתַח וְסָלֵיק, אֲמַר: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דַּם זְבָחִים דְּאִשְׁתְּפוּךְ. אַיְיתִי דְּמֵי וְלָא אִידְּמוֹ.
human_translation: found the blood of Zechariah, that it was bubbling up he said: What is this? said to him: sacrificial blood that had been poured He brought blood, and it was not similar
llm_translation: He found its likeness of the memory of Zachariah who was boiling and ascending, he said: What is this? They said to him: The blood of sacrifices that spilled. He brought blood but they did not resemble it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי אָמְרִיתוּ לִי – מוּטָב, וְאִי לָאו – מְסָרֵיקְנָא לְבִשְׂרַיְיכוּ בְּמַסְרְקֵי דְפַרְזְלֵי. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מַאי נֵימָא לָךְ? נְבִיָּיא הֲוָה בַּן דַּהֲוָה קָא מוֹכַח לַן בְּמִילֵּי דִשְׁמַיָּא, קַמְינַן עִילָּוֵיהּ וּקְטַלְינַן לֵיהּ, וְהָא כַּמָּה שְׁנִין דְּלָא קָא נָיַיח דְּמֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to If you tell me well But if not, I will comb your flesh with iron combs. They said to him: What shall we say to you? He was a prophet among us, who used to rebuke us about heavenly matters, we rose up against him, and killed him and for many years his blood has not settled.
llm_translation: He said to them: If you have told me - good, and if not - I will pierce your flesh with iron prongs. They said to him: What is the meaning for you? He was a prophet, the son of a prophet, who was rebuking us with words of heaven, we rose against him and killed him, and his blood did not settle for many years.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא מְפַיֵּיסְנָא לֵיהּ. אַיְיתִי סַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה וְסַנְהֶדְרִי קְטַנָּה קְטַל עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְלָא נָח. בַּחוּרִים וּבְתוּלוֹת קְטַל עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְלָא נָח. אַיְיתִי תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן קְטַל עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְלָא נָח. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זְכַרְיָה, זְכַרְיָה, טוֹבִים שֶׁבָּהֶן אִיבַּדְתִּים, נִיחָא לָךְ דְּאֹבְדִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ? כְּדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי, נָח.
human_translation: said to them: I will appease He brought the Great Sanhedrin and a lesser Sanhedrin killed them alongside but did not settle. young men and virgins and killed them alongside it, but did not settle. He brought schoolchildren and killed them alongside it, but did not settle. said to him: Zechariah, Zechariah, I have killed the best of them. please you if I destroyed them all? When he said this, settled.
llm_translation: He said to them: I am appeasing him. I brought a great Sanhedrin and a small Sanhedrin, I killed them, and it did not help. I killed young men and maidens, and it did not help. I brought infants from the school of Rabban, I killed them, and it did not help. He said to him: Zechariah, Zechariah, have I destroyed the good ones among them, is it pleasing to you that I destroy them all? As he said to him thus, it helped.

hebrew_text: בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא הַרְהַר תְּשׁוּבָה בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ, אֲמַר: וּמָה אִם עַל נֶפֶשׁ אַחַת, כָּךְ; הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּקְטַל כׇּל הָנֵי נִשְׁמָתָא – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה! עֲרַק, אֲזַל שַׁדַּר שְׁטַר פִּרְטְתָא בְּבֵיתֵיהּ, וְאִגַּיַּיר.
human_translation: At that moment contemplated repentance said If, for one soul, this that man, who has killed all of those souls, all the more so He fled, sent to his house a document detailing and converted
llm_translation: At that moment, he contemplated repentance in his mind, saying: "And if for one soul, so; that man who killed all those souls - for one how much more so! He fled, went and sent a bill of divorce to his wife, and divorced her.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: נַעֲמָן גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב הָיָה; נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן גֵּר צֶדֶק הָיָה;
human_translation: taught Naaman, was a ger toshav , Nebuzaradan, was a convert,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Naaman was a resident alien; Nebuzaradan was a righteous convert.

hebrew_text: מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל הָמָן לִמְּדוּ תּוֹרָה בִּבְנֵי בְרַק; מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל סִיסְרָא לִמְּדוּ תִּינוֹקוֹת בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם; מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל סַנְחֵרִיב לִמְּדוּ תּוֹרָה בָּרַבִּים – מַאן אִינּוּן? שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן.
human_translation: of Haman’s descendants studied Torah in Bnei Brak, of Sisera’s descendants taught children in Jerusalem, of Sennacherib’s descendants taught Torah in public. Who are they? Shemaya and Avtalyon,
llm_translation: From the descendants of Haman they learned Torah in the children of Barak; from the descendants of Sisera they taught infants in Jerusalem; from the descendants of Sancheirev they learned Torah in public - who are they? Shemaiah and Avtalyon.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״נָתַתִּי אֶת דָּמָהּ עַל צְחִיחַ סָלַע לְבִלְתִּי הִכָּסוֹת״.
human_translation: this is that which is written: “I have set her blood upon the bare rock that it should not be covered”
llm_translation: That is as it is written: "I have set her blood upon the bare rock, that it should not be covered."

hebrew_text: ״הַקּוֹל קוֹל יַעֲקֹב וְהַיָּדַיִם יְדֵי עֵשָׂו״ – ״הַקּוֹל״, זֶה אַדְרִיָּינוּס קֵיסָר, שֶׁהָרַג בַּאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא עַל שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא, כִּפְלַיִם כְּיוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם. ״קוֹל יַעֲקֹב״ – זֶה אַסְפַּסְיָינוּס קֵיסָר, שֶׁהָרַג בִּכְרַךְ בֵּיתֵּר אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת רִבּוֹא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים רִבּוֹא. ״וְהַיָּדַיִם יְדֵי עֵשָׂו״ – זוֹ מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה, שֶׁהֶחְרִיבָה אֶת בָּתֵּינוּ, וְשָׂרְפָה אֶת הֵיכָלֵנוּ, וְהִגְלְתָנוּ מֵאַרְצֵנוּ.
human_translation: “The voice is the voice of Jacob, but the hands are the hands of Esau” “The voice”; this the emperor Hadrian, who killed six hundred thousand on six hundred thousand in Alexandria of Egypt, twice who left Egypt. “The voice of Jacob”; this is the emperor Vespasian, who killed four million in the city of Beitar. And some say: forty million “And the hands are the hands of Esau”; this is the wicked kingdom that destroyed our Temple, burned our Sanctuary, and exiled us from our land.
llm_translation: "The voice is the voice of Jacob, but the hands are the hands of Esau" - "The voice" - this is Adrinyinus Caesar, who killed in Alexandria of Egypt sixty myriads, on sixty myriads, twice as many as those who left Egypt. "The voice of Jacob" - this is Aspasyinus Caesar, who killed in Bark Beitar four hundred myriads, and some say: four thousand myriads. "And the hands are the hands of Esau" - this is the wicked kingdom, which destroyed our Temple, burned our sanctuary, and exiled us from our land."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״הַקּוֹל קוֹל יַעֲקֹב״ – אֵין לְךָ תְּפִלָּה שֶׁמּוֹעֶלֶת, שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מִזַּרְעוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. ״וְהַיָּדַיִם יְדֵי עֵשָׂו״ – אֵין לְךָ מִלְחָמָה שֶׁנּוֹצַחַת, שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מִזַּרְעוֹ שֶׁל עֵשָׂו.
human_translation: Alternatively, “the voice is the voice of Jacob” no prayer is effective unless the seed of Jacob has in it. “and the hands are the hands of Esau,” no war grants victory unless the seed of Esau has in it.
llm_translation: Another explanation: "The voice is the voice of Jacob" - you have no prayer that is rejected, as it does not contain the seed of Jacob. "And the hands are the hands of Esau" - you have no war that is victorious, as it does not contain the seed of Esau.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״בְּשׁוֹט לָשׁוֹן תֵּחָבֵא״ – בְּחִירְחוּרֵי לָשׁוֹן תֵּחָבֵא. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל נַהֲרוֹת בָּבֶל, שָׁם יָשַׁבְנוּ גַּם בָּכִינוּ בְּזׇכְרֵנוּ אֶת צִיּוֹן״? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶרְאָהוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְדָוִד חוּרְבַּן בַּיִת רִאשׁוֹן וְחוּרְבַּן בַּיִת שֵׁנִי. חוּרְבַּן בַּיִת רִאשׁוֹן – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל נַהֲרוֹת בָּבֶל שָׁם יָשַׁבְנוּ גַּם בָּכִינוּ״. בַּיִת שֵׁנִי – דִּכְתִיב: ״זְכוֹר ה׳ לִבְנֵי אֱדוֹם אֵת יוֹם יְרוּשָׁלִָים, הָאוֹמְרִים עָרוּ עָרוּ עַד הַיְסוֹד בָּהּ״.
human_translation: And this is Rabbi Elazar says: “You shall be hid from the scourge of the tongue” You shall hide on account of quarrels by the tongue. Rav Yehuda says Rav says: What which is written: “By the rivers of Babylonia, there we sat down and wept, when we remembered Zion” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, showed David the destruction of the First Temple and the destruction of the Second Temple. the First Temple, as it is stated: “By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down and wept.” Second Temple, as it is written “Remember, O Lord, against the children of Edom the day of Jerusalem, when they said: Raze it, raze it, to its very foundation”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: "With a whip, language will be hidden" - with the choice of language it will be hidden. Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav, what is the meaning of what is written: "By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat, also we wept when we remembered Zion"? This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, showed David the destruction of the first Temple and the destruction of the second Temple. The destruction of the first Temple - as it is said: "By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat, also we wept." The destruction of the second Temple - as it is written: "Remember, O Lord, against the children of Edom the day of Jerusalem; who said, 'Raze it, raze it, even to its foundation.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אַמֵּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת יְלָדִים וִילָדוֹת שֶׁנִּשְׁבּוּ לְקָלוֹן, הִרְגִּישׁוּ בְּעַצְמָן לְמָה הֵן מִתְבַּקְּשִׁים, אָמְרוּ: אִם אָנוּ טוֹבְעִין בַּיָּם – אָנוּ בָּאִין לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא? דָּרַשׁ לָהֶן הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶן: ״אָמַר ה׳ מִבָּשָׁן אָשִׁיב, אָשִׁיב מִמְּצוּלוֹת יָם״ – ״מִבָּשָׁן אָשִׁיב״, מִבֵּין שִׁינֵּי אַרְיֵה; ״אָשִׁיב מִמְּצוּלוֹת יָם״, אֵלּוּ שֶׁטּוֹבְעִין בַּיָּם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says, and some say Rabbi Ami and some say it was taught in a baraita : an incident involving four hundred boys and girls who were taken as captives for prostitution. sensed on their own what they were expected they said: If we drown in the sea, we come to life in the World-to-Come? The oldest among them expounded “The Lord said, I will bring back from Bashan, I will bring them back from the depths of the sea” “I will bring back from Bashan,” from between the teeth [ bein shen ] of the lion, “I will bring them back from the depths of the sea” those who drown in the sea
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, and some say it was Rabbi Ammi, and it was taught in a baraita: There was an incident with four hundred boys and girls who were taken captive for disgrace, they thought to themselves, why are we seeking this? They said: If we drown in the sea - will we come to the World to Come? The elder among them expounded to them: "God said, 'I will bring back from Bashan, I will bring back from the depths of the sea'" - "I will bring back from Bashan," from between the teeth of the lion; "I will bring back from the depths of the sea," those who drown in the sea.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ יְלָדוֹת כָּךְ, קָפְצוּ כּוּלָּן וְנָפְלוּ לְתוֹךְ הַיָּם. נָשְׂאוּ יְלָדִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמָן, וְאָמְרוּ: מָה הַלָּלוּ, שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לְכָךְ – כָּךְ; אָנוּ, שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכֵּנוּ לְכָךְ – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה! אַף הֵם קָפְצוּ לְתוֹךְ הַיָּם. וַעֲלֵיהֶם הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי עָלֶיךָ הֹרַגְנוּ כׇל הַיּוֹם, נֶחְשַׁבְנוּ כְּצֹאן טִבְחָה״.
human_translation: When the girls heard this, they all leapt and fell into the sea. The boys drew an a fortiori with regard to themselves and said: If these for whom is their natural way, such we, for whom is not our natural way, all the more so They too leapt into the sea. Concerning them the verse states: “As For Your sake we are killed all the day long; we are reckoned as sheep for the slaughter”
llm_translation: Since they heard like this, all of them jumped and fell into the sea. The children themselves took a strict stance and said: "What are these Israelites, whose way is like this - like this; and we, whose way is not like this - all the more so!" They too jumped into the sea. And regarding them, the verse says: "For Your sake we are killed all day long, we are considered as sheep for the slaughter."

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: זוֹ אִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה בָּנֶיהָ – אַתְיוּהּ לְקַמָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּקֵיסָר, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פְּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״אָנֹכִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״. אַפְּקוּהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said: This woman and her seven sons They brought the first before the emperor said to him: Worship the idol. He said to them: it is written in the Torah: “I am the Lord your God” They took him out and killed him.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: This is a woman and her seven sons - they brought her before the Caesar, they said to her: Worship idolatry! She said to them, it is written in the Torah: "I am the Lord your God." They took her out and killed her.

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְאִידַּךְ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּקֵיסָר, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פְּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״לֹא יִהְיֶה לְךָ אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים עַל פָּנָי״. אַפְּקוּהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ. אַתְיוּהּ לְאִידַּךְ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פְּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״זוֹבֵחַ לֵאלֹהִים יׇחֳרָם״. אַפְּקוּהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ.
human_translation: And they brought another before the emperor, said to him: Worship the idol. He said to them: it is written in the Torah: “You shall have no other gods beside Me” they took him out and killed him. They brought in another said to him: Worship the idol. He said to them: it is written in the Torah: “He that sacrifices to any god, he shall be utterly destroyed” they took him out and killed him.
llm_translation: He came to his fellow before Caesar, they said to him: Worship foreign gods! He said to them, it is written in the Torah: "You shall have no other gods before Me." They took him out and killed him. He came to his fellow, they said to him: Worship foreign gods! He said to them, it is written in the Torah: "One who sacrifices to gods shall be utterly destroyed." They took him out and killed him.

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְאִידַּךְ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פְּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״לֹא תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לְאֵל אַחֵר״. אַפְּקוּהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ. אַתְיוּהּ לְאִידַּךְ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פְּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״. אַפְּקוּהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ.
human_translation: They brought another said to him: Worship the idol. He said to them: it is written in the Torah: “You shall not bow down to any other god” they took him out and killed him. They brought another said to him: Worship the idol. He said to them: it is written in the Torah: “Hear, O Israel, the Lord is our God, the Lord is One” they took him out and killed him.
llm_translation: He came to his companion, they said to him: "Worship idolatry!" He said to them, "It is written in the Torah: 'You shall not bow down to another god.'" They took him out and killed him. He came to his companion, they said to him: "Worship idolatry!" He said to them, "It is written in the Torah: 'Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is One.'" They took him out and killed him.

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְאִידַּךְ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פְּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״וְיָדַעְתָּ הַיּוֹם וַהֲשֵׁבוֹתָ אֶל לְבָבֶךָ, כִּי ה׳ הוּא הָאֱלֹהִים בַּשָּׁמַיִם מִמַּעַל וְעַל הָאָרֶץ מִתָּחַת, אֵין עוֹד״. אַפְּקוּהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ.
human_translation: They brought another said to him: Worship the idol. He said to them: it is written in the Torah: “Know therefore this today, and consider it in your heart, that the Lord, He is God in heaven above and upon the earth beneath; there is no other” they took him out and killed him.
llm_translation: He came to his companion, they said to him: "Plow for idol worship!" He said to them, "It is written in the Torah: 'And you shall know today and take it to your heart, that the Lord, He is the God in the heavens above and on the earth below, there is none else.'" They seized him and killed him.

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְאִידַּךְ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: פְּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״אֶת ה׳ הֶאֱמַרְתָּ וְגוֹ׳ וַה׳ הֶאֱמִירְךָ הַיּוֹם״, כְּבָר נִשְׁבַּעְנוּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ מַעֲבִירִין אוֹתוֹ בְּאֵל אַחֵר, וְאַף הוּא נִשְׁבַּע לָנוּ שֶׁאֵין מַעֲבִיר אוֹתָנוּ בְּאוּמָּה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: They brought another said to him: Worship the idol. He said to them: it is written in the Torah: “You have avouched the Lord and the Lord has avouched you this day We already took an oath to the Holy One, Blessed be He, that we will not exchange Him for a different god, and He too has taken an oath to us that He will not exchange us for another nation.
llm_translation: He came to his companion, they said to him: "Plow for idol worship!" He said to them, "It is written in the Torah: 'You have declared today that the Lord is your God' (Deuteronomy 26:17), we have already sworn to the Holy One, blessed be He, that we will not pass Him over for another god, and He also swore to us that He will not pass us over for another nation."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר: אֶישְׁדֵּי לָךְ גּוּשְׁפַּנְקָא וּגְחֵין וְשִׁקְלֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵימְרוּ: קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ הַרְמָנָא דְּמַלְכָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲבָל עֲלָךְ קֵיסָר, חֲבָל עֲלָךְ קֵיסָר; עַל כְּבוֹד עַצְמְךָ כָּךְ, עַל כְּבוֹד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: the emperor said to him: I will throw down my seal before you; bend over and pick it up, so that will say he has accepted the king’s authority [ harmana ]. said to him: Woe [ ḥaval ] to you, Caesar, woe to you, Caesar. for the sake of your honor this, for the sake of the honor of the Holy One, Blessed be He, all the more so
llm_translation: He said to him, "Caesar, take your silver and gold and weigh it, so that they will say: 'Accept the tribute of the king.' He said to him, 'Woe to you, Caesar, woe to you, Caesar; for your own honor, so much, for the honor of the Holy One, blessed be He, how much more so!"

hebrew_text: אַפְּקוּהּ לְמִיקְטְלֵיהּ, אֲמַרָה לְהוּ אִימֵּיהּ: יַהֲבוּהּ נִיהֲלִי וְאֶינַשְּׁקֵיהּ פּוּרְתָּא. אָמְרָה לוֹ: בָּנַיי, לְכוּ וְאִמְרוּ לְאַבְרָהָם אֲבִיכֶם: אַתָּה עָקַדְתָּ מִזְבֵּחַ אֶחָד וַאֲנִי עָקַדְתִּי שִׁבְעָה מִזְבְּחוֹת! אַף הִיא עָלְתָה לַגַּג וְנָפְלָה וּמֵתָה. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״אֵם הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה״.
human_translation: they were taking him out to be killed, his mother said to them: Give him to me so that I may give him a small kiss. She said to him: My son, go and say to your father Abraham, You bound one altar, but I bound seven altars. She too went up to the roof, fell, and died. A Divine Voice emerged and said: “A joyful mother of children”
llm_translation: They took him to kill him, his mother said to them: Give him to me and I will kiss him once. She said to him: My sons, go and tell your father Abraham: You bound one altar, and I bound seven altars! She also went up to the roof, fell, and died. A heavenly voice came out and said: "The mother of the children is rejoicing."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: זוֹ מִילָה שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בַּשְּׁמִינִי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁמַּרְאִין הִלְכוֹת שְׁחִיטָה בְּעַצְמָן, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: כֹּל מִילֵּי לִיחְזֵי אִינִישׁ בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, בַּר מִשְּׁחִיטָה וְדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says this circumcision, which was given for the eighth Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Torah scholars who demonstrate the halakhot of slaughter on themselves, as Rava says: A person may demonstrate anything using himself except for slaughter and another matter,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: This is circumcision that was given on the eighth day. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: These are Torah scholars who can determine the laws of ritual slaughter by themselves, as Rava said: "All matters are subject to a person's own judgment, except for slaughter and another matter."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁמְּמִיתִין עַצְמָן עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, כִּדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּמִית עַצְמוֹ עֲלֵיהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זֹאת הַתּוֹרָה אָדָם כִּי יָמוּת בְּאֹהֶל וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: These are Torah scholars who kill themselves over the words of Torah, in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish. As Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: The words of the Torah endure only for one who kills himself over them, as it is stated: “This is the Torah, when a man dies in a tent” Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Forty se’a
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: These are the students of the sages who cause themselves to die through matters of Torah, like Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish - for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: The words of Torah are only upheld by one who causes himself to die for them, as it is stated: "This is the Torah, when a man dies in a tent, etc." Rabba bar bar Chana said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Forty se'ah.

hebrew_text: קְצוּצֵי תְפִילִּין נִמְצְאוּ בְּרָאשֵׁי הֲרוּגֵי בֵיתֵּר. רַבִּי יַנַּאי בְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר: שָׁלֹשׁ קוּפּוֹת שֶׁל אַרְבָּעִים אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: אַרְבָּעִים קוּפּוֹת שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ סְאִין.
human_translation: of phylactery boxes were found on the heads of those killed in Beitar. Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yishmael, says: three large baskets forty se’a it was taught in a baraita : forty large baskets three se’a .
llm_translation: The fringes of the phylacteries were found in the heads of the slain of Beitar. Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yishmael, said: Three heaps of forty forty se'ah. In a baraita it was taught: Forty heaps of three three se'ah.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא דְּרֵישָׁא, הָא דִּדְרָעָא.
human_translation: And do not disagree: This of the head, this of the arm,
llm_translation: And they do not argue: this that was stated first, this that was stated later.
