hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: אַרְבָּעָה קַבִּין מוֹחַ נִמְצְאוּ עַל אֶבֶן אַחַת. עוּלָּא אָמַר: תִּשְׁעַת קַבִּין. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא וְאִיתֵּימָא שֵׁילָא בַּר מָרִי: מַאי קְרָאָה? ״בַּת בָּבֶל הַשְּׁדוּדָה, אַשְׁרֵי שֶׁיְשַׁלֶּם לָךְ וְגוֹ׳, אַשְׁרֵי שֶׁיֹּאחֵז וְנִפֵּץ אֶת עוֹלָלַיִךְ אֶל הַסָּלַע״.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says: Four kav of brains were found on one stone. Ulla says: Nine kav . Rav Kahana said, and some say Sheila bar Mari What is the verse “O daughter of Babylon, marked for devastation; happy is he who shall repay you Happy is he who shall seize and dash your little ones against the rock”
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said: Four kavim of moach were found on one stone. Ula said: Nine kavim. Rav Kahana said, and some say it was Sheilah bar Mari: What is the verse? "O daughter of Babylon, who is to be destroyed, happy is he who repays you as you have done to us. Happy is he who takes and dashes your little ones against the rock."

hebrew_text: ״בְּנֵי צִיּוֹן הַיְקָרִים הַמְסוּלָּאִים בַּפָּז״ – מַאי ״מְסוּלָּאִים בַּפָּז״? אִילֵּימָא דַּהֲווֹ מְחַפִּי בְּפִיזָּא, וְהָאָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: תַּרְתֵּי מַתְקָלֵי אִיסְתֵּירֵי פִּיזָּא נְחוּת בְּעָלְמָא – חֲדָא בְּרוֹמִי, וַחֲדָא בְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא! אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיוּ מְגַנִּין אֶת הַפָּז בְּיוֹפְיָין.
human_translation: “The precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold” What “comparable to fine gold”? If we say that they were covered in fine gold [ piza ], but didn’t the school of Rabbi Sheila say: Two istira weights of fine gold came down into the world, one in Rome and one in all the world. Rather, that they would disgrace fine gold because of their beauty.
llm_translation: Sons of Zion, the precious, adorned in gold - What is "adorned in gold"? If you say that they were covering themselves with gold, but the House of Rabbi Sheila said: Two things obscure the beauty of gold in the world - one is poverty, and one is excessive wealth! Rather, they were protecting the gold with beauty.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא, חֲשִׁיבִי דְרוֹמָאֵי הֲווֹ נָקְטִי בִּלְיוֹנָא דְגוּשְׁפַּנְקָא, וּמְשַׁמְּשִׁי עַרְסַיְיהוּ; מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, מַיְיתוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָסְרִי בְּכַרְעֵי דְּפוּרַיְיהוּ, וּמְשַׁמְּשִׁי.
human_translation: initially the noblemen of Rome would keep an image on a seal and engage in sexual intercourse From this forward, they would bring Jewish children, tie them to the foot of their beds, and engage in sexual intercourse
llm_translation: From the outset, the esteemed individuals from Rome would take a basket of fine white wool and make use of it; from here on, the children of Israel would bring and tie their firstborn calves' legs, and make use of them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ חַד לְחַבְרֵיהּ: הָא, הֵיכָא כְּתִיבָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״גַּם כׇּל חֳלִי וְכׇל מַכָּה אֲשֶׁר לֹא כָתוּב בְּסֵפֶר הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת״. אֲמַר: כַּמָּה מְרַחַיקְנָא מִדּוּכְתָּא פְּלָן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִינְּגֵד פּוּסְתָּא וּפַלְגָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מְטַאי לְגַבֵּיהּ לָא אִיצְטְרִיכִי לָךְ.
human_translation: one said to the other: Where is this written said to him: “Also every sickness, and every plague, which is not written in the book of this Torah” said: How far am I from this, said: Had you gone on one and a half columns [ pusta ], said to Had I reached this I would not have needed you,
llm_translation: He said to him one to his colleagues: "Here, where is it written?" He said to him: "Also every illness and every wound that is not written in this Torah scroll." He said: "How far are we distancing ourselves from such and such a place?" He said to him: "A Parsa and a half." He said to him: "If he comes towards you, I do not need you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵינִי עוֹלְלָה לְנַפְשִׁי מִכֹּל בְּנוֹת עִירִי״? אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת הָיוּ בִּכְרַךְ בֵּיתֵּר, וּבְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת הָיוּ בָּהּ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת מְלַמְּדֵי תִּינוֹקוֹת, וְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הָיוּ לְפָנָיו אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: What which is written: “My eye affects my soul because of all the daughters of my city” There were four hundred synagogues in the city of Beitar, and in each and every one of them there were four hundred schoolteachers, and each and every one had four hundred schoolchildren.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, what is the meaning of what is written: "My eye is afflicted by my soul because of all the daughters of my city"? There were four hundred synagogues in the district of Beit Tzur, and in each and every one of them there were four hundred teachers of young children, and each and every one of them had before him four hundred young children of the school of Rabban.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהָיָה אוֹיֵב נִכְנָס לְשָׁם הָיוּ דּוֹקְרִין אוֹתָן בְּחוֹטְרֵיהֶן. וּכְשֶׁגָּבַר אוֹיֵב וּלְכָדוּם, כְּרָכוּם בְּסִפְרֵיהֶם וְהִצִּיתוּם בָּאֵשׁ.
human_translation: And when the enemy entered there, stabbed them with their pens [ beḥotreihen ]. And when the enemy prevailed and caught them, they wrapped in their scrolls and lit them on fire.
llm_translation: And when the enemy entered there, they would pierce them with their staves. And when the enemy prevailed and captured them, they wrapped them in their scrolls and burned them with fire.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה שֶׁהָלַךְ לִכְרַךְ גָּדוֹל שֶׁבְּרוֹמִי, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: תִּינוֹק אֶחָד יֵשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים, יְפֵה עֵינַיִם וְטוֹב רוֹאִי וּקְווּצּוֹתָיו סְדוּרוֹת לוֹ תַּלְתַּלִּים. הָלַךְ וְעָמַד עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִים, אָמַר: ״מִי נָתַן לִמְשִׁיסָּה יַעֲקֹב וְיִשְׂרָאֵל לְבוֹזְזִים״? עָנָה אוֹתוֹ תִּינוֹק וְאָמַר: ״הֲלֹא ה׳ זוּ חָטָאנוּ לוֹ וְלֹא אָבוּ בִדְרָכָיו הָלוֹךְ וְלֹא שָׁמְעוּ בְּתוֹרָתוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident involving Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya who went to the great city of Rome, they said to him: There is a child in prison beautiful eyes an attractive appearance, and his curly hair is arranged in locks. went and stood by the entrance to the prison. He said, “Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers?” That child answered by reciting “Did not the Lord, He against Whom we have sinned, and in Whose ways they would not walk, neither were they obedient to His law?”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah who went to visit a great sage in Rome. They said to him: "There is a certain child in the prison, with beautiful eyes, good appearance, and his curls arranged in rows of three. He went and stood at the entrance of the prison and said: "Who caused Jacob and Israel to be handed over to plunderers?" The child answered him and said: "Is it not the Lord whom we have sinned against, and they did not want to walk in His ways, nor did they listen to His Torah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר: מוּבְטְחַנִי בּוֹ שֶׁמּוֹרֶה הוֹרָאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, הָעֲבוֹדָה! שֶׁאֵינִי זָז מִכָּאן עַד שֶׁאֶפְדֶּנּוּ בְּכׇל מָמוֹן שֶׁפּוֹסְקִין עָלָיו. אָמְרוּ: לֹא זָז מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁפְּדָאוֹ בְּמָמוֹן הַרְבֵּה, וְלֹא הָיוּ יָמִים מוּעָטִין עַד שֶׁהוֹרָה הוֹרָאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. וּמַנּוּ? רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע.
human_translation: said: I am certain that, this issue rulings in Israel, by the Temple service that I will not move from here until I ransom him for whatever money they set for him. They said he did not move from there until he ransomed him for a great money, and not a few days issued rulings in Israel. And who was Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha.
llm_translation: He said: "I am confident in him that he teaches Torah in Israel, the service! For I will not move from here until I redeem him with all the money that is collected upon him." They said: "He did not move from there until he redeemed him with much money, and there were not many days until he taught Torah in Israel." And who is it? Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּבְנוֹ וּבְבִתּוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע שֶׁנִּשְׁבּוּ לִשְׁנֵי אֲדוֹנִים. לְיָמִים נִזְדַּוְּוגוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם בִּמְקוֹם אֶחָד, זֶה אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לִי עֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין כְּיוֹפְיוֹ בְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לִי שִׁפְחָה שֶׁאֵין בְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ כְּיוֹפְיָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: an incident involving the son and the daughter of Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha who were taken captive to two masters. After some time met in a certain place. This said: I have a male slave whose beauty is unmatched in all of the world, and that said: I have a female slave whose beauty is unmatched in all of the world.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident involving the son and daughter of Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha who were sold to two masters. After some time, they met in one place. One of them said, "I have a slave who is unmatched in the whole world," and the other said, "I have a maidservant who is unmatched in the whole world in her beauty."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: בּוֹא וְנַשִּׂיאֵם זֶה לָזֶה, וּנְחַלֵּק בַּוְּולָדוֹת. הִכְנִיסוּם לְחֶדֶר. זֶה יָשַׁב בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית זֶה, וְזוֹ יָשְׁבָה בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית זֶה, זֶה אוֹמֵר: אֲנִי, כֹּהֵן בֶּן כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים, אֶשָּׂא שִׁפְחָה?! וְזֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: אֲנִי, כֹּהֶנֶת בַּת כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים, אֶנָּשֵׂא לְעֶבֶד?! וּבָכוּ כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: said: Come, let us marry to one another and divide the children This sat in one corner, and that sat in the other corner. He said: I am a priest the descendant of High Priests. Shall I marry a female slave? And she said: I am the daughter of a priest the descendant of High Priests. Shall I be married to a male slave? And they wept all night.
llm_translation: They said: "Let us bring them together, this one to that one, and let us divide the blankets." They brought them into the room. This one sat in this corner, and that one sat in that corner. This one said: "I, a Kohen, son of great Kohanim, should marry a maidservant?!" And that one said: "I, a Kohenet, daughter of great Kohanim, should marry a slave?!" And they cried all night.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר, הִכִּירוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה, וְנָפְלוּ זֶה עַל זֶה וְגָעוּ בִּבְכִיָּה עַד שֶׁיָּצְאָה נִשְׁמָתָן. וַעֲלֵיהֶן קוֹנֵן יִרְמְיָה: ״עַל אֵלֶּה אֲנִי בוֹכִיָּה, עֵינִי עֵינִי יוֹרְדָה מַּיִם״.
human_translation: When dawn arrived they recognized each other They fell on each other and burst into tears until their souls departed And with regard to them Jeremiah lamented: “For these things I weep; my eye, my eye runs down with water”
llm_translation: Once the pillar of dawn rose, they recognized one another, and they fell on each other and wept until their souls departed. Concerning them, Jeremiah laments: "For these I weep, my eyes, my eyes flow with water."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת, וְצָפְנַת בַּת פְּנִיאֵל שְׁמָהּ; ״צָפְנַת״ – שֶׁהַכֹּל צוֹפִין בְּיוֹפְיָהּ, ״בַּת פְּנִיאֵל״ – בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים;
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: an incident involving a certain woman named Tzafenat bat Peniel. Tzafenat they would all gaze [ tzofin ] at her beauty, bat Peniel the daughter [ bat ] of the High Priest who served in the innermost sanctum [ lifnai velefnim ]
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: There was an incident involving a certain woman, and her name was Tzafnat Bat Peniel; "Tzafnat" - because everyone gazed at her beauty, "Bat Peniel" - the daughter of the High Priest who served inside and outside.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנִּתְעַלֵּל בָּהּ שַׁבַּאי כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה. לְמָחָר הִלְבִּישָׁהּ שִׁבְעָה חֲלוּקִים, וְהוֹצִיאָהּ לְמוֹכְרָהּ. בָּא אָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מְכוֹעָר בְּיוֹתֵר, אָמַר לוֹ: הַרְאֵנִי אֶת יוֹפְיָהּ. אָמַר לוֹ: רֵיקָא! אִם אַתָּה רוֹצֶה לִיקַּח – קַח, שֶׁאֵין כְּיוֹפְיָהּ בְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: her captor abused her all night. The next day he dressed her in seven garments and took her out to sell her. A certain man who was especially ugly came said to Show me her beauty. He said to him: Good-for-nothing, if you wish to buy buy for there is no beauty like hers in all of the world.
llm_translation: He indulged in her all night. The next day, he dressed her in seven garments and brought her to her seller. A certain man, who was exceedingly ugly, came to him and said: "Show me her beauty." He said to him: "Empty one! If you wish to buy, buy, for there is no beauty like hers in all the world."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן. הִפְשִׁיטָהּ שִׁשָּׁה חֲלוּקִים, וּשְׁבִיעִי קְרָעַתּוּ וְנִתְפַּלְּשָׁה בָּאֵפֶר, אָמְרָה לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אִם עָלֵינוּ לֹא חַסְתָּ, עַל קְדוּשַּׁת שִׁמְךָ (הַגִּבּוֹר) [הַגָּדוֹל] לָמָּה לֹא תָּחוּס.
human_translation: said to Even so, He removed six garments, and she tore the seventh, and rolled in ashes. She said before Master of the Universe, if You have shown no pity to us, why have You not shown pity to the sanctity of Your mighty name
llm_translation: He said to him: Even so. He stripped it into six parts, and the seventh tore and fell into the ashes. She said before him: Master of the universe, if You did not have mercy on us, for the sanctity of Your name (the Mighty) the Great, why would You not have mercy.

hebrew_text: וְעָלֶיהָ קוֹנֵן יִרְמְיָה: ״בַּת עַמִּי חִגְרִי שָׂק וְהִתְפַּלְּשִׁי בָאֵפֶר, אֵבֶל יָחִיד עֲשִׂי לָךְ מִסְפַּד תַּמְרוּרִים, כִּי פִתְאוֹם יָבֹא הַשּׁוֹדֵד עָלֵינוּ״ – ״עָלַיִךְ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״עָלֵינוּ״; כִּבְיָכוֹל, עָלַי וְעָלַיִךְ בָּא שׁוֹדֵד.
human_translation: And with regard to her Jeremiah lamented: “O daughter of My people, gird yourself with sackcloth and roll in ashes; make you mourning as for an only son, most bitter lamentation, for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us” It is not stated: Upon you, but “upon us,” the spoiler shall come, as it were, over Me and over you.
llm_translation: And upon it Jeremiah establishes: "Daughter of my people, gird yourself with sackcloth and wallow in ashes, a mourner of bitterness make for yourself, for suddenly the spoiler shall come upon us" - "Upon you" is not stated, rather "upon us"; as it is possible, upon me and upon you the spoiler comes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָשְׁקוּ גֶּבֶר וּבֵיתוֹ וְאִישׁ וְנַחֲלָתוֹ״? מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּאֵשֶׁת רַבּוֹ, וּשְׁוַלְיָא דְנַגָּרֵי הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: What which is written: so they oppress a man and his house, even a man and his heritage” an incident involving a certain man who set his eyes on his master’s wife, and he was a carpenter’s apprentice [ shulya ].
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, what is the meaning of what is written: "And they shall oppress a man and his house, a man and his inheritance"? There was an incident with a certain man who set his eyes on his master's wife, and Shulay the barber was there.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת הוּצְרַךְ (רַבּוֹ) לִלְוֹת, אָמַר לוֹ: שַׁגֵּר אִשְׁתְּךָ אֶצְלִי וְאַלְוֶנָּה. שִׁיגֵּר אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, שָׁהָה עִמָּהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים. קָדַם וּבָא אֶצְלוֹ, אָמַר לוֹ: אִשְׁתִּי שֶׁשִּׁיגַּרְתִּי לְךָ הֵיכָן הִיא? אָמַר לוֹ: אֲנִי פְּטַרְתִּיהָ לְאַלְתַּר, וְשָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁהַתִּינוֹקוֹת נִתְעַלְּלוּ בָּהּ בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: One time his master needed to borrow said to him: Send your wife to me and I will lend her He sent his wife to him, stayed with her for three days. He went back to before said to him: Where is my wife whom I sent to you? said to him: I sent her immediately, but I heard that the youth abused her on the way.
llm_translation: One time, (Rabbi) needed to borrow, he said to him: "Send your wife to me and I will lodge her." He sent his wife to him, she stayed with him for three days. He came before him and said to him: "Where is my wife that I sent to you?" He said to him: "I divorced her immediately, and I heard that the children were mistreating her on the way."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה? אָמַר לוֹ: אִם אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ לַעֲצָתִי, גָּרְשָׁהּ. אָמַר לוֹ: כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה. אָמַר לוֹ: אֲנִי אַלְוְוךָ וְתֵן לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. עָמַד זֶה וְגֵרְשָׁהּ, הָלַךְ הוּא וּנְשָׂאָהּ.
human_translation: said to What shall I do? said to him: If you listen to my advice, divorce her. He said to him: her marriage contract is large said to him: I will lend you you will give her her marriage contract. arose and divorced her, went and married her.
llm_translation: He said to him: What shall I do? He said to him: If you listen to my advice, divorce her. He said to him: Her marriage contract is extensive. He said to him: I will accompany you and give her what is written in her marriage contract. This one stood and divorced her, while the other went and married her.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ זְמַנּוֹ וְלֹא הָיָה לוֹ לְפוֹרְעוֹ, אָמַר לוֹ: בֹּא וַעֲשֵׂה עִמִּי בְּחוֹבְךָ. וְהָיוּ הֵם יוֹשְׁבִים וְאוֹכְלִים וְשׁוֹתִין, וְהוּא הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמַשְׁקֶה עֲלֵיהֶן, וְהָיוּ דְּמָעוֹת נוֹשְׁרוֹת מֵעֵינָיו וְנוֹפְלוֹת בְּכוֹסֵיהֶן. וְעַל אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְחַתֵּם גְּזַר דִּין. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: עַל שְׁתֵּי פְתִילוֹת בְּנֵר אֶחָד.
human_translation: When the time came and he did not have to repay it, said to Come and work off your debt with me. And they, would sit and eat and drink, while he, would stand and serve them their drinks. And tears would drop from his eyes and fall into their cups, and at that time sentence was sealed, And some say for two wicks in one lamp,
llm_translation: When his time arrived and he had no means to pay, he said to him: "Come and work with me to settle your debt." They were sitting, eating, and drinking, while he stood and served them. Tears were streaming from his eyes and falling into their cups. At that moment, the decree was sealed. Some say: "On two wicks in one lamp."

hebrew_text: לָקַח מִן הַסִּיקָרִיקוֹן וְכוּ׳: אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר לוֹ: ״לֵךְ, חֲזֵק וּקְנִי״, אֲבָל בִּשְׁטָר – קָנָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אַף בִּשְׁטָר נָמֵי לֹא קָנָה, עַד שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב לוֹ אַחְרָיוּת.
human_translation: one purchased from a Sicarius, Rav says: They taught only says to Go, take possession and acquire But with a bill acquires And Shmuel says: Even with a bill does not acquire unless writes him a guarantee
llm_translation: He took from the sikarikon, etc. Rav said: They only taught that he said to him, "Go, strengthen and acquire," but with a document - he acquires. And Shmuel said: Even with a document, he also does not acquire until it is written for him afterwards.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לָקַח מִן הָאִשָּׁה, וְחָזַר וְלָקַח מִן הָאִישׁ – מִקָּחוֹ קַיָּים. מִן הָאִישׁ, וְחָזַר וְלָקַח מִן הָאִשָּׁה – מִקָּחוֹ בָּטֵל, עַד שֶׁתִּכְתּוֹב לוֹ אַחְרָיוּת.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Shmuel Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: one purchased from the wife, and he returned and purchased from the husband, his purchase stands. from the husband, and he returned and purchased from the wife, his purchase is void, unless writes him a guarantee.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Shmuel, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If one took from the woman, and then took from the man - his acquisition stands. If he took from the man, and then took from the woman - his acquisition is nullified, until it is written for him afterwards.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב? אָמַר לְךָ רַב: מַאי ״אַחְרָיוּת״ – נָמֵי שְׁטָר.
human_translation: Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rav, Rav said to you: What guarantee too bill
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Nay, should it be the preference of Rav? Rav said to you: What is 'achrayut' - also a document."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לָקַח מִן הַסִּיקָרִיקוֹן, וַאֲכָלָהּ שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים בִּפְנֵי בְּעָלִים, וְחָזַר וּמְכָרָהּ לְאַחֵר – אֵין לַבְּעָלִים עַל לוֹקֵחַ שֵׁנִי כְּלוּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught one purchased from a Sicarius and consumed its for three years in the presence of the owner, and returned and sold it to another the owner has no against the second buyer.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one took from the storehouse and ate it for three years in the presence of the owners, and then returned and sold it to another - the owners have no claim against the second buyer.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּקָא טָעֵין וְאָמַר: ״מִינָּךְ זַבְנַהּ״ – אֲפִילּוּ רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי! אִי דְּלָא קָא טָעֵין וְאָמַר: ״מִינָּךְ זַבְנַהּ״, אֲפִילּוּ שֵׁנִי נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If claims and says purchased it from you, even the first if does not claim and say He purchased from you, even the second also not
llm_translation: "How are the circumstances? If he erred and said, 'From yours I bought it' – even if the first witness is credible! If he did not err and said, 'From yours I bought it,' even the second witness is not credible!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא קָא טָעֵין לֵיהּ, וּכְגוֹן זֶה – טוֹעֲנִין לְיוֹרֵשׁ, וְטוֹעֲנִין לְלוֹקֵחַ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: Actually, where does not claim And such as this makes a claim on behalf of an heir and makes a claim on behalf of a buyer.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Always that not he is mistaken to him, and such as this - they load to the inheritor, and they load to the buyer.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, אִי טָעֵין – אִין, וְאִי לָא טָעֵין – לָא.
human_translation: the other if claims yes, But if he does not make a claim, not
llm_translation: And the other opinion, if they erred - no, and if they did not err - no.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּא מֵחֲמַת חוֹב וּמֵחֲמַת אַנְפָּרוּת – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם סִיקָרִיקוֹן, וְאַנְפָּרוּת עַצְמָהּ – צְרִיכָה שֶׁתִּשְׁהֶה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught due to of a debt or due to unjust seizure [ anparot ] Sicarii do not And unjustly seized land itself must remain for twelve months
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who comes due to a debt or due to a pledge - does not have any right to interest, and the pledge itself - requires that it remain for twelve months.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם סִיקָרִיקוֹן! הָכִי קָאָמַר: סִיקָרִיקוֹן עַצְמָהּ – צְרִיכָה שֶׁתִּשְׁהֶה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: But didn’t you say the laws of Sicarii do not apply This is what is saying: the Sicarius himself must remain twelve months.
llm_translation: The text states: "And you said there is no sīqārīqōn in it! This is what it means: sīqārīqōn itself - it needs to wait twelve months."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, נָקְטִינַן: אֵין אַנְפָּרוּת בְּבָבֶל. וְהָא קָחָזֵינַן דְּאִיכָּא! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אֵין דִּין אַנְפָּרוּת בְּבָבֶל. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא בֵּי דַוּוֹאר וְלָא אָזֵיל קָבֵיל, אֵימָא אַחוֹלֵי אַחֵיל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says we have a tradition there is no unjust seizure of land in Babylonia. But don’t we see that there is Rather, say there is no law of unjust seizure in Babylonia, What is the reason Since there is a regional seat of government [ bei davar ], and does not go and complain say that he waived
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, "We have established: there is no 'anparut' in Babylonia." But behold, we see that there is! Rather say: there is no 'din anparut' in Babylonia. What is the reason? Since there is a house of assembly and I do not go to receive, say, I will go and receive.

hebrew_text: גִּידּוּל בַּר רְעִילַאי קַבֵּיל אַרְעָא בְּטַסְקָא מִבְּנֵי בָאגָא. אַקְדֵּים וְיָהֵיב זוּזֵי דִּתְלָת שְׁנִין. לְסוֹף אֲתָא מָרְווֹתָא קַמָּאֵי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: שַׁתָּא קַמַּיְיתָא דִּיהַבְתְּ – אֲכַלְתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא אֲנַן יָהֲבִינַן – אֲנַן אָכְלִינַן.
human_translation: Giddel bar Re’ilai received land from the residents of valley for land tax [ taska ]. gave the money for three years in advance, Eventually, the prior owners came and said to the first year for which you paid you have consumed Now we will pay we will consume
llm_translation: Gidul son of Reilai received a field in Taska from the sons of Baga. He advanced and gave three years' worth of rent. In the end, the owners came before him and said: "The year that you have given – you may eat, the year that we give – we will eat."

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, סָבַר מִיכְתַּב לֵיהּ טִירְפָא אַבְּנֵי בָאגָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: אִם כֵּן, עָשִׂיתָ סִיקָרִיקוֹן! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הִנִּיחַ מְעוֹתָיו עַל קֶרֶן הַצְּבִי.
human_translation: came before Rav Pappa thought writing for authorization to repossess against the residents of the valley [ baga ], Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: If so, you made a Sicarius, Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: placed his money on the horn of a deer,
llm_translation: They came before Rav Papa, he thought to bring him a stone of the roof. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Papa: If so, you made a skylight! Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: He placed his purse on the horn of the deer.

hebrew_text: זוֹ מִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אַחֲרֵיהֶן אָמְרוּ: הַלּוֹקֵחַ מִן הַסִּיקָרִיקוֹן נוֹתֵן לַבְּעָלִים רְבִיעַ: אָמַר רַב: רְבִיעַ בְּקַרְקַע, אוֹ רְבִיעַ בְּמָעוֹת. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: רְבִיעַ בְּקַרְקַע – שֶׁהֵן שְׁלִישׁ בְּמָעוֹת.
human_translation: This is the initial mishna. the court of those after said: one who purchased from a Sicarius, he must give the owner one-fourth Rav says: one-fourth of land, or one-fourth in money, And Shmuel says: one-fourth of land, which is one-third of the money
llm_translation: This is the first Mishnah. The court following them said: One who buys from the silk merchant gives to the owners a quarter. Rav said: A quarter in land, or a quarter in money. And Shmuel said: A quarter in land - which is a third in money.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: נְכֵי רְבִיעַ זָבֵין, וּמָר סָבַר: נְכֵי חוּמְשָׁא זָבֵין.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds sold for one-fourth less And Sage, holds sold for one-fifth less
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds: the emissions of a Revi'it are impure, and the other Master holds: the emissions of a Chamisha are impure.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: זוֹ מִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אַחֲרֵיהֶן אָמְרוּ: הַלּוֹקֵחַ מִן הַסִּיקָרִיקוֹן, נוֹתֵן לַבְּעָלִים רְבִיעַ, וְיַד בְּעָלִים עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה – רָצוּ בְּקַרְקַע נוֹטְלִין, רָצוּ בְּמָעוֹת נוֹטְלִין. אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בְּיָדָן לִיקַּח, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בְּיָדָן לִיקַּח – הֵן קוֹדְמִין לְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: raises an objection This is the initial mishna. the court of those after said: one who purchased from a Sicarius, he must give the owner one-fourth and the owner has the advantage. he wants land, he takes he wants money, he takes When At a time when is unable to purchase but if he is able to purchase he precedes anyone
llm_translation: Challenger: This is the first Mishnah. The court following them said: One who buys from the silk merchant, gives to the owners a quarter, and the hand of the owners is on the upper part - if they want to acquire land, they take it, if they want to acquire coins, they take them. When? When they do not have the means in their hand to take, but if they have the means in their hand to take - they have precedence over all people.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי הוֹשִׁיב בֵּית דִּין וְנִמְנוּ, שֶׁאִם שָׁהֲתָה בִּפְנֵי סִיקָרִיקוֹן שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ, כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם לִיקַּח – זָכָה, אֲבָל נוֹתֵן לַבְּעָלִים רְבִיעַ בְּקַרְקַע אוֹ רְבִיעַ בְּמָעוֹת!
human_translation: Rabbi convened a court, and they counted that if remained before, the Sicarius twelve months, whoever first purchases acquires possession but he must give the owner one-fourth of land or one-fourth in money.
llm_translation: Rabbi sat in the court and they counted, that if she stayed in front of Sikarikon for twelve months, anyone who precedes to take - he merits, but gives to the owners a quarter in land or a quarter in money!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, לְאַחַר שֶׁבָּאוּ מָעוֹת לְיָדוֹ. אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: When that is taught, after the money reached possession. Rav says:
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: When it was taught, "after the money came into his hand." Rav said:

hebrew_text: אֲנָא הֲוַאי בְּמִנְיָינָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי, וּמִינַּאי דִּידִי מְנוֹ בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: I was for the counting in the school of Rabbi and they would start with me first,
llm_translation: I was among the students of the house of Rabbi, and my portion I would take at the beginning.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְהַטְּהָרוֹת וְהַטְּמָאוֹת – מַתְחִילִין מִן הַגָּדוֹל, וְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת מַתְחִילִין מִן הַצַּד!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn monetary law and ritual purities and impurities, begin the most learned But in capital law, begin on the side
llm_translation: And we learned: Laws of monetary matters, purity, and impurity - we begin with the greater severity, and laws of life capital cases we begin from the side!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי הִילֵּל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי וָולָס: שָׁאנֵי מִנְיָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי, דְּכוּלְּהוּ מִנְיָנַיְיהוּ מִן הַצַּד הֲווֹ מַתְחִילִין.
human_translation: And Rabba, son of Rava, says, and some say Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Volas, The counting in the school of Rabbi was different, as all of their countings would begin on the side.
llm_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, said, and some say it was Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Wolas: The counting of the students of the house of Rabbi, all their counts were from the side, they would begin.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי הִילֵּל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי ווֹלֶס: מִימוֹת מֹשֶׁה וְעַד רַבִּי לֹא מָצִינוּ תּוֹרָה וּגְדוּלָּה בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: And Rabba, son of Rava, says, and some say Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Volas, From the days of Moses and until Rabbi we do not find Torah and greatness in one place,
llm_translation: And Rabba, son of Rava, said, and it was stated: Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Wolles, said: From the days of Moses until Rabbi, we have not found Torah and greatness in one place.

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! הָא הֲוָה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ! הֲוָה אֶלְעָזָר. הָא הֲוָה אֶלְעָזָר! הֲוָה פִּנְחָס. וְהָא הֲוָה פִּנְחָס! הֲווֹ זְקֵנִים.
human_translation: But not Wasn’t there Joshua, there was Elazar, Wasn’t there Elazar, there was Pinehas, Wasn’t there Pinehas, There were the Elders,
llm_translation: And not?! This was Yehoshua! Was Elazar. This was Elazar! Was Pinchas. And this was Pinchas! Were elders.

hebrew_text: הָא הֲוָה שָׁאוּל! הֲוָה שְׁמוּאֵל. וְהָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ! כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵי קָאָמְרִינַן. וְהָא הֲוָה דָּוִד! הֲוָה עִירָא הַיָּאִירִי.
human_translation: Wasn’t there Saul, There was Samuel, But didn’t pass away We say all the years But wasn’t there David, There was Ira the Jairite,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: This was Saul! This was Samuel. And this was Nahshon himself! All of them we say. And this was David! This was Ira the Jairite.

hebrew_text: וְהָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ! כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵי בָּעֵינַן. הָא הֲוָה שְׁלֹמֹה! הֲוָה שִׁמְעִי בֶּן גֵּרָא. וְהָא קַטְלֵיהּ! כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵי קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But didn’t pass away we require all the years Wasn’t there Solomon, there was Shimi ben Gera, But didn’t kill him We say all years.
llm_translation: And he died by himself! All of them two we require. This was Shlomo! This was Shimei ben Gera. And he killed him! All of them two we are saying.

hebrew_text: הָא הֲוָה חִזְקִיָּה! הֲוָה שֶׁבְנָא. הָא אִיקְּטִיל! כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵי קָאָמְרִינַן. וְהָא הֲוָה עֶזְרָא! הֲוָה נְחֶמְיָה בֶּן חֲכַלְיָה.
human_translation: Wasn’t there Hezekiah, There was Shebnah Wasn’t he killed We say all years. But wasn’t there Ezra, There was Nehemiah ben Hacaliah
llm_translation: Here was Hezekiah! Here was Shevna. Here he stumbled! All of them we say. And here was Ezra! Here was Nehemiah son of Hacaliah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: אַף אֲנִי אוֹמֵר, מִימוֹת רַבִּי וְעַד רַב אָשֵׁי לֹא מָצִינוּ תּוֹרָה וּגְדוּלָּה בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד. וְלָא?! וְהָא הֲוָה הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן! שָׁאנֵי הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן, דְּמֵיכָף הֲוָה כַּיִיף לֵיהּ לְרַב אָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, says: I also say from the days of Rabbi and until Rav Ashi, we do not find Torah and greatness in one place, But not But wasn’t there Huna bar Natan, Huna bar Natan is different, as he was subordinate to Rav Ashi,
llm_translation: Rav Ahah son of Rava said: Even I say, from the days of Rabbi until Rav Ashi, we did not find Torah and greatness in one place. Is it not so?! But there was Huna son of Nathan! Huna son of Nathan was different, as he enjoyed Rav Ashi's company.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֵרֵשׁ רוֹמֵז וְנִרְמָז. וּבֶן בְּתִירָא אוֹמֵר: קוֹפֵץ וְנִקְפָּץ – בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין. הַפָּעוֹטוֹת מִקָּחָן מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּרָן מִמְכָּר – בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: A deaf-mute may express through gestures [ romez ]; And he may respond through gestures; And ben Beteira says: he expresses through lip movements [ kofetz ] or responds through lip movements, to movable property. a purchase by young children [ paotot ] purchase, and a sale sale. to movable property.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A deaf person hints and is hinted to. And Ben Beteira says: One who jumps and is jumped upon - with regards to movable objects. Those who are selling, their sale is a sale, and those who are buying, their purchase is a purchase - with regards to movable objects.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין, אֲבָל בְּגִיטִּין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל בִּרְמִיזָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says dispute with regard to movable property. But with regard to bills of divorce, all agree, through gestures
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Nachman said: Disagreement in mitzvahs, but in gittin - the words of everyone are in a hint.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, ״בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין״ תְּנַן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא ״אַף בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is obvious didn’t we learn to movable property? lest you say even movable property, teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Peshita, 'bemittaltelin' tenan! Mahu d'teima 'af bemittaltelin', ka mashma lan." English translation: "It is obvious, 'with moving' we learned! What is the reasoning 'even with moving', it implies to us."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּגִיטִּין. וְהָאֲנַן ״בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין״ תְּנַן! אֵימָא: ״אַף בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין״.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Naḥman says Just as a dispute with regard to movable property, so too, a dispute with regard to bills of divorce. But didn’t we learn to movable property? Say even to movable property,
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Nachman said: Just as there is a dispute regarding mitzvah wagons, so too there is a dispute regarding divorces. But haven't we learned about "mitzvah wagons"! Say: "Even with mitzvah wagons."

hebrew_text: הַפָּעוֹטוֹת מִקָּחָן מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּרָן מִמְכָּר – בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין. וְעַד כַּמָּה? מַחְוֵי רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ: כְּבַר שֵׁית – כְּבָר שַׁב. רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: כְּבַר שַׁב – כְּבַר תַּמְנֵי. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: כְּבַר תֵּשַׁע – כְּבַר עֶשֶׂר.
human_translation: a purchase by young children purchase, and a sale sale. to movable property. And from what Rav Yehuda pointed to Rav Yitzḥak, his son: about six or seven. Rav Kahana said: about seven or eight. It was taught in a baraita : about nine or ten.
llm_translation: The small coins from their purchase are considered a purchase, and from their sale are considered a sale - with regard to transferring ownership. And until when? The measure of Rav Yehudah to Rav Yitzchak his son: When it is a barley grain - when it is a barley kernel. Rav Kahana said: When it is a barley kernel - when it is a barley half-kernel. In a Baraita it was taught: When it is a barley nine - when it is a barley ten.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי; כֹּל חַד וְחַד לְפִי חוּרְפֵּיהּ. וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו.
human_translation: And they do not disagree each according to his sharpness. What is the reason Rabbi Abba bar Ya’akov says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: In order to provide for livelihood,
llm_translation: The text does not contain a dispute; each one according to his disgrace. And what is the reason? Rabbi Abba bar Yaakov said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: for the sake of his life.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לַאֲשֶׁר עַל הַמֶּלְתָּחָה, הוֹצֵא לְבוּשׁ לְכֹל עוֹבְדֵי הַבָּעַל״ – מַאי ״מֶלְתָּחָה״? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּבַר הַנִּמְלָל וְנִמְתָּח.
human_translation: “And he said to him who was over the wardrobe [ meltaḥa ]: Bring forth garments for all the worshippers of the Ba’al” What “ meltaḥa ”? Rabbi Abba bar Ya’akov says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: something that can be compressed and stretched [ nimlal venimtaḥ ]
llm_translation: "And he said to the one who was in charge of the wardrobe, 'Bring out garments for all the worshipers of Baal.'" - What is 'מֶלְתָּחָה'? Rabbi Abba bar Yaakov said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A matter that is spoken and explained.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁיגֵּר לוֹ בּוּנְיָים בֶּן נוּנְיָים לְרַבִּי – סִיבְנִי, וְחוֹמֶס, סַלְסָלָה, וּמַלְמָלָא. סִיבְנִי וְחוֹמֶס – כְּאַמְגּוּזָא וּפַלְגֵיהּ דְּאַמְגּוּזָא. סַלְסָלָה וּמַלְמָלָא – כְּפִיסְתְּקָא וּפַלְגוּ דְּפִיסְתְּקָא. מַאי מַלְמָלָא? דָּבָר הַנִּמְלָל וְנִמְתָּח.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Bonyam ben Nunyam sent Rabbi Sivni and ḥoms , salsela and malmala , sivni and ḥoms of a nut and half a nut. salsela and malmala of a pistachio nut and half a pistachio nut. What malmala ? something that can be compressed and stretched.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Shinayger (he built) for him Buniyayim son of Nunyayim to Rabbi - Sibni, and Chomes, Salsalah, and Malmala. Sibni and Chomes - like a fortress and its moat. Salsalah and Malmala - like a bolt and the hole of a bolt. What is Malmala? A matter that is spoken and is analyzed.

hebrew_text: וְטָעוּתָן עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: עַד שְׁתוּת כְּגָדוֹל.
human_translation: And up to how much is their mistake? Rabbi Yona says Rabbi Zeira says: Up to one-sixth like an adult.
llm_translation: Their error, until when? Rabbi Yonah said in the name of Rabbi Zeira: Until they drink like adults.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי אַבָּיֵי: מַתְּנָתוֹ, מַאי? רַב יֵימַר אֲמַר: אֵין מַתְּנָתוֹ מַתָּנָה; מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַתְּנָתוֹ מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: Abaye raises a dilemma: What gift? Rav Yeimar says: His gift is not gift. Mar bar Rav Ashi says: His gift is gift.
llm_translation: Ba'ei Abaye: Matnato, mai? Rav Yeimar amar: ein matnato mattanah; Mar bar Rav Ashe amar: matnato mattanah. Ba'ei Abaye (Abaye asked): His gift, what is it? Rav Yeimar said: His gift is not a gift; Mar bar Rav Ashe said: His gift is a gift.

hebrew_text: אַפְכוּהָ וְשַׁדְּרוּהָ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב מׇרְדֳּכַי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִילוּ אֱמַרוּ לְבַר מָר, לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא? כִּי הֲוָה קָאֵי מָר – חַד כַּרְעֵיהּ אַאַרְעָא וְחַד כַּרְעֵיהּ אַדַּרְגָּא, וַאֲמַרְנָא לֵיהּ: מַתְּנָתוֹ מַאי? וַאֲמַר לַן: מַתְּנָתוֹ מַתָּנָה – אַחַת מַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע וְאַחַת מַתְּנַת בָּרִיא, אַחַת מַתָּנָה מְרוּבָּה וְאַחַת מַתָּנָה מוּעֶטֶת.
human_translation: reversed and sent to Rav Mordekhai, said to them: Go say to son of my Master, Wasn’t the incident as follows? When the Master, was standing one foot on the ground and one foot on the step, we said to him: What gift? And he said to us: His gift is gift, whether gift of a person on his deathbed, or the gift of a healthy person, whether a large gift or a small gift.
llm_translation: Turn her over and present her before Rav Mordechai. He said to him: If they told you to give it to the son of a master, was it not so? When the master was standing - one foot on the ground and one foot on a step, and we said to him: What is his gift? And he said to us: His gift is a gift - one gift for a sick person and one gift for a healthy person, one gift abundant and one gift meager.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים אָמְרוּ מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם: כֹּהֵן קוֹרֵא רִאשׁוֹן, וְאַחֲרָיו לֵוִי וְאַחֲרָיו יִשְׂרָאֵל – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם. מְעָרְבִין בְּבַיִת יָשָׁן – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: These are the matters instituted on account of the ways of peace, a priest reads first, and after him a Levite, and after him an Israelite. on account of the ways of peace, a joining is placed in an old house on account of the ways of peace,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the things that were said for the sake of peaceful relations: The Kohen reads first, then the Levi, and then the Yisrael - for the sake of peaceful relations. One may mix in a dilapidated house - for the sake of peaceful relations.

hebrew_text: בּוֹר שֶׁהוּא קָרוֹב לָאַמָּה מִתְמַלֵּא רִאשׁוֹן – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: the pit that is nearest to the irrigation channel is filled first on account of the ways of peace.
llm_translation: A pit that is close to the mother animal fills up first - because of the ways of peace.

hebrew_text: מְצוּדוֹת חַיָּה וְעוֹפוֹת וְדָגִים, יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם; רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר.
human_translation: Animals, birds, or fish traps is considered robbery on account of the ways of peace. Rabbi Yosei says: full-fledged robbery.
llm_translation: Text: "M'tzudot chayah v'ofot v'dagim, yesh bahen mi'shum gazel - mi'pnei darkhei shalom; Rabbi Yosei omer: gazel gamur." Translation: "Traps for wild animals, birds, and fish, have in them an element of theft - for the sake of peace; Rabbi Yosei says: it is outright theft."

hebrew_text: מְצִיאַת חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם; רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר.
human_translation: a lost item a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor is considered robbery on account of the ways of peace. Rabbi Yosei says: full-fledged robbery.
llm_translation: Discovery of a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor, there is in them a matter of theft - due to ways of peace; Rabbi Yosei says: outright theft.

hebrew_text: עָנִי הַמְנַקֵּף בְּרֹאשׁ הַזַּיִת, מַה שֶּׁתַּחְתָּיו גָּזֵל – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם; רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר.
human_translation: a poor person gleans at the top of an olive tree that are beneath it is robbery on account of the ways of peace. Rabbi Yosei says: full-fledged robbery.
llm_translation: The poor person who picks olives, whatever is beneath him is stolen - for the sake of peace; Rabbi Yosei says: it is outright theft.

hebrew_text: אֵין מְמַחִין בְּיַד עֲנִיֵּי גּוֹיִם בְּלֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: One does not protest against poor gentiles gleanings, forgotten and the produce in the corner of the field, which is given to the poor [ pe’a ], on account of the ways of peace.
llm_translation: One does not protest with the hands of non-Jewish poor people in gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and corners of the field - due to the ways of peace.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיִּכְתּוֹב מֹשֶׁה אֶת הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת וַיִּתְּנָהּ אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי לֵוִי״ – אַטּוּ אֲנָא לָא יָדַעְנָא דְּכֹהֲנִים, בְּנֵי לֵוִי נִינְהוּ? אֶלָּא כֹּהֵן בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר לֵוִי.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Mattana said: As the verse states: “And Moses wrote this Torah, and delivered it to the priests, the sons of Levi” Is that to say I do not know that the priests are the sons of Levi? Rather, a priest and after a Levite.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of these words? Rav Matna said, as the verse states: "And Moses wrote this Torah and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi" (Deuteronomy 31:9). Did I not know that they are priests, the sons of Levi? Rather, first they are priests, and then Levi.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְנִגְּשׁוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי לֵוִי״ – אַטּוּ אֲנַן לָא יָדְעִינַן דְּכֹהֲנִים, בְּנֵי לֵוִי נִינְהוּ? אֶלָּא כֹּהֵן בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר לֵוִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said from here, “And the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come near” Is that to say I do not know that the priests are the sons of Levi? Rather, first a priest and after a Levite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said, from here: "And the priests, the sons of Levi shall approach" - do we not know that the priests are the sons of Levi? Rather, it means first they are priests, and afterwards they are Levi.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״בְּנֵי עַמְרָם אַהֲרֹן וּמֹשֶׁה, וַיִּבָּדֵל אַהֲרֹן לְהַקְדִּישׁוֹ קֹדֶשׁ קֳדָשִׁים״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said from here: “The sons of Amram, Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was separated, that he should be sanctified as most holy”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said from here: "The sons of Amram, Aaron and Moses, and Aaron separated to sanctify him as most holy."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ״ – לְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבִּקְדוּשָּׁה. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ״ – לְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבִּקְדוּשָּׁה; לִפְתּוֹחַ רִאשׁוֹן, וּלְבָרֵךְ רִאשׁוֹן, וְלִיטּוֹל מָנָה יָפָה רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said from here, “And you shall sanctify him” for every matter of sanctity. the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “And you shall sanctify him,” for every matter of sanctity: To open first, to recite the blessing first, and to take a fine portion first,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said from here: "And you shall sanctify him" - for every matter in holiness. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And you shall sanctify him" - for every matter in holiness; to open the first, and to bless the first, and to take a beautiful portion first.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם?! דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: on account of the ways of peace, by Torah law said to by Torah law, but on account of the ways of peace.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: because of the ways of peace?! It is from the Torah! He said to him: it is from the Torah, and because of the ways of peace.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ נָמֵי מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״דְּרָכֶיהָ דַרְכֵי נוֹעַם וְכׇל נְתִיבוֹתֶיהָ שָׁלוֹם״!
human_translation: the entire Torah also on account of the ways of peace, as it is written: “Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace”
llm_translation: The entire Torah, all of it, is pleasant because of the ways of peace, as it is written: "Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְכִדְמַר; דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁנַיִם – מַמְתִּינִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּקְּעָרָה. שְׁלֹשָׁה – אֵין מַמְתִּינִין. הַבּוֹצֵעַ – הוּא פּוֹשֵׁט יָדוֹ תְּחִלָּה, וְאִם בָּא לַחְלוֹק כָּבוֹד לְרַבּוֹ אוֹ לְמִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ – הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: is in accordance with my master, As it is taught two people from a single dish, wait for each other, three, not wait the one who breaks bread extends his hand first, but if he wishes to show respect to his teacher or to one who is greater he has permission
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: according to the opinion of the one who taught: Two - they wait for each other in the bowl. Three - they do not wait. The one who takes first - he extends his hand first, and if he comes to give honor to his teacher or to someone greater than him - the permission is in his hands.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר מָר עֲלַהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּסְעוּדָה, אֲבָל בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת לֹא, דְּאָתוּ לְאִינְּצוֹיֵי.
human_translation: And the Master, said with regard to They taught with regard to a meal, But in the synagogue, not come to quarrel
llm_translation: And Mar said: They only said this regarding a meal, but not in the synagogue, for there it leads to neglect.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת לֹא, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים – דִּשְׁכִיחִי רַבִּים, אֲבָל בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי – לָא.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: this that you stated, in the synagogue not we said only concerning Shabbatot and Festivals, when many people are present but not on Mondays and Thursdays,
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: This that you said in the synagogue, no, we only say it on Shabbatot and holidays - for many people are present, but not on Mondays and Thursdays.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב הוּנָא קָרֵי בְּכָהֲנֵי בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וְיוֹם טוֹב! שָׁאנֵי רַב הוּנָא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי – כָּהֲנֵי חֲשִׁיבִי דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – מֵיכָף הֲווֹ כַּיְיפִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Huna, read for priests, on Shabbatot and Festivals? Rav Huna is different, as even Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, the most important priests in Eretz Yisrael, were subject to his
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rav Huna read the Torah portion regarding the priests on Sabbaths and festivals! Rav Huna is different, for even Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi - who are considered priests of the Land of Israel - they would kiss his hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, נָקְטִינַן: אֵין שָׁם כֹּהֵן – נִתְפָּרְדָה חֲבִילָה. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, נָקְטִינַן: אֵין שָׁם לֵוִי – קוֹרֵא כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Abaye said we have a tradition there is no priest there the bundle is separated, And Abaye said we have a tradition there is no Levite there a priest reads
llm_translation: Abaye said, we have learned: If there is no Kohen present - the bundle is separated. And Abaye said, we have learned: If there is no Levi present - a Kohen reads.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כֹּהֵן אַחַר כֹּהֵן לֹא יִקְרָא, מִשּׁוּם פְּגָמוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן. לֵוִי אַחַר לֵוִי לֹא יִקְרָא מִשּׁוּם פְּגַם שְׁנֵיהֶם! כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן, בְּאוֹתוֹ כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: priest should not read after priest, because a flaw in the first Levite should not read after Levite, because a flaw in both of them. When we said of the same priest
llm_translation: I?! And did not Rabbi Yochanan say: A Kohen after a Kohen may not read, because of the blemish of the first. A Levi after a Levi may not read because of the blemish of both! For we say, with that Kohen.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לֵוִי אַחַר לֵוִי, דְּאִיכָּא פְּגַם שְׁנֵיהֶם – דְּאָמְרִי: חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ לָאו לֵוִי הוּא; כֹּהֵן אַחֵר כֹּהֵן נָמֵי, אָמְרִי: חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ לָאו כֹּהֵן הוּא! כְּגוֹן דְּמוּחְזָק לַן בַּאֲבוּהּ דְּהַאי שֵׁנִי, דְּכֹהֵן הוּא.
human_translation: What is different Levite after Levite, that there is a flaw in both of them? say one of them, is not a Levite. priest after priest, also say one of them, is not a priest. where we have a presumption concerning the father of the second that he is a priest.
llm_translation: What is the difference between one Levi and another Levi, where there is a blemish in both of them - for they say: one of them is not a Levi; another priest is standing in place of another priest, they say: one of them is not a priest! For example, we are certain about the father of this second one, that he is a priest.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, דְּמוּחְזָק לַן בַּאֲבוּהּ דְּהַאי שֵׁנִי, דְּלֵוִי הוּא! אֶלָּא אָמְרִי: מַמְזֶרֶת אוֹ נְתִינָה נְסֵיב, וּפַסְלֵיהּ לְזַרְעֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, אָמְרִי: גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ חֲלוּצָה נְסֵיב, וְאַחֲלֵיהּ לְזַרְעֵיהּ!
human_translation: here too, we have a presumption concerning the father of the second that he is a Levite. Rather, say married a mamzeret , or a Gibeonite woman, and disqualified his children, here too, say married a divorced woman or a yevama who underwent ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] and disqualified his children
llm_translation: Here it is stated, that we are certain about the father of this second one, that he is Levi! Rather they said: Whether a mamzeret or a Netinah one marries, and disqualifies her offspring. Here it is stated, they said: Whether a divorced woman or a widow one marries, and she disqualifies her offspring!

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, לֵוִי מִי קָא הָוֵי?!
human_translation: Ultimately, is he a Levite?
llm_translation: Ultimately, Levi who is he?!

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן? אִי לְיוֹשְׁבִין – הָא קָא חָזוּ לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לְיוֹצְאִין.
human_translation: And about whom If for those sitting they see Rather, for those who leave
llm_translation: And for whom? If for the residents - this one sees it! Rather, for the travelers.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי גָלִילָא לְרַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: אַחֲרֵיהֶן,
human_translation: The people of the Galilee sent to Rabbi Ḥelbo: After them,
llm_translation: Send to him the sons of Galila to Rabbi Helbo: after them,

hebrew_text: מִי קוֹרְאִין? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתָא וְשַׁיְילֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַחֲרֵיהֶן קוֹרְאִין תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְמוּנִּין פַּרְנָסִים עַל הַצִּבּוּר, וְאַחֲרֵיהֶן תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הָרְאוּיִין לְמַנּוֹתָם פַּרְנָסִים עַל הַצִּיבּוּר, וְאַחֲרֵיהֶן בְּנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁאֲבוֹתֵיהֶן מְמוּנִּים פַּרְנָסִים עַל הַצִּבּוּר, וְאַחֲרֵיהֶן רָאשֵׁי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: who reads was not available to him. He came and asked Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, said to him: After them read Torah scholars who are appointed as leaders [ parnasim ] of the community. And after them Torah scholars who are fit to be appointed as leaders of the community, And after them the sons of Torah scholars whose fathers were appointed as leaders of the community. And after them the heads of synagogues, and any person.
llm_translation: Who are they calling? It was not in his hand. He came and asked Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, he said to him: After them, they call the trusted Torah scholars who are providing for the public, and after them, the Torah scholars who are fit to be appointed as providers for the public, and after them, the sons of Torah scholars whose fathers are providers for the public, and after them, the heads of the synagogues and every person.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי גָלִיל לְרַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: מַהוּ לִקְרוֹת בְּחוּמָּשִׁים בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּצִיבּוּר? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתָא שַׁיְילֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתָא שְׁאֵיל בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, וּפַשְׁטוּהָ מֵהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁחָסַר יְרִיעָה אַחַת – אֵין קוֹרִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: The people of the Galilee sent to Rabbi Ḥelbo: What is to reading from ḥumashim , in the synagogue in public? was not available to him. He came and asked Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, was not available to him came and asked in the study hall, and they resolved from that which Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a Torah scroll that is missing one sheet one may not read from it
llm_translation: Send to him the sons of Galil to Rabbi Helbo: What is the law to read with five in the synagogue in public? It was not in his hands. He asked Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, it was not in his hands. He asked the study hall, and they interpreted it from what Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A Torah scroll that lacks one curtain - one may not read from it.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, הָתָם מְחַסַּר בְּמִילְּתֵיהּ, הָכָא לָא מְחַסַּר בְּמִילְּתֵיהּ. רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֵין קוֹרְאִין בְּחוּמָּשִׁין בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד צִבּוּר.
human_translation: But is not so, There, lacking of the matter here, it is not lacking of the matter Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: One does not read from ḥumashim in the synagogue out of respect for the community.
llm_translation: And not it, there, lacking in its words, here not lacking in its words. Rabbah and Rav Yosef who say both: One does not read the Five Books of Moses in the synagogue, out of respect for the congregation.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הַאי סֵפֶר אַפְטָרָתָא – אָסוּר לְמִקְרֵי בֵּיהּ בְּשַׁבָּת. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּלֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב.
human_translation: And Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: It is prohibited to read on Shabbat, from a scroll the haftarot . What is the reason because may not be written,
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: This scroll of Aphtaratha - it is forbidden to read from it on Shabbat. What is the reason? Because it is not fit to be written.

hebrew_text: מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְטַלְטוֹלֵי נָמֵי אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּהָא לָא חֲזֵי לְמִיקְרֵי בֵּיהּ. וְלָא הִיא, שְׁרֵי לְטַלְטוֹלֵי וּשְׁרֵי לְמִיקְרֵי בֵּיהּ –
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: To handle is also prohibited. What is the reason because it is not fit to be read. But is not so; it is permitted to handle and it is permitted to read from it.
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: For hanging on a tree it is forbidden. What is the reason? Because it is not fit to be read upon it. And it is not so, if it is permitted for hanging, it is permitted for reading upon it.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ מְעַיְּינִי בְּסִפְרָא דְאַגַּדְתָּא בְּשַׁבְּתָא; וְהָא לֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר, ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״; הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר, ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: that Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish used to read from a scroll of aggada on Shabbat. But may not be written, Rather, since it is not possible “It is time to act for the Lord; they have nullified your Torah” Here too, since it is not possible “It is time to act for the Lord; they have nullified your Torah.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish were delving into the book of Aggadah on Shabbat; and since it was not possible to write it down, once it became possible, "It is time to act for the Lord; they have violated Your Torah." Here too, once it became possible, "It is time to act for the Lord; they have violated Your Torah."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: מַהוּ לִכְתּוֹב מְגִילָּה לְתִינוֹק לְהִתְלַמֵּד בָּהּ? תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: תּוֹרָה מְגִילָּה מְגִילָּה נִיתְּנָה; תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: תּוֹרָה חֲתוּמָה נִיתְּנָה.
human_translation: Abaye raised a dilemma before Rabba: What is to write a scroll for a child to study it? Let the dilemma be raised according to the one who says the Torah was given scroll by scroll, let the dilemma be raised according to the one who says the Torah was given a complete
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabbah: What about writing a scroll for a child to learn from it? Let him ask according to the one who says: Torah was given scroll by scroll; let him ask according to the one who says: Torah was given sealed.

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תּוֹרָה מְגִילָּה מְגִילָּה נִיתְּנָה – כֵּיוָן דִּמְגִילָּה מְגִילָּה נִיתְּנָה, כּוֹתְבִין; אוֹ דִילְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִידְּבַק – אִידְּבַק.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised according to the one who says the Torah was given scroll by scroll. since was given scroll by scroll, one may write Or perhaps since it was joined it was joined
llm_translation: The text reads: "It is inquired according to the one who says, 'The Torah was given scroll by scroll' - since it was given scroll by scroll, we write; or perhaps, since it is joined - it is joined."

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תּוֹרָה חֲתוּמָה נִיתְּנָה – כֵּיוָן דַּחֲתוּמָה נִיתְּנָה, אֵין כּוֹתְבִין; אוֹ דִילְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר – כָּתְבִינַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין. וּמָה טַעַם? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין.
human_translation: let the dilemma be raised according to the one who says the Torah was given a complete since it was given a complete one may not write Or perhaps since it is not possible one may write said to him: One may not write And what is the reason? Because one may not write
llm_translation: The question was raised: According to the one who says that the Torah was given sealed - once it was given sealed, we do not write it down; or perhaps, since it is not possible to remember, should we write it down? He said to him: We do not write it down. And what is the reason? Because we do not write it down.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אַף הִיא עָשְׂתָה טַבְלָא שֶׁל זָהָב, שֶׁפָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה כְּתוּבָה עָלֶיהָ! אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בְּאָלֶף בֵּית.
human_translation: raised an objection to his also fashioned a golden tablet on which the portion a sota was written. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Yannai: of alef-beit ,
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: She also made a golden tablet, on which the portion of the suspected woman was written! Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: With an Aleph and a Bet.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹתֵב, רוֹאֶה וְכוֹתֵב מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא! אֵימָא: ״כְּמָה שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא״.
human_translation: raised an objection When writes he looks and writes that which is written on the tablet, say like that which is written on the tablet.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: When he writes, he sees and writes what is written in the tablet! Say: "As much as is written in the tablet."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹתֵב, רוֹאֶה בַּטַּבְלָא וְכוֹתֵב מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא. מָה הוּא כָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא? ״אִם שָׁכַב״, ״אִם לֹא שָׁכַב״! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּסֵירוּגִין.
human_translation: raised an objection When he writes, he looks at the tablet and writes that which is written on the tablet. what is written on the tablet? “If lay if he did not lay With what are we dealing here? by alternating
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: When he is writing, he looks at the tablet and writes what is written on the tablet. What is written on the tablet? "If he lay down," "If he did not lay down"! What are we dealing with here? - With regards to precautions.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין מְגִילָּה לְתִינוֹק לְהִתְלַמֵּד בָּהּ, וְאִם דַּעְתּוֹ לְהַשְׁלִים – מוּתָּר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּבְרֵאשִׁית – עַד דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל. בְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים – עַד ״וַיְהִי בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי״.
human_translation: subject to tanna’im , One may not write a scroll for a child to study, but if intention is to complete it is permitted. Rabbi Yehuda says: In Genesis until the generation of the flood. In Torat Kohanim , until “And it came to pass on the eighth day”
llm_translation: Tannaim: One does not write a Megillah for a child to learn from it, but if his intention is to complete it – it is permitted. Rabbi Yehuda says: In the beginning - until the generation of the Flood. In the Torah of the Priests - until "And it was on the eighth day."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי בְּנָאָה: תּוֹרָה – מְגִילָּה מְגִילָּה נִיתְּנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָז אָמַרְתִּי הִנֵּה בָאתִי בִּמְגִילַּת סֵפֶר כָּתוּב עָלָי״. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: תּוֹרָה – חֲתוּמָה נִיתְּנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָקוֹחַ אֵת סֵפֶר הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Bana’a: The Torah was given scroll by scroll, as it is stated: “Then I said, behold, I come with the scroll of the book that is written for me” Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: The Torah was given a complete as it is stated: “Take this scroll of the Torah”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Bena'ah: Torah - scroll by scroll was given, as it is stated: "Then I said, 'Behold, I have come - in the scroll of the book it is written about me.'" Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Torah - sealed was given, as it is stated: "Take this scroll of the Torah."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״לָקוֹחַ״! הָהוּא לְבָתַר דְּאִידְּבַק.
human_translation: And the other as well, isn’t it written “take,” That after it was joined
llm_translation: And the other one, it is written "to take"! That one is after he clung.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״בִּמְגִילַּת סֵפֶר כָּתוּב עָלָי״! הַהוּא, דְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ אִיקְּרִי מְגִילָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי מָה אַתָּה רוֹאֶה, וָאוֹמַר אֲנִי רוֹאֶה מְגִילָּה עָפָה״.
human_translation: And the other as well, isn’t it written: “With the scroll of the book that is written for me,” That the entire Torah is called a scroll. as it is written: “And He said to me: What do you see? And I said: I see a flying scroll”
llm_translation: And the other one, it is written "in the scroll of the book it is written about me"! That one, for the entire Torah is called a scroll, as it is written: "And He said to me, 'What do you see?' And I said, 'I see a flying scroll.'"

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, לְכִדְרַבִּי לֵוִי – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: שְׁמֹנֶה פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת נֶאֶמְרוּ בַּיּוֹם שֶׁהוּקַם בּוֹ הַמִּשְׁכָּן, אֵלּוּ הֵן: פָּרָשַׁת כֹּהֲנִים, וּפָרָשַׁת לְוִיִּם, וּפָרָשַׁת טְמֵאִים, וּפָרָשַׁת שִׁילּוּחַ טְמֵאִים, וּפָרָשַׁת ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת״,
human_translation: Alternatively, to that of Rabbi Levi, as Rabbi Levi says: Eight sections were said on the day that the Tabernacle was erected, They are: The section of the priests the section of the Levites the section of the impure the section of the sending away of the impure the section “After the death”
llm_translation: If you wish, according to Rabbi Levi - for Rabbi Levi said: Eight sections were recited on the day the Tabernacle was erected, these are they: the section of the priests, the section of the Levites, the section of the impure, the section of the sending away of the impure, and the section of "Acharei Mot."

hebrew_text: וּפָרָשַׁת שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן, וּפָרָשַׁת נֵרוֹת, וּפָרָשַׁת פָּרָה אֲדוּמָּה.
human_translation: the section intoxicated with wine the section of the lamps and the section of the red heifer
llm_translation: The portion of the drinking of wine, and the portion of lamps, and the portion of the red heifer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תּוֹרָה – רוֹב בִּכְתָב וּמִיעוּט עַל פֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶכְתּוֹב לוֹ רוּבֵּי תּוֹרָתִי כְּמוֹ זָר נֶחְשָׁבוּ״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: רוֹב עַל פֶּה וּמִיעוּט בִּכְתָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַל פִּי הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: The majority of the Torah in writing, while the minority orally, as it is stated: “I wrote for him the greater part of My Torah; they were reckoned a strange thing” And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The majority orally [ al peh ], while the minority in writing, as it is stated “For on the basis of [ al pi ] these matters
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Torah - mostly in writing and a little orally, as it is stated: "I will write for him the multitude of My teachings, they are considered as a stranger's." And Rabbi Yochanan said: mostly orally and a little in writing, as it is stated: "For by the words of these things."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״אֶכְתּוֹב לוֹ רוּבֵּי תּוֹרָתִי״! הָהוּא, אַתְמוֹהֵי קָא מַתְמַהּ: אֶכְתּוֹב לוֹ רוּבֵּי תּוֹרָתִי?! הֲלֹא ״כְּמוֹ זָר נֶחְשָׁבוּ״!
human_translation: And the other as well, isn’t it written: “I wrote for him the greater part of My Torah”? This is bewilderment: I write for him the greater part of My Torah? they, would be reckoned as strangers,
llm_translation: And the other one, however, it is written: "I will multiply for him the days of My Torah"! That one, the wise one is wondering: "I will multiply for him the days of My Torah?!" Is it not "considered as a strange thing"?

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״כִּי עַל פִּי הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״! הַהוּא – מִשּׁוּם דְּתַקִּיפִי לְמִיגְמְרִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And the other as well, isn’t it written: “For on the basis of these matters That due to it is difficult to learn
llm_translation: And the other one, it is written: "For by these words"! That one - because he is strict in concluding them.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר נַחְמָנִי, מְתוּרְגְּמָנֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, כְּתִיב: ״כְּתוֹב לְךָ אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי עַל פִּי הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״ – הָא כֵּיצַד? דְּבָרִים שֶׁבִּכְתָב אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְאוֹמְרָן עַל פֶּה, דְּבָרִים שֶׁבְּעַל פֶּה אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְאוֹמְרָן בִּכְתָב, דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. תָּנָא: ״אֵלֶּה״ – אֵלֶּה אַתָּה כּוֹתֵב, וְאִי אַתָּה כּוֹתֵב הֲלָכוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Naḥmani, the disseminator for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, expounded It is written: “Write you these matters” and it is written “For on the basis of [ al pi ] these matters.” How these Matters that were written you may not express them orally [ al peh ], matters that were orally you may not express them in writing. The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “these” These you may write, but you may not write halakhot ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Nachmani expounded, the interpreters of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, it is written: "Write for yourself these words," and it is written: "For by these words" - how so? Words that are in writing you are not permitted to say orally, words that are oral you are not permitted to write, the school of Rabbi Yishmael. It was taught: "These" - these you may write, but you may not write halakhot.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא כָּרַת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּרִית עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דְּבָרִים שֶׁבְּעַל פֶּה – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַל פִּי הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה כָּרַתִּי אִתְּךָ בְּרִית וְאֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, made a covenant with the Jewish people only for the sake of the matters that orally [ be’al peh ], as it is stated: “For on the basis of [ al pi ] these matters I have made a covenant with you and with Israel”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Not by cutting did the Holy One, blessed be He, make a covenant with Israel, but for matters of verbal agreement - as it is said: "For by the words of these things I made a covenant with you and with Israel."

hebrew_text: מְעָרְבִין בְּבַיִת יָשָׁן, מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם כָּבוֹד, וְהָא הָהוּא שִׁיפּוּרָא, דַּהֲוָה מֵעִיקָּרָא בֵּי רַב יְהוּדָה, וּלְבַסּוֹף בֵּי רַבָּה, וּלְבַסּוֹף בֵּי רַב יוֹסֵף, וּלְבַסּוֹף בֵּי אַבָּיֵי, וּלְבַסּוֹף בֵּי רָבָא!
human_translation: a joining is placed in an old house on account of the ways of peace. What is the reason If we say to respect but wasn’t a certain charity box, that initially it was in Rav Yehuda’s house, and afterward Rabba’s house, and afterward Rav Yosef’s house, and afterward Abaye’s house, and afterward Rava’s house.
llm_translation: We mix in an old house, because of the ways of peace. What is the reason? If you say it is because of honor, but there was that dilapidated house, which was initially the house of Rav Yehudah, and ultimately the house of Rabba, and ultimately the house of Rav Yosef, and ultimately the house of Abbaye, and ultimately the house of Rava!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם חֲשָׁדָא.
human_translation: Rather, to suspicion.
llm_translation: Rather, due to suspicion.

hebrew_text: בּוֹר שֶׁהוּא קָרוֹב לָאַמָּה וְכוּ׳: אִיתְּמַר: בְּנֵי נַהֲרָא; רַב אָמַר: תַּתָּאֵי שָׁתוּ מַיָּא בְּרֵישָׁא, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אֲמַר: עִילָּאֵי שָׁתוּ מַיָּא בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: the pit that is nearest to the irrigation channel It was stated people along a river Rav said: the lowermost drink the water, first. And Shmuel said: the uppermost drink the water first.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A pit that is close to the mother well, etc. It was stated: Sons of Nahara; Rav said: The lower ones drank water first, and Shmuel said: The upper ones drank water first.

hebrew_text: בִּדְמֵיזַל – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי. כִּי פְלִיגִי – בְּמִיסְכַּר וְאַשְׁקוֹיֵי; שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עִילָּאֵי שָׁתוּ מַיָּא בְּרֵישָׁא, דְּאָמְרִי: אֲנַן מְקָרְבִינַן טְפֵי. וְרַב אָמַר: תַּתָּאֵי שָׁתוּ מַיָּא בְּרֵישָׁא, דְּאָמְרִי: נַהֲרָא כִּפְשָׁטֵיהּ לֵיזִיל.
human_translation: With flows everyone agrees When they disagree, with where they dam and irrigate Shmuel said: the uppermost drink the water first because say: We are nearer And Rav said: the lowermost drink the water first because say: Let the river go its way
llm_translation: In the case of Dimizal - everyone does not disagree. When they disagree - it is in regards to mixing and drinking; Shmuel said: The upper ones drank water first, as they say: We bring the drops closer. And Rav said: The lower ones drank water first, as they say: Let the river flow according to its natural course.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: בּוֹר הַקָּרוֹב לָאַמָּה, מִתְמַלֵּא רִאשׁוֹן – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם! תַּרְגְּמַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַב: בְּאַמָּה הַמִּתְהַלֶּכֶת עַל פִּי בוֹרוֹ.
human_translation: We learned the pit that is nearest to the irrigation channel is filled first on account of the ways of peace. Shmuel interpreted in accordance with of Rav: an irrigation channel that passes the mouth of the pit,
llm_translation: We learned: A pit that is close to a cubit to the public domain, if it fills up first - due to the ways of peace! Shmuel the son of Rav said: In a cubit that walks along the edge of its pit.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, מָצֵי אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: סְכַר מִיסְכָּר, וְאַשְׁקִי בְּהִינְדָּזָא; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, what of stating Lest you say can say to Dam and irrigate in proportion [ hindeza ], teaches us
llm_translation: If so, what can be said? What might one say? Perhaps one could say to him: "Close the door, and drink with delight"; this is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּמָר וְלָא כְּמָר, כֹּל דְּאַלִּים גָּבַר.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Taḥalifa said: Now that the halakha was stated neither in accordance with this Sage, nor in accordance with that Sage, whoever is stronger prevails.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Tachlifa said: Now that the halakha has not been stated either like this master or like that master, every strong person prevails.

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לוֹתְבַן מָר בְּעִידָּנָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית לִי עִידָּנָא לְדִידִי. וְלוֹתְבַן מָר בְּלֵילְיָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית לִי מַיָּא לְאַשְׁקוֹיֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא מַשְׁקֵינָא לֵיהּ לְמָר מַיָּא בִּימָמָא, וְלוֹתְבַן מָר בְּלֵילְיָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְחַיֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi came before Abaye said to him: Master, set a time for me said to him: I have time for myself, Master, set for me at night, said to him: I have water to irrigate said to him: I will irrigate for Master during the day, and Master can set for me at night said to him: Very well;
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi came before Abaye, he said to him: "Master, let us establish a testimony!" He said to him: "I have a testimony for myself." "Master, let us establish a testimony at night!" He said to him: "I have water to drink." He said to him: "I will give him water to drink during the day, and let us establish a testimony at night!" He said to him: "By the life of God, yes."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל לְעִילָּאֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּתָּאֵי שָׁתוּ מַיָּא בְּרֵישָׁא. אֲזַל לְתַתָּאֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: עִילָּאֵי שָׁתוּ מַיָּא בְּרֵישָׁא. אַדְּהָכִי סְכַר מִיסְכָּר וְאַשְׁקִי. כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּבֵי תְרֵי עֲבַדְתְּ לִי! וְלָא טַעְמִינְהוּ אַבָּיֵי לְפֵירֵי דְּהַהִיא שַׁתָּא.
human_translation: He went to the uppermost said to them: the lowermost drink the water first, He went to the lowermost and said to them: the uppermost drink the water first, In the meantime, dammed and irrigated When he came before Abaye, said to him: You have acted for me in accordance with two And Abaye would not taste the produce of that year
llm_translation: He went up to the upper chamber, he said to them: The lower ones drank water first. He went down to the lower chamber, he said to them: The upper ones drank water first. Meanwhile, he closed the door and drank. When he came before Abbaye, he said to him: You have done the work of two! And Abbaye did not give them a reason for that drink.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בְּנֵי בֵּי חַרְמָךְ, דַּאֲזוּל כְּרוֹ בְּרֵישָׁא דְשַׁנְווֹתָא, וְאַהְדְּרוּהּ וְשַׁדְיוּהּ בְּשִׁילְהֵי נַהֲרָא. אֲתוֹ עִילָּאֵי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מַתְקֵיל לְנַהֲרִין! אֲמַר לְהוּ: כְּרוֹ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ טְפֵי פּוּרְתָּא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא יָבְשִׁי פֵּירִין. אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ סַלִּיקוּ נַפְשַׁיְיכוּ מֵהָתָם.
human_translation: certain residents Bei Ḥarmakh who went dug at the head of the Shanvata and then they returned downstream. upstream came before Abaye, said to him: This damages our river, said to them: Dig a little deeper with them, They said to him: our pits will become dry. he said to Go remove yourselves from there,
llm_translation: Those are the sons of the family of Charmak, who went to the head of the marketplace of Shanvota, and they returned and threw it into the waters of the river. They came up to Abaye, they said to him: "He is polluting the rivers!" He said to them: "He throws it with its peelings." They said to him: "The fruits are drying up." He said to them: "Go, take your souls away from there."

hebrew_text: מְצוּדוֹת חַיָּה וְעוֹפוֹת וְדָגִים, יֵשׁ בָּהֶן וְכוּ׳: בְּאוּזְלֵי וְאוֹהָרֵי
human_translation: animals, birds, or fish traps With regard to nets [ uzlei ] and traps [ oharei ],
llm_translation: Tractate: M'tzudot chayyah v'ofot v'dagim, yesh bahen v'chu: b'uz'lei v'oharei

hebrew_text: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי – בְּלֶחִי וְקוּקְרֵי.
human_translation: everyone agrees When they disagree, with regard to a fishhook or traps [ kokrei ]
llm_translation: All the world does not argue, when they argue - it is about the cheek and the gullet.

hebrew_text: מְצִיאַת חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה וְכוּ׳ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּדַיָּינִין.
human_translation: a lost item a deaf-mute, an imbecile, Rabbi Yosei says: full-fledged robbery. Rav Ḥisda says: full-fledged robbery by rabbinic law What difference is there recover by judges,
llm_translation: Discovery of a deaf-mute, a fool, etc. Rabbi Yosei says: Complete theft. Rav Ḥisda said: Complete theft from their words. What practical difference does it make? To obligate him in monetary matters.

hebrew_text: עָנִי הַמְנַקֵּף בְּרֹאשׁ הַזַּיִת, מַה שֶּׁתַּחְתָּיו וְכוּ׳: תָּנָא: אִם לִיקֵּט וְנָתַן בַּיָּד – הֲרֵי זֶה גָּזֵל גָּמוּר.
human_translation: a poor person gleans at the top of an olive tree that are beneath it taught: If gathered and placed in his hand this is full-fledged robbery,
llm_translation: The poor person who picks olives from the top of the olive tree, what is beneath him, etc.: It was taught: If he plucks and puts in his hand - this is outright theft.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל לְהוּצָל, חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה שָׁדֵי אוּפְיֵי וְקָא נָתְרָן תַּמְרֵי, אֲזַל קָא מְנַקֵּיט וְאָכֵיל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מָר דְּבִידַאי שְׁדֵיתִינְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אַתָּה. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״וְצַדִּיק יְסוֹד עוֹלָם״.
