human_translation: Rav Kahana was walking to Huzal he saw a certain man who was throwing sticks and dates were falling went, gathered and ate said to See, Master, that I threw them with my hand, said to him: You are from the place of Rabbi Yoshiya, read about “And a righteous man is the foundation of the world”
llm_translation: Rav Kahana was walking to save himself, he saw that certain man who was throwing dates and they were falling, he went, picked them up, and ate. He said to him: "See, master, that I have thrown them." He said to him: "You are from the students of Rabbi Yoshiyah." He recited about him: "And the righteous is the foundation of the world."

hebrew_text: אֵין מְמַחִין בְּיַד עֲנִיֵּי גוֹיִם בְּלֶקֶט בְּשִׁכְחָה וּבְפֵאָה, מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְפַרְנְסִים עֲנִיֵּי גוֹיִם עִם עֲנִיֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמְבַקְּרִין חוֹלֵי גוֹיִם עִם חוֹלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְקוֹבְרִין מֵתֵי גוֹיִם עִם מֵתֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: One does not protest against poor gentiles gleanings, forgotten and the produce in the corner of the field, which is given to the poor [ pe’a ], on account of the ways of peace. the Sages taught One sustains poor gentiles with poor Jews, and one visits sick gentiles with sick Jews, and one buries dead gentiles with dead Jews. on account of the ways of peace,
llm_translation: The poor of the nations may not be gleaned by the hand, nor forgotten sheaf, nor corner of the field, because of the ways of peace. The Rabbis taught: We sustain the poor of the nations along with the poor of Israel, visit the sick of the nations along with the sick of Israel, and bury the dead of the nations along with the dead of Israel, because of the ways of peace.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַשְׁאֶלֶת אִשָּׁה לַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ הַחֲשׁוּדָה עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית – נָפָה, וּכְבָרָה, וְרֵיחַיִם, וְתַנּוּר. אֲבָל לֹא תָּבוֹר וְלֹא תִּטְחַן עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: A woman may lend to her friend who is suspect with regard to the Sabbatical A winnow, a sieve, a mill, and an oven. But she may not select or grind with her,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a woman borrows from her friend suspected of violating the seventh year produce – she may bake, cook, wash clothes, and light a fire. But she may not dig or grind with her.

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת חָבֵר מַשְׁאֶלֶת לְאֵשֶׁת עַם הָאָרֶץ – נָפָה וּכְבָרָה; וּבוֹרֶרֶת, וְטוֹחֶנֶת, וּמְרַקֶּדֶת עִמָּהּ; אֲבָל מִשֶּׁתָּטִיל אֶת הַמַּיִם – לֹא תִּגַּע עִמָּהּ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַחְזִיקִין יְדֵי עוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה. וְכוּלָּן לֹא אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: The wife of a ḥaver , may lend the wife of an am ha’aretz , a winnow and a sieve, and she may select, grind, and sift with her. But once pours water may not touch with her, because one may not assist those who commit transgressions. And all of were stated only on account of the ways of peace.
llm_translation: The wife of a fellow is permitted to the wife of an am ha'aretz - she may spin and bleach; and sift, and grind, and dance with her. But if she pours water - she should not touch with her, because we do not support the hands of transgressors. And all of these they only said, for the sake of peaceful ways.

hebrew_text: וּמַחְזִיקִין יְדֵי גוֹיִם בַּשְּׁבִיעִית – אֲבָל לֹא יְדֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; וְשׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹמָן, מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: And one may assist gentiles during the Sabbatical but not Jews one may extend greetings on account of the ways of peace.
llm_translation: And holding the hands of non-Jews in the seventh year - but not the hands of Jews; and we inquire about their well-being, for the sake of peace.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רוֹב עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ מְעַשְּׂרִין הֵן.
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause Abaye said: Most amei ha’aretz tithe
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between the beginning (Reishah) and the end (Seifah)? Abaye said: Most of the common people tithe.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָכָא בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְטוּמְאָה וְטׇהֳרָה דְּרַבָּנַן – דְּתַנְיָא: אֵיזֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל חוּלָּיו בְּטָהֳרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְעַשֵּׂר פֵּירוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rava said: Here about the am ha’aretz by Rabbi Meir and ritual impurity and purity by rabbinic law. As it is taught Who is an am ha’aretz ? Anyone who does not eat his non-sacred produce in ritual purity; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: anyone who does not tithe his produce.
llm_translation: Rava said: Here in the case of the Am Haaretz according to Rabbi Meir, and the impurity and purity according to the Rabbis - as it was taught: Who is considered an Am Haaretz? Anyone who does not eat his food in a state of purity, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Anyone who does not tithe his produce.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: מִשֶּׁתָּטִיל אֶת הַמַּיִם לֹא תִּגַּע עִמָּהּ; מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא, לָאו בְּטוּמְאָה וְטׇהֳרָה עָסְקִינַן!
human_translation: But from that the latter clause teaches: Once pours water may not touch with her it may be inferred that the first clause we are not dealing with impurity and purity.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is learned in the latter clause: When one pours the water, she shall not touch with it; from the inference of the former clause, are we not dealing with impurity and purity!

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא בְּטוּמְאָה וְטׇהֳרָה; וְרֵישָׁא – בְּטוּמְאַת חוּלִּין, וְסֵיפָא – בְּטוּמְאַת חַלָּה.
human_translation: the first clause and the latter clause impurity and purity. the first clause, about impurity of non-sacred produce. But the latter clause, the impurity of ḥalla ,
llm_translation: The beginning and the end in impurity and purity; the beginning - in the impurity of ordinary food, and the end - in the impurity of dough.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ:
human_translation: And raises a contradiction
llm_translation: And they asked them:

hebrew_text: טוֹחֲנִין וּמַפְקִידִין אֵצֶל אוֹכְלֵי שְׁבִיעִית, וְאֵצֶל אוֹכְלֵי פֵירוֹתֵיהֶן בְּטוּמְאָה; אֲבָל לֹא לְאוֹכְלֵי שְׁבִיעִית, וְלֹא לְאוֹכְלֵי פֵירוֹתֵיהֶן בְּטוּמְאָה!
human_translation: One may grind and deposit with those who eat Sabbatical- and those who eat their own produce in impurity, But not for those who eat Sabbatical- or for those who eat their own produce in impurity,
llm_translation: We grind and deposit by those who eat produce of the seventh year, and by those who eat their fruits in a state of impurity; but not by those who eat produce of the seventh year, and not by those who eat their fruits in a state of impurity!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָתָם, בְּכֹהֵן הֶחָשׁוּד לֶאֱכוֹל תְּרוּמָה בְּטוּמְאָה עָסְקִינַן – דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ טוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: There, we are dealing with a priest who is suspected with regard to partaking of teruma in ritual impurity, which impurity by Torah law.
llm_translation: Abaye said: There, in the case of a suspected Kohen who is involved in eating Terumah while impure, we are dealing with a Torah-level impurity.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַפְקִידִין?! וּרְמִינְהוּ: מַפְקִידִין תְּרוּמָה אֵצֶל יִשְׂרָאֵל עַם הָאָרֶץ, וְלֹא אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן עַם הָאָרֶץ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלִּבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ!
human_translation: If so, deposit raises a contradiction One may deposit teruma with an Israelite an am ha’aretz . But not with a priest an am ha’aretz because he is accustomed
llm_translation: So, do we appoint?! And they asked: Do we appoint a contribution with Israel, the common people, and not with a priest from the common people, because his heart is arrogant in it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בִּכְלִי חֶרֶשׂ הַמּוּקָּף צָמִיד פָּתִיל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a says: With what are we dealing here, in an earthenware vessel with a tightly bound cover.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai said: Here we are dealing with what - with a clay vessel that is surrounded by a twisted wick.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא תְּסִיטֶנּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה!
human_translation: And let be a concern lest menstruating wife move
llm_translation: And to be concerned lest his wife, a menstruant, might seduce him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לָא קַשְׁיָא; כָּאן בְּפֵירוֹת שֶׁהוּכְשְׁרוּ, כָּאן בְּפֵירוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּכְשְׁרוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya says not difficult. Here, produce that became susceptible There, produce that has not become susceptible
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya said: It is not difficult; here with fruits that were checked, here with fruits that were not checked.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמּוֹלִיךְ חִטִּין לְטָחוֹן כּוּתִי אוֹ לְטָחוֹן עַם הָאָרֶץ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בְּחֶזְקָתָן לְמַעֲשֵׂר וְלִשְׁבִיעִית, אֲבָל לֹא לְטוּמְאָה!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction one who takes wheat to a Samaritan grinder or to a grinder who is an am ha’aretz , its presumptive status with regard to tithes and Sabbatical- But not with regard to impurity,
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: One who brings wheat to be ground by a Kutite or by an Am Haaretz - behold, these are considered established for tithing and for the Sabbatical year, but not for ritual impurity!

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי רוּמְיָא? לָאו אוֹקֵימְנָא בְּפֵירוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּכְשְׁרוּ?
human_translation: What contradiction is Did we not establish produce that has not become susceptible
llm_translation: This what? What is "Rumya"? Is it not established with fruits that were not checked?

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָרֵי לַהּ – מַאי קָאָרֵי לַהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִירְמֵי אַחֲרִיתִי עֲלַהּ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בְּחֶזְקָתָן לְמַעֲשֵׂר וְלִשְׁבִיעִית, וּלְחַלּוֹפֵי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: And he who asked why did he ask it? because he wished to raise a contradiction to it from another its presumptive status with regard to tithes and Sabbatical- and we are not concerned that exchanged
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "U'de'ka'arei la - mai ka'arei la? Mishum de'ka ba'ei le'mirmei achariti alah - harei elu be'chezkatam le'ma'aser ve'lishvi'it, u'le'chalofei la chayeshinan." English translation: "And it is being called to it - what is being called to it? Because it requires to deceive the end upon it - these are in their presumption for tithing and the Sabbatical year, and for exchanges we are not concerned."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַנּוֹתֵן לַחֲמוֹתוֹ, מְעַשֵּׂר אֵת שֶׁהוּא נוֹתֵן לָהּ וְאֵת שֶׁהוּא נוֹטֵל הֵימֶנָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחֲשׁוּדָה מַחְלֶפֶת הַמִּתְקַלְקֵל!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction one who gives to his mother-in-law, he must tithe that he gives her and that he takes from her. because she is suspected of exchanging that was spoiled
llm_translation: And they asked: One who gives his mother-in-law, he tithes what he gives to her and what he takes from her, because suspicion undermines the relationship!

hebrew_text: הָתָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: רוֹצֶה הִיא בְּתַקָּנַת בִּתָּהּ, וּבוֹשָׁה מֵחֲתָנָהּ.
human_translation: there the reason that was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: wants good for her daughter, and she is ashamed before her son-in-law
llm_translation: There, as it is taught in the Mishnah, Rabbi Yehuda said: "She desires the improvement of her daughter, and is embarrassed by her son-in-law."

hebrew_text: וּלְעָלְמָא – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן?! וְהָתְנַן: הַנּוֹתֵן לַפּוּנְדָּקִית, מְעַשֵּׂר אֶת שֶׁהוּא נוֹתֵן לָהּ וְאֶת שֶׁהוּא נוֹטֵל הֵימֶנָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּחְלֶפֶת! הָתָם מוֹרְיָא וְאָמְרָה: בַּר בֵּי רַב לֵיכוֹל חַמִּימָא, וַאֲנָא אֵיכוֹל קָרִירָא?!
human_translation: And ordinary we are not concerned But didn’t we learn one gives to an innkeeper [ pundakit ] he must tithe that he gives her and that he takes from her, because she exchanges There, rules and says: should student eat hot while I will eat cold
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for the world - do we not worry?! And we learned: One who gives to the fund collector, he tithes what he gives to her and what he takes from her, because she changes! There, Moriya said: "The son of Rav should eat hot food, and I should eat cold food?!"

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, לְעָלְמָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן?! וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵשֶׁת חָבֵר טוֹחֶנֶת עִם אֵשֶׁת עַם הָאָרֶץ – בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא טְמֵאָה אֲבָל לֹא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא טְהוֹרָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא טְמֵאָה לֹא תִּטְחוֹן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחֲבֶרְתָּהּ
human_translation: And still, ordinary are we not concerned But isn’t it taught The wife of a ḥaver may grind with the wife of an am ha’aretz when she, is impure, But not when she is pure. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: She may not grind even when she is impure, because the other
llm_translation: And yet, do we not concern ourselves with the world?! And it was taught: The wife of a scholar may grind with the wife of an 'am ha'aretz - when she is ritually impure, but not when she is ritually pure. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even when she is ritually impure, she should not grind, because of her friend.

hebrew_text: נוֹתֶנֶת לָהּ וְאוֹכֶלֶת. הַשְׁתָּא מִיגְנָב גָּנְבָא, חַלּוֹפֵי לָא מְיחַלְּפָא?!
human_translation: may give her and she may eat Now, steal she might exchange
llm_translation: She gives to her and eats. Now, if a thief steals, do the changers not change?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָתָם נָמֵי, מוֹרְיָא וְאָמְרָה: תּוֹרָא מִדִּישֵׁיהּ קָאָכֵיל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: There too, rules and she says: The ox may eat from its threshing.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: There, Naomi, the teacher, said: "The Torah is being consumed by its scholars."

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָחִיו, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חַסָּמָא: אֵין עוֹשִׂין חַלַּת עַם הָאָרֶץ בְּטׇהֳרָה, אֲבָל עוֹשִׂין עִיסַּת חוּלָּיו בְּטָהֳרָה; וְנוֹטֵל הֵימֶנָּה כְּדֵי חַלָּה, וּמַנִּיחָהּ בִּכְפִישָׁא אוֹ בְּאַנְחוּתָא; וּכְשֶׁבָּא עַם הָאָרֶץ לִיטּוֹל, נוֹטֵל אֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam testified in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, his brother, who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥasma: may not prepare ḥalla for an am ha’aretz in ritual purity. But he may prepare his ordinary dough in purity, and take for ḥalla from it, and place it in a basket [ kefisha ] or vessel [ anḥuta ], And when the am ha’aretz comes to take he can take both and does not concerned
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben Hamshulam testified in the name of Rabbi Yochanan his brother, who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Chasma: They do not make the dough of an am ha'aretz in purity, but they make his dough in purity; and he takes from it an amount like a loaf, and places it in a basket or in a cloth; and when an am ha'aretz comes to take, he takes both of them and is not concerned.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּרוּמַת זֵיתָיו בְּטׇהֳרָה, אֲבָל עוֹשִׂין זֵיתֵי חוּלָּיו בְּטָהֳרָה; וְנוֹטֵל הֵימֶנָּה כְּדֵי תְּרוּמָה, וּמַנִּיחָהּ בְּכִלְיוֹ שֶׁל חָבֵר; וּכְשֶׁבָּא עַם הָאָרֶץ לִיטּוֹל – נוֹטֵל אֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: And may not prepare from the olives teruma in ritual impurity. But he may prepare his ordinary olives in purity, and take for teruma from and place it in vessels belonging to the ḥaver . And when the am ha’aretz comes to take he takes both and does not concerned
llm_translation: And they do not make the tithe of his olives in purity, but they make the olives of his profane trees in purity; and he takes from it an amount for a tithe, and places it in the vessel of his friend; and when an ignorant person comes to take – he takes both of them, and he is not concerned.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו דְּגַבָּל, וּמִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו דְּבַדָּד.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For the sake of the kneader’s livelihood and for the sake of the presser’s livelihood.
llm_translation: The reason is what? Rabbi Yochanan said: For the sake of his life in the city of Gebal, and for the sake of his life in solitude.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן גַּבָּל – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא נְפִישׁ אַגְרֵיהּ, אֲבָל בַּדָּד – דִּנְפִישׁ אַגְרֵיהּ, אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן בַּדָּד – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ לֵיהּ, אֲבָל גַּבָּל – דִּשְׁכִיחַ לֵיהּ, אֵימָא לָא; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary as had taught us a kneader, because his payment is not great, but presser, whose payment is great, say not And had taught us presser, because is not common. But a kneader, is common say not necessary
llm_translation: And it is necessary; for if we were to hear the case of a boundary - because his reward is not great, but if it is alone - because his reward is great, we might say no. And if we were to hear the case of alone - because it is not common for him, but if it is a boundary - because it is common for him, we might say no; it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: נוֹטֵל הֵימֶנָּה כְּדֵי חַלָּה, וּמַנִּיחָהּ בִּכְפִישָׁא אוֹ בְּאַנְחוּתָא; וּכְשֶׁבָּא עַם הָאָרֶץ לִיטּוֹל, נוֹטֵל אֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא נָגַע בָּהּ! דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: חֲזִי, אִי נָגְעַתְּ בַּהּ הָדְרָא לְטִיבְלָא.
human_translation: the Master said: take for ḥalla from it, and place it in a basket or vessel, And when the am ha’aretz comes to take he can take both and does not concerned But let a concern lest touch because we say to him: See if you touch it will again be untithed produce.
llm_translation: Master said: One takes from it an olive's bulk, and places it in vinegar or in brine; and when an ignorant person comes to take, he takes both and is not concerned. Lest he touched it! For we say to him: See, if you touched it, return it for immersion.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ! הַשְׁתָּא לְתַקּוֹנֵי קָא מִיכַּוֵּין, מִיכְפָּת לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: But let a concern lest he does not care Now that his intention was to do right he does not care
llm_translation: And perhaps he should not be concerned! Now he is focused on repairs, should he not be concerned?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: נוֹטֵל הֵימֶנָּה כְּדֵי תְרוּמָה, וּמַנִּיחָהּ בְּכִלְיוֹ שֶׁל חָבֵר; וּכְשֶׁבָּא עַם הָאָרֶץ לִיטּוֹל, נוֹטֵל אֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא נָגַע בַּהּ! בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם, אִית לֵיהּ הֶיכֵּרָא; הָכָא, מַאי הֶיכֵּרָא אִית לֵיהּ? דְּמַנַּח לֵיהּ בִּכְלֵי גְלָלִים, בִּכְלֵי אֲבָנִים, בִּכְלֵי אֲדָמָה.
human_translation: The Master said take for teruma from and place it in vessels belonging to the ḥaver . And when the am ha’aretz comes to take he takes both and does not concerned But let a concern lest touch Granted, there, there is a conspicuous marker, here, what conspicuous marker is there? He places in dung vessels, in stone vessels, in clay vessels,
llm_translation: Master said: Takes from her as a donation, and places it in the vessel of his friend; and when an ignorant person comes to take, he takes both of them and is not concerned. And should we be concerned that perhaps he touched it! Granted there, there is a recognizable mark; but here, what recognizable mark is there? That he places it in vessels of dung, vessels of stone, vessels of earth.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא דְּחָבֵר? אֲפִילּוּ דְּעַם הָאָרֶץ נָמֵי! הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: בְּכֵלִים שֶׁל עַם הָאָרֶץ, הָרְאוּיִין לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן חָבֵר.
human_translation: If so, why specifically of a ḥaver ? even of an am ha’aretz , That is also what is saying, in vessels belonging to the am ha’aretz fit to be used by a ḥaver .
llm_translation: So, what is the status of a vessel belonging to an ignoramus? Even if it is clean! This is what he is saying: In vessels of an ignoramus, suitable for use, a scholar may use them.

hebrew_text: מַחְזִיקִין יְדֵי גּוֹיִם בַּשְּׁבִיעִית: מַחְזִיקִין?! וְהָאָמַר רַב דִּימִי בַּר שִׁישְׁנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: אֵין עוֹדְרִין עִם הַגּוֹי בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וְאֵין כּוֹפְלִין ״שָׁלוֹם״ לְגוֹי! לָא צְרִיכָא, לְמֵימְרָא לְהוּ ״אַחְזוּקוּ״ בְּעָלְמָא – כִּי הָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אֲמַר לְהוּ ״אַחְזוּקוּ״; רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר לְהוּ ״אַשַּׁרְתָּא״.
human_translation: one may assist gentiles during the Sabbatical one assist But didn’t Rav Dimi bar Shishna say in the name of Rav: One may not hoe with a gentile during the Sabbatical and one may not double the greeting to a gentile, No, it is necessary merely say to them: Be strong, as that where Rav Yehuda said to Be strong, Rav Sheshet said to them: Well done.
llm_translation: We uphold the hands of non-Jews during the Sabbatical year. Uphold?! But didn't Rav Dimi bar Shishna say in the name of Rav: We do not uphold with the non-Jew during the Sabbatical year, and we do not greet a non-Jew with "shalom"! It is not necessary, rather to say to them "achzuku" in general - for this is what Rav Yehudah said to them "achzuku"; Rav Sheshet said to them "ashtata."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין כּוֹפְלִין ״שָׁלוֹם״ לְגוֹי: רַב חִסְדָּא מַקְדֵּים וְיָהֵיב לְהוּ שְׁלָמָא. רַב כָּהֲנָא אֲמַר לְהוּ ״שְׁלָמָא לְמָר״.
human_translation: one may not double the greeting to a gentile. Rav Ḥisda greet first Rav Kahana, say to them: Peace to my master,
llm_translation: And one does not respond "peace" to a gentile. Rav Ḥisdah would greet them and say "shalom." Rav Kahana said to them, "Shalom to our master."

hebrew_text: וְשׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹמָן. הַשְׁתָּא אַחְזוֹקֵי מַחְזְקִינַן, שׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹמָן מִיבַּעְיָא?! אָמַר רַב יֵיבָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְיוֹם אֵידָם – דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יִכָּנֵס אָדָם לְבֵיתוֹ שֶׁל גּוֹי בְּיוֹם אֵידוֹ, וְיִתֵּן לוֹ ״שָׁלוֹם״. מְצָאוֹ בַּשּׁוּק – נוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּשָׂפָה רָפָה וּבְכוֹבֶד רֹאשׁ.
human_translation: one may extend greetings Now one may assist them, is it necessary one may extend greetings to them? Rav Yeiva said: is necessary only on their holidays, as it is taught A person may not enter the home of a gentile on his holiday and extend greetings to him, he encounters him in the market, he may greet him in an undertone and in a solemn manner,
llm_translation: And they inquire about their well-being. Now, the holders of the decree are holding firm, inquiring about their well-being as if they need it?! Rav Yeiva said: It was only necessary for the day of their calamity - as it was taught: A person should not enter the house of a gentile on the day of their calamity, and should greet them with "shalom." If one finds them in the marketplace, one should greet them with a soft voice and with a bowed head.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא הֲווֹ יָתְבִי. חָלֵיף וְאָזֵיל גְּנִיבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ חַד לְחַבְרֵיהּ: נֵיקוּם מִקַּמֵּיהּ, דְּבַר אוֹרְיָין הוּא. אָמַר לוֹ: וּמִקַּמֵּי פָּלְגָאָה נֵיקוּם?! אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אִיהוּ לְגַבַּיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׁלָמָא עֲלַיְיכוּ מַלְכֵי, שְׁלָמָא עֲלַיְיכוּ מַלְכֵי! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מְנָא לָךְ דְּרַבָּנַן אִיקְּרוּ מְלָכִים? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּכְתִיב: ״בִּי מְלָכִים יִמְלוֹכוּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda were sitting Geneiva passed by One said to the other: We should stand before him, for he is a son of Torah. said to him: But should we stand before an argumentative person? In the meantime, approached them said to them: Peace be upon you, kings, peace be upon you, kings. They said to him: From where do you that the Sages are called kings? He said to them: As it is written “Through me kings rule”
llm_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Hisda were sitting. A thief passed by and went to steal. One of them said to his friend: "Let us get up and confront him, for he is a descendant of thieves." He said to him: "And should we confront the descendants of the exiles?!" Meanwhile, the thief came towards them, and he said to them: "Peace be upon you, kings, peace be upon you, kings!" They said to him: "How do you know that we are scholars?" He said to them: "For it is written: 'By me kings reign.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וּמְנָא לָךְ דְּכָפְלִינַן ״שְׁלָמָא״ לְמַלְכֵי? אֲמַר לְהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכּוֹפְלִין ״שָׁלוֹם״ לְמֶלֶךְ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרוּחַ לָבְשָׁה אֶת עֲמָשַׂי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁלִישִׁים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: said to him And from where do you that we must double the greeting to kings? He said to them: As Rav Yehuda says Rav says: From where that one must double the greeting to a king? As it is stated: “And the spirit clothed Amasai, who was chief of the captains,
llm_translation: They said to him: And how do you know that we double the word "shalom" for kings? He said to them, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: From where do we know that we double the word "shalom" for a king? As it is stated: "And the spirit clothed Amasai, chief of the captains, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לִיטְעוֹם מָר מִידֵּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיִּטְעוֹם כְּלוּם עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן מַאֲכָל לִבְהֶמְתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַתִּי עֵשֶׂב בְּשָׂדְךָ לִבְהֶמְתֶּךָ״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ״.
human_translation: said to Does the Master wish to taste something? said to them: So says Rav Yehuda Rav says: It is prohibited for a person to taste anything until he gives food to his animal, as it is stated “And I will give grass in the field for your animals” and afterward “And you shall eat and be satisfied.”
llm_translation: They said to him: Let the master taste it. He said to them: Thus said Rav Yehudah said Rav: It is forbidden for a person to taste anything until he gives food to his animal, as it is stated: "And I will give grass in your field for your animals," and afterwards: "And you shall eat and be satisfied."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַנִּיזָּקִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, O injured ones.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר ״הִתְקַבֵּל גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״, אוֹ ״הוֹלֵךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: one who says Receive this bill of divorce for my wife, or: Deliver this bill of divorce to my wife if seeks to retract he can retract a woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, if seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: The one who says, "I accept this bill of divorce for my wife," or "I am giving this bill of divorce to my wife," if he wishes to retract - he may retract. But the woman who says, "Accept my divorce," if she wishes to retract - she may not retract.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ, אִם אָמַר לוֹ הַבַּעַל: ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל לָהּ, אֶלָּא הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: Therefore, said to I do not want [ ee ifshi ] for you to receive for her; rather, deliver and give to her, if seeks to retract he can retract
llm_translation: Therefore, if the husband said to him: "I am unable to accept her, but go and give her," if he wishes to retract, he may retract.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הָאוֹמֶרֶת: ״טוֹל לִי גִּיטִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even who says: Take my bill of divorce for me, if seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even she who says, "Take my bill of divorce," if she wishes to retract - she may not retract.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: טַעְמָא דְּלָא שַׁוֵּיתֵיהּ אִיהִי שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה, הָא שַׁוֵּיתֵיהּ אִיהִי שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה, רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ – ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכִי״ דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi The reason that did not designate an agent for receipt. However, she designated him an agent for receipt, if seeks to retract he cannot retract Learn from Deliver, is like Acquire.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Aḥa said to Rav Ashi, the son of Rav Avya: The reason that if she did not appoint him as her agent to receive the bill of divorce, and then she appointed him as her agent to receive the bill of divorce, if he wants to retract – he may not retract. Learn from this – "one who goes" is like "one who acquires" the money!

hebrew_text: לָא; לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: ״הוֹלֵךְ״ לָאו כִּ״זְכִי״ דָּמֵי, וְ״הִתְקַבֵּל גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ –
human_translation: No, actually I say to you that Deliver, is not like Acquire, and Receive this bill of divorce on my wife, was necessary for
llm_translation: Not; forever say to you: "going" not like "acquisition" of money, and "receiving a bill of divorce for my wife" necessary for him –

hebrew_text: דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וּבַעַל לָאו בַּר שַׁוּוֹיֵי שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה הוּא, אַף עַל גַּב דִּמְטָא גִּיטָּא לִידֵהּ – לָא לֶהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּ״הִתְקַבֵּל וְהוֹלֵךְ״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: as it might enter your mind to say since the husband is not eligible to designate an agent for receipt, even though the bill of divorce reached her possession, is not bill of divorce. teaches us as he said: Receive and deliver
llm_translation: When your mind arose, I say, since the husband is not of equal status as the messenger to receive, even though the bill of divorce reached her hand - it is not considered a valid bill of divorce. It is implied to us, "it is accepted and goes" is what he meant.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר. מַאי, לָאו לָא שְׁנָא אַקַּבָּלָה, לָא שְׁנָא אַהוֹלָכָה?
human_translation: We learned a woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, if seeks to retract he cannot retract What, is it not it is no different of receipt it is no different of delivery,
llm_translation: We learned: A woman who said, "Accept my divorce document." If he wants to retract - he may not retract. What, is it not the same whether I accept or whether I walk away?

hebrew_text: לָא, אַקַּבָּלָה.
human_translation: No, of receipt,
llm_translation: Not, Akkavala.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לְפִיכָךְ, אִם אָמַר לוֹ הַבַּעַל: ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל לָהּ, אֶלָּא הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי״; הָא לָא אָמַר ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ – ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכִי״ דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Come hear Therefore, said to I do not want you to receive on her rather, deliver and give to her, if seeks to retract he can retract The reason is that he said: I do not want, However, if he did not say: I do not want, if seeks to retract he cannot retract Learn from Deliver, is like Acquire.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Therefore, if the husband said to her, "I am unwilling to give her a divorce unless she accepts it willingly," if he wishes to retract, he may retract. The reason he said, "I am unwilling," is because he did not actually say, "I am unwilling." If he wishes to retract, he may not retract. Learn from this that "he may retract" is similar to "he may not retract."

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא בְּ״הֵילָךְ״.
human_translation: Perhaps where Here you are [ heilakh ].
llm_translation: Perhaps in the "way."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא – אִישׁ הָוֵי שָׁלִיחַ לְהוֹלָכָה, שֶׁכֵּן בַּעַל מוֹלִיךְ גֵּט אִשְׁתּוֹ; וְאִשָּׁה הָוְיָא שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה, שֶׁכֵּן אִשָּׁה מְקַבֶּלֶת גִּיטָּהּ מִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ. אִישׁ – לְקַבָּלָה, וְהָאִשָּׁה – לְהוֹלָכָה, מַאי?
human_translation: obvious man can be an agent for delivery, as a husband delivers his wife’s bill of divorce. And a woman can be an agent for receipt, as a woman receives her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband. a man for receipt and a woman for delivery, what
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Peshita - ish havi shaliach leholakha, sheken baal molikh get ishto; ve'isha havya shaliach lekabbala, sheken isha mekabelet gitah miyad ba'alah. Ish - lekabbala, veha'isha - leholakha, mai? English translation: Simple - a man is an agent for divorce, as the husband sends his wife; and a woman is an agent for receiving, as a woman receives her divorce from the hand of her husband. A man - for receiving, and the woman - for divorce, what is the law?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, הָאוֹמֵר: ״הִתְקַבֵּל גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״, אוֹ ״הוֹלֵךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר. מַאי, לָאו בְּחַד שָׁלִיחַ – וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כָּשֵׁר לְקַבָּלָה כָּשֵׁר לְהוֹלָכָה? לָא, בִּשְׁנֵי שְׁלוּחִין.
human_translation: Come hear one who says Receive this bill of divorce for my wife, or: Deliver this bill of divorce to my wife if seeks to retract he can retract a woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, if seeks to retract he cannot retract What, is it not one agent and conclude from it valid for receipt is valid for delivery No, to two agents,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who says, "This bill of divorce is accepted by my wife," or "This bill of divorce is going to my wife," if he wishes to retract, he may retract. But a woman who says, "My bill of divorce is accepted," if she wishes to retract, she may not retract. What is the reason? Is it not because with one agent, and we learn from it that it is valid for acceptance but not for delivery? No, it is with two agents.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לְפִיכָךְ, אִם אָמַר לוֹ הַבַּעַל: ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל לָהּ, אֶלָּא הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. וְהָא הָכָא, דְּחַד שָׁלִיחַ הוּא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כָּשֵׁר לְקַבָּלָה כָּשֵׁר לְהוֹלָכָה!
human_translation: Come hear Therefore, said to I do not want you to receive on her rather, deliver and give to her, if seeks to retract he can retract And isn’t here where it is one agent and conclude from valid for receipt is valid for delivery
llm_translation: Come and hear: Therefore, if the husband said to her, "I am unwilling to accept her, rather go and give her," if he wishes to retract - he may retract. And here, since he is one messenger, and he heard from her, it is valid for acceptance and valid for returning!

hebrew_text: פְּשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ אִישׁ הָוֵי שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבָּלָה – שֶׁכֵּן אָב מְקַבֵּל גֵּט לְבִתּוֹ קְטַנָּה; אִשָּׁה לְהוֹלָכָה – תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, מַאי? אָמַר רַב מָרִי, תָּא שְׁמַע: אַף הַנָּשִׁים שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱמָנוֹת לוֹמַר מֵת בַּעְלָהּ, נֶאֱמָנוֹת לְהָבִיא אֶת גִּיטָּהּ – וְהָתָם הוֹלָכָה הִיא.
human_translation: Resolve from a man can be an agent for receipt, as a father receives a bill of divorce on of his daughter a minor a woman for delivery, raise the dilemma: What Rav Mari said: Come hear Even the women who are not deemed credible to say husband died, are deemed credible to bring her bill of divorce And there, is delivery.
llm_translation: The simple understanding is: a man can be a messenger to receive a bill of divorce - just as a father can receive a bill of divorce for his minor daughter; a woman for divorce - she should demand it for herself, what is the reason? Rav Mari said, come and hear: even women who are not trusted to say 'her husband is dead,' are trusted to bring her bill of divorce - and there she is going for divorce.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִסֵּיפָא נָמֵי שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ – דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָאִשָּׁה עַצְמָהּ מְבִיאָה אֶת גִּיטָּהּ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁהִיא צְרִיכָה לוֹמַר: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״; וְאוֹקֵימְנָא בְּהוֹלָכָה; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Learn from the latter clause as well, as the latter clause teaches: The woman herself may bring her bill of divorce, provided that she is required to state It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, and we established for delivery. Learn from
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: From the end, we can infer the principle - as it is taught in the end: "The woman herself brings her bill of divorce, but only if she needs to say: 'It was written and signed in my presence'; and we establish it through her walking away; that is the inference.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: ״הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְ״אִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אָמַר: ״הֵילָךְ כְּמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה״;
human_translation: was stated Bring my bill of divorce to me, and Your wife said receive my bill of divorce for me, and says: Here you are, as she said;
llm_translation: It was stated: "Bring me my bill of divorce," and "Your wife said, 'Accept my bill of divorce,'" and he said: "Go according to what she said."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ הִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַדִּיבּוּרָא דִידֵיהּ קָא סָמֵיךְ – דְּאִי אַדִּיבּוּרָא דִידַהּ קָא סָמֵיךְ, מִכִּי מָטֵי גִּיטָּא לִידַהּ מִיהָא תִּיגָּרַשׁ!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: even the bill of divorce reached her possession, she is not divorced. Learn from relies on statement As, if relies on statement at least when the bill of divorce reaches her possession let her be divorced,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said, Rav said: Even if the get reaches her hand - she is not divorced. Learn from this that her own speech is relied upon - for if her own speech is relied upon, when the get reaches her hand she will be divorced!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: How can be compared?
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: "Is this so?!"

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אִי אִיתְּמַר אִיפְּכָא: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְ״אִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אֹמֵר: ״הֵילָךְ כְּמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה״; וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת – אַלְמָא אַדִּיבּוּרָא דִידַהּ הוּא דְּקָא סָמֵיךְ;
human_translation: Granted, if the opposite was stated, Receive my bill of divorce for me, Your wife said: Bring me my bill of divorce, and said: Here you are, as she said, and Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: Once the bill of divorce reaches possession, she is divorced, Apparently, relies upon her statement
llm_translation: In truth, if it is said, it is reversed: "My divorce document has been accepted by me," and "Your wife said, 'Bring me my divorce document,'" and he says, "Go according to what she said." And Rav Nachman said that Rabba bar Avuh said in the name of Rav: Once the divorce document reaches his hand, she is divorced - this proves that her speech is what he relies on.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי ״לְיָדָהּ״ – אַדִּיבּוּרָא דִידֵיהּ קָא סָמֵיךְ. אֶלָּא הָכָא – מִשּׁוּם דְּעַקְרַיהּ שָׁלִיחַ לִשְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ לִגְמָרֵי הוּא; דְּאָמַר: שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה הָוֵינָא, לְהוֹלָכָה לָא הָוֵינָא.
human_translation: Alternatively, her possession, relies on statement, However, here, due to that the agent negates his agency entirely, as he said: I am an agent for receipt, I am not to be an agent for delivery.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei 'leyadah' – adibura dida kaa sameich. Ella hacha – mishum de'akrayah shalich leshlichutai ligmarei hu; de'amar: shalich lekabbalah haveina, leholacha la lo haveina." English translation: "If it were only 'to her hand' – his own statement is supporting. Rather here – because his messenger is a messenger for his complete agency; as he said: 'A messenger for receiving I was, not for delivering.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא: תָּא שְׁמַע, הָאוֹמֵר: ״הִתְקַבֵּל גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״ אוֹ ״הוֹלֵךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״, רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. טַעְמָא דְּרָצָה, הָא לֹא רָצָה – הָוֵי גֵּט;
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya says: Come hear one who says Receive this bill of divorce for my wife, or: Deliver this bill of divorce to my wife if seeks to retract he may retract The reason he seeks However, did not seek it is bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chiya said: Come and hear, one who says, "I accept this bill of divorce for my wife" or "I am giving this bill of divorce to my wife," if he wishes to retract - he may retract. The reason for his desire, if he does not desire - it is a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? הָא בַּעַל לָאו בַּר שַׁוּוֹיֵי שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה הוּא! אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו לְגָרְשָׁהּ, מֵימָר אָמַר: תִּיגָּרַשׁ כֹּל הֵיכִי דְּמִגָּרְשָׁה; הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו לְגָרְשָׁהּ, מֵימָר אָמַר: תִּיגָּרַשׁ כֹּל הֵיכִי דְּמִגָּרְשָׁה!
human_translation: But why Isn’t the husband ineligible to designate an agent for receipt? Rather, we say: Once he decided to divorce her, he said Let her be divorced any way that she is divorced. Here too, once he decided to divorce her, he says: Let her be divorced any way that she is divorced.
llm_translation: And why? This is because Ba'al Lav is a trustworthy messenger for receiving the bill of divorce! Rather we say: Once he has set his eyes to divorce her, he may say: "You shall be divorced in any way that you choose." Here too, once he has set his eyes to divorce her, he may say: "You shall be divorced in any way that you choose."

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם – אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין שְׁלִיחוּת לְקַבָּלָה, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לְשֵׁם הוֹלָכָה; הָכָא – טָעֵי.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, a person knows that agency for receipt cannot and he decided to give for the sake of delivery. here, errs
llm_translation: So now?! There - a person knows that there is no agency for receiving, and he completed and gave to the name of the recipient; here - mistaken.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תָּא שְׁמַע, קְטַנָּה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ. כִּי מָטֵי גִּיטָּא לִידַהּ – מִיהָא מִגָּרְשָׁה, וְאַמַּאי? וְהָא לָאו שָׁלִיחַ לְהוֹלָכָה שַׁוְּיֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו לְגָרְשָׁהּ, מֵימָר אָמַר: תִּיגָּרַשׁ כֹּל הֵיכִי דְּמִגָּרְשָׁה; הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו לְגָרְשָׁהּ, מֵימָר אָמַר: תִּיגָּרַשׁ כֹּל הֵיכִי דְּמִגָּרְשָׁה!
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear a minor girl who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, it is not a bill of divorce until it reaches her possession, In any event, once the bill of divorce reaches her possession she is divorced. But why did not designate him an agent for delivery. Rather, we say: Once he decided to divorce her, he said Let her be divorced any way that she is divorced, Here too, once he decided to divorce her, he says: Let her be divorced any way that she is divorced.
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear, a minor who said, "My get was accepted" - it is not a get until the get reaches her hand. When the get reaches her hand - from here she may divorce, and why? Isn't he not a messenger for her to go? Rather we say: Once he has given his attention to her divorce, he should say: "You shall be divorced just as you have divorced." Here too, once he has given his attention to her divorce, he should say: "You shall be divorced just as you have divorced."

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם – אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין שְׁלִיחוּת לְקָטָן, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לָהּ לְשׁוּם הוֹלָכָה דִּידֵיהּ; הָכָא – טָעֵי.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, a person knows that there is no agency for a minor and he decided to give for delivery. here, errs
llm_translation: So, is this a question?! There - a person knows that there is no agency for a minor, and he concluded and gave it to her for the purpose of her own benefit; here - he made a mistake.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְ״אִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״; ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְ״אִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אֹמֵר: ״הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״, ״זְכֵי לָהּ״, וְ״הִתְקַבֵּל לָהּ״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, יַחְזוֹר; מִשֶּׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Come hear Bring me my bill of divorce, and Your wife said: Receive my bill of divorce for me; Receive my bill of divorce for me, and Your wife said: Bring me my bill of divorce, and said Deliver and give to her, Acquire for her, or: Receive for her, if seeks to retract he may retract once the bill of divorce reaches her possession, divorced.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'Bring me my bill of divorce,' and 'Your wife said, 'Accept my bill of divorce'; 'Accept my bill of divorce,' and 'Your wife said, 'Bring me my bill of divorce.' And he says: 'Go and give it to her,' 'Acquire it for her,' and 'Accept it for her' - if he wanted to retract, he may retract; once the bill of divorce reaches her hand - she is divorced."

hebrew_text: מַאי, לָאו קַבָּלָה – אַקַּבָּלָה, וְהוֹלָכָה – אַהוֹלָכָה?
human_translation: What, is it not receipt, to receipt, and delivery, to delivery,
llm_translation: What, is it not Kabbalah - I will accept it, and is it not Halakha - I will walk in it?

hebrew_text: לָא; קַבָּלָה – אַהוֹלָכָה, וְהוֹלָכָה – אַקַּבָּלָה.
human_translation: No, receipt, to delivery, and delivery, to receipt.
llm_translation: Not received; Kabbalah - receiving, and receiving - accepting.

hebrew_text: אִי קַבָּלָה אַהוֹלָכָה – מִכִּי מָטֵי גִּיטָּא לִידֵיהּ, לְאַלְתַּר לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא! שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ, דְּאַדִּיבּוּרָא דִידֵיהּ קָא סָמֵיךְ!
human_translation: If receipt, to delivery, from that the bill of divorce reaches possession let it be a bill of divorce immediately [ le’altar ], Conclude from that relies on statement
llm_translation: If it is according to the laws of reception, the divorce document goes from the husband into her hands, in order that it should immediately be a valid divorce document! You have heard from it, that his speech is close to his hands!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״הֵילָךְ כְּמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה״, הָכָא מִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״הֵילָךְ כְּמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה״?!
human_translation: How can be compared? There, said to Here you are, as she said, Here does say to Here you are, as she said?
llm_translation: So what is the difference?! There, he is saying to him: "Go as she said." Here, who is he saying to him: "Go as she said"?!

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְ״אִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הוֹלֵךְ״, וְ״תֵן לָהּ״, ״זְכֵי לָהּ״, וְ״הִתְקַבֵּל לָהּ״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, לֹא יַחְזוֹר. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, יַחְזוֹר; ״זְכֵי לָהּ״ וְ״הִתְקַבֵּל לָהּ״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, לֹא יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: The Sages taught Receive my bill of divorce for me, and Your wife said: Receive my bill of divorce for me, and says: Deliver and give to her, Acquire for her, or: Receive for her, seeks to retract he cannot retract Rabbi Natan says: Deliver and give to her, he seeks to retract he can retract Acquire for her, or: Receive for her, seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "My divorce document was accepted by me," and "Your wife said, 'My divorce document was accepted by me,'" and he says: "Go," and "Give it to her," "Acquire it for her," and "It was accepted by her" - if he wanted to retract, he may not retract. Rabbi Natan says: "Go and give it to her" - if he wanted to retract, he may retract; "Acquire it for her" and "It was accepted by her" - if he wanted to retract, he may not retract.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּכוּלָּן – אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, לֹא יַחְזוֹר. אֲבָל אִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל לָהּ, אֶלָּא הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״, רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: Rabbi says: In all of if he seeks to retract he cannot retract However, if he said to I do not want you to receive for her; rather, deliver and give to her, he seeks to retract he can retract
llm_translation: Rabbi says: In all of them - if he wanted to retract, he should not retract. But if he said to him: "I am unable to accept her except by going and giving her," if he wanted to retract - he may retract.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״אִי אֶיפְשִׁי״ אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן; וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, מַאן תַּנָּא קַמָּא – רַבִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi is the first tanna ; If you wish, say comes to teach us I do not want And if you wish, say this teaches us: Who is the first tanna Rabbi
llm_translation: Rabbi Hainu taught first! If you ask, say: "If it is impossible," he came to teach us; and if you ask, say: "Here he is informing us, who is the first Tanna? - Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״הֵילָךְ״ – לְרַבִּי נָתָן, כִּ״זְכֵי״ דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָאו כִּ״זְכֵי״ דָּמֵי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Here you are, to Rabbi Natan it comparable where Acquire, or not comparable where Acquire?
llm_translation: He asked them: "Heilach" - to Rabbi Natan, like "zakhei" of money, or not like "zakhei" of money?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָאוֹמֵר ״הִתְקַבֵּל גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״ אוֹ ״הוֹלֵךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״, רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: Come hear one who says Receive this bill of divorce for my wife, or: Deliver this bill of divorce to my wife seeks to retract he can retract a woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: ha'omer 'hitkabel get zeh le'ishti' o 'holekh get zeh le'ishti', ratza lachzor - yachzor. Ha'isha she'amarah: 'hitkabel li gitit', ratza lachzor - lo yachzor." English translation: "Come and hear: One who says, 'I accept this bill of divorce for my wife' or 'I am giving this bill of divorce to my wife,' if he wants to retract - he may retract. But a woman who says, 'Accept my divorce,' if she wants to retract - she may not retract."

hebrew_text: מַאי, לָאו בְּ״הֵילָךְ״ – וְרַבִּי נָתָן? לָא; בְּ״הוֹלֵךְ״ – וְרַבִּי.
human_translation: What, is not where Here you are, and Rabbi Natan, No, where Deliver, Rabbi
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "heilach" according to Rabbi Natan? No, "holech" according to Rabbi.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לְפִיכָךְ, אִם אָמַר לוֹ הַבַּעַל: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל לָהּ, אֶלָּא הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״, רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי״; הָא לָא אָמַר: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי״, רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר;
human_translation: Come hear Therefore, said to I do not want you to receive for her; rather, deliver and give to her, seeks to retract he can retract The reason is that he said: I do not want, However, if he did not say: I do not want, seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: Come and hear: Therefore, if the husband said to her, "I do not want you except on the condition that you accept it," and he wants to retract - he may retract. The reason he said, "I do not want" is because he did not say, "I do not want." If he wants to retract - he may not retract.

hebrew_text: מַאי, לָאו בְּ״הֵילָךְ״ – וְרַבִּי נָתָן? לָא; בְּ״הוֹלֵךְ״ – וְרַבִּי.
human_translation: What, not where Here you are, and Rabbi Natan, No, where Deliver, Rabbi
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "heilach" - and Rabbi Nathan? No; "holech" - and Rabbi.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הוֹלֵךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, יַחְזוֹר. ״הֵילָךְ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, לֹא יַחְזוֹר. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר בְּ״הוֹלֵךְ״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, יַחְזוֹר – רַבִּי נָתָן; וְקָאָמַר בְּ״הֵילָךְ״ – רָצָה לַחְזוֹר, לֹא יַחְזוֹר; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ – ״הֵילָךְ״ כִּ״זְכֵי״ דָּמֵי; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Deliver this bill of divorce to my wife, seeks to retract he can retract Here you are; this bill of divorce for my wife, seeks to retract he cannot retract Whom did you hear who said with regard to Deliver, seeks to retract he can retract Rabbi Natan; and he says in Here you are, seeks to retract he cannot retract Learn from Here you are, comparable where Acquire. Learn from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: 'holekh get zeh le'ishti' - ratsah la'chzor, yachzor. 'heilekh get zeh le'ishti' - ratsah la'chzor, lo yachzor. Man shama't leih de'amar be'holekh' - ratsah la'chzor, yachzor - Rabbi Natan; ve'ka'amar be'heilekh' - ratsah la'chzor, lo yachzor; shema minah - 'heilekh' ki'zakhei damei; shema minah." English translation: "Come and hear: 'He goes to give this bill of divorce to his wife' - if he wants to return, he may return. 'He walks to give this bill of divorce to his wife' - if he wants to return, he may not return. Who heard him saying 'he goes' - if he wants to return, he may return - Rabbi Natan; and he said 'he walks' - if he wants to return, he may not return; learn from it - 'he walks' is like 'the righteous' in its consequences; learn from it."

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְ״אִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הוֹלֵךְ וְתֵן לָהּ״ – אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: נַעֲשָׂה שְׁלוּחוֹ וּשְׁלוּחָהּ – וְחוֹלֶצֶת.
human_translation: It was stated Receive my bill of divorce for me, and Your wife said: Receive my bill of divorce for me, and says Deliver and give her, Rabbi Abba says Rav Huna says Rav says: becomes agent and agent but she performs ḥalitza
llm_translation: It was stated: "My divorce was accepted by me," and "Your wife said, 'My divorce was accepted by me,'" and he says: "Go and give it to her" - Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav: Her emissary is considered as her and she is divorced.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּמְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לְרַב אִי ״הוֹלֵךְ״ כִּ״זְכֵי״ דָּמֵי, אִי לָאו כִּ״זְכֵי״ דָּמֵי?! וְהָא אִתְּמַר: ״הוֹלֵךְ מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לוֹ״, אָמַר רַב: חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, וְאִם בָּא לַחְזוֹר – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר!
human_translation: Is this to say that Rav was uncertain whether Deliver, comparable Acquire, whether not comparable where Acquire? But wasn’t it stated Deliver one hundred dinars to so-and-so, as I owe him Rav says: bears responsibility if seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: In the matter of doubt, Rav is uncertain whether "halakh" is like "zekhei" or not like "zekhei"?! But it was stated: "One who gives a coin to so-and-so, I am indebted to him," Rav said: He is owed in return, and if he comes to retract – he does not retract!

hebrew_text: הָתָם – סְפֵק מָמוֹנָא לְקוּלָּא, הָכָא – סְפֵק אִיסּוּרָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: There, uncertainty monetary lenient, here, uncertainty ritual stringent.
llm_translation: There - doubt money for leniency, here - doubt prohibition for stringency.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל לָהּ גִּיטָּהּ מִיַּד שְׁלִיחַ בַּעְלָהּ. וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אִשָּׁה עוֹשָׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל לָהּ גִּיטָּהּ מִיַּד שְׁלִיחַ בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rav says: A woman cannot appoint an agent to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband’s agent, and Rabbi Ḥanina says: A woman can appoint an agent to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband’s agent.
llm_translation: Rav said: A woman does not appoint a messenger to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband's messenger. And Rabbi Chanina said: A woman appoints a messenger to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband's messenger.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם בִּזָּיוֹן דְּבַעַל;
human_translation: What is the reason of Rav, If you wish, say: due to contempt for husband.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rav's opinion? If you wish, I can say: Because of the degradation of Baal.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם חֲצֵרָהּ הַבָּא לְאַחַר מִיכָּן.
human_translation: If you wish, say due to her courtyard that comes thereafter.
llm_translation: If you ask, say: because of her courtyard he came after from here.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דִּקְדַמָה אִיהִי, וְשַׁוִּיָּה שָׁלִיחַ מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: What is between between them where she first appointed an agent from the outset,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that one precedes, and the other is a messenger from the outset.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּשַׁדַּר לַהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ, אֲזַל שְׁלִיחָא אַשְׁכְּחַהּ כִּי יָתְבָה וְקָא לָיְשָׁא, אֲמַר לַהּ: ״הֵילָךְ גִּיטָּךְ״, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״לֶיהֱוֵי בִּידָךְ״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אִם אִיתָא לִדְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, עֲבַדִי בַּהּ עוֹבָדָא.
human_translation: a certain man who sent a bill of divorce to his wife. The agent went and found her while she was sitting and kneading. He said to her: Here you are, your bill of divorce. She said to him: let be in your hand, Rav Naḥman said: If it is so that of Rabbi Ḥanina I would perform an action with regard to
llm_translation: That man who sent a get to his wife, the messenger went and found her sitting and crying. He said to her, "Take your get." She replied to him, "Let it be in your hand." Rav Nachman said: If it comes to Rabbi Chanina, he would perform the matter.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְאִם אִיתָא לִדְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, עֲבַדְתְּ בַּהּ עוֹבָדָא?! הָא לֹא חָזְרָה שְׁלִיחוּת אֵצֶל הַבַּעַל!
human_translation: Rava said to him: And if it is so that of Rabbi Ḥanina, would you perform an action with regard to agency did not return to the husband
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: And if it comes to Rabbi Chanina, did you perform the task with it?! Behold, the mission did not return to the sender!

hebrew_text: שַׁלְחוּהָ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, שְׁלַח לְהוּ: לֹא חָזְרָה שְׁלִיחוּת אֵצֶל הַבַּעַל. וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: נִתְיַישֵּׁב בַּדָּבָר.
human_translation: sent this before Rabbi Ami. He sent to them: The agency did not return to the husband, And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: We will consider the matter
llm_translation: Send her before Rabbi Ammi, send to him: did not return the mission by the husband. And Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: he settled in the matter.

hebrew_text: הֲדוּר שַׁלְחוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר: כֹּל הָנֵי שָׁלְחוּ לַהּ וְאָזְלִי? כִּי הֵיכִי דִּמְסַפְּקָא לְהוּ לְדִידְהוּ, הָכִי נָמֵי מְסַפְּקָא לַן לְדִידַן;
human_translation: they again sent before Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba. He said: All these they continue to send Just as the matter is uncertain to them, so too, it is uncertain to us,
llm_translation: Adorned, they sent her before Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, he said: All these that sent to her and went? For how that doubtful to them to themselves, so also doubtful to us to ourselves.

hebrew_text: הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁבָּעֶרְוָה, וְדָבָר שֶׁבָּעֶרְוָה – חוֹלֶצֶת.
human_translation: a matter of forbidden relations, a matter of forbidden relations, she performs ḥalitza .
llm_translation: Be a matter that is forbidden, and a matter that is forbidden - it exempts.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וְאַצְרְכַהּ רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָּא גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה. תַּרְתֵּי?! גֵּט מֵחַיִּים, וַחֲלִיצָה לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: was an incident and Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta required bill of divorce and ḥalitza . Two a bill of divorce where alive, and ḥalitza after death.
llm_translation: The matter was, and Rav Yitzchak son of Shmuel son of Marta needed a divorce document and a redemption. Two?! A divorce from the living, and redemption after death.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּהֲווֹ קָרוּ לַהּ ״נַפְאָתָה״, אֲזוּל סָהֲדֵי כְּתוּב ״תַּפְאָתָה״. אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְרַב: עָשׂוּ עֵדִים שְׁלִיחוּתָן.
human_translation: a certain who was named Nefata The witnesses went and wrote Tefata Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta says in the name of Rav: witnesses performed their agency
llm_translation: That one that they called her "Nafatah," went to testify as it is written "Tafatah." Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta said in the name of Rav: They made their witnesses emissaries.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה: מִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ ״כְּתוּבוּ חַסְפָּא וְהַבוּ לַהּ״?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: וַדַּאי, אִי כְּתוּב סָהֲדֵי גִּיטָּא מְעַלְּיָא, וַאֲבַד, עָשׂוּ עֵדִים שְׁלִיחוּתָן.
human_translation: Rabba objects to this Does say to them: Write shard and give it to her? Rather, Rabba said: Certainly, if the witnesses wrote a proper bill of divorce and it was lost, the witnesses performed their agency,
llm_translation: Rabah objects to him: Who said to them, "Write a bill of divorce and give it to her"? Rather, Rabah said: Certainly, if it is written, the witnesses of the divorce document are superior, and it was lost, they should appoint new witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן: מִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ ״כְּתֻבוּ וְאַנְּחוּהּ בְּכִיסַיְיכוּ״?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין, אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman objects to this Does say to them: Write and place it in your pockets? Rather, Rav Naḥman said: write and give even one hundred times.
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Nachman: Who is saying to them "Write it and place it in your pockets"?! Rather Rav Nachman said: One may write and give, even a hundred times.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: ״כִּתְבוּ, וּתְנוּ לְשָׁלִיחַ״, מַהוּ? סַלּוֹקֵי סַלֵּיק לְהוּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא לְטִירְחָא דִּידְהוּ חָיֵישׁ?
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: Write and give to an agent, what exclude them Or perhaps was concerned about their exertions,
llm_translation: Rava asked a question of Rav Nachman: "They wrote, 'and give to the messenger,' what is the law? Should we remove and give to him, or perhaps they are concerned about their own trouble?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: ״וְיוֹלִיךְ לָהּ״, מַהוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, and he will deliver to her, what is shall stand
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "And he shall lead her," what is the ruling? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״טוֹל לִי גִּיטִּי״, אִם רָצָה לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״טוֹל לִי״, וְ״שָׂא לִי״, וִ״יהֵא לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״ – כּוּלָּן לְשׁוֹן קַבָּלָה הֵן.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even who says Take my bill of divorce for me, if seeks to retract he cannot retract The Sages taught Take for me, Lift for me, or: will be in your possession for me, all of them are expressions of receipt,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even she who says, "Take my bill of divorce," if she wishes to retract, she may not retract. The Sages taught: "Take for me," "Acquire for me," and "Let it be in your possession" - all of these are expressions of acquisition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, צְרִיכָה שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים – שְׁנַיִם שֶׁאוֹמְרִים: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ אָמְרָה״, וּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁאוֹמְרִים: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ קִבֵּל, וְקָרַע״; אֲפִילּוּ הֵן הָרִאשׁוֹנִים וְהֵן הָאַחֲרוֹנִים,
human_translation: A woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, requires two sets of witnesses two who say: In our presence she said and two who say: In our presence received and tore even are the first and are the latter
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If a woman says, 'My divorce document was accepted by me,' she requires two groups of witnesses - two who say, 'She said it in our presence,' and two who say, 'She accepted it in our presence, and tore it up.' Even if they are the first witnesses and the last witnesses."

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֶחָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, וְאֶחָד מִן הָאַחֲרוֹנִים, וְאֶחָד מִצְטָרֵף עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: or one from the first and one from the latter and one joins with them
llm_translation: Or one from the first, and one from the last, and one joins with them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: בַּעַל אוֹמֵר לְפִקָּדוֹן, וְשָׁלִישׁ אוֹמֵר לְגֵירוּשִׁין – מִי נֶאֱמָן? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: בַּעַל נֶאֱמָן, וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: שָׁלִישׁ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: It was stated a husband says as a deposit and the third party [ shalish ], says for divorce. who is deemed credible? Rav Huna says: The husband is deemed credible, and Rav Ḥisda says: The third party is deemed credible.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: If a husband says to the agent, "to divorce," and the messenger says, "to betroth" - who is believed? Rav Huna said: The husband is believed, and Rav Ḥisdah said: The messenger is believed.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: בַּעַל נֶאֱמָן – דְּאִם אִיתָא דִּלְגֵירוּשִׁין יַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, לְדִידַהּ הֲוָה יָהֵיב לַהּ נִיהֲלַהּ. וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: שָׁלִישׁ נֶאֱמָן – דְּהָא הֵימְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said the husband is deemed credible, as, if it is so that he gave it to for divorce, he would have given to her. And Rav Ḥisda said: The third party is deemed credible, as deemed him credible
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A trustworthy husband - if it is said that he should divorce, he should give her the divorce, for in her interest he gave it. And Rav Hisda said: A trustworthy agent - for he trusted him.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי אַבָּא: הוֹדָאַת בַּעַל דִּין כְּמֵאָה עֵדִים דָּמֵי, וְשָׁלִישׁ נֶאֱמָן מִשְּׁנֵיהֶם. כֵּיצַד? זֶה אוֹמֵר כָּךְ, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר כָּךְ, שָׁלִישׁ נֶאֱמָן!
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raises an objection the admission of a litigant is similar to one hundred witnesses, and a third party is deemed credible than both of How so? this says this and that says that third party deemed credible
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Abba raises an objection: The admission of a litigant is like the testimony of a hundred witnesses, and a trusted third party is as two of them. How so? One says this, and the other says that, the third party is trusted!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מָמוֹן, דְּאִיתְיְהִיב לִמְחִילָּה.
human_translation: A monetary is different, as it can be forgiven.
llm_translation: The money is different, for it is given as a gift.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: וְכֵן לְגִיטִּין! גִּיטֵּי מָמוֹן. וְהָתַנְיָא: וְכֵן לִשְׁטָרוֹת!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught And likewise to bills of divorce [ gittin ], monetary documents [ gittei mamon ]. But isn’t it taught And likewise to documents [ shetarot ]?
llm_translation: And there is a teaching: And so too regarding divorce documents! Divorce documents involving money. And it was taught: And so too regarding contracts!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי תַּנְיָא?!
human_translation: Are they, taught together?
llm_translation: From the hands of Gabbei Hadadei it was taught?!

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, צְרִיכָה שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים – שְׁנַיִם שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ אָמְרָה״, וּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ קִבֵּל, וְקָרַע״. וְאַמַּאי? לִיהֵמְנֵיהּ לְשָׁלִישׁ!
human_translation: We learned a woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, requires two sets of witnesses two who say: In our presence she said and two who say: In our presence received and tore And why Let us deem the third party, credible
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: A woman who says, "Accept my divorce document," requires two groups of witnesses - two who will say, "She said it in our presence," and two who will say, "She accepted it in our presence and tore it." And why? To enable her to marry a third husband!

hebrew_text: מִי קָא נָפֵיק גִּיטָּא מִתּוּתֵי יְדֵיהּ – דְּלִיהֵמְנֵיהּ?!
human_translation: Does the bill of divorce emerge from his possession, that to deem him credible?
llm_translation: Who is the one who is taking out the bill of divorce from her hands - for he is repudiating her?!

hebrew_text: תִּינַח אָמְרָה; קִיבֵּל לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַבָּה: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי.
human_translation: works out well she said why do I received Rabba said: whose is this It is Rabbi Elazar, says: Witnesses of transmission effect
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tinach said; why did he accept me? Rabba said: this is from the count - Rabbi Elazar is he, who said: witnesses of transfer I cut." English translation: Tinach said; why did he accept me? Rabba said: this is from the count - Rabbi Elazar is he, who said: witnesses of transfer I cut.

hebrew_text: קָרַע לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בִּשְׁעַת הַשְּׁמָד שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Why do I tore Rav Yehuda says Rav says: taught during a period of persecution,
llm_translation: He tore - why to me? Rav Yehudah said Rav: At the time of destruction they changed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: וּמוֹדֶה רַב הוּנָא, דְּאִי אֲמַרָה אִיהִי: לְדִידִי אֲמַר לִי שָׁלִישׁ דִּלְגֵירוּשִׁין יַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ – מְהֵימְנָא. מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּשָׁלִישׁ גּוּפֵיהּ לָא מְהֵימַן, וְאִיהִי מְהֵימְנָא?!
human_translation: Rabba said: And Rav Huna concedes that if said: third party said to me gave to him for divorce, she is deemed credible. Is there anything the third party himself is not deemed credible, but is deemed credible
llm_translation: Rabba said: And Rav Huna agrees, for if she said, "According to me, a third party who gives a bill of divorce is trustworthy," - it is trustworthy. But if it is from the hands of the third party himself, it is not trustworthy, and she is trustworthy?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אֲמַרָה: קַמַּאי דִּידִי לְגֵרוּשִׁין יַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ – מְהֵימְנָא; מִיגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא אָמְרָה לְדִידַהּ יַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ בַּעַל.
human_translation: Rather, if she said: In my presence gave to for divorce, she is deemed credible. miggo , Since, if she wished, she said the husband gave it to her
llm_translation: Rather, if she said: "The first husband of mine gave her a bill of divorce," we trust her; because if she wanted, she could have said, "Her husband gave her a bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: בַּעַל אֹמֵר לְגֵירוּשִׁין, וְשָׁלִישׁ אוֹמֵר לְגֵירוּשִׁין, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: נָתַן לִי, וְאָבַד – אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָוֵה דָּבָר שֶׁבָּעֶרְוָה, וְאֵין דָּבָר שֶׁבְּעֶרְוָה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם.
human_translation: husband said for divorce, and third party says for divorce, and says: gave me and was lost, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: is a matter of forbidden relations. And no matter of forbidden relations fewer than two
llm_translation: The husband says for divorces, and the wife says for divorces, and she says: he gave me, and it got lost - Rabbi Yochanan said: A matter that is prohibited, and there is nothing that is less prohibited than two.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? וְלִיהֵימְנֵיהּ לְשָׁלִישׁ! מִי קָא נָפֵיק גִּיטָּא מִתּוּתֵי יְדֵיהּ דְּלִהֵימְנֵיהּ?!
human_translation: But why But let us deem the third party credible, Does the bill of divorce emerge from his possession, that to deem him credible?
llm_translation: And why? And to believe him for a third! Who is taking out the bill of divorce from the hands of his wife?!

hebrew_text: וְלִהֵימְנֵיהּ לְבַעַל – דְּאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּעַל שֶׁאָמַר ״גֵּירַשְׁתִּי אֶת אִשְׁתִּי״ – נֶאֱמָן! מִי קָאָמַר ״גֵּירַשְׁתִּי״?!
human_translation: But let deem the husband credible, as Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A husband who says: I divorced my wife, is deemed credible. does say: I divorced
llm_translation: And to believe him, to the husband - as Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A husband who said, "I have divorced my wife" - he is believed! Who is saying, "I have divorced"?

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״צֵא וְקַדֵּשׁ לִי אִשָּׁה״ – סְתָם, וּמֵת שְׁלוּחוֹ – אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַנָּשִׁים שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם; חֲזָקָה שָׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ!
human_translation: But let us say a presumption an agent performs his agency, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says one who says to his agent: Go out and betroth a woman for me, not specify and his agent died prohibited all the women in the world, a presumption an agent performs his agency.
llm_translation: And say: Strong is the agent who performs his mission - as Rabbi Yitzchak said, one who says to his agent, "Go and betroth a woman for me" - generally, and if his agent dies - he is forbidden to all the women in the world; strong is the agent who performs his mission!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְחוּמְרָא, אֲבָל לְקוּלָּא לָא.
human_translation: This matter, to stringency, However, to leniency, no,
llm_translation: These matters are for stringency, but for leniency not.

hebrew_text: וְלִיהֵמְנַהּ לְדִידַהּ, מִדְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא – דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא, הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה לְבַעְלָהּ: ״גֵּירַשְׁתַּנִי״ – נֶאֱמֶנֶת, חֲזָקָה אֵין הָאִשָּׁה מְעִיזָּה פָּנֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי בַּעְלָהּ!
human_translation: But let deem the wife herself credible, on Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna says: woman who said to her husband: You divorced me, is deemed credible, a presumption a woman not be insolent in the presence of her husband
llm_translation: And to establish it according to her, from Rav Hamnuna - as Rav Hamnuna said, the woman who said to her husband: "You have divorced me" - she is believed, strong is the presumption that a woman does not dare to confront her husband!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּקָא מְסַיַּיע לַהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לַהּ – מְעִיזָּה וּמְעִיזָּה.
human_translation: This matter applies only where there is no that supports her However, where that supports her she indeed be insolent.
llm_translation: These words, where there is no one assisting her, but where there is one assisting her - she is bold and daring.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, הִיא וְאָבִיהָ מְקַבְּלִין אֶת גִּיטָּהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵין שְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם זוֹכוֹת כְּאַחַת, אֶלָּא אָבִיהָ מְקַבֵּל אֶת גִּיטָּהּ בִּלְבַד. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת גִּיטָּהּ, אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְגָּרֵשׁ.
human_translation: a betrothed young woman, she and her father receive her bill of divorce, Rabbi Yehuda said: Two hands do not acquire as one. Rather, her father alone receives her bill of divorce And Any who is unable to safeguard her bill of divorce is unable to be divorced.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A betrothed maiden, she and her father accept her bill of divorce. Rabbi Yehuda said: Two hands are not able to acquire as one, rather her father alone accepts her bill of divorce. And anyone who is unable to safeguard her bill of divorce, she is unable to divorce.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יְדָא יַתִּירְתָּא זַכִּי לַהּ רַחֲמָנָא, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: בִּמְקוֹם אָבִיהָ – יָד דִּילַהּ לָאו כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? The Rabbis hold: The Merciful One grants an additional hand, And Rabbi Yehuda holds: In a place, her father her hand is nothing
llm_translation: Gemara: With what issue do they disagree? The Rabbis hold: An additional hand of a woman is considered as if it were her own hand, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: In the place of her father, her hand is not considered as nothing.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת גִּיטָּהּ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קְטַנָּה הַיּוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת גִּיטָּהּ – מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת גִּיטָּהּ – אֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת. וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא קְטַנָּה יוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת גִּיטָּהּ? כֹּל שֶׁמְּשַׁמֶּרֶת גִּיטָּהּ וְדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: And any who is unable to safeguard her bill of divorce The Sages taught: A minor girl who knows to safeguard her bill of divorce can be divorced, and who does not know to safeguard her bill of divorce cannot be divorced. And which is minor girl knows to safeguard her bill of divorce? any who safeguards her bill of divorce and something else.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And all that she is not able to guard her bill of divorce. The Rabbis taught: A minor who knows how to guard her bill of divorce - she gets divorced, and one who does not know how to guard her bill of divorce - she does not get divorced. And who is a minor who knows how to guard her bill of divorce? Anyone who guards her bill of divorce and another matter.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁמְּשַׁמֶּרֶת דָּבָר אַחֵר מֵחֲמַת גִּיטָּהּ.
human_translation: What is saying Rabbi Yoḥanan says this is he is saying: Any who safeguards something else due to her bill of divorce,
llm_translation: What is he saying? Rabbi Yochanan said, thus he is saying: anyone who refrains from something because of her divorce.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ: הָא שׁוֹטָה בְּעָלְמָא הִיא! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: כֹּל שֶׁמַּבְחֶנֶת בֵּין גִּיטָּהּ לְדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ objects to this: That is merely an imbecile, Rather, Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ says in the name of Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika: any who distinguishes between her bill of divorce and something else,
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Huna son of Manoah: "She is simply a fool in the world!" Rather, Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Acha son of Rika: "Anyone who examines between her get and another matter."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: צְרוֹר וְזוֹרְקוֹ, אֱגוֹז וְנוֹטְלוֹ – זוֹכֶה לְעַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין זוֹכֶה לַאֲחֵרִים. חֵפֶץ – וּמַחְזִירוֹ לְאַחַר שָׁעָה, זוֹכֶה בֵּין לְעַצְמוֹ וּבֵין לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rabbi Asi says: a pebble and he throws it a nut and he takes it, he acquires for himself but does not acquire on others. an item and he returns it later, he acquires both for himself and on others.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rabbi Assi: One who ties and unties, cracks a nut and eats it - he gains for himself, but he does not gain for others. An object - and he returns it after a while, he gains both for himself and for others.

hebrew_text: כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי: דָּא וְדָא אַחַת הִיא. מַאי ״דָּא וְדָא אַחַת הִיא״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה – זוֹכֶה לְעַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין זוֹכֶה לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: When I stated before Shmuel he said to me: This and that are one. What This and that are one? Rav Ḥisda says: both this and that acquires for himself but does not acquire on others,
llm_translation: When she said it before Samuel, he said to me: "This and this are one." What is "this and this are one"? Rav Ḥisdah said: One this and one this - one benefits himself, and one does not benefit others.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִינָּנָא וַורְדָּאן: כֵּיצַד מִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בְּמָבוֹי? מַנִּיחַ אֶת הֶחָבִית, וְאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵי זוֹ לְכׇל בְּנֵי הַמָּבוֹי״, וּמְזַכֶּה לָהֶם עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, וְעַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana of Vardania raises an objection How does one merge into the alleyway He places a barrel and says: This is for all the residents of the alleyway. And he confer possession to by means of his adult son or daughter, or by means of his Hebrew slave or maidservant.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: How do they participate in an alleyway? One places the barrel and says, "This is for all the residents of the alleyway," and he acquires it for them through his adult son and daughter, and through his Hebrew slave and maidservant.

hebrew_text: הַאי שִׁפְחָה – הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאַתְיָא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, מַאי בָּעֲיָא גַּבֵּיהּ? אֶלָּא לָאו דְּלָא אַתְיָא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, וְקָתָנֵי זוֹכָה לַאֲחֵרִים?
human_translation: What are the circumstances this maidservant? If she developed two hairs, what doing with Rather, is not where she did not develop two hairs, and it is taught acquire on others?
llm_translation: This maidservant - how is it similar? If it comes with two hairs, what does its master require of it? Rather, if it does not come with two hairs, and the Mishnah teaches that it is fit for others?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי שִׁיתּוּפֵי מְבוֹאוֹת – דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: merging of alleyways is different, by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: The partners of the entrances are the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אִישְׁתִּיק וַורְדָּאן. מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר? כֹּל דְּתַקּוּן רַבָּנַן –
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Vardonia was silent What could he have said All that the Sages instituted,
