llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: Vardan remained silent. What could he have said? Anything that the Rabbis established –

hebrew_text: כְּעֵין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תַּקּוּן.
human_translation: they instituted parallel to Torah law,
llm_translation: As the manner of the Torah, so shall it be established.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ – כִּי אָמְרִינַן: כָּל דְּתַקּוּן רַבָּנַן כְּעֵין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תַּקּוּן – בְּמִילְּתָא דְּאִית לַהּ עִיקָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל מִילְּתָא דְּלֵית לַהּ עִיקָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה – לָא.
human_translation: And the other when we say: All that the Sages instituted, they instituted parallel to Torah law, with regard to a matter that is rooted in the Torah, However, with regard to a matter that is not rooted in the Torah, no,
llm_translation: The other opinion - for we say: any enactment of the Rabbis like the essence of the Torah, an enactment - in a matter that has a basis from the Torah, but a matter that does not have a basis from the Torah - no.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַוְיָא: מַעֲרִימִין עַל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי. כֵּיצַד? אוֹמֵר אָדָם לִבְנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים; לְעַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים: ״הֵא לָכֶם מָעוֹת הַלָּלוּ, וּפְדוּ בָּהֶן מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי זֶה״, וְאוֹכְלוֹ בְּלֹא חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Avya raises objection One may employ artifice second tithe, How so? A person says to his adult son or daughter, to his Hebrew slave or his maidservant: Here you are, money and redeem second tithe with it. and he eats it without one-fifth.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: One may heap up produce for the second tithe. How so? A person may say to his adult son and daughter, to his Hebrew slave and maidservant, "Here are these coins for you, and redeem with them this second tithe," and consume it without adding a fifth.

hebrew_text: הַאי שִׁפְחָה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאַתְיָא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, מַאי בָּעֲיָא גַּבֵּיהּ? אֶלָּא לָאו דְּלָא אַתְיָא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת? הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בְּמַעֲשֵׂר בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה – דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: What are the circumstances this maidservant? If she developed two hairs, what doing with Rather, is not where she did not develop two hairs? With what are we dealing here? with tithes today, by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: This maidservant, how is she comparable? If she comes with two hairs, what does her master require of her? Rather, is it not that she does not come with two hairs? Here, what are we dealing with? With tithing in our time – according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה מִי אִיכָּא?! וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַיּוֹבֵל נוֹהֵג! אֶלָּא בְּעָצִיץ שֶׁאֵינוֹ נָקוּב – דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And is there a Hebrew maidservant today? But isn’t it taught a Hebrew slave is in practice only during a period when the Jubilee is in practice. Rather, in an unperforated pot, by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a Hebrew maidservant, is there one in our time?! And it was taught: A Hebrew slave only applies when the Jubilee year applies! Except for a flowerpot that is not perforated - this is the view of the Rabbis." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, שָׁלֹשׁ מִדּוֹת בְּקָטָן: צְרוֹר וְזוֹרְקוֹ, אֱגוֹז וְנוֹטְלוֹ – זוֹכֶה לְעַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין זוֹכֶה לַאֲחֵרִים; וּכְנֶגְדָּן בִּקְטַנָּה – מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת לְמֵיאוּן.
human_translation: Rava says three stages in a minor: a pebble and he throws it a nut he takes it, he acquires for himself but does not acquire on others. And with regard to a minor girl with the corresponding betrothed through refusal.
llm_translation: Rava said, "Three characteristics in a minor: a bundle and he scatters it, a nut and he takes it - he acquires for himself, and he does not acquire for others; and corresponding to them in a minor - she becomes betrothed for intercourse."

hebrew_text: הַפָּעוֹטוֹת – מִקָּחָן מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּרָן מִמְכָּר בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין; וּכְנֶגְדָּן בִּקְטַנָּה – מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: children purchase is a purchase and whose sale is a sale, with regard to movable property. And with regard to a minor girl with the corresponding she is divorced from betrothal by her father,
llm_translation: The "pa'otot" - their purchase is a valid purchase, and their sale is a valid sale when they are movable; and corresponding to them in the case of a minor - she becomes divorced through the betrothal of her father.

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעוּ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים – נִדְרֵיהֶן נֶדֶר וְהֶקְדֵּשָׁן הֶקְדֵּשׁ; וּכְנֶגְדָּן בִּקְטַנָּה – חוֹלֶצֶת. וְלִמְכּוֹר בְּנִכְסֵי אָבִיו – עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: they have reached the age of vows, their vows are vows and their consecration is consecration. And with regard to a minor girl with the corresponding she performs ḥalitza And to selling his father’s property, until he will age of twenty.
llm_translation: They reached the time of vows - their vows are vows and their sanctifications are sanctifications; and corresponding to them in a minor way - chalitzah. And to sell from the property of his father - until he is twenty years old.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קְטַנָּה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ; לְפִיכָךְ, אִם רָצָה הַבַּעַל לַחֲזוֹר – יַחְזוֹר. שֶׁאֵין קָטָן עוֹשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: a minor girl who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, it is not bill of divorce until the bill of divorce reaches her possession. Therefore, if the husband seeks to retract he can retract as a minor does not designate an agent.
llm_translation: It was taught: A minor who said, "My get was accepted" - it is not a get until the get reaches her hand; therefore, if the husband wishes to retract, he may retract. For a minor does not appoint a messenger.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ אָבִיהָ: ״צֵא וְהִתְקַבֵּל לְבִתִּי גִּיטָּהּ״, אִם רָצָה לַחֲזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: And her father said to Go out and receive my daughter’s bill of divorce on if seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: And if her father said to him: "Go and accept my daughter's bill of divorce," if he wishes to retract - he may not retract.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר: ״תֵּן גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – פָּסוּל. ״הֲרֵי הִיא בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: one who says Give this bill of divorce to my wife in such and such a place, and gave it to her in another place invalid. she is in such and such a place, and he gave it to her in another place valid.
llm_translation: One who says, "Give this bill of divorce to my wife in the place of so-and-so," and it was given to her in a different place - it is invalid. "Here it is in the place of so-and-so," and it was given to her in a different place - it is valid.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, וְקִיבְּלוֹ לָהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – פָּסוּל; רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַכְשִׁיר. ״הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ לָהּ מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: the woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me in such and such a place, and he received it for her in another place, invalid; Rabbi Elazar deems valid. Bring me my bill of divorce from such and such a place, and he brought it for her from another place, valid.
llm_translation: The woman who said: "Accept my get in the place of so-and-so," and they accepted it for her in a different place - it is invalid; Rabbi Elazar deems it valid. "Bring me my get from such-and-such a place," and they brought it to her from a different place - it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא דְּלָא פְּלִיג, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא דִּפְלִיג?
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, what is different the first clause, where he does not disagree and what is different the latter clause, where he disagrees
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Elazar - What is the difference between the beginning where he does not argue, and the end where he does argue?

hebrew_text: אִיהוּ, דְּמִדַּעְתֵּיהּ מְגָרֵשׁ – קָפֵיד, אִיהִי, דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחַהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת – מַרְאָה מָקוֹם הִיא לוֹ.
human_translation: He, who divorces of his own volition, insists she, who is divorced against her will, is indicating a place for him
llm_translation: He, whose knowledge is vast - meticulous, she, whose husband divorces her - a place is shown to him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי״ – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ. ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, אֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה מִיָּד. ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ גֵּט לְאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹסֵר מִיָּד.
human_translation: Bring me my bill of divorce, she partake of teruma until the bill of divorce reaches her possession. Receive my bill of divorce for me, immediately prohibited to partake of teruma . Receive my bill of divorce for me in such and such a place, she partake of teruma until the bill of divorce reaches that place. Rabbi Elazar prohibits immediately.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If she says, 'Bring me my bill of divorce,' she may eat terumah until the bill of divorce reaches her hand. If she says, 'My bill of divorce has been accepted by me,' she is immediately forbidden to eat terumah. If she says, 'My bill of divorce has been accepted by me in such and such a place,' she may eat terumah until the bill of divorce reaches that place. Rabbi Elazar forbids immediately."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְגִיטָּא מִיהָא הָוֵי? וְהָאָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא, לָא הָוֵי גִּיטָּא!
human_translation: And in any event, is it bill of divorce? But didn’t you say the first clause, it is not bill of divorce?
llm_translation: Gemara: "And a divorce document, is it effective from it? But didn't you say at the beginning that it is not effective?"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטָּא בְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא, וְזִימְנִין דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ בְּבָבֶל״; וְהָכִי קָאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: מִשְׁקָל – כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ, שִׁקְלֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ;
human_translation: No, necessary where she said to him: Receive the bill of divorce for me in Mata Meḥasya, and sometimes you find him in Babylon. And this is what she is saying: taking anywhere that you find him, take it from him,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for she said to him: "I have received a get in Matha Mechesya, and sometimes you remember it in Babylon"; and thus she said to him: "Take - wherever you remember it, take it from him."

hebrew_text: גִּיטָּא לָא הָוֵי – עַד דְּמָטֵית לְמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא.
human_translation: is not a bill of divorce until you reach Mata Meḥasya.
llm_translation: Get not is - until you reach to city of Machseya.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹסֵר מִיָּד. פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּהָא מַרְאָה מָקוֹם הִיא לוֹ!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar prohibits immediately. is obvious, as is indicating a place for him
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar prohibits immediately. Obviously, because it is a matter of appearance of a place for him!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״זִיל לְמִזְרָח, דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּמִזְרָח״; וְקָא אָזֵל לְמַעֲרָב. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, בְּמַעֲרָב – הָא לֵיתֵיהּ; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דִּילְמָא בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָזֵיל מֵיגָס גָּאֵיס בֵּיהּ, וִיהַב לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא.
human_translation: No, necessary where she said to him: Go to the east, as is in the east, and went to the west. Lest you say is not in the west teaches us perhaps while he was going encounter and gave the bill of divorce to
llm_translation: Not necessary, for she said to him: "Go to the east, for there is one in the east"; and he went to the west. What can you say, in the west - there is none; we learn, perhaps while he was going, a wall collapsed on him, and he gave him a divorce.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ ״עָרֵב לִי בִּתְמָרִים״, וְעֵירַב לוֹ בִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת; ״בִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת״, וְעֵירַב לוֹ בִּתְמָרִים; תָּנֵי חֲדָא: עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב!
human_translation: one who says to his agent: Establish an eiruv on my with dates, and he established an eiruv on his with dried figs, with dried figs, and he established an eiruv on his with dates, is taught one His eiruv is eiruv . And is taught another His eiruv is not eiruv .
llm_translation: The one who says to his messenger, "Be my agent with dates," and he acted as an agent with figs; "with figs," and he acted as an agent with dates; one teaching one: his agency is valid, and another teaching: his agency is not valid!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לָא קַשְׁיָא; הָא רַבָּנַן, הָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. הָא רַבָּנַן – דְּאָמְרִי: קְפִידָא; הָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: מַרְאָה מָקוֹם הִיא לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba said: not difficult. This the Rabbis, that Rabbi Elazar. This the Rabbis, who say: insistence that Rabbi Elazar, says: She is indicating a place for him
llm_translation: Rabah said: Not difficult; here are the Rabbis, here is Rabbi Elazar. The Rabbis - who say: strictness; Rabbi Elazar, who says: it is a vision of a place for him.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: הָא וְהָא רַבָּנַן; כָּאן בְּשֶׁלּוֹ, כָּאן בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: this and that the Rabbis, Here, with his There, with of another,
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: "Here and here are the Rabbis; here regarding his own, here regarding his fellow's."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״עָרֵב לִי בְּמִגְדָּל״ – וְעֵירַב לוֹ בְּשׁוֹבָךְ, ״בְּשׁוֹבָךְ״ – וְעֵירַב לוֹ בְּמִגְדָּל; דְּתַנְיָא חֲדָא: עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין עֵירוּבוֹ עֵירוּב; הָתָם – מַאי שֶׁלּוֹ וְשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Abaye said However, that which is taught one who says to his agent: Establish a joining on my in a tower, and he established the eiruv in a dovecote, Establish a joining on my in a dovecote, and he established the eiruv in a tower, taught one His joining is eiruv . And is taught another His joining is not eiruv . There, what his and of another is there?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: But rather, this that is taught, one who says to his messenger, "Be my agent in the tower" - and he acted as his agent in the return, "in the return" - and he acted as his agent in the tower; as it was taught in one teaching: his agency is effective, and it was taught in another teaching: his agency is not effective; there - what is the difference between his and his friend's agency?

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי, אִיכָּא פֵּירֵי דְמִגְדָּל וּפֵירֵי דְשׁוֹבָךְ.
human_translation: There too, there is fruit of the tower and fruit of the dovecote.
llm_translation: There, in that place, there are the fruits of Migdal and the fruits of Shovakh.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט וּתְנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי״; ״גָּרְשׁוּהָ״; ״כִּתְבוּ אִיגֶּרֶת וּתְנוּ לַהּ״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ.
human_translation: who says Write a bill of divorce and give to my wife, Divorce her, Write a letter and give to her, they should write and give
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says, "Write a bill of divorce and give it to my wife," "Divorce her," or "Write a letter of release and give it to her" - these shall be written and given.

hebrew_text: ״פַּטְּרוּהָ״; ״פַּרְנְסוּהָ״; ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כְּנִימוּס״; ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כָּרָאוּי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Release her, Sustain her, or: Treat her according to the law [ nimus ], Treat her appropriately, said nothing,
llm_translation: "Patruha"; "Parnsuha"; "Asu la k'nimus"; "Asu la karauy" - lo amar klum.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״שַׁלְּחוּהָ״; ״שִׁבְקוּהָ״; ״תָּרְכוּהָ״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ. ״פַּטְּרוּהָ״; ״פַּרְנְסוּהָ״; ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כְּנִימוֹס״; ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כָּרָאוּי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught Send her, Separate her, Banish her, they should write and give Release her [ patruha ], Sustain her, Treat her according to the law, Treat her appropriately, said nothing.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Send her"; "Let her go"; "Divorce her" - these must be written and given. "Release her"; "Provide for her"; "Treat her with delicacy"; "Treat her appropriately" - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״פַּטְּרוּהָ״ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין, ״פִּיטְרוּהָ״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. אָמַר רָבָא: רַבִּי נָתָן – דְּבַבְלָאָה הוּא, וְדָיֵיק בֵּין ״פִּיטְרוּהָ״ לְ״פַטְּרוּהָ״, תַּנָּא דִּידַן – דְּבַר אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא, לָא דָּיֵיק.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Natan says: patruha , his statement stands, pitruha , he said nothing. Rava said: Rabbi Natan, who is a Babylonian, distinguished between pitruha and patruha . the tanna of our who is a resident of Eretz Yisrael, did not distinguish
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Natan says: "Patruha" - his words stand, "Pitruha" - he did not say anything. Rava said: Rabbi Natan is of Babylonian origin, and he distinguished between "Pitruha" and "Patruha." Our Mishna - it is of the land of Israel, it does not distinguish.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״הוֹצִיאוּהָ״, מַהוּ? ״עִזְבוּהָ״, מַהוּ? ״הַתִּירוּהָ״, מַהוּ? ״הַנִּיחוּהָ״, מַהוּ? ״הוֹעִילוּ לָהּ״, מַהוּ? ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כַּדָּת״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Remove her, what is Abandon her, what is Unbind her, what is Let her be, what is Be useful for her, what is Treat her according to the custom, what is
llm_translation: He asked them: "HOTZI'UHA", what is it? "IZVU'HA", what is it? "HATIRU'HA", what is it? "HANICHU'HA", what is it? "HO'ILU LAH", what is it? "ASU LAH KADAT", what is it?

hebrew_text: פְּשׁוֹט מִיהָא חֲדָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כַּדָּת״; ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כְּנִימוֹס״; ״עֲשׂוּ לָהּ כָּרָאוּי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Resolve at least one as it is taught Treat her according to the custom, Treat her according to the law, Treat her appropriately, said nothing
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Peshut miha Chadah, detanya: "Asu lah kadat"; "Asu lah kenimos"; "Asu lah karavui" - lo amar kelum. English translation: Simply from one, as it was taught: "Do to her as is customary"; "Do to her as is fitting"; "Do to her as is appropriate" - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: הַיּוֹצֵא בְּקוֹלָר, וְאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ. חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר: אַף הַמְפָרֵשׁ, וְהַיּוֹצֵא בִּשְׁיָירָא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמְסוּכָּן.
human_translation: At first would say: one who is taken out in a neck chain [ kolar ] and said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, these should write and give They then said: Even to one who sets sail and one who departs in a caravan Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even one who is dangerously ill
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Initially they would say: One who goes out with a collar and says, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," - these should be written and given. They came back to say: Also one who is divorced, and one who goes out with a kerchief. Rabbi Shimon ben Shetach says: Also one who is in danger.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ גְּנִיבָא יוֹצֵא בְּקוֹלָר הֲוָה, כִּי הֲוָה קָא נָפֵיק, אָמַר: הַבוּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי לְרַבִּי אֲבִינָא, מֵחַמְרָא דִּנְהַר פַּנְיָא. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא:
human_translation: Geneiva was went out in a neck chain When he was going out, he said Give four hundred dinars to Rabbi Avina from wine Nehar Panya. Rabbi Zeira said:
llm_translation: Gemara: If a thief leaves with a collar, when he was leaving, he said: "Give four hundred zuz to Rabbi Avina from the wine of the riverbank." Rabbi Zeira said:

hebrew_text: דְּרָא רַבִּי אֲבִינָא לְסִילְּתֵיהּ, וַאֲזַל לְגַבֵּי דְּרַב הוּנָא רַבֵּיהּ – דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: גִּיטּוֹ כְּמַתְּנָתוֹ, מַה מַתְּנָתוֹ, אִם עָמַד – חוֹזֵר, אַף גִּיטּוֹ, אִם עָמַד – חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Avina lift his basket and go to Rav Huna his teacher, as Rav Huna said: one’s bill of divorce like his gift. Just as gift his if he arose he revokes so too, his bill of divorce if he arose he revokes
llm_translation: Rav Avina went to his place of residence, and went to Rav Huna his teacher - for Rav Huna said: "A divorce document is like his gift, just as his gift, if he retracts - he must return, so too his divorce document, if he retracts - he must return."

hebrew_text: וּמָה גִּיטּוֹ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא פָּרֵישׁ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״כִּתְבוּ״ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״; אַף מַתְּנָתוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קְנוֹ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And just as bill of divorce his even though he did not specify, once he said: Write even though he did not say: Give So too, gift his once he said: Give even though did not acquire from him
llm_translation: And what is his get, even though he did not separate, since he said "write" - even though he did not say "give"; his gift also, since he said "give" - even though he did not acquire from her.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: אִי – מָה מַתָּנָה יֶשְׁנָהּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה, אַף גֵּט יֶשְׁנוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה?! הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא מַתָּנָה – אִיתַהּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה, אֶלָּא גֵּט – לְאַחַר מִיתָה מִי אִיכָּא?!
human_translation: Rabbi Abba objects to If Just as a gift is after death, so too, a bill of divorce is after death. How can be compared? Granted, a gift is after death; however, is a bill of divorce after death?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Abba objects to her: If - what gift does she have after death, so too a divorce document is valid after death?! Is it so now?! Granted a gift - it is for after death, but a divorce document - after death, who is there?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי אַבָּא, הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: מַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע בְּמִקְצָת הִיא, וּמַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע בְּמִקְצָת בָּעֲיָא קִנְיָן! מִכְּלָל דְּרַב הוּנָא סָבַר לָא בָּעֲיָא קִנְיָן?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּבָעֲיָא קִנְיָן! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּמְצַוֶּה מֵחֲמַת מִיתָה הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, this is what difficult to Rabbi Abba: is the gift of a person on his deathbed of a portion and the gift of a person on his deathbed of a portion requires an act of acquisition. by inference, Rav Huna, holds does not require an act of acquisition? But don’t we maintain requires an act of acquisition? is different here, where one issues an instruction due to his death.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abba, thus difficult for him: a gift of a dying person is in part, and a gift of a dying person in part requires acquisition! From the principle that Rav Huna does not require acquisition?! But we have established that it does require acquisition! The difference here is that it is a commandment due to death.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא סָבַר: מְצַוֶּה מֵחֲמַת מִיתָה בָּעֲיָא קִנְיָן?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּלָא בָּעֵי קִנְיָן!
human_translation: by inference Rabbi Abba holds one who issues an instruction due to his death requires an act of acquisition? But don’t we maintain that does not require an act of acquisition?
llm_translation: From the premise of Rabbi Abba, he holds: A commandment due to death requires acquisition?! But we have established that it does not require acquisition!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי אַבָּא, הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: ״חַמְרָא״ – לָא קָאָמַר, ״דְּמֵי חַמְרָא״ – לָא קָאָמַר, ״מֵחַמְרָא״ קָאָמַר! וְאִידַּךְ, ״מֵחַמְרָא״ – כְּדֵי לְיַיפּוֹת אֶת כֹּחוֹ. שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: ״מֵחַמְרָא״ – כְּדֵי לְיַיפּוֹת אֶת כֹּחוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, this is what difficult to Rabbi Abba: did not say wine he did not say: The monetary value of wine. He said: from wine. And the other from wine, in order to enhance ability They sent from there, From wine, in order to enhance ability
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abba, thus difficult for him: "Chamra" - he did not say, "similar to chamra" - he did not say, "from chamra" he said! And the other opinion, "from chamra" - in order to enhance his strength. They sent from there: "from chamra" - in order to enhance his strength.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה מוּשְׁלָךְ לְבוֹר, וְאָמַר: כׇּל הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ אֶת קוֹלוֹ יִכְתּוֹב גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ.
human_translation: one who was thrown into a pit and he said anyone who hears his voice should write a bill of divorce for his wife, those should write and give
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was being pushed into a pit, and he said: "Anyone who hears my voice should write a bill of divorce for my wife," these individuals should write and give it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא שֵׁד הוּא! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּשֶׁרָאוּ לוֹ דְּמוּת אָדָם.
human_translation: But let us be concerned perhaps is a demon, Rav Yehuda says: where they saw has human form.
llm_translation: Gemara: And to be concerned that perhaps it is a demon! Rav Yehudah said: When they saw the likeness of a man.

hebrew_text: אִינְהוּ נָמֵי אִידְּמוֹיֵי אִידְּמוֹ! דַּחֲזוֹ לֵיהּ בָּבוּאָה. אִינְהוּ נָמֵי אִית לְהוּ בָּבוּאָה! דַּחֲזוֹ לֵיהּ בָּבוּאָה דְבָבוּאָה. וְדִלְמָא אִינְהוּ נָמֵי אִית לְהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לִימְּדַנִי יוֹנָתָן בְּנִי: בָּבוּאָה אִית לְהוּ, בָּבוּאָה דְבָבוּאָה לֵית לְהוּ.
human_translation: too appear where they saw that he has a shadow [ bavua ]. also have a shadow. where they saw that he has the shadow of a shadow. And perhaps too have Rabbi Ḥanina says: Yonatan my son taught me have a shadow they do not have the shadow of a shadow.
llm_translation: They are like similar to similar! For they saw it in the entrance. They are like there is to them in the entrance! For they saw it in the entrance of the entrance. And perhaps there is to them? Rabbi Chanina said: Yonatan my son taught me: They have an entrance, they have an entrance of an entrance.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא צָרָה הִיא! תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה, כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין.
human_translation: But perhaps is a rival wife from the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: During a time of danger, one writes and gives even though are not familiar
llm_translation: And perhaps it is a danger! It was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: In a time of danger, we may write and give a document even though we do not recognize the recipient.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבָּרִיא שֶׁאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – רָצָה לְשַׂחֶק בָּהּ.
human_translation: A healthy man who said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, sought to mock her.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "The healthy one who said, 'Write a bill of divorce for my wife' - he wanted to mock her."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבָרִיא אֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, וְעָלָה לְרֹאשׁ הַגָּג וְנָפַל וָמֵת; אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אִם מֵעַצְמוֹ נָפַל, הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט, אִם הָרוּחַ דָּחַתּוּ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: an incident involving a healthy man who said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, and ascended to the roof and fell, and died. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If he fell at his own it is bill of divorce, if the wind forced him it is not bill of divorce,
llm_translation: The matter of a certain healthy person who said: "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," and he went up to the top of the roof and fell and died; Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If he fell of his own accord, this is a bill of divorce, but if the wind pushed him – it is not a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר?!
human_translation: an incident to contradict
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma' ma'aseh listor?!"

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אִם הוֹכִיחַ סוֹפוֹ עַל תְּחִילָּתוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט; וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּבָרִיא שֶׁאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, וְעָלָה לְרֹאשׁ הַגָּג וְנָפַל וָמֵת, וְאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אִם מֵעַצְמוֹ נָפַל – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט, אִם הָרוּחַ דָּחַתּוּ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: is incomplete and this is what it is teaching: if his ultimate prove his initial it is bill of divorce. And an incident involving a healthy man who said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, and ascended to the roof and fell and died. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If he fell at his own it is bill of divorce. if the wind forced him it is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The lacking from the lacking, and thus it was taught: If he proved its end from its beginning - this is a bill of divorce; and there was a similar incident with a healthy man who said, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," and he went up to the roof and fell and died, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If he fell by himself - this is a bill of divorce, if the wind pushed him - it is not a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּעָל לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא, אַשְׁכַּח מַקְרֵי יָנוֹקָא וּבְרֵיהּ דְּיָתְבִי, וְיָתֵיב אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא גַּבַּיְיהוּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: בֵּי תְרֵי מִינַּיְיכוּ נִכְתְּבוּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ. לְסוֹף שְׁכֵיב מַקְרֵי יָנוֹקָא, מִי מְשַׁוּוּ אִינָשֵׁי בְּרָא שְׁלִיחָא בִּמְקוֹם אַבָּא, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: a certain man who entered the synagogue and found a schoolteacher and his son who were sitting and another person sat with them. said to them: Two of you should write a bill of divorce for my wife. Ultimately, the schoolteacher died. Do people designate a son an agent in the presence of father, or not?
llm_translation: That man who entered the synagogue, found a baby's note and his son sitting, and another man sitting beside them, said to them: "Two men wrote a bill of divorce for his wife." At the end, he found the baby's note, are people compared to a messenger in place of a father, or not?

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: לָא מְשַׁוּוּ אִינָשֵׁי בְּרָא שְׁלִיחָא בִּמְקוֹם אַבָּא; וְרַב פַּפֵּי אָמַר: מְשַׁוּוּ אִינָשֵׁי בְּרָא שְׁלִיחָא בִּמְקוֹם אַבָּא. אָמַר רָבָא, הִילְכְתָא: מְשַׁוּוּ אִינָשֵׁי בְּרָא שְׁלִיחָא בִּמְקוֹם אַבָּא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: People do not designate a son an agent in the presence of father. And Rav Pappi said: People designate a son an agent in the presence of father. Rava said the halakha People designate a son an agent in the presence of father.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: People are not equal in the matter of a messenger in the place of a father; and Rav Pappi said: People are equal in the matter of a messenger in the place of a father. Rava said, the halakha is: People are equal in the matter of a messenger in the place of a father.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״,
human_translation: said to two Give a bill of divorce to my wife,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He said to two witnesses: "Give a bill of divorce to my wife."

hebrew_text: אוֹ לִשְׁלֹשָׁה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט, וּתְנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי״, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ. אָמַר לִשְׁלֹשָׁה: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יֹאמְרוּ לַאֲחֵרִים וְיִכְתְּבוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן בֵּית דִּין; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: or to three Write a bill of divorce and give to my wife, these should write and give he said to three Give a bill of divorce to my wife, these should tell others, and will write because he designated a court. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Or for three: "Write a bill of divorce, and give it to my wife," these may be written and given. He said to three: "Give a bill of divorce to my wife," these may be said to others and written, because the court made them; the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹ הֲלָכָה הֶעֱלָה רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אִישׁ אוֹנוֹ מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין: מְקוּבָּל אֲנִי בְּאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלֹשָׁה: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לַאֲחֵרִים וְיִכְתְּבוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן בֵּית דִּין,
human_translation: And that halakha Rabbi Ḥanina of Ono brought up from prison I received in says to three Give a bill of divorce to my wife, that these should tell others and will write because he designated a court.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is the halakha that Rabbi Hanina, the man of Ono, brought up from the house of the prisoners: I am a tradition bearer in saying to three: "Give a bill of divorce to my wife" - that they should say to others and write, because the court made them do so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, נוּמֵינוּ לַשָּׁלִיחַ: אַף אָנוּ מְקוּבָּלִין, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ אָמַר לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – שֶׁיִּלְמְדוּ וְיִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: We said [ nomeinu ] to the agent, We too received that even said to the High Court [Sanhedrin] in Jerusalem: Give a bill of divorce to my wife, that should learn and should write and give
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said, "We are accustomed to the messenger: Even we, who are Kabbalists, that even if he says to the Great Court of Jerusalem, 'Give a bill of divorce to my wife,' they should learn, write, and give."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לַעֲשָׂרָה: ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב, וּשְׁנַיִם חוֹתְמִין. ״כּוּלְּכֶם כְּתוֹבוּ״ – אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב, וְכוּלָּם חוֹתְמִין; לְפִיכָךְ אִם מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט בָּטֵל.
human_translation: said to ten Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife, one writes and two sign All of you write one of them writes and all of them sign Therefore, if one of them died, this is a bill of divorce null and void,
llm_translation: He said to ten: "Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife" - one writes, and two sign. "All of you write" - one writes, and all of them sign; therefore, if one of them dies, this bill of divorce is annulled.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ מִבֵּי רַב לִשְׁמוּאֵל: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ; אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, וְאָמְרוּ לְסוֹפֵר וְכָתַב, וְחָתְמוּ הֵן, מַהוּ? שְׁלַח לְהוּ: תֵּצֵא, וְהַדָּבָר צָרִיךְ תַּלְמוּד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: they sent from the study hall of Rav to Shmuel: Let our teacher teach us: said to two Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife, and they told the scribe and he wrote and they signed what is He sent to them: should leave and the matter requires study.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba said: They sent from the house of Rav to Shmuel: Our teacher should teach us; he said to two people: "Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife," and they said to the scribe, and he wrote, and they signed, what is the law? He should send to them: She should leave, and the matter requires study.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״הַדָּבָר צָרִיךְ תַּלְמוּד״? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָווּ לְהוּ מִילֵּי; וּמְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ מִילֵּי – אִי מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ, אִי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ;
human_translation: What The matter requires study? If we say due to that these are directives, and is uncertain whether directives, are transferred to agent whether are not transferred to agent;
llm_translation: What is "the matter requires study"? Perhaps because they were words; and he is in doubt about the words - whether they were handed over to the messenger or not handed over to the messenger.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר רַבִּי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר מִילֵּי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ!
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel say Rabbi says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, said: directives cannot be delegated to an agent,
llm_translation: And Samuel said Rabbi: Halacha like Rabbi Yosei, for he said words not handed over to the messenger!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל – הָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: הַאי ״כְּתוֹבוּ״ – אִי כְּתַב יָדָן, אִי כְּתַב הַגֵּט?
human_translation: Rather, this is the dilemma Shmuel is raising: Write whether their signatures, or whether he was referring to writing the bill of divorce,
llm_translation: Rather, to Shmuel - this is what he asked him: this "written" - whether it is written by their hand, or written in the bill of divorce?

hebrew_text: וְתִיפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מִמַּתְנִיתִין: אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, אוֹ לִשְׁלֹשָׁה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט וּתְנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ.
human_translation: But let resolve from the mishna: said to two Give a bill of divorce to my wife, or to three Write a bill of divorce and give to my wife, these should write and give
llm_translation: And he should force him with a court order. He said to two: "Give a bill of divorce to my wife," or to three: "Write a bill of divorce and give it to my wife" - these should be written and given.

hebrew_text: הִיא גּוּפָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, ״כְּתוֹבוּ״ – כְּתַב יָדָן הוּא, אוֹ כְּתַב הַגֵּט הוּא? פְּשִׁיטָא דִּכְתַב הַגֵּט הוּא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, נוּמֵינוּ לַשָּׁלִיחַ: אַף אָנוּ מְקוּבָּלִין, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ אָמַר לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: ״תְּנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – שֶׁיִּלְמְדוּ וְיִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ לָהּ.
human_translation: the itself is the dilemma is raising: Write their signatures, or writing the bill of divorce? is obvious that it is writing of the bill of divorce, as it is taught in the latter clause Rabbi Yosei said: We said to the agent, We too received that even said to the High Court in Jerusalem: Give a bill of divorce to my wife, that should learn and should write and give
llm_translation: It is the body that he is asking about, "as it is written" - is it their handwriting, or is it the writing of the divorce document? It is obvious that it is the writing of the divorce document, as the latter part teaches: Rabbi Yosei said, "We also are trustworthy messengers, for even if he said to the Great Court of Jerusalem, 'Give a divorce document to my wife,' they should learn, write, and give it to her."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא כְּתַב הַגֵּט הוּא, שַׁפִּיר; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ כְּתַב יָדָן הוּא, מִי אִיכָּא בֵּי דִינָא דְּלָא יָדְעִי מִחְתָּם חֲתִימַת יְדַיְיהוּ?! אִין, אִיכָּא בֵּי דִינָא חַדְתָּא.
human_translation: Granted, if you say it writing of the bill of divorce, well, However, if you say it their signatures, is there a court whose do not know to sign their signatures? Yes, there is a new court,
llm_translation: If you say, "It is written in the bill of divorce, it is fine," but if you say, "It is their handwriting, who is there in the court that does not know the signature of their hands?!" No, there is another court.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סְבִירָא לַן דְּהַאי ״כְּתוֹבוּ״ – כְּתַב יָדָן הוּא; הָא כְּתַב הַגֵּט – כָּשֵׁר?! וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר רַבִּי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר מִילֵּי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ!
human_translation: But if we hold that this Write is their signatures, is writing of the bill of divorce valid? But didn’t Shmuel say Rabbi says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, says: directives cannot be delegated to an agent.
llm_translation: And if it seems to us that this "written" – it is their handwriting; but a bill of divorce – is it valid?! And Shmuel said, Rabbi said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei, who said matters are not transmitted to an agent!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אִי סְבִירִי לַן דִּ״כְתוֹבוּ״ – כְּתַב יָדָן הוּא; כְּתַב הַגֵּט – נַעֲשָׂה כְּאוֹמֵר: ״אִמְרוּ״, וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאוֹמֵר ״אִמְרוּ״. וּמִי מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאוֹמֵר: ״אִמְרוּ״?! וְהָתְנַן: ״כָּתַב סוֹפֵר וְעֵד – כָּשֵׁר״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: ״חָתַם סוֹפֵר״ שָׁנִינוּ;
human_translation: say if we hold Write is their signatures, writing of the bill of divorce becomes as says Tell And Rabbi Yosei concedes in one who says: Tell And does Rabbi Yosei concede in one who says: Tell But didn’t we learn the writing of a scribe, and witness valid And Rabbi Yirmeya said: We learned the scribe’s signature
llm_translation: They said: If you think that "it is written" - it is their handwriting; if it is a bill of divorce - it is done as it says: "Say," and Rabbi Yosei agrees with saying "Say." But who does Rabbi Yosei agree with saying "Say"?! And we learned: "If a scribe and a witness wrote - it is valid," and Rabbi Yirmeya said: "If a scribe signed" we have learned.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִילֵּי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Whose mishna? It is Rabbi Yosei, said: directives cannot be delegated to an agent,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisdah said: The Mishnah is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as he said: Matters were not transmitted to an agent.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאוֹמֵר ״אִמְרוּ״, נָפֵיק מִינַּהּ חוּרְבָּה – דְּזִימְנִין דְּאָמַר לְהוּ לִשְׁנַיִם:
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Rabbi Yosei concedes in says: Tell a pitfall will result from it. As sometimes, that one said to two
llm_translation: "And if it enters your mind, Rabbi Yosei concedes by saying 'say,' a sword emerges from it - sometimes he would say to two."

hebrew_text: ״אִמְרוּ לְסוֹפֵר וְיִכְתּוֹב, וְלִפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְיַחְתֹּמוּ״; וּמִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא דְּסוֹפֵר – חָיְישִׁי וּמַחְתְּמִי חַד מֵהָנָךְ סָהֲדִי, וְסוֹפֵר בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, וּבַעַל לָא אָמַר הָכִי!
human_translation: Tell a scribe and he will write and so-and-so and so-and-so and they will sign And due to the shame of the scribe, are concerned and have one of those witnesses and the scribe sign together with him, and the husband did not say so.
llm_translation: They said to the scribe, "Write, and to so-and-so and so-and-so let them sign." And because of the suspicion of the scribe - they are concerned and one of them signs, and the scribe simultaneously, and the husband did not say so!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: ״כָּשֵׁר, וְלֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה כֵּן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ – לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: Since the Master said, valid, however, it shall not be done in Israel, it is uncommon
llm_translation: As the Master said: "Kasher, and do not do so in Israel" - it is not common.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא אֲמַר לְהוּ לְבֵי תְרֵי: ״אִמְרוּ לְסוֹפֵר וְיִכְתּוֹב, וְאַתֶּם חֲתוֹמוּ״, וְאָזְלִי הָנָךְ מִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא דְּסוֹפֵר, וּמַחְתְּמִי לֵיהּ לְסוֹפֵר בַּהֲדֵי חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, וּבַעַל לָא אָמַר הָכִי! אָמְרִי: הָא נָמֵי ״כָּשֵׁר וְלֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה״ הוּא.
human_translation: And let us be concerned lest say to two Tell the scribe and he will write and you sign and these due to the shame of the scribe, go and have the scribe sign together with one of them, and the husband did not say so. say: this too, it is valid; however, it shall not be done.
llm_translation: And he might be concerned that perhaps he will say to two people: "Tell the scribe to write, and you sign," and then he goes there because of the scribe's negligence, and they sign for the scribe in the presence of one of them, and the owner did not say so! They said: Indeed, "fit but not to be done" it is.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: ״כָּשֵׁר וְלֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה״; אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כָּשֵׁר וְתַעֲשֶׂה״ – מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said valid; however, it shall not be done. But according to the one who said: valid and it may be done, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The one who said, "fit but do not do," what is there to say? Rather, the one who said, "fit and do," what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי – תַּרְתֵּי אָמַר; וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר לַהּ כְּווֹתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei stated two And Shmuel holds in accordance with in one and he disagrees with him in one
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei - two said; and Shmuel thought to her like his opinion in one, and he disagreed with her in one.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר רַבִּי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר מִילֵּי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ. אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי: מֵאַחַר שֶׁרַבִּי מֵאִיר וַחֲנִינָא אִישׁ אוֹנוֹ חוֹלְקִין עַל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, מָה רָאָה רַבִּי לוֹמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי?
human_translation: the itself, Shmuel says Rabbi says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, says: directives cannot be delegated to an agent. Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi said before Since Rabbi Meir and Ḥanina of Ono, disagree with Rabbi Yosei, what led Rabbi to say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei?
llm_translation: Body - Samuel said Rabbi: Halacha like Rabbi Yosei, who said words not handed over to a messenger. Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, said before him: After Rabbi Meir and Chanina disagreed with Rabbi Yosei, what did Rabbi see to say halacha like Rabbi Yosei?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: שְׁתוֹק בְּנִי, שְׁתוֹק, לֹא רָאִיתָ אֶת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אִילְמָלֵי רְאִיתוֹ – נִמּוּקוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: said to his Be silent, my son; be silent. You did not see Rabbi Yosei, as, if you had seen him, his reasoning [ nimmuko ] accompanies his
llm_translation: He said to him: "Be silent, my son, be silent. You have not seen Rabbi Yosei. If you had seen him, you would have been even more impressed with him."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה הָיָה מוֹנֶה שִׁבְחָן שֶׁל חֲכָמִים: רַבִּי מֵאִיר – חָכָם וְסוֹפֵר; רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – חָכָם לִכְשֶׁיִּרְצֶה; רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן – גַּל שֶׁל אֱגוֹזִין; רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל – חֲנוּת מְיוּזֶּנֶת; רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – אוֹצָר בָּלוּם; רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי – קוּפַּת הָרוֹכְלִים; רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה – קוּפָּה שֶׁל בְּשָׂמִים; מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב – קַב וְנָקִי; רַבִּי יוֹסֵי – נִמּוּקוֹ עִמּוֹ; רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – טוֹחֵן הַרְבֵּה וּמוֹצִיא קִימְעָא.
human_translation: as it is taught Isi ben Yehuda would recount the praise of the Sages Rabbi Meir, a scholar and scribe; Rabbi Yehuda, a scholar when he chooses Rabbi Tarfon, a pile of nuts, Rabbi Yishmael, a well-stocked store; Rabbi Akiva, a full storehouse; Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, a peddler’s basket, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, a basket of spices, the mishna of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov measured [ kav ] and immaculate; Rabbi Yosei, his reasoning accompanies his Rabbi Shimon grinds much and removes little.
llm_translation: It was taught: Issi ben Yehuda would enumerate the praise of the sages: Rabbi Meir - wise and a scribe; Rabbi Yehuda - wise when he is pleased; Rabbi Tarfon - a bag of nuts; Rabbi Yishmael - a well-stocked store; Rabbi Akiva - a full treasury; Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri - a peddler's basket; Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah - a basket of spices; Mishnat Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - a clean and pure measure; Rabbi Yosei - his words are refined with him; Rabbi Shimon - he grinds much and produces a lot.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: מְשַׁכֵּחַ קִימְעָא, וּמַה שֶּׁמּוֹצִיא – אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא אֶלָּא סוּבִּין. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְתַלְמִידָיו: בָּנַיי, שְׁנוּ מִדּוֹתַי, שֶׁמִּדּוֹתַי תְּרוּמוֹת מִתְּרוּמוֹת מִידּוֹתָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: taught would forget little and what he removed he removed only chaff. And likewise, Rabbi Shimon said to his students: My sons, accept my rulings, as my rulings are the finest of the finest rulings of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who finds a purse, and whatever he takes out - he only takes out coins. And so said Rabbi Shimon to his students: My sons, review my teachings, for my teachings are like the contributions from the contributions of the teachings of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״אִמְרוּ לְסוֹפֵר וְיִכְתּוֹב, וְלִפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְיַחְתֹּמוּ״ – אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כָּשֵׁר, וְלֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה זֹאת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: the itself, one said to two Tell a scribe and he will write and so-and-so and so-and-so and they will sign Rav Huna says Rav says: valid; however, it shall not be done in Israel
llm_translation: Body - he said to two: "say to the scribe and let him write, and to so-and-so and so-and-so and let them sign" - Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: valid, but this should not be done in Israel.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּלָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְעוּלָּא: מֵאַחַר דְּכָשֵׁר, אַמַּאי לֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה זֹאת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תִּשְׂכּוֹר עֵדִים.
human_translation: Ulla said to Rav Naḥman, and some say Rav Naḥman to Ulla: Since valid, why shall it not be done in Israel? He said to him: We are concerned lest hire witnesses.
llm_translation: He said to him Ulai to Rav Nachman, and some say Rav Nachman to Ulai: Since it is valid, why not do this in Israel? He said to him: We are concerned that witnesses may be rented.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן?! וְהָתַנְיָא: עֵדִים הַחֲתוּמִין עַל שְׂדֵה מִקָּח, וְעַל גֵּט אִשָּׁה – לֹא חָשׁוּ חֲכָמִים לְדָבָר זֶה! מַעֲשֶׂה לָא עָבְדִי, דִּבּוּרָא קָאָמְרִי.
human_translation: But are we concerned But isn’t it taught witnesses who are signed on a field of sale and a woman’s bill of divorce, the Sages were not concerned with regard to this matter they not perform an action they utter a statement
llm_translation: And who are we concerned about?! And it was taught: Sealed witnesses on a field of purchase, and on a bill of divorce - the sages did not pay attention to this matter! It was not done in practice, they are speaking hypothetically.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״אִמְרוּ לְסוֹפֵר וְיִכְתּוֹב, וְאַתֶּם חֲתוֹמוּ״ – רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: ״כָּשֵׁר וְלֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה״, רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר: ״כָּשֵׁר וְתֵעָשֶׂה״;
human_translation: one said to two Tell the scribe and he will write and you sign Rav Ḥisda says: valid; however, it shall not be done Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: valid and it may be done
llm_translation: He said to two: "Tell the scribe to write, and you should sign." - Rav Ḥisdah said: "It is valid but should not be done." Rabbah bar bar Ḥannah said: "It is valid and should be done."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: ״כָּשֵׁר וְלֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה״, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: ״כָּשֵׁר וְתֵעָשֶׂה״; רַבָּה אָמַר: ״כָּשֵׁר וְלֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה״, רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: ״כָּשֵׁר וְתֵעָשֶׂה״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: valid; however, it shall not be done Rav Sheshet says: valid and it may be done Rabba says: valid; however, it shall not be done. Rav Yosef says: valid and it may be done.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "Kasher and do not do." Rav Sheshet said: "Kasher and do." Rabbah said: "Kasher and do not do." Rav Yosef said: "Kasher and do."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָפֵיךְ לְהוּ.
human_translation: And there are who reverse
llm_translation: And there is one who answered them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לַעֲשָׂרָה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אָמַר לַעֲשָׂרָה: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט, וּתְנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב עַל יְדֵי כּוּלָּם. ״כּוּלְּכֶם כְּתוֹבוּ״ – אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב בְּמַעֲמַד כּוּלָּם. ״הוֹלִיכוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – אֶחָד מוֹלִיךְ עַל יְדֵי כּוּלָּם. ״כּוּלְּכֶם הוֹלִיכוּ״ – אֶחָד מוֹלִיךְ בְּמַעֲמַד כּוּלָּם.
human_translation: said to ten Write a bill of divorce The Sages taught: one said to ten Write a bill of divorce and give to my wife, one writes on behalf of them all. All of you write one writes in the presence of them all. Deliver a bill of divorce to my wife, one brings on behalf of them all. All of you deliver one brings in the presence of them all.
llm_translation: He said to ten: "Write a bill of divorce." The Rabbis taught, he said to ten: "Write a bill of divorce, and give it to my wife" - one writes on behalf of all of them. "All of you write" - one writes in the presence of all of them. "Bring the bill of divorce to my wife" - one brings it on behalf of all of them. "All of you bring" - one brings it in the presence of all of them.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מָנָה אוֹתָן, מַהוּ? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מָנָה אֵינוֹ כְּ״כוּלְּכֶם״, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּמִן רוֹמָה אָמַר: מָנָה הֲרֵי הוּא כְּ״כוּלְּכֶם״.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before he enumerated them what is Rav Huna says: one enumerated it is not comparable to All of you Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar of Rome: one enumerated it is comparable to All of you
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: He asked them: If one counted them, what is the ruling? Rav Huna said: Counting is not like "all of you." Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Elazar from Rome said: Counting is indeed like "all of you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי; הָא דְּמָנָה כּוּלְּהוּ, וְהָא דְּמָנָה מִקְצָתַיְיהוּ – אָמְרִי לַהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לְהַאי גִּיסָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: And they do not disagree. This where he enumerated them all, and that where he enumerated some of them. Some say in this manner, and some say it in that manner.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: And do not argue; this one who counted them all, and this one who counted some of them - they said to him for this case, and they said to him for that case.

hebrew_text: אַתְקֵין רַב יְהוּדָה בְּגִיטָּא דְּ״כוּלְּכֶם״: כְּתוֹבוּ – אוֹ כּוּלְּכוֹן אוֹ כֹּל חַד וְחַד מִינְּכוֹן; חֲתוֹמוּ – אוֹ כּוּלְּכוֹן אוֹ כֹּל תְּרֵי מִינְּכוֹן; אוֹבִילוּ – אוֹ כּוּלְּכוֹן אוֹ כֹּל חַד וְחַד מִינְּכוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda instituted in a bill of divorce All of you Write either all of you or each and every one of you; sign either all of you or every two of you; deliver either all of you or each and every one of you.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah established in a bill of divorce of "kulchem": Write - either all of you or all of you individually; sign - either all of you or all of you two by two; deliver - either all of you or all of you individually.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: זִימְנִין דְּגָאֵיז לֵיהּ לְדִיבּוּרֵיהּ, וְאָמַר ״כּוּלְּכוֹן״ וְלָא אָמַר ״כֹּל חַד מִינְּכוֹן״, וְאָתֵי לְאִיפְּסוֹלֵי!
human_translation: Rava said: sometimes may truncate his statement and say: All of you, but he will not say: Every one of you. And will be invalidated
llm_translation: Rava said: Sometimes he (the speaker) strengthens his words, and says "all of you," and does not say "each one of you," and comes to disqualify!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: ״כְּתוֹבוּ – כֹּל חַד מִינְּכוֹן, חֲתוֹמוּ – כֹּל תְּרֵי מִינְּכוֹן, אוֹבִילוּ – כֹּל חַד מִינְּכוֹן״.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Each of you write every two of you sign each one of you deliver
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "When it is written - each one of its kind, when it is sealed - two of its kind, when it is brought - each one of its kind."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאוֹמֵר
llm_translation: We will return to you, O say-er.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁאֲחָזוֹ קוּרְדְּיָיקוֹס, וְאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. אָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, וַאֲחָזוֹ קוּרְדְּיָיקוֹס, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר: ״לֹא תִּכְתְּבֶנּוּ״ – אֵין דְּבָרָיו הָאַחֲרוֹנִים כְּלוּם.
human_translation: one who was afflicted with insanity [ kordeyakos ] and said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, he said nothing, he said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, and was afflicted with insanity and he retracted and said: Do not write it, his latter statement nothing,
llm_translation: One who seized a Kordyakos and said, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife" - he did not say anything. He said, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," and he seized a Kordyakos, and then he retracted and said, "Do not write it" - his latter words are of no consequence.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּתֵּק, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״נִכְתּוֹב גֵּט לְאִשְׁתְּךָ״, וְהִרְכִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ – בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּעָמִים, אִם אָמַר עַל לָאו – ״לָאו״, וְעַל הֵן – ״הֵן״, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ.
human_translation: became mute, and said to him: we write a bill of divorce for your wife, and he nodded his head they examine him three times. If he responded to a negative No, and to a positive Yes, they shall write and give
llm_translation: He became silent, and they said to him: "Write a bill of divorce for your wife," and he nodded his head - they examine him three times, if he said "no" - "no," and if "yes" - "yes," these shall be written and given.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קוּרְדְּיָיקוֹס? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דְּנַכְתֵיהּ חַמְרָא חַדְתָּא דְּמַעְצַרְתָּא. וְלִיתְנֵי: מִי שֶׁנְּשָׁכוֹ יַיִן חָדָשׁ! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּהָא רוּחָא – ״קוּרְדְּיָיקוֹס״ שְׁמַהּ.
human_translation: What insanity Shmuel said: who was afflicted by new wine that from the winepress. And let teach one who was afflicted by new wine. This teaches us that the name of the demon is Kordeyakos .
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "Kurdyaikos"? Shmuel said: It is the new wine sediment of Ma'atzarta. And it should be taught: One who drinks new wine! This teaches us that the spirit is called "Kurdyaikos."

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לִקְמִיעָא. מַאי אָסוּתֵיהּ? בִּישְׂרָא סוּמָּקָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא מַרְקָא.
human_translation: What difference is there? to an amulet What is the remedy red meat over coals and wine diluted [ marka ]
llm_translation: For what purpose does it come out? For a measuring vessel. What is its remedy? In Yisra Sumaka Agumrei, and wine is a cure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: לְשִׁימְשָׁא בַּת יוֹמָא – כּוּזָא דְמַיָּא. בַּת תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי – סִיכּוּרֵי. בַּת תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי – בִּשְׂרָא סוּמָּקָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא מַרְקָא. לְשִׁימְשָׁא עַתִּיקְתָּא – לַיְתֵי תַּרְנְגוֹלְתָּא אוּכַּמְתִּי, וְלִיקְרְעַהּ שְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב, וְלִיגַלְּחֵיהּ לִמְצִיעֲתָא דְרֵישֵׁיהּ – וְלוֹתְבֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְנַנְּחֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ עַד (דְּמִיסְּרַךְ);
human_translation: Abaye said: mother told me for a day-old fever, a jug [ kuza ] of water. two days old bloodletting [ sikurei ]. three days old red meat over coals and diluted wine. For an old fever to bring a black hen, tear it lengthwise and widthwise, shave the middle of head, and place upon it, and leave upon him until adheres to his
llm_translation: Abaye said, his mother said to me: for a one-day-old baby - it is like water. For a two-day-old baby - swaddling clothes. For a three-day-old baby - red flesh and white skin, and red wine. For an older baby - bring a chicken, cook it, tear it into pieces, and feed it to him with its feathers, and place it under his pillow until he falls asleep.

hebrew_text: וְלִינְחוֹת וְלֵיקוּם בְּמַיָּא עַד צַוְּארֵיהּ – עַד דְּחָלֵישׁ עָלְמָא עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְלֵימוֹד, וְלִסְלַיק וְלִיתֵיב. וְאִי לָא – לֵיכוֹל כַּרָּתֵי, וְלִינְחוֹת וְלֵיקוּם בְּמַיָּא עַד צַוְּארֵיהּ – עַד דְּחָלֵישׁ עָלְמָא עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְלֵימוֹד, וְלִסְלַיק וְלִיתֵיב.
human_translation: And let him descend and let him stand in the water up to his neck until the world faint for him, And let him submerge and emerge and sit And if not let him eat leeks, and descend and stand in the water up to his neck until the world faint for him. And let him submerge and emerge and sit
llm_translation: To rinse and to place in water up to its neck - until it weakens its strength, and to learn, and to remove and to sit. And if not - to be able to cut it, and to rinse and to place in water up to its neck - until it weakens its strength, and to learn, and to remove and to sit.

hebrew_text: לְשִׁימְשָׁא – בִּישְׂרָא סוּמָּקָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא מַרְקָא. לְתַלְגָא – בִּישְׂרָא שַׁמִּינָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא חַיָּיא.
human_translation: for a fever red meat over coals and diluted wine. for the chills fatty meat over coals and undiluted wine.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Leshimsha - bisra sumaka aggumrei, ve'chamra marka. L'talga - bisra shammina aggumrei, ve'chamra chayya." English translation: "For sesame - in Israel, white sesame seeds are better, and red wine. For snow - in Israel, white wool is better, and red wine."

hebrew_text: רַב עַמְרָם חֲסִידָא, כִּי הֲוָה מְצַעֲרִין לֵיהּ בֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, הֲווֹ מַגְנוּ לֵיהּ אַתַּלְגָא. לִמְחַר אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְמָר דְּלַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ? אָמַר: הָנֵי, כֹּל דְּאָמֵינָא לְהוּ – מֵיפָךְ אָפְכִי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בִּישְׂרָא סוּמָּקָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא מַרְקָא. אַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ אִינְהוּ: בִּישְׂרָא שַׁמִּינָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא חַיָּיא.
human_translation: When the of the Exilarch’s house would afflict Rav Amram the pious they would him lie down on snow. The next day they would say to him: What is preferable for the Master, for us to bring him said Anything I say to them, the opposite. He said to them: red meat over coals and diluted wine. They brought him fatty meat over coals and undiluted wine
llm_translation: Rav Amram Hasida, when they would trouble him in the house of exile, they would bring him a certain type of wine. The next day they said to him: What is pleasing to our master that we should bring to him? He said: Those, all that I say to them – they turn it around. He said to them: In Israel, they conclude with red wine, and white wine. They brought him: In Israel, they conclude with white wine, and red wine.

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעָה יַלְתָּא, וּמְעַיְּילָה לֵיהּ לְבֵי מַסּוּתָא, וּמוֹקְמִי לֵיהּ בְּמַיָּא דְּבֵי מַסּוּתָא – עַד דִּמְהַפְכִי מַיָּא דְּבֵי מַסּוּתָא וְהָווּ דְּמָא, וְקָאֵי בִּישְׂרֵיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי פְּשִׁיטֵי.
human_translation: Yalta, heard And she brought him to the bathhouse, and placed him in the water of the bathhouse until the water of the bathhouse turned blood. And his flesh became coins [ peshitei ].
llm_translation: Sham'ah Yalta, u'me'ayilah lei l'vei masuta, u'mokmei lei b'maya d'vei masuta - ad d'mehafchi maya d'vei masuta v'havu d'ma, v'kaei b'isrei peshitei peshitei.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אִיעֲסֵק בְּרִיחְיָא. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אִיעֲסֵק בִּכְשׁוּרֵי, אֲמַר: גְּדוֹלָה מְלָאכָה שֶׁמְּחַמֶּמֶת אֶת בְּעָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef he would work by millstones Rav Sheshet he would work by beams. He said: Great is labor, as it warms its master.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef is engaged in perfume-making. Rav Sheshet is engaged in glassmaking; he said: "Great is the craft that warms its master."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא סָעֵיד מָר גַּבָּן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלָא מְעַלּוּ עַבְדֵי, דַּחֲשִׁידִי אַאֵבֶר מִן הַחַי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי יֵימַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא מַחְוֵינָא לָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: זִיל גְּנוֹב, אַיְיתִי לִי חֲדָא כַּרְעָא מֵחֵיוְתָא.
human_translation: The Exilarch said to Rav Sheshet: What is the reason Master, does not eat with us? He said to him: Because the slaves according to a high standard, as suspected a limb from a living said to him: Who says said to him: I will now show you. said to his servant: Go steal one leg from the animal bring to me.
llm_translation: He said to him, the head of the exile, to Rav Sheshet: What is the reason that Master Gaban does not walk? He said to him: Because the servants did not bring him, as I suspect a limb from a living animal. He said to him: Who can say? He said to him: Now I will prove it to you. He said to his attendant: Go steal, bring me a leg from a living animal.

hebrew_text: אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַהְדְּמוּ לִי הַדְמֵי דְּחֵיוְתָא. אַיְיתוֹ תְּלָת כַּרְעֵי, אוֹתִיבוּ קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא בַּעֲלַת שָׁלֹשׁ רַגְלַיִם הֲוַאי? פְּסוּק אַיְיתוֹ חֲדָא מֵעָלְמָא, אוֹתִיבוּ קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: אוֹתְבַיהּ נָמֵי לְהָךְ דִּידָךְ. אוֹתְבַהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַאי בַּת חָמֵשׁ רַגְלַיִם הֲוַאי?!
human_translation: brought to him said to Set out the portions of the animal for me. They brought him three legs and placed them before him, said to them: Did this have three legs? they cut one from another they brought placed before said to his servant: Bring this of yours, as well. He placed said to them: Did this have five legs?
llm_translation: He brought it to him. He said to them: "Bring me the blood of the demon." They brought three legs, placed them before him. He said to them: "Is this the owner of three legs?" They brought one piece from the world, placed it before him. He said to his servant: "Place it in front of your uncle." He placed it. He said to them: "Is this the daughter of five legs?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, לִיעְבְּדוּ קַמֵּיהּ (שַׁמָּעֵיהּ) דְּמָר, וְלֵיכוֹל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְחַיֵּי. קָרִיבוּ תַּכָּא קַמַּיְיהוּ, וְאַיְיתוֹ קַמֵּיהּ בִּישְׂרָא, וְאוֹתִיבוּ קַמֵּיהּ רִיסְתָּנָא דְּחָנְקָא חַמְתָּא. גַּשְּׁשֵׁיהּ וְשַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: He said to If so, they should prepare in the presence of Master’s servant and eat said to him: Very well. They brought a table before them, and they brought meat before him. And placed a small before him so that would cause choke. He felt it, took wrapped it in his scarf [ sudarei ]
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, let them serve before (listen to) the Master, and go. He said to him: By the life. They brought a sack before him, and they brought him before Yisra, and they sat him before a bundle of flax. He felt it and weighed it, he wrapped it in his cloak.

hebrew_text: לְבָתַר דְּאָכֵיל, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ:
human_translation: After he ate, said to
llm_translation: After he ate, they said to him:

hebrew_text: אִיגְּנִיב לַן כָּסָא דְכַסְפָּא! בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא מְעַיְּינִי וְאָתוּ, אַשְׁכְּחוּהָ דִּכְרִוכָה בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: A silver cup was stolen from us, When they were checking they found wrapped in his scarf.
llm_translation: He has stolen our silver cup! While he was examining and coming, we found it in his sack, concealed in his provisions.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חֲזִי מָר, דְּלָא מֵיכַל קָא בָּעֵי – אֶלָּא לְצַעוֹרַן! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא מֵיכָל אֲכַלִי, וּטְעַמִי בֵּיהּ טַעְמָא דְחִיוָּרָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: חִיוָּרָא לָא עֲבִיד לַן הָאִידָּנָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּדַקוּ בְּדוּכְתֵּיהּ; דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אוּכָּמָא בְּחִיוָּרָא, וְחִיוָּרָא בְּאוּכַּמְתָּא – לָקוּתָא הִיא. בְּדוּק אַשְׁכְּחוּהּ.
human_translation: said to See Master, does not desire to eat, rather to afflict us. said to them: I ate and I tasted the taste of white in They said to We did not prepare white today. said to them: Check the in place as Rav Ḥisda said: Black within white and white within black are an affliction They checked found
llm_translation: They said to him: "See, Master, he does not need to eat - only to store!" He said to them: "I need to eat, and I taste in it the taste of life." They said to him: "Life does not depend on us now." He said to them: "Examine his spittle; for Rav Ḥisda said: If there is spittle in life, and life in spittle - it is a sign of vitality." They examined it and found it to be clear.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָא נָפֵיק, כְּרוֹ לֵיהּ בֵּירָא וּשְׁדוֹ לֵיהּ צִיפְּתָא עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לֵיתֵי מָר לֵינַח. נְחַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא מֵאֲחוֹרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא: פְּסוֹק לִי פְּסוּקָיךְ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״נְטֵה לְךָ עַל יְמִינְךָ אוֹ עַל שְׂמֹאלֶךָ״. אֲמַר לֵיה לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: מַאי קָא חָזֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צִיפְּיתָא דְּשַׁדְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲדַר מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: When was exiting dug a pit and placed a reed mat [ tzifta ] on top of it And they said to The Master, should come and rest Rav Ḥisda, snorted [ neḥar ] to him from behind said to a child Recite your verse for me said to him: “Turn to your right or to your left” said to his servant: What do you see? said to him: a mat that placed said to him: Turn away from it
llm_translation: When he went out, he saw a well, and a branch of myrtle was floating on its surface. They said to him: Let the Master come and drink. Rav Ḥisda pushed him from behind. He said to the child: Quote to me your verses. He said to him: "Turn to your right or to your left." He said to his attendant: What did you see? He said to him: A branch of myrtle from the side. He said to him: Return it.

hebrew_text: לְבָתַר דִּנְפַק, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: מְנָא הֲוָה יָדַע מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲדָא – דִּנְחַר לִי מָר. וְעוֹד – דִּפְסַק לִי יָנוֹקָא פְּסוּקָא. וְעוֹד – דַּחֲשִׁידִי עַבְדֵי דְּלָא מְעַלּוּ.
human_translation: After left Rav Ḥisda said to him: From where did the Master, know said to him: One, that the Master, snorted to me And additionally, when the child recited the verse And additionally, servants are suspect of not according to a high standard,
llm_translation: After he went out, Rav Ḥisda said to him: From where did the Master know? He said to him: One - the Master revealed himself to me. And furthermore - a verse was divided for me. And furthermore - I suspected the servants that they did not act properly.

hebrew_text: ״עָשִׂיתִי לִי שָׁרִים וְשָׁרוֹת וְתַעֲנוּגוֹת בְּנֵי הָאָדָם, שִׁדָּה וְשִׁדּוֹת״; ״שָׁרִים וְשָׁרוֹת״ – אֵלּוּ מִינֵי זֶמֶר, ״וְתַעֲנוּגוֹת בְּנֵי הָאָדָם״ – אֵלּוּ בְּרֵיכוֹת וּמֶרְחֲצָאוֹת, ״שִׁדָּה וְשִׁדּוֹת״ – הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: שֵׁידָה וְשֵׁידְתִין. בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי: שִׁידְּתָא.
human_translation: “I got myself sharim and sharot , and human pleasures, shidda and shiddot ” “ Sharim and sharot ”: These are types of musical “And human pleasures”: These are pools and bathhouses. “ Shidda and shiddot ”: Here, they interpreted Male demons [ shidda ] and female demons [ shiddetin ]. In the West, they said carriages [ shiddeta ].
llm_translation: "I have made for myself ministers and ministeresses, and delights of the sons of men, fields and vineyards"; "ministers and ministeresses" - these are types of music, "and delights of the sons of men" - these are pools and baths, "fields and vineyards" - here it should be translated as: fields and vineyards. In the West they say: baths.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת מִינֵי שֵׁדִים הָיוּ בְּשִׁיחִין, וְשֵׁידָה עַצְמָהּ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There were three hundred types of demons in Shiḥin, but I do not know what a demon itself is.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Three hundred types of demons were in the sky, and the demoness herself I do not know what she is.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: שֵׁידָא וְשֵׁידְתִין. שֵׁידָה וְשֵׁידְתִין – לְמַאי אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַבַּיִת בְּהִבָּנוֹתוֹ אֶבֶן שְׁלֵמָה מַסָּע נִבְנָה וְגוֹ׳״ – אָמַר לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן: הֵיכִי אֶעֱבֵיד? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא שָׁמִירָא דְּאַיְיתִי מֹשֶׁה לְאַבְנֵי אֵפוֹד.
human_translation: The Master said: Here they interpreted Male demons and female demons. Why was it necessary for male demons and female demons? As it is written “For the house, when it was being built, was built of stone made ready at the quarry; said to the sages: How shall I make They said to him: There is a a shamir which Moses brought the stones of the ephod.
llm_translation: Master said, here they translated: "Shayda and Shaydetin." Shayda and Shaydetin - for what did he ask? As it is written: "And the house, when it was in building, was built of whole stone made ready beforehand." He said to the sages: How shall I act? They said to him: There is a tradition that Moses brought for the stones of the ephod.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: הֵיכָא אִישְׁתְּכַח? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי שֵׁידָה וְשֵׁידְתִין כַּבְשִׁינְהוּ אַהֲדָדֵי, אֶפְשָׁר דְּיָדְעִי וּמְגַלּוּ לָךְ. אַיְיתִי שֵׁידָה וְשֵׁידְתִין כַּבְשִׁינְהוּ אַהֲדָדֵי, אָמְרִי: אֲנַן לָא יָדְעִינַן, דִּילְמָא אַשְׁמְדַאי – מַלְכָּא דְשֵׁידֵי, יָדַע.
human_translation: said to them: Where is it found? They said to him: Bring a male demon and a female demon torment them together. It is possible that they know they will reveal to you. brought a male demon and a female demon tormented them together, they said: We do not know Perhaps Ashmedai, king of the demons, knows.
llm_translation: He said to them: Where can a woman be found? They said to him: We brought a demon and we bound it like a calf, perhaps it will reveal to you. We brought a demon and we bound it like a calf, perhaps it will reveal to you. They said: We do not know, perhaps it is a demon - the king of demons, knows.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: הֵיכָא אִיתֵיהּ? אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִיתֵיהּ בְּטוּרָא פְּלָן. כַּרְיָא לֵיהּ בֵּירָא, וּמַלְיָא לֵיהּ מַיָּא, וּמִיכַּסְּיָא בְּטִינָּרָא, וַחֲתִימָה בְּגוּשְׁפַּנְקֵיהּ; וְכֹל יוֹמָא סָלֵיק לִרְקִיעָא וְגָמַר מְתִיבְתָּא דִרְקִיעָא, וְנָחֵית לְאַרְעָא וְגָמַר מְתִיבְתָּא דְאַרְעָא; וְאָתֵי סָיֵיר לֵיהּ לְגוּשְׁפַּנְקֵיהּ וּמְגַלֵּי לֵיהּ וְשָׁתֵי, וּמְכַסֵּי לֵיהּ וְחָתֵים לֵיהּ וְאָזֵיל.
human_translation: said to them: Where is They said to him: is on such-and-such a mountain. dug a pit for himself and filled it with water, and covered it with a rock, and sealed it with his seal. And every day he ascends to Heaven and studies in the heavenly study hall and he descends to the earth and studies in the earthly study hall. And he comes and checks his seal and he uncovers it and drinks And he covers it and seals it and goes.
llm_translation: He said to them: Where is it found? They said to him: It is found in such and such a mountain. He digs for it in the earth, fills it with water, covers it with straw, seals it with pitch; every day he ascends to the sky and completes the measurement of the sky, then descends to the earth and completes the measurement of the earth; he comes back to his treasure, uncovers it, drinks, covers it, seals it, and departs.

hebrew_text: שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לִבְנָיָהוּ בֶּן יְהוֹיָדָע, יְהַב לֵיהּ שׁוּשִׁילְתָּא דַּחֲקִיק עֲלַהּ שֵׁם, וְעִזְקְתָא דַּחֲקִיק עֲלַהּ שֵׁם, וּגְבָבֵי דְעַמְרָא, וְזִיקֵי דְחַמְרָא. אֲזַל, כְּרָא בֵּירָא מִתַּתַּאי, וּשְׁפִינְהוּ לְמַיָּא, וְסַתְמִינְהוּ בִּגְבָבֵי דְעַמְרָא; וּכְרָא בֵּירָא מֵעִילַּאי, (וְשַׁפְכִינְהוּ) [וְשַׁפְכֵיהּ] לְחַמְרָא; וְטַמִּינְהוּ. סְלֵיק יְתֵיב בְּאִילָנָא
human_translation: sent for Benayahu, son of Jehoiada, gave him a chain onto which name was carved, and a ring onto which name was carved, and fleeces of wool and wineskins of wine. He went and dug a pit lower drained the water, and plugged it with the fleeces of wool And he dug a pit higher And he poured the wine into it and he plugged He up sat in a tree.
llm_translation: He sent for Ben Yehoyada's sons, gave them a flask of oil, a bundle of myrtle, a bundle of balsam, and a bundle of wine. They went and saw a wellspring at the bottom, poured water into it, covered it with a stone, and ascended. They sat under a tree.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא סַיְירֵיהּ לְגוּשְׁפַּנְקָא, גַּלְּיֵיהּ, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ חַמְרָא. אֲמַר: כְּתִיב: ״לֵץ הַיַּיִן הוֹמֶה שֵׁכָר, וְכׇל שׁוֹגֶה בּוֹ לֹא יֶחְכָּם״, וּכְתִיב: ״זְנוּת וְיַיִן וְתִירוֹשׁ יִקַּח לֵב״. לָא אִישְׁתִּי. כִּי צָחֵי, לָא סַגִּיא לֵיהּ; אִישְׁתִּי, רְוָא וּגְנָא.
human_translation: When came he checked his seal, opened found it wine. He said it is written: “Wine is a mocker, strong drink is riotous; and whosoever wallows in it is not wise” and it is written: “Harlotry, wine, and new wine take away the heart” I will not drink when he became thirsty, he was unable to he drank, became intoxicated, and fell asleep.
llm_translation: When his cupbearer came to Gushpanka, he uncovered it and found wine. He said: It is written, "Scoffer is the wine, arrogant is the strong drink, and whoever is led astray by it is not wise," and it is written, "Lewdness, wine, and new wine take away the heart." I did not drink. When he was sober, it was not significant to him; when he drank, it was pleasant and delightful.

hebrew_text: נְחֵית, אֲתָא, שְׁדָא בֵּיהּ שׁוּשִׁילְתָּא, סְתָמֵיהּ. כִּי אִתְּעַר, הֲוָה קָא מִיפַּרְזַל; אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמָא דְמָרָךְ עֲלָךְ! שְׁמָא דְּמָרָךְ עֲלָךְ!
human_translation: descended came, threw the chain around enclosed him When awoke he struggled said to him: The name of your Master is upon you, the name of your Master is upon you,
llm_translation: Descended, came, a demon in it, a female demon, its name. When he woke up, it was dissipating; he said to it: Perhaps the Master has mercy on you! Perhaps the Master has mercy on you!

hebrew_text: כִּי נָקֵיט לֵיהּ וְאָתֵי, מְטָא דִּיקְלָא – חַף בֵּיהּ, שַׁדְיֵיהּ; מְטָא לְבֵיתָא – שַׁדְיֵיהּ; מְטָא גַּבֵּי כּוּבָּא דְּהָהִיא אַרְמַלְתָּא, נְפַקָא
human_translation: When took and came he reached a palm tree rubbed against it knocked it down. He reached a house knocked it down. He reached a small shack [ kuva ] belonging to a certain widow. emerged,
llm_translation: When he took it and came, when he reached the palm tree - he shook it, its fruits fell; when he reached the house - its fruits fell; when he reached the top of that vineyard, he went out.

hebrew_text: אִיחַנַּנָא לֵיהּ. כְּפָא לְקוֹמְתֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ, אִיתְּבַר בֵּיהּ גַּרְמָא. אֲמַר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלָשׁוֹן רַכָּה תִּשְׁבׇּר גָּרֶם״.
human_translation: she begged him He bent from her, broke one of his bones. He said: This is as it is written: “Soft speech can break a bone”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Iichanna lei. K'fa lekumteih mineih, itt'var beih garma. Amar, hayinu dikhtiv: "Ve'l'shon rakha tishbor garem." English translation: He leaned on it. When he got up from his seat, he broke a bone. He said, this is what is written: "And a soft tongue breaks the bone."

hebrew_text: חֲזָא סַמְיָא דַּהֲוָה קָא טָעֵי בְּאוֹרְחָא, אַסְּקֵיהּ לְאוֹרְחֵיהּ. חֲזָא רַוְיָא דַּהֲוָה קָא טָעֵי בְּאוֹרְחָא, אַסְּקֵיהּ לְאוֹרְחֵיהּ. חֲזָא חֶדְוְותָא דַּהֲווֹ קָמְחַדִּי לַהּ, בְּכָה. שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר לְאוּשְׁכָּפָא: עָבֵיד לִי מְסָאנֵי לְשַׁב שְׁנֵי, אַחֵיךְ. חֲזָא הָהוּא קַסָּמָא דַּהֲוָה קָסֵים, אַחֵיךְ.
human_translation: saw a blind man who was lost on the road he brought him to the road. He saw a drunk who was lost on the road he brought him to the road. He saw the joy in which they were celebrating, he cried. He heard a certain man say to a shoemaker [ ushkafa ]: Make me shoes for seven years, he laughed. He saw a certain sorcerer performing magic, he laughed.
llm_translation: See Samya who was walking on the road, he went to his way. See Ravya who was walking on the road, he went to his way. See Hedvata who was standing and crying, he heard that man who was saying to his friend: "Prepare for me a meal for two, your brother." See that magician who was practicing, your brother.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא לְהָתָם, לָא עַיְּילוּהּ לְגַבֵּיהּ דִּשְׁלֹמֹה עַד תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי. יוֹמָא קַמָּא אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַמַּאי לָא קָא בָעֵי לִי מַלְכָּא לְגַבֵּיהּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַנְסֵיהּ מִישְׁתְּיָא. שְׁקַל לְבֵינְתָּא אוֹתֵיב אַחֲבִרְתַּהּ. אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁלֹמֹה. אָמַר לְהוּ, הָכִי אָמַר לְכוּ: הֲדוּר אַשְׁקְיוּהּ.
human_translation: When arrived there, they did not bring him before Solomon until three days the first day he said to them: Why doesn’t the king want me to him? They said to him: overcome drink. took a brick placed on another came and told Solomon said to them: This is what he said to you Return give drink.
llm_translation: When he arrived there, they did not bring it before him, the king Solomon, until three days. On the first day, he said to them: Why does the king not want me before him? They said to him: He is busy with his wives. He took a brick and sat down at her door. They came and said to Solomon. He said to them, so he said to you: "Dwell in my shadow."

hebrew_text: לִמְחַר אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְאַמַּאי לָא קָא בָּעֵי לִי מַלְכָּא לְגַבֵּיהּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַנְסֵיהּ מֵיכְלָא. שְׁקַל לְבֵינְתָּא מֵחֲבִרְתַּהּ, אוֹתְבַהּ אַאַרְעָא. אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁלֹמֹה. אֲמַר לְהוּ, הָכִי אָמַר לְכוּ: נְגִידוּ מִינֵּיהּ מֵיכְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: The following day said to them: And why doesn’t the king want me to him? They said to him: overcome food. took the brick off the other placed it on the ground. came told Solomon He said to them: This is what he said to you Take his food away from him.
llm_translation: On the morrow he said to them: "And why does the king not require him for himself?" They said to him: "They took him from the dining hall. He took a brick from his friend, and threw it into the earth. They came and said to Solomon. He said to them, thus he said to you: 'Let his property be taken from him.'"

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי עֲיַיל לְקַמֵּיהּ. שְׁקַל קַנְיָא, וּמְשַׁח אַרְבְּעָה גַּרְמִידֵי, וּשְׁדָא קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִכְּדִי כִּי מָיֵית הָהוּא גַּבְרָא, לֵית לֵיהּ בְּהָדֵין עָלְמָא אֶלָּא אַרְבָּעָה גַּרְמִידֵי; הַשְׁתָּא כְּבַשְׁתֵּיהּ לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, וְלָא שְׂבַעְתְּ עַד דִּכְבַשְׁתְּ נָמֵי לְדִידִי?!
human_translation: At the end of three days came before took a reed and measured four cubits [ garmidei ], and threw it before him.
