He said to See, when that man, dies, he have nothing in this world except the four cubits Now you have conquered the entire world and you are not satisfied until you also conquer me?
llm_translation: At the end of three days he came before him. He took a reed, and anointed four piles, and sat before him. He said to him: "Since you have killed that man, you have no share in the world to come except for four piles; now you have subdued all the people of the world, but you will not be satisfied until you subdue my piles!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא קָא בָעֵינָא מִינָּךְ מִידֵּי; בָּעֵינָא דְּאֶיבְנְיֵיהּ לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְקָא מִיבְּעֵי לִי שָׁמִירָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִידִי לָא מְסִיר לִי, לְשָׂרָא דְיַמָּא מָסֵיר לֵיהּ; וְלָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ אֶלָּא לְתַרְנְגוֹלָא בָּרָא, דִּמְהֵימַן לֵיהּ אַשְּׁבוּעֲתֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: I need nothing from you. I want to build the Temple and I need the shamir said to him: was not given to me, it was given to the minister of the sea. And he gives it only to the wild rooster, whom he trusts by his oath
llm_translation: He said to him: I do not seek from you anything; I seek to build for him the Temple, and he seeks to give me a bribe. He said to him: For me, he does not remove it, but for the officer of the day he removes it; and he did not give it to him except for a rooster, for he trusted his oath.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי עָבֵד בֵּיהּ? מַמְטֵי לֵיהּ לְטוּרֵי דְּלֵית בְּהוּ יִשּׁוּב, וּמַנַּח לֵהּ אַשִּׁינָּא דְטוּרָא, וּפָקַע טוּרָא; וּמְנַקֵּיט מַיְיתִי בִּיזְרָנֵי מֵאִילָנֵי, וְשָׁדֵי הָתָם, וְהָוֵי יִשּׁוּב. וְהַיְינוּ דִּמְתַרְגְּמִינַן: ״נַגָּר טוּרָא״.
human_translation: And what does do with it? He brings it to mountains that are not habitation, and he places on the craggy rock and the mountain splits. And he takes brings seeds of trees, throws them there, and it becomes habitation. And this is why we interpret a cutter of mountains [ naggar tura ],
llm_translation: And what does he do with it? He places it in a basket that does not have a bottom, and he places a strap of a basket on it, and the basket breaks; and he collects nuts from the trees, and throws them there, and it will return. And this is what we translate: "A basket of nuts."

hebrew_text: בְּדַקוּ קִינָּא דְּתַרְנְגוֹלָא בָּרָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ בְּנֵי, וְחַפְּיוּהּ לְקִינֵּיהּ זוּגִּיתָא חִיוָּרְתִּי. כִּי אֲתָא, בָּעֵי לְמֵיעַל וְלָא מָצֵי. אֲזַל אַיְיתִי שָׁמִירָא, וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ עִלָּוֵיהּ. רְמָא בֵּיהּ קָלָא, שַׁדְיֵיהּ, שַׁקְלֵיהּ. אֲזַל חֲנַק נַפְשֵׁיהּ אַשְּׁבוּעֲתֵיהּ.
human_translation: They investigated the nest of a wild rooster in which there were chicks, and he covered its nest with translucent glass. When came it wanted to enter but was unable It went and brought the shamir and placed it on top threw a clump at knocked over took it went strangled itself over its oath,
llm_translation: They examined the nest of a rooster in which there were eggs, and they found it to be a pair of yellowish eggs. When he came, he wanted to take them and could not find them. He went and brought thorns, and placed them on the nest. The rooster cried out, removed them, and took them away. He went and strangled himself in his own oath.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בְּנָיָהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי חֲזִיתֵיהּ לְהָהוּא סַמְיָא דַּהֲוָה קָא טָעֵי בְּאוֹרְחָא, אַסֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְאוֹרְחֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַכְרְזִי עֲלֵיהּ בִּרְקִיעָא דְּצַדִּיק גָּמוּר הוּא, וּמַאן דַּעֲבַד לֵיהּ נִיחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ, זָכֵי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.
human_translation: Benayahu said to What is the reason when you saw that blind man who was lost on the road you brought him to the road? said to him: They proclaim about him in heaven that he is a completely righteous man, and anyone who does good for his soul shall merit the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the reason that when you saw it (the lost object) in that dark place where it was lying in the path, you did not return it to its owner? He said to him: Proclaim concerning it in the sky of the completely righteous, and whoever does it for its own sake, merits the world to come.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי טַעְמָא כִּי חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְהָהוּא רַוְיָא דְּקָטָעֵי בְּאוֹרְחָא, אַסֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְאוֹרְחֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַכְרְזִי עֲלֵיהּ בִּרְקִיעָא דְּרָשָׁע גָּמוּר הוּא, וְעָבְדִי לֵיהּ נִיחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵיכְלֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And what is the reason when you saw the drunk man who was lost on the road you brought him to the road? said to him: They proclaim about him in heaven that he is a completely wicked man. And I did good for his soul so that he will consume world
llm_translation: And what is the reason that when he saw that certain radishes were cut in the road, he diverted his path? He said to him: Proclaim upon it in the firmament that it is a completely wicked one, and let his soul find rest, so that he may not enter the world.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְהָהוּא חֶדְוְותָא, בְּכֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּעֵי מֵימָת גַּבְרָא בְּגוֹ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין, וּבָעֲיָא מִינְטָר לְיָבָם קָטָן תְּלֵיסְרֵי שְׁנִין.
human_translation: What is the reason when you saw that joy you cried? said to him: man will die within thirty days. And is required to wait for the yavam , a minor, thirteen years,
llm_translation: What is the reason that when you saw that beauty, you wept? He said to him: It requires a man to die in his prime at the age of thirty days, and it requires a minor to wait for his yavam for thirteen years.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי שְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְאוּשְׁכָּפָא: ״עֲבֵיד לִי מְסָאנֵי לְשַׁב שְׁנִין״, אַחֵיכְתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהוּא, שִׁבְעָה יוֹמֵי לֵית לֵיהּ, מְסָאנֵי לְשַׁב שְׁנִין בָּעֵי?!
human_translation: What is the reason when you heard that man say to a shoemaker: Make me shoes for seven years, you laughed? said to him: That does not have seven days does he need shoes for seven years?
llm_translation: What is the reason that when you heard from that man who said to you, "Prepare for me a dish to sit for two years," did you not believe him? He said to him: That man, he does not have seven days, and he wants a dish to sit for two years?!

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְהָהוּא קַסָּמָא דַּהֲוָה קָסֵים, אַחֵיכְתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּהֲוָה יְתֵיב אַבֵּי גַזָּא דְּמַלְכָּא, לִקְסוֹם מַאי דְּאִיכָּא תּוּתֵיהּ!
human_translation: What is the reason when you saw that sorcerer performing magic you laughed? said to him: Because he was sitting on the king’s treasury [ bei gaza ]. Let him use his magic what there is underneath him.
llm_translation: "What is the reason that when you saw that sorcerer who was practicing sorcery, you laughed? He said to him: Because he was sitting in the king's treasury to practice whatever sorcery he had learned!"

hebrew_text: תַּרְחֵיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ עַד דְּבַנְיֵיהּ לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ. יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָאֵי לְחוֹדֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּתִיב: ״כְּתוֹעֲפוֹת רְאֵם לוֹ״; וְאָמְרִינַן: ״כְּתוֹעֲפוֹת״ – אֵלּוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, ״רְאֵם״ – אֵלּוּ הַשֵּׁדִים. מַאי רְבוּתַיְיכוּ מִינַּן?
human_translation: kept with him until building the Temple. One day he stood alone. He said to It is written: “For him like the lofty horns of the wild ox” and say “Like the lofty horns”; these are the ministering angels. “The wild ox”; these are the demons. what are you greater than us?
llm_translation: His father's generation until his sons to the Temple. One day he was standing in his chamber, he said to him: It is written: "As the appearance of a horse." And we say: "As the appearance" - these are ministering angels, "of a horse" - these are demons. What is your preference from us?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁקוֹל שׁוּשִׁילְתָּא מִינַּאי, וְהַב לִי עִיזְקְתָךְ, וְאַחְוִי לָךְ רְבוּתַאי. שַׁקְלֵיהּ לְשׁוּשִׁילְתָּא מִינֵּיהּ, וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ עִיזְקְתֵיהּ. בַּלְעֵיהּ, אוֹתְבֵיהּ לְחַד גַּפֵּיהּ בִּרְקִיעָא, וּלְחַד גַּפֵּיהּ בְּאַרְעָא, פַּתְקֵיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה פַּרְסֵי. עַל הַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא אֲמַר שְׁלֹמֹה: ״מַה יִּתְרוֹן לָאָדָם בְּכׇל עֲמָלוֹ שֶׁיַּעֲמֹל תַּחַת הַשָּׁמֶשׁ״.
human_translation: said to him: Take the chain off me and give me your ring and I will show you my strength. took the chain off him and he gave him his ring. swallowed he placed one wing in the heaven and one wing on the earth. He threw four hundred parasangs. With regard to that moment Solomon said: “What profit is there for a person through all of his toil under the sun?”
llm_translation: He said to him: "Weigh the silk from me, and bring me your cloak, and I will give you my merchandise." He weighed the silk from him and gave him his cloak. He swallowed it, placed one end of it in the sky and the other end in the earth, its length was four hundred parasangs. At that moment, Solomon said: "What advantage does man have in all his toil under the sun?"

hebrew_text: ״וְזֶה הָיָה חֶלְקִי מִכׇּל עֲמָלִי״ – מַאי ״וְזֶה״? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל; חַד אָמַר: מַקְלוֹ; וְחַד אָמַר: גּוּנְדּוֹ. הָיָה מְחַזֵּר עַל הַפְּתָחִים, כֹּל הֵיכָא דִּמְטָא, אָמַר: ״אֲנִי קֹהֶלֶת הָיִיתִי מֶלֶךְ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּירוּשָׁלִָים״. כִּי מְטָא גַּבֵּי סַנְהֶדְרִין, אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן: מִכְּדִי שׁוֹטֶה – בַּחֲדָא מִילְּתָא לָא סְרִיךְ, מַאי הַאי?
human_translation: “And this was my portion from all of my toil” What “And this”? Rav and Shmuel One said: staff And one said: his cloak. circulated from door to door wherever he arrived he would say: “I, Ecclesiastes, was king over Israel in Jerusalem” When he arrived at the Sanhedrin the sages said: Now, an imbecile does not fixate on one matter what is this
llm_translation: "And this was my portion from all my toil" - What is "and this"? Rav and Shmuel; one said: his staff; and one said: his cloak. He used to go around the doorways, wherever he would come, he would say: "I, Kohelet, was king over Israel in Jerusalem." When he came before the Sanhedrin, the sages said: Since he is a fool, one word is not necessary, what is this?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִבְנָיָהוּ: קָא בָעֵי לָךְ מַלְכָּא לְגַבֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. שְׁלַחוּ לְהוּ לְמַלְכְּווֹתָא: קָאָתֵי מַלְכָּא לְגַבַּיְיכוּ? שְׁלַחוּ לְהוּ: אִין, קָאָתֵי. שְׁלַחוּ לְהוּ: בִּידְקוּ בְּכַרְעֵיהּ. שְׁלַחוּ לְהוּ: בְּמוּקֵי קָאָתֵי;
human_translation: said to Benayahu: Does the king require you with him? said to them: No. They sent to the queens the king come with you? sent to them: Yes, he comes. They sent to Check his feet sent to He comes in socks [ bemokei ],
llm_translation: They said to him, to Benayahu: Does the king seek you? He said to them: No. They sent to the kings: Does the king come to you? They sent to them: No, he comes. They sent to them: Examine his feet. They sent to them: He is standing in the marketplaces.

hebrew_text: וְקָא תָבַע לְהוּ בְּנִידּוּתַיְיהוּ; וְקָא תָבַע לַהּ נָמֵי לְבַת שֶׁבַע אִימֵּיהּ. אַתְיוּהּ לִשְׁלֹמֹה, וְהַבוּ לֵיהּ עִזְקְתָא, וְשׁוּשִׁילְתָּא דַּחֲקִוק עָלֶיהָ שֵׁם. כִּי עָיֵיל, חַזְיֵיהּ, פְּרַח.
human_translation: And he demands them, when they are menstruating. And he also demands Bathsheba his mother They brought Solomon, gave him a ring and the chain on which the name was carved. When entered, saw him fled.
llm_translation: He demanded of them with his arguments; and he demanded of her, the mother of Bat Sheva. They brought him a staff, and the chain that had the Name engraved on it. When he came, he saw her, and he desired her.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, הֲוָה לֵיהּ בִּיעֲתוּתָא מִינֵּיהּ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה מִטָּתוֹ שֶׁלִּשְׁלֹמֹה שִׁשִּׁים גִּבּוֹרִים סָבִיב לָהּ מִגִּבּוֹרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, כּוּלָּם אֲחוּזֵי חֶרֶב מְלוּמְּדֵי מִלְחָמָה, אִישׁ חַרְבּוֹ עַל יְרֵיכוֹ מִפַּחַד בַּלֵּילוֹת״.
human_translation: And even so, was fearful of him, and this is as it is written: “Behold the bed of Solomon surrounded by sixty strong men from the warriors of Israel. All of them holding swords and trained in war, each man with his sword on his thigh from fear in the nights”
llm_translation: And even so, he had a dagger from him. And that is what is written: "Behold, it is the bed of Solomon, surrounded by sixty mighty men from the mighty men of Israel, all holding swords and expert in warfare, each man with his sword on his thigh because of fear in the nights."

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: מֶלֶךְ וְהֶדְיוֹט, וְחַד אָמַר: מֶלֶךְ וְהֶדְיוֹט וּמֶלֶךְ.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel One said: a king and a commoner, And one said: a king, and a commoner, and a king,
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel, one said: king and commoner, and one said: king, commoner, and king.

hebrew_text: לִדְמָא דְּרֵישָׁא – לַיְתֵי שׁוּרְבִּינָא, וּבִינָא, וְאָסָא דָּרָא, וְזֵיתָא, וְחִילְפָא, וְחִילְפֵי דְיַמָּא, וְיַבְלָא; וְלִישְׁלוֹקִינְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי; וְלִנְטוֹל תְּלָת מְאָה כָּסֵי אַהַאי גִּיסָא דְרֵישָׁא, וּתְלָת מְאָה כָּסֵי אַהַאי גִּיסָא דְרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: for blood in the head, let him bring cypress [ shurvina ], willow, fresh myrtle [ asa dara ], olive, poplar, sea willow, and cynodon and boil them together. And he should pour three hundred cups on one side of his head and three hundred cups on this, side of his head.
llm_translation: In the likeness of the first – let him bring barley, and beans, and lentils, and olives, and turnips, and Egyptian beans, and a pumpkin; and let him boil them together; and let him take three hundred silver coins for this measure of the first, and three hundred silver coins for this measure of the first.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי וַרְדָּא חִיוָּרָא דְּקָאֵי בְּחַד דָּרָא, וְלִישְׁלְקֵיהּ, וְלִינְטוֹל שִׁיתִּין כָּסֵי אַהַאי גִּיסָא דְרֵישָׁא, וְשִׁיתִּין כָּסֵי אַהַאי גִּיסָא דְרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: And if not let him bring a white rose [ varda ] that stands in one row, and he should boil it. And he should pour sixty cups on this side of head and sixty cups on this side of head.
llm_translation: If not - let him bring a red heifer that is standing in one row, and burn it, and take six measures of the ashes of this heifer, and six measures of the ashes of that heifer.

hebrew_text: לִצְלִיחְתָּא – לַיְתֵי תַּרְנְגוֹלָא בָּרָא; וְלִישְׁחֲטֵיהּ בְּזוּזָא חִיוָּרָא – אַהָהוּא גִּיסָא דְּכָיֵיב לֵיהּ, וְנִזְדְּהַר מִדְּמֵיהּ דְּלָא לְסַמִּינְהוּ לְעֵינֵיהּ; וְלִיתְלְיֵיהּ בְּסֵיפָא דְבָבָא – דְּכִי עָיֵיל חָיֵיף בֵּיהּ, וְכִי נָפֵיק חָיֵיף בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: for a migraine, let him bring a wild rooster and slaughter it using a silver dinar, over the side that hurts him. And he should be careful of its blood as not to blind his eye. And he should hang it on the doorpost so that when he enters he rubs against it and when he exits he rubs against it.
llm_translation: For the success - let the rooster come; and let him slaughter it with a coin of white silver - that is a sign that is favorable for him, and he should be cautious of his blood not to place it in his eyes; and let him hang it on the doorpost of the house - for when a harmful spirit comes, it will see it and depart.

hebrew_text: לִבְרוּקְתִּי – לַיְתֵי עַקְרַבָּא דְּשַׁב חוּמְרֵי, וּנְיַיבְּשֵׁיהּ בְּטוּלָּא; וְנִישְׁחוֹק תַּרְתֵּי מְנָתָא כּוּחְלָא, וַחֲדָא מְנָתָא מִינֵּיהּ; וְלִימְלֵי תַּלְתָּא מַכְחָלֵי בְּהַאי עֵינָא וּתְלָתָא מַכְחָלֵי בְּהַאי עֵינָא; טְפֵי לָא לִימַלֵּי, דְּאִי לָא – פָּקַע עֵינֵיהּ.
human_translation: for eye disease [ beroketi ], let him bring a seven-colored scorpion, dry it in the shade, and grind two portions of stibium and one portion of And let him place three eyebrushes full in this eye, and three eyebrushes in that eye. But he should not place more, as if not his eye will burst.
llm_translation: My cistern - let the scorpion come, bring barley straw, and dry it; and grind two portions of galal, and one portion of it; and fill three barrels with this eye and three barrels with that eye; if not filled, her eye will burst.

hebrew_text: לְשַׁבְרִירֵי דְלֵילְיָא – נֵיתֵי שׁוּדְרָא בָּרְקָא, וְנֵיסַר חֲדָא כַּרְעָא מִינֵּיהּ וַחֲדָא כַּרְעָא מִכַּלְבָּא; וְנִיטְרְפוּ יָנוֹקֵי חַסְפָּא אַבָּתְרֵיהּ, וְלֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ: ״אַסָּא כַּלְבָּא אַכְסָא תַּרְנְגוֹלָא״; וְלִיגְבֵּי שַׁב אוּמְצֵי מִשִּׁבְעָה בָּתֵּי, וְלִיתְּבִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּצִינּוֹרָא דְּדַשָּׁא, וְנֵיכְלִינְהוּ בְּקִלְקְולֵי דְּמָתָא. בָּתַר הָכִי, לִפְשׁוֹט שׁוּדְרָא בָּרְקָא, וְנֵימְרוּ הָכִי: ״שַׁבְרִירֵי דִּפְלוֹנִי בַּר פְּלוֹנִיתָא (שַׁבְקִינְהוּ) [לִישְׁבְּקוּהּ] לִפְלוֹנִי בַּר פְּלוֹנִיתָא, וְלִיחֲרוּ לְכַלְבָּא בְּבָבִיתָא דְּעֵינֵיה״ּ.
human_translation: for night blindness, he should bring a rope of hair [ shudra barka ], and he should tie one of his legs and one leg of a dog And let children throw shards behind him, and let them say to him: The dog is old the rooster is foolish. And let him take seven raw meat from seven houses and let him leave them for him in the socket of the door. And let him eat them in the junkyard of the city. Afterward, he should untie the rope of hair and say as follows: The blindness of so-and-so, son of so-and-so; leave so-and-so, son of so-and-so; and Let them blow into the dog’s eye.
llm_translation: The strong ones of the night - a demon is placed in the east, and one leg of it is from a dog and one leg is from a rooster; and the young children of the village were harmed because of it, and they said to it: "As a dog, a rooster, and a cat." And to break the demon, they would take seven pieces of lead, and they would melt them in a lead tube, and they would feed them to the cat. After this, to remove the demon from the east, they would say: "The strong ones of so-and-so, son of so-and-so, remove it to so-and-so, son of so-and-so, and they would tie it to a dog in the house of its owner."

hebrew_text: לְשַׁבְרִירֵי דִימָמָא – לַיְתֵי שִׁבְעָה סוּמָּקֵי מִגַּוּוֹא דְחֵיוְתָא, וְנִיטְוִינְהוּ אַחַסְפָּא דְאוּמָּנָא; וְלִיתֵיב אִיהוּ מִגַּוַּאי וְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא מֵאַבָּרַאי, וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ עַוִּירָא: ״הַב לִי דְּאֵיכוֹל״, וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ הַאיְךְ פְּתִיחָא: ״סַב אֵיכוֹל״; וּבָתַר דְּאָכֵיל לִיתְבְּרֵיהּ לְחַסְפָּא, דְּאִי לָא – הָדְרִי עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: for day blindness, let him bring seven animal spleens, and let roast them on shard of a bloodletter. And let sit on the inside and another person on the outside, and let say to Blind man, give me to eat, and let the other say to Seeing man, take eat. And after eats, let him break the shard, as if not, will follow him.
llm_translation: Regarding the strong ones of blood - let seven tubes come from the back of the liver, and they should be tied with a rope of reeds; and he should sit in the sun and another person from his family, and he should say to him: "Give me to eat," and he should say to him: "Sit and eat"; and after he eats, he should sit in the shade, for if not - return to his illness.

hebrew_text: לִדְמָא דְּאָתֵי מִנְּחִירָא – לֵיתֵי גַּבְרָא כֹּהֵן דִּשְׁמֵיהּ לֵוִי, וְלִיכְתּוֹב לֵיהּ לֵוִי לְמַפְרֵעַ. וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי אִינִישׁ מֵעָלְמָא, וְנִיכְתּוֹב לֵיהּ: ״אֲנָא פַּפֵּי שֵׁילָא בַּר סוּמָּקֵי״ – לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: for a nosebleed, let bring a man named Levi a priest, and should write for Levi, backward. And if not let him bring an ordinary man, and let write for I am Pappi Sheila bar Summakei. backward.
llm_translation: In the case where one comes from Nehirah - a man named Kohen whose name is Levi should come, and it should be written for him Levi for Mafraya. And if not - let a person come from the world, and it should be written for him: "I, Pappai Sheila son of Sumakei" - for Mafraya.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – נִיכְתּוֹב לֵיהּ הָכִי: טַעַם דְּלִי בְּמֵי כֶסֶף, טַעַם דְּלִי בְּמֵי פְגָם. וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי עִיקָּרָא דְאַסְפַּסְתָּא, וְאַשְׁלָא דְפוּרְיָיא עַתִּיקָא, וְקוּרְטְסָא, וּמוֹרִיקֵי, וְסוּמָּקָא דְלוּלִיבָּא; וְנִקְלִינְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי; וְלַיְתֵי גְּבָבָא דְעַמְרָא וְנִיגְדּוֹל תַּרְתֵּי פְּתִילָתָא, וְלִטְמִישׁ בְּחַלָּא, וְנִיגַדְבֵּל בְּקִיטְמָא הָדֵין, וְנִיתֵּיב בִּנְחִירֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if not let write for like this: Taste from a bucket in silver water, taste from a bucket in tainted water. And if not let him bring the root of fodder [ aspasta ], rope [ ashla ] from an old bed, and paper [ kurtesa ], and saffron, and the red of a palm branch, and let him burn them with each other. And let bring a fleece of wool and spin two strings, and let him soak [ litmish ] them in vinegar, roll them in this ash and place in his nostrils.
llm_translation: If not - it should be written thus: the taste of a leech in silver water, the taste of a leech in vinegar. And if not - bring the root of aspassta, and the eye of an ancient frog, and a lizard, and morikei, and the red dye of the luliba; and grind them together; and bring the bone of a black ant and two threads of wool, and mix them with milk, and apply it to the affected area, and tie it with a hair of its tail.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – לִיחְזֵי אַמַּת הַמַּיִם דְּאָזְלָא מִמִּזְרָח כְּלַפֵּי מַעֲרָב; וְנִפְסַע וְנֵיקוּם חַד כַּרְעָא לְהַאי גִּיסָא וְחַד כַּרְעָא לְהַאי גִּיסָא; וְנִישְׁקוֹל טִינָא בִּידֵיהּ דְּיַמִּינָא מִתּוּתֵי כַּרְעָא דִשְׂמָאלֵיהּ, וּבִידֵיהּ דִּשְׂמָאלָא מִתּוּתֵי כַּרְעָא דְיַמִּינֵיהּ; וְנִיגְדּוֹל תַּרְתֵּי פְּתִילָתָא דְעַמְרָא וְנִיטְמִישׁ בְּטִינָא, וְנִיתֵּיב בִּנְחִירֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if not let him look at a stream of water flowing from east toward west, and let him spread and stand one foot on this side and one foot on that side. And let him take clay in his right hand from under his left foot, and with his left hand from under his right foot. And let him spin two strings of wool, soak in the clay, and place them in his nostrils.
llm_translation: If not - he should see a cubit of water that goes from the east to the west; and he should take a step and rise one foot for this side and one foot for that side; and he should take a fig in the right hand from the middle of the left foot, and in the left hand from the middle of the right foot; and he should twist two threads of wool and immerse them in mud, and place them in his nostrils.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – לֵיתֵיב תּוּתֵי מַרְזָבָא, וְנַיְיתוֹ מַיָּא וְלִישְׁדּוֹ עֲלֵיהּ, וְלֵימְרוּ: ״כִּי הֵיכִי דְּפָסְקִי הָנֵי מַיָּא, לִיפְסוֹק דְּמֵיהּ דִּפְלָנְיָא בַּר פְּלָנִיתָא״.
human_translation: And if not let him sit under the gutter and let them bring water and pour it on him. And let them say: Just as the water has ceased, let the blood of so-and-so, son of so-and-so, cease.
llm_translation: "And if not - let Marzava's daughters sit, and bring water and pour it on her, and let them say: 'As these waters cease, may the blood of so-and-so son of so-and-so cease.'"

hebrew_text: לִדְמָא דְּאָתֵי מִפּוּמָּא – בָּדְקִינַן לֵיהּ בְּגִילָא דְחִיטְּתָא, אִי סָרֵיךְ – מֵרֵיאָה קָאָתֵי וְאִית לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא, וְאִי לָא – מִכַּבְדָּא קָאָתֵי וְלֵית לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: for blood that comes from the mouth we check with a straw of wheat. If sticks from his lungs and it has a remedy. But if not comes from the liver and it has no remedy.
llm_translation: In the case where it comes from the mouth - we examine it with a winnowing shovel of wheat, if it is necessary - it has a benefit, and if not - it is a disgrace and has no benefit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַמֵּי לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְהָאֲנַן אִיפְּכָא תְּנַן: נִיטָּל הַכָּבֵד וְלֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנָּה כְּלוּם, הָרֵיאָה שֶׁנִּיקְּבָה אוֹ שֶׁחָסְרָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּמִפּוּמֵּיהּ קָאָתֵי, אֵימַר אִיתְּמוֹחֵי אִיתְּמַח.
human_translation: Rav Ami said to Rav Ashi: But didn’t we learn the opposite the liver was removed and none of it remains, a lung that is punctured or missing, said to him: Since comes out from mouth, say that dissolved
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ammi to Rav Ashi, but we learned the opposite: If the liver was removed and nothing remained of it, or the lung was punctured or deficient! He said to him: Since it is coming from his mouth, let him say what he wants to say.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִי מֵרֵיאָה קָאָתֵי, אִית לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לַיְתֵי שִׁבְעָה כּוּנֵי מִפִּירְמָא דְסִילְקָא, וְשִׁבְעָה כּוּנֵי פִּירְמָא דְכַרָּתֵי, וְחַמְשָׁה כּוּנֵי פְּרִידָא, וּתְלָתָא כּוּנֵי דִּטְלָפְחֵי, וְכוּנָא דְּכַמּוֹנָא, וְכוּנָא (דְּחַבְלֵי) [דְּתַבְלֵי]; וּכְנֶגְדָּן – כַּנְתָּא פְּטִירְתָּא; וְלִיבַשֵּׁיל וְלֵיכוֹל, וְלִישְׁתֵּי אַבָּתְרֵיהּ שִׁיכְרָא חֲרִיפָא דְּטֵבֵת.
human_translation: The Master said: If the comes from the lungs it has a remedy. What is its remedy? Let him bring seven fistfuls of sliced beets, and seven fistfuls of sliced leek, and five fistfuls of perida and three fistfuls of lentils, and a fistful of cumin, and a fistful of ropes, and a corresponding the intestines of a firstborn animal. And let him cook and let him eat and afterward let him drink good, strong beer.
llm_translation: Master said: If it is from the liver, there is a remedy for it. What is its remedy? Let him bring seven intentions from the gall of the liver, and seven intentions from the gall of the gallbladder, and five intentions of the spleen, and three intentions of the kidneys, and the intention of the stomach, and the intention of the intestines; and corresponding to them - a bundle of flax; and let him roast and eat, and drink two cups of strong beer of wheat.

hebrew_text: לְכַכָּא – אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: לַיְתֵי תּוּמָא יְחִידָאָה וְנִימְרְסֵיהּ בְּמִישְׁחָא וּמִילְחָא, וְנִתְּבֵיהּ אַטֻּופְרָא דְאִלְיוֹנָא דְּהָהוּא גִּיסָא דְּכָיֵיב לֵיהּ, וְנַהְדַּר לֵיהּ גְּדָנְפָא דְלֵישָׁא. וְנִיזְדְּהַר לְבִישְׂרֵיהּ, דְּקָשֵׁי לְחִיוָּרָא.
human_translation: for teeth [ lekhakha ], Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Let him bring individual garlic and grind it with oil and salt. And let him place it on the thumbnail of the side that hurts him, and let him surround it a rim [ gedanpa ] of dough. And he should take care his flesh harmful boils.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Lekakha - amar Rabbah bar Rav Huna: Laitei tuma yechidaha v'nimr'sei b'mishcha u'milcha, v'nitvei atufra d'ilyona d'hahu gisa d'khayev lei, v'nahdar lei gedanfa d'leisha. V'nizdehar l'visrei, d'kashei l'chiyura. English translation: Lekakha - Rabbah son of Rav Huna said: Let a single worm come and mix it with oil and salt, and place it in the upper nostril of that arrowhead that is harmful to him, and let the nostril be honored with a bandage of linen. And let him be careful with his health, for it is difficult to heal.

hebrew_text: לְחִינְכֵי – אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חוּמְתִי – כִּי מַמְרוּ, וְעִיקָּרָא דְחוּמְתִי – עֲדִיף מִמַּמְרוּ, וְנִינְקוֹט בְּפוּמֵּיהּ. הָנֵי לְאוֹקוֹמֵי; לְבַשּׁוֹלֵי – לַיְיתֵי פָּארֵי דְּרֵישׁ נָפְיָיא, וּטְלָפְחֵי בְּעַפְרַיְיהוּ, וְשׁוּבְלִילְתָּא, וְחוּמַרְתָּא דִכְשׁוּתָא, וְנִינְקוֹט כְּאַמְגּוּזָא בְּפוּמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: for gums, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Spanish chamomile [ ḥomti ] like mamru and the root Spanish chamomile is preferable to mamru , and let him take it in his mouth. This to stabilize To boil them, let him bring the bran at the upper portion of the sifter, and lentils in their dirt, and fenugreek [ shuvlilta ], and the flower of the hop And let him take about nut in his mouth.
llm_translation: For the disciples - Rabbi Yochanan said: My wall - when it is smooth, and the essence of my wall - is preferable to when it is smooth, and it is adorned with pomegranates. Those for the beams; for the cooks - to bring the beauty of the head of the cabbage, and the beetles in their dust, and the turnip, and the wine of the press, and it is adorned like a bride in her adornments.

hebrew_text: לְאִיפְּתוֹחֵי – לִינְפַּח לֵיהּ חַבְרֵיהּ תַּחְלֵי חִיוָּרְתָּא בְּגִילָא דְחִיטְּתָא. לְאַסּוֹקֵי – לַיְתֵי עַפְרָא מִטּוּלָּא דְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וְנִיגְבּוֹל בְּדוּבְשָׁא וְנֵיכוֹל, דִּמְעַלֵּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: to open let his friend blow white cress with a straw of wheat. to heal let him bring dirt found in the shade of the bathroom and knead it with honey and eat it, as this is effective
llm_translation: To the baker - his companions should blow into the dough before the kneading of the wheat. To the dyer - he should take dust from the refuse heap of the dyers' guild, and mix it with honey and consume, for it is beneficial for him.

hebrew_text: לְבַרְסָם – לַיְתֵי כִּי פִיסְתְּקָא דְּנִישָׁדוּר, וְכִי אַמְגּוּזָא דְחֶלְבְּנִיתָא דּוּבְשָׁנִיתָא, וּמְלֵי תַּרְווֹדָא דּוּבְשָׁא חִיוָּרָא, וּמְלֵי נַטְלָא בַּת מָחוֹזָא חַמְרָא נְקִידָא; וְנִישְׁלוֹקִינְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי; וְכִי בְּשִׁיל נִשָׁדוּר – בְּשִׁיל לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ. וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי רְבִיעֵתָא דַּחֲלָבָא דְּעִיזָּא חִיוַּורְתִּי
human_translation: For a bronchial infection [ levarsam ], let him bring a nut-sized of ammonia [ nishdor ] and a of sweet galbanum, and a large spoonful of white honey, a vessel from Meḥoza, full of clear [ nekida ] wine, and let him boil them together. And once the ammonia is cooked everything will have cooked. And if not let him bring a quarter- of milk from a white goat,
llm_translation: "L'barsam - laytei ki fis'teka d'nishadur, v'ki amguz'a d'chelb'nita dub'shanita, u'melei tarvoda dub'sha chivara, u'melei natla bat machoza chamra nekida; v'nishlukinhu bahadei hadadei; v'ki b'shil nishadur - b'shil lei kulei. V'ai la - laytei revi'eta d'chalava d'iza chivaurti."

hebrew_text: וְנִיטַּיְיפֵיהּ אַתְּלָת קִלְחֵי כְּרָבָא, וְנִיבְחֲשֵׁיהּ בִּגְווֹזָא דְּמַרְמְהִין; וְכִי בְּשִׁיל גְּווֹזָא דְמַרְמָהִין – בְּשִׁיל לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ. וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי נִפְקָא דְּכַלְבָּא חִיוָּרָא, וְנִיגְבּוֹל בְּנִטְפָא. וְכַמָּה דְּאֶפְשָׁר – נִפְקָא לָא נֵיכוֹל, דִּמְפָרֵיק.
human_translation: and let him drip it on three stalks of cabbage and stir it with a sprig a marjoram And when the sprig of marjoram boiled all of it boiled. And if not let him take the feces of a white dog and let him mix it with balm. And as much as possible let him not eat the feces because the separation
llm_translation: And they would wrap it with three strands of calf hair, and they would immerse it in a vessel of boiling water; and if due to the boiling of the vessel of boiling water – it would boil all of it. And if not – let it come out that all the blackness would come out, and it would be absorbed in a drop. And as much as possible – if it cannot come out, for it is breaking.

hebrew_text: לְגִירָא – לַיְתֵי גִּירָא דְלִילִיתָא, וְנֵיפְכֵיהּ, וְנִשְׁדֵּי מַיָּא עִלָּוֵיהּ וְנִשְׁתֵּי. וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי מִמַּיָּא דְּאִישְׁתִּי מִינַּיְיהוּ כַּלְבָּא בְּלֵילְיָא; וְנִיזְדְּהַר מִגִּילּוּיָא. לְגִילּוּיָא – אַנְפָּקָא דְחַמְרָא חַיָּיא.
human_translation: for a stinging pain [ gira ], let him bring an arrow of Lilith, and let him turn it upside down. And let him pour water on it and drink it. And if not let him bring water from which a dog drank at night, and let him be careful about uncovered for uncovered a quarter- [ anpaka ] of undiluted wine.
llm_translation: "L'gira - laytei gira d'lilita, v'neifcheih, v'nishdei maya ilaveih v'nishte. V'ei la - laytei mimmaya d'ishti minaihu kalba b'leilya; v'nizdehar m'giluya. L'giluya - anpaka d'chamra chayya."

hebrew_text: לְמוּרְסָא – אַנְפָּקָא דְּחַמְרָא, בְּאַהֲלָא תּוֹלָאנָא.
human_translation: for a pus-filled wound, a quarter- of wine in red ice plant.
llm_translation: To Mursa - the nostril of the wine, in the tent of Tolanah.

hebrew_text: לְפִירְחָא דְלִיבָּא – לַיְתֵי תְּלָת בְּרוֹשִׁיָּיאתָא דִשְׂעָרֵי, וְנִשְׁטְרִינְהוּ בְּכַמְכָּא דְּלָא עֲבַר עִילָּוֵיהּ אַרְבְּעִין יוֹמִין, וְנֵיכוֹל; וְנִשְׁתֵּי אַבָּתְרַיְיהוּ חַמְרָא מַרְקָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן דְּפָרַח לִיבֵּיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא – לְיוּקְרָא דְלִיבָּא אֲמַרִי;
human_translation: for palpitations of the heart, let him bring three loaves of barley, and soak them in kamka which forty days have not passed And let him eat and drink diluted wine after them. Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: All the more so his heart will palpitate said to him: I said for heaviness of the heart.
llm_translation: At the opening of the heart - three young shoots of hair come forth, and they are intertwined in a knot that has not passed forty days, and they are permitted; and they drink two cups of strong wine. Rav Acha said to Ravina: "And all the more so when his heart blossoms!" He said to him: "I - according to the preciousness of the heart, I speak."

hebrew_text: לְפִירְחָא דְלִיבָּא – לַיְתֵי תְּלָת בְּרוֹשִׁיָּיאתָא דְחִיטֵּי, וְנִישְׁטְרִינְהוּ בְּדוּבְשָׁא וְנֵיכוֹל, וְנִישְׁתֵּי אַבָּתְרַיְיהוּ חַמְרָא חַיָּיא.
human_translation: for palpitations of the heart, let him bring three loaves of wheat, soak them in honey, and eat And let him drink undiluted wine after them.
llm_translation: At the opening of the heart - let three barrels of wheat come, and soak them in honey and eat, and drink afterwards live wine.

hebrew_text: לְצִרְחָא דְלִיבָּא – לַיְתֵי תְּלָת בֵּיעֵי נִינְיָיא, וּבֵיעֲתָא דְכַמּוֹנָא, וּבֵיעֲתָא דְשֻׁומְשְׁמֵי, וְלֵיכוֹל.
human_translation: for heart pain, let him bring three egg of mint, and an egg of cumin, and an egg of sesame seeds, and let him eat
llm_translation: For the need of the heart - let three come in the eyes of the judges, and in the eighth of the month, and in the eighth of Shumshmei, and go.

hebrew_text: לִכְאֵב מְעֵי – לַיְתֵי תְּלָת מְאָה פִּלְפְּלֵי אֲרִיכָתָא, וְכֹל יוֹמֵי נִשְׁתֵּי מְאָה מִינַּיְיהוּ בְּחַמְרָא. רָבִין דְּמִן נָרֶשׁ עֲבַד לַהּ לְבַרְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי מְאָה וְחַמְשִׁין מֵהָנֵי דִּידַן, וְאִתְּסִיאַת.
human_translation: for pain of the intestines, let him bring three hundred long peppers, and every day let him drink one hundred of them with wine. Ravin of Neresh prepared one hundred and fifty of our, for the daughter of Rav Ashi, and she was healed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lik'ev mei - laytei t'lat me'ah pilpelai arichata, v'chol yomei nishte me'ah minnaiyehu b'chamra. Ravin d'min nareish avad lah l'varteih d'Rav Ashey me'ah v'chamshin mehanei didan, v'itseiyat." English translation: "For stomach pain - let him bring three hundred peppers of length, and every day he should drink two hundred of them with wine. Ravin from Naresheh did for the son of Rav Ashe one hundred and fifty of ours, and he was healed."

hebrew_text: לְכִירְצָא – אַנְפָּקָא דְּחַמְרָא בַּאֲטַרְפָּא דְעָרָאָה. לְכִירְצָא חִיוָּרָא – לַיְתֵי בִּיזְרָא גַּלְגִּילָא וְנִיצְיְירֵהּ בְּשִׁיסְתַּג, וְנִיתְיְירֵיהּ בְּמַיָּא וְנִשְׁתְּיֵהּ; וְנִזְדְּהַר מִבִּינְתָּא, דְּאִי לָא – מְנַקְּבָא לַהּ לְמַעְיָינֵיהּ.
human_translation: for roundworm, a quarter- of wine in laurel leaves. for white worm, let him bring cress and tie it with a piece of woven cloth. And let him soak it in water and drink it. And let him be careful with the seed, as if not and puncture his intestines.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lekhirtza - anpaka dechamra ba'atarpa de'ara'ah. Lekhirtza chivara - laiti bizra galgila venitzireih beshishtag, venitireih bemayya venishteih; venizdehar mibinta, de'i la - menakva la lema'ayaneih." English translation: "To the wine cellar - the opening of the wine barrel in the winepress of the city. To the wine cellar of Chivara - one should bring a tube, insert it into the barrel, and let it flow with a stream, and drink it; and be cautious of understanding, for if not - it may become contaminated with its source."

hebrew_text: לְמֵיסַר – סִיסִין רַטִּיבָא בְּמַיָּא. לְמִישְׁרֵא – יַבִּישְׁתָּא בְּמַיָּא. וְסִימָנָךְ: אִיצָא רַטִּיבְ[תָּ]א דְּסָכַר נַהֲרָא.
human_translation: to bind chamomile [ sisin ] wet with water. to relax dry in water, And your mnemonic Wet grass [ itza ] that is used to dam rivers,
llm_translation: To Meisar - wet sisisin in water. To Mishra - dry sisisin in water. And your sign: the wet hair of a riverbank.

hebrew_text: לִטְחָלָא – לַיְתֵי שַׁב בִּינֵי דְמַיָּא וּנְיַיבְּשִׁינְהוּ בְּטוּלָּא, וְכֹל יוֹמָא נִישְׁתֵּי תַּרְתֵּי וְתִלְתָּא בְּחַמְרָא. וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי טְחָלָא דִצְיפִרְתָּא דְּלָא אִיפְּתַח, וְנִטְחֲיֵיהּ בְּתַנּוּרָא, וְנוֹקֵי לַהֲדֵיהּ, וְנֵימָא: ״כִּי הֵיכִי דְּיַבִּישׁ הַאי טְחָלָא, נִיַּיבַּשׁ טְחָלֵיהּ דִּפְלוֹנִי בַּר פְּלוֹנִיתָא״.
human_translation: for the spleen, let him bring seven leeches, dry them in the shade, and every day drink two or three with wine. And if not let him bring the spleen of a female goat that has not given birth, and place it in the oven, and stand across from it, and let him say: Just as this spleen is dried, so shall the spleen of so-and-so, son of so-and-so, be dried.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Litkhala - laytei shav binei demayya uneyabshinhu betula, vekhol yoma nishteitartei vetilta bechamra. Ve'i la - laytei tekhala ditzifirta delo iftakh, venitkhayei betanura, venokei lahadeih, veneima: "Ki heichi deyavish hai tekhala, niyabash tekhaleih difloni bar plonita." English translation: Litkhala - he brings white between blood and dries them in the shade, and every day he drinks two or three with wine. And if not - he brings a plaster of cypress that does not open, and he smokes it in the oven, and he applies it to his forehead, and it is said: "So that this plaster may dry, let the plaster of so-and-so's son of so-and-so dry."

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – נִיטְחֲיֵיהּ בֵּינֵי אוּרְבֵי דְבֵיתָא חַדְתָּא, וְנֵימָא הָכִי. וְאִי לָא, לִיבְקֵי שָׁכְבָא דִּשְׁכֵיב בְּשַׁבְּתָא, וְנִישְׁקְלֵיהּ לִידֵיהּ וְנוֹתְבַהּ אַטְּחָלֵיהּ, וְנֵימָא: ״כִּי הֵיכִי דְּיַבִּישׁ הָא יְדָא, נִיַּיבַּשׁ טְחָלֵיהּ דִּפְלוֹנִי בַּר פְּלוֹנִיתָא״.
human_translation: And if not let him place between the bricks of a new house, and let him say this And if not, let him search for someone who died on Shabbat and let him take the hand and let him place it on his spleen and say: Just as the hand of so-and-so was dried, the spleen of so-and-so, the son of so-and-so, should be dried.
llm_translation: If not - they should place it between the beams of a new house, and it should be said thus. And if not, they should place it under the pillow of one who sleeps on Shabbat, and they should weigh it in his hand and insert it into his ear, and it should be said: "In the same way that this hand dries, may the earwax of so-and-so son of so-and-so dry up."

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – נַיְתֵי בִּינִיתָא וְנִיטְוְויֵיהּ בֵּי נַפָּחָא, וְנֵיכְלֵיהּ בְּמַיָּא דְּבֵי נַפָּחָא, וְנִישְׁתֵּי מִמַּיָּא דְּבֵי נַפָּחָא. הָהִיא עִיזָּא דַּהֲוָת שָׁתְיָא מַיָּא דְּבֵי נַפָּחָא, אִישְׁתְּחִיט – וְלָא אִישְׁתְּכַח לַהּ טְחָלָא.
human_translation: And if not let him take a fish and roast it house of a blacksmith. And let him eat it with the water from the blacksmith’s house And let him drink water from the blacksmith’s house. A certain goat drank water from the blacksmith’s house, was slaughtered there was no spleen found
llm_translation: "If not - he placed it in a basket and its opening in the house of the baker, and he fed it with water from the house of the baker, and it drank from the water of the house of the baker. That goat that was drinking water from the house of the baker, it would bleat, but it would not find a remedy."

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – לִיפְתַּח חָבִיתָא דְּחַמְרָא לִשְׁמֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אִי אִית לֵיהּ חָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא, לָא אָתֵי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר. אֶלָּא מַרְגַּל בְּפַת שַׁחֲרִית, דִּמְעַלְּיָא לְכוּלֵּי גּוּפֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if not let him open a barrel of wine for his sake, Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: If he has a barrel of wine he will not come before Master Rather, accustomed bread in the morning, because it benefits his entire body.
llm_translation: If not - open a barrel of wine in his name. Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashe: If he has a barrel of wine, he will not come before the Master. Rather, he should soak in black bread, which is beneficial for his entire body.

hebrew_text: לְרוּשְׁחָתָא – לַיְתֵי אַקִּיקָא, וְאִילְווֹא, וְאַסְפִּירְכָא, וּמַרְתְּכָא, וְחוּמַרְתָּא דְפִילוֹן, וּשְׁיָאפָא דַחֲמִימְתָּא, וְנִינְקֹט בְּשַׁחֲקֵי דְכִיתָּנָא – בְּקַיְיטָא, וְדַעֲמַר גּוּפְנָא – בְּסִיתְוָא. וְאִי לָא – לִישְׁתֵּי שִׁיכְרָא מַרְקָא.
human_translation: for hemorrhoids, let him bring acacia [ akika ], and aloe [ ilava ], and mercury, and silver dross, and a bundle [ ḥumreta ] of fragrant herbs [ defilon ], and feces of pigeons [ ḥamimta ]. And let him take it in linen bags in the summer, or cotton in the winter, And if not let him drink diluted beer.
llm_translation: For the head - let him bring a cucumber, and a gourd, and a squash, and a pumpkin, and the marrow of a melon, and the peel of a heated date, and suck on the pits of a fig - with a knife, and if not - let him drink barley beer.

hebrew_text: לְשִׁיגְרוֹנָא – לַיְתֵי פַּתְיָא דְמוֹנִינֵי, וְנִיגַנְדְּרֵיהּ שִׁיתִּין זִימְנֵי אַהָא מְטַחְתֵּיהּ, וְשִׁיתִּין זִימְנֵי אַהָא מְטַחְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: For rheumatism [ shigrona ], let him bring a vessel full of brine from small fish [ moninei ] and roll it sixty times on this thigh and sixty times on that thigh.
llm_translation: "Leshigrona - Laytei patya d'moninei, v'nigandrei shitein zimnei aha metachtei, v'shitein zimnei aha metachtei."

hebrew_text: לִצְמִירְתָּא – נֵיתֵי תְּלָת נִיטּוּפְיָיתָא מִישְׁחָא דְכוּפְרָא, וּתְלָת נִיטּוּפְיָיתָא אִיצְרָא דְכַרָּתֵי, וּתְלָת נִיטּוּפְיָיתָא דְחַמְרָא נְקִידָא, וְלִישְׁדֵּי לֵיהּ לְאִישׁ – בָּאַמָּה, וּלְאִשָּׁה – בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: for a bladder stone [ litzmireta ], let him bring three drops of tar oil, three drops from the squeezing [ itzra ] of leeks, and three drops of clean wine, and place for a man on the penis, and for a woman on that place,
llm_translation: At the time of the evening twilight - three bundles of myrrh are placed in the town of Kufra, and three bundles of myrrh in the treasury of Karatei, and three bundles of myrrh of pure wine, and to a man - by an amah, and to a woman - in the same place.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי אוּנָּא דְזִיקָא, וְלִתְלֵי לֵיהּ לְאִישׁ בָּאַמָּה, וּלְאִשָּׁה בַּדַּדִּין. וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי חוֹטֵא דִּזְהוֹרִיתָא דִּשְׂדֹתֶיהָ דּוּמָה בַּת דּוּמָה, וְלִיתְלֵי לֵיהּ לְאִישׁ בָּאַמָּה וּלְאִשָּׁה בַּדַּדִּין.
human_translation: And if not let him bring the ear, of a wine sac and suspend it, for a man from penis, and for a woman from breasts. And if not let him bring a crimson string spun by suspected the daughter of a suspected and let him suspend it, for a man from penis and for a woman from breasts.
llm_translation: If not - let him bring a bundle of flax, and let him give it to a man in the city and to a woman separately. If not - let him bring a sin-offering of a he-goat whose value is equal to the value of the field, and let him give it to a man in the city and to a woman separately.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – לַיְתֵי כִּינָּה דְּזָכָר וּנְקֵבָה, וְלִיתְלֵי לֵיהּ לְאִישׁ בָּאַמָּה וּלְאִשָּׁה בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם; וְכִי מַשְׁתִּין, נַשְׁתִּין אַסִּיסָנָא יַבִּישְׁתָּא בְּצִינּוֹרָא דְּדַשָּׁא, וּנְעַיֵּין בְּחוּמַרְתָּא דְּנָפְקָא מִינֵּיהּ, דִּמְעַלְּיָא לְכוּלְּהוּ צִימְרִי.
human_translation: And if not, let him bring a louse from a male and a female, and suspend it, for a man from his penis, and for a woman on that place, And when he urinates let him urinate on a dry branch [ sisna ] by the door pivot. And let him examine the stone that comes out of him as it is effective for any a fever [ tzimra ]
llm_translation: If not - let the species of male and female come, and let him not go to a man with a cubit and to a woman in the same place; and when urinating, let him urinate a dried fig in a tube of a lentil, and let them be careful of the wine that comes out of it, for it is superior to all wines.

hebrew_text: לְצִימְרָא בָּרָא – לַיְתֵי תְּלָתָא גְּרִיבֵי סוּפְלֵי, וּתְלָתָא גְּרִיבֵי אַטְרַף אַדָּרָא, וְנִישְׁלוֹקִינְהוּ כֹּל חַד לְחוֹדֵיהּ; וְלִיתֵיב בֵּינַיְיהוּ; וְלֹתְבִינְהוּ בְּתַרְתֵּי מְשִׁיכְלֵי, וְנַיְתֵי פָּתוּרָא וְנַנַּח עִילָּוֵיהּ, וְנֵיקוּם מֵעִילָּוֵי הַאי וְלֵותֵיב עִילָּוֵי הַאי, וּמֵעִילָּוֵי הַאי וְלֵותֵיב עִילָּוֵי הַאי, עַד דְּנִיסַּק בֵּיהּ הַבְלָא; וְלִסְחֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְכִי שָׁתֵי – מִמַּיָּא דְאַדָּרָא לִישְׁתֵּי, מִמַּיָּא דְסוּפְלֵי לָא לִישְׁתֵּי; מִשּׁוּם דִּמְיעַקְּרִי.
human_translation: for an external fever, let him bring three se’a date pits [ suflei ], and three se’a [ gerivei ] leaves of an eder Let him cook each one individually and sit between them. And let him place them in two basins, and bring a table and place it over him. And let him stand up from over this and sit over this and let him stand up from over this and sit over this until the heat rises on him And let him wash from the and when drinks, let him drink from the eder water. not let him drink from the date water, because causes infertility.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "LeTzimra barah - laytei t'lata g'rivei suflai, ut'lata g'rivei atraf adara, venishlokinehu kol chad l'chodeih; veliteiv beinaiyehu; velotvinhu b'taratei meshichlei, venatei patura venanach ilaveih, veneikum meilavei hai veloteiv ilavei hai, umeilavei hai veloteiv ilavei hai, ad denisk beih habla; velischey minaiyehu, vechi shatei - mimayya de'adara l'ishtei, mimayya de'suflai la'ishtei; mishum dimeakri." English translation: "For a belt he created - let three straps of sapphire come, and three straps of precious stone come, and they interlock each one to the other; and sit between them; and weave them with two chains, and place a clasp and hang it on its upper part, and remove from the upper part of this and place on the upper part of that, and from the upper part of that and place on the upper part of this, until it is attached with a clasp; and remove from them, and when you drink - from the water of the precious stone you may drink, from the water of the sapphire you may not drink; because they are mixed."

hebrew_text: לְצִימְרָא גַּוְונָא – לַיְתֵי שִׁבְעָה בּוּנֵי דְסִילְקָא מִשַּׁב מְשָׁארֵי, וְנִישְׁלוֹקִינְהוּ בְּעַפְרַיְיהוּ, וְנֵיכוֹל, וְנִישְׁתֵּי אַטְרַף אַדָּרָא בְּשִׁיכְרָא, אוֹ
human_translation: for an internal fever, let him bring seven handfuls of beet leaves from seven furrows. And let him cook them with their dirt and eat And let him drink eder leaves with beer or
llm_translation: To the storehouse of Gavna - let seven sons of Silka come from the market with provisions, and let them be divided among themselves in their aprons, and let them eat, and let them drink a cup of wine, or...

hebrew_text: עִנְבֵי תַאֲלָא בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: grapes a palm tree in water.
llm_translation: Clusters of grapes in water.

hebrew_text: לַחֲזָזִיתָא – לַיְתֵי שַׁב חִיטֵּי אַרְזַנְיָיתָא, וְנִיקְלִינְהוּ אַמָּרָא חַדְתָּא, וְנָפֵיק מִשְׁחָא מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְנֵישׁוּף. רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי עֲבַד לֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גּוֹי לְדָבָר אַחֵר, וְאִיתַּסִּי.
human_translation: for lichen planus [ ḥazazita ] let him bring seven large wheat kernels [ arzanayata ] and roast them over a new hoe. And extract oil from and rub Rav Shimi bar Ashi used this for a certain gentile something else, and he was healed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lachazazita - laytei shav chittei arzanayita, veniklinhu amara chatata, venafek mishcha minayei, veneishuf. Rav Shimi bar Ashey avad lei lehahu goy ledavar acher, ve'itasi." English translation: "For the hazazita - let him bring a measure of barley, and they should be sifted with a new sieve, and oil should be poured over them, and they should be baked. Rav Shimi bar Ashey did it for that Gentile for another matter, and it was successful."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַאי מַאן דִּמְחוֹ לֵיהּ בַּאֲלוֹנְכֵּי דְפָרְסָאֵי, מִיחְיָיא לָא חָיֵי; אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי, נִיסְפּוֹ לֵיהּ בִּשְׂרָא שַׁמִּינָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא חַיָּיא, אֶפְשָׁר דְּחָיֵי פּוּרְתָּא וּמְפַקֵּיד אַבֵּיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel said: One who is struck with Persian spears [ alunkei ] will not live In the meantime, they should force-feed him fatty meat over coals, and undiluted wine. possible that he will live a little bit and instruct his household
llm_translation: Shmuel said: The one who anoints himself with the oil of the oak trees of Parsa, Miḥyaya does not live; however, in the meantime, when they anointed him with the fat of a fat-tailed ram and living wine, it is possible that he will live a long time and take care of his household.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: הַאי מַאן דִּבְלַע זִיבּוּרָא – מִיחְיָיא לָא חָיֵי, אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי נַשְׁקְיֵהּ רְבִיעֵתָא דְּחַלָּא שַׁמְגָּז, אֶפְשָׁר דְּחָיֵי פּוּרְתָּא וּמְפַקֵּיד לְבֵיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: One who swallowed a hornet will not live. In the meantime they should give him a quarter- of sharp [ shamzag ] vinegar to drink. it is possible that he will live a little bit and instruct his household
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: One who swallows a splinter of glass - he does not live. However, if he drinks a quarter-log of vinegar afterwards, it is possible that he will live and be able to take care of his household.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָכַל בְּשַׂר שׁוֹר בְּלֶפֶת, וְלָן בַּלְּבָנָה בְּלֵילֵי אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר אוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּתְקוּפַת תַּמּוּז – אֹחַזְתּוֹ אֲחִילוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: ate ox meat with a turnip, and slept by the moon on the night of the fourteenth or the fifteenth in the season of Tammuz, afflicted with aḥilu ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who eats beef with turnips and sleeps in white garments during the nights of the fourteenth or fifteenth of the month of Tamuz - it will sustain him.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: וְהַמְמַלֵּא כְּרֵיסוֹ מִכׇּל דָּבָר, אֹחַזְתּוֹ אֲחִילוּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ מִתַּמְרֵי. פְּשִׁיטָא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר מָר: תַּמְרֵי – מַשְׂבְּעָן, וּמְשַׁחֲנָן, וּמְשַׁלְשְׁלָן, וּמְאַשְּׁרָן וְלָא מְפַנְּקָן; אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: taught: And one who fills his stomach with anything, afflicted with aḥilu . Rav Pappa said: Even with dates. Isn’t obvious, It might enter your mind to say since the Master said Dates satisfy warm act as a laxative, strengthen and do not spoil say teaches us
llm_translation: Mishna: And one who fills his stomach with anything, his bowels hold it. Rav Papa said: Even with dates. Obviously! Your mind should have told you, since the Master said: Dates - they satisfy, and loosen, and cause flatulence, and enrich, but do not pamper; say, perhaps not, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: מַאי אֲחִילוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵשׁ שֶׁל עֲצָמוֹת. מַאי ״אֵשׁ שֶׁל עֲצָמוֹת״? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֵשׁ גַּרְמֵי.
human_translation: What aḥilu Rabbi Elazar says: A fire of the bones. What is a fire of the bones? Abaye said: esh garmei
llm_translation: What is "Achilu"? Rabbi Elazar said: Fire of bones. What is "Fire of bones"? Abaye said: Fire caused by friction.

hebrew_text: מַאי אָסוּתֵיהּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: כּוּלְּהוּ שַׁקְיָינֵי – תְּלָתָא, וְשִׁבְעָא, וּתְרֵיסַר; וְהַאי – עַד דְּמִתַּסֵּי.
human_translation: What is its remedy? Abaye said: My mother told me any drink three or seven or twelve And this until he is healed.
llm_translation: What is its remedy? Abaye said, his mother told him: all the cups - three, and seven, and thirteen; and this one - until he is healed.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ שַׁקְיָינֵי – אַלִּיבָּא רֵיקָנָא, וְהַאי – בָּתַר דְּאָכֵל, וְשָׁתֵי, וְעָיֵיל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וְנָפֵיק וּמָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ. וּמַיְיתוּ לֵיהּ בּוּנָא דִּשְׁתִיתָא דִּטְלָפְחֵי, וּבוּנָא דְּחַמְרָא עַתִּיקָא, וְנִיגְבְּלִינְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי וְנֵיכוֹל; וְנִיכְרוֹךְ בִּסְדִינֵיהּ, וְנַיגְנְיֵהּ, וְלֵיכָּא דְּנוֹקְמֵיהּ עַד דְּקָאֵי מִנַּפְשֵׁיהּ; וְכִי קָאֵי, לִישְׁקְלֵיהּ לִסְדִינֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ, וְאִי לָא, הָדַר עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: Any drink with an empty heart, And this after he eats and drinks and enters the bathroom, and exits and washes his hands, and they bring him a fistful of shetita , from lentils, and a fistful of aged wine. And let him mix them together and let him eat And let him wrap himself with his sheet and sleep. And let there be no who will awaken him until he awakens on his own. And when he awakens let him remove the sheet from himself. And if not will return to him.
llm_translation: All the cups - empty, and this one - after eating, drinking, going to the bathroom, and washing his hands. They brought him a cup of date beer, a cup of old wine, mixed them together, and drank. He wrapped himself in his cloak, slept, and did not wake up until he regained his senses. When he woke up, he checked his cloak, and if it was wet from him, he would return it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵלִיָּהוּ לְרַבִּי נָתָן: אֱכוֹל שְׁלִישׁ וּשְׁתֵה שְׁלִישׁ וְהַנַּח שְׁלִישׁ – לִכְשֶׁתִּכְעוֹס, תַּעֲמוֹד עַל מִילּוּאֶךָ.
human_translation: Elijah said to Rabbi Natan: Eat a third and drink a third and leave a third when you become angry you become full.
llm_translation: He said to him Elijah to Rabbi Nathan: Eat a third, drink a third, and leave a third - when you become angry, stand on your words.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁלֹּא יָבֹא לִידֵי חוֹלִי מֵעַיִים, יְהֵא רָגִיל בְּטִיבּוּל – קַיִץ וָחוֹרֶף; סְעוּדָתְךָ שֶׁהֲנָאָתְךָ מִמֶּנָּה – מְשׁוֹךְ יָדְךָ הֵימֶנָּה; וְאַל תְּשַׁהֶה עַצְמְךָ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאַתָּה צָרִיךְ לִנְקָבֶיךָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: One who does not want to come to intestinal disease become accustomed to dipping summer winter. You should remove your hand, from a meal that you enjoy And do not delay yourself at the time when it is necessary to relieve yourself.
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: One who wishes to avoid becoming ill from stomach ailments should regularly immerse himself - in summer and winter; your meal, its pleasure - draw your hand from it; and do not delay yourself at the time when you need to relieve yourself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּשָׁתֵי טִילְיָא חִיוָּרָא – אֹחַזְתּוֹ וִיתֵּק. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שִׁיתִּין מִינֵי חַמְרָא הֲווֹ, מְעַלְּיָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ – סוּמָּקָא רֵיחָתָנָא, גְּרִיעָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ – טִילְיָא חִיוָּרָא.
human_translation: Mar Ukva said: This one who drinks inferior white wine [ tilya ] afflicted with weakness [ vitak ]. Rav Ḥisda said: There are sixty types of wine. The best of them all red, fragrant The worst of them all inferior white wine.
llm_translation: Master Uqva said: Whoever drinks the first cup becomes red, hold him and give him to drink. Rav Ḥisda said: Six types of wine were, the best of all - its color is red, the worst of all - its color is yellow.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַאי מַאן דְּיָתֵיב בְּצַפְרָנֵי נִיסָן גַּבֵּי נוּרָא, וְשָׁיֵיף מִשְׁחָא, וְנָפֵיק וְיָתֵיב בְּשִׁמְשָׁא – אֹחַזְתּוֹ וִיתַּק.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: This one who sits near the fire during the mornings of Nisan and rubs with oil and goes out and sits in the sun afflicted with weakness.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: One who sits in Tsafarnei Nisan in front of a lamp, and smears oil, and goes out and sits in the sun - he is held responsible and liable.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הִקִּיז דָּם וְשִׁימֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ – הוֹוִיין לוֹ בָּנִים וִיתְּקִין. הִקִּיזוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם וְשִׁימְּשׁוּ – הוֹוִיין לָהֶן בָּנִים בַּעֲלֵי רָאתָן. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא טָעֵים מִידֵּי, אֲבָל טָעֵים מִידֵּי – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: let blood and engaged in sexual intercourse has weak children both of them, let blood and engaged in sexual intercourse they will have children afflicted ra’atan . Rav Pappa said: We said only he did not taste anything But he tasted something we have no with it.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If he spat blood and wiped it with his bed - he will have sons and daughters. If they both spat blood and wiped it - they will have sons who are masters of vision. Rav Papa said: We only said this when it is not due to an illness, but if it is due to an illness - we have no part in it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: בָּא מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ וְשִׁימֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ – הוֹוִיין לוֹ בָּנִים וִיתְּקִין. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּא מִבֵּית הַכִּסֵּא, אַל יְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁהֶה שִׁיעוּר חֲצִי מִיל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשֵּׁד בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא מְלַוֶּה עִמּוֹ; וְאִם שִׁימֵּשׁ – הוֹוִיין לוֹ בָּנִים נִכְפִּים.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says: came from the road and engaged in sexual intercourse has weak children The Sages taught: one who comes from the bathroom, not engage in sexual intercourse until he waits the measure of half a mil because the demon of the bathroom accompanies him. And if he engaged in sexual intercourse he has children epileptic.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: If one comes from the road and uses his bed - he will have sons and daughters. The Rabbis taught: One who comes from the bathroom should not use his bed until he waits the time it takes to walk half a mil, because the demon of the bathroom accompanies him; and if he uses it - he will have stubborn children.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ מְעוּמָּד – אוֹחַזְתּוֹ עֲוִית; מְיוּשָּׁב – אוֹחַזְתּוֹ דָּלָרְיָא; הִיא מִלְּמַעְלָה וְהוּא מִלְּמַטָּה – אוֹחַזְתּוֹ דָּלָרְיָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who engages in sexual intercourse standing afflicted by spasms. sitting afflicted with dalarya .  she, above and he, below afflicted with dalarya .
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who serves his bed standing - his oath is valid; sitting - his oath is invalid; she is above and he is below - his oath is invalid.

hebrew_text: מַאי דָּלָרְיָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: סַם דָּלָרְיָא – דַּרְדָּרָא. מַאי דַּרְדָּרָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מוֹרִיקָא דְחוֹחֵי. רַב פָּפָּא אָלֵיס וּבָלַע לֵיהּ. רַב פַּפֵּי אָלֵיס וְשָׁדֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What dalarya ? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: remedy for dalarya dardara . What dardara ? Abaye said: Saffron of thorns. Rav Pappa chew [ aleis ] and swallow Rav Pappi chew and spit it
llm_translation: What is "dalarya"? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The spice of dalarya is daradara. What is daradara? Abbaye said: The saliva of snakes. Rav Papa would swallow it. Rav Pappi would apply it and drink it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ, לֵיתֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה קְפִיזֵי קוּרְטְמֵי דְחוֹחֵי, וְנֵידוּקִינְהוּ, וְנִישְׁלְקִינְהוּ בְּחַמְרָא וְנִישְׁתֵּי. אֲמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֵן הֵן הֶחְזִירוּנִי לְנַעֲרוּתִי.
human_translation: Abaye says: one who is not an expert, in way of the world, let him bring three vessels [ kefizei ], safflower thorns. And let him grind them, and boil them in wine, and drink Rabbi Yoḥanan says: These are return me to my youth
llm_translation: Abaye said: One who is not proficient in the way of the land, let him bring three handfuls of barley groats, roast them, grind them, mix them with wine, and drink. Rabbi Yochanan said: Indeed, indeed, they have restored me to my youth.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מַכְחִישִׁים כֹּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: פַּחַד, דֶּרֶךְ וְעָוֹן. פַּחַד – דִּכְתִיב: ״לִבִּי סְחַרְחַר עֲזָבַנִי כֹחִי״. דֶּרֶךְ – דִּכְתִיב: ״עִנָּה בַדֶּרֶךְ כֹּחִי״. עָוֹן – דִּכְתִיב: ״כָּשַׁל בַּעֲוֹנִי כֹחִי״.
human_translation: Three things diminish a person’s strength, and they are: Fear, road, and sin. Fear, as it is written: “My heart flutters, my strength fails me” road, as it is written: “He has weakened my strength on the road” Sin, as it is written: “My strength fails because of my sin”
llm_translation: Three things weaken a person's strength, and these are: fear, way, and sin. Fear - as it is written: "My heart throbs, my strength has forsaken me." Way - as it is written: "I am worn out on the way, my strength." Sin - as it is written: "My strength fails because of my iniquity."

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מַתִּיזִין גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אָכַל מְעוּמָּד, וְשָׁתָה מְעוּמָּד, וְשִׁימֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ מְעוּמָּד.
human_translation: Three things break a person’s body, and they are: ate standing, drank standing, and engaged in sexual intercourse standing.
llm_translation: Three things cause a person's body to deteriorate, and they are: eating while standing, drinking while standing, and relieving oneself while standing.

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה קְרוֹבִין לְמִיתָה יוֹתֵר מִן הַחַיִּים, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אָכַל וְעָמַד, שָׁתָה וְעָמַד, הִקִּיז דָּם וְעָמַד, יָשֵׁן וְעָמַד, שִׁימֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ וְעָמַד.
human_translation: five closer to death than life, and they are: ate and stood drank and stood let blood and stood slept and stood engaged in sexual intercourse and stood
llm_translation: Five close to death more than alive, and these are they: ate and stood, drank and stood, vomited blood and stood, slept and stood, had relations with his wife and stood.

hebrew_text: שִׁשָּׁה, הָעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן – מִיָּד מֵת, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַבָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְנִתְיַיגַּע, הִקִּיז דָּם, וְנִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ, וְשָׁתָה וְנִשְׁתַּכֵּר, וְיָשַׁן עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, וְשִׁימֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן כְּסִידְרָן.
human_translation: one who performs six them he dies immediately, and they are: one came from on the road and was exhausted, let blood, and entered the bathhouse, and drank and became intoxicated, and slept on the ground, and engaged in sexual intercourse, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: But he where he performs them in this order.
llm_translation: Six, one who does them - immediately dies, and these are they: one who comes on the road and becomes exhausted, spits blood, enters the bathhouse, drinks and becomes intoxicated, sleeps on the ground, and has relations with his wife. Rabbi Yochanan said: and this is if he did them in order.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּסִידְרָן – מֵת, שֶׁלֹּא כְּסִידְרָן – חָלֵישׁ. אִינִי?! וְהָא מְעוּרַת עֲבַדָה לֵיהּ לְעַבְדַּהּ תְּלָת מִינַּיְיהוּ, וּמִית! הָהוּא כָּחוּשׁ הֲוָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: in this order he will die. out of order he will become weak. Is that so? But didn’t Me’oret make her slave three of these and he died That was weak,
llm_translation: Abaye said: If they were arranged properly - he dies, if they were not arranged properly - he becomes weak. Is it not so?! But there was a case where they pierced his ear with three types of implements, and he died! That one was a weak person.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוֹנָה – רוּבָּן קָשֶׁה וּמִיעוּטָן יָפֶה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: דֶּרֶךְ, וְדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ, עוֹשֶׁר, וּמְלָאכָה, יַיִן, וְשֵׁינָה, חַמִּין, וְהַקָּזַת דָּם.
human_translation: Eight difficult in large and beneficial in small and they are: road, way of the world, wealth, work, wine, sleep, hot water, and bloodletting.
llm_translation: Eight - much difficult and little beautiful, and these are: way, and way of the land, wealth, and work, wine, and sleep, heat, and bloodshed.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוֹנָה מְמַעֲטִים אֶת הַזֶּרַע, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַמֶּלַח, וְהָרָעָב, וְהַנֶּתֶק, בְּכִיָּיה, וְשֵׁינָה עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, וְגֻדְגְּדָנִיּוֹת, וּכְשׁוּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ, וְהַקָּזַת דָּם לְמַטָּה – כִּפְלַיִם.
human_translation: Eight decrease the semen, and they are: Salt, hunger, netek , crying, sleeping on the ground, melilot and dodder not in its time, And bloodletting below, twice
llm_translation: Eight diminish the seed, and these are they: salt, famine, locust, weeping, sleep on the ground, gnats, a premature death, and bloodletting below - double.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁקָּשָׁה לְמַטָּה כִּפְלַיִם, כָּךְ יָפָה לְמַעְלָה – כִּפְלַיִם. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: taught: Just as below twice harm, so too, above, twice effective. Rav Pappa said:
llm_translation: Mishnah: Just as it is difficult below like two, so it is beautiful above - like two. Rav Papa said:

hebrew_text: לְמַטָּה – לְמַטָּה מִן הַבֵּיצִים, לְמַעְלָה – לְמַעְלָה מִן הַבֵּיצִים.
human_translation: below below the testicles, above above the testicles.
llm_translation: Below - below from the eggs, above - above from the eggs.

hebrew_text: וּכְשׁוּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ. תָּנָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁקָּשָׁה שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ, כָּךְ יָפָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: זְמַנָּהּ – תַּמּוּז, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ – טֵבֵת, יוֹמֵי נִיסָן וְיוֹמֵי תִּשְׁרֵי – לָא מְעַלּוּ וְלָא קָשׁוּ.
human_translation: And dodder not in its time, taught: Just as not in its time harmful so too, in its time, good Rav Pappa said: Its time Tammuz, not in its time Tevet, the days of Nisan, and the days of Tishrei, they neither help nor harm.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And when it is not in its proper time." It was taught: Just as it is difficult when it is not in its proper time, so too it is beautiful when it is in its proper time. Rav Papa said: Its proper time is Tamuz, when it is not in its proper time is Tevet, the days of Nissan and the days of Tishrei - neither too early nor too late.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״, וַאֲחָזוֹ קוּרְדְּיָיקוֹס, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר: ״אַל תִּכְתְּבוּ״ – אֵין דְּבָרָיו הָאַחֲרוֹנִים כְּלוּם. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין גֵּט לְאַלְתַּר. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין אֶלָּא לִכְשֶׁיִּשְׁתַּפֶּה.
human_translation: he said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, and was afflicted with insanity and he retracted and said: Do not write it, his latter statement nothing, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: writes and gives the bill of divorce immediately, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: write only once he is healed
llm_translation: He said: "Write a get for my wife," and he grabbed a Kordeikos, and he returned and said: "Do not write" - his latter words are nothing. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: One writes and gives a get immediately. And Rabbi Yochanan said: One only writes when he intends to give it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? דְּקָתָנֵי: אֵין בִּדְבָרָיו הָאַחֲרוֹנִים כְּלוּם. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לָךְ: אֵין בִּדְבָרָיו הָאַחֲרוֹנִים כְּלוּם – דִּלְכִי מִתְּצִיל לָא צְרִיךְ לְמִיהְדַּר אִימְּלוֹכֵי בֵּיהּ; וּלְעוֹלָם אֵין כּוֹתְבִין אֶלָּא לִכְשֶׁיִּשְׁתַּפֶּה.
human_translation: What is the reason of Reish Lakish? As it teaches His final statement nothing, Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you his final statement nothing that when becomes lucid not necessary to return and confirm But actually writes only once he is healed.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Reish Lakish? For it is taught: "His latter words are nothing." And Rabbi Yochanan said to you: "His latter words are nothing" - because if one can save, there is no need to retract; and one should always not write until he is appeased.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְיָשֵׁן, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְשׁוֹטֶה.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Reish Lakish compares to one who is sleeping. And Rabbi Yoḥanan compares him to an imbecile:
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Reish Lakish compares it to a sleeping person, and Rabbi Yochanan compares it to a fool.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן נָמֵי לִידַמְּיֵהּ לְיָשֵׁן! יָשֵׁן – לָא מְחוּסָּר מַעֲשֶׂה, הַאי – מְחוּסָּר מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan also could compare him to one who is sleeping, One who is sleeping is not lacking an action, This lacking an action
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan would doze off to sleep! Asleep - not lacking in action, this - lacking in action.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ נָמֵי נִידַמְּיֵיהּ לְשׁוֹטֶה! שׁוֹטֶה לָא סַמֵּיהּ בִּידַן, הַאי, סַמֵּיהּ בִּידַן – בִּישְׂרָא סוּמָּקָא אַגּוּמְרֵי, וְחַמְרָא מַרְקָא.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish could also compare him to an imbecile, there is no remedy in our possession an imbecile. this there is a remedy in our possession. red meat over coals and wine diluted
llm_translation: Reish Lakish before us appears like a fool! A fool is not trusted in our hands, this one, trusted in our hands - in Yisrael, a red strap is conclusive, and wine is diluted.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁחַט בּוֹ שְׁנַיִם, אוֹ רוֹב שְׁנַיִם, וְרָמַז וְאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ;
human_translation: But did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this, But didn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel says: slit two or the majority of two and signaled and stated Write a bill of divorce for my wife, those should write and give
llm_translation: And who said it, Rabbi Yochanan thus?! But didn't Rabbi Yehuda say in the name of Shmuel: If one slaughters it twice, or the majority of it twice, and hints and says, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," – behold, these may be written and given.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: רָאוּהוּ מְגוּיָּד אוֹ צָלוּב עַל הַצְּלִיבָה, וְרָמַז וְאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ!
human_translation: And it was taught they saw severed or crucified on a cross, and he signaled and stated: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, those should write and give
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: If one saw him being hanged or crucified on the cross, and he hinted and said: "Write a bill of divorce for my wife" - behold, these shall be written and given!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם דַּעְתָּא צִילּוּתָא הִיא, וּכְחִישׁוּתָא הוּא דְּאַתְחִילָה בֵּיהּ; הָכָא דַּעְתָּא שְׁגִישְׁתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, his mind is lucid, but he has begun weakness here, his mind is confused,
llm_translation: So now?! There, it is a matter of precaution, and it is a matter of concealment that one should start with it; here, it is a matter of proximity that one should bring close.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁחַט בּוֹ שְׁנַיִם אוֹ רוֹב שְׁנַיִם, וּבָרַח – מְעִידִין עָלָיו. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חַי הוּא, אַמַּאי מְעִידִין עָלָיו?
human_translation: But did Shmuel say this, But didn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel says: slit two in or the majority of two and fled they may testify with regard to him And if it enters your mind is alive why can testify with regard to him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Samuel?! And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Samuel: If one slaughters it twice or the majority of it, and it escapes - they testify against him. And if you think he is still alive, why do they testify against him?"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: חַי הוּא – וְסוֹפוֹ לָמוּת.
human_translation: says he is alive but ultimately die
llm_translation: They said: "He is alive - and his end is to die."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, יְהֵא גּוֹלֶה עַל יָדוֹ! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: שָׁחַט בּוֹ שְׁנַיִם אוֹ רוֹב שְׁנַיִם – הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה?
human_translation: If that is so, should be exiled on his account why is it taught he slit two in or the majority of two, this is not exiled?
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, let it be rolled by his hand! But why is it taught: If two slaughtered it, or the majority of two slaughtered it - this one does not roll?

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא הָרוּחַ בִּלְבְּלַתּוּ. אִי נָמֵי, הוּא קֵירַב אֶת מִיתָתוֹ.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rabbi Hoshaya says: We are concerned that perhaps the wind made him senseless, Or also he, brought his death closer
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: If it was said about him, Rabbi Hoshaya said: We are concerned that perhaps the wind confused him. Alternatively, he brought about his own death.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּשַׁחְטֵיהּ בְּבֵיתָא דְשֵׁישָׁא, וּפַירְכֵּס. אִי נָמֵי, דְּשַׁחְטֵיהּ בְּבָרָא, וְלָא פַּירְכֵּס.
human_translation: What is between between is if he slit his in a marble house and convulsed. Alternatively, he slit his outside and did not convulse.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between slaughtering it in a marble house and a stone house. If you say it is also when he slaughters it in a pit, and not a stone house.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּתֵּק, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״נִכְתּוֹב גֵּט לְאִשְׁתְּךָ״ כּוּ׳. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא שִׁיחְיָא דְּ״לָאו לָאו״ נַקְטֵיהּ, אִי נָמֵי שִׁיחְיָא דְּ״הֵן הֵן״ נַקְטֵיהּ!
human_translation: became mute, and said to him: we will write a bill of divorce for your wife? But let a concern that perhaps the movement of: No, no, took hold of him, Alternatively, the movement of: Yes, yes, took hold of him?
llm_translation: He was released, and they said to him: "A get should be written for your wife." And be concerned that perhaps the language of "no" was taken, or perhaps the language of "yes" was taken!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ בְּסֵירוּגִין.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: that we, say alternating to him,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: As we say to him in Seirugin.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא שִׁיחְיָא דְּסֵירוּגִין נַקְטֵיהּ! דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ חַד ״לָאו״ וּתְרֵין ״הֵן״, וּתְרֵין ״לָאו״ וְחַד ״הֵן״.
human_translation: But let a concern that perhaps alternating movements took hold of him, that we, say to him no once and yes twice, and twice no and one yes.
llm_translation: And be concerned lest perhaps the conversation of the Sages was taken! For we say to him one "no" and two "yes," and two "no" and one "yes."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: אוֹמְרִים לוֹ דְּבָרִים שֶׁל יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, וְשֶׁל יְמוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: says to him matters of the summer in the rainy season, and of the rainy season in the summer,
llm_translation: In the academy of Rabbi Yishmael it was taught: They say to him words of the days of the sun in the days of the rain, and of the days of the rain in the days of the sun.

hebrew_text: מַאי נִיהוּ? אִילֵּימָא גְּלוּפְקְרֵי וּסְדִינֵי – לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא קוֹרָא אַחְדֵּיהּ, אִי נָמֵי חַמָּה אַחְדֵּיהּ!
human_translation: What are these If we say coat sheet Let a concern perhaps he has the chills Alternatively, the heat afflicted him
llm_translation: What is it? If you say "rolled up scrolls and linen garments" - there is concern that perhaps one will read by mistake, or perhaps one will expose it to the sun!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּפֵירֵי.
human_translation: Rather, with produce
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of fruits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: חֵרֵשׁ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְדַבֵּר מִתּוֹךְ הַכְּתָב, כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: נִשְׁתַּתֵּק, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״נִכְתּוֹב גֵּט לְאִשְׁתְּךָ?״ וְהִרְכִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ, בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּעָמִים, אִם אָמַר עַל לָאו – ״לָאו״, וְעַל הֵן – ״הֵן״, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says Rav says: a deaf-mute who can express through writing, write and give a bill of divorce to his wife Rav Yosef said: What is he teaching us? We learned became mute, and said to him: we write a bill of divorce for your wife, and he nodded his head they examine him three times. If he responded to a negative No, and to a positive Yes, they shall write and give
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rav: A deaf-mute who can speak through writing, we write and give a bill of divorce to his wife. Rav Yosef said: What does this imply to us? We learned: He became disconnected, and they said to him, "Should we write a bill of divorce for your wife?" And he nodded his head, they examine him three times, if he said regarding a negative commandment – "no," and regarding affirmative commandments – "yes," then these should be written and given.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: אִלֵּם קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי אִלֵּם – דְּתַנְיָא: מְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ – זֶהוּ חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר – זֶהוּ אִלֵּם, וְזֶה וָזֶה הֲרֵי הֵן כְּפִקְחִין לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to him: A mute, you say? A mute is different As it is taught who speaks but cannot hear, this is a deaf person. who hears but cannot speak, this is a mute person, and this and that are like competent with regard to all their matters.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Zeira: Are you saying mute? Different is mute - as it was taught: One who speaks but does not hear - this is a deaf person, one who hears but does not speak - this is a mute, and both of them are considered competent for all their matters.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דִּמְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ זֶהוּ חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר זֶהוּ אִלֵּם? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲנִי כְחֵרֵשׁ לֹא אֶשְׁמָע וּכְאִלֵּם לֹא יִפְתַּח פִּיו״. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִישְׁתְּקִיל מִילּוּלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And from where that who speaks but cannot hear, this is a deaf person, who hears but cannot speak, this is a mute person? As it is written: “And I am like a deaf man, I do not hear, and like the mute man who will not open his mouth” And if you wish, say as people say: his speech has been taken [ ishtakil millulei ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from what is the case of one who speaks but does not hear, this is a deaf person; and one who hears but does not speak, this is a mute? As it is written: "But as for me, like a deaf man, I do not hear, and I am like a mute who does not open his mouth." And if you wish, say, as people say: His words are weighty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אִי קַשְׁיָא לִי – הָא קַשְׁיָא לִי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִם לֹא יַגִּיד״ – פְּרָט לְאִלֵּם, שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַגִּיד. אַמַּאי? הָא יָכוֹל לְהַגִּיד מִתּוֹךְ הַכְּתָב!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: If difficult for me, this difficult for me, as it is taught “If he does not utter to exclude a mute who is unable to utter Why but he is able to utter through writing?
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: If it is difficult for me - behold, it is difficult for me, as it was taught: "If he does not tell" - excluding the mute, who cannot tell. Why? Because he can tell from within the writing!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: עֵדוּת קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי עֵדוּת, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״מִפִּיהֶם״ – וְלֹא מִפִּי כְתָבָם.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: You say testimony? Testimony is different, as the Merciful One states: “From their mouths” and not from their writing.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Testimony you are saying? Differing testimony, for the Merciful One said: "From their mouths" - and not from their writings.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ לְגִיטִּין, כָּךְ בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ לְמַשָּׂאוֹת, וּלְמַתָּנוֹת, וּלְעֵדִיּוֹת, וְלִירוּשּׁוֹת. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת – ״עֵדִיּוֹת״!
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection Just as investigate him, with regard to bills of divorce, so too, investigate him with regard to business testimonies, and inheritances. In any event it teaches: Testimonies,
llm_translation: Challenger: Just as we examine him for divorces, so do we examine him for levirate marriages, and for gifts, and for testimonies, and for inheritances. The response is from the latter: "testimonies"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בְּעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה, דַּאֲקִילּוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Sheshet said: to testimony a woman as the Sages were lenient with her
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Sheshet: In the testimony of a woman, the Rabbis were lenient with her.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי: ״יְרוּשּׁוֹת״! אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: יְרוּשַּׁת בְּנוֹ הַבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught: Inheritances. Rabbi Abbahu said: the inheritance of his firstborn son,
llm_translation: And this was taught: "Yerushot"! Rabbi Avahu said: The inheritance of his firstborn son.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת – ״לְמַשָּׂאוֹת וּלְמַתָּנוֹת״, מַאי, לָאו לְעָלְמָא? לָא, לְדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: In any event it teaches With regard to business what, does it not for everyone No, for himself
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught from there - 'for lifting and for giving as gifts,' what is this, is it not for the world? No, for his own sake."
