hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חֵרֵשׁ, לֹא הָלְכוּ בּוֹ אַחַר רְמִיזוֹתָיו וְאַחַר קְפִיצוֹתָיו וְאַחַר כְּתַב יָדוֹ, אֶלָּא בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין; אֲבָל לֹא לְגִיטִּין.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection a deaf-mute, follow his signals, and follow the movement and follow his handwriting only movable property but not for bills of divorce.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: A deaf-mute – they did not walk after his hints, after his jumps, or after his handwritings, rather they communicate with him through gestures; but not with documents.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא – דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּחֵרֵשׁ מֵעִיקָּרוֹ, אֲבָל פִּיקֵּחַ וְנִתְחָרֵשׁ – הוּא כּוֹתֵב וְהֵן חוֹתְמִין.
human_translation: It is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? in of a deaf-mute from the outset, competent, but became a deaf-mute he may write and they, sign,
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita - as it was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? In the case of a deaf-mute from birth, but a wise person who became deaf-mute - he may write and they may sign.

hebrew_text: וְחֵרֵשׁ מֵעִיקָּרוֹ – לֹא?! כְּשֵׁם שֶׁכּוֹנְסָהּ בִּרְמִיזָה, כָּךְ מוֹצִיאָהּ בִּרְמִיזָה!
human_translation: And deaf-mute from the outset cannot just as he marries her with intimation, so too, he divorces her with intimation.
llm_translation: "And a deaf person from the outset - not?! Just as she enters with a hint, so too she may leave with a hint!"

hebrew_text: אִי בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ, הָכִי נָמֵי; הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בִּיבִמְתּוֹ.
human_translation: If to his wife, indeed with what are we dealing here? With his yevama ,
llm_translation: If it is with his wife, thus it is stated; here, with what are we dealing? - with yibum.

hebrew_text: יְבִמְתּוֹ מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ מֵאָחִיו חֵרֵשׁ – כְּשֵׁם שֶׁכְּנִיסָתָהּ בִּרְמִיזָה, כָּךְ יְצִיאָתָהּ בִּרְמִיזָה! אֶלָּא דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ מֵאָחִיו פִּיקֵּחַ.
human_translation: His yevama from whom? If we say that she fell to him from his brother a deaf-mute, just as her marriage through intimation, so too, her divorce through intimation. Rather, that she fell to him from his competent brother.
llm_translation: His yevamah from whom? If you say that she fell to him from his brother who is deaf - just as she entered through a hint, so too her departure is through a hint! Rather, if she fell to him from his brother who is intelligent.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ מֵאָחִיו חֵרֵשׁ, וּגְזֵירָה אָחִיו חֵרֵשׁ אַטּוּ אָחִיו פִּיקֵּחַ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, that she fell to him from his deaf-mute brother, and decree from his deaf-mute brother due to his competent brother.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Indeed, that he fell from his brother, a deaf person, and the decree his brother, a deaf person, then his brother is intelligent.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אִשְׁתּוֹ נָמֵי! יְבִמְתּוֹ בִּיבִמְתּוֹ מִיחַלְּפָא, אִשְׁתּוֹ בִּיבִמְתּוֹ לָא מִיחַלְּפָא.
human_translation: If so, his wife as well, His yevama be confused with his yevama would not confuse his wife with his yevama .
llm_translation: If so, his wife is also considered! His yevamah with his yevamah is interchangeable, his wife with his yevamah is not interchangeable.

hebrew_text: וּמִי גָּזְרִינַן חֵרֵשׁ אַטּוּ פִּיקֵּחַ?!
human_translation: And do we, decree deaf-mute due to competent
llm_translation: And who decreed a deaf-mute as a Pikach?!

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: שְׁנֵי אַחִין חֵרְשִׁין – נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת פִּיקְּחוֹת, אוֹ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת חֵרְשׁוֹת, אוֹ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת אַחַת פִּיקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת; וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת חֵרְשׁוֹת – נְשׂוּאוֹת לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין פִּיקְּחִין, אוֹ לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין חֵרְשִׁין, אוֹ לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין אֶחָד פִּיקֵּחַ וְאֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרוֹת מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּבּוּם.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn two deaf-mute brothers, married two competent sisters, or two deaf-mute sisters, or two sisters, one competent and one a deaf-mute; and similarly, two deaf-mute sisters, married to two competent brothers, or to two deaf-mute brothers, or to two brothers, one competent and one a deaf-mute; these are exempt from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Two brothers who are deaf - married two sisters who are capable of engaging in levirate marriage, or two sisters who are deaf, or two sisters, one capable of engaging in levirate marriage and one deaf; and likewise, two sisters who are deaf - married to two brothers, one capable of engaging in levirate marriage and one deaf, or to two deaf brothers, or to two brothers, one capable of engaging in levirate marriage and one deaf - these are exempt from halitzah and from levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיוּ נׇכְרִיּוֹת, יִכָּנְסוּ; וְאִם רָצוּ לְהוֹצִיאָן – יוֹצִיאוּ.
human_translation: And if they were unrelated women may marry them and if they wanted to divorce them they may divorce
llm_translation: And if they were gentile women, they may enter; and if they wish to leave - let them leave.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rather, it is clear as we initially answered,
llm_translation: Rather, Mechavvarta as we say from the outset.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲלוּקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵירָיו עַל רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The colleagues of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel disagree with him,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: His colleagues disagreed with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: נִישַּׁטֵּת, לֹא יוֹצִיא. נִתְחָרֵשׁ הוּא אוֹ נִשְׁתַּטָּה – לֹא יוֹצִיא עוֹלָמִית. מַאי ״עוֹלָמִית״? לָאו – אַף עַל גַּב דְּיָכוֹל לְדַבֵּר מִתּוֹךְ הַכְּתָב?
human_translation: Abaye said we, too, learn became an imbecile must not divorce became a deaf-mute or an imbecile he can never divorce her, What never Isn’t even though he can communicate through writing,
llm_translation: Abaye said, "We also learned: If it is bent, do not take it out. If it became dull or was blunted - do not take it out permanently." What is meant by 'permanently'? Is it not - even though it could speak from within the Scripture?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי לָאו דְּאַשְׁמְעִינַן רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְפָרוֹשֵׁי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא הוּא דַּאֲתָא; וּמַאי ״עוֹלָמִית״? אַף עַל גַּב דַּחֲזֵינָא לֵיהּ דְּחָרִיף.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: If not Rabbi Yoḥanan teaches us I would say Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel comes to explain the reason the first tanna , And what never? even though I see that he is sharp
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If we did not hear this teaching from Rabbi Yochanan, I would have said it was Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who came to explain the reasoning of the Mishnah. And what is "eternal"? Even though we see that it is sharp.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, לְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, שׁוֹטָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת – מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַפִּיקַּחַת בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
human_translation: Alternatively, in accordance with of Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: By Torah law an imbecile may be divorced just as it is competent woman against her will.
llm_translation: If you wish, according to Rabbi Yitzchak - for Rabbi Yitzchak said: A matter of Torah, a fool separates from it - immediately it becomes an unwanted possession against its will.

hebrew_text: וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ אֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת – שֶׁלֹּא יִנְהֲגוּ בָּהּ מִנְהַג הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: And what the reason said she may not be divorced? that she will not be treated as ownerless property.
llm_translation: And what is the reason they said she does not get divorced - because they do not conduct with her the practice of hefker.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״נִכְתּוֹב גֵּט לְאִשְׁתֶּךָ?״ וְאָמַר לָהֶן: ״כְּתוֹבוּ״; אָמְרוּ לַסּוֹפֵר וְכָתַב, וְלָעֵדִים וְחָתְמוּ; אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכְּתָבוּהוּ וַחֲתָמוּהוּ וּנְתָנוּהוּ לוֹ, וְחָזַר וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – הֲרֵי הַגֵּט בָּטֵל, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לַסּוֹפֵר ״כְּתוֹב״ וְלָעֵדִים ״חֲתוֹמוּ״.
human_translation: said to Shall we write a bill of divorce for your wife? And he said to them: Write told the scribe and he wrote and the witnesses and they signed even if they wrote it, and signed it, and gave it to him, and he then gave it to the bill of divorce is void unless he says to the scribe: Write and to the witnesses: Sign
llm_translation: They taught him: "Is it written a bill of divorce for your wife?" And he said to them: "Write." They said to the scribe, and he wrote, and to the witnesses, and they signed; even though he wrote it, and they signed it, and gave it to him, and he then gave it to her - behold, the bill of divorce is nullified, until he says to the scribe "Write" and to the witnesses "Sign."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּלֹא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״, הָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – נוֹתְנִין, מַנִּי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִילֵּי מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: The reason because he did not say: Give But he said Give give whose It is Rabbi Meir, who says: directives can be delegated to an agent.
llm_translation: The taste of not saying "give," but saying "give" - we give, who is the authority? It is Rabbi Meir, as he said: matters entrusted to an agent.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לַסּוֹפֵר כְּתוֹב וְלָעֵדִים חֲתוֹמוּ״ – אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: מִילֵּי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: Say the latter clause unless he says to the scribe: Write and to the witnesses: Sign we arrive at Rabbi Yosei, who said: directives cannot be delegated to an agent.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: 'Ad sheyomar la'sofer k'tov v'la'edim chatumim" - atan l'Rabbi Yosei, de'amar: milei la mimasran l'shalich. English translation: "The reason for the conclusion: 'Until he says to the scribe, write, and to the witnesses, sign' - they came to Rabbi Yosei, who said: matters were not handed over to an agent."

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי?! אִין, רֵישָׁא רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: the first clause Rabbi Meir and the latter clause Rabbi Yosei? Yes, the first clause Rabbi Meir and the latter clause Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: The beginning: Rabbi Meir, and the end: Rabbi Yosei?! No, the beginning: Rabbi Meir, and the end: Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כּוּלָּהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּלָא אֲמַר ״תְּנוּ״. אִי הָכִי, ״עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר תְּנוּ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said: its entirety is Rabbi Meir. And with what are we dealing here? whereby did not say: Give If so, should have unless he says: Give
llm_translation: Abaye said: The entire argument is that of Rabbi Meir, and here we are dealing with what? - that he did not say "teach." If so, it is necessary "until he says 'teach'"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּלָא אֲמַר לְבֵי תְלָתָא. אִי הָכִי, ״עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לִשְׁלֹשָׁה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, with what are we dealing here? whereby did not say to three If so, should have said: Unless he says to three
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with what? - that he did not say to three. If so, "until he says to three" is required for it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּלָא אֲמַר ״אִמְרוּ״.
human_translation: Rather, its entirety is Rabbi Yosei, and with what are we dealing here? whereby did not say Say
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety is Rabbi Yosei, and here we are dealing with what? - that he did not say "say."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר אִמְרוּ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, Until he says should have tell.
llm_translation: "If so, 'until it is said, say' - what does he require?"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, מִי מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאוֹמֵר: ״אִמְרוּ״?! וְהָתְנַן: ״כָּתַב סוֹפֵר וְעֵד – כָּשֵׁר״; וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: ״חָתַם סוֹפֵר״ שָׁנִינוּ. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי –
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yosei concede in one who says: Tell But didn’t we learn the writing of a scribe, and witness valid And Rabbi Yirmeya said: We learned the scribe’s signature And Rav Ḥisda said: Whose mishna?
llm_translation: And furthermore, who does Rabbi Yosei agree with when he says: "Say"?! And we learned in a Mishnah: "If a scribe wrote and an witness signed - it is valid"; and Rabbi Yirmeya said: "If a scribe sealed" we have learned. And Rav Ḥisda said: I hold like the Mishnah -

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִילֵּי לָא מִימַּסְרָן לְשָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Yosei, who says: directives cannot be delegated to an agent,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, he said: matters not entrusted to an agent.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאוֹמֵר ״אִמְרוּ״, נָפֵיק מִינַּהּ חוּרְבָּא – דְּזִימְנִין דְּאָמַר לְהוּ לִשְׁנַיִם ״אִמְרוּ לְסוֹפֵר וְיִכְתּוֹב, וְלִפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְיַחְתֹּמוּ״; וּמִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא דְּסוֹפֵר – חָיְישִׁי וּמַחְתְּמִי לֵיהּ, וּבַעַל לָא אֲמַר הָכִי.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Rabbi Yosei concedes in says: Tell a pitfall will result from it. As sometimes, that one said to two Tell a scribe and he will write and so-and-so and so-and-so and they will sign And due to the shame of the scribe, are concerned and have one of those witnesses and the scribe sign together with him, and the husband did not say so.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind, Rabbi Yosei concedes by saying "say," a sword emerges from it - sometimes he would say to two people, "Say to the scribe and let him write, and to so-and-so and so-and-so and let them sign"; and due to the suspicion of the scribe - he would be cautious and sign it, but the husband did not say so.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא, רֵישָׁא רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rather, it is clear the first clause Rabbi Meir and the latter clause Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Rather, Mechavvarta. The beginning, Rabbi Meir, and the end, Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִבַּעְיָא הֵיכָא דְּלָא אֲמַר ״תְּנוּ״, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אֲמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – לָא. וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא הֵיכָא דְּלָא אֲמַר לְבֵי תְלָתָא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אֲמַר לְבֵי תְּלָתָא – לָא. וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא הֵיכָא דְּלָא אֲמַר ״אִמְרוּ״, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אֲמַר ״אִמְרוּ״ – נָמֵי לָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said its entirety is Rabbi Yosei, and it is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary where he did not say Give rather, even he said Give not And it is not necessary where did not say to three rather, even he said to three no, And it is not necessary where did not say Say but even he said: Say also not
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The entire statement is attributed to Rabbi Yosei, and he is not asking a question. This means not in a case where he did not say "teach," but even if he did say "teach" - no. And not in a case where he did not say to three people, but even if he said to three - no. And not in a case where he did not say "say," but even if he said "say" - also no.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: כָּתַב סוֹפֵר לִשְׁמָהּ וְחָתְמוּ עֵדִים לִשְׁמָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכְּתָבוּהוּ וַחֲתָמוּהוּ וּנְתָנוּהוּ לוֹ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ – הֲרֵי הַגֵּט בָּטֵל, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ קוֹלוֹ שֶׁיֹּאמַר לַסּוֹפֵר ״כְּתוֹב״ וְלָעֵדִים ״חֲתוֹמוּ״.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Ashi the scribe wrote for her sake and the witnesses signed it for her sake even though they wrote it, and they signed it, and they gave it to and he gave it to the bill of divorce is void until they hear voice when he says to the scribe: Write and to the witnesses: Sign
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ashi: If a scribe wrote a bill of divorce for her name and witnesses signed it for her name, even though he wrote it, signed it, gave it to him, and he gave it to her - the divorce document is nullified until his voice is heard saying to the scribe, "Write," and to the witnesses, "Sign."

hebrew_text: ״יִשְׁמְעוּ״ – לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמַּאן דְּאָמַר, מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאוֹמֵר: ״אִמְרוּ״. ״קוֹלוֹ״ – לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב כָּהֲנָא אֲמַר רַב.
human_translation: they hear, to exclude the one who said: Rabbi Yosei concedes in says: Say His voice, to exclude that which Rav Kahana Rav says,
llm_translation: "Yishme'u" - to counter the opinion of the one who said, Rabbi Yosei agrees by saying: "Imru." "Kolo" - to counter the opinion of Rav Kahana said Rav.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ אִם מַתִּי״; ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״; ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. ״מֵהַיּוֹם אִם מַתִּי״; ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו אִם מַתִּי״ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce if I die, This is your bill of divorce from this illness, This is your bill of divorce after death, he said nothing, from today if I die, from now if I die, this is bill of divorce,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Matni 'zeh gitikh im mati"; "zeh gitikh mehochi zeh"; "zeh gitikh le'achar mita" - lo amar kelum. "Mehayom im mati"; "me'achshav im mati" - harei zeh get.

hebrew_text: ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – גֵּט וְאֵינוֹ גֵּט; וְאִם מֵת – חוֹלֶצֶת, וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: from today and after death, bill of divorce or not bill of divorce. And if he dies perform ḥalitza , But she may not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: "From the day and after death" - a get and it is not a get; and if he dies - she performs ḥalitza, and does not perform yibum.

hebrew_text: ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ מֵהַיּוֹם, אִם מַתִּי מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״, וְעָמַד וְהָלַךְ בַּשּׁוּק, וְחָלָה וָמֵת – אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ, אִם מֵחֲמַת חוֹלִי הָרִאשׁוֹן מֵת – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce from today if I die from this illness, and he arose and walked in the market, but became ill and died, assesses him. If he died because of the first illness this is bill of divorce, but if not, it is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: "This is your bill of divorce from this day, if I die from this illness." And he stood up and walked in the marketplace, and he fell ill and died - they examine him; if he died due to the first illness - this is a divorce document, and if not - it is not a divorce document."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַלְמָא ״אִם מַתִּי״ כִּ״לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ דָּמֵי, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: ״מֵהַיּוֹם אִם מַתִּי״; ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו אִם מַתִּי״ – אַלְמָא ״אִם מַתִּי״ לָאו כִּ״לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Apparently, If I die, considered like after death. And afterward teaches: from today if I die, from now if I die, Apparently, If I die, not considered like after death.
llm_translation: Gemara: Why does it say "if he dies" after death, the money, and then it teaches: "from today if he dies"; "from now if he dies" - this means "if he dies" is not like "after death"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״אִם מַתִּי״ – שְׁתֵּי לְשׁוֹנוֹת מַשְׁמַע; מַשְׁמַע כְּמֵעַכְשָׁיו, וּמַשְׁמַע כִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה;
human_translation: Abaye said: If I die, indicates two meanings. indicates as From now, And indicates as After death,
llm_translation: Abaye said: "If 'when' - two languages imply; implies like now, and implies after death."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ ״מֵהַיּוֹם״ – כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לָהּ ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי, לֹא אָמַר לָהּ ״מֵהַיּוֹם״ – כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לָהּ ״לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: said to From today considered like one who says to her: From now, he did not say to her: From today, considered like one who says to her: After death,
llm_translation: He said to her, "From today" - like one who says to her "from now" it is similar, he did not say to her "from today" - like one who says to her "after death" it is similar.

hebrew_text: ״זֶה גִּיטֵּךְ אִם מַתִּי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְחוֹלֶצֶת.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce if I die, he said nothing. Rav Huna says: But perform ḥalitza
llm_translation: "This is your bill of divorce if you die" - he did not say anything. Rav Huna said: And she shall depart.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם״ קָתָנֵי! לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם – דַּאֲסִירָא לְעָלְמָא; וּלְיָבָם נָמֵי אֲסִירָא.
human_translation: But isn’t he said nothing, taught he said nothing she is forbidden to everyone And she is also forbidden to the yavam
llm_translation: And this, "he did not say anything," is taught! He did not say anything - that it is prohibited forever; and to a yavam also it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּסֵיפָא חוֹלֶצֶת, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא יַבּוֹמֵי נָמֵי מִיַּבְּמָה! מַתְנִיתִין כְּרַבָּנַן;
human_translation: But since the latter clause she perform ḥalitza , by inference that the first clause she may also enter into levirate marriage, the mishna is in accordance the Rabbis
llm_translation: And this from the end, a garment, from the general principle of the beginning, the yevamot of the sea, from yevamah! Mishnah according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו.
human_translation: But Rav Huna that he said is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says The date in a document proves it
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi Yosei, who said: "The time of a document proves it."

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, חֲלִיצָה נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְעֵי! וְכִי תֵּימָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא אִי הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי; וּמִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: If Rabbi Yosei should also not require ḥalitza , And if you would say Rav Huna is uncertain if the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei or the halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, But is uncertain?
llm_translation: If Rabbi Yosei, a ḥalitza is not required! And if you will say, let Rav Huna be in doubt whether the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei or not like Rabbi Yosei; who is in doubt?!

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ חֲלַשׁ, עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב הוּנָא וְרַב נַחְמָן; אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַב נַחְמָן, בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לָא יָדַעְנָא, הֲלָכָה אֶיבְעֵי מִינֵּיהּ?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ הֲלָכָה, וְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֲנָא אָמֵינָא לָךְ.
human_translation: But when Rabba bar Avuh was ill Rav Huna and Rav Naḥman entered him. Rav Huna said to Rav Naḥman: Ask of him, Rabba bar Avuh: the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei or the halakha not said to I do not know the reason by Rabbi Yosei, you ask me halakha ? said to You ask him halakha , and I will tell you the reason by Rabbi Yosei
llm_translation: Rabah bar Avuh became weak, Rav Huna and Rav Nachman went to visit him. Rav Huna said to Rav Nachman, "Inquire from Rabah bar Avuh: Is the halakha like Rabbi Yosei, or not?" He replied, "I do not know the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, does the halakha require his reasoning?!" He said to him, "You inquire about the halakha, and I will tell you the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אֲמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. לְבָתַר דִּנְפַק אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – דְּקָסָבַר: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו! אֶלָּא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ
human_translation: asked of said to him: So said Rav: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. After he left said to This is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, as he holds: The date in a document proves it Rather, is uncertain
llm_translation: He asked him. He said to him, thus said Rav: the halacha is like Rabbi Yosei. After he went out, he said to him: this is the reason of Rabbi Yosei - for he holds: his appointed time of a document testifies for him! Rather, he is in doubt.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּעַל פֶּה, אִי לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: if Rabbi Yosei says a verbal if does not say
llm_translation: If Rabbi Yosei said it orally, if not, he did not say it.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ?! וְהָתְנַן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: רַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּהָ לְהִינָּשֵׁא.
human_translation: But is uncertain But didn’t we learn This is hereby your bill of divorce if I have not come from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, it is not bill of divorce And it is taught with regard to Our Rabbis they permitted her to marry,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is in doubt about it?! And we learned: 'Here is your bill of divorce, if I do not come back from here until twelve months,' and if he dies within twelve months - it is not a bill of divorce. And it was taught about it: Our Rabbis permitted her to marry."

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאן רַבּוֹתֵינוּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בֵּי דִינָא דִּשְׁרוֹ מִישְׁחָא; וְסָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו.
human_translation: And we say: Who our Rabbis? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: the court that permitted oil and they hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says: The date in a document proves it
llm_translation: And we say: Who are our teachers? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The court of Shira from Yishcha; and they hold like Rabbi Yosei, who said: The time of a document proves it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּעַל פֶּה, אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה.
human_translation: Rather, is uncertain if halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei a verbal or halakha not
llm_translation: Rather, it is a question for him: whether the halakha follows Rabbi Yosei Baal Peh, or it does not follow the halakha.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ?! וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ אִם מַתִּי״ וְ״שֶׁאֲנִי מֵת״ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. ״כְּשֶׁאָמוּת״ וּ״לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – אֵין זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: But is uncertain But didn’t Rava say: This is hereby your bill of divorce if I die, or: when I am dead, this is bill of divorce? When I die, After death, this is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is in doubt about it?! And Rava said: 'Here is your bill of divorce if I die' and 'when I die' – this is a bill of divorce. 'When I die' and 'after my death' – this is not a bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵימָא דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״מֵהַיּוֹם״, וְרַבָּנַן; צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר?! וְהָתְנַן: ״מֵהַיּוֹם אִם מַתִּי״ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט! וְאֶלָּא לָאו דְּלָא אָמַר לַהּ ״מֵהַיּוֹם״, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say that he said to her: from today and the Rabbis, necessary be said by Rava, But didn’t we learn from today if I die, it is bill of divorce? But rather, is it not where he did not say From today, and Rabbi Yosei? Conclude from it halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: How are the laws of the divorce document? If you say that he said to her "from today," and the Rabbis; is it necessary to say?! But we learned: "from today if he dies" - this is a valid divorce document! Rather, isn't it that he did not say to her "from today," and Rabbi Yosei? Learn from it that the halacha follows Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: לְרָבָא פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, לְרַב הוּנָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: It is obvious to Rava But to Rav Huna, is uncertain
llm_translation: To Rava it is obvious, to Rav Huna it is uncertain.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם דַּאֲמַר לַהּ ״מֵהַיּוֹם״ – וְרַבָּנַן, וְהָנֵי לִישָּׁנֵי אִיצְטְרִיכִי לֵיהּ: ״שֶׁאֲנִי מֵת״ – כְּ״אִם מַתִּי״ דָּמֵי; ״כְּשֶׁאָמוּת״ – כִּ״לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, where he said to her: from today, and the Rabbis. And it was necessary for these expressions When I am dead, considered like If I die. When I die, considered like After death.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always that he said to her "from today" - and the sages, and those who are old, it is necessary for him: "that I am dying" - like "if I die" it is similar; "when I die" - it is similar to "after death."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ לְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וּלְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, חוֹלֶצֶת.
human_translation: And there are those who teach with regard to the latter clause This is your bill of divorce after death, he said nothing. Rav Huna says: But to the statement of Rabbi Yosei she must perform ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there are those who teach in the latter part: "This is your bill of divorce after death" - he did not say anything. Rav Huna said: According to the words of Rabbi Yosei, she may perform halitzah.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, מִדְּסֵיפָא – לְרַבָּנַן חוֹלֶצֶת, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי – לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי חוֹלֶצֶת!
human_translation: is obvious. Since in the latter clause according to the Rabbis she must perform ḥalitza the first clause as well, according to Rabbi Yosei she must perform ḥalitza
llm_translation: The straightforward conclusion is: from the latter part - according to the Rabbis it exempts, from the beginning - according to Rabbi Yosei it exempts!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּהָא כְּרַבִּי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ – דְּאָמַר: גִּיטָּא מְעַלְּיָא הָוֵי, וַחֲלִיצָה נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְעֵי; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא רַבִּי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: lest you say with regard to this, Rabbi Yosei holds in accordance with Rabbi who says: It is a proper bill of divorce, and she is not even required to perform ḥalitza . teaches us that Rabbi does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yosei does not hold in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reasoning? Rabbi Yosei in this case is of the opinion like Rabbi Sevira - for he said: A divorce document is effective above, but halitzah is not required below; we infer from this that Rabbi does not hold like Rabbi Sevira, and Rabbi Yosei does not hold like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – דְּקָתָנֵי: ״כָּזֶה – גֵּט״, לְמַעוֹטֵי דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי; וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי – דְּקָתָנֵי: ״כָּזֶה – גֵּט״, לְמַעוֹטֵי דְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as it teaches like this bill of divorce to exclude of Rabbi Yosei, And Rabbi Yosei did not hold in accordance with Rabbi as it teaches like this bill of divorce, to exclude of Rabbi
llm_translation: Rabbi does not hold like Rabbi Yosei - as it was taught: "such - a bill of divorce," to exclude the opinion of Rabbi Yosei; and Rabbi Yosei does not hold like Rabbi - as it was taught: "such - a bill of divorce," to exclude the opinion of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – גֵּט וְאֵינוֹ גֵּט, דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים; רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה – גֵּט.
human_translation: What is Rabbi As it is taught from today and after death, it is a bill of divorce or it is not a bill of divorce, the statement of the Rabbis. Rabbi says: like this bill of divorce
llm_translation: Rabbi, what is it? For it was taught: "From the day and onwards after death" - a bill of divorce and it is not a bill of divorce, the words of the Sages; Rabbi says: like this - a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַאי הִיא? דִּתְנַן: ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי, אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִיכָּן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, כְּתָבוּהוּ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ וּנְתָנוּהוּ לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט; רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה – גֵּט.
human_translation: What is Rabbi Yosei? As we learned Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife if I have not come from now until twelve months, wrote within twelve months and gave after twelve months, it is not bill of divorce. Rabbi Yosei says: A case like this bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, what is it? As we learned: "Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife, if I do not return from here until twelve months," if they wrote it within twelve months and gave it to another after twelve months - it is not a bill of divorce; Rabbi Yosei says: Such a document is a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ מֵהַיּוֹם, אִם מַתִּי מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״, וְעָמַד וְהָלַךְ בַּשּׁוּק כּוּ׳.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce from today if I die from this illness, and he arose and walked in the market
llm_translation: "This is your bill of divorce from this day, if I die from this illness," and he got up and walked in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: גִּיטּוֹ כְּמַתְּנָתוֹ; מָה מַתְּנָתוֹ, אִם עָמַד – חוֹזֵר; אַף גִּיטּוֹ, אִם עָמַד – חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: his bill of divorce as his gift. Just as his gift, if he arose retracted, so too, his bill of divorce, if he arose retracted
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A get is like its condition; what is its condition, if it stood - it returns; so too, a get, if it stood - it returns.

hebrew_text: וּמָה גִּיטּוֹ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא פָּרֵישׁ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״כְּתוֹבוּ״ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״; אַף מַתְּנָתוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קְנוֹ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And just as his bill of divorce, even though he did not explicitly say once he said: Write even though he did not say: Give so too, his gift. Once he said: Give even though did not acquire from him,
llm_translation: "And what is the law regarding his divorce document - even though he did not separate, since it says 'as it is written' - even though he did not say 'give'; so too, his gift, since it says 'give' - even though he did not acquire from it."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ מֵהַיּוֹם, אִם מַתִּי מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״, וְעָמַד וְהָלַךְ בַּשּׁוּק, וְחָלָה וָמֵת; אוֹמְדִים אוֹתוֹ – אִם מֵחֲמַת חוֹלִי הָרִאשׁוֹן מֵת, הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט; אִם לָאו, אֵינוֹ גֵּט. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ ״אִם עָמַד – חוֹזֵר״, לְמָה לִי אוּמְדָּנָא? הֲרֵי עָמַד!
human_translation: We learned This is your bill of divorce from today if I die from this illness, and he arose and walked in the market, but became ill and died, assesses him. If he died because of the first illness this is bill of divorce, if not not bill of divorce. And if you say if he arose retracted, why do I assessment He arose
llm_translation: We learned: "This is your bill of divorce from this day, if I die from this illness." And he stood up and walked in the marketplace, and he fell ill and died; they evaluate him - if he died due to the first illness, this is a bill of divorce; if not, it is not a bill of divorce. And if you say, "If he stood up - he returns," why do I need an evaluation? He stood up!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: שֶׁנִּיתַּק מֵחוֹלִי לְחוֹלִי.
human_translation: Mar, son of Rav Yosef, says in the name of Rava: where, he proceeded from illness to illness,
llm_translation: Master, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: "That which was detached from a weekday to another weekday."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״עָמַד״ קָתָנֵי! עָמַד מֵחוֹלִי זֶה, וְנָפַל לְחוֹלִי אַחֵר. וְהָא ״הָלַךְ בַּשּׁוּק״ קָתָנֵי! הָלַךְ עַל מִשְׁעַנְתּוֹ;
human_translation: But isn’t it taught He arose arose from this illness but fell into another illness. But isn’t it taught He walked in the market? he walked with his staff
llm_translation: And this, "stood" it teaches! He stood from this sickness, and fell to another sickness. And this, "walked in the market" it teaches! He walked with his crutch.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּהָלַךְ עַל מִשְׁעַנְתּוֹ – הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן אוּמְדָּנָא, אִידַּךְ – אוּמְדָּנָא נָמֵי לָא בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: And this teaches us that we require assessment where he walked with his staff. another we do not even require assessment,
llm_translation: And here it is implied to us, that when one walks with his staff - he requires estimation, otherwise - estimation is not required.

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ, שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁנִּיתַּק מֵחוֹלִי לְחוֹלִי – מַתְּנָתוֹ מַתָּנָה? אִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁנִּיתַּק מֵחוֹלִי לְחוֹלִי – מַתְּנָתוֹ מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: you conclude from it a person on his deathbed who proceeded from illness to illness, his gift gift, Yes, as Rabbi Elazar says in the name of Rav: a person on his deathbed who proceeded from illness to illness, his gift gift.
llm_translation: You heard from her, a bed that was detached from one sick person to another sick person - its gift is a gift? No, as Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rav: a bed that was detached from one sick person to another sick person - its gift is not a gift.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרָבָא לָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ יֵשׁ גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Rabba and Rava do not hold this by Rav Huna, decree lest say there bill of divorce after death.
llm_translation: Rabba and Rava do not agree with Rav Huna, decree lest they say there is a get after death.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא הָוֵי גִּיטָּא, וּמִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה שָׁרֵינַן אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְעָלְמָא?!
human_translation: And is there anything that by Torah law is not bill of divorce, but due to a decree we permit a married woman to anyone,
llm_translation: And who is there that can from the hands of, for from the Torah it is not considered a divorce, and because of a decree we permit the wife of a man to marry forever?!

hebrew_text: אִין, כֹּל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאַפְקְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקִדּוּשִׁין מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Yes, anyone who betroths betroths upon the will of the Sages, and the Sages expropriated his betrothal from him
llm_translation: "אִין, כֹּל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאַפְקְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקִדּוּשִׁין מִינֵּיהּ." "No, all who sanctify the knowledge of the Rabbis sanctify, and the Rabbis separate them for holiness from their kind."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תִּינַח דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּכַסְפָּא, קַדֵּישׁ בְּבִיאָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁוְּיוּהּ רַבָּנַן לִבְעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: works out well where he betrothed with money, he betrothed by means of sexual intercourse what is there to say? said to him: The Sages declared his sexual intercourse licentious sexual intercourse,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "If one sanctified with money, sanctified with intercourse, what is there to say?" He said to him: "The Rabbis have compared his intercourse to the intercourse of harlotry."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ מֵהַיּוֹם, אִם מַתִּי מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״, וְנָפַל הַבַּיִת עָלָיו אוֹ הִכִּישׁוֹ נָחָשׁ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט. ״אִם לֹא אֶעֱמוֹד מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״, וְנָפַל עָלָיו בַּיִת אוֹ הִכִּישׁוֹ נָחָשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: The Sages taught This is your bill of divorce from today if I die from this illness, and the house collapsed on him or a snake bit him, it is not bill of divorce. if I will not arise from this illness, and the house collapsed on him or a snake bit him, this is bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "This is your bill of divorce from this day, if I die from this illness," and the house fell on him or a snake bit him - it is not a bill of divorce. "If I do not recover from this illness," and the house fell on him or a snake bit him - this is indeed a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא?
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause
llm_translation: What is different about the beginning and what is different about the end?

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: אֲכָלוֹ אֲרִי – אֵין לָנוּ.
human_translation: They sent from there, a lion ate him, we do not
llm_translation: Send from there: they ate lion - we do not have.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין אַרְעָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ כֹּל אוּנְסָא דְּמִתְיְלִיד. לְסוֹף אַפִּיקוּ בַּהּ נַהֲרָא.
human_translation: a certain man who sold land to another, accepted upon himself any unavoidable accident that may happen In the end they diverted a river into it,
llm_translation: That man who sells land to his friends, he accepted upon himself all the responsibility of the produce. In the end, they took him to the river.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שְׁפִי לֵיהּ, דְּהָא קַבֵּילְתְּ עֲלָךְ כׇּל אוּנְסָא דְּמִתְיְלִיד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא לְרָבִינָא: אוּנְסָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ הוּא!
human_translation: came before Ravina said to Go pacify him, as you accepted upon yourself any unavoidable accident that might happen. Rav Aḥa bar Taḥalifa said to Ravina: It is an uncommon, unavoidable accident,
llm_translation: He came before Ravina, he said to him: Go pour for him, for you have accepted upon yourself all the responsibility of the newborn. Rav Acha bar Tahalifa said to Ravina: It is not a common responsibility!

hebrew_text: אִיגַּלְגַּל מִילְּתָא, וּמְטָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אוּנְסָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ הוּא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: ״אִם לֹא אֶעֱמוֹד מֵחוֹלִי זֶה״, וְנָפַל עָלָיו בַּיִת אוֹ הִכִּישׁוֹ נָחָשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט!
human_translation: The matter was circulated, and it came before Rava. He said to them: It is an uncommon, unavoidable accident, Ravina raised an objection to Rava: if I am not healed from this illness, and the house collapsed on him or a snake bit him it is bill of divorce?
llm_translation: He rolled a matter, and came before Rava. He said to them: A rare occurrence it is not. Rabinah raised an objection to Rava: "If I do not arise from this sickness," and a house fell on him or a snake bit him - behold, this is a divorce document!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְאֵימָא מֵרֵישָׁא – אֵינוֹ גֵּט!
human_translation: Rava said to him: But say from the first clause: it is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: And why not say from the beginning - it is not a bill of divorce!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וּמִשּׁוּם דְּקַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא אַסֵּיפָא – לָא מוֹתְבִינַן תְּיוּבְתָּא מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: And because a difficulty the first clause and the latter clause, can we no raise an objection from it?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: And because the beginning of the gathering is difficult - are we not establishing a conclusion from it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, כֵּיוָן דְּקַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא אַסֵּיפָא – לָא אִיתְּמַר בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, וּמְשַׁבַּשְׁתָּא הִיא; זִיל בָּתַר סְבָרָא.
human_translation: said to him: Yes, Since a difficulty the first clause and the latter clause, was stated the study hall and it is corrupted. follow reason,
llm_translation: He said to him: No, since the beginning of the gathering was not stated in the study hall, and it is a disturbance; go after reason.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ זְבֻן שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי אַגִּידָּא דִּנְהַר מַלְכָּא. אֲגוּר מַלָּחֵי לְעַבּוֹרִינְהוּ, קַבִּילוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ כֹּל אוּנְסָא דְּמִתְיְלִיד. לְסוֹף אִיסְתְּכַר נְהַר מַלְכָּא,
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, purchased sesame on the bank of the Malka River. They hired sailors to cross them accepted upon themselves any unavoidable accident that might occur. In the end the Malka River was dammed
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, purchased a boat from the people of Aggida on the river Malka. They tied it with salted ropes to cross it, they accepted upon themselves all the risks of its offspring. In the end, the river Malka became clear.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לְהוּ: אֱגוּרוּ חַמָּרֵי אַפְקְעִינְהוּ נִיהֲלַן, דְּהָא קַבֵּילְתּוּ עֲלַיְיכוּ כֹּל אוּנְסָא דְּמִיתְיְלִיד!
human_translation: said to them: Hire donkeys and release them to us as you accepted upon yourself any unavoidable accident that might arise.
llm_translation: They said to him: "Mix the wine with hot water and give it to them to drink, for you have accepted upon yourselves all the responsibility that may arise!"

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: קָאקֵי חִיוָּרֵי מְשַׁלְּחִי גְּלִימֵי דְאִינָשֵׁי, אוּנְסָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ הוּא.
human_translation: came before Rava he said to You white geese [ kakei ḥivarei ], who strip men of their cloaks. It is an uncommon, unavoidable accident
llm_translation: They came before Rava, he said to them: "The rooster pecks at the garments of people, it is a rare occurrence."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא תִּתְיַיחֵד עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי עֵדִים,
human_translation: she may be secluded with him only in the presence of two witnesses,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One may not be alone with him, except in the presence of witnesses."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ עַל פִּי עֶבֶד אֲפִילּוּ עַל פִּי שִׁפְחָה; חוּץ מִשִּׁפְחָתָהּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלִּבָּהּ גַּס בָּהּ בְּשִׁפְחָתָהּ.
human_translation: even in the presence of a slave even in the presence of a maidservant, except for maidservant. because she is accustomed to her maidservant,
llm_translation: Even according to the opinion of a slave, even according to the opinion of a maidservant; except for her own maidservant, because her heart is arrogant towards her in her maidservant.

hebrew_text: מָה הִיא בְּאוֹתָן הַיָּמִים? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: What is during these days Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: What is meant by "in those days"? Rabbi Yehuda says:

hebrew_text: כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְכׇל דְּבָרֶיהָ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: like a married woman with regard to all of her matters, Rabbi Yosei says: she is divorced or she is not divorced.
llm_translation: Like a married woman in all her matters. Rabbi Yosei says: Divorced and not divorced.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּתְיַיחֲדָה עִמּוֹ בַּאֲפֵילָה, אוֹ שֶׁיָּשְׁנָה עִמּוֹ תַּחַת מַרְגְּלוֹת הַמִּטָּה – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא נִתְעַסְּקוּ בְּדָבָר אַחֵר; וְחוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם זְנוּת וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִדּוּשִׁין. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: The Sages taught saw that she secluded herself with in the dark, or that she slept with him under the foot of the bed, one is not concerned perhaps they were engaged in another matter, And one is concerned due to licentiousness but one is not concerned due to a betrothal. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One is also concerned due to a betrothal.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one saw her that she was secluded with him in darkness, or that she slept with him beneath the bedcovers - we are not concerned that perhaps they engaged in another matter; and we are concerned about the suspicion of promiscuity, but we are not concerned about the suspicion of sanctity. Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: We are even concerned about the suspicion of sanctity.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, הָכִי קָאָמַר: רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה – חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִידּוּשִׁין. נָתַן לָהּ כְּסָפִים – חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם זְנוּת, דְּאָמְרִינַן: בְּאֶתְנַנָּהּ נָתַן לָהּ; וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִידּוּשִׁין. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּזוֹ חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: What saying? Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: This is what is saying: they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse there one is concerned due to a betrothal he gave her money one is concerned due to licentiousness, wherein we say: He gave as hire for a prostitute, but one is not concerned due to a betrothal. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even in this one is concerned due to a betrothal,
llm_translation: What is he saying? Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said thus: If she was seen that she was married - we are concerned about kiddushin. If he gave her money - we are concerned about promiscuity, as we say: "He gave it to her as a gift"; and we are not concerned about kiddushin. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even in this case, we are concerned about kiddushin.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת – כְּשֶׁרָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה, אֲבָל לֹא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי? כְּמַאן –
human_translation: in accordance with whose is that which Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says, the dispute when they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse everyone agrees that she does not require a second bill of divorce from him? In accordance with whose
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A dispute - when it is seen that she was married, but not seen that she was married - everyone agrees that she does not need a second bill of divorce? As to where -

hebrew_text: כְּדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: in accordance with everyone.
llm_translation: As the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִידֵּי כְּסָפִים קָתָנֵי?!
human_translation: Abaye objects to this Is anything money taught
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to her: "From the hands of silver, does the verse speak?!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה – חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם זְנוּת, וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִידּוּשִׁין. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: This is is saying: they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse one is concerned due to licentiousness, but one is not concerned due to a betrothal. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One is also concerned due to a betrothal.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, thus he said: If she was seen that she was married - we are concerned about adultery, and we are not concerned about sanctity. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: We are also concerned about sanctity.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת – כְּשֶׁרָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה, אֲבָל לֹא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי? כְּמַאן –
human_translation: in accordance with whose is that which Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The dispute when they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse But they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse everyone agrees that she does not require a second bill of divorce from him. with whose
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A dispute - when it is seen that she was married, but not seen that she was married - everyone agrees that she does not need from him a second bill of divorce? As to where -

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Like Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אִם כֵּן, מַאי ״אַף״?
human_translation: Rava objects to this: If so, what also
llm_translation: Rava objects to this: If so, what is the meaning of "af"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי קָאָמַר, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה – חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is is saying: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse, one is concerned due to a betrothal.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is what Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even if they did not see her that she was married - we are concerned about betrothals.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת – כְּשֶׁרָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה, אֲבָל לֹא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט? כְּמַאן –
human_translation: in accordance with whose is that which Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The dispute where they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse But they did not see that she engaged in intercourse everyone agrees that she does not require bill of divorce from him. with whose
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A dispute - when it is seen that she was married, but not seen that she was married - everyone agrees that she does not need a bill of divorce? As to where -

hebrew_text: דְּלָא כְּחַד.
human_translation: not in accordance with one
llm_translation: Not like one.

hebrew_text: מָה הִיא בְּאוֹתָן הַיָּמִים? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְכׇל דְּבָרֶיהָ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת:
human_translation: What is during these days? Rabbi Yehuda says: like a married woman with regard to all of her matters. Rabbi Yosei says: she is divorced or she is not divorced.
llm_translation: What is the law in those days? Rabbi Yehuda says: Like a married woman regarding all matters. Rabbi Yosei says: Whether she is divorced or not divorced.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיָּמוּת. וּלְכִי מָיֵית הָוֵי גִּיטָּא?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּאֵין גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה! אָמַר רַבָּה: בְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעֵת שֶׁאֲנִי בָּעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: taught provided that he dies. And when he dies, is bill of divorce? But don’t we maintain that there is no bill of divorce after death? Rabba says where says: from moment that I am in the world,
llm_translation: Mishna: And only if he dies. And if he dies, is it a valid divorce document?! But we have established that a divorce document is not valid after death! Rabba said: By saying "from the time that I am in the world."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָמִים שֶׁבֵּינָתַיִם – בַּעְלָהּ זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ; וְיוֹרְשָׁהּ,
human_translation: The Sages taught during the days between, her husband is entitled to she finds, And her earnings, and annul her vows and he inherits her
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Days of Doubt" - her husband is entitled to her findings, and to the work of her hands, and to the annulment of her vows; and he inherits her.

hebrew_text: וּמִטַּמֵּא לָהּ. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר – אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: and he becomes ritually impure for her The principle of the matter she is like his wife in every sense, but she does not require a second bill of divorce from him the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And he becomes impure to her. The principle of the matter: Behold she is like his wife in all matters - except that she does not require from him a second divorce, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בְּעִילָתָהּ תְּלוּיָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּעִילָתָהּ סָפֵק. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיָּמוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: her sexual intercourse depends Rabbi Yosei says: Her sexual intercourse uncertain And the Rabbis say: she is divorced or she is not divorced, provided that he dies
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: In her intercourse is dependent. Rabbi Yosei says: In her intercourse is doubtful. And the Sages say: Whether she is divorced or not divorced, only that he should die.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי?
human_translation: What is there between Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ; לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר – לָא מַיְיתֵי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – מַיְיתֵי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The between them is a provisional guilt-offering, According to Rabbi Meir, does not bring a provisional guilt-offering And according to Rabbi Yosei bring a provisional guilt-offering.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: There is a hanging guilt-offering between them; according to Rabbi Meir - he does not bring a hanging guilt-offering, and according to Rabbi Yosei - he brings a hanging guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. חֲכָמִים הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר יִרְמְיָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים ״מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״ – בַּעְלָהּ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: she is divorced or she is not divorced. the Rabbis is Rabbi Yosei. There is between them by Rabbi Zeira. As Rabbi Zeira says Rabba bar Yirmeya says Shmuel says: Wherever the Sages said: she is divorced or she is not divorced, her husband is obligated to provide her sustenance.
llm_translation: The sages say: "Megoreshet and she is not Megoreshet." The sages, that is Rabbi Yosei! There is a difference between them of Rabbi Zeira - for Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rabba bar Yirmeya said Shmuel: Any place where the sages said "Megoreshet and she is not Megoreshet" - her husband is obligated in her sustenance.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ, עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, וְתִתֵּן.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, she is divorced and must give
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce, on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz" - Behold, she is divorced, and she shall give.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מִיכָּן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ – אִם נָתְנָה לוֹ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת; וְאִם לָאו, אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: on the condition that you will give me from now until thirty days, if she gives to him within thirty days she is divorced. And if not she is not divorced.
llm_translation: "‘On condition that you give it to me from here until thirty days’ – if she gives it to him within thirty days, she is divorced; but if not, she is not divorced."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַיְדָּן, בְּאֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ, עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי אִיצְטְלִיתִי״, וְאָבְדָה אִיצְטְלִיתוֹ, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: תִּתֵּן לוֹ אֶת דָּמֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: an incident in Tzaidan involving one who said to his wife: This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me my coat [ itztaliti ], and she lost his coat, And the Rabbis said she must give him the value
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: There was an incident in Zaydan, with one who said to his wife, "Here is your divorce, on the condition that you give me my cloak," and his cloak was lost. The sages said: Give him its value.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״וְתִתֵּן״? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: וְהִיא תִּתֵּן. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: לִכְשֶׁתִּתֵּן.
human_translation: What And must give? Rav Huna says: and she must give Rav Yehuda says: when she gives
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "and she shall give"? Rav Huna said: "And she shall give." Rav Yehudah said: "When she shall give."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שֶׁנִּתְקָרַע הַגֵּט אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד; רַב הוּנָא אָמַר ״וְהִיא תִּתֵּן״ – אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי; רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר ״לִכְשֶׁתִּתֵּן״ – צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: What is between There is between them if the bill of divorce was torn or lost Rav Huna, says: And she must give she does not require a second bill of divorce from him. Rav Yehuda says when she gives she requires a second bill of divorce from him,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? The difference between them is if the divorce document was torn or lost; Rav Huna said, "And she shall give" - she does not need another divorce document; Rav Yehudah said, "When she gives" - she does need another divorce document.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא – דִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי, עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֶתֵּן לִיךְ מָאתַיִם זוּז״ – הֲרֵי הִיא מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיִתֵּן. וְאִיתְּמַר: מַאי ״וְיִתֵּן״? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: וְהוּא יִתֵּן. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: לִכְשֶׁיִּתֵּן.
human_translation: And it was also taught with regard to betrothal a case like this, as we learned one says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me on the condition that I will give you two hundred dinars, she is betrothed, and he must give And it was stated what And he must give. Rav Huna says: And he must give, Rav Yehuda says: when he gives.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah regarding the case of betrothals, for this is the case that we learned: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are betrothed to me on the condition that I give you two hundred zuz," she is betrothed, and he should give. And it was stated: What does "and he should give" mean? Rav Huna said: And he should give. Rav Yehudah said: When he will give.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ – שֶׁפָּשְׁטָה יָדָהּ וְקִיבְּלָה קִידּוּשִׁין מֵאַחֵר. רַב הוּנָא אָמַר ״וְהוּא יִתֵּן״ – תְּנָאָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, מְקַיֵּים תְּנָאֵיהּ וְאָזֵיל. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר ״לִכְשֶׁיִּתֵּן״ – לְכִי יָהֵיב לַהּ הוּא דְּהָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין, הַשְׁתָּא לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: What is between them? There is between them where she extended her hand and received betrothal from another Rav Huna says: And he must give, it is merely a condition He fulfills his condition and moves on, Rav Yehuda says: When he gives, when he gives her it will be betrothal. now it is not betrothal
llm_translation: What is the difference between them: There is a difference between them - she extended her hand and received the betrothal from another. Rav Huna said, "And he shall give" - it is a condition in general, he fulfills his condition and departs. Rav Yehudah said, "When he gives" - when he gives it to her, that is when the betrothal takes effect, now it is not effective.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא ״וְהוּא יִתֵּן״ – מִשּׁוּם דִּלְקָרוֹבַהּ קָאָתֵי; אֲבָל גַּבֵּי גֵירוּשִׁין – דִּלְרַחוֹקַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה;
human_translation: And necessary As if it would have taught us with regard to betrothal, with regard to this Rav Huna says: And he should give, because he comes to draw her close But with regard to divorce, where he comes to distance her, say concedes to Rav Yehuda
llm_translation: The matter is necessary; for if we were to hear regarding betrothal, in that context Rav Huna said, "And he shall give" - because he is close by; but regarding divorce - because he is far away, one might say that Rav Yehudah agrees with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי גֵירוּשִׁין; בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא ״וְהִיא תִּתֵּן״ – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא כְּסִיף לְמִיתְבְּעַהּ; אֲבָל גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין, דִּכְסִיפָא לְמִיתְבְּעֵיהּ, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And if it would have taught us with regard to divorce, with regard to this Rav Huna says: And she must give, because he is not embarrassed to demand from her But with regard to betrothal, where she is embarrassed to demand from him, say concedes to Rav Yehuda
llm_translation: And if we were to hear regarding divorce; in that case Rav Huna said, "And she shall depart" - because it is not difficult for her; but regarding betrothal, where it is difficult for her, say that Rav Yehudah agrees with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין; בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה ״לִכְשֶׁיִּתֵּן״ – מִשּׁוּם דִּכְסִיפָא לְמִיתְבְּעֵיהּ; אֲבָל גַּבֵּי גֵירוּשִׁין – דְּלָא כְּסִיף לְמִיתְבְּעַהּ, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא;
human_translation: And if it would have taught us with regard to betrothal, with regard to this Rav Yehuda says when he gives because she is embarrassed to demand it from him But with regard to divorce, where is not embarrassed to demand from her, say that concedes to Rav Huna
llm_translation: And if we were to hear regarding betrothals; in this case Rav Yehudah said "when he gives" - because it is difficult for him to sit; but regarding divorces - since it is not difficult for him to sit, let him agree with Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי גֵירוּשִׁין; בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה ״לִכְשֶׁתִּתֵּן״ – מִשּׁוּם דִּלְרַחוֹקַהּ קָאָתֵי; אֲבָל גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין – דִּלְקָרוֹבַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֵימָא מוֹדֵה לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if it would have taught us with regard to divorce, with regard to this Rav Yehuda says when she gives because comes to distance her. But with regard to betrothal, where he comes to draw her close, say concedes to Rav Huna. necessary
llm_translation: And if we would hear regarding divorces; in this case Rav Yehudah said "when she gives" - because she is standing far away; but regarding betrothals - because she is standing close, say that Rav Huna agrees with him; this is necessary.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ, עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּקְרַע הַגֵּט אוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱבַד – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת; וּלְאַחֵר לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא עַד שֶׁתִּתֵּן.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, even though the bill of divorce was torn or lost she is divorced. And she may not marry another until she gives
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: "Here is your bill of divorce, on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz." Even if the bill of divorce is torn or lost - she is divorced; and she may not marry another until she gives the money.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ, עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, וָמֵת, נָתְנָה – אֵינָהּ זְקוּקָה לְיָבָם; לֹא נָתְנָה – זְקוּקָה לְיָבָם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֶנֶת לְאָבִיו אוֹ לְאָחִיו אוֹ לְאֶחָד מִן הַקְּרוֹבִים.
human_translation: And it is taught further This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give two hundred dinars to me, and died given she is not bound to the yavam she had not given she is bound to the yavam Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She should give to father, or to his brother, or to one of the relatives
llm_translation: And furthermore it was taught: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce, on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz," and he dies, if she gave it - she is not bound to perform the rite of levirate marriage; if she did not give it - she is bound to perform the rite of levirate marriage. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She may give it to her father, or to her brother, or to one of her close relatives.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי – אֶלָּא דְּמָר סָבַר: ״לִי״ – וְלָא לְיוֹרְשַׁי, וּמָר סָבַר: ״לִי״ – וַאֲפִילּוּ לְיוֹרְשַׁי; וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא תְּנָאָה הָוֵי – תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: disagree only with regard to Sage, holds to me, and not to my heirs. And Sage, holds to me, and even to my heirs. But in any event, everyone is condition, a conclusive refutation of Rav Yehuda,
llm_translation: Until here they do not argue - rather, Mar holds: "to me" - and not to my heirs, and Mar holds: "to me" - and even to my heirs; and the entire world is sustained by it - the gift of Rav Yehudah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַב יְהוּדָה: הָא מַנִּי, רַבִּי הִיא – דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי. וּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ, וַאֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to you: whose is this It is Rabbi As Rav Huna says Rabbi says: Anyone who states On the condition, like states: from now, And the Rabbis disagree with him. And I say in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Yehudah: "Ha manni, Rabbi Hiya - de'amar Rav Huna amar Rabbi: Kol ha'omer 'al menat' ke'omer 'me'achshav' dami. U'fligi Rabbanan aleih, va'ana de'amari ke'Rabbanan."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בְּבָבֶל אָמְרִינַן, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי – פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ. כִּי סְלִיקִי, אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ לְרַבִּי אַסִּי דְּיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ – כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira says: When we were in Babylonia we say this that Rav Huna says Rabbi says: Anyone who states On the condition, like states: from now, the Rabbis disagree with him. When I ascended I found Rabbi Asi, who was sitting and saying in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Everyone concedes that with regard to states On the condition, like states: from now; disagreed only in From today and after death.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said: When we were in Babylon, we would say, as Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi: Anyone who says "on condition" is like one who says "from now" – the Rabbis disagree with him. When I went out, I found Rabbi Assi sitting and saying in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Everyone agrees regarding saying "on condition" – it is like saying "from now." They only disagreed regarding "from today and after death."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – גֵּט וְאֵינוֹ גֵּט, דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים; רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה – גֵּט.
human_translation: And it is taught from today and after death, bill of divorce and not bill of divorce. the statement of the Rabbis. Rabbi says: like this bill of divorce
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'From the day and after death' - a get and it is not a get, the words of the sages; Rabbi says: like this - a get."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב יְהוּדָה – דְּאָמַר: בְּ״עַל מְנָת״ פְּלִיגִי, אַדְּמִיפַּלְגִי בְּ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״, (לִיפַּלְגִי) [לִיפַּלְגוּ] בְּ״עַל מְנָת״! לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: And according to Rav Yehuda, who said disagree about On the condition, rather than disagreeing with regard to From today and after death, let them disagree with regard to On the condition. to inform you about the far-reaching nature of Rabbi
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda - who said: In "ba'al menat" they argue, he should argue in "from the day and after death," (to argue) they should argue in "ba'al menat"! To inform you of the strength of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפַּלְגוּ בְּ״עַל מְנָת״ – וּלְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּרַבָּנַן! כֹּחַ דְּהֶיתֵּירָא עֲדִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And let them disagree about: On the condition, to convey to you the far-reaching nature of the Rabbis, preferable the power of leniency,
llm_translation: "To divide with 'Ba'al Menat' - and to inform you of the power of the Rabbis! The power of the majority is superior to it."

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא קְפִידֵיהּ לָאו קְפִידָא – וּלְזָרֹזַהּ קָאָתֵי; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: on the condition that you will give me from now until thirty days, Isn’t obvious, lest you say the concern is not concern, comes to galvanize her. it teaches us
llm_translation: "‘On condition that you give it to me from here until thirty days’ and so forth." Obviously! What might you have thought, that he is particular, not particular – but he is hastening; he is informing us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַיְדָּן כּוּ׳. מַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָתָנֵי מַעֲשֶׂה?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: an incident in Tzaidan What teach that he teaches an incident
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: There was an incident in Tzaydan, as it is written (in the Mishnah). What is the teaching of the Mishnah regarding the incident?

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אִם אָמַר לָהּ: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי אִיצְטְלִיתִי״, וְאָבְדָה אִיצְטְלִיתוֹ – אִיצְטְלִיתִי דַּוְקָא קָאָמַר לַהּ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: תִּתֵּן לוֹ אֶת דָּמֶיהָ. וְאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּצַיְדָּן, בְּאֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי אִצְטְלִיתִי״, וְאָבְדָה אִצְטְלִיתוֹ, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: תִּתֵּן לוֹ אֶת דָּמֶיהָ.
human_translation: is incomplete and this is what it is teaching: If said to on the condition that you will give me my coat, and she lost his coat, he specifically stated to her: my coat, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: she can give him its value. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said an incident also in Tzaidan involving one who said to his wife: This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me my coat, and she lost his coat. And the Rabbis said she should give him its value.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Short of the required amount, and thus it was taught: If he said to her, 'On condition that you give me my cloak,' and his cloak was lost - he specifically said 'my cloak' to her. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Give him its value. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: There was an incident in Tzaydan, where one said to his wife, 'Here is your divorce on condition that you give me my cloak,' and his cloak was lost, and the sages said: Give him its value."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר לָהּ ״מְחוּלִים לָךְ״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Asi raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, and he returned and said to her: It is waived for you, what is
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Assi from Rabbi Yochanan: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz," and he went back and said to her, "I forgive you." What is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבָּנַן; תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised according to the Rabbis, let the dilemma be raised according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: The sages asked; the sages asked of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבָּנַן – עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּלָא אַחֲלַהּ גַּבָּהּ; אֲבָל הָכָא, הָא קָאָמַר לַהּ: ״מְחוּלִים לָךְ״; אוֹ דִלְמָא, אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָא קָאָמַר, אֶלָּא דְּקָא מְפַיְּיסָה לֵיהּ בִּדְמֵי; אֲבָל לִגְמָרֵי – לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised according to the Rabbis: only there the Rabbis state he did not waive but here he says to her: It is waived for you, Or perhaps even Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel states only there, as she appeases him by money, but entirely, no, said to him She is not divorced,
llm_translation: The sages asked - until here the sages did not say there, rather that he should not make her hair unkempt; but here, he said to her: "You are free"; or perhaps, even Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel did not say, rather that he appeases her with money; but completely - no. He said to her: she is not divorced.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאַתָּה נֶהֱנֶה לִי, אִם אִי אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לִבְנִי כּוֹר אֶחָד שֶׁל חִטִּין וּשְׁתֵּי חָבִיּוֹת שֶׁל יַיִן״, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן; וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף זֶה – יָכוֹל לְהַתִּיר אֶת נִדְרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא עַל פִּי חָכָם, וְאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵינִי כְּאִילּוּ הִתְקַבַּלְתִּי״!
human_translation: He raised an objection to his one who says to another: Benefiting from me is konam for you, if you do not give my son one kor of wheat and two barrels of wine Rabbi Meir says: prohibited until he gives And the Rabbis say: Even this can dissolve his vow without consent of a halakhic authority, and saying: I hereby as though I have received
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: One who says to his fellow, "Designate for me that which you benefit from me, if you do not give my son one kor of wheat and two barrels of wine," Rabbi Meir says: It is forbidden until he gives; and the Sages say: Even this – he can permit his vow without consulting a sage, and he says: "Behold, I am as if I had been accepted!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם לְצַעוֹרַהּ קָא מְכַוֵּין – וְלָא צַיעֲרַהּ. הָכָא מִשּׁוּם הַרְוָוחָה הוּא, וְהָא לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, he intends to vex her, and he did not vex her. Here, for the sake of profit; but it was not necessary.
llm_translation: So what is the difference?! There, it is directed towards its benefit - and not towards its detriment. Here, it is because of spaciousness, and there it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲרִיסֵיהּ: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא דְּלוּ תְּלָת דָּלָווֹתָא, וְאָכְלִי רִיבְעָא; אַתְּ דְּלִי אַרְבְּעָה, וֶאֱכוֹל תִּילְתָּא. לְסוֹף אֲתָא מִיטְרָא.
human_translation: a certain man who said to his sharecropper: Everyone waters three and they consume, one quarter you water four and consume one-third Ultimately, rain came
llm_translation: That man who said to his tenant: "All the world is sustained by three measures, and you consume a quarter measure; you, who do not have four, should consume a third." In the end, rain came down.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא לָא דְּלָה. רַבָּה אָמַר: הָא לָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: But he did not water Rabba said: But it was not necessary
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Ha la da'la." Rabbah said: "Ha la itztrikha."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן, וְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל?
human_translation: Shall we say that Rav Yosef said in accordance the Rabbis, and that Rabba said in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel,
llm_translation: Let us say, Rav Yosef said like Rabbanan, and Rabbah said like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel?

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן הִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה; וּבְהָא – אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל!
human_translation: And you understand But don’t we maintain the halakha in accordance with of Rabba And with regard to this halakha not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: And should it be reasoned?! But this follows the opinion of Rabah; and in this case - the halakha is not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבָּנַן. רַב יוֹסֵף – כְּרַבָּנַן; וְרַבָּה אָמַר לָךְ: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם – אֶלָּא דִּלְצַעוֹרַהּ קָא מִיכַּוֵּין; אֲבָל הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם הַרְוָוחָה הוּא, וְהָא לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ.
human_translation: Rather, actually in accordance with the Rabbis. Rav Yosef in accordance with the Rabbis. And Rabba said to you: I was saying even according to the Rabbis, the Rabbis are saying there only when intends to vex her, here, is for the sake of profit, and it was not necessary
llm_translation: Rather, always like Rabbanan. Rav Yosef - like Rabbanan; and Rabbah said to you: I who say even to Rabbanan, until here not saying Rabbanan there - rather for the sake of clarity they are particular; but here, because of spaciousness it is, and that is not necessary.
