hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיָה נִטְמָן יוֹם שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא חָלוּט לוֹ. הִתְקִין הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁיְּהֵא חוֹלֵשׁ אֶת מְעוֹתָיו לַלִּשְׁכָּה, וִיהֵא שׁוֹבֵר אֶת הַדֶּלֶת וְנִכְנָס. וְאֵימָתַי שֶׁיִּרְצֶה הַלָּה, יָבוֹא וְיִטּוֹל אֶת מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: we learned elsewhere At first would hide day of the twelfth month so that confirmed his Hillel the Elder instituted whereby may deposit [ ḥolesh ] his money in chamber, and he may break the door and enter And when that wishes, he should come and take his money
llm_translation: We learned there: Initially, he would hide for twelve months, so that he would be accustomed to it. Hillel the Elder instituted that he should weaken his purse for the chamber, and he should break the door and enter. And when does she desire him? He should come and take his purse.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: מִתַּקָּנָתוֹ שֶׁל הִלֵּל נִשְׁמַע – ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, וְנָתְנָה לוֹ מִדַּעְתּוֹ, מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת; עַל כּוֹרְחוֹ, אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת –
human_translation: And Rava says: From the ordinance of Hillel we learn This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, and she gave him with his consent, divorced. against his will she is not divorced.
llm_translation: And Rava said: From the correction of Hillel it is heard - "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz," and she gave it to him willingly, she is divorced; against his will, she is not divorced -

hebrew_text: מִדְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ לְהִלֵּל לְתַקּוֹנֵי נְתִינָה בְּעַל כּוּרְחֵיהּ – דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ נְתִינָה,
human_translation: From that was necessary for Hillel to institute giving against the will is giving.
llm_translation: From where it is necessary for Hillel to establish the regulations of giving with his own authority - for it would be considered a valid giving for him.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דִּבְעָלְמָא, נְתִינָה בְּעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ לָא הָוְיָא נְתִינָה.
human_translation: by inference that generally, giving against will is not giving,
llm_translation: From the general principle, giving by the owner of his own accord is not considered giving.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: וְדִלְמָא כִּי אִצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ לְתַקּוֹנֵי – שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, אֲבָל בְּפָנָיו – בֵּין מִדַּעְתּוֹ בֵּין בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ הָוְיָא נְתִינָה!
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this, and some say Rav Shimi bar Ashi And perhaps when it was necessary to institute where not in presence But in his presence, whether willing whether against his will, it is giving.
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Papa, and some say Rav Shimi bar Ashi: Perhaps when it is necessary for him to fix it - not in his presence, but in his presence - whether with his knowledge or against his will, it is considered a valid gift!

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: מִתַּקָּנָתוֹ שֶׁל הִלֵּל – ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, וּנְתָנָהּ לוֹ – בֵּין מִדַּעְתּוֹ וּבֵין בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ הָוְיָא נְתִינָה; וְכִי אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ לְהִלֵּל לְתַקּוֹנֵי – שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, אֲבָל בְּפָנָיו – בֵּין מִדַּעְתּוֹ בֵּין בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ הָוְיָא נְתִינָה.
human_translation: And there are who say Rava says: From the ordinance of Hillel This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, and she gave to him, whether with his consent or whether against his will, it is giving. And where it was necessary for Hillel to institute when was not in his presence. But in his presence, whether with his consent whether against his will, it is giving.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rava said: From the time of Hillel's enactment - "Here is your bill of divorce on condition that you give me two hundred zuz," and she gives it to him - whether willingly or by force, it is considered a valid giving. And when it is necessary for Hillel to effect a remedy - not in his presence, but in his presence - whether willingly or by force, it is considered a valid giving.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: וְדִלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ בְּפָנָיו נָמֵי – מִדַּעְתּוֹ אִין, עַל כׇּרְחוֹ לָא; וְהִלֵּל – מַאי דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ תַּקֵּין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this, and some say Rav Shimi bar Ashi And perhaps even in his presence, with his consent, yes, against his will, no, And Hillel instituted what was necessary,
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Papa, and some say Rav Shimi bar Ashi: Perhaps even in his presence, yes - not willingly, but by force; and Hillel - what does he need to establish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ – הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ; חוּץ מֵעָרֵב, וְצַיְדָן,
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: every place where Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught in our Mishna, the halakha in accordance with except a guarantor And Tzaidan.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: In every place that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel changed in our Mishnah – the halakha is like his opinion; except for the evening and hunting.

hebrew_text: וּרְאָיָה אַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: And evidence final
llm_translation: And a later vision.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ, וְהַנְּיָיר שֶׁלִּי״ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתַּחְזִירִי לִי אֶת הַנְּיָיר״ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: The Sages taught Behold this is your bill of divorce, the paper is mine, she is not divorced, on the condition that you return the paper to me, she is divorced.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Here is your bill of divorce, and the document is mine" - she is not divorced. "On the condition that you return the document to me" - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מַנִּי – רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: תִּתֵּן לוֹ אֶת דָּמֶיהָ; הָכָא נָמֵי – אֶפְשָׁר דִּמְפַיְּיסָה לֵיהּ בִּדְמֵי.
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause? Rav Ḥisda said: whose is this It is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who says she give him its value Here also, it is possible for her to appease him with money
llm_translation: What is the difference between the beginning and the end? Rav Ḥisdah said: Here it is a case of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said: "Give her the money." Here it is possible that she will appease him with money.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – הֵיכָא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ, הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ מִי אָמַר?!
human_translation: Abaye objects to this Say that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says when is not extant, where it is extant, did say
llm_translation: Abbaye strongly objects: Say that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said - where there is no issue in his eyes, where there is an issue in his eyes, who said this?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: בָּעֵינַן תְּנַאי כָּפוּל; וְהָכָא – הָא לָא כַּפְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who says: We require a compound condition And here he did not compound his condition.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: This is a dispute of Rabbi Meir, as he said: We require a redundant Mishna; and here, this Mishna does not match its counterparts.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: טַעְמָא דְּלָא כַּפְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ, הָא כַּפְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ – לָא הָוֵי גִּיטָּא; מִכְּדֵי כֹּל תְּנָאֵי מֵהֵיכָא גָּמְרִינַן לְהוּ? מִתְּנַאי בְּנֵי גָּד וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן;
human_translation: Rava objects to this the reason that did not compound his condition, but if compound his condition would not be bill of divorce. Now, from where do we learn all conditions? from the condition of the children of Gad and the children of Reuben.
llm_translation: Rava objects to her: The reason that she did not double for her students, if she doubled for her students - it is not a valid bill of divorce; since when do we learn all the teachings from where? From the teachings of the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben.

hebrew_text: מָה הָתָם – תְּנַאי קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה, אַף כֹּל תְּנַאי קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה; לְאַפּוֹקֵי הָכָא – דְּמַעֲשֶׂה קוֹדֵם לִתְנַאי!
human_translation: Just as there, condition precedes the action, so too, any condition before the action. to exclude here, where the action precedes the condition.
llm_translation: There, it is a Tannaic dispute prior to the action, so too, every Tannaic dispute is prior to the action; to refute here - for the action precedes the Tanna!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּמַעֲשֶׂה קוֹדֵם לִתְנַאי.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: because action precedes condition.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Because the deed precedes the teaching.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: טַעְמָא דְּמַעֲשֶׂה קוֹדֵם לִתְנַאי, הָא תְּנַאי קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה – לָא הָוֵי גִּיטָּא; מִכְּדֵי כֹּל תְּנָאֵי מֵהֵיכָא גָּמְרִינַן לְהוּ – מִתְּנַאי בְּנֵי גָּד וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן, מָה הָתָם – תְּנַאי בְּדָבָר אֶחָד וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּדָבָר אַחֵר, אַף כֹּל; לְאַפּוֹקֵי הָכָא –
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava objects to this The reason that the action precedes the condition, But the condition precede the action not be bill of divorce. Now, from where do we learn all conditions? from the condition of the children of Gad and the children of Reuben. Just as there a condition with regard to one matter, and action with regard to another matter, so too, every to exclude here,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava strongly objects to her: The reason that the teaching precedes the action is because if the teaching were to follow the action, it would not be a valid divorce document. Since we establish all teachings from where do we derive them? From the teachings of the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben. Just as there, the teaching is regarding one matter and the action is regarding another matter, so too here -

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַאי וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּדָבָר אֶחָד! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: מִשּׁוּם דִּתְנַאי וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּדָבָר אֶחָד.
human_translation: where the condition and the action are about the same matter, Rather, Rav Adda bar Ahava said because the condition and the action are about the same matter,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ditnai and a case in one matter! Rather, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Because Ditnai and a case in one matter."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: whose is this It is Rabbi as Rav Huna says Rav says: Anyone who states On the condition, like states: from now,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: This is a mnemonic - it is Rabbi Hiya, as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Anyone who says "al menat" is like one who says "me'achshav."

hebrew_text: אַתְקֵין שְׁמוּאֵל בְּגִיטָּא דִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע: ״אִם לֹא מַתִּי לֹא יְהֵא גֵּט, וְאִם מַתִּי יְהֵא גֵּט״.
human_translation: Shmuel instituted in a bill of divorce of a person on his deathbed If I do not die this will not be bill of divorce, and if I die it will be bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Samuel established in a bill of divorce of one who is on his deathbed: "If I do not die, it shall not be a divorce, and if I die, it shall be a divorce."

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: ״אִם מַתִּי יְהֵא גֵּט, וְאִם לֹא מַתִּי לֹא יְהֵא גֵּט״! לָא מַקְדֵּים אִינִישׁ פּוּרְעָנוּתָא לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: But let us say If I die it will be bill of divorce, and if I do not die this will not be bill of divorce. A person does not hasten a calamity upon himself.
llm_translation: And say: "If he dies, let there be a divorce, and if he does not die, there shall not be a divorce"! A person should not bring punishment upon themselves.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: ״לֹא יְהֵא גֵּט אִם לֹא מַתִּי״! בָּעֵינַן תְּנַאי קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: But let us It will not be bill of divorce if I do not die, we require the condition before the action,
llm_translation: And say: "A get should not be valid unless it is given willingly!" We require a Tanna before the action.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: מִכְּדֵי כֹּל תְּנָאֵי מֵהֵיכָא גָּמְרִינַן – מִתְּנַאי בְּנֵי גָּד וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן; מָה הָתָם – הֵן קוֹדֵם לְלָאו, אַף כֹּל [תְּנָאֵי, הֵן קוֹדֵם לְלָאו].
human_translation: Rava objects to this Now, from where do we learn all conditions? from the condition of the children of Gad and the children of Reuben. Just as there, the affirmative precedes the negative, so too, all to exclude here, where the negative precedes the affirmative.
llm_translation: Rava objects to this: From where do we derive that we conclude in accordance with all the Tannaim? From the Tannaim of the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben. Just as there – they precede the negative commandment, so too here, all Tannaim precede the negative commandment.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: ״אִם לֹא מַתִּי לֹא יְהֵא גֵּט, אִם מַתִּי יְהֵא גֵּט, אִם לֹא מַתִּי לֹא יְהֵא גֵּט״ –
human_translation: Rather, Rava said If I do not die this will not be a bill of divorce. If I die this will be a bill of divorce, if I do not die this will not be a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rava said: "If I do not die, there will be no divorce document; if I die, there will be a divorce document; if I do not die, there will be no divorce document."

hebrew_text: ״אִם לֹא מַתִּי לֹא יְהֵא גֵּט״ – לָא מַקְדֵּים אִינִישׁ פּוּרְעָנוּתָא לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ; ״אִם מַתִּי יְהֵא גֵּט, אִם לֹא מַתִּי לֹא יְהֵא גֵּט״ – בָּעֵינַן הֵן קוֹדֵם לְלָאו.
human_translation: If I do not die this will not be a bill of divorce, a person does not hasten a calamity upon himself. If I die this will be a bill of divorce, if I do not die this will not be a bill of divorce. we require the affirmative precedes the negative.
llm_translation: "If he does not die, there will be no divorce" - a person does not hasten misfortune upon himself; "If he dies, there will be a divorce; if he does not die, there will be no divorce" - they are considered primary in this matter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשִׁי אֶת אַבָּא״; ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתָּנִיקִי אֶת בְּנִי״ – כַּמָּה הִיא מְנִיקָתוֹ? שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. מֵת הַבֵּן אוֹ שֶׁמֵּת הָאָב – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve father, On the condition that you will nurse, my son, how long she to nurse him two years Rabbi Yehuda says: eighteen months. the son died or the father died, this is bill of divorce,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Here is your divorce document on the condition that you serve my father"; "on the condition that you nurse my son" - How long is the period of nursing? Two years. Rabbi Yehuda says: eighteen months. If the son dies or the father dies - this is a valid divorce document.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשִׁי אֶת אַבָּא שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״; ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתָּנִיקִי אֶת בְּנִי שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״ – מֵת הַבֵּן, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר הָאָב: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשֵׁנִי״ שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַקְפָּדָה – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve father two years, On the condition that you will nurse my son two years, the son died or the father said: I do not want you to serve me, did not in anger is not bill of divorce
llm_translation: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you serve my father for two years"; "on the condition that you nurse my son for two years" - if the son dies, or if the father says, "I do not mind if you do not serve me" without any stipulation - it is not a valid divorce document.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה – גֵּט. כְּלָל אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כׇּל עַכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הֵימֶנָּה – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: like this bill of divorce. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel stated a principle: any hindrance that does not from her, it is bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Like this - a get." In general, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: "Any obstruction that does not have its seal - this is a get."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמִי בָּעֵינַן כּוּלֵּי הַאי?! וּרְמִינְהִי: שִׁמְּשַׁתּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד; הֱנִיקַתּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט!
human_translation: But do we require all of this And raises a contradiction she served one day she nursed one day it is bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Gemara: Do we need all of this?! And raise a contradiction: If she served him for one day, nursed him for one day - this is a divorce document!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבָּנַן, וְהָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל –
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said not difficult: This the Rabbis, and this Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said, it is not difficult: this is the Rabbanan, and this is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel –

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וּבָרַיְיתָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: The mishna Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, And the baraita the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and in the Baraita the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָוֵי, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל! אֶלָּא בָּרַיְיתָא – רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, דְּמֵיקֵל בִּתְנָאֵי; מַתְנִיתִין – רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But from the latter clause is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, by inference that the first clause not Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rather, baraita is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who is lenient with regard to a condition, The mishna the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel should be included in the list of the first group, is he not Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? Rather, it is a baraita - it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who is lenient in the rulings of the Tannaim; Mishna - the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּסְתָם, כָּאן בִּמְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rava said is not difficult: Here, without specification There, explicitly
llm_translation: Rava said, it is not difficult: here in a general case, here in a specific case.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כׇּל סְתָם נָמֵי כִּמְפָרֵשׁ ״יוֹם אֶחָד״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Any unspecified also considered as though explicitly one day.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Every unspecified matter is like the explicit "one day."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כַּמָּה הִיא מְנִיקָתוֹ? שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא – נִיחָא; אֶלָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, לְמָה לִי שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים? לְמָה לִי שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ? בְּיוֹם אֶחָד סַגִּי!
human_translation: We learned How long she to nurse him two years Rabbi Yehuda says: eighteen months. Granted, according to Rava, works out well But according to Rav Ashi, why do I two years why do I eighteen months? One day suffice
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: How long is the period of nursing? Two years. Rabbi Yehuda says: eighteen months. If it is according to Rava, it is fine; but according to Rav Ashi, why do I need two years? Why do I need eighteen months? One day is sufficient!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: יוֹם אֶחָד – מִשְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים; לְאַפּוֹקֵי לְאַחַר שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים – דְּלָא. יוֹם אֶחָד – מִשְּׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ; לְאַפּוֹקֵי לְאַחַר שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – דְּלָא.
human_translation: This is what is saying One day from two years to exclude after two years not one day from eighteen months to exclude after eighteen months
llm_translation: So it is stated: one day - from two years; to go out after two years - no. One day - from eighteen months; to go out after eighteen months - no.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשִׁי אֶת אַבָּא שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״; ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתָּנִיקִי אֶת בְּנִי שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״ – מֵת הַבֵּן, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר הָאָב ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשֵׁנִי״ שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַקְפָּדָה – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: raises an objection This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve father two years, on the condition that you will nurse my son two years, the son died or the father said: I do not want you to serve me, did not in anger, is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Challenger: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce on the condition that you serve my father for two years"; "on the condition that you nurse my son for two years" - if the son dies, or if the father says, "I do not want you to serve me" without any stipulation - it is not a valid bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא – רֵישָׁא בִּדְלָא פָּרֵישׁ, סֵיפָא דְּפָרֵישׁ.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rava, the first clause about did not explicitly mention the latter clause explicitly mention
llm_translation: In peace to Rava - the beginning is when he did not separate, the end is when he separated.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי – מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But according to Rav Ashi, what is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause? is difficult.
llm_translation: To Rav Ashe - What is different about the beginning, and what is different about the end? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשִׁי אֶת אַבָּא שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״, וְ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתָּנִיקִי אֶת בְּנִי שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַיֵּים הַתְּנַאי, הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט; לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא אָמַר לָהּ: ״אִם תְּשַׁמְּשִׁי – אִם לֹא תְּשַׁמְּשִׁי״; ״אִם תָּנִיקִי – וְאִם לֹא תָּנִיקִי״; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: The Sages taught This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve father two years, or on the condition that you will nurse my son two years, even if the condition was not fulfilled it is bill of divorce because he did not say to her: If you will serve if you will not serve If you will nurse and if you will not nurse the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce on the condition that you serve my father for two years," and "on the condition that you nurse my son for two years" - even though the condition was not fulfilled, this is a valid bill of divorce; because he did not say to her, "If you serve - if you do not serve," "If you nurse - and if you do not nurse." These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נִתְקַיֵּים הַתְּנַאי – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינוֹ גֵּט. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ תְּנַאי בַּכְּתוּבִים, שֶׁאֵינוֹ כָּפוּל.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: the condition was fulfilled this is bill of divorce, and if not this is not bill of divorce. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: You do not have a condition in the Bible that is not compounded.
llm_translation: The sages say: If the condition is fulfilled - this is a bill of divorce, and if not - it is not a bill of divorce. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: You do not have a condition in the Scriptures that is not doubled.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ; וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: לְרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ – וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין לְךָ תְּנַאי בַּכְּתוּבִים שֶׁאֵינוֹ כָּפוּל, וְהָווּ לְהוּ שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד – אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: There are who say: He is speaking to Rabbi Meir. And there are who say: He is speaking to the Rabbis. There are who say he is speaking to Rabbi Meir and this is what he is saying to him: You do not have a condition in the Bible that is not compounded, have two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rabbi Meir is saying to him; and there are those who say: to the Rabbis he is saying. There are those who say Rabbi Meir is saying to him - and this is what he is saying to him: You do not have a Mishnah in the Scriptures that is not repeated, and let there be two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one - we do not teach.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי לְרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ – וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: אִין לָךְ תְּנַאי בַּכְּתוּבִים שֶׁאֵינוֹ כָּפוּל, וְגָמְרִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: There are who say: He is saying to the Rabbis, and this is what he is saying to them: There is no condition in the Bible that is not compounded, and we learn from
llm_translation: There are those who say to the sages, he says to them - and thus he says to them: You have no Mishnah in the Scriptures that is not repeated, and we learn from them.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשִׁי אֶת אַבָּא שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״; ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתָּנִיקִי אֶת בְּנִי שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״ – מֵת הָאָב אוֹ מֵת הַבֵּן, אֵינוֹ גֵּט; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve father two years, on the condition that you will nurse my son two years, the father died or the son died, it is not bill of divorce, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And they asked: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve my father for two years"; "on the condition that you will nurse my son for two years" - if the father dies or the son dies, it is not a valid bill of divorce; these are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַיֵּים הַתְּנַאי, הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט – יְכוֹלָה הִיא שֶׁתֹּאמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי אָבִיךָ, וַאֲשַׁמְּשֶׁנּוּ״; ״תֵּן לִי בִּנְךָ, וַאֲנִיקֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Even though the condition was not fulfilled it is bill of divorce, she could have said to him: Give me your father and I will serve him, Give me your son and I will nurse him.
llm_translation: The sages say: Even though the condition was not fulfilled, this is a valid bill of divorce - she can say to him: "Give me your father, and I will serve him"; "Give me your son, and I will nurse him."

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אַדְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: difficult of Rabbi Meir with Rabbi Meir, difficult of the Rabbis with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Meir is a difficulty, the difficulty of the Rabbis is a difficulty!

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אַדְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר לָא קַשְׁיָא – הָתָם בִּדְלָא כַּפְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ, הָכָא בִּדְכַפְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ.
human_translation: not difficult of Rabbi Meir with of Rabbi Meir, there, when he did not compound his condition. Here, when he did compound his condition,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir addressed Rabbi Meir: It is not difficult. There, where he did not repeat it to his teachers, here, where he repeated it to his teachers.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא, מַאן חֲכָמִים דְּהָכָא – רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל עַכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הֵימֶנָּה, הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: And not difficult the Rabbis with of the Rabbis, whose here the Rabbis? It is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who says: any hindrance that is not from her, it is bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The sages of the sages do not pose a difficulty. Who are the sages from here? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel it is, who said: "Any peg that does not have its support, behold, this is a bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אָמַר לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתְּשַׁמְּשִׁי אֶת אַבָּא שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים״, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״ – לֹא בִּיטֵּל דִּבְרֵי הָאַחֲרוֹן אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן; רָצְתָה – מְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ, רָצְתָה – נוֹתֶנֶת לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז.
human_translation: The Sages taught said to in the presence of two This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve father two years, and he returned and said to her in the presence of two This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, the latter statement does not nullify the first she wishes, she serves she wishes, she gives him two hundred dinars
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: He said to her in the presence of two witnesses, "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will serve my father for two years." And he went back and said to her in the presence of two witnesses, "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz." The latter statement did not annul the former. If she wishes, she may serve him; if she wishes, she may give him two hundred zuz.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָמַר לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת זוּז״ – בִּיטֵּל דִּבְרֵי הָאַחֲרוֹן אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן; וְאֵין אֶחָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹנִים וְאֶחָד מִן הָאַחֲרוֹנִים מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: But he said to her in the presence of two This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, and he returned and said to her in the presence of two This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me three hundred dinars, the latter statement nullifies the first And one of the first and of the last cannot combine
llm_translation: He said to her in the presence of two: "Here is your bill of divorce on condition that you give me two hundred zuz," and then he went back and said to her in the presence of two: "Here is your bill of divorce on condition that you give me three hundred zuz" - the latter statement annuls the former, and neither the first nor the last statements combine.

hebrew_text: אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַסֵּיפָא – הֲרֵי בָּטֵל! אֶלָּא אַרֵישָׁא –
human_translation: To which If we say the latter clause, is nullified. Rather, to the first clause.
llm_translation: Ahayya? Ileima aseifa - harei batel! Ella areisha -

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, כֹּל לְקַיּוֹמֵי תְּנַאי – מִצְטָרְפִין; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: isn’t obvious Lest you say all to the existence of conditions can combine teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say, that all the statements of the Tannaim - combine; this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וְהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ מִיהוּדָה לַגָּלִיל; הִגִּיעַ לְאַנְטִיפְרַס וְחָזַר – בָּטֵל תְּנָאוֹ.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce if I do not come from now until thirty days, and he was going from Judea to the Galilee reached Antipatris and he returned his condition is void
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Here is your bill of divorce, if I do not return within thirty days from now." And he was traveling from Judea to the Galilee; he reached Antipatris and returned - his condition was annulled.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וְהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ מִגָּלִיל לִיהוּדָה, וְהִגִּיעַ לִכְפַר עוֹתְנַאי וְחָזַר – בָּטֵל תְּנָאוֹ.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce if I do not come from now until thirty days, and he was going from the Galilee to Judea, and he reached Kefar Otnai and returned his condition is void
llm_translation: "Here is your bill of divorce, if I do not return within thirty days," and he was traveling from the Galilee to Judea, and he reached the village of Otnai and returned - his condition was annulled.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וְהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְהִגִּיעַ לְעַכּוֹ וְחָזַר – בָּטֵל תְּנָאוֹ.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce if I do not come from now until thirty days, and he was going to a country overseas, and he reached Akko and returned his condition is void
llm_translation: "Here is your bill of divorce, if I do not return within thirty days," and he was going to the sea country, and he arrived at Akko and returned - his condition is nullified.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֶעֱבוֹר מִכְּנֶגֶד פָּנַיִךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״; הָיָה הוֹלֵךְ וּבָא, הוֹלֵךְ וּבָא, הוֹאִיל וְלֹא נִתְיַחֵד עִמָּהּ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce any time I will depart from your presence thirty days, he was going and coming, going and coming, since he was not secluded with her during these thirty days, this is bill of divorce.
llm_translation: "Here is your bill of divorce, as long as I pass in front of you for thirty days"; he was going and coming, going and coming, desiring but not being secluded with her - this is a divorce document.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּאַנְטִיפְרַס בְּגָלִיל הֲוָה קָיְימָא?! וּרְמִינְהִי: אַנְטִיפְרַס – בִּיהוּדָה; וּכְפַר עוֹתְנַאי – בַּגָּלִיל; בֵּינְתַיִם – מְטִילִין אוֹתוֹ לְחוּמְרָא, מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת
human_translation: Is this to say that Antipatris was in the Galilee? And raises a contradiction Antipatris in Judea, and Kefar Otnai in the Galilee. between them, a stringent is placed on it, she is divorced
llm_translation: Gemara: Was Antipras in the Galilee established?! And raise a contradiction: Antipras - in Judea; and Kfar Otnai - in the Galilee; in the meantime - they impose upon it stringency, it is expelled.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת!
human_translation: or she is not divorced.
llm_translation: And she is not divorced!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תְּרֵי תְּנָאֵי קָאָמַר לַהּ: אִי מָטֵינָא לְגָלִיל – לְאַלְתַּר לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא, וְאִי מִשְׁתַּהֵינָא בְּאוֹרְחָא תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין וְלָא אָתֵינָא – לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. הִגִּיעַ לְאַנְטִיפְרַס וְחָזַר – דְּלָא לְגָלִיל מְטָא, וְלָא אִישְׁתַּהוֹיֵי נָמֵי אִשְׁתַּהִי תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין – בָּטֵל תְּנָאוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: saying two conditions to her: If I arrive in the Galilee will be a bill of divorce immediately, or if I will tarry on the way for thirty days and I do not come will be bill of divorce. he reached Antipatris and returned as he did not arrive in the Galilee and he also did not tarry for thirty days, his condition is void
llm_translation: Abaye said, two Tannaim are speaking to her: If I go to Galilee - immediately let it be a divorce, and if I am delayed on the road for thirty days and do not arrive - let it be a divorce. If he reached Antipatris and returned - since he did not reach Galilee, and his companions did not wait for him for thirty days - his condition is annulled.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ כּוּ׳: לְמֵימְרָא דְּעַכּוֹ בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם קָיְימָא?! וְהָא אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: כִּי הֲווֹ מִיפַּטְרִי רַבָּנַן מֵהֲדָדֵי – בְּעַכּוֹ הֲווֹ מִפַּטְרִי, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָסוּר לָצֵאת מֵאָרֶץ לְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ!
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce if I do not come from now until thirty days. Is this to say that Akko is in a country overseas, But didn’t Rav Safra say: When the Sages would take leave from one another they would take leave in Akko, because it is prohibited to leave from Eretz Yisrael to outside of Eretz
llm_translation: "Here is your bill of divorce, if I do not return within thirty days." - To say that Akko in the region of the sea is established?! But Rav Safra said: When the Rabbis were exempt from the obligation of Hadadei, they were exempt in Akko, because it is forbidden to leave the land to go outside the land!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תְּרֵי תְּנָאֵי קָאָמַר לַהּ: אִי מָטֵינָא לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם – לְאַלְתַּר לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא, אִי מִשְׁתַּהֵינָא בְּאוֹרְחָא תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין וְלָא אָתֵינָא – לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. הִגִּיעַ לְעַכּוֹ וְחָזַר – דְּלָא לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם מְטָא, וְלָא אִישְׁתַּהוֹיֵי נָמֵי אִשְׁתַּהִי תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין – בָּטֵל תְּנָאוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: saying two conditions to her: If I arrive in a country overseas, will be bill of divorce immediately, if I tarry thirty days on the way and I do not come will be bill of divorce. he reached Akko and returned, as he did not reach a country overseas and he also did not tarry for thirty days, his condition is void
llm_translation: Abaye said, two Tannaim are speaking to her: If we arrive at the seaport - immediately let her be divorced, if we are delayed on the road for thirty days and do not arrive - let her be divorced. If he reached Akko and returned - since he did not arrive at the seaport, and his companions waited for him for thirty days - his condition is annulled.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֶעֱבוֹר״ וְכוּ׳: וְהָא לָא עֲבַר! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי ״פָּנַיִךְ״ – תַּשְׁמִישׁ; וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״פָּנַיִךְ״ – לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא נָקֵט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce any time I will depart But did he not pass Rav Huna said: What your presence sexual intercourse. And why does he call your presence? He employed a euphemistic expression
llm_translation: "Here is your bill of divorce as long as I pass," etc. And this one did not pass! Rav Huna said: What is meant by "your face" - marital relations; and why is it called "your face" - for the higher pleasure it takes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם ״פָּנַיִךְ״ מַמָּשׁ. מִי קָתָנֵי ״הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״? ״הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט״ קָתָנֵי – דְּלָא הָוֵי גֵּט יָשָׁן, וּלְכִי מָלוּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמֵי הָוֵי גִּיטָּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Actually, literally: Your presence, Is teaching she is divorced is teaching this is bill of divorce. is not considered an outdated bill of divorce, And when, the thirty days are fulfilled, this will be bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Always "your face" literally. Who taught "behold she is divorced"? It teaches "behold this is a bill of divorce" - for it is not an old bill of divorce, and until thirty days it is considered a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֶעֱבוֹר מִנֶּגֶד פָּנַיִךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וְהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ וּבָא, הוֹלֵךְ וּבָא; הוֹאִיל וְלֹא נִתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט; וּלְגֵט יָשָׁן אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין, שֶׁהֲרֵי לֹא נִתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: This is your bill of divorce any time I will depart from your presence thirty days, and he was going and coming, going and coming since he was not secluded with her this is bill of divorce. And one is not concerned an outdated bill of divorce, because he was not secluded with her.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: "Here is your bill of divorce, as long as I pass in front of you for thirty days," and he would go and come, go and come; since he did not become intimate with her - this is a bill of divorce; and for an old bill of divorce, we are not concerned, for he did not become intimate with her.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא פִּיֵּיס! אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הָכִי אָמַר אַבָּא מָרִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב, בְּאוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמֶנֶת עָלַי לוֹמַר שֶׁלֹּא בָּאתִי.
human_translation: But let concern perhaps he appeased Rabba bar Rav Huna said: So said my father, my teacher, in the name of Rav: where says: She is deemed credible by me to say that I did not come.
llm_translation: "And to be concerned lest he appease! Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Thus said Abba Mari in the name of Rav, by saying: 'I am trustworthy to say that I did not come.'"

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתִין: ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא פִּיֵּיס! אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הָכִי אָמַר אַבָּא מָרִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב, בְּאוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמֶנֶת עָלַי לוֹמַר שֶׁלֹּא בָּאתִי.
human_translation: There are who teach this with regard to the mishna from now if I do not come from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, this is bill of divorce. But let concern perhaps he appeased Rabba bar Rav Huna said: So said my father, my teacher, in the name of Rav: where says: She is deemed credible by me to say that I did not come,
llm_translation: There is one who teaches her a conditional bill of divorce: "From now, if I do not come from here until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - this is a valid divorce. And should we be concerned that perhaps he appeased her! Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Thus said Abba Mari in the name of Rav, by saying: "I am trustworthy to say that I did not come."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתִין, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַבָּרַיְיתָא.
human_translation: the one who taught that with regard to the mishna, all the more so with regard to the baraita .
llm_translation: One who teaches her, teaches Amatnitin, all the more so Avrayita.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַבָּרַיְיתָא – אֲבָל אַמַּתְנִיתִין, הָא לָא אֲתָא.
human_translation: the one who taught this with regard to the baraita , but with regard to the mishna, as he did not come
llm_translation: One who teaches her the Hebrew language - but the Aramaic language, this does not come.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ, אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce if I do not come from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, it is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Here is your bill of divorce, 'If I do not come from now until twelve months,' and he dies within twelve months - it is not a bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ מֵעַכְשָׁיו, אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: This is your bill of divorce from now if I do not come from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, this is bill of divorce.
llm_translation: "Here is your bill of divorce from now, if I do not come from here until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - this is a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: ״אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ – כָּתְבוּ גֵּט בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְנָתְנוּ לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: If I do not come from now until twelve months, write and give a bill of divorce to my wife, they wrote a bill of divorce during twelve months and gave after twelve months it is not bill of divorce
llm_translation: "If I do not come from here until twelve months, write and give a get to my wife" - they wrote a get within twelve months, and they gave it after twelve months - it is not a get.

hebrew_text: ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי, אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״ – כָּתְבוּ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְנָתְנוּ לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה – גֵּט.
human_translation: Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife if I do not come from now until twelve months, they wrote during twelve months but gave after twelve months, it is not bill of divorce Rabbi Yosei says: like this, bill of divorce,
llm_translation: "Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife, if I do not return from here within twelve months." - They wrote within twelve months, and they gave it after twelve months - it is not a valid divorce document. Rabbi Yosei says: In such a case, it is a valid divorce document.

hebrew_text: כָּתְבוּ לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְנָתְנוּ לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וָמֵת; אִם הַגֵּט קוֹדֵם לַמִּיתָה – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט; וְאִם מִיתָה קָדְמָה לַגֵּט – אֵינוֹ גֵּט; וְאִם אֵין יָדוּעַ – זוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: they wrote after twelve months and gave after twelve months but died, if the bill of divorce before death this is bill of divorce. But if death before the bill of divorce is not bill of divorce. And if it is not known this is where said she is divorced or she is not divorced.
llm_translation: They wrote for after twelve months, and they gave for after twelve months, and he died; if the divorce document precedes the death - this is a divorce document; but if the death precedes the divorce document - it is not a divorce document; and if it is not known - this is what they said, "she is divorced and she is not divorced."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: רַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּהָ לִינָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: taught Our Rabbis permitted her to marry
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Tanah: Raboteinu hitiruha linasei. English translation: Our Rabbis permitted her to marry.

hebrew_text: מַאן רַבּוֹתֵינוּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בֵּי דִינָא דִּשְׁרוֹ מִישְׁחָא; סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Who are our Rabbis Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: the court that permitted oil They hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says: The date in a document proves it
llm_translation: Our Rabbis? Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: In the court that appoints him through oil; they hold like Rabbi Yosei, who said: The time of a document proves it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בַּר רַבִּי הוֹרָה, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ כׇּל סִיעָתוֹ; וְאָמְרִי לָהּ כׇּל שְׁעָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia, son of Rabban Gamliel son of Rabbi taught and all of his colleagues [ siato ] did not concede to his And some say all of his life [ she’ato ]
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Yehudah Nasi, the son of Rabban Gamliel bar Rabbi taught, and all his colleagues did not acknowledge him; and some say, all his days.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְהָהוּא סָבָא: כִּי שְׁרִיתוּהָ – לְאַלְתַּר שְׁרִיתוּהָ, אוֹ לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ שְׁרִיתוּהָ? לְאַלְתַּר שְׁרִיתוּהָ – דְּהָא לָא אָתֵי; אוֹ דִלְמָא, לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ שְׁרִיתוּהָ – דְּהָא אִיקַּיַּים לֵיהּ תְּנָאוֹ?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to a certain elderly man When you permitted you permit her immediately or did you permit her after twelve months? you permit her immediately because he will not come Or perhaps you permitted her after twelve months, because condition fulfilled?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Elazar to that elder: "When you divorced her - did you divorce her immediately, or after twelve months did you divorce her?" "If you divorced her immediately - because she did not come back; or perhaps, after twelve months did you divorce her - because the condition was fulfilled?"

hebrew_text: וְתִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ מַתְנִיתִין: ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו, אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. לְאַלְתַּר הָוֵי, דְּהָא לָא אָתֵי; אוֹ דִלְמָא, לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – דְּהָא אִיקַּיַּים לֵיהּ תְּנָאֵיהּ? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וּמִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוָה בְּהָהוּא מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And let his dilemma be raised the mishna, from now if I do not come from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, this is bill of divorce. Is immediately because he will not come Or perhaps after twelve months because his condition fulfilled? Yes, indeed so; And because was at that incident,
llm_translation: And they raise an objection from a Mishnah: "From now, if I do not come from here until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - this is a bill of divorce. Immediately it should be, for if not, it will not come; or perhaps, after twelve months - for then his condition will be fulfilled? It is indeed so, and because it was in that matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר: ״לִכְשֶׁתֵּצֵא חַמָּה מִנַּרְתִּיקָהּ״ –
human_translation: Abaye said: Everyone concedes where said once the sun emerges from its sheath minnartikah ],
llm_translation: Abaye said: Everyone agrees in a case where it is stated: "When the sun emerges from its sheath" -

hebrew_text: לְכִי נָפְקָא קָאָמַר לָהּ, וְכִי מָיֵית בְּלֵילְיָא – הָוֵי גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: he is saying to her once comes out And dies during the night, will be bill of divorce after death
llm_translation: "Go out and tell her, 'If you come at night - it is a divorce after death.'"

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתֵּצֵא חַמָּה מִנַּרְתִּיקָהּ״ – מֵעַכְשָׁיו קָאָמַר לַהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: On the condition that the sun will emerge from its sheath, he is saying to from now As Rav Huna says Rav says: Anyone who states On the condition, like states: from now.
llm_translation: "‘In order for the sun to emerge from its pouch’ – from now he is saying to her, as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Anyone who says ‘in order for’ is like saying ‘from now.’"

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּ״אִם תֵּצֵא״ – מָר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּ״מֵהַיּוֹם אִם מַתִּי״, כְּ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו אִם מַתִּי״; מָר לָא סָבַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּ״אִם מַתִּי״ גְּרֵידָא.
human_translation: disagreed only in if emerges Sage, holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says the date in a document proves it and it is as From today if I die, as From now if I die. Sage, does not hold in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, and it is as only: If I die,
llm_translation: They only disagreed regarding "if she goes out" - Mar holds like Rabbi Yosei, for he said: The time of a divorce document proves against him, and it is to him as "from today if he dies," as "from now if he dies"; Mar does not hold like Rabbi Yosei, and it is to him as "if he dies" a blade.

hebrew_text: ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי, אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״ – כָּתְבוּ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife if I do not come from now until twelve months, they wrote
llm_translation: "Write and give a bill of divorce to my wife, if I do not return from here until twelve months." - They wrote it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לֵימָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי כָּתַב גֵּט עַל תְּנַאי – כָּשֵׁר? לָא; לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ פָּסוּל, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא – מִדַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר: ״אִם לֹא בָּאתִי כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ״; וְאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי״; הָכִי קָאָמַר: כִּתְבוּ מֵעַכְשָׁיו, וּתְנוּ אִם לֹא בָּאתִי. וְרַבָּנַן – לָא שְׁנָא הָכִי וְלָא שְׁנָא הָכִי.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: Shall we say Rabbi Yosei holds he wrote a bill of divorce on condition valid, No, actually I say to you invalid and here it is different. Since he could have said: If I do not come write and give but he said: Write and give if I do not come this is what is saying: Write from now, and give if I do not come And the Rabbis it is no different this and it is no different that.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yeimar to Rav Ashi: Let us say, does Rabbi Yosei hold that a conditional bill of divorce is valid? No; rather, say to him: it is invalid for you. And the difference here is that he has room to say, "If I do not come, write and give." And he said, "Write and give if I do not come." This is what he is saying: Write from now, and give if I do not come. And the Rabbis - it does not matter this way or that way.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לְאַחַר שָׁבוּעַ״ – שָׁנָה; ״לְאַחַר שָׁנָה״ – חֹדֶשׁ; ״לְאַחַר חֹדֶשׁ״ – שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: after a seven- year after year, month after month, week
llm_translation: The sages taught: "After a week" - a year; "After a year" - a month; "After a month" - Shabbat.

hebrew_text: ״לְאַחַר שַׁבָּת״, מַאי? יָתֵיב רַבִּי זֵירָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְקָאָמַר: חַד בְּשַׁבָּא, וּתְרֵי, וּתְלָתָא – בָּתַר שַׁבְּתָא. אַרְבְּעָה, וְחַמְשָׁא וּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא – קַמֵּי שַׁבְּתָא.
human_translation: after a week, what Rabbi Zeira sat before Rabbi Asi, and some say Rabbi Asi before Rabbi Yoḥanan, and he said Sunday and Monday and Tuesday after Shabbat. Wednesday and Thursday and Friday prior to Shabbat.
llm_translation: "After Shabbat," what is it? Rabbi Zeira was sitting before Rabbi Assi, and some say before him was Rabbi Yochanan, and he said: One on Shabbat, and two, and three - after Shabbat. Four, and five and onwards of Shabbat - before Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״לְאַחַר הָרֶגֶל״ – שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. נְפַק רַבִּי חִיָּיא דַּרְשַׁהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי – וְקַלְּסוּהּ; מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּים – וְלָא קַלְּסוּהּ; אַלְמָא לֵית הִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi says: after the pilgrimage Festival, thirty days Rabbi Ḥiyya went out taught in the name of Rabbi and they praised it. in the name of the majority, and they did not praise it. Apparently, the halakha is not in accordance with
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says, "After the festival" - thirty days. Rabbi Chiya derived it in the name of Rabbi - and they accepted it; in the name of the Sages - and they did not accept it. This proves that the law is not in accordance with his opinion.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מִי שֶׁאֲחָזוֹ
llm_translation: We will return to you, one who has grasped it.

hebrew_text: הַזּוֹרֵק גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהִיא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ אוֹ בְּתוֹךְ חֲצֵרָהּ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. זְרָקוֹ לָהּ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ אוֹ בְּתוֹךְ חֲצֵרוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ הוּא עִמָּהּ בַּמִּטָּה – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. לְתוֹךְ חֵיקָהּ אוֹ לְתוֹךְ קַלְתָּהּ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: one who throws a bill of divorce to his wife, and she is in her house or in her courtyard she is divorced he threw it to her in his house or in his courtyard, even if is with her in the bed, she is not divorced. into her lap, or into her basket kaltah she is divorced,
llm_translation: The one who throws a bill of divorce to his wife, and she is inside her house or inside her courtyard - she is considered divorced. If he threw it to her inside his house or inside his courtyard, even if he is with her in bed - she is not considered divorced. Into her lap or into her basket - she is considered divorced.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנָתַן בְּיָדָהּ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יָדָהּ; גַּגָּהּ, חֲצֵרָהּ וְקַרְפֵּיפָהּ – מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught: “And gives it in her hand” I have only her hand. from where her roof, her courtyard, or her enclosure? The verse states: “And gives it,” in any case,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? De'tanu rabanan: "ve'natan beyadah" - ein li ela yadah; gagah, chatzerah ve'karpeifah - minayin? Talmud lomar: "ve'natan" - mikol makom. English translation: How do we know these matters? For our Rabbis taught: "And he shall put it in her hand" - I have only her hand; her roof, her courtyard, and her balcony - from where? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall put" - from any place.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי גַּבֵּי גַנָּב: ״יָדוֹ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יָדוֹ; גַּגּוֹ, חֲצֵרוֹ וְקַרְפֵּיפוֹ – מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הִמָּצֵא תִמָּצֵא״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: And that is also taught with regard to a thief. in his hand” I have only his hand. from where his roof, his courtyard, or his enclosure, The verse states: “If be found,” in any case,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita similarly regarding a thief: "His hand" - I have nothing except his hand; his roof, his courtyard, and his fence - from where? The Talmud teaches: "If it is found, it shall be found" - in any case.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן גֵּט – מִשּׁוּם דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחַהּ מִגָּרְשָׁה; אֲבָל גַּנָּב – דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּעַל כּוּרְחֵיהּ, אֵימָא לָא;
human_translation: And necessary As if had taught us a bill of divorce, Because divorces against her will, But a thief, who is not against his will, say no,
llm_translation: "And it is necessary; for if we were to hear a divorce - because of the husband's coercion from her; but a thief - since he does not have a husband, we might say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן גַּנָּב – מִשּׁוּם דְּקַנְסֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא; אֲבָל גֵּט – אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had taught us a thief, Because the Merciful One penalized But bill of divorce, say no, necessary
llm_translation: If we hear that someone stole - because of the penalty of the Merciful One; but with regards to a divorce document - I will say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: חֲצֵרָהּ?! מָה שֶׁקָּנְתָה אִשָּׁה קָנָה בַּעְלָהּ!
human_translation: courtyard, That which a woman acquired acquired her husband,
llm_translation: Her courtyard?! Just as a woman acquires, her husband acquires!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, בְּכוֹתֵב לָהּ: ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי בִּנְכָסַיִךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: where writes to I have no legal or involvement in your property,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, "If one writes to her: 'Judgment and words I have no in your possessions.'"

hebrew_text: וְכִי כְּתַב לַהּ הָכִי – מַאי הָוֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא, הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״דִּין וּדְבָרִים אֵין לִי עַל שָׂדֶה זוֹ״; וְ״אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בָּהּ״; וְ״יָדִי מְסוּלֶּקֶת הֵימֶנָּה״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם!
human_translation: And when he writes this to her, what of it? But isn’t it taught One who says to another I have no rights and claims to this field, or: I have no involvement with it, or: My hand is removed from it; he said nothing,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if he wrote to her thus - what is the ruling? And it was taught: One who says to his fellow, 'I have no claim on this field,' and 'I have no dealings with it,' and 'my hand is withdrawn from it' - he has not said anything!" English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בְּכוֹתֵב לָהּ – וְעוֹדָהּ אֲרוּסָה, וְכִדְרַב כָּהֲנָא – דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: נַחֲלָה הַבָּאָה לוֹ לְאָדָם מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר, אָדָם מַתְנֶה עָלֶיהָ שֶׁלֹּא יִרָשֶׁנָּה;
human_translation: They say in the school of Rabbi Yannai: where he writes to her and she is still betrothed; And in accordance with of Rav Kahana, as Rav Kahana says: an inheritance that comes to a person from another place, a person can stipulate about it that he should not inherit it,
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: If one writes a document of marriage for her - and she is still engaged, and like Rav Kahana - for Rav Kahana said: If an inheritance comes to a person from elsewhere, a person can make a gift of it so that he does not inherit it.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר רָבָא, הָאוֹמֵר:
human_translation: And in accordance with of Rava, as Rava says: One who says:
llm_translation: And like Rava - for Rava said, the one who says:

hebrew_text: אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּתַקָּנַת חֲכָמִים כְּגוֹן זוֹ – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: I do not want the ordinance of the Sages such as this we listen to him.
llm_translation: If a fool in the matter of the sages, like this one - they listen to him.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּגוֹן זוֹ״? כִּדְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב – דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: יְכוֹלָה אִשָּׁה שֶׁתֹּאמַר לְבַעְלָהּ: ״אֵינִי נִיזּוֹנֶית וְאֵינִי עוֹשָׂה״.
human_translation: What Such as this that which Rav Huna Rav says. As Rav Huna says Rav says: A woman can say to her husband: I do not be sustained and I will not do
llm_translation: What is "like this"? As Rav Huna said in the name of Rav - for Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: A woman can say to her husband, "I am not sustained and I do not do."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אַטּוּ יָדָהּ מִי לָא קַנְיָא לֵיהּ לְבַעַל?! אֶלָּא גִּיטָּהּ וְיָדָהּ בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד; הָכָא נָמֵי – גִּיטָּהּ וַחֲצֵרָהּ בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rava said Is that to say her hand is not acquired by her husband? Rather, her bill of divorce and her hand, enter simultaneously. Here too, her bill of divorce and her courtyard enter simultaneously,
llm_translation: Rava said: Does her hand alone not acquire her for her husband?! Rather, her get and her hand come together as one; here too - her get and her courtyard come together as one.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: רָבָא – יָד דְּאִשָּׁה קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ?! נְהִי דְּקָנֵי לַהּ לְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, יָדָהּ גּוּפַהּ מִי קַנְיָ[א] לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Was difficult for Rava the hand of a woman? Though to her earnings belong to does her hand itself belong to him?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "Rava - the hand of a woman is difficult for him? Even though he acquires her for the purpose of her handiwork, does he acquire her hand as well?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָבָא – יַד הָעֶבֶד קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ; לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: בִּשְׁטָר – עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, יַד עֶבֶד כְּיַד רַבּוֹ דָּמְיָא! אֶלָּא גִּטּוֹ וְיָדוֹ בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד; הָכִי נָמֵי – גִּיטָּהּ וַחֲצֵירָהּ בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: said to him: difficult for Rava the hand of a slave, According to the one who says with a bill by himself, the hand of a slave like the hand of his master, Rather, his bill and his hand enter simultaneously. So too, her bill of divorce and her courtyard enter simultaneously.
llm_translation: He said to him: Rava - the hand of the slave is difficult for him; according to the one who says: in a document - it is considered as his own hand, the hand of a slave is like the hand of his master! Rather, his bill of divorce and his hand come together as one; so too, her bill of divorce and her field come together as one.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא שְׁכִיב מְרַע דִּכְתַב לַהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי פַּנְיָא דְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְמִיתְּבֵיהּ לַהּ. לִמְחַר, תְּקַף לֵיהּ עָלְמָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ אֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ, לַיקְנְיֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ לְהָהוּא דּוּכְתָּא דְּיָתֵיב בֵּיהּ גִּיטָּא, וְתֵיזִיל אִיהִי וְתֵיחוֹד וְתִפְתַּח וְתַחְזֵיק בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: a certain person on his deathbed who wrote a bill of divorce for his wife toward the evening of the coming of the Shabbat, but he did not manage to give it to her. The next day his condition intensified came before Rava He said to them: Go tell him to transfer to her of that place where the bill of divorce is resting, and she should go and close and open and assert ownership over it,
llm_translation: That one who was lying ill, who wrote a get for his wife in the presence of those who ascend on Shabbat, and did not manage to give it to her. The next day, the world turned against him. They came before Rava, he said to them: Go and tell him, let him acquire her through that document that is sitting in which the get is written, and she should go and take possession and open and hold onto it.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: נָעַל, גָּדַר, פָּרַץ כׇּל שֶׁהוּא – הֲרֵי זוֹ חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: As we learned one locked, fenced breached any amount, this is taking possession
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: If one locked, fenced, or breached a property boundary in any way - this constitutes a valid demarcation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב עִילִישׁ לְרָבָא: מָה שֶׁקָּנְתָה אִשָּׁה קָנָה בַּעְלָהּ! אִיכְּסִיף.
human_translation: Rav Ilish said to Rava: that which a woman acquired acquired her husband? was embarrassed
llm_translation: Rav Eilish said to Rava: "Whatever a woman acquires, her husband acquires!" He added.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּי מִילְּתָא דַּאֲרוּסָה הֲוַאי. אָמַר רָבָא: אִם אָמְרוּ בִּנְשׂוּאָה, יֹאמְרוּ בַּאֲרוּסָה?! הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: לָא שְׁנָא אֲרוּסָה וְלָא שְׁנָא נְשׂוּאָה – גִּיטָּהּ וַחֲצֵירָהּ בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: Ultimately, it was revealed that she was a betrothed woman. Rava said: if they said with regard to a married woman they say with regard to a betrothed woman? Rava then said: is no difference a betrothed woman, and there is no difference a married woman, her bill of divorce and her courtyard enter simultaneously.
llm_translation: At the end of the matter of betrothal, he is. Rava said: If they said in marriage, should they say in betrothal?! Rava then said: Betrothal is no different from marriage - her divorce and her property come together as one.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַמְרַהּ רָבָא מֵעִיקָּרָא! כִּי אַמְרַהּ רָבָא – אַהַאי מַעֲשֶׂה אַמְרַהּ.
human_translation: But Rava say this at the outset? When Rava said this he said it in connection with this incident.
llm_translation: And this, Rava said initially! When Rava said - this matter he said.

hebrew_text: וְהִיא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ. אָמַר עוּלָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁעוֹמֶדֶת בְּצַד בֵּיתָהּ וּבְצַד חֲצֵרָהּ. רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ הִיא בִּטְבֶרְיָא וַחֲצֵרָהּ בְּצִיפּוֹרִי; הִיא בְּצִיפּוֹרִי וַחֲצֵרָהּ בִּטְבֶרְיָא – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: and she is in her house, Ulla says: This is she is standing next to her house and next to her courtyard, Rabbi Oshaya says: Even she in Tiberius and her courtyard in Tzippori, she in Tzippori and her courtyard in Tiberius, she is divorced.
llm_translation: "And she is inside her house." Ulla said: "And that is when she is standing at the side of her house and at the side of her courtyard." Rabbi Oshaya said: "Even if she is in Tivraia and her courtyard is in Tzipori; if she is in Tzipori and her courtyard is in Tivraia - she is divorced."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״הִיא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ וּבְתוֹךְ חֲצֵרָהּ״ קָתָנֵי! הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״וְהִיא כְּמִי שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ״; ״וְהִיא כְּמִי שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ חֲצֵרָהּ״ – דְּכֵיוָן דְּחָצֵר מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְדַעְתָּהּ הִיא, מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: But isn’t taught she is in her house and in her courtyard? This is what is saying: And she is like one who is in her house; and she is like one who is in her courtyard. since it is a courtyard that is secured with her knowledge, she is divorced.
llm_translation: "And this, 'she is within her house and within her courtyard,' is what it teaches! Thus it is saying: 'And she is like one who is within her house'; 'and she is like one who is within her courtyard' – since when the courtyard is preserved according to her will, she is divorced."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר: חָצֵר מִשּׁוּם יָדָהּ אִתְרַבַּאי; וּמָר סָבַר: חָצֵר מִשּׁוּם שְׁלִיחוּת אִתְרַבַּאי?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this Sage, holds courtyard is included as her hand. And Sage, holds courtyard is included as agency,
llm_translation: Let us say in this case he divided - for Mar holds: a courtyard due to her hand is acquired; and Mar holds: a courtyard due to her agency is acquired?

hebrew_text: לָא; דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא – חָצֵר מִשּׁוּם יָדָהּ אִיתְרְבַּאי; מָר סָבַר: כְּיָדָהּ – מָה יָדָהּ בִּסְמוּכָה, אַף חֲצֵרָהּ בִּסְמוּכָה.
human_translation: No, everyone courtyard is included as her hand. Sage, holds like her hand. Just as her hand is next to so too, her courtyard, when next to
llm_translation: Not; all the world - courtyard from the hand its is increased; master thought: like her hand - what her hand in close, also her courtyard in close.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ – אִי, מָה יָדָהּ בִּדְבוּקָה, אַף חֲצֵרָהּ בִּדְבוּקָה?! אֶלָּא כְּיָדָהּ – מָה יָדָהּ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְדַעְתָּהּ, אַף חֲצֵרָהּ הַמִּשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְדַעְתָּהּ; לְאַפּוֹקֵי חֲצֵרָהּ הַמִּשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתָּהּ.
human_translation: And the other if just as her hand is attached so too, her courtyard when attached Rather, like her hand, just as her hand is secured with her knowledge, so too, her courtyard that is consciously secured by her to exclude her courtyard that is not consciously secured by her,
llm_translation: And the other - if, what is the hand in attachment, so too its courtyard in attachment?! Rather, like the hand - just as the hand is preserved for its knowledge, so too its courtyard that is preserved for its knowledge; to exclude its courtyard that is preserved without its knowledge.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּזְרַק לַהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ. הֲוָה קָיְימָא בְּחָצֵר. אֲזַל גִּיטָּא, נְפַל בְּפִיסְלָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: חָזֵינַן, אִי הָוְיָא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת עַל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת – פְּלַג לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ; וְאִי לָא – חֲדָא רְשׁוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: a certain man who threw a bill of divorce to his wife she was standing in a courtyard. The bill of divorce went fell onto a board Rav Yosef said: We see If the four cubits by four cubits, it a separate domain of its own And if not it is one domain,
llm_translation: That man who threw a get to his wife. He was standing in the courtyard. The get went, fell into the idol. Rav Yosef said: We see, if it was four cubits by four cubits - he has divided the domain for himself; and if not - it is one domain.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּחָצֵר דִּידַהּ, כִּי הָוֵי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא בְּחָצֵר דִּידֵיהּ, כִּי לָא הָוֵי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: With what are we dealing If we say in her courtyard, if had four cubits, what of it? Rather, in his courtyard; if not have four cubits, what of it?
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? If you say in our courtyard, when it is four cubits, what is it? Rather, in its courtyard, when it is not four cubits, what is it?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאוֹשְׁלַהּ מָקוֹם; דְּחַד מָקוֹם מוֹשְׁלִי אִינָשֵׁי, תְּרֵי מְקוֹמוֹת לָא מוֹשְׁלִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: No, necessary where he lent her place, since people lend one place, people do not lend two places,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it has a place; for one place people govern, two places people do not govern.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֹא גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה, אֲבָל גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הָוֵי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: And we said only was not ten higher But ten higher, even though not have four cubits,
llm_translation: And we did not say except that it is not high ten, but high ten - even though it is not four cubits.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ
human_translation: And we said only does not have
llm_translation: And we did not say except that it does not have.

hebrew_text: שֵׁם לְוַוי, אֲבָל אִית לֵיהּ שֵׁם לְוַוי – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הָוֵי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: a modifier, But it has a modifier, even though it is not ten higher and even though not have four cubits,
llm_translation: Name of Levi, but has name of Levi - even though not high ten, and even though not be four cubits.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הוּא עִמָּהּ בַּמִּטָּה כּוּ׳: אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּמִטָּה שֶׁלּוֹ, אֲבָל בְּמִטָּה שֶׁלָּהּ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: even if is with her in the bed, Rava says: They taught only in his bed. But in her bed, she is divorced.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even if he is with her in the bed, etc. Rava said: They only taught this regarding his bed, but in her bed - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בְּמִטָּה שֶׁלּוֹ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, בְּמִטָּה שֶׁלָּהּ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Eliezer says: in his bed, she is not divorced; in her bed, she is divorced.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says: In his bed - she is not divorced, in her bed - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: וּבְמִטָּה שֶׁלָּהּ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת? כִּלְיוֹ שֶׁל לוֹקֵחַ בִּרְשׁוּת מוֹכֵר הוּא; שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: כִּלְיוֹ שֶׁל לוֹקֵחַ בִּרְשׁוּת מוֹכֵר – קָנָה לוֹקֵחַ?
human_translation: in her bed, is she divorced? is vessels of a buyer in the domain of the seller, you conclude from vessels of a buyer in the domain of the seller, the buyer acquires
llm_translation: In her bed - divorced? The vessel of the buyer in the domain of the seller it is; you heard from her kind: the vessel of the buyer in the domain of the seller - did the buyer acquire?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּגָבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה. וְהָאִיכָּא מְקוֹם כַּרְעֵי! אַמְּקוֹם כַּרְעֵי לָא קָפְדִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: No, necessary where ten high, But there is the place legs People are not particular the place of the legs
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it is ten high. But what about the space for the feet? In a place for the feet, people are not particular.

hebrew_text: לְתוֹךְ חֵיקָהּ אוֹ לְתוֹךְ קַלְתָּהּ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת: אַמַּאי? כִּלְיוֹ שֶׁל לוֹקֵחַ בִּרְשׁוּת מוֹכֵר הוּא!
human_translation: into her lap, or into her basket, she is divorced, Why Is this the vessels of a buyer in the domain of the seller,
llm_translation: Into her bosom or into her basket - she is divorced. Why? Because the utensil of the buyer is in the possession of the seller!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה קַלְתָּהּ תְּלוּיָה בָּהּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה קַלְתָּהּ תְּלוּיָה בָּהּ. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: קְשׁוּרָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ תְּלוּיָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: where her basket was hanging from her And so Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: where her basket was hanging from her And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: tied even though it is not hanging
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: For example, if her basket was hanging on her. And similarly, Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: For example, if her basket was hanging on her. And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Tied, even though it is not hanging on her.

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה קַלְתָּהּ מוּנַּחַת לָהּ בֵּין יַרְכוֹתֶיהָ. רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא בַּר רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה בַּעְלָהּ מוֹכֵר קְלָתוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: where her basket was placed between her thighs Rav Mesharshiyya bar Rav Dimi says: where her husband was a basket seller,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: For example, if her womb was resting between her thighs. Rav Mesharshya bar Rav Dimi said: For example, if her husband was selling her thighs.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מְקוֹם חֵיקָהּ קָנוּי לָהּ, מְקוֹם קַלְתָּהּ קָנוּי לָהּ. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם מַקְפִּיד לֹא עַל מְקוֹם חֵיקָהּ וְלֹא עַל מְקוֹם קַלְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the place of her lap belongs to her, the place of her basket belongs to her. Rava said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan’s Because a person is not particular, not about the place of lap, nor about the place of her basket,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The place of her bosom is designated for her, the place of her thigh is designated for her. Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan's statement? Because a person is not particular about either the place of her bosom or the place of her thigh.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: זְרָקוֹ לָהּ לְתוֹךְ חֵיקָהּ אוֹ לְתוֹךְ קַלְתָּהּ, אוֹ לְתוֹךְ כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא כְּקַלְתָּהּ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: This is also taught he threw to her into her lap, or into her basket, or into anything that is like her basket, then she is divorced.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If he threw it into her bosom, or into her basket, or into anything that is like her basket - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: ״כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא כְּקַלְתָּהּ״ – לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵיתוֹיֵי טַסְקָא דְּאָכְלָה בַּהּ תַּמְרֵי.
human_translation: What is included Anything that is like her basket? to include the basket [ taska ] from which she eats dates,
llm_translation: "Any matter that is like its peel" - to what is this referring? To what is the case of a palm branch that has eaten dates in it comparable.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר לָהּ: ״כִּנְסִי שְׁטַר חוֹב זֶה״, אוֹ שֶׁמְּצָאַתּוּ מֵאֲחוֹרָיו, קוֹרְאָה וַהֲרֵי הוּא גִּיטָּהּ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לַהּ: ״הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ״.
human_translation: he said to Take this promissory note, or she found it behind him she reads it and it is her bill of divorce, it is not bill of divorce until he says to her: This is your bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He said to her, "Here is a promissory note of this debt," or if she found it behind him, she reads it and behold, it is her divorce document - it is not a divorce document until he says to her, "Behold, this is your divorce document."

hebrew_text: נָתַן בְּיָדָהּ וְהִיא יְשֵׁנָה; נֵיעוֹרָה, קוֹרְאָה, וַהֲרֵי הוּא גִּיטָּהּ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לָהּ ״הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ״.
human_translation: he gave it in her hand and she sleeping, woke her, and she reads it, it is her bill of divorce, it is not bill of divorce until he says to her: This is your bill of divorce.
llm_translation: He gave in her hand and she is sleeping; she wakes up, reads, and behold, it is her bill of divorce - it is not a divorce document until he says to her, "Here is your bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כִּי אָמַר לַהּ: ״הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ״ מַאי הָוֵי? הָוֵה לֵיהּ ״טְלִי גִּיטִּיךְ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע״,
human_translation: when he says to her: This is your bill of divorce, what of it? it is Take your bill of divorce from on the ground?
llm_translation: The text reads: "Gemar, when he said to her: 'Here is your divorce document,' what is the status? It is considered to her as 'Take your divorce document from upon the ground.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: ״טְלִי גִּיטִּיךְ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם! אֵימָא: שֶׁשְּׁלָפַתּוּ מֵאֲחוֹרָיו.
human_translation: And Rava says Take your bill of divorce from on the ground, he didn’t say anything Say that she pulled it out from behind him.
llm_translation: And Rava said: "Remove your bill of divorce from upon the ground" - he did not say anything! Rather, say: that she took it out from behind him.

hebrew_text: שְׁלָפַתּוּ נָמֵי, הָא בָּעֵינָא ״וְנָתַן בְּיָדָהּ״, וְלֵיכָּא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּעֲרַק לַהּ חַרְצֵיהּ, וּשְׁלַפְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: she pulled it out, also required “And gives it in her hand” and it is not No, necessary where he bent da’arak his waist and she pulled it out,
llm_translation: His garment, they said, "and he shall place it in her hand," but it is not necessary! For he already tore it and handed it to her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אָמַר לָהּ ״כִּנְסִי שְׁטַר חוֹב זֶה״, אוֹ שֶׁשְּׁלָפַתּוּ מֵאֲחוֹרָיו, קְרָאַתּוּ וַהֲרֵי הוּא גִּיטָּהּ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לָהּ ״הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ גֵּט, עַד שֶׁיִּטְּלֶנּוּ הֵימֶנָּה, וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיִתְּנֶנּוּ לָהּ, וְיֹאמַר לָהּ ״הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ״.
human_translation: This is also taught he said to Take this promissory note, or she pulled it out from behind him, read it, and it is her bill of divorce; it is not bill of divorce until he says to her: This is your bill of divorce. the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Actually, it is not bill of divorce until he takes it from her and gives it to her again, and says to her: This is your bill of divorce.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said to her, "Bring this promissory note of debt," or if she took it out from behind him, she read it and behold, it is her bill of divorce - it is not a valid divorce document until he says to her, "Here is your bill of divorce," the words of Rabbi.
