Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: It is never a valid divorce document until he hands it to her, takes it back, and gives it to her again, and says to her, "Here is your bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: נְתָנוֹ בְּיָדָהּ וְהִיא יְשֵׁנָה, נֵיעוֹרָה וְקוֹרְאָה וַהֲרֵי הוּא גִּיטָּהּ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לָהּ: ״הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּטְּלֶנּוּ הֵימֶנָּה, וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיִתְּנֶנּוּ לָהּ, וְיֹאמַר לָהּ ״הֵא גִּיטִּיךְ״.
human_translation: he gave it in her hand, and she sleeping, woke her, and she reads it, it is her bill of divorce; it is not bill of divorce until he says to her: This is your bill of divorce. the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: until he takes it from her and gives it to her again, and says to her: This is your bill of divorce.
llm_translation: They gave it into her hand and she was sleeping, she wakes up and reads it, and behold, it is her bill of divorce - it is not a divorce document until he says to her: "Here is your bill of divorce," the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: It is not a divorce document until he takes it from her, goes back and gives it to her, and says to her, "Here is your bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהַהִיא קָאָמַר רַבִּי – מִשּׁוּם דְּבַת אִיגָּרוֹשֵׁי הִיא; אֲבָל נָתַן בְּיָדָהּ וְהִיא יְשֵׁנָה, דְּלָאו בַּת אִיגָּרוֹשֵׁי הִיא – אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר;
human_translation: And necessary As if been stated with regard to the first clause, Rabbi is saying with regard to this because she is subject to being divorced, But he gave it in her hand and she sleeping, she is not subject to being divorced say concedes to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar
llm_translation: And it is necessary; for if it was stated in that case before him, in that case Rabbi said - because it is the daughter of divorcees; but if he placed it in her hand and she is asleep, for she is not the daughter of divorcees - say that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar agrees with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר; אֲבָל בְּהָךְ – אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if been stated with regard to this with regard to this Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar is saying But in the other say he concedes to Rabbi necessary
llm_translation: "And if it was stated in this case, in this case Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said; but in that case - say that he agrees with Rabbi; this is necessary."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כָּתַב לָהּ גֵּט, וּנְתָנוֹ בְּיַד עַבְדָּהּ יָשֵׁן, וּמְשַׁמַּרְתּוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. נֵיעוֹר – אֵינוֹ גֵּט, דְּהָוְיָא לַיהּ חָצֵר הַמִּשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rava says: he wrote a bill of divorce for her, and he placed it in the hand of her slave he is sleeping and she is guarding him, it is bill of divorce. was awake, it is not bill of divorce he is a courtyard that is not consciously secured by her.
llm_translation: Rava said: He wrote for her a bill of divorce, and he gave it into the hand of her old maidservant, and she guards it - this is a bill of divorce. If she is young - it is not a bill of divorce, for it becomes like a courtyard that is guarded without her knowledge.

hebrew_text: יָשֵׁן וּמְשַׁמַּרְתּוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. אַמַּאי? חָצֵר מְהַלֶּכֶת הִיא, וְחָצֵר מְהַלֶּכֶת לֹא קָנָה!
human_translation: he is sleeping and she is guarding him, it is bill of divorce. why; is a mobile courtyard, and a mobile courtyard does not acquire
llm_translation: "He sleeps and she guards him - this is a divorce document. Why? It is a courtyard that is walking, and a walking courtyard does not acquire!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא יָשֵׁן שָׁאנֵי, וְהָא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מְהַלֵּךְ לֹא קָנָה, עוֹמֵד וְיוֹשֵׁב – לֹא קָנָה! וְהִלְכְתָא: בְּכָפוּת.
human_translation: And if you would say sleeping is different but didn’t Rava say: any if he would be moving not acquire standing or sitting, not acquire And halakha where bound
llm_translation: And if you say, "Perhaps he was asleep," but didn't Rava say: Anyone who, even if he walks, did not acquire, standing and sitting - did not acquire! And the halakha is in accordance with the stringent opinion.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ; קָרוֹב לָהּ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. קָרוֹב לוֹ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן קִדּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: was standing in the public domain and threw it to her, closer to her, she is divorced, closer to him, she is not divorced. equally balanced, she is divorced or she is not divorced. And same with regard to betrothal.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If she was standing in a public domain and he threw it to her; if he is close to her - she is divorced. If he is close to him - she is not divorced. If it is half and half - she is divorced and she is not divorced. And so too regarding matters of betrothal.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַחוֹב, אָמַר לוֹ בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ: ״זְרוֹק לִי חוֹבִי״, וּזְרָקוֹ לוֹ; קָרוֹב לַמַּלְוֶה – זָכָה הַמַּלְוֶה. קָרוֹב לַלֹּוֶה – הַלֹּוֶה חַיָּיב. מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה – שְׁנֵיהֶם יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: And same with regard to a debt. his creditor said to him: Throw my debt to me, and he threw it to him closer to the creditor, creditor acquired closer to the debtor the debtor obligated equally balanced the two of them divide
llm_translation: And similarly regarding a debt, the lender said to him: "Throw me my debt," and he threw it to him; if the borrower is close – the lender has acquired. If the lender is close – the borrower is liable. Half and half – they shall divide it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָמֵי קָרוֹב לָהּ, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי קָרוֹב לוֹ? אָמַר רַב: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁלָּהּ – זֶהוּ קָרוֹב לָהּ, אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ – זֶהוּ קָרוֹב לוֹ.
human_translation: What is considered closer to her, and what is considered closer to him? Rav says: four cubits of her, this is Closer to her; four cubits of him, this is Closer to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Heich di damei karov lah, veheich di damei karov lo? Amar Rav: Arba amot shelah - zehu karov lah, arba amot shelo - zehu karov lo. English translation: Gemara: How are the blood relatives of a woman considered close to her, and how are the blood relatives of a man considered close to him? Rav said: Four cubits of hers - this is considered close to her, four cubits of his - this is considered close to him.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה? אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן עוֹמְדִין בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: What is considered midway? Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: Such as the two of them were standing within four cubits.
llm_translation: "How are the laws of dividing equally? Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said: For example, when both of them were standing within four cubits."

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְזֵי הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ קְדֵים! וְכִי תֵּימָא דַּאֲתוֹ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, וְהָא אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם!
human_translation: And let us see which of them preceded And if you would say that both of them came simultaneously, but it is impossible to be precise?
llm_translation: And to Yechzei, he was from among them, from the east! And if you say that they both came together in the presence of Hadadei, but it is impossible to limit!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הָכָא בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה אַמּוֹת מְצוּמְצָמוֹת עָסְקִינַן,
human_translation: Rather, Rav Kahana said: Here we are dealing with precisely eight cubits,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Kahana said: Here we are dealing with eight narrow cubits.

hebrew_text: וְגֵט יוֹצֵא מֵאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: and bill of divorce extends from his four cubits into her four cubits,
llm_translation: And a get exits from his four cubits to her four cubits.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲגִיד גַּבֵּיהּ! אֶלָּא רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הָכָא בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים עָסְקִינַן – אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת קָרוֹב לוֹ, וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת קָרוֹב לָהּ.
human_translation: But isn’t attached to him, Rather, Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: Here we are dealing with two groups of witnesses; one says closer to him, and one says closer to her.
llm_translation: And behold, I will tell you the strength of his argument! Rather, Rabba and Rav Yosef who both say: Here we are dealing with two groups of witnesses - one group says "close to him," and one group says "close to her."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: ״קָרוֹב לָהּ״ שָׁנִינוּ – אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה אַמָּה; וְ״קָרוֹב לוֹ״ שָׁנִינוּ – אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה אַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: We learned closer to her even one hundred cubits And we learned closer to him even one hundred cubits
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan says: "Close to her" we have learned - even from one hundred cubits; and "close to him" we have learned - even from one hundred cubits.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה? אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא, לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוּא יָכוֹל לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ וְהִיא אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ – זֶהוּ קָרוֹב לוֹ; הִיא יְכוֹלָה לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ וְהוּא אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ – זֶהוּ קָרוֹב לָהּ; שְׁנֵיהֶם יְכוֹלִין לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ, שְׁנֵיהֶם אֵין יְכוֹלִין – זֶהוּ מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה.
human_translation: what are the circumstances equally balanced? Rav Shemen bar Abba said: This was explained to me by Rabbi Yoḥanan he can guard it and she cannot guard it, this is closer to him. she can guard it and he cannot guard it, this is closer to her. the two of them can guard it, the two of them cannot this is equally balanced.
llm_translation: How are the laws of dividing equally on both sides? Rav Shemen bar Abba said: According to my understanding, it can be explained based on the teaching of Rabbi Yochanan: If he is able to guard it and she is not able to guard it - it is considered closer to him; if she is able to guard it and he is not able to guard it - it is considered closer to her; if both of them are able to guard it, or if neither of them are able to guard it - this is dividing equally on both sides.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן הָכִי, אָמַר: יָדְעִין חַבְרִין בַּבְלָאֵי לְפָרוֹשֵׁי כִּי הַאי טַעְמָא!
human_translation: The Rabbis said this before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the name of Rabbi Yonatan, said our Babylonian friends know how to explain in accordance with this explanation?
llm_translation: The sages said before Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yonatan thus: He said, "The colleagues in Babylon knew to interpret this reason!"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא קָרוֹב לָהּ מִלּוֹ, וּבָא כֶּלֶב וּנְטָלוֹ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת?! כֹּל הָיכִי תִּינְטְרֵיהּ וְתֵיזִיל?
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Eliezer says: any that is closer to her than to him, and a dog came and took it she is not divorced. she is not divorced? Must she continue guarding indefinitely,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who is close to her from the beginning, and a dog comes and takes it – she is not divorced. She is not divorced?! In such a case, should we wait and see?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו הָכִי קָאָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁקָּרוֹב לָהּ מִלּוֹ; וְאִילּוּ בָּא כֶּלֶב וּנְטָלוֹ – וְהוּא יָכוֹל לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ וְהִיא אֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ, אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rather, is it not this is what is saying: any that is closer to her than to him, and if a dog come and take it, he able to guard it and she not able to guard it, she is not divorced,
llm_translation: Rather, this is what he is saying: anyone who is close to her, and if a dog came and took it, and he is able to guard it but she is not able to guard it, she is not divorced.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, כְּדֵי שֶׁתָּשׁוּחַ וְתִטְּלֶנּוּ. וְאַתְּ לָא תַּעֲבֵיד עוֹבָדָא, עַד דְּמָטֵי גִּיטָּא לִידַהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: One with large teeth shinnana so that she could bend down and take it. And you should not perform an action until the bill of divorce reaches her hand.
llm_translation: Samuel said to Rav Yehudah: "A tooth, in order to extract and remove it. But you should not do the work until the bill of divorce reaches her hand."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא הָכִי, וְאַצְרְכוּהָ חֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: There was an incident like this, and, they required the ritual through which the yavam frees the yevama of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ]
llm_translation: Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: The matter was thus, and they needed a chalitza.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן קִדּוּשִׁין. אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְגִיטִּין אָמְרוּ, וְלֹא לְדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: And same with regard to betrothal. Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They said with regard to bills of divorce, but not with regard to another matter.
llm_translation: And so too regarding the matter of Kiddushin. Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They said this regarding Gitin, and not for another matter.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן קִדּוּשִׁין! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דִּכְתִיב ״וְיָצְאָה״–״וְהָיְתָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Rabbi Asi And same with regard to betrothal. It is different there as it is written: “And she departs and becomes
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Abba to Rabbi Assi: And similarly regarding the matter of Kiddushin! It is different there, for it is written "and she shall go out" - "and she shall be."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַחוֹב, ״זְרוֹק לִי חוֹבִי״ וּזְרָקוֹ לוֹ, קָרוֹב לַמַּלְוֶה – זָכָה הַלֹּוֶה, קָרוֹב לַלֹּוֶה – הַלֹּוֶה חַיָּיב, מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה – שְׁנֵיהֶם יַחְלוֹקוּ!
human_translation: Another objection to raised And same with regard to a debt. Throw my debt to me, and he threw it to him closer to the creditor, debtor merits, closer to the debtor the debtor obligated equally balanced the two of them divide
llm_translation: He raised an objection: And similarly regarding a debt, "Throw my debt to me" and he threw it to him, close to the lender - the borrower has acquired, close to the borrower - the borrower is obligated, half and half - they shall divide it!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״זְרוֹק לִי חוֹבִי וְתִיפָּטֵר״. אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״זְרוֹק לִי חוֹבִי בְּתוֹרַת גִּיטִּין״.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where said to Throw my debt to me, and you will be absolved If so, what of stating No, necessary where said to Throw my debt to me to the procedure bills of divorce,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For he said to him: "Throw my debt and be exempt." If so, what is there to say? It is not necessary, for he said to him: "Throw my debt in the manner of divorce documents."

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, מָצֵי אָמַר לֵיהּ מְשַׁטֶּה אֲנִי בָּךְ; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And still, what of stating Lest you say can say to I am teasing you, teaches us
llm_translation: And now, what is there to say? What might you suggest, that he said to her, "I am disgusted by you"? We hear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גֵּט בְּיָדָהּ וּמְשִׁיחָה בְּיָדוֹ; אִם יָכוֹל לְנַתְּקוֹ וְלַהֲבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: the bill of divorce was in her hand and a string in his hand, if can pull and bring it to him, she is not divorced; and if not she is divorced.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "A get in her hand and he anoints it in his hand; if he is able to detach it and bring it to him - she is not divorced, and if not - she is divorced."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? בָּעֵינַן כְּרִיתוּת, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: What is the reason we require severance, and it is lacking,
llm_translation: What is the reason? We require a clear distinction, and it is not available.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָיְתָה יָדָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה כְּקָטַפְרֵס, וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ; אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: her hand was positioned like a slope and he threw it to her, despite that the bill of divorce reached her hand, she is not divorced,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Her hand was made like a sickle, and he threw it to her; even though the divorce document reached her hand - she is not divorced.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? הָא כִּי נָפֵיל – בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דִּידַהּ קָא נָפֵיל! בִּדְלָא נָח.
human_translation: Why? But when falls it falls within her four cubits. where did not rest
llm_translation: "Why? Because when it falls - it falls within its own four cubits! If not, it does not fall."

hebrew_text: וְתִיגָּרַשׁ מֵאַוֵּירָא דְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת! תִּפְשׁוֹט דְּבָעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ, יֵשׁ לָהֶן אֲוִיר אוֹ אֵין לָהֶן אֲוִיר? תִּפְשׁוֹט דְּאֵין לָהֶן אֲוִיר!
human_translation: But let her be divorced the airspace of four cubits? resolve that Rabbi Elazar raised the four cubits that stated Do they have airspace or do they not have airspace? Resolve that they do not have airspace.
llm_translation: And she shall be divorced from the airspace of four cubits! Interpret the words of Rabbi Eliezer - four cubits that they said, do they have airspace or do they not have airspace? Interpret that they do not have airspace!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּעוֹמֶדֶת עַל גַּב הַנָּהָר, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לְאִיבּוּד קָאֵי.
human_translation: here we are dealing with standing at the riverbank, as stands to be destroyed from the outset,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - when standing on the bank of the river, where initially for immersion it stands.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת עַל רֹאשׁ הַגָּג וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לַאֲוִיר הַגָּג – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. הוּא מִלְּמַעְלָה וְהִיא מִלְּמַטָּה, וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָא מֵרְשׁוּת הַגָּג, נִמְחַק אוֹ נִשְׂרַף – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: was standing on top of the roof and he threw to her, once reaches the airspace of the roof, she is divorced. he above and she below, and he threw it to her, once it leaves the area of the roof, was erased or was burned she is divorced.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one was standing on the roof and threw something to her, once it reaches the airspace of the roof, she is divorced. He is above and she is below, and he threw it to her. Once it exits the domain of the roof, whether it was erased or burned, she is divorced.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָא לָא מִינְּטַר! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּגַג שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַעֲקֶה עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: But isn’t unsecured? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: We are dealing with a roof that has a parapet.
llm_translation: Gemara: But isn't this not necessary! Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: We are dealing with a roof that has a parapet.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא בַּר מְנַשְּׁיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דַּאֲבִימִי אָמַר: הָכָא בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג עָסְקִינַן, דְּכֹל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה סָמוּךְ לַגַּג – כְּגַג דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Ulla bar Menashya said in the name of Avimi Here we are dealing with within three of the roof, as anything within three of the roof is like the roof
llm_translation: Ulla bar Menashiya, whose father's name was Avimi, said: Here we are dealing with a roof that is less than three handbreadths from the edge of the roof, for any roof that is less than three handbreadths from the edge of the roof is considered as the edge of the roof.

hebrew_text: הוּא מִלְּמַעְלָה: וְהָא לָא מִינְּטַר! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ מְחִיצוֹת הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת עוֹדְפוֹת עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: he above But isn’t not secured, Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: where the lower partitions extend beyond the upper
llm_translation: He from above: but not from below! Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: For example, when the lower partitions protruded over the upper ones.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ מְחִיצוֹת הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת עוֹדְפוֹת עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת. וְכֵן אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ מְחִיצוֹת הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת עוֹדְפוֹת עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: And so Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: where the lower partitions extend beyond the upper And so Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: where the lower partitions extend beyond the upper
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya: For example, the lower partitions were protruding over the upper ones. And so said Ulla said Rabbi Yochanan: For example, the lower partitions were protruding over the upper ones.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְעוּלָּא: כְּמַאן, כְּרַבִּי – דְּאָמַר: קְלוּטָה, כְּמִי שֶׁהוּנְּחָה דָּמְיָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Ulla: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi who said in airspace is considered at rest?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Abba to Ulai: Like whom, like Rabbi - who said: "Kluta, like one who is resting of blood?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן – עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי, אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת; אֲבָל הָכָא – מִשּׁוּם אִינְּטוֹרֵי הוּא, וְהָא קָא מִינְּטַר.
human_translation: said to him: You even say the Rabbis, the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi only with regard to Shabbat. But here, it is because is secured and it is secured
llm_translation: He said to him: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis - up to this point the Rabbis do not argue with Rabbi, except regarding the matter of Shabbat; but here - it is due to an interruption, and here it is interrupted.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ מְחִיצוֹת הַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת עוֹדְפוֹת עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: כְּמַאן, כְּרַבִּי – דְּאָמַר: קְלוּטָה כְּמִי שֶׁהוּנְּחָה דָּמְיָא?
human_translation: And so Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: where the lower partitions extend beyond the upper Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi who says in airspace is considered at rest?
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: For example, the lower partitions were protruding over the upper ones. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Assi: Like whom, like Rabbi - who said: A receptacle is like one that is designated for its contents?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן – עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי, אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת; אֲבָל הָכָא – מִשּׁוּם אִינְּטוֹרֵי הוּא, וְהָא קָא מִינְּטַר.
human_translation: said to him: You even say the Rabbis, the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi only with regard to Shabbat. But here, it is because is secured and it is secured
llm_translation: He said to him: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis - up to this point the Rabbis do not argue with Rabbi, except regarding the matter of Shabbat; but here - it is due to a different reason, and this is what is being discussed.

hebrew_text: נִמְחַק: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּמְחַק דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה, אֲבָל נִמְחַק דֶּרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה – לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא לְמֵינַח קָאֵי.
human_translation: was erased Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: They taught only when was erased descent, But was erased ascent, no, What is the reason initially, is not destined to land
llm_translation: Erased: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: They only taught regarding erasure through descent, but erasure through ascent - no. What is the reason? It is not standing on its original foundation.

hebrew_text: נִשְׂרַף: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁקָּדַם גֵּט לִדְלֵיקָה, אֲבָל קָדְמָה דְּלֵיקָה לְגֵט – לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? מֵעִיקָּרָא לִשְׂרֵיפָה קָאָזֵיל.
human_translation: was burned Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: They taught only when bill of divorce preceded the fire. But fire preceded the bill of divorce, not What is the reason initially, it was heading toward being burned,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Nisraf: Amar Rav Nachman Amar Rabba Bar Avuh: Lo Shanu Ela Shekadim Get Lidleikah, Aval Kadma Dleikah Legget - La. Mai Ta'ama? Me'ikara Lisreifah Ka'azil." English translation: "It was burned: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba Bar Avuh: They only taught that if the divorce document preceded the kindling, it is valid, but if the kindling preceded the divorce document - no. What is the reason? Because it is going from the outset to burning."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רְשׁוּיוֹת חֲלוּקוֹת בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Domains are divided with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The permissions are divided in gittin.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְרָבָא: מְנָא לֵיהּ לְסָבָא הָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, מַתְנִיתִין הִיא: הָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת עַל רֹאשׁ הַגָּג וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לַאֲוִיר הַגָּג – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said to Rava: From where does the Elder, this said to him: It is the mishna was standing on the top of the roof and threw to her once the bill of divorce reaches the airspace of the roof, she is divorced.
llm_translation: He said to him, Ramei son of Hama to Rava: From where does he derive this? He said to him, it is a Mishnah: If she was standing on the roof and he threw the bill of divorce to her, once the bill of divorce reached the airspace of the roof - she is considered divorced.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּגַג דִּידַהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידַהּ, לְמָה לִי אֲוִיר הַגָּג?
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If we say with her roof and her courtyard, why do I the airspace of the roof
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? Perhaps with the roof of this one and the courtyard of this one, why do I need the air of the roof?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּגַג דִּידֵיהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידֵיהּ, כִּי הִגִּיעַ לַאֲוִיר הַגָּג מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: Rather, with his roof and his courtyard. when reaches the airspace of the roof, what of it?
llm_translation: Rather, on its own roof and its own courtyard, when it reaches the airspace of the roof, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא – בְּגַג דִּידַהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידֵיהּ. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הוּא מִלְּמַעְלָה וְהִיא מִלְּמַטָּה וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ; כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָא מֵרְשׁוּת הַגָּג, נִמְחַק אוֹ נִשְׂרַף – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. וְאִי בְּגַג דִּידַהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידֵיהּ, אַמַּאי מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת? אֶלָּא בְּגַג דִּידֵיהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידַהּ;
human_translation: Rather, is obvious with her roof and his courtyard. Say the latter clause he above and she below, and he threw it to her, once it leaves the area of the roof, was erased or was burned she is divorced. And if with her roof and his courtyard, why is she divorced? Rather, with his roof and her courtyard.
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious – in its roof and its courtyard. Say the latter part: he from above and she from below and he threw to her; once it exits from the domain of the roof, if it is erased or burnt – she is divorced. And if in its roof and its courtyard, why is she divorced? Rather, in its courtyard and its roof.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא בְּגַג דִּידַהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידֵיהּ, סֵיפָא בְּגַג דִּידֵיהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידַהּ?!
human_translation: the first clause with her roof and his courtyard, and the latter clause with his roof and her courtyard?
llm_translation: The beginning in the roof of hers and the courtyard of his, the end in the roof of his and the courtyard of hers?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו דְּאוֹשְׁלַהּ מָקוֹם – דְּחַד מָקוֹם מוֹשְׁלִי אִינָשֵׁי, תְּרֵי מְקוֹמוֹת לָא מוֹשְׁלִי אִינָשֵׁי?
human_translation: Rather, is it not that where he lent her place that people lend one place; people do not lend two places.
llm_translation: Rather, is it not because the place was slippery - where one place is ruled by people, two places are not ruled by people?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִידֵי אִירְיָא?! דִּלְמָא הָא כִּדְאִיתַהּ וְהָא כִּדְאִיתַהּ – רֵישָׁא בְּגַג דִּידַהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידֵיהּ, סֵיפָא בְּגַג דִּידֵיהּ וְחָצֵר דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: said to Are the cases comparable? Perhaps this as it is and that as it is, the first clause with her roof and his courtyard, the latter clause with his roof and her courtyard.
llm_translation: He said to him: From the roof of yours?! Perhaps this one is as you say, and this one is as you say - the beginning in his roof and courtyard of hers, the end in his roof and courtyard of hers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ מִדּוֹת בְּגִיטִּין; הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי: קְלוּטָה כְּמִי שֶׁהוּנְּחָה, וּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עָלֶיהָ – הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת, אֲבָל הָכָא מִשּׁוּם אִינְּטוֹרֵי הוּא, וְהָא מִינְּטַר;
human_translation: Rava says: three qualities with regard to bills of divorce, that which Rabbi says: in airspace is at rest; and the Rabbis disagree with him. This matter applies with regard to Shabbat. But here, it is because is secured and it is secured
llm_translation: Rava said: Three categories in bills of divorce; this that Rabbi said: like one who was led, and the Rabbis disputed it - those matters are for the purpose of Shabbat, but here it is because it is a matter of interest, and it is a matter of interest.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: נָעַץ קָנֶה בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד וּבְרֹאשׁוֹ טְרַסְקָל, וְזָרַק וְנָח עַל גַּבָּיו – אֲפִילּוּ גָּבוֹהַּ מֵאָה אַמָּה, חַיָּיב, לְפִי שֶׁרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד עוֹלָה עַד לָרָקִיעַ – הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת, אֲבָל הָכָא מִשּׁוּם אִינְּטוֹרֵי הוּא, וְהָא לָא מִינְּטַר;
human_translation: And that which Rav Ḥisda says embedded a reed in a private domain, and on its top was a basket [ teraskal ], and he threw it rested on top of it, even a hundred cubits high, he is liable because the private domain extends upward until the sky. This matter applies with regard to Shabbat, But here, it is because is secured and it is not secured.
llm_translation: And this that Rav Ḥisda said: If one inserted a reed into a private domain with a tile at its top, and he threw it and it landed on his shoulders - even if it is higher than a hundred cubits, he is liable, because the private domain extends up to the sky. Those words are relevant to the matter of Shabbat, but here it is due to an unintentional act, and this is not unintentional.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בְּגַג זֶה וְיִקְלוֹט מֵי גְשָׁמִים מִגַּגּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁכְּשֵׁם שֶׁדִּיּוּרִין חֲלוּקִין מִלְּמַטָּה, כָּךְ דִּיּוּרִין חֲלוּקִין מִלְּמַעְלָה –
human_translation: And that which Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: a person should not stand on this roof and collect rainwater from the roof of another As just as the residences are separated below, so too, the residences are separated above.
llm_translation: And this that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A person should not stand on this roof and cause rainwater to drip from his neighbor's roof, for just as the apartments are divided below, so too the apartments are divided above –

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן גֵּט – מִשּׁוּם קְפִידָא הוּא, וְכוּלֵּי הַאי לָא קָפְדִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: This matter applies with regard to Shabbat. But with regard to a bill of divorce, due to is particular but people are not particular to that extent,
llm_translation: These matters are relevant to the issue of Shabbat, but regarding the matter of divorce - it is due to strictness, and all these people are not strict.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁתֵּי חֲצֵרוֹת זוֹ לִפְנִים מִזּוֹ, פְּנִימִית שֶׁלָּהּ וְחִיצוֹנָה שֶׁלּוֹ, וּמְחִיצוֹת הַחִיצוֹנוֹת עוֹדְפוֹת עַל הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת; וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ; כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לַאֲוִיר מְחִיצוֹת הַחִיצוֹנָה – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Abaye says: two courtyards this within that inner is hers and outer is his, and partitions the outer extend higher than the inner and he threw to her once it reaches the airspace of the partitions of the outer she is divorced.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Two courtyards, this one inside of that one, its inner one hers and its outer one his, and the partitions of the outer ones protrude over the inner ones; and he threw it to her; once it reached the airspace of the outer partitions - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? פְּנִימִית גּוּפַהּ – בִּמְחִיצוֹת הַחִיצוֹנָה קָא מִינַּטְרָה.
human_translation: What is the reason inner itself is secured by partitions the outer
llm_translation: What is the reason? Its inner part - it is considered an interposition within the outer partitions.

hebrew_text: מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּקוּפּוֹת – שְׁתֵּי קוּפּוֹת זוֹ בְּתוֹךְ זוֹ, פְּנִימִית שֶׁלָּהּ וְחִיצוֹנָה שֶׁלּוֹ; וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ; אֲפִילּוּ הִגִּיעַ לַאֲוִיר פְּנִימִית – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: This is not so with regard to baskets. two baskets, this within that the inner is hers and the outer is his, and he threw to her even reached the airspace the inner she is not divorced.
llm_translation: What is not so with regard to "kupot" - two "kupot," this one within the other, its inner one belonging to it and its outer one belonging to it; and he threw it to her; even if it reached the inner air, it is not considered as being driven away.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּהָא לָא נָח.
human_translation: What is the reason because not rest
llm_translation: What is the reason? Because it is not fitting.

hebrew_text: וְכִי נָח מַאי הָוֵי? כִּלְיוֹ שֶׁל לוֹקֵחַ בִּרְשׁוּת מוֹכֵר הוּא!
human_translation: And when it rests what of it? are vessels of a buyer in the domain of the seller,
llm_translation: And when Noah, what is it? A vessel of the buyer in the possession of the seller it is!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּקוּפָּה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ שׁוּלַיִים.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? With a basket that has no bottom,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - a basket that does not have handles.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: פּוֹטֵר אָדָם אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט יָשָׁן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹסְרִין. וְאֵיזֶהוּ גֵּט יָשָׁן – כֹּל שֶׁנִּתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהּ מֵאַחַר שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ לָהּ.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: A man may send, his wife with an outdated bill of divorce, and Beit Hillel prohibit And what is an outdated bill of divorce? Any where he was secluded with her after he wrote it for her
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Beit Shammai say: A man may divorce his wife with an old bill of divorce. Beit Hillel say: They may not. What is considered an old bill of divorce? Any document that he wrote for her after he secluded with her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ גִּיטָּהּ קוֹדֵם לִבְנָהּ;
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Beit Shammai hold we do not say decree, lest they say her bill of divorce precedes her son.
llm_translation: Gemara: With what do they disagree? Beit Shammai hold: We do not say a decree lest they say her get before her marriage.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: אָמְרִינַן גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ גִּיטָּהּ קוֹדֵם לִבְנָהּ.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold we do say decree, lest they say her bill of divorce precedes her son.
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: we say decree lest say her divorce before her menstruation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִם נִישֵּׂאת, לֹא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says Shmuel says: if was married she not leave
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba said Samuel: If married, not shall go out.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִם נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, תִּינָּשֵׂא לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: And there are who say Rabbi Abba says Shmuel says: If she was divorced marry ab initio
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rabbi Abba said in the name of Shmuel: If she was divorced, she may remarry immediately.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כָּתַב לְשׁוּם מַלְכוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת; לְשׁוּם מַלְכוּת מָדַי; לְשׁוּם מַלְכוּת יָוָן; לְבִנְיַן הַבַּיִת; לְחוּרְבַּן הַבַּיִת;
human_translation: he wrote in the name of a kingdom that is not legitimate, in the name of the kingdom of Media, in the name of the Greek Empire, to the building of the Temple, to the destruction of the Temple,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one writes for the sake of a kingdom that is not dignified; for the sake of the kingdom of Media; for the sake of the kingdom of Greece; for the construction of a house; for the destruction of a house.

hebrew_text: הָיָה בַּמִּזְרָח וְכָתַב בַּמַּעֲרָב; בַּמַּעֲרָב וְכָתַב בַּמִּזְרָח – תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וּצְרִיכָה גֵּט מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה.
human_translation: he was in the east and he wrote in the west, in the west and he wrote in the east, she leave this and that and she needs a bill of divorce from this and that
llm_translation: He was in the east and wrote in the west; in the west and wrote in the east - she may depart from here and from here, and she requires a bill of divorce from here and from here.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לָהּ לֹא כְּתוּבָּה וְלֹא פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא מְזוֹנוֹת וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת – לֹא עַל זֶה, וְלֹא עַל זֶה.
human_translation: And she does not receive marriage contract, and not profits and not sustenance, and not worn clothes not of this and not of that
llm_translation: And she has neither writing nor fruits nor sustenance nor obligations - not for this, and not for that.

hebrew_text: אִם נָטְלָה מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה – תַּחְזִיר. וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה. וְלֹא זֶה וָזֶה מְטַמְּאִין לָהּ, וְלֹא זֶה וָזֶה זַכָּאִין – לֹא בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וְלֹא בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: If she took from this or from that she return And the child from this or from that son born from an adulterous relationship [ mamzer ]. And neither this nor that become ritually impure by her And neither this nor that have the rights to objects she finds, or to her earnings, or to the annulment of her vows.
llm_translation: If she took from this one and from this one - she shall return. And the mamzer offspring from this one and from this one. And neither this one nor that one render her impure, and neither this one nor that one render her pure - neither by her existence, nor by her actions, nor by the annulment of her vows.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – נִפְסֶלֶת מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: she was an Israelite woman, she disqualified from priesthood,
llm_translation: The daughter of Israel - disqualified from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: בַּת לֵוִי – מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. בַּת כֹּהֵן – מִן הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: daughter of a Levite, from the tithe daughter of a priest, from teruma ,
llm_translation: Daughter of Levi - from the tithe. Daughter of Kohen - from the contribution.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין יוֹרְשִׁין שֶׁל זֶה וְיוֹרְשִׁין שֶׁל זֶה יוֹרְשִׁים כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. וְאִם מֵתוּ – אָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה וְאָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה חוֹלְצִין, וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין.
human_translation: And the heirs of this and the heirs of that do not inherit her marriage contract And if die, the brother of this and the brother of that perform ḥalitza , and they do not consummate the levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And not inheritors of this one and inheritors of this one inherit according to its writing. And if they die - the brothers of this one and the brothers of this one perform chalitzah, and do not perform yibum.

hebrew_text: שִׁינָּה שְׁמוֹ, וּשְׁמָהּ, שֵׁם עִירוֹ, וְשֵׁם עִירָהּ – תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: he changed his name, or her name, the name of his city or the name of her city, she leave this and that And all of those ways to her
llm_translation: Shinna his name, and her name, the name of his city, and the name of her city - she shall depart from this and from this, and all these ways in it.

hebrew_text: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ ״צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת״ –
human_translation: all which they said those with whom relations are forbidden, the rival wives are permitted
llm_translation: All the forbidden relationships that they said, "their rivals are permitted" -

hebrew_text: הָלְכוּ הַצָּרוֹת הָאֵלּוּ וְנִישְּׂאוּ, וְנִמְצְאוּ אֵלּוּ אַיְילוֹנִיֹּת – תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: These rival wives went and married and these were found sexually underdeveloped women [ ailonit ]. leave this and that And all of those ways to her
llm_translation: The troubles went and were lifted, and these were found - the fir trees will come out from here and from here, and all these paths are in it.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ, וְהָלְכָה צָרָתָהּ וְנִישֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר, וְנִמְצֵאת זוֹ – שֶׁהָיְתָה אַיְילוֹנִית; תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: one who marries his yevama , and her rival wife went and got married to another and it was found that this was a sexually underdeveloped woman, leave this and that And all of those ways to her
llm_translation: Gathering his yevamah, and the halakhah is that her rival marries, and she is found to be this one - that she was sterile; she shall depart from here and from here, and all these paths are in her.

hebrew_text: כָּתַב סוֹפֵר גֵּט לָאִישׁ, וְשׁוֹבָר לָאִשָּׁה; וְטָעָה וְנָתַן גֵּט לָאִשָּׁה, וְשׁוֹבָר לָאִישׁ, וְנָתְנוּ זֶה לָזֶה;
human_translation: A scribe wrote a bill of divorce for a man, and a receipt for the woman, And erred and gave bill of divorce to the woman and receipt to the man, and they gave to each other.
llm_translation: A scribe writes a bill of divorce for a man, and breaks it for a woman; and if he erred and gave the bill of divorce to the woman, and breaks it for the man, and they exchange it with each other.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַחַר זְמַן הֲרֵי הַגֵּט יוֹצֵא מִיַּד הָאִישׁ וְשׁוֹבָר מִיַּד הָאִשָּׁה – תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: And after time, the bill of divorce is in the possession of the man, and the receipt is in the possession of the woman, she leave this, and that, And all of those ways to her
llm_translation: And after time, behold the get exits from the hand of the man and breaks from the hand of the woman - she shall depart from this one and from this one, and all these ways are in it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם לְאַלְתַּר יָצָא, אֵין זֶה גֵּט; אִם לְאַחַר זְמַן יָצָא, הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט – לֹא כָּל הֵימֶנּוּ מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן לְאַבֵּד זְכוּתוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: If is immediately [ le’altar ] in this is not bill of divorce, if it is in after time, this is bill of divorce, it is not in the power of the first to eliminate the right of the second
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: If he divorced immediately, this is not a get; if he divorced after some time, this is a get - not everyone who divorces from the first to lose the right of the second.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״מַלְכוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת״? רוֹמִי. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לַהּ מַלְכוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת? מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין לָהֶם לֹא כְּתָב, וְלֹא לָשׁוֹן.
human_translation: What A kingdom that is not legitimate? the Roman Empire, And why is it called: A kingdom that is not legitimate? Because they have neither script, nor language,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "a kingdom that is not respectable"? - Roman. And why is it called a kingdom that is not respectable? Because they have neither script nor language.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: מִפְּנֵי מָה תִּיקְּנוּ מַלְכוּת בְּגִיטִּין – מִשּׁוּם שְׁלוֹם מַלְכוּת.
human_translation: Ulla said: For what did institute kingdom, in bills of divorce? Due to peaceful the kingdom,
llm_translation: Ula said: "For what reason did they establish the kingdom in divorce documents? Because of the peace of the kingdom."

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם שְׁלוֹם מַלְכוּת – תֵּצֵא וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר?!
human_translation: But due to peaceful the kingdom, leave and the offspring is a mamzer ?
llm_translation: "And because of the peace of the kingdom - shall the legitimate child be considered a mamzer?!"

hebrew_text: אִין, רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְטַעְמֵיהּ – דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כָּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה מִמַּטְבֵּעַ שֶׁטָּבְעוּ חֲכָמִים בְּגִיטִּין – הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Yes. Rabbi Meir to his reasoning. As Rav Hamnuna says in the name of Ulla: Rabbi Meir would say anyone deviating from the formula coined by the Sages for bills of divorce, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: There is, Rabbi Meir according to his reasoning - as Rav Hamnuna said in the name of Ulla, Rabbi Meir would say: Anyone who deviates from the natural way that the Sages established in matters of divorce - the child is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: לְשׁוּם מַלְכוּת יָוָן. וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן מַלְכוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת – מִשּׁוּם דִּמְלִיכָא; אֲבָל מַלְכוּת מָדַי וּמַלְכוּת יָוָן – מַאי דַהֲוָה הֲוָה;
human_translation: in the name of the Greek Empire, And necessary As, if had taught us a kingdom that is not legitimate, because ruling, But the kingdom of Media, and the Greek Empire, what was, was,
llm_translation: For the sake of the kingdom of Greece. And it is necessary; for if we were to hear of a kingdom that is not fitting - because the king; but the kingdom of Media and the kingdom of Greece - what was, was.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מַלְכוּת מָדַי וּמַלְכוּת יָוָן – מִשּׁוּם דְּמַלְכְוָתָא הָווּ; אֲבָל בִּנְיַן הַבַּיִת – מַאי דַהֲוָה הֲוָה;
human_translation: And if had taught us the kingdom of Media and the Greek Empire, because they were kingdoms, But the building of the Temple, what was, was,
llm_translation: And if we were to hear about the kingdom of Media and the kingdom of Greece - because they were kingdoms; but regarding the construction of the house - what was, was.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בִּנְיַן הַבַּיִת – דְּאָמְרִי: קָמַדְכְּרִי שְׁבָחַיְיהוּ; אֲבָל חוּרְבַּן הַבַּיִת, דְּצַעֲרָא הוּא – אֵימָא לָא; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had taught us the building of the Temple, will say: mention their praise, But the destruction of the Temple, which is a anguish say no, necessary
llm_translation: "And if we were to hear regarding the construction of the house - for they say: 'they praised its beauty'; but regarding the destruction of the house, which is a sorrow - I would say no; it is necessary."

hebrew_text: הָיָה בַּמִּזְרָח וְכָתַב בַּמַּעֲרָב: מַאן? אִילֵּימָא בַּעַל, הַיְינוּ ״שִׁינָּה שְׁמוֹ וּשְׁמָהּ, שֵׁם עִירוֹ וְשֵׁם עִירָהּ״!
human_translation: he was in the east and he wrote in the west, Who If we say husband this is He changed his name, or her name; the name of his city or the name of her city.
llm_translation: He was in the east and wrote in the west: Who? If you say Baal, that is "His name and her name, the name of his city and the name of her city!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו סוֹפֵר – כְּדַאֲמַר לְהוּ רַב לְסָפְרֵיהּ, וְכֵן אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא לְסָפְרֵיהּ: כִּי יָתְבִיתוּ בְּשִׁילֵי, כְּתוּבוּ בְּשִׁילֵי; וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִימַּסְרָן לְכוּ מִילֵּי בְּהִינֵי. וְכִי יָתְבִיתוּ בְּהִינֵי, כְּתוּבוּ בְּהִינֵי; וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִימַּסְרָן לְכוּ מִילֵּי בְּשִׁילֵי.
human_translation: Rather, is it not a scribe As Rav said to his scribes, and similarly, Rav Huna said to his scribes: When you are situated in Shili, write In Shili, even though the matters were presented to you, in Hini. And when you are situated in Hini, write: In Hini, even though the matters were presented to you in Shili.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not like the scribe - as Rav said to his scribes, and so too Rav Huna said to his scribes: "When you sit in the shade, write in the shade; and even though they handed you matters in the sun. And when you sit in the sun, write in the sun; and even though they handed you matters in the shade."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says:
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא כָּתַב אֶלָּא לְשֵׁם סַנְטָר שֶׁבָּעִיר – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, But the Rabbis say: Even if he wrote only in the name of guardsman [ santar ] in the city, she is divorced,
llm_translation: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the sages say: Even if one only wrote for the sake of a document in the city council - she is divorced.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גִּיטָּא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ לְשֵׁם אִיסְטַנְדְּרָא דְּבַשְׁכָּר, שַׁלְחֵהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא, מַאי?
human_translation: a certain bill of divorce in which was written in the name of the governor [ istandera ] of Bascar, Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda sent this before Rabba: What a case like this?
llm_translation: That bill of divorce that was written in it for the sake of the innkeeper of Baskhar, Rav Nachman sent it with Rav Hisda's son to be brought before Rabba: "Regarding this case, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: בְּהָא אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר מוֹדֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא? מֵאוֹתָהּ מַלְכוּת הוּא.
human_translation: He sent him With regard to this, even Rabbi Meir concedes What is the reason? is from that kingdom,
llm_translation: Send to him: In this case, even Rabbi Meir agrees, what is the reason? It is from that kingdom.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִסַּנְטָר שֶׁבָּעִיר? הָתָם זִילָא לְהוּ מִילְּתָא, הָכָא שְׁבִיחָא לְהוּ מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: And what is different from the guardsman in the city? There, it is demeaning for them Here, it is complimentary for them
llm_translation: And what is the difference from the officer in the city? There, go tell them the matter, here, speak to them the matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר. וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, שֶׁאִם שִׁינָּה שְׁמוֹ וּשְׁמָהּ, שֵׁם עִירוֹ וְשֵׁם עִירָהּ – שֶׁהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says Rav Huna says Rav says: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, But the Rabbis say: the offspring is unflawed. And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir, that if he changed his name or her name, the name of his city or the name of her city, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav: These are the words of Rabbi Meir, but the Sages say: the offspring is legitimate. And the Sages concede to Rabbi Meir that if one changed his name and her name, the name of his city and the name of her city - the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: שִׁינָּה שְׁמוֹ וּשְׁמָהּ, שֵׁם עִירוֹ וְשֵׁם עִירָהּ – תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: We, too, learn he changed his name or her name, the name of his city or the name of her city, she leave this and that and all of those ways to her.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, "We also learned: 'His name and her name, the name of his city and the name of her city - she shall go out from here and from here, and all these paths are in it."

hebrew_text: הָא מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר – לִיעָרְבִינְהוּ וְלִיתְנִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבָּנַן; שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: who teaches this If we say Rabbi Meir, let him combine and teach them Rather, conclude from it the Rabbis. Conclude from it
llm_translation: The text: Who taught it to him? If you say Rabbi Meir - let him mix them and teach them! Rather, learn from it the Rabbis; learn from it.

hebrew_text: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ כּוּ׳. נִישְּׂאוּ – אֵין, זִינּוּ – לָא;
human_translation: all which they said those with whom relations are forbidden, they married yes, engaged in licentious sexual intercourse, no,
llm_translation: All forbidden relationships that they said "yes" - are not, they said "no."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא – דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה, אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ!
human_translation: Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna says: A widow awaiting her brother-in-law who engaged in licentious sexual intercourse she is prohibited from her yavam .
llm_translation: Let it be the response of Rav Hamnuna - for Rav Hamnuna said: A yevamah who committed adultery is forbidden to her yavam!

hebrew_text: לָא; נִישְּׂאוּ – וְהוּא הַדִּין לְזִינּוּ. וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי נִישְּׂאוּ – לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא נָקֵט.
human_translation: No, they married, and the same is true in they engaged in licentious sexual intercourse. And this that teaches: they married, employed a euphemistic expression,
llm_translation: Not lifted; they were married - and it is the same for his prostitute. And this that it teaches "they were married" - for a higher level of prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: נִישְּׂאוּ – וְהוּא הַדִּין לְזִינּוּ;
human_translation: And there are who say they married, and the same is true in they engaged in licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: And there are those who say: "They were married" - and it is the same as "they committed adultery."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הַמְנוּנָא – דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה – אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ?
human_translation: Let us say supports Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna says: A widow awaiting her brother-in-law who engaged in licentious sexual intercourse is prohibited from her yavam .
llm_translation: Let us say, it assists for Rav Hamnuna - for Rav Hamnuna said: A yevamah who committed adultery - is she forbidden to her yavam?

hebrew_text: לָא; נִישְּׂאוּ דַּוְוקָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחַלְּפָא בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: No, specifically they married because is confused with a woman whose husband traveled to a country overseas
llm_translation: Not; they were specifically married, because he exchanged with a woman whose husband went to the country of the sea.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ כּוּ׳. וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אִיקַּיַּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם;
human_translation: one who marries his yevama , And necessary As, if had taught us with regard to the first because the mitzva of levirate marriage was not fulfilled
llm_translation: The one who gathers his yevamah, so. And it is necessary; for if we would hear in that case - because he does not fulfill the mitzvah of yibum.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא – דְּאִיקַּיַּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם, אֵימָא לָא;
human_translation: But here, where the mitzva of levirate marriage was fulfilled say not
llm_translation: But here - since the mitzvah of yibum is established, why not?

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא – מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא רַמְיָא קַמֵּיהּ; אֲבָל הָתָם – דְּלָא רַמְיָא קַמֵּיהּ, אֵימָא לָא; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had taught us here, because was placed before But there, that she is not placed before him, say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear here - because he is raising an objection before him; but there - because he is not raising an objection before him, say no; it is necessary.

hebrew_text: כָּתַב הַסּוֹפֵר וְטָעָה, וְנָתַן גֵּט לָאִשָּׁה וְשׁוֹבָר וְכוּ׳; רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר אִם לְאַלְתַּר יָצָא וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: the scribe wrote and erred and gave bill of divorce to the woman and the receipt Rabbi Eliezer says: If is immediately in
llm_translation: The scribe wrote and erred, and gave a bill of divorce to the woman and tore it, etc.; Rabbi Eliezer says if immediately he went out, etc.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי לְאַלְתַּר, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי לְאַחַר זְמַן? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין וַעֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן – זֶהוּ לְאַלְתַּר; עָמְדוּ – זֶהוּ לְאַחַר זְמַן.
human_translation: What are the circumstances immediately and what are the circumstances after time? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: All while that they are sitting and are engaged in the issue this is immediately. they arose this is after time.
llm_translation: "How are they similar to immediately, and how are they similar to after some time? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Any time they are sitting and engaging in that matter - this is similar to immediately; if they stood up - this is similar to after some time."

hebrew_text: וְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר: לֹא נִישֵּׂאת – זֶהוּ לְאַלְתַּר; נִישֵּׂאת – זֶהוּ לְאַחַר זְמַן.
human_translation: And Rav Adda bar Ahava says: she was not married this is immediately, she was married, this is after time.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "Lo niseit - this is for immediate consumption; niseit - this is for later consumption."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: לֹא כׇּל הֵימֶנּוּ מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן לְאַבֵּד זְכוּתוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה – הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״שֵׁנִי״, אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל – מַאי ״שֵׁנִי״?
human_translation: We learned It is not in the power of the first to eliminate the right of the second Granted, according to Rav Adda bar Ahava, this is that which is taught: second But according to Shmuel, what second
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Not everyone who is appointed from the first is to lose the merit of the second. Granted according to Rav Adda bar Ahava - that is what is taught as "second," but according to Shmuel - what is "second"?

hebrew_text: זְכוּת הָרְאוּיָה לַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: the right that is due second
llm_translation: The merit fitting for the second.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כָּתַב לְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְנִמְלַךְ; בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנְּתָנוֹ לָהּ עַל תְּנַאי, וְלֹא נַעֲשָׂה הַתְּנַאי – לֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: one wrote to divorce his wife, and reconsidered Beit Shammai say: he disqualified her from the priesthood. And Beit Hillel say: Even if he gave to her conditionally and the condition was not fulfilled, he did not disqualify her from the priesthood.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one wrote a bill of divorce to divorce his wife, and it was lost, and he became a king, Beit Shammai say: She is disqualified from the priesthood. And Beit Hillel say: Even though he gave it to her conditionally, and the condition was not fulfilled, she is not disqualified from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מְנַשֶּׁה מִדְּוִיל, לִשְׁמוּאֵל: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, יָצָא עָלָיו קוֹל – ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן כָּתַב גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְיוֹשֶׁבֶת תַּחְתָּיו וּמְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Menashe from Devil, sent to Shmuel: Our teacher, instruct us. about whom rumor circulated: So-and-so priest wrote a bill of divorce to his wife, but she is residing under his and attending to him; what is
llm_translation: Gemara: Shalach leih Rav Yosef bereih d'Rav Menasheh miD'vil, l'Shmuel: Yelammedeinu Rabbeinu, yatza alav kol - "Ish ploni kohen katav get l'ishto, v'yoshevet tachto u'meshamasho," mahhu?

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: תֵּצֵא, וְהַדָּבָר צָרִיךְ בְּדִיקָה. מַאי הִיא? אִילֵימָא דְּאִי מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא אוֹ לָא מְבַטְּלִינַן; וְהָא נְהַרְדְּעָא אַתְרֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הִיא, וּבִנְהַרְדְּעָא לָא מְבַטְּלִי קָלָא! אֶלָּא דְּאִי קָרוּ לִנְתִינָה ״כְּתִיבָה״.
human_translation: sent to him: She leave but the matter requires investigation What is If we say that whether we abolish the rumor or we cannot abolish But isn’t Neharde’a the place Shmuel and in Neharde’a they do not abolish a rumor? Rather, whether refer to giving writing.
llm_translation: Send him: Go out, and the matter requires investigation. What is it? If we say that if we annul a vow or not annul a vow; and this is the river D'arta of Shmuel, and in the river D'arta we do not annul a vow! Rather, if they called it "writing."

hebrew_text: וְכִי קָרוּ לִנְתִינָה ״כְּתִיבָה״ – לִכְתִיבָה גּוּפַהּ מִי לָא קָרוּ לַהּ ״כְּתִיבָה״?!
human_translation: And if they refer to giving writing, don’t they refer to writing itself writing?
llm_translation: And when they called it "writing" - for writing itself who called it "writing"?!

hebrew_text: אִין; דְּאִי מִיגַּלְּיָא מִילְּתָא דְּקָרוּ לִנְתִינָה כְּתִיבָה, דִּלְמָא ״נָתַן״ קָאָמְרִי.
human_translation: Yes, as if it is discovered that they refer to giving writing, perhaps they are saying that he gave
llm_translation: אִין; דְּאִי מִיגַּלְּיָא מִילְּתָא דְּקָרוּ לִנְתִינָה כְּתִיבָה, דִּלְמָא ״נָתַן״ קָאָמְרִי. There is; for if it were revealed a matter that they read for giving writing, perhaps "he gave" they are saying.

hebrew_text: תֵּצֵא?! וְהָאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כֹּל קָלָא דְּבָתַר נִישּׂוּאִין – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לֵיהּ!
human_translation: She leave? But doesn’t Rav Ashi say: We are not concerned for any rumor that after marriage.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Tetzai?! Veha'amar Rav Ashe: Kol kala d'vatar nis'uin - la chayishinan leih!" Translation: "She will go out?! But didn't Rav Ashe say: Every voice after marriage - we are not concerned about it!"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״תֵּצֵא״ נָמֵי – תֵּצֵא מִשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: What She leave? also she leave the second
llm_translation: What is "tezei" also - tezei from second.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, אַתָּה מוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל בָּנָיו שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן! כֵּיוָן דְּמִשֵּׁנִי הוּא דְּמַפְּקִינַן לַהּ וּמֵרִאשׁוֹן לָא מַפְּקִינַן לַהּ, אָתֵי לְמֵימַר: סָמוּךְ לְמִיתָה גֵּרְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: If so, you cast aspersions on the children of the first Since we remove her from the second and we do not remove her from the first they will come to saying divorced her proximate to death,
llm_translation: If so, you are attributing illegitimacy to the children of the first husband! Since it is the second husband who provides for her, and not the first husband who provides for her, it comes to say: She is close to death, divorce her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִילְעַי: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים דּוֹרוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Elai: Come and see that the later generations are unlike the earlier generations,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai: Come and see that the later generations are not like the earlier generations.

hebrew_text: דּוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים – בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. דּוֹרוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים – רַבִּי דּוֹסָא. דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁבוּיָיה – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא.
human_translation: The earlier generations Beit Shammai. The later generations Rabbi Dosa, as it is taught captive partake of teruma , the statement of Rabbi Dosa.
llm_translation: Generations of the first - Beit Shammai. Generations of the last - Rabbi Dosa. As it was taught: His captive - may eat of the terumah, the words of Rabbi Dosa.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא: וְכִי מָה עָשָׂה לָהּ עַרְבִי זֶה? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּיעֵךְ לָהּ בֵּין דַּדֶּיהָ, פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה?!
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: And what did this Arab do to her Because he fondled her breasts he disqualified her from the priesthood?
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa said: And what did this Arab do to her? Because he heard between her breasts, he disqualified her from the priesthood?!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִילְעַי: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים דּוֹרוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים. דּוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, מַכְנִיסִין פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן דֶּרֶךְ טְרַקְסְמוֹן, כְּדֵי לְחַיְּיבָן בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. דּוֹרוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים, מַכְנִיסִין פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן דֶּרֶךְ גַּגּוֹת וְדֶרֶךְ קַרְפֵּיפוֹת, כְּדֵי לְפוֹטְרָן מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Elai: Come and see that the later generations are unlike the earlier generations. The earlier generations bring in their produce way main entranceway [ teraksemon ], in order to obligate in tithes. the later generations bring in their produce way roofs and way enclosures, in order to exempt from tithes.
llm_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai: Come and see that the later generations are not like the earlier generations. The earlier generations would bring in their fruits through windows, in order to obligate them in tithing. The later generations bring in their fruits through roofs and porches, in order to exempt them from tithing.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אֵין הַטֶּבֶל מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, עַד שֶׁיִּרְאֶה פְּנֵי הַבַּיִת – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּעַרְתִּי הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִן הַבַּיִת״.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yannai says: Untithed produce does not become obligated in tithes until it sees the entrance of the house, as it is stated “I have put away the hallowed things out of my house”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yannai said: The tevel (untithed produce) is not obligated in ma'aser (tithe) until it sees the face of the house - as it is stated: "I have removed the holy from the house."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חָצֵר קוֹבַעַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָכְלוּ בִשְׁעָרֶיךָ וְשָׂבֵעוּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says Even courtyard establishes as it is stated: “That they may eat within your gates, and be satisfied”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even a courtyard that is enclosed, as it is stated: "And you shall eat in your gates and be satisfied."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְלָנָה עִמּוֹ בְּפוּנְדְּקִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי; וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: one who divorces his wife, and she spent the night with him at an inn [ befundaki ], Beit Shammai say: She does not require a second bill of divorce from him, and Beit Hillel say: She requires a second bill of divorce from him,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who divorces his wife and then cohabits with her in an inn, Beit Shammai say: She does not require from him a second bill of divorce; and Beit Hillel say: She does require from him a second bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין; וּמוֹדִים בְּנִתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין – שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לִבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ.
human_translation: When When she was divorced following marriage. concede that when she was divorced following betrothal, she does not require a second bill of divorce from him, due to he is not accustomed to her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eimatai - bizman she'nitgarshah min ha'nissu'in; u'modim b'nitgarshah min ha'eirusin - she'einah tzerichah heimenu get sheni, mipnei she'ein libo gas bah." English translation: "When - at the time she is divorced from the marriage; and they agree when she is divorced from the betrothal - that she does not need from him a second bill of divorce, because his heart is not arrogant towards her."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁרָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה,
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute in where they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Dispute regarding a field that was acquired,

hebrew_text: דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה בְּעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת;
human_translation: as Beit Shammai hold: A person does licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: The House of Shammai holds: A man should engage in marital relations with his wife for the sake of marital relations.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: אֵין אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה בְּעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת. אֲבָל לֹא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold: A person does not licentious sexual intercourse. But they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse, everyone agrees she does not require a second bill of divorce from him,
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: a man does not engage in intercourse with his wife for the sake of promiscuity. But if it is seen that she has been married - the words of all, she does not require from him a second bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וּמוֹדִים בְּנִתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין – שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי, שֶׁאֵין לִבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ. וְאִי בְּשֶׁרָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה, מָה לִי מִן הָאֵירוּסִין וּמָה לִי מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין?
human_translation: We learned concede that when she was divorced following betrothal, she does not require a second bill of divorce from him because he is not accustomed to her. And if which they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse, what to me following betrothal and what to me following marriage?
llm_translation: We learned: And they agree regarding a woman who was divorced from the betrothal - that she does not need a second divorce document, because his heart is not arrogant towards her. And if she was seen that she was married, what do I have from the betrothal and what do I have from the marriage?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין – בְּשֶׁלֹּא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה; וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר – כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה, שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי,
human_translation: Rather the mishna which they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse. Rabbi Yoḥanan stated in accordance that tanna . As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Hillel and Beit Shammai did not disagree about where they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse. that she does not require a second bill of divorce from him.
llm_translation: Rather, it is a Mishnah - when they did not see that she was married; and Rabbi Yochanan said - for this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding a case where they did not see that she was married, as she does not need from him a second bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ – עַל שֶׁרָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה; שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה בְּעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת; וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵין אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה בְּעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: With regard to what did they disagree? about where they saw that she engaged in sexual intercourse. As Beit Shammai say: A person does engage in licentious sexual intercourse. And Beit Hillel say: A person does not licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: On what do they argue? On the matter of a woman whom he saw and desired; for Beit Shammai say: A man should engage in marital relations with his wife for the sake of marital relations, and Beit Hillel say: A man should not engage in marital relations with his wife for the sake of marital relations.

hebrew_text: וּמַתְנִיתִין – דְּאוֹקֵימְנָא בְּלֹא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה, בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי? דְּאִיכָּא עֵדֵי יִחוּד, וְלֵיכָּא עֵדֵי בִיאָה.
human_translation: And the mishna, which we established which they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse, with regard to what do they disagree? which there are witnesses seclusion, but there are no witnesses sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: Mishnah - that we establish without seeing her that she was married, with what do they argue? Because there are witnesses of seclusion, but there are no witnesses of intercourse.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי יִחוּד וְהֵן הֵן עֵדֵי בִיאָה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: אָמְרִינַן הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי יִחוּד וְהֵן הֵן עֵדֵי בִיאָה.
human_translation: Beit Shammai hold: We do not say these are the witnesses of seclusion, these are the witnesses of sexual intercourse. And Beit Hillel hold: We say these are the witnesses of seclusion, these are the witnesses of sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: House of Shammai hold: we do not say they are witnesses of betrothal and they are witnesses of consummation. And House of Hillel hold: we say they are witnesses of betrothal and they are witnesses of consummation.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים בְּנִתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין – שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאֵין לִבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ. לָא אָמְרִינַן הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי בִיאָה.
human_translation: And concede that when she was divorced following betrothal, she does not require a second bill of divorce from him, For since he is not accustomed to her, we do not say these are the witnesses of intercourse.
llm_translation: And they agree regarding a woman who was divorced from betrothal - that she does not need from him a second bill of divorce, since his heart is not arrogant towards her. We do not say, "Yes, they are witnesses of intercourse."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה; וְאוֹקִימְנָא לְמַתְנִיתִין בְּשֶׁלֹּא רָאוּהָ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה! אָמוֹרָאֵי נִינְהוּ וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: But did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this, But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: halakha is like an unattributed mishna. And we established the mishna they did not see that she engaged in sexual intercourse. They are amora’im , and with regard to Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Rabbi Yochanan? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: The halacha follows the anonymous Mishnah; and I establish it according to the tradition even if it was not seen that it was accepted! They are the words of the Amoraim, and the principle of Rabbi Yochanan."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כְּנָסָהּ בְּגֵט קֵרֵחַ – תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: was married on the basis of a bare bill of divorce, she leave this, and that, And all of those ways to her
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If she entered into the marriage contract with a kerach document - she may exit from it, from here and from there, and all these pathways are within it.

hebrew_text: גֵּט קֵרֵחַ – הַכֹּל מַשְׁלִימִין עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי בֶּן נַנָּס. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַשְׁלִימִין עָלָיו אֶלָּא קְרוֹבִים, הָרְאוּיִין לְהָעִיד בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: a bare bill of divorce; anyone, can complete it, the statement of ben Nannas. Rabbi Akiva says: Not complete it. Rather, only relatives who are fit to testify in another case.
llm_translation: Get Kerach - everyone completes on it, the words of Ben Nanas. Rabbi Akiva says: only close relatives, suitable to testify elsewhere.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ גֵּט קֵרֵחַ? כׇּל שֶׁקְּשָׁרָיו מְרוּבִּין מֵעֵדָיו.
human_translation: And what is a bare bill of divorce? any where its folds more than its witnesses.
llm_translation: And which is a get kerach? Any whose knots are more than its witnesses.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּגֵט קֵרֵחַ? גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם ״כּוּלְּכֶם״.
human_translation: What is the reason that a bare bill of divorce decree due to All of you
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for the law of a "get" of a bald man? It is a decree due to "all of you."

hebrew_text: גֵּט קֵרֵחַ – הַכֹּל מַשְׁלִימִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: a bare bill of divorce, anyone can complete it.
llm_translation: Get Kerach - hakol mashlimin alav.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, עֶבֶד מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? דְּאָתוּ לְמֵימַר כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת. קָרוֹב נָמֵי, אָתוּ לְמֵימַר כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת!
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, what is the reason a slave cannot that will come to say fit to bear witness a relative, too, they will come to say fit to bear witness
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, what is the reason that the slave is not valid? Because they came to say "fit for testimony." Close by, they came to say "fit for testimony!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עֶבֶד הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא – דְּדִלְמָא אָתוּ לְאַסּוֹקֵיהּ לְיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: Rather, a slave, this is the reason perhaps they will come to elevate with regard to lineage.
llm_translation: Rather, the servant, that is the reason - perhaps they came to engage in relations.

hebrew_text: גַּזְלָן – דְּבַר יוּחֲסִין הוּא, לִיתַּכְשַׁר! אַלְּמָה תְּנַן, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַשְׁלִימִין עָלָיו אֶלָּא קְרוֹבִים, הָרְאוּיִין לְהָעִיד בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר; קָרוֹב – אִין, גַּזְלָן – לָא!
human_translation: a robber, who is of lineage, should be fit Why, we learn Rabbi Akiva says: Not complete it. Rather, only relatives who are fit to testify in another case. A relative, yes; a robber, no.
llm_translation: Theft - it is a matter of lineage, it should be rectified! Why do we teach, Rabbi Akiva says: Only close relatives may testify on his behalf, those fitting to testify elsewhere; close - no, theft - no!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עֶבֶד הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא – דְּאָתוּ לְמֵימַר: שַׁחְרוֹרֵי שַׁחְרְרֵיהּ; גַּזְלָן נָמֵי – אָתוּ לְמֵימַר: תְּשׁוּבָה עֲבַד; קָרוֹב – מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? קָרוֹב כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָדְעִי דְּקָרוֹב הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, this is the reason a slave They will come to say emancipated him a robber, they will also come to say he repented a relative, what can be said a relative, everyone knows that he is a relative,
llm_translation: Rather, the slave, that is the reason - that they came to say: "The freed ones of his freed ones"; the thief, it is also the reason - that they came to say: "He has done repentance"; close - what is there to say? Everyone in the world knows that "close" means close.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁאֵילְתָא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא סָבָא אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: גֵּט קֵרֵחַ – קְשָׁרָיו שִׁבְעָה וְעֵדָיו שִׁשָּׁה; שִׁשָּׁה וְעֵדָיו חֲמִשָּׁה; חֲמִשָּׁה וְעֵדָיו אַרְבָּעָה; אַרְבָּעָה וְעֵדָיו שְׁלֹשָׁה – עַד כָּאן מַחְלוֹקֶת בֶּן נַנָּס וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אֲבָל קְשָׁרָיו שְׁלֹשָׁה וְעֵדָיו שְׁנַיִם – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין מַשְׁלִימִין עָלָיו אֶלָּא קָרוֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rabba bar She’eilta says Rav Hamnuna the Elder says Rav Adda bar Ahava says: dispute ben Nannas and Rabbi Akiva a bare bill of divorce only its ties seven and its witnesses six, six and its witnesses five, five and its witnesses four, four and its witnesses three. its ties three and its witnesses two, everyone, agrees not complete it. Rather, only a relative
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi Abba bar Sheilta said, Rav Hamnuna Saba said, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: A get of a bald man - his knots are seven and his witnesses are six; six and his witnesses are five; five and his witnesses are four; four and his witnesses are three - until here is the dispute of Ben Nannas and Rabbi Akiva. But if his knots are three and his witnesses are two - the words of everyone are that they do not complete it except if it is close.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבָּה בַּר שְׁאֵילְתָא: מִכְּדֵי כׇּל שְׁלֹשָׁה בִּמְקוּשָּׁר – כִּשְׁנַיִם בְּפָשׁוּט דָּמֵי; מָה הָתָם – קָרוֹב לָא, אַף הָכָא נָמֵי – קָרוֹב לָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabba bar She’eilta: After all, all three in tied like two in an ordinary just as there, a relative cannot so too here, a relative not
