llm_translation: "Outside of those who are born," what is it? Is it that they are not yet born, or perhaps they are destined to be born?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ: ״לְעֶבֶד וּלְנׇכְרִי״, אִם אִיתָא – עֶבֶד וְנׇכְרִי נָמֵי עֲבִידִי דְּמִיגַּיְּירִי!
human_translation: said to him: You learned to a slave or to a gentile if it is so a slave and a gentile are also likely to convert.
llm_translation: He said to him: You have taught it: "To a slave and to a foreigner," if it comes - a slave and a foreigner are also considered converts!

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ – לָאו לְאִיגַּיּוֹרֵי קָיְימִי, הָנֵי – לְאִיתְיְלוֹדֵי קָיְימִי.
human_translation: Those do not stand to convert. these stand to be born.
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "Hanach - not for the winepresses standing, hanei - for the newborns standing."

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִבַּעַל אֲחוֹתָהּ, מַהוּ? הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא חַזְיָא לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא זִמְנִין דְּמֵתָה אֲחוֹתָהּ וְחַזְיָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: except for her sister’s husband, what is now, in any event she is not yet fit for him, Or perhaps sometimes sister dies and she is fit to
llm_translation: Outside of her brother-in-law, what is the law? Perhaps he did not see her, or maybe at times her sister died and he did see her?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ: ״לְעֶבֶד וּלְנׇכְרִי״, עֶבֶד וְנׇכְרִי נָמֵי עֲבִידִי דְּמִיגַּיְּירִי! גֵּירוּת לָא שְׁכִיחָא, מִיתָה שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: said to him: You learned to a slave or to a gentile a slave and a gentile are also likely to convert. conversion is uncommon, death is common.
llm_translation: He said to him: You have taught it: "To a slave and to a foreigner," a slave and a foreigner are similar in that they are converts! Conversion is not common, death is common.

hebrew_text: ״חוּץ מִזְּנוּתִיךְ״, מַהוּ? בְּנִשּׂוּאִין – הָא לָא שַׁיַּיר, אוֹ דִלְמָא שַׁיַּיר – בְּבִיאָה?
human_translation: except for your licentiousness, what is with regard to marriage he did not leave out or perhaps he left out with regard to sexual intercourse?
llm_translation: "Outside of your harlotries," what is it? In marriage - is it not left, or perhaps it is left - in intercourse?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: ״לְאַבָּא וּלְאָבִיךָ״. וּבְמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּנִשּׂוּאִין, אַבָּא וְאָבִיךְ בְּנֵי נִשּׂוּאִין נִינְהוּ?! אֶלָּא לָאו בִּזְנוּת – וּלְאַבָּא וּלְאָבִיךְ הוּא דְּלָא שַׁיַּיר, הָא לְאַחֵר – שַׁיַּיר.
human_translation: said to him: You learned to my father or to your father, And with regard to what If we say with regard to marriage, are my father and your father eligible for marriage? Rather, is it not with regard to licentiousness And to my father or to your father is it not he left out to another he left out
llm_translation: He said to him, "You have taught it: 'For your father and your mother.' And with what? If you say with regard to marriage, are your father and mother not those who are married? Rather, not with regard to marriage - but for your father and your mother who are not left, for others - they are left."

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא בְּנִשּׂוּאִין, דַּעֲבַר וְאִינְּסִיב.
human_translation: Perhaps to marriage, where transgresses and marries
llm_translation: Perhaps in marriage, he transgressed and did not marry.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִשֶּׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, מַהוּ? בִּכְדַרְכָּהּ הָא לָא שַׁיַּיר, אוֹ דִלְמָא ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: except for intercourse in an atypical manner, what is with regard to typical he did not leave out Or perhaps “Cohabitations of a woman” is written
llm_translation: Outside of its normal way, what is the law? In its normal way, is it not left over, or perhaps "lying with a woman" is written?

hebrew_text: ״חוּץ מֵהֲפָרַת נְדָרַיִךְ״, מַהוּ? בְּנִשּׂוּאִין הָא לֹא שַׁיַּיר, אוֹ דִלְמָא ״אִישָׁהּ יְקִימֶנּוּ וְאִישָׁהּ יְפֵרֶנּוּ״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: Except the nullification of your vows, what is with regard to marriage, he did not leave out Or perhaps is written: “Her husband may sustain it, or her husband may nullify it”
llm_translation: "Outside of annulment of my vows," what is it? In marriage, is it not left, or perhaps "her husband shall establish it, and her husband shall annul it" is written?

hebrew_text: ״חוּץ מִתְּרוּמָתִיךְ״, מַהוּ? בְּנִשּׂוּאִין הָא לָא שַׁיַּיר, אוֹ דִלְמָא ״קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: except for your teruma , what is with regard to marriage, he did not leave out Or perhaps is written: “The purchase of his money,
llm_translation: "Outside of your contributions," what is it? In the case of marriage, is it not left, or perhaps "the purchase of his money" is written?

hebrew_text: ״חוּץ מִיְּרוּשָּׁתִיךְ״, מַהוּ? בְּנִשּׂוּאִין הָא לָא שַׁיַּיר, אוֹ דִלְמָא ״לִשְׁאֵרוֹ״, ״וְיָרַשׁ אוֹתָהּ״, כְּתִיב?
human_translation: except for your inheritance, what is with regard to marriage, he did not leave out Or perhaps is written: “To his kinsman and he shall possess it”
llm_translation: "Outside of your inheritance," what is it? In marriage, this is not left, or perhaps "to his offspring," "and he shall inherit it," is it written?

hebrew_text: ״חוּץ מִקִּידּוּשַׁיִךְ בִּשְׁטָר״, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: אֶפְשָׁר דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ לַהּ בְּכֶסֶף וּבְבִיאָה; אוֹ דִלְמָא ״וְיָצְאָה״–״וְהָיְתָה״, אִיתַּקּוּשׁ הֲווֹיוֹת לַהֲדָדֵי?
human_translation: except for your betrothal by a document, what is Do we say can betroth her with money or with sexual intercourse, Or perhaps “And she departs” “And becomes” becoming are compared to each other,
llm_translation: "Outside of your betrothals in a document," what is it? Who said: Is it possible to sanctify her with money and with intercourse; or perhaps "and she will go out" - "and she will be," are these mere expressions for each other?

hebrew_text: תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: shall stand
llm_translation: The case remains undecided.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל גֵּט: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מוּתֶּרֶת לְכׇל אָדָם״.
human_translation: The basic, of a bill of divorce is: You are hereby permitted to any man.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The body of a divorce document: "Behold, you are permitted to all men."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״וְדֵן, דְּיֶהֱוֵי לִיכִי מִינַּאי – סֵפֶר תֵּירוּכִין, וְאִגֶּרֶת שִׁבּוּקִין, וְגֵט פִּטּוּרִין; לִמְהָךְ לְהִתְנְסָבָא לְכֹל גְּבַר דִּיתִצְבִּיִּין״. גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ (בַּת) [בֶּן] חוֹרִין״; ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לְעַצְמָךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says And this that you shall have from me is a scroll of divorce, and a letter of leave, and a bill of dismissal to go to marry any man that you wish. the basic of a bill of manumission You are hereby a free woman, You are hereby your own.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "And a judge, who should be appointed from among us - the Book of Teyrukhin, and the letter of Shibuqin, and the divorce document of Piturin; to go and marry any man who has the ability." The body of a divorce document of emancipation: "Behold, you are (the daughter) son of free people"; "Behold, you are for yourself."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא, אָמַר לָהּ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ בַּת חוֹרִין״ – לֹא אָמַר וְלֹא כְּלוּם; אָמַר לָהּ לְשִׁפְחָתוֹ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מוּתֶּרֶת לְכׇל אָדָם״ – לֹא אָמַר וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: It is obvious stated for his wife: You are hereby a free woman, he has stated nothing, stated for his maidservant: You are hereby permitted to any man, he has stated nothing,
llm_translation: Theft is obvious, he said to his wife: "Behold, you are a free woman" - he did not say anything; he said to his maidservant: "Behold, you are permitted to any man" - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ לְאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לְעַצְמָךְ״, מַהוּ? לִגְמָרֵי קָאָמַר לַהּ, אוֹ לִמְלָאכָה קָאָמַר לַהּ?
human_translation: he stated for wife: You are hereby your own, what is Is he saying to her: entirely Or is he saying to her: to work,
llm_translation: He said to her to a woman: "Behold you to yourself," what? completely he said to her, or to work he said to her?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תָּא שְׁמַע, דִּתְנַן: גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ (בַּת) [בֶּן] חוֹרִין״; ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לְעַצְמָךְ״. וּמָה עַבְדָּא, דִּקְנִי לֵיהּ גּוּפֵיהּ, כִּי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לְעַצְמָךְ״ – קְנִי גּוּפֵיהּ; אִשָּׁה, דְּלָא קְנִי גּוּפַהּ – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Come hear that we learned The basic of a bill of manumission is: You are hereby a free woman, You are hereby your own. And just as a slave, whose body is acquired if states for You are hereby your own, acquires his body, all the more so a wife, whose body is not acquired not
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Come and hear, as we learned: The body of a bill of divorce states, "Behold, you are free"; "Behold, you are for yourself." And what is the difference, that one acquires it for himself, as he said to her: "Behold, you are for yourself" – he acquires it for himself; but a woman, who does not acquire herself – all the more so?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אָמַר לוֹ לְעַבְדּוֹ: ״אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בָּךְ״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: he stated for his slave: I have no business with you, what is
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashe: He said to his servant: "I have no business with you," what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חָנִין לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב חָנִין מָחוֹזְנָאָה לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לְגוֹי – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר מֵרַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן. אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב עָלָיו אוֹנוֹ, אֲבָל כָּתַב עָלָיו אוֹנוֹ – זֶהוּ שִׁחְרוּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanin said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Ḥanin from Meḥoza to Rav Ashi: Come hear that we learned one who sells his slave to a gentile, is emancipated but requires a bill of manumission from his first master. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? when did not write his document for but he wrote his document for him, that is manumission.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Chanin said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Chanin said to Rav Ashi's steward: Come and hear, as it was taught: If one sells his slave to a non-Jew - he goes out to freedom, and he requires a bill of emancipation from his original master. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? - When he did not write his claim against him, but if he wrote his claim against him - that is his emancipation.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אוֹנוֹ״? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ: ״לִכְשֶׁתִּבְרַח מִמֶּנּוּ, אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בָּךְ״.
human_translation: What His document, Rav Sheshet says that he writes for him When you will escape from I have no business with you.
llm_translation: What is "onu"? Rav Sheshet said, as it is written about it: "When you flee from it, I have no business with you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״וְדֵן, דְּיֶהֱוֵי לִיכִי מִינַּאי – סֵפֶר תֵּירוּכִין וְאִגֶּרֶת שִׁבּוּקִין״. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יָדַיִם שֶׁאֵין מוֹכִיחוֹת הָוְיָין יָדַיִם, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא כְּתַב לָהּ ״וְדֵן״ – מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא דִּבְהַאי גִּיטָּא קָא מְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says And this [ veden ] that you shall have from me is a scroll of divorce and a letter [ ve’iggeret ] of leave. With regard to what do disagree? The Rabbis hold ambiguous intimations are valid intimations. And even if he does not write for her And this it is evident that he is divorcing her with this bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "And judge, that I may be from them - the book of Teiruchin and the letter of Shibuqin." With what does he disagree? The Rabbis hold: Hands that do not prove themselves are not considered hands, and even though he did not write to her "and judge" - it is a proof regarding the matter of this divorce document that he is divorcing her.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: יָדַיִם שֶׁאֵין מוֹכִיחוֹת לָא הָוְיָין יָדַיִם, וְטַעְמָא דִּכְתַב לַהּ ״וְדֵן״ – דְּמוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא דִּבְהַאי גִּיטָּא קָא מְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ; אֲבָל לָא כְּתַב לָהּ ״וְדֵן״ – אָמְרִי: בְּדִיבּוּרָא גָּרְשַׁהּ, וּשְׁטָרָא רְאָיָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds ambiguous intimations are not valid intimations, and the reason is that he writes for her: And this so it is evident that he is divorcing her with this bill of divorce. But he does not write for her: And this will say he is divorcing her orally, and the document is merely evidence
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: hands that do not prove are not considered hands, and the reason he wrote for her "and he shall judge" - is because the matter of this bill of divorce is proving it for her; but if he did not write for her "and he shall judge" - they say: he divorced her verbally, and a document is merely a formality.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּכָתֵב גִּיטָּא, לָא לִכְתּוֹב ״וְדֵין״ – דְּמַשְׁמַע וְדִין; אֶלָּא ״וְדֵן״.
human_translation: Abaye said: This person who writes a bill of divorce should not write And this, as indicates: And a law Rather, And this,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Whoever writes a bill of divorce should not write "ve-din" (and judgment), for it implies "and judgment," rather write "ve-dan" (and judge).

hebrew_text: וְלָא לִכְתּוֹב ״אִיגֶּרֶת״ – דְּמַשְׁמַע (אִיגֶּרֶת) [אִיגָּרָא]; אֶלָּא ״אִגֶּרֶת״. וְלָא לִכְתּוֹב ״לִימְהָךְ״ – דְּמַשְׁמַע לִי מֵהָךְ; וְלָא לִכְתּוֹב ״לִמְחָךְ״ – דְּמַשְׁמַע כִּי חוּכָא.
human_translation: And he should not write A letter, as indicates a roof. Rather, A letter, And he should not write: To go, as indicates: For me from this. And he should not to write limḥakh , as that indicates like a joke.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And not to write 'igeret' - for it implies (igeret) igara; rather 'igeret'. And not to write 'limhakh' - for it implies to me from you; and not to write 'limkhakh' - for it implies that it is a joke."

hebrew_text: ״דִּיתִיהְוִייִין״, ״דִּיתִיצְבִּייִין״ – תְּלָתָא תְּלָתָא יוֹדִין; דְּמַשְׁמַע תֶּהֶוְיָין וְתִצְבְּיָין. וְלוֹרְכֵיהּ לְוָיו ״דְּתֵירוּכִין״, וּלְוָיו ״דְּשִׁבּוּקִין״; דְּמַשְׁמַע תְּרִיכִין וּשְׁבִיקִין.
human_translation: ditihevyin dititzviyin three yod as indicate: they shall be [ tehevyan ], and: they wish [ titzviyan ], And he should extend the vav of teirukhin and the vav of shevukin , as indicate divorced [ terikhin ] and left [ shevikin ]
llm_translation: "Ditihevayin," "Dititzbiyin" - three three judges; for it implies existence and standing. And for its legs "Deteirukhin," and for its legs "Deshibukhin"; for it implies support and attachment.

hebrew_text: וְלוֹרְכֵיהּ לְוָיו ״דְּכַדּוּ״; דְּמַשְׁמַע ״וּכְדִי״. וְלָא לִיכְתּוֹב ״לְאִיתְנְסָבָא״ – דְּמַשְׁמַע לָא יִתְנַסְבָא, אֶלָּא ״לְהִתְנְסָבָא״.
human_translation: And he should extend the vav of khedu , as indicates: And with nothing [ ukhedi ]. And he should not write le’itnasseva as, indicate: Will not get married [ la yitnasseva ]. Rather, lehitnasseva ,
llm_translation: His garments to Levi "Dakdu"; that implies "and like." And it is not written "Leitn'sava" - that implies he will not be tested, but "Lehitn'sava."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בָּעֵינַן ״וְדֵן״, אוֹ לָא בָּעֵינַן ״וְדֵן״?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before them: Do we need And this or do we not need And this?
llm_translation: The question was asked of them: Do we require "v'dan" or do we not require "v'dan"?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאַתְקֵין רָבָא בְּגִיטֵּי: ״אֵיךְ פְּלָנְיָא בַּר פְּלָנְיָא, פְּטַר וְתָרֵיךְ יָת פְּלוֹנִיתָא אִינְתְּתֵיהּ, דַּהֲוָת אִינְתְּתֵיהּ מִן קֳדָם דְּנָא – מִיּוֹמָא דְּנַן וּלְעָלַם״. וְאִילּוּ ״וְדֵן״ לָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Come hear as Rava instituted in bills of divorce: how so-and-so, son of so-and-so, dismissed and divorced so-and-so, his wife, who was his wife from beforehand, from this day and forever. But he did not state And this.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rava was engaged in matters of divorce: "How so-and-so son of so-and-so, exempted and then obligated his wife Plonit, who was his wife from before we were born - from the day we were created and forever." And he did not say "and judged."

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, כּוּלְּהוּ מִי קָאָמַר? אֶלָּא בָּעֵינַן, הָכָא נָמֵי בָּעֵינַן;
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, did state all Rather, we need Here too, we need
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, is everyone saying? Rather, we require, here we require.

hebrew_text: ״מִיּוֹמָא דְּנַן״ – לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁטָר מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו;
human_translation: From this day, to the exclusion of of Rabbi Yosei, who said: The date in a document proves it
llm_translation: "From the day that we" - to challenge from Rabbi Yosei, who said: the time of a document proves it upon him.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְעָלַם״ –
human_translation: And forever,
llm_translation: "And forever" -

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדִּבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן – דְּאָמַר: ״הַיּוֹם אִי אַתְּ אִשְׁתִּי וּלְמָחָר אַתְּ אִשְׁתִּי״.
human_translation: to the exclusion of that which Rava asked Rav Naḥman, where said Today you are not my wife and tomorrow you are my wife.
llm_translation: To go out from his house, Rava from Rav Nachman - who said: "Today you are my wife, and tomorrow you are my wife."

hebrew_text: גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ (בַּת) [בֶּן] חוֹרִין״; ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לְעַצְמָךְ״: אַתְקֵין רַב יְהוּדָה בִּשְׁטָר זְבִינֵי דְּעַבְדֵי: ״עַבְדָּא דְּנַן מוּצְדָּק לְעַבְדוּ; וּפְטִיר וַעֲטִיר מִן חֲרוּרֵי, וּמִן עֲלוּלֵי, וּמִן עָרוֹרֵי מַלְכָּא וּמַלְכְּתָא; וּרְשׁוּם דְּאִינִישׁ לָא אִית עֲלוֹהִי, וּמְנוּקֶּה מִכֹּל מוּם, וּמִן שְׁחִין דְּנָפֵיק עַד טַצְהַר חֲדַת וְעַתִּיק״.
human_translation: The basic of a bill of manumission You are hereby a free woman, You are hereby your own. Rav Yehuda instituted in a document of sale for slaves: This slave is justified, for slavery, and he is dismissed and removed from manumission and from accusations and from contests of the king and queen, And there is not a sign [ reshum ] of person on him. And he is clean of any blemish and of boils that emerge on him for four [ tatzhar ] new or old.
llm_translation: The body of a bill of divorce: "Behold, you are (the daughter) son of free individuals"; "Behold, you are for yourself": Rav Yehudah established in the document of the sale of slaves: "A slave that we are selling is acquitted to his master; and he is exempt from all curses, and from lashes, and from the king's and queen's curses; and he is considered as if he has no curses, and is free from any blemish, and from any skin disease, from new and old."

hebrew_text: מַאי אָסוּתֵיהּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גִּינְבְּרָא, וּמַרְתְּכָא, וְכַבְרִיתָא, וְחַלָּא דְחַמְרָא, וּמִשְׁחָא דְזֵיתָא, וְנַטְפִּיק חִיוָּרָא; וְשָׁיְיפִי לֵיהּ בְּגַדְפָּא דַאֲווֹזָא.
human_translation: What is the cure for Abaye said: ginger [ ginebara ], and slag from silver, and sulfur [ kavrita ], and wine vinegar, and olive oil, and white naphtha [ natpik ], and spreads it with a goose feather.
llm_translation: What is its remedy? Abaye said: Ginbera, and Martecha, and Kabrita, and milk of a donkey, and olive oil, and the sap of a wild cucumber; and smear it with the dung of a white she-goat.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה גִּיטִּין פְּסוּלִין, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת הַוּוֹלָד כָּשֵׁר –
human_translation: Three bills of divorce are invalid but if marries the offspring is unflawed.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Three Gitin are invalid, and if the woman who gave birth remarries, it is valid –

hebrew_text: כָּתַב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ, וְאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים; יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים, וְאֵין בּוֹ זְמַן; יֵשׁ בּוֹ זְמַן, וְאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד; הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה גִּיטִּין פְּסוּלִין, וְאִם נִשֵּׂאת – הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: wrote in his handwriting but has no witnesses on there are witnesses on but there is no date on it, there is a date on it, but it contains only one witness. These are three invalid bills of divorce And if she marries, the offspring is unflawed.
llm_translation: He wrote with his own hand, and there are no witnesses on it; there are witnesses on it, and there is no set time; there is a set time, and there is only one witness in it; these are three invalid bills of divorce, and if she married, the child is legitimate.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים, אֶלָּא שֶׁנְּתָנוֹ לָהּ בִּפְנֵי עֵדִים – כָּשֵׁר, וְגוֹבָה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים; שֶׁאֵין הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִים עַל הַגֵּט אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even though there are no witnesses on but he handed it to her in the presence of witnesses, is a valid And can collect from liened property, as the witnesses sign the bill of divorce only for the betterment of the world.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even though there are no witnesses on it, but that he gave it to her in front of witnesses - it is valid, and collection from encumbered property; for witnesses do not sign on a divorce document except for the betterment of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְתוּ לֵיכָּא?! וְהָא אִיכָּא גֵּט יָשָׁן! הָתָם לֹא תֵּצֵא, הָכָא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: But are there no other But isn’t there an outdated bill of divorce, There, she not leave here, she must leave
llm_translation: Gemara: "And is there no 'get' here?! But there is an old 'get'! There, it shall not go out; here, it shall go out."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הָכָא תֵּצֵא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הָכָא לֹא תֵּצֵא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says here she must leave But according to the one who says here she not leave, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text: "He left it for the one who said: 'Here it will come out,' but for the one who said: 'Here it will not come out,' what can be said?"

hebrew_text: הָתָם תִּינָּשֵׂא לְכַתְּחִלָּה, הָכָא דִּיעֲבַד.
human_translation: there, she may remarry ab initio ; here, after the fact,
llm_translation: There, it is lifted up for the beginning, here, it is done.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא גֵּט קֵרֵחַ! הָתָם הַוּוֹלָד מַמְזֵר, הָכָא הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: But isn’t there a bare bill of divorce, There, the offspring is a mamzer ; here, the offspring is unflawed.
llm_translation: And there is a case of a "Get Kereach"! There, the child is a mamzer; here, the child is legitimate.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר (דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה מִמַּטְבֵּעַ שֶׁטָּבְעוּ חֲכָמִים בְּגִיטִּין, הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר). אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to Rabbi Meir, who said anyone who deviates from the formula coined by the Sages with regard to bills of divorce the offspring a mamzer . But according to the Rabbis, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The Gemara left it for Rabbi Meir (as he said: Anyone who changes the standard form that the Sages established for bills of divorce, the child born from such a bill is a mamzer). Rather, according to the Rabbis, what can be said?

hebrew_text: הָתָם תֵּצֵא, הָכָא לֹא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: There, she must leave here, she not leave
llm_translation: There, you shall go out; here, you shall not go out.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָכָא לֹא תֵּצֵא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָכָא תֵּצֵא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? בִּמְקוּשָּׁר לָא קָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says here she not leave but according to the one who says here she must leave what is there to say? is not speaking about tied
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says here it shall not go out, but for the one who says here it shall go out, what can be said? In a case of entanglement, he does not explain.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא שְׁלוֹם מַלְכוּת! הָתָם תֵּצֵא, הָכָא לֹא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: But isn’t there due to peaceful the kingdom, There, she must leave here, she not leave
llm_translation: And there is peace in the kingdom! There it will go out, here it will not go out.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָכָא לֹא תֵּצֵא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תֵּצֵא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? (הָתָם הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, הָכָא הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says here she not leave But according to the one who says she must leave what is there to say? There, the offspring is a mamzer ; here, the offspring is unflawed.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hanicha leman de'amar hacha lo teitzei, ela leman de'amar teitzei, mai ikka lemeimar? (hatam havalad mamzer, hacha havalad kasher)." Translation: "It is satisfactory for the one who says here she shall not go out, but for the one who says she shall go out, what is there to say? (There the child is a mamzer, here the child is legitimate)."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?) מוֹקֵים לַהּ כִּדְרַבִּי מֵאִיר; וְהָתָם הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, הָכָא הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: This works out well according to Rabbi Meir; but according to the Rabbis, what is there to say? establishes it in accordance with Rabbi Meir, there, the offspring is a mamzer . Here, the offspring is unflawed.
llm_translation: The Gemara left it for Rabbi Meir, but for the Rabbis, what can be said? Establish it like Rabbi Meir. And there, the child is a mamzer; here, the child is legitimate.

hebrew_text: מִנְיָנָא דְרֵישָׁא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי, וּמִנְיָנָא דְסֵיפָא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: What the quantity in the first clause to exclude? And what the quantity in the latter clause to exclude?
llm_translation: The count of the first part to exclude what, and the count of the last part to exclude what?

hebrew_text: מִנְיָנָא דְרֵישָׁא – לְמַעוֹטֵי הָנֵי דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: The quantity in the first clause to exclude those that we mentioned,
llm_translation: The count of the first part - to exclude those that we have said.

hebrew_text: מִנְיָנָא דְסֵיפָא – לְמַעוֹטֵי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, נְתָנוֹ לָהּ וְלֹא אָמַר לָהּ: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – יוֹצִיא וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: The quantity in the latter clause to exclude that which is taught who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas, gives it to her but does not say to her: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, must divorce and the offspring is a mamzer . the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The count of the latter clause - to exclude that which was taught: One who brings a bill of divorce from a transmarine region, gave it to her, and did not say to her, "Written and signed in my presence" - he may divorce her, and the offspring is a mamzer, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? יִטְּלֶנּוּ הֵימֶנָּה, וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיִתְּנֶנּוּ לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְיֹאמַר: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: The offspring is not a mamzer ; how should act He should take from her, and give it to her again in the presence of two and say: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence.
llm_translation: The sages say: A mamzer does not exist. How so? He should take him from her, and return and give him to her in the presence of two, and say: "Written in my presence and sealed in my presence."

hebrew_text: כָּתַב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ וְאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים. אָמַר רַב: ״כְּתַב יָדוֹ״ שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: wrote in his handwriting, but has no witnesses on it Rav says: We learned his handwriting.
llm_translation: He wrote with his own hand and there are no witnesses upon it. Rav said: "His own hand" - we have learned.

hebrew_text: אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַרֵישָׁא – פְּשִׁיטָא! ״כְּתַב יָדוֹ״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: With regard to which If we say to the first clause, is obvious, his handwriting is taught
llm_translation: Ahayya? Ileima areisha - peshita! "Ketav yado" katanai!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא אַמְּצִיעֲתָא – הֲרֵי יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים! אֶלָּא אַסֵּיפָא: יֵשׁ בּוֹ זְמַן וְאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד –
human_translation: And rather to the middle clause, Aren’t there witnesses on it? Rather, to the latter clause has a date on it but has only one witness.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And rather, a counter-argument - behold there are witnesses upon it! Rather, the conclusion: it has a fixed time and it only has one witness -"

hebrew_text: וְדַוְקָא כְּתַב יָדוֹ וְעֵד; אֲבָל כְּתַב סוֹפֵר וְעֵד – לֹא.
human_translation: And specifically his handwriting and witness, But a scribe’s handwriting, witness, not
llm_translation: And specifically he wrote and witness; but wrote scribe and witness - no.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ כְּתַב סוֹפֵר וְעֵד, שֶׁהֲרֵי שָׁנִינוּ: כָּתַב סוֹפֵר וְעֵד – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: Even a scribe’s handwriting and a witness, as we learned the scribe’s handwriting and witness valid.
llm_translation: Samuel said: Even if a scribe and a witness wrote, for we learned: "A scribe and a witness - valid."

hebrew_text: וְרַב – מִי דָּמֵי?! הָתָם תִּינָּשֵׂא לְכַתְּחִילָּה, הָכָא דִּיעֲבַד.
human_translation: And Rav Is comparable? There, may marry ab initio . here, after the fact.
llm_translation: Rav - who is comparable?! There, it is lifted up initially, here, it is done.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל – לָא קַשְׁיָא; הָא בְּסָפְרָא דְּמוּבְהַק, וְהָא בְּסָפְרָא דְּלָא מוּבְהַק.
human_translation: And Shmuel, not difficult. That to an expert scribe, and this to a scribe who is not expert.
llm_translation: Samuel - not difficult; this in the book of Muvhak, and this in the book of not Muvhak.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״כְּתַב יָדוֹ״ שָׁנִינוּ. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֲרֵי יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַסֵּיפָא.
human_translation: And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan says We learned his handwriting. Rabbi Elazar, said to him: Aren’t there witnesses in said to him: to the latter clause,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so said Rabbi Yochanan: "We have learned 'his handwriting'." Rabbi Elazar said to him: "But there are witnesses upon it!" He said to him: "The conclusion."

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין אָמַר רַב: תֵּצֵא, זִימְנִין אָמַר רַב: לֹא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: sometimes Rav said she must leave sometimes Rav said she not leave.
llm_translation: Times, said Rav: "You shall go out," times, said Rav: "You shall not go out."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים – לֹא תֵּצֵא, אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים – תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: How so? she has children she not leave she does not have children she must leave
llm_translation: This is how? She has sons - she shall not go out, she has no sons - she shall go out.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב מָר זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה: וְכוּלָּן, שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהֶן סְפֵק קִידּוּשִׁין אוֹ סְפֵק גֵּירוּשִׁין – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: Mar Zutra bar Toviya raises an objection And any of these had undergone a betrothal or divorce uncertain those must perform the ritual through which the yavam frees the yevama of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ] and not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: The Master Zutra Bar Tobiah raises an objection: And all of them, in whom there was a doubt of betrothal or a doubt of divorce - these are exempt and not subject to levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד סְפֵק קִידּוּשִׁין? זָרַק לָהּ קִידּוּשִׁין – סָפֵק קָרוֹב לָהּ, סָפֵק קָרוֹב לוֹ, זֶהוּ סְפֵק קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: How a betrothal uncertain? he threw her betrothal possibly closer to her, possibly closer to him, this is a betrothal uncertain.
llm_translation: How is a doubt regarding betrothal resolved? If he threw the betrothal to her - perhaps it is closer to her, perhaps it is closer to him, this is a doubt regarding betrothal.

hebrew_text: סְפֵק גֵּירוּשִׁין – כָּתַב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ וְאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים, יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים וְאֵין בּוֹ זְמַן, יֵשׁ בּוֹ זְמַן וְאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד – הֲרֵי זֶה סְפֵק גֵּירוּשִׁין.
human_translation: a divorce uncertain? wrote in his handwriting but has no witnesses on there are witnesses on but there is no date on it, there is a date on it but it contains only one witness. this is a divorce uncertain.
llm_translation: Doubt of divorce - he wrote with his own hand and there are no witnesses on it, there are witnesses on it and there is no time in it, there is a time in it and there is only one witness in it - this is a doubt of divorce.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ לֹא תֵּצֵא, צָרָתָהּ אָתְיָא לְיַבּוֹמֵי!
human_translation: And if you say she not leave her rival wife come to enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: And if you say, "She shall not go out," her rival will come to the levir!

hebrew_text: תִּתְיַבֵּם, וְאֵין בְּכָךְ כְּלוּם; חֲשָׁשָׁא דְרַבָּנַן הִיא.
human_translation: She may enter into levirate marriage, and no with that, is a concern by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: They should be embarrassed, and there is no shame in this; it is a concern of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לֹא תֵּצֵא. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם לֹא תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: Levi says she never leave And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan says she never leave
llm_translation: Levi said: Always not you shall go out. And so said Rabbi Yochanan: Always not you shall go out.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לִבְנֵי רַבִּי חֲלַפְתָּא דְּמִן הוּנָא, הָכִי אָמַר אֲבוּכוֹן: לְעוֹלָם לֹא תֵּצֵא; וְקַרְצִית שֶׁבֶּעָמִיר אֵינָהּ פּוֹסֶלֶת בְּמֵי חַטָּאת.
human_translation: And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan said to the sons of Rabbi Ḥalafta of Huna: Your father said the following she never leave and a kartzit in the sheaf does not disqualify water of purification
llm_translation: And so said to them Rabbi Yochanan to the sons of Rabbi Chalaphta from Hunah, thus said their father: "You shall never go out; and the knot in the Amair is not disqualifying in the waters of purification."

hebrew_text: מַאי קַרְצִית? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דִּידְבְּתָא דְּבֵינֵי כֵיפֵי.
human_translation: What is a kartzit ? Abaye said fly [ didveta ] that is between the sheaves.
llm_translation: What is "karzit"? Abaye said: The handle of a basket.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב דָּנִיאֵל בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא: כׇּל הָעוֹפוֹת פּוֹסְלִין בְּמֵי חַטָּאת, חוּץ מִן הַיּוֹנָה – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוֹצֶצֶת. וְאִם אִיתָא, נִיתְנֵי: חוּץ מִיּוֹנָה וְקַרְצִית!
human_translation: Rav Daniel bar Rav Ketina raises an objection All birds disqualify water of purification except for the pigeon, because it sucks And if it is so let teach except for pigeon and kartzit .
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Daniyel son of Rav Katina asked: All birds disqualify the waters of the sin offering, except for the dove - because it pecks. And if you wish, it can be said: except for the dove and the young pigeon!

hebrew_text: לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ, דִּגְדוֹלָה לָא פָּסְלָה, וּקְטַנָּה פָּסְלָה. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אַמֵּי: עַד כְּזַיִת.
human_translation: is not clear-cut, as, a large does not disqualify a small one does disqualify And how Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say Rabbi Ami up to an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: It does not interrupt it, for the large one did not disqualify, and the small one disqualified. And until when? Rabbi Yirmiyah said, and some say Rabbi Ammi: Until the size of a olive.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר: אַף בִּשְׁטָרוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even if Rav Yehuda said Rav said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce. when I said this before Shmuel, he said with regard to documents as well.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: "Even though and so forth." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce. For when she said it before Shmuel, he said: "Even in documents."

hebrew_text: וְרַב סָבַר – בִּשְׁטָרוֹת לָא?! הָא קָתָנֵי: וְגוֹבָה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים!
human_translation: But does Rav hold with regard to documents not Doesn’t teach can collect from liened property?
llm_translation: And Rav holds - in contracts not?! This is what is taught: "And the collection of debts from encumbered properties!"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר תַּרְתֵּי אָמַר; וְרַב סָבַר כְּווֹתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar made two statements, And Rav holds in accordance with his with regard to one and disagrees with his with regard to one
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said two things; and Rav holds like him in one, and disagrees with him in one.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין. וְרַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט אֵין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And similarly, Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce. And Rabbi Yannai says: does not have even the trace of a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halakha is according to Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce. And Rabbi Yannai said: Even the smell of the divorce document is not in it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יַנַּאי לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לְרַבָּנַן – אֲפִילּוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט אֵין בּוֹ.
human_translation: But does Rabbi Yannai not hold of Rabbi Elazar this is what is saying: According to the Rabbis, does not have even the trace of a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai does not have Rabbi Elazar?! This is what he is saying: To the Rabbis - even the smell of the divorce document is not in it.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט אֵין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And similarly, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says Reish Lakish says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: does not have even the trace of a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Yosei the son of Rabbi Chanina said Reish Lakish: The halakha is according to Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Even the smell of the divorce document is not in it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לְרַבָּנַן – אֲפִילּוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט אֵין בּוֹ.
human_translation: Let us say Rabbi Yoḥanan does not hold of Rabbi Elazar this is what is saying: According to the Rabbis, does not have even the trace of a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Let us say, does Rabbi Yochanan not have Rabbi Elazar?! This is what he is saying: To the Rabbis - even the smell of the divorce document is not in it.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא לְמָרִי בַּר מָר, בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין, אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Zavda sent to Marei bar Mar: Ask Rav Huna halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce or halakha is not
llm_translation: Send to him Rabbi Abba bar Zavda to Master Bar Mar, ask from him from Rav Huna: Is the halakha like Rabbi Elazar in Gittin, or not the halakha?

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר אַבָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין. וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הַבְּקִיאִין בִּדְבַר הֲלָכָה, מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ אָמְרוּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין – דְּאָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: Meanwhile, Rav Huna died. Rabba, son of said to My father said in the name of Rava like this: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce. And our teachers who are well-versed in matters of halakha said in the name of our teacher halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce, as Rav Ḥama bar Gurya, says Rav says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: So now, Rav Huna's soul found rest. Rabba his son said to him: Thus said Abba in the name of Rava: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce. And our Rabbis, who are experts in matters of halakha, said in the name of our teacher: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce - as Rav Hama bar Gurya said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: וַחֲבֵרֵינוּ הַבְּקִיאִין בִּדְבַר הֲלָכָה, וְתַלְמִידֵי רַבֵּינוּ, מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ אָמְרוּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין – דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: There are who say And our colleagues who are well versed in matters of halakha and the disciples of our teacher said in the name of our teacher halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce, as Rav Ḥisda, said that Rav Ḥama bar Gurya, said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: There are those who say: "And our colleagues, the experts in matters of halakha, and the disciples of our master, in the name of our master, said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer in matters of divorce - as Rav Ḥisda said that Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said that Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer in matters of divorce."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּגִיטִּין.
human_translation: And similarly, when Ravin came Rabbi Elazar, says Rav says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar with regard to bills of divorce.
llm_translation: And so, when Ravin came, Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Elazar in matters of divorce.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנַיִם שֶׁשָּׁלְחוּ שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין שָׁוִין, וְנִתְעָרְבוּ; נוֹתֵן שְׁנֵיהֶם לָזוֹ, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לָזוֹ. לְפִיכָךְ, אָבַד אֶחָד מֵהֶן – הֲרֵי הַשֵּׁנִי בָּטֵל.
human_translation: two who sent two identical bills of divorce and were mixed up, should hand both to this and both to that Therefore, one of was lost the other is void,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If two people send two identical bills of divorce and they become mixed up, one should give one to one woman and the other to the other woman. Therefore, if one of them is lost, the other one is nullified."

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁכָּתְבוּ כְּלָל בְּתוֹךְ הַגֵּט – ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מְגָרֵשׁ פְּלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי פְּלוֹנִית״, וְהָעֵדִים מִלְּמַטָּה; כּוּלָּן כְּשֵׁרִין, וְיִנָּתֵן לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: five who wrote a general wording in the bill of divorce, so-and-so divorces so-and-so, and so-and-so so-and-so, and the witnesses below, all are valid; and must be handed to each and every
llm_translation: Five that wrote general in the get - "a certain man divorces a certain woman, and so-and-so divorces so-and-so," and the witnesses from below; all of them are valid, and it should be given to each one separately.

hebrew_text: הָיָה כּוֹתֵב טוֹפֶס לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וְהָעֵדִים מִלְּמַטָּה; אֶת שֶׁהָעֵדִים נִיקְרִין עִמּוֹ – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: was writing formula for each and every and the witnesses below, with which the witnesses’ are read is valid.
llm_translation: He would write a document for each and every one, and the witnesses from below; that when the witnesses are recognized with him - it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאִי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי – הָא לָא יָדְעִי בְּהֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ קָא מִגָּרְשָׁה.
human_translation: Who taught Rabbi Yirmeya said: is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as had been Rabbi Elazar, since he says witnesses of the transmission effect do not know with which one of she is being divorced.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Ma'an Tana? Amar Rabbi Yirmeya: D'lo k'Rabbi Elazar. D'i Rabbi Elazar, keivan d'amar edei mesirah karti - ha lo yad'i b'hei minaihu ka migarsha. English translation: Gemara: Who is the Tana? Rabbi Yirmeya said: Not like Rabbi Elazar. For if it were Rabbi Elazar, since he said witnesses of transfer cut off - he does not know with what type of case they are cutting off.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – אֵימָא דְּבָעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כְּתִיבָה לִשְׁמָהּ, נְתִינָה לִשְׁמָהּ מִי בָּעֵי?!
human_translation: Abaye said: You even say Rabbi Elazar. Say that Rabbi Elazar requires the writing for her sake, does he require giving for her sake?
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Elazar - say that Rabbi Elazar requires a written document for its sake, does he require a gift for its sake?!

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁכָּתְבוּ כְּלָל כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי כְּלָל, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי טוֹפֶס?
human_translation: five who wrote a general wording What are the circumstances of general wording, what are the circumstances of formula
llm_translation: Five who wrote a general document. How is the law of a general document, how is the law of a specific document?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זְמַן אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן – זֶהוּ כְּלָל. זְמַן לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד – זֶהוּ טוֹפֶס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one date for all of them, that is a general wording. date for each and every one that is formula.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "One time for all of them - this is a general principle. Time for each and every one - this is a specification."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר:
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says:
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said:

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ זְמַן אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן נָמֵי הָוֵי טוֹפֶס, אֶלָּא הֵיכִי דָּמֵי כְּלָל? דְּכָתֵב ״אָנוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי גֵּירַשְׁנוּ נְשׁוֹתֵינוּ פְּלוֹנִית וּפְלוֹנִית״.
human_translation: Even one date for all of them it is still formula Rather, what are the circumstances of a general wording? where one wrote: We, so-and-so and so-and-so, have divorced our wives so-and-so and so-and-so.
llm_translation: Even one time for all of them, yes, it is considered a gathering. Rather, how is it similar to a general principle? As it is written, "We have divorced our wives, each one of us from his wife."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר זְמַן אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן – זֶהוּ כְּלָל, לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא כִּי (חָתְמוּ) [חֲתִימִי] סָהֲדִי, אַבָּתְרָא הוּא דַּחֲתִימִי! מִי לָא תַּנְיָא: עֵדִים חֲתוּמִין עַל שְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם בְּגֵט – פָּסוּל, חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא עַל שְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם חָתְמוּ?!
human_translation: Rabbi Abba objects to this: According to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says one date for all of them that is a general wording, we should be concerned perhaps when the witnesses signed they sign for the last Isn’t it taught witnesses are signed on a greeting in a bill of divorce, invalid, we are concerned perhaps they signed greeting
llm_translation: Rebbe Abba objects to him: According to Rebbe Yochanan who says there is one designated time for all of them - this is a general principle, but perhaps when they sign, the last one is the one who signs! Who did not teach: Signed witnesses on a peace inquiry in a divorce document - invalid, we are concerned that perhaps they signed on a peace inquiry?!

hebrew_text: לָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״שַׁאֲלוּ״ – פָּסוּל, ״וְשַׁאֲלוּ״ – כָּשֵׁר; הָכָא נָמֵי – דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to Rabbi Abbahu says: was explained to me by Rabbi Yoḥanan Ask invalid, And ask valid, Here too, in which it is written: So-and-so and so-and-so and so-and-so
llm_translation: The matter was not concluded. Rabbi Avahu said, according to my understanding, I can explain the words of Rabbi Yochanan: "Ask" - invalid, "and ask" - valid; here too, as it is written in it: "So-and-so and so-and-so and so-and-so."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר זְמַן לְכׇל אֶחָד – זֶהוּ טוֹפֶס; מַאי אִירְיָא מִשּׁוּם טוֹפֶס? וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ נִכְתַּב בַּיּוֹם וְנֶחְתַּם בַּלַּיְלָה!
human_translation: And furthermore, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says date for each that is formula, why specifically due to formula? Derive because it is was written during the day and signed at night,
llm_translation: And come, according to Rabbi Yochanan who said, "A set time for each one - this is a document." What is the reason it is called a document? Because it is written during the day and signed at night!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ ״בְּחַד בְּשַׁבָּא, בְּחַד בְּשַׁבָּא״.
human_translation: Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: We say the following in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: where it is written in On Sunday, on Sunday.
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Kashisha, son of Rav Chisda, to Rav Ashe: Thus we say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: As it is written in it, "In one place in Sheba, in one place in Sheba."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמַר: זְמַן אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן נָמֵי טוֹפֶס הָוֵי; וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי כְּלָל – דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ הָכִי: ״אָנוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי גֵּירַשְׁנוּ נְשׁוֹתֵינוּ פְּלוֹנִית וּפְלוֹנִית״; נִמְצְאוּ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים מִתְגָּרְשׁוֹת בְּגֵט אֶחָד, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ – וְלֹא לָהּ וְלַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: to Reish Lakish, who says one date for all of them it is still formula, and what are the circumstances of a general wording; where the following is written in We, so-and-so and so-and-so, have divorced our wives so-and-so and so-and-so. two women are found being divorced with one bill of divorce. And the Torah said: “And he writes her” and cannot for her and for another
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, according to Reish Lakish who said: "One time for all of them is considered a valid document." And how is it similar to a general principle? For it is written in it thus: "We, so-and-so and so-and-so, have divorced our wives, so-and-so and so-and-so." If two women are found divorced in one bill of divorce, and the Torah said: "And he shall write for her" - not for her and her friend!

hebrew_text: דַּהֲדַר כְּתַב: ״פְּלוֹנִי גֵּירַשׁ פְּלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי גֵּירַשׁ פְּלוֹנִית״.
human_translation: because he then wrote So-and-so has divorced so-and-so, and so-and-so has divorced so-and-so.
llm_translation: He returned and wrote: "So-and-so divorced so-and-so, and so-and-so divorced so-and-so."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַכּוֹתֵב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לִשְׁנֵי עֲבָדָיו – קָנוּ, וּמְשַׁחְרְרִין זֶה אֶת זֶה?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: And what is different from that which is taught one who writes all of his property to his two slaves, they acquire and emancipate each other?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, "And what is the difference from what is taught: 'One who writes all his possessions to his two slaves - they acquire, and they free each other'?"

hebrew_text: וְלָאו אוֹקֵימְנָא בִּשְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת?!
human_translation: But didn’t we establish to two documents,
llm_translation: And not established with two documents?!

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, is taught in accordance with of Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan, it was taught in a Baraita in accordance with the opinion of Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁכָּתְבוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַגֵּט: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מְגָרֵשׁ פְּלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי פְּלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי פְּלוֹנִית״, וּזְמַן אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן, וְהָעֵדִים מִלְּמַטָּה – כּוּלָּן כְּשֵׁרִים, וְתִנָּתֵן לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan five who wrote in the bill of divorce: So-and-so divorces so-and-so, and so-and-so so-and-so, and so-and-so so-and-so, and one date for all of them, and the witnesses below, all of them are valid; and must be handed to each and every one
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: Five cases that were written in the middle of a bill of divorce: "A certain man divorces a certain woman, and a certain man divorces a certain woman, and a certain man divorces a certain woman," and if one time is specified for all of them, and the witnesses signed from below - all of them are valid, and the bill of divorce should be given to each one separately.

hebrew_text: זְמַן לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד וְהָעֵדִים מִלְּמַטָּה – אֶת שֶׁהָעֵדִים נִקְרָאִים עִמּוֹ, כָּשֵׁר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ רֶיוַח בֵּינֵיהֶן – פָּסוּל, וְאִם לָאו – כָּשֵׁר; שֶׁאֵין זְמַן מַפְסִיקָן.
human_translation: date for each and every one and the witnesses below, with which the witnesses’ are read is valid. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: If there is space between them invalid, But if not valid, as date does not separate them.
llm_translation: Time for each and every one and the witnesses from below - that the witnesses are called with him, valid. Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: If there is a contradiction between them - invalid, and if not - valid; for time does not interrupt them.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: חֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁכָּתְבוּ כְּלָל בְּתוֹךְ הַגֵּט – ״אָנוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי גֵּירַשְׁנוּ נְשׁוֹתֵינוּ פְּלוֹנִית וּפְלוֹנִית, פְּלוֹנִי גֵּירַשׁ פְּלוֹנִית וּפְלוֹנִי גֵּירַשׁ פְּלוֹנִית״; וּזְמַן אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן, וְהָעֵדִים מִלְּמַטָּה – כּוּלָּן כְּשֵׁרִין, וְתִנָּתֵן לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Reish Lakish: five who wrote a general wording in the bill of divorce: We, so-and-so and so-and-so, have divorced our wives so-and-so and so-and-so; so-and-so has divorced so-and-so, and so-and-so has divorced so-and-so, and one date for all of them, and the witnesses below, all of them are valid; and it must be handed to each and every
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Reish Lakish: Five cases where they wrote a general statement in the middle of a bill of divorce - "We, so-and-so and so-and-so, have divorced our wives, so-and-so and so-and-so, so-and-so has divorced so-and-so, and so-and-so has divorced so-and-so"; and at one time for all of them, and the witnesses are below - all of them are valid, and it should be given to each one separately.

hebrew_text: זְמַן לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וְרֶיוַח לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וְהָעֵדִים מִלְּמַטָּה – אֶת שֶׁהָעֵדִים נִקְרָאִין עִמּוֹ, כָּשֵׁר. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רֶיוַח בֵּינֵיהֶם – פָּסוּל, שֶׁהַזְּמַן מַפְסִיקָן.
human_translation: date for each and every one, and a space for each and every one, and the witnesses below, the one with which the witnesses’ are read is valid; Rabbi Meir says: Even if there is no space between them, invalid, as the date separates them.
llm_translation: Time for each and every one, and space for each and every one, and the witnesses from below - the witnesses are called with him, valid. Rabbi Meir says: Even though there is no space between them - invalid, because time interrupts them.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – מַאי אִירְיָא זְמַן לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד? הָא אָמַר: זְמַן אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן נָמֵי טוֹפֶס הָוֵי!
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, why specifically date for each and every one? Didn’t he say one date for all of them it is still formula?
llm_translation: Reish Lakish - What is meant by "a time for each and every one"? This means: there is one time for all of them, as it is said: "There is a time for everything."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא עָרְבִינְהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא; אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּעָרְבִינְהוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא, אִי פָּלֵיג לְהוּ זְמַן – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: This matter where he did not merge them at the outset But here, he merged them at the outset, if date separates them are if not, not
llm_translation: These matters, where they did not initially mix; but here, where they mixed initially, if he separates them within the time - no, if not - no.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין שֶׁכְּתָבָן זֶה בְּצַד זֶה, וּשְׁנַיִם עֵדִים עִבְרִים בָּאִים מִתַּחַת זֶה לְתַחַת זֶה, וּשְׁנַיִם עֵדִים יְוָנִים בָּאִים מִתַּחַת זֶה לְתַחַת זֶה – אֶת שֶׁהָעֵדִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים נִקְרָאִין עִמּוֹ, כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: two bills of divorce that wrote one next to the other, and two Hebrew witnesses, extend from underneath this to underneath that and two Greek witnesses, extend from underneath that to underneath this with which the first witnesses are read [ nikra’in ] is valid.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If two divorce documents were written, one alongside the other, and two Hebrew witnesses come from below to below, and two Greek witnesses come from below to below - the original witnesses are considered with him, it is valid.

hebrew_text: עֵד אֶחָד עִבְרִי וְעֵד אֶחָד יְוָנִי, וְעֵד אֶחָד עִבְרִי וְעֵד אֶחָד יְוָנִי, בָּאִין מִתַּחַת זֶה לְתַחַת זֶה – שְׁנֵיהֶם פְּסוּלִין.
human_translation: one witness Hebrew and one witness Greek and one witness Hebrew, and one witness Greek, extending from underneath this to underneath that both are invalid.
llm_translation: One witness Hebrew and one witness Greek, and one witness Hebrew and one witness Greek, they come from beneath this to beneath this - both of them are disqualified.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלִיתַּכְשַׁר הַאי בִּ״רְאוּבֵן״, וְהַאי בְּ״בֶן יַעֲקֹב עֵד״, דְּהָא תְּנַן: ״בֶּן אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי עֵד״ – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: But let this be validated by Reuven and that by Son of Ya’akov, witness, Didn’t we learn Son of so-and-so, witness, is valid?
llm_translation: Gemara: And this case is not valid with "Reuven," and this case is with "Ben Yaakov Ed," for we learned: "Son of so-and-so Ed" - it is valid!

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״רְאוּבֵן בֶּן״ אַקַּמָּא, וְ״יַעֲקֹב עֵד״ אַבָּתְרָא.
human_translation: where Reuven, son of, are written on the first and Ya’akov, witness, on the latter
llm_translation: It is written: "Reuben, son" first, and "Jacob, witness" afterwards.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתַּכְשַׁר הַאי בִּ״רְאוּבֵן בֶּן״, וְלִיתַּכְשַׁר הַאי בְּ״יַעֲקֹב עֵד״, דְּהָא תְּנַן: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי עֵד״ – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: But let this be validated by Reuven, son of, and let that be validated by Ya’akov, witness. Didn’t we learn So-and-so, witness, is valid?
llm_translation: And it is valid this one in "Reuven son", and it is valid this one in "Yaakov witness", for we learned: "a certain man witness" - valid!

hebrew_text: דְּלָא כְּתִיב ״עֵד״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם דִּכְתִיב ״עֵד״, וּדְיָדְעִינַן בְּהָא חֲתִימָה דְּלָאו דְּיַעֲקֹב הוּא.
human_translation: where witness is not written. And if you wish, say: Actually, where witness, is written but where we know that this signature is not Ya’akov’s.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Since it is not written "עֵד". And if you wish, say: Indeed, it is always written "עֵד", and we know by this signature that it is not the signature of Yaakov.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא בִּשְׁמָא דַאֲבוּהּ חָתֵים! לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ שְׁמֵיהּ וְחָתֵים שְׁמָא דַאֲבוּהּ.
human_translation: But perhaps he signed with his father’s name? One does not leave his name and sign in the name of his father.
llm_translation: Perhaps in the name of his father he was signed! A person should not abandon his name, and perhaps he was signed in the name of his father.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא סִימָנָא שַׁוְּיֵיהּ – דְּהָא רַב צָיֵיר כְּווֹרָא, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא – חֲרוּתָא, רַב חִסְדָּא – סָמֶךְ, רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא – עַיִן, רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא צָיֵיר מָכוּתָא!
human_translation: But perhaps he made a symbol As Rav would draw a fish Rabbi Ḥanina a date palm, Rav Ḥisda a samekh , Rav Hoshaya an ayin , Rabba bar Rav Huna would draw a sail.
llm_translation: Perhaps the sign is appropriate - for Rav depicted a line, Rabbi Chanina - a groove, Rav Chisda - a support, Rav Hoshaya - an eye, Rabba bar Rav Huna depicted a hammer!

hebrew_text: לָא חֲצִיף אִינִישׁ לְשַׁוּוֹיֵי לִשְׁמָא דַאֲבוּהּ סִימָנָא.
human_translation: A person would not be so brazen as to make his father’s name a symbol.
llm_translation: Not angry a person to equal to the name of his father a sign.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתַּכְשַׁר הַאי בִּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים עִבְרִים, וְלִיתַּכְשַׁר הַאי בִּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים יְוָנִים – דִּתְנַן: גֵּט שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ עִבְרִית וְעֵדָיו יְוָנִית, יְוָנִית וְעֵדָיו עִבְרִית – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: But let this be validated by two Hebrew witnesses, and let that be validated by two Greek witnesses, as we learned a bill of divorce that was written in Hebrew and its witnesses in Greek, in Greek and its witnesses in Hebrew, is valid.
llm_translation: And it is valid this one with two witnesses Hebrew, and it is valid this one with two witnesses Greek - as we learned: A bill of divorce that its writing is Hebrew and its witnesses are Greek, or its witnesses are Greek and its writing is Hebrew - it is valid!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, כֵּיוָן דְּמוּפְלָג בִּשְׁנֵי שִׁיטִין – לָא; וְהָאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: מִלְּאָהוּ בִּקְרוֹבִים – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: And if you would say that since are two lines away not but didn’t Ḥizkiyya say filled, with relatives valid?
llm_translation: And if you will say, since they are divided into two opinions - no; and Chizkiyah said: If it is filled by relatives - it is valid!

hebrew_text: הָא תָּנֵי זְעֵירִי: שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּשֵׁרִין. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן – דִּלְמָא גּוּנְדָּלִית חֲתֻים, וְכוּלְּהוּ אַחַד הוּא דַּחֲתִימִי.
human_translation: Ze’eiri teaches both of are valid, And the tanna of our perhaps signed in reverse [ gundalit ]. and all of the signed one
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: "Ha tanay ze'iri: shneihem k'sherin. Ve'tana didan - dilmah gundalit chatum, v'chullehu echad hu dachatimi." English translation: "Here is what Ze'iri taught: both of them are valid. And our Mishna teaches - perhaps the gundalit is sealed, and all of them are considered as one who seals."

hebrew_text: עֵד אֶחָד עִבְרִי וְעֵד אֶחָד יְוָנִי. וְלִיתַּכְשַׁר הַאי בְּעֵד אֶחָד עִבְרִי וְעֵד אֶחָד יְוָנִי, וְהַאי בְּעֵד אֶחָד עִבְרִי וְעֵד אֶחָד יְוָנִי – דְּהָא תְּנַן: עֵד אֶחָד עִבְרִי וְעֵד אֶחָד יְוָנִי – כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: one witness Hebrew and one witness Greek, But let this be validated by one Hebrew witness and one Greek witness, and that by one Hebrew witness and one Greek witness. Didn’t we learn one witness Hebrew and one witness Greek is valid?
llm_translation: One witness Hebrew and one witness Greek. And this case is valid with one witness Hebrew and one witness Greek, and this case is valid with one witness Hebrew and one witness Greek - for we learned: One witness Hebrew and one witness Greek - valid!

hebrew_text: הָא תָּנֵי זְעֵירִי: שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּשֵׁרִים. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן – דִּלְמָא גּוּנְדָּלִית חֲתֻים; וּתְלָתָא אַחַד, וְחַד אַחַד.
human_translation: Ze’eiri teaches both of them are valid. And the tanna of our perhaps they signed in reverse, and three one and one one.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: Z'eiri taught: Both of them are valid. And our Mishna teaches: Perhaps the handle is sealed, and there are three seals on one vessel, and one on the other.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שִׁיֵּיר מִקְצָת הַגֵּט וּכְתָבוֹ בְּדַף הַשֵּׁנִי, וְהָעֵדִים מִלְּמַטָּה – כָּשֵׁר. חָתְמוּ עֵדִים בְּרֹאשׁ הַדַּף, מִן הַצַּד, אוֹ מֵאַחֲרָיו; בְּגֵט פָּשׁוּט – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: left out part of the bill of divorce and wrote it in the second column, and the witnesses are beneath valid witnesses signed at the top of the column, on the side, or on the back of an ordinary, bill of divorce, invalid.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one leaves part of the get and writes it on the second page, and the witnesses sign from below - it is valid. If the witnesses sign at the top of the page, on the side, or after it, in a straightforward get - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: הִקִּיף רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְהָעֵדִים בָּאֶמְצַע – שְׁנֵיהֶם פְּסוּלִין. סוֹפוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד סוֹפוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְהָעֵדִים בָּאֶמְצַע – אֶת שֶׁהָעֵדִים נִקְרִין עִמּוֹ, כָּשֵׁר. רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד סוֹפוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְהָעֵדִים בָּאֶמְצַע – אֶת שֶׁהָעֵדִים נִקְרִין בְּסוֹפוֹ, כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: placed the top of this next to the top of that and the witnesses in the middle, both are invalid. the end of this next to the end of that and the witnesses in the middle with which the witnesses’ are read, is valid. the top of this next to the end of that and the witnesses in the middle, at the end of which the witnesses are read, is valid.
llm_translation: He encircled the head of this one alongside the head of that one, and the witnesses are in the middle - both of them are disqualified. The end of this one alongside the end of that one, and the witnesses are in the middle - if the witnesses are recognized with him, it is valid. The head of this one alongside the end of that one, and the witnesses are in the middle - if the witnesses are recognized at his end, it is valid.

hebrew_text: גֵּט שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ עִבְרִית וְעֵדָיו יְווֹנִית; יְווֹנִית וְעֵדָיו עִבְרִית; עֵד אֶחָד עִבְרִי וְעֵד אֶחָד יְווֹנִי; כָּתַב סוֹפֵר וְעֵד – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: a bill of divorce that was written in Hebrew and its witnesses in Greek, in Greek and its witnesses in Hebrew, one witness in Hebrew and one witness in Greek, the writing of a scribe, and witness valid
llm_translation: A bill of divorce that its writing is in Hebrew and its witnesses are in Greek; in Greek and its witnesses are in Hebrew; one witness is Hebrew and one witness is Greek; if a scribe wrote and a witness - it is valid.

hebrew_text: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, עֵד״ – כָּשֵׁר. ״בֶּן אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, עֵד״ – כָּשֵׁר; ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי בֶּן אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״, וְלֹא כָּתַב ״עֵד״ – כָּשֵׁר, וְכָךְ הָיוּ נְקִיֵּי הַדַּעַת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם עוֹשִׂין. כָּתַב חֲנִיכָתוֹ וַחֲנִיכָתָהּ – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: So-and-so, witness, valid. Son of so-and-so, witness, valid. So-and-so, son of so-and-so, but did not write witness, valid. And this is what the scrupulous people of Jerusalem would do, wrote his surname [ ḥanikhato ] and her surname valid.
llm_translation: "A certain man, a witness" - valid. "The son of a certain man, a witness" - valid; "a certain man, the son of a certain man," and did not write "witness" - valid, and so did the conscientious people of Jerusalem. He wrote his betrothal and her betrothal - valid."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא הָנֵי תְּרֵי גִּיטֵּי הֲווֹ; וְאִיתְרְמִי לֵיהּ זְמַן דְּקַמָּא, וְעֵדִים דְּבָתְרָא; וְגַזְיֵיהּ לִזְמַן דְּבָתְרָא וְעֵדִים דְּקַמָּא!
human_translation: let us be concerned perhaps these were two bills of divorce, and the date of the first and the witnesses of the latter happened and cut out the date of the latter and the witnesses of the first
llm_translation: Gemara: And we should be concerned that perhaps these two bills of divorce were written together; and they were dated with the time of the first divorce, and witnesses signed after the date; and he cut the bill for the time of the second divorce and witnesses signed before the date!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: כְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ רֶיוַח מִלְּמַטָּה. וְדִלְמָא זְמַן דְּבָתְרָא מִיגָּז גַּזְיֵיהּ! כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: כְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ רֶיוַח מִלְּמַטָּה;
human_translation: Rav Abba says Rav says: where there is space below And perhaps he cut out the date of the latter Just as Rabbi Abba says Rav says where there is space below
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba said Rav: When there is a draft from below. But perhaps when the wind comes from the other side, it will blow it away! As Rabbi Abba said Rav: When there is a draft from below.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי – כְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ רֶיוַח מִלְּמַעְלָה.
human_translation: so too, where there is space above
llm_translation: Here we say - when there is a breeze from above.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אִימְּלוֹכֵי אִימְּלִיךְ (וּכְתַב)!
human_translation: But perhaps changed his mind and wrote
llm_translation: And perhaps they will say, "He ruled, he ruled (and wrote)!"

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ״ מִלְּמַטָּה, וּ״מוּתֶּרֶת״ מִלְּמַעְלָה. וְדִלְמָא אִיתְרְמִי לֵיהּ? כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: where he wrote: You are hereby, on the bottom and Permitted at the top But perhaps it happened We are not concerned to such a degree;
llm_translation: It is written, "Here you are" from below, and "permitted" from above. And perhaps it is a deception? We are not concerned about all this.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: דִּידִיעָה בֵּיהּ מְתַחְתָּא דִמְגִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: where the stretch of the scroll is clear,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Knowledge is inferior to the Megillah.

hebrew_text: חָתְמוּ עֵדִים בְּרֹאשׁ הַדַּף וְכוּ׳. אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב חָתֵים מִן הַצַּד! הָתָם בְּשֶׁגַּגּוֹ כְּלַפֵּי כְתָב.
human_translation: the witnesses signed at the top of the column Is that so? Wouldn’t Rav sign on the side? There, with the roof, of facing the text
llm_translation: The witnesses signed at the top of the page, etc. Is it not so?! But Rav signed from the side! There, it was a mistake corresponding to the writing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי: הִקִּיף רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְהָעֵדִים בָּאֶמְצַע – שְׁנֵיהֶם פְּסוּלִין; וְלִיחְזֵי הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ כְּלַפֵּי כְתָב, וְלִיתַּכְשַׁר!
human_translation: But that which is taught placed the top of this next to the top of that and the witnesses in the middle both are invalid. let us see which of them faces the text, and let it be rendered valid.
llm_translation: Rather, this that is taught: He encircled the head of this one alongside the head of that one, and the witnesses came in between - both of them are disqualified; and let us see which of them is according to the writing, and it will be valid!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, דִּרְמֵי לֵיהּ כְּעִיבְרָא.
human_translation: There, where they are placed like bolt,
llm_translation: There, similar to the liver.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד סוֹפוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְהָעֵדִים בָּאֶמְצַע – אֶת שֶׁהָעֵדִים נִיקְרִין בְּסוֹפוֹ, כָּשֵׁר. וְאִי דִּרְמֵי כְּעִיבְרָא – לָאו בַּהֲדֵי הַאי מִיקְּרֵי, וְלָאו בַּהֲדֵי הַאי מִיקְּרֵי!
human_translation: If so, the latter clause which teaches the top of this next to the end of that and the witnesses in the middle, at the end of which the witnesses are read is valid. And if where are placed like a bolt, they are neither read with this nor are they read with that
llm_translation: If so, the end of the Mishnah states: the head of this one is adjacent to the end of that one, and the witnesses are in the middle - when the witnesses are recognized at the end, it is valid. But if they are like a crossbeam - neither with the recognition of this one nor with the recognition of that one!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַב בְּדִיסְקֵי הֲוָה חָתֵים.
human_translation: Rather, Rav would sign letters
llm_translation: Rather, Rav was sitting in Diski.

hebrew_text: גֵּט שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ עִבְרִית וְכוּ׳ כָּתַב סוֹפֵר וְעֵד כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: ״חָתַם סוֹפֵר״ שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: a bill of divorce that was written in Hebrew the writing of a scribe, and witness valid Rabbi Yirmeya says: We learned the scribe signed
llm_translation: A bill of divorce that was written in Hebrew, etc., if a scribe and witnesses signed it, it is valid. Rabbi Yirmeya said: "The sealing of the scribe" we have learned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: whose is this? It is Rabbi Yosei
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "Ha mani - Rabbi Yosei hi."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא כְּתוּבַּת חֲתָנִים דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, דַּהֲווֹ יָדְעִי לֵיהּ לְטוּפְסָא, וְלַחֲתִימַת יְדָא דְּחַד סָהֲדָא. סְבַר לְאַכְשׁוֹרַהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: ״חָתַם סוֹפֵר״ שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: a certain marriage contract that was brought before Rabbi Abbahu, which recognized its formula, and the signature of one witness. thought to deem it valid Rabbi Yirmeya said to him: We learned the scribe signed
llm_translation: That written document of witnesses that came before Rabbi Avahu, for they were familiar with the signature, and the sealing of the hand of one witness. He thought to challenge it, Rabbi Yirmiyah said to him: "We have learned 'the seal of a scribe.'"

hebrew_text: כָּתַב חֲנִיכָתוֹ וַחֲנִיכָתָהּ – כָּשֵׁר. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲנִיכַת אָבוֹת בְּגִיטִּין – עַד עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת – כָּשֵׁר, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: wrote his surname and her surname valid. The Sages taught A surname forefathers with regard to bills of divorce until ten generations Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: valid three generations; from this forward invalid.
llm_translation: He wrote his betrothal and her betrothal - valid. The Sages taught: The betrothal of fathers in bills of divorce - up to ten generations. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Three generations - valid, from here on - invalid.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כָּתַב חֲנִיכַת אָבוֹת בְּגִיטִּין עַד שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת? כְּמַאן – כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Ḥanina said, the writing of a surname forefathers with regard to bills of divorce until three generations in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.
llm_translation: As to where did this go? This is like what Rabbi Chanina said: "One should write the introduction of the fathers in bills of divorce up to three generations." As to where? Like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי קְרָאָה? ״כִּי תוֹלִיד בָּנִים וּבְנֵי בָנִים וְנוֹשַׁנְתֶּם״.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the verse “When you will beget children, and children’s children, and you will have been long [ venoshantem ]
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the verse? "When you beget children and grandchildren and have grown old."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לֹא חָרְבָה אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַד שֶׁעָבְדוּ בָּהּ שִׁבְעָה בָּתֵּי דִינִים עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט, וּבַעְשָׁא בֶּן אֲחִיָּה, וְאַחְאָב בֶּן עָמְרִי, וְיֵהוּא בֶּן נִמְשִׁי, וּפֶקַח בֶּן רְמַלְיָהוּ, וּמְנַחֵם בֶּן גָּדִי, וְהוֹשֵׁעַ בֶּן אֵלָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוּמְלְלָה יוֹלֶדֶת הַשִּׁבְעָה, נָפְחָה נַפְשָׁהּ, בָּאָה שִׁמְשָׁהּ בְּעוֹד יוֹמָם, בּוֹשָׁה וְחָפֵרָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: destruction Eretz Yisrael did not until seven courts committed idol worship in it, and they are these: Jeroboam, son of Nevat; and Baasa, son of Ahijah; and Ahab, son of Omri; and Jehu, son of Nimshi; and Pekah, son of Remaliah; and Menahem, son of Gadi; and Hoshea, son of Elah, as it is stated: “She who has given birth to seven languishes; her spirit droops; her sun is gone down while it was yet day, she is ashamed and confounded”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The land of Israel was not destroyed until seven courts of idolatry were established in it, and these are they: Jeroboam ben Nebat, Baasha ben Ahijah, Ahab ben Omri, Jehu ben Nimshi, Pekah ben Remaliah, Menachem ben Gadi, and Hoshea ben Elah. As it is stated: "She who bore seven languishes, she breathes her last; her sun sets while it is still day, she is shamed and disgraced."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַמֵּי: מַאי קְרָאָה? ״כִּי תוֹלִיד בָּנִים וּבְנֵי בָנִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: What is the verse “When you will beget children, and children’s children,
llm_translation: Rav Ammi said: What is the verse? "When you give birth to children and grandchildren."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב, כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּהוֹשֵׁעַ בֶּן אֵלָה: ״וַיַּעַשׂ הָרַע בְּעֵינֵי ה׳, רַק לֹא כְּמַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּכְתִיב: ״עָלָיו עָלָה שַׁלְמַנְאֶסֶר וְגוֹ׳״?
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: It is written with regard to Hoshea ben Elah: “And he did that which was evil in the eyes of the Lord, yet not as the kings of Israel But it is written “Against him came up Shalmaneser,
llm_translation: They said to him, Rav Kahana and Rav Assi to Rav, it is written in it in Hosea son of Elah: "And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord, but not like the kings of Israel," and it is written: "Shalmaneser came up against him, etc."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אוֹתָן פַּרְדְּסִיאוֹת שֶׁהוֹשִׁיב יָרׇבְעָם עַל הַדְּרָכִים כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל, בָּא הוֹשֵׁעַ וּבִיטְּלָן, וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן לֹא עָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁלֹּא עָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל – יֵלְכוּ בַּשֶּׁבִי.
human_translation: said to them: Hoshea came and canceled those guards [ pardesei’ot ] that Jeroboam placed on the roads in order to prevent Israel from ascending to on the pilgrimage Festival, and even so Israel did not ascend to on the pilgrimage Festival. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said those years that Israel did not ascend to on the pilgrimage Festival they will go into captivity.
llm_translation: He said to them: Those orchards that Jeroboam established on the roads so that the Israelites would not go up to Jerusalem for the pilgrimage, Hosea came and nullified them, yet the Israelites did not go up for the pilgrimage. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Those years that the Israelites did not go up for the pilgrimage - they will go into exile.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, דָּרֵשׁ מָרִימָר: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁקוֹד ה׳ עַל הָרָעָה וַיְבִיאֶהָ עָלֵינוּ, כִּי צַדִּיק ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״? מִשּׁוּם דְּ״צַדִּיק ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״ – ״וַיִּשְׁקוֹד ה׳ עַל הָרָעָה וַיְבִיאֶהָ עָלֵינוּ״?!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said, and some say Rav Ḥisda said Rabbi Yirmeya said, Mareimar interpreted homiletically What which is written: “And so the Lord has watched over the evil, and brought it upon us; for the Lord our God is righteous [ tzaddik ]” because the Lord, our God, is righteous, the Lord watched over the evil and brought it upon us?
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva, and some say in the name of Rav Ḥisda in the name of Rabbi Yirmeya, Marimar expounded: What is the meaning of what is written: "And the Lord has brought upon us great evil, for the Lord our God is righteous"? Because "the Lord our God is righteous" – "And the Lord has brought upon us great evil"?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא צְדָקָה עָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁהִגְלָה גָּלוּת צִדְקִיָּהוּ – וַעֲדַיִין גָּלוּת יְכָנְיָה קַיֶּימֶת; דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּגָלוּת יְכָנְיָה: ״הֶחָרָשׁ וְהַמַּסְגֵּר אֶלֶף״;
