human_translation: Rather, The Holy One, Blessed be He, performed charity [ tzedaka ] with Israel by exiling the exile of Zedekiah while the exile of Jeconiah still existed as it is written with regard to the exile of Jeconiah: “And the craftsmen [ ḥarash ] and the smiths [ masger ] a thousand”
llm_translation: Rather, charity did the Holy One, blessed be He, perform with Israel, for He exiled the exile of Zedekiah - and yet the exile of Jeconiah remains standing; as it is written regarding it in the exile of Jeconiah: "The carpenter and the smith, a thousand."

hebrew_text: ״חָרָשׁ״ – שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁפּוֹתְחִין, נַעֲשׂוּ הַכֹּל כְּחֵרְשִׁין. ״מַסְגֵּר״ – כֵּיוָן שֶׁסּוֹגְרִין, שׁוּב אֵינָן פּוֹתְחִין. וְכַמָּה – אֶלֶף.
human_translation: Ḥarash , that when they would introduce everyone would become like deaf persons, Masger , once they would close no would introduce again, And how many one thousand.
llm_translation: "Charash" - when they open, everything is made like potters. "Masger" - once they close, they do not open again. And how many? A thousand.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: שֶׁהִקְדִּים שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים לִ״וְנוֹשַׁנְתֶּם״.
human_translation: Ulla says by advancing by two years venoshantem
llm_translation: Ulla said: "That he preceded two years with 'And you shall be changed.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, ״מְהֵרָה״ דְּמָרֵי עָלְמָא – תַּמְנֵי מְאָה וְחַמְשִׁין וְתַרְתֵּי הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Learn from soon [ mehera ] for the Master of the World is eight hundred and fifty-two
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Understand from it, "mehera" of the masters of the world - eighty-five and two it is.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ גֵּט מְעוּשֶּׂה, בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל – כָּשֵׁר, וּבְגוֹיִם – פָּסוּל. וּבְגוֹיִם – חוֹבְטִין אוֹתוֹ וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: ״עֲשֵׂה מַה שֶּׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל אוֹמְרִים לָךְ״ (וְכָשֵׁר).
human_translation: a bill of divorce was compelled by a Jewish valid, but by gentiles invalid. But with regard to gentiles they may beat him and say to him: Do what the Jews are telling you, and it is a valid
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A divorce document that is written by a Jew is valid among Jews, but invalid among non-Jews. Among non-Jews, they beat him and say to him: "Do what the Jews tell you to do" (and it is valid).

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: גֵּט הַמְעוּשֶּׂה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, כַּדִּין – כָּשֵׁר; שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין – פָּסוּל, וּפוֹסֵל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: a bill of divorce was compelled by a Jewish lawfully, valid. unlawfully, invalid, but disqualifies
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: A divorce document that is written according to the custom of Israel, if it is done correctly - it is valid; if not done correctly - it is invalid and disqualifies the divorce.

hebrew_text: וּבְגוֹיִם, כַּדִּין – פָּסוּל וּפוֹסֵל, שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין – אֲפִילּוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט אֵין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And by gentiles, lawfully, invalid, but disqualifies unlawfully it does not have even the trace of a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: And among the nations, similarly - disqualified and disqualifies, not similarly - even the smell of the divorce document is not in it.

hebrew_text: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי גּוֹיִם בְּנֵי עַשּׂוֹיֵי נִינְהוּ, אִיתַּכְשׁוֹרֵי נָמֵי לִיתַּכְשַׁר! אִי לָאו בְּנֵי עַשּׂוֹיֵי נִינְהוּ, מִיפְסָל לָא לִיפְסֹל!
human_translation: whichever way you look at it, If gentiles are capable of compulsion, it should be rendered valid as well. If they are not capable of compulsion, it should not disqualify
llm_translation: "What is your soul? If they are from the nations, they are the descendants of Esau, they are fit; if not, they are not fit!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה – גֵּט מְעוּשֶּׂה בַּגּוֹיִם, כָּשֵׁר. וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ פָּסוּל – שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת הוֹלֶכֶת וְתוֹלָה עַצְמָהּ בְּגוֹי, ומַפְקַעַת עַצְמָהּ מִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya says: By Torah law a bill of divorce was compelled by gentiles is valid, and what is the reason said invalid? so that each and every woman will not go and depend on a gentile and release herself from her husband
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said: A matter of Torah - a bill of divorce executed among the nations, is valid. And what is the reason they said it is invalid? So that not every single woman goes and marries herself off to a gentile, and then frees herself immediately from her husband's hand.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין – אֲפִילּוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט אֵין בּוֹ?! וְנֶהֱוֵי שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמִפְסָל נָמֵי לִפְסוֹל!
human_translation: If that is so, unlawfully it does not have even the trace of a bill of divorce? Let unlawfully be compared to Jews, and disqualify as well.
llm_translation: If so, that it is not according to the law - even the smell of the divorce document is not in it?! And it will be that it is not according to the law like a Jew, and disqualified is also to disqualify!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא – בְּדוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, that of Rav Mesharshiyya, is a mistake.
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Mesharshya said - it is a certainty.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? כַּדִּין בְּכַדִּין דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל – מִיחַלַּף. שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין בְּכַדִּין [דְּ]יִשְׂרָאֵל – לָא מִיחַלַּף.
human_translation: And what is the reason lawfully can be confused with lawfully by Jews. unlawfully cannot be confused with lawfully by Jews,
llm_translation: The reason what? As the law in the law of Israel - it changes. Not as the law in the law of Israel - it does not change.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּיָתֵיב וְקָא מְעַשֵּׂה אַגִּיטֵּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא אֲנַן – הֶדְיוֹטוֹת אֲנַן, וְתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֲגוֹרִיאוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁדִּינֵיהֶם כְּדִינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל – אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְהִיזָּקֵק לָהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵלֶּה הַמִּשְׁפָּטִים אֲשֶׁר תָּשִׂים לִפְנֵיהֶם״; ״לִפְנֵיהֶם״ – וְלֹא לִפְנֵי גּוֹיִם. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״לִפְנֵיהֶם״ – וְלֹא לִפְנֵי הֶדְיוֹטוֹת!
human_translation: Abaye found Rav Yosef sitting and compelling bills of divorce. He said to him: But aren’t we ordinary people, And it is taught Rabbi Tarfon would say: any place where you find gentile courts [ agoriot ], even if their laws are like Jewish laws, you may not attend them, as it is stated: “Now these are the ordinances which you shall set before them” before them, and not before gentiles. Alternatively, before them, and not before ordinary people.
llm_translation: Abaye found Rav Yosef sitting and counting coins. He said to him: "But we are laymen, and it is taught: Rabbi Tarfon used to say, 'In any place where you find Gentile coins, even though their laws are like the laws of Israel, you are not permitted to benefit from them, as it is stated: 'And these are the judgments that you shall set before them' - 'before them' and not before Gentiles.' Another explanation: 'before them' and not before laymen!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנַן – שְׁלִיחוּתַיְיהוּ קָא עָבְדִינַן, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַהוֹדָאוֹת וְהַלְוָאוֹת.
human_translation: said to him: we are performing their agency, just as is with regard to admissions and loans,
llm_translation: He said to him: We - their emissaries are acting, since it is a matter of witnesses and loans.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, גְּזֵילוֹת וְחַבָּלוֹת נָמֵי! כִּי עָבְדִינַן שְׁלִיחוּתַיְיהוּ – בְּמִילְּתָא דִשְׁכִיחָא, בְּמִילְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא – לָא עָבְדִינַן שְׁלִיחוּתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: If so, robbery and injury? as well. When we perform their agency, with regard to common matters, with regard to uncommon matters, we do not perform their agency.
llm_translation: Thus, regarding robbery and extortion, indeed! For we establish their agency - in a matter that is common, in a matter that is not common - we do not establish their agency.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יָצָא שְׁמָהּ בָּעִיר ״מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת; ״מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא שָׁם אֲמַתְלָא.
human_translation: a rumor circulated in the city betrothed, she is betrothed. divorced, she is divorced, provided there is no explanation [ amatla ]
llm_translation: It was taught: If her name went out in the city as "Mekudeshet" - behold, she is Mekudeshet; "Megureshet" - behold, she is Megureshet. And only if there is no amata there.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹ הִיא אֲמַתְלָא? גֵּירַשׁ אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ עַל תְּנַאי; זָרַק לָהּ קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ – סָפֵק קָרוֹב לָהּ, סָפֵק קָרוֹב לוֹ – זוֹ הִיא אֲמַתְלָא.
human_translation: What is explanation? so-and-so divorced his wife conditionally. threw her betrothal, to her, uncertain closer to her uncertain closer to him, this is explanation.
llm_translation: Which is the case of Amatla? A man divorced a certain woman on condition; he threw her his betrothal - doubt close to her, doubt close to him - this is the case of Amatla.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאָסְרִינַן לַהּ אַגַּבְרָא?! וְהָא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כֹּל קָלָא דְּבָתַר נִישּׂוּאִין – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לֵיהּ!
human_translation: do we render her forbidden to husband But didn’t Rav Ashi say we are not concerned about any rumor that after marriage?
llm_translation: Gemara: And we forbid her because of a man?! But didn't Rav Ashi say: "Any light matter of betrothal - we do not pay attention to it!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: יָצָא שְׁמָהּ בָּעִיר ״מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת וּמְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״ –
human_translation: this is what is saying: a rumor circulated in the city betrothed, she is betrothed, betrothed and divorced
llm_translation: So it is stated: Her name went out in the city as "Mekudeshet" - this is considered Mekudeshet. "Mekudeshet and Megoreshet" -

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. מַאי טַעְמָא? קוֹל וְשׁוֹבְרוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: she is divorced What is the reason rumor with its receipt.
llm_translation: Behold, she is divorced. What is the reason? A voice and he detests her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: יָצָא לָהּ שֵׁם מְזַנָּה בָּעִיר – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? פְּרִיצוּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּחֲזוֹ לַהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: a rumor circulated in the city engaged in licentious sexual intercourse, we are not concerned What is the reason saw her merely licentious behavior,
llm_translation: Rava said: If the name of a prostitute has become known in the city - we are not concerned for her. What is the reason? It is merely a matter of promiscuity that people have seen in her.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: אָכְלָה בַּשּׁוּק, גִּירְגְּרָה בַּשּׁוּק, הֵנִיקָה בַּשּׁוּק – בְּכוּלָּן רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: תֵּצֵא. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיִּשְּׂאוּ וְיִתְּנוּ בָּהּ מוֹזְרוֹת בַּלְּבָנָה.
human_translation: parallel to tanna’im : ate in the marketplace, walked with her neck stretched forward in the marketplace, nursed in the marketplace, with regard to all of Rabbi Meir says she must leave Rabbi Akiva says once the women who spin [ mozerot ] by the moonlight converse about her
llm_translation: The Tannaim: If she ate in the marketplace, rolled in the marketplace, nursed in the marketplace - in all these cases Rabbi Meir says: she is divorced. Rabbi Akiva says: until they lift and place in it girdles of white wool.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: אִם כֵּן, לֹא הִנַּחְתָּ בַּת לְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת תַּחַת בַּעֲלָהּ, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים אוֹ עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יָקוּם דָּבָר״; מָה לְהַלָּן דָּבָר בָּרוּר, אַף כָּאן דָּבָר בָּרוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said to him: If so, you have not allowed daughter of Abraham our forefather to remain with her husband, And the Torah said: “Because he has found some unseemly matter in her, and it says over there: “At the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, a matter shall be established” Just as there, a clear matter, so too here, a clear matter
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri: If so, you did not leave the daughter of our father Abraham who sits beneath her husband, and the Torah said: "For he found in her the nakedness of a thing," and there it says: "By the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter be established"; just as there it is a clear matter, so too here it is a clear matter.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בְּעוּלָה״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ. ״נְשׂוּאָה״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ. ״אֲרוּסָה״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ. ״שֶׁלֹּא לִפְלוֹנִי״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ. ״בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a non-virgin, one is not concerned about it, a married woman, one is not concerned about it. a betrothed woman, one is not concerned about it. not to so-and-so, one is not concerned about it. in another city, one is not concerned about it.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Ba'ulah" - we are not concerned for her. "Nesu'ah" - we are not concerned for her. "Arusah" - we are not concerned for her. "Shelo lifloni" - we are not concerned for her. "Be'ir acheret" - we are not concerned for her.

hebrew_text: ״מַמְזֶרֶת״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ. ״שִׁפְחָה״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהּ.
human_translation: a daughter born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzeret ], one is not concerned about it. a maidservant, one is not concerned about it.
llm_translation: "Mamzeret" - we do not suspect her. "Shifcha" - we do not suspect her.

hebrew_text: ״הִקְדִּישׁ פְּלוֹנִי נְכָסָיו״; ״הִפְקִיר פְּלוֹנִי נְכָסָיו״ – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לָהֶן.
human_translation: so-and-so consecrated his property, so-and-so renounced ownership of his property, we are not concerned about these
llm_translation: "The one sanctified so-and-so's possessions"; "The one declared ownerless so-and-so's possessions" - we are not concerned for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: לֹא שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ קוֹל הֲבָרָה; אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ נֵרוֹת דּוֹלְקוֹת וּמִטּוֹת מוּצָּעוֹת, וּבְנֵי אָדָם נִכְנָסִין וְיוֹצְאִין וְאוֹמְרִים: ״פְּלוֹנִית מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: Ulla says: not where heard an echo. Rather, where there are candles lit and beds made and people entering and leaving and saying so-and-so is becoming betrothed today.
llm_translation: Ulla said: Not that they heard the voice of the embryo; rather, so that the candles are lit and the beds are made, and people come in and go out and say, "So-and-so is betrothed today."

hebrew_text: ״מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת״?! וְדִלְמָא לָא אִקַּדַּשָׁה! אֵימָא: ״פְּלוֹנִית נִתְקַדְּשָׁה הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: becoming betrothed, Perhaps she was not betrothed say so-and-so was betrothed today.
llm_translation: "Is she sanctified"?! And perhaps she was not sanctified! Say: "So-and-so was sanctified today."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן תָּנֵי לֵוִי: לֹא שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ קוֹל הֲבָרָה; אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ נֵרוֹת דּוֹלְקוֹת וּמִטּוֹת מוּצָּעוֹת, וְנָשִׁים טוֹוֹת לְאוֹר הַנֵּר וּשְׂמֵחוֹת לָהּ, וְאוֹמְרוֹת: ״פְּלוֹנִית מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת הַיּוֹם״. ״מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת״?! וְדִלְמָא לָא אִקַּדַּשָׁה! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, אֵימָא: ״פְּלוֹנִית נִתְקַדְּשָׁה הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: And similarly, Levi taught not where hear an echo. Rather, where candles are lit and beds are made, and women are spinning by candlelight and rejoicing for her and saying so-and-so is becoming betrothed today. becoming betrothed, Perhaps she was not betrothed Rav Pappa said: Say so-and-so was betrothed today.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so Levi taught: Not that they should hear the voice of the embryo; rather, so that the lamps are burning, the beds are made, and the women are adorned for the light of the lamp and rejoice in it, and they say, "So-and-so is sanctified today." "Is sanctified"?! But perhaps she has not been sanctified! Rav Papa said, rather, "So-and-so has been sanctified today."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ קוֹל הֲבָרָה; אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ נֵרוֹת דּוֹלְקוֹת וּמִטּוֹת מוּצָּעוֹת, וּבְנֵי אָדָם נִכְנָסִין וְיוֹצְאִין. אָמְרוּ דָּבָר – זֶה הוּא קוֹל, לֹא אָמְרוּ דָּבָר – זֶהוּ אֲמַתְלָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: not where heard an echo. Rather, where there are candles lit and beds made and people entering and leaving. they made statement this is a rumor they did not make a statement, this is explanation
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Not that they heard the voice of a frog; rather, so that the lamps may be lit and the beds made, and people may come and go. They said a matter - this is the voice; they did not say a matter - this is a falsehood.

hebrew_text: לֹא אָמְרוּ?! וְהָא לֹא אָמְרוּ וְלֹא כְּלוּם! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: אֲמַתְלָא שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אֲפִילּוּ מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – לָא אָמְרוּ, הוּא דְּהָוְיָא אֲמַתְלָא; הָא אָמְרוּ – לָא הָוְיָא אֲמַתְלָא.
human_translation: they did not make a statement, But they did not say anything to the exclusion of that which Rabba bar Rav Huna said: The explanation mentioned even from now until ten days teaches us did not say is it considered an explanation they said is not considered an explanation
llm_translation: They did not say?! But did they not say, and not nothing! To refute from Rabba bar Rav Huna, who said: The truth is that they said, even from here until ten days. It is implied to us - they did not say, that is when it is not the truth; but they did say - it is not the truth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ קוֹל הֲבָרָה, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: פְּלוֹנִי מֵהֵיכָן שָׁמַע? מִפְּלוֹנִי; וּפְלוֹנִי מִפְּלוֹנִי; וּבוֹדְקִין וְהוֹלְכִין עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעִין לְדָבָר הַבָּרוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Rav Huna said Rav said: not where heard an echo. Rather, where say: From where did so-and-so hear From so-and-so, and so-and-so from so-and-so. And investigate continuously, until they reach a clear matter,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav: Not that they heard the voice of the frog, but rather so that they would say, "So-and-so, from where did he hear?" "From so-and-so." "And so-and-so from so-and-so." And they investigate and inquire until they reach a clear matter.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר הַבָּרוּר – עֵדוּת מְעַלַּיְיתָא הוּא! אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: לֹא שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ קוֹל הֲבָרָה, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: פְּלוֹנִי, מֵהֵיכָן שָׁמַע? מִפְּלוֹנִי; וּפְלוֹנִי מִפְּלוֹנִי; וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: a clear matter it is proper testimony, Rather, when Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda came Rabbi Abba said Rav Huna said Rav said: not where heard an echo. Rather, where say: From where did so-and-so hear From so-and-so, and so-and-so from so-and-so, and they went overseas,
llm_translation: Clear testimony - it is a higher testimony! Rather, when Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah came, Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav: Not that they heard the voice of a wild animal, but rather so that they would say, "So-and-so, from where did he hear?" "From so-and-so." And so on, they went to the province by the sea.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא, אוֹ לָא מְבַטְּלִינַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ מִפִּי הַכְּשֵׁרִים, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Do we suppress a rumor or do we not suppress He said to him: Since Rav Ḥisda says until hears from valid learn from it we suppress a rumor.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: We nullify a voice, or do we not nullify? He said to him: From what Rav Chisda said: Until they hear from the mouths of the qualified, hear from it: we nullify a voice.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדְּרַבָּה! מִדְּאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אֲפִילּוּ מִפִּי נָשִׁים הָוֵי קוֹל – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לָא מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא!
human_translation: said to him: On the contrary, since Rav Sheshet said even from women it is rumor, learn from it we do not suppress a rumor.
llm_translation: He said to him: Adrabah! Since Rav Sheshet said: Even from the mouth of women is considered a voice - infer from it: we do not nullify a voice!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְרָווֹתָא נִינְהוּ; בְּסוּרָא מְבַטְּלִי קָלָא, בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא לָא מְבַטְּלִי קָלָא.
human_translation: said to him: These places. In Sura they suppress a rumor, in Neharde’a they do not suppress a rumor.
llm_translation: He said to him: They are idols; in Surah they nullify a vow, in Nehardea they do not nullify a vow.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דִּנְפַק עֲלַהּ קָלָא דְּאִיקַּדַּשָׁה לְבַר בֵּי רַב, אַתְיֵיהּ רַב חָמָא לַאֲבוּהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לִי – הֵיכִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַל תְּנַאי קַדֵּישׁ, אַדַּעְתָּא דְּלָא אָזֵיל לְבֵי חוֹזַאי, וַאֲזַל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דִּבְעִידָּנָא דַּהֲוַאי קָלָא – לָא הֲוַאי אֲמַתְלָא, לָאו כֹּל כְּמִינָךְ דְּמַחְזְקַתְּ אֲמַתְלָא.
human_translation: A rumor circulated that a certain was betrothed to a student Rav Ḥama summoned her father said to him: Tell me how the incident said to him: betrothed conditionally, with the intention that he would not go to Bei Ḥozai, and he went said to him: Since at the time that the rumor existed explanation did not exist, it is not in your power to create the presumption of an explanation.
llm_translation: That incident where a voice came out and proclaimed, "Bar Be Rav has been sanctified," Rav Chama came to his father. He said to him: "Tell me, how was the matter conducted?" He said to him: "According to the conditions of sanctity. I knew that he did not go to the house of the butcher, and he went." He said to him: "Since the voice that came out was not clear, it was not certain, not everyone is like you who can ascertain certainty."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דִּנְפַק עֲלַהּ קָלָא, דְּאִיקַּדַּשָׁה בַּאֲצִיפָּא דְּתוּחְלָא, בְּעֵינָא דְּ״בֵי שִׁיפֵי״. שַׁלְחַהּ רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא, בְּהָא מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא; מֵימָר אָמְרִי: עַיִּינוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי, וְלָא הֲוָה בְּהוּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: A rumor circulated that a certain was betrothed with a mat of dates [ atzifa detoḥela ] from the spring of Bei Shifei. Rav Idi bar Avin sent before Abaye, What a case like this? said to him: Even according to the one who said we do not suppress a rumor, in this we suppress the rumor. they will say the Sages investigated her betrothal, and it was not worth one peruta
llm_translation: That one who went out with a light leaf, which became sanctified in the oven of Tuchla, in the eyes of the "House of Shifei." Rav Idi bar Avin sent it before Abaye: What is the status of this bundle? He said to him: Even according to the one who says we do not nullify a leaf, in this case we nullify a leaf; the statement they said: The Rabbis were mistaken in their sanctifications, and it was not equal in its details.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דִּנְפַק עֲלַהּ קָלָא, דְּאִיקַּדַּשָׁה
human_translation: A rumor circulated that a certain was betrothed
llm_translation: That one that went out with a light, that she was betrothed.

hebrew_text: לְחַד מִבְּנֵי פְּלָנְיָא, אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא, בְּהָא מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא; מֵימָר אָמְרִי: עַיִּינוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי, וְקִידּוּשֵׁי קָטָן הֲווֹ.
human_translation: to one of the sons of so-and-so, Rava said: Even according to the one who says we do not suppress a rumor, in this we suppress the rumor. they will say the Sages investigated the betrothal and it was the betrothal of a minor.
llm_translation: From one of the sons of Ploni, Rava said: Even according to the one who says we do not nullify a light, in this case we nullify a light; the statement is said: The Rabbis looked at them in matters of sanctification, and the sanctifications were minor.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דִּנְפַק עֲלַהּ קָלָא, דְּאִיקַּדַּשָׁה לְקָטָן הַנִּרְאֶה כְּגָדוֹל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וְאָמְרוּ: עֲדַיִין לֹא הִגִּיעַ לִ״פְלַגּוֹת רְאוּבֵן״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִפְלַגּוֹת רְאוּבֵן גְּדוֹלִים חִקְרֵי לֵב״.
human_translation: A rumor circulated that a certain woman was betrothed to a minor boy who looked like an adult, Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: There was a precedent in which said did not yet reach the divisions of Reuben, as it is stated: “Among the divisions of Reuben there were major resolves of heart”
llm_translation: That one that went out with a light, that she was betrothed to a minor who appears as an adult. Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: There was a case, and they said: "He has not yet reached the age of 'half of Reuven's days,'" as it is stated: "For the divisions of Reuven there are great searchings of heart."

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא שָׁם אֲמַתְלָא: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: אֲמַתְלָא שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אֲפִילּוּ מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים. רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: בִּמְקוֹם אֲמַתְלָא, חוֹשְׁשִׁין לַאֲמַתְלָא.
human_translation: provided there is no explanation. Rabba bar Rav Huna said: The explanation mentioned even from now, until ten days Rav Zevid says: Where an explanation, we are concerned about an explanation
llm_translation: And only not be there Amatla: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Amatla that they said, even from here until ten days. Rav Zevid said: In a place of Amatla, we are concerned for Amatla.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרַב זְבִיד: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא שָׁם אֲמַתְלָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּמְקוֹם אֲמַתְלָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised an objection to Rav Zevid Provided there is no explanation, said to him: is saying where an explanation
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Papa against Rav Zevid: "And only that there should not be a truth there!" He said to him: "He was speaking in a place of truth."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא לְרַב פָּפָּא: וְאַתְּ לָא תִּסְבְּרַאּ?! וְהָתְנַן: נִתְקַדְּשָׁה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא בַּעְלָהּ – מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר. לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן עַל תְּנַאי קַדֵּישׁ?
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to Rav Pappa: And you, do you not hold But didn’t we learn was betrothed and then her husband came she is permitted to return Isn’t because we say betrothed her conditionally,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Kahana to Rav Papa: "And you do not think so?!" And we learned in a Mishnah: If she became consecrated, and afterwards her husband came - she is permitted to return. Is it not because we say regarding a condition of sanctity?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָתֵי בַּעַל וְקָא מְעַרְעֵר.
human_translation: It is different there because the husband comes and contests
llm_translation: The difference there is that the owner comes and objects.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נִישֵּׂאת נָמֵי! נִישֵּׂאת, דַּעֲבַדָה אִיסּוּרָא – קַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן; נִתְקַדְּשָׁה, דְּלָא עֲבַדָה אִיסּוּרָא – לָא קַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: If so, she married also she married since she performed a prohibited the Sages penalized her. she was betrothed, since she did not perform a prohibited the Sages did not penalize her.
llm_translation: So it is, she is married! If she is married, because she committed a prohibition - the Rabbis penalize her; if she is consecrated, because she did not commit a prohibition - the Rabbis do not penalize her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כֹּל קָלָא דְּלָא אִיתַּחְזַק בְּבֵי דִינָא – לָאו קָלָא הוּא. וְאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כֹּל קָלָא דְּבָתַר נִישּׂוּאִין – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לֵיהּ; הָא דְּבָתַר אֵירוּסִין – חָיְישִׁינַן לֵיהּ. רַב חֲבִיבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ דְּבָתַר אֵירוּסִין נָמֵי, לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לֵיהּ. וְהִלְכְתָא: לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Any rumor that was not confirmed in court is not rumor. And Rav Ashi said: any rumor that after marriage, we are not concerned about it. after betrothal we are concerned about it, Rav Ḥaviva said: Even after betrothal, we are still not concerned about it. And the halakha is we are not concerned about it.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Any light matter that is not taken seriously in the court - is not a light matter. And Rav Ashei said: Any light matter after betrothal - we are not concerned about it; but after marriage - we are concerned about it. Rav Chaviva said: Even after betrothal, we are also not concerned about it. And the halakha is: we are not concerned about it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ מִבֵּי רַב לִשְׁמוּאֵל, יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ: יָצָא עָלֶיהָ קוֹל מֵרִאשׁוֹן, וּבָא אַחֵר וְקִדְּשָׁהּ קִידּוּשֵׁי תוֹרָה, מַהוּ? שְׁלַח לְהוּ: תֵּצֵא, וְהַעֲמִידוּ הַדָּבָר עַל בּוּרְיוֹ, וְהוֹדִיעוּנִי.
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said from the study hall of Rav sent to Shmuel Teach us, our master: a rumor circulated about to a first and another came and betrothed her betrothal by Torah law, what is He sent them She must leave and you clarify the matter and inform me.
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: They sent to him from the house of Rav to Shmuel, let our master teach us: A voice came out against her from the beginning, and another came and sanctified her with the sanctification of Torah, what is the law? Send to them: She shall go out, and establish the matter on its own, and inform me.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְהַעֲמִידוּ הַדָּבָר עַל בּוּרְיוֹ״? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִי מִגַּלְּיָא מִילְּתָא דְּקִידּוּשֵׁי דְקַמָּא לָאו קִידּוּשֵׁי מְעַלְּיָא נִינְהוּ – מְבַטְּלִינַן קָלָא; וְהָא נְהַרְדְּעָא אַתְרֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הוּא, וְלָא מְבַטְּלִי קָלָא! אֶלָּא דְּאִי מִיגַּלְּיָא מִילְּתָא דְּקִידּוּשֵׁי קַמָּא קִידּוּשֵׁי מְעַלְּיָא נִינְהוּ – לֹא צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: What And you clarify the matter? If we say that if it is discovered that the betrothal of the first was not a proper betrothal we suppress the rumor, isn’t Neharde’a Shmuel’s locale? And they would not suppress a rumor. Rather, because if it is discovered that the betrothal of the first was a proper betrothal, she does not need a bill of divorce from the second
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and establish the matter on its own merit"? If you say that if the matter of the first betrothal is revealed, it is not considered a valid betrothal - we nullify it lightly; but the river Dirde'a is the place of Samuel, and they do not nullify it lightly! Rather, if the matter of the first betrothal is revealed, it is considered a valid betrothal - a divorce is not needed afterward.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב הוּנָא – דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁפָּשְׁטָה יָדָהּ, וְקִיבְּלָה קִידּוּשִׁין מֵאַחֵר, מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת –
human_translation: And is in disagreement with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: a married woman who extended her hand and received betrothal from another betrothed
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rav Huna - for Rav Huna said: A married woman who has extended her hand, and received betrothal from another, she is betrothed -

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא; דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה לְבַעְלָהּ: ״גֵּירַשְׁתַּנִי״ – נֶאֱמֶנֶת, חֲזָקָה אֵין אִשָּׁה מְעִיזָּה פָּנֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: by Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna says a woman who said to her husband: You divorced me, is deemed credible, presumption a wife is not brazen before her husband.
llm_translation: From Rav Hamnuna; for Rav Hamnuna said: A woman who said to her husband, "You have divorced me" - she is believed, for it is an established presumption that a woman does not dare to confront her husband.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ – כִּי אִתְּמַר דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא, בְּפָנָיו; שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו – מְעִיזָּה וּמְעִיזָּה.
human_translation: And the other Rav Hamnuna’s was stated when in presence not in his presence she is certainly brazen
llm_translation: And the other opinion - for it was said by Rav Hamnuna, in his presence; if not in his presence - it is daring and daring.

hebrew_text: לֹא מָצְאוּ דָּבָר עַל בּוּרְיוֹ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: What is they did not find a clear matter,
llm_translation: They did not find a matter on his pit, what is it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מְגָרֵשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, וְנוֹשֵׂא שֵׁנִי. אֲבָל מְגָרֵשׁ שֵׁנִי וְנוֹשֵׂא רִאשׁוֹן – לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָתֵי לְמֵימַר: מַחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִן הָאֵירוּסִין.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: first divorces and second marries But second divorce her and first marry not What is the reason come to say remarrying his divorcée after betrothal
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The first divorcee remarries, and the second one carries out the divorce. But the second divorcee remarries, and the first one carries out the divorce - no. What is the reason? It comes to say: He returns his divorced wife from the betrothal.

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁינָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר: אַף מְגָרֵשׁ שֵׁנִי וְנוֹשֵׂא רִאשׁוֹן, מֵימָר אָמְרִי: עַיִּינוּ רַבָּנַן בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי, וְקִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rav Shinnana, son of Rav Idi, says: second divorce and first marry is also they will say the Sages investigated the betrothal and it was a mistaken betrothal.
llm_translation: Rav Shinnana, son of Rav Idi, said: Even a divorced man marries a second wife and then divorces her, the first wife is still considered his primary wife. The Gemara says: The Rabbis were mistaken in matters of sanctity, and sanctity was in error.

hebrew_text: יָצָא עָלֶיהָ קוֹל מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, מַהוּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אַף זוֹ – מְגָרֵשׁ רִאשׁוֹן וְנוֹשֵׂא שֵׁנִי. אַמֵּימָר אָמַר: מוּתֶּרֶת לִשְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: What is a rumor circulated about her to this and to that Rav Pappa says: this too, first divorces and second marries Ameimar says: She is permitted to both
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A voice came out from here and from there, what is it? Rav Papa said: This too - the first divorces and the second marries. Ameimar said: She is permitted to both of them.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: מוּתֶּרֶת לִשְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And the halakha she is permitted to both of them.
llm_translation: And the halakha: permitted for both of them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יְגָרֵשׁ אָדָם אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מָצָא בָּהּ דְּבַר עֶרְוָה – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: A man may not divorce his wife unless he finds about her a matter of forbidden sexual intercourse [ devar erva ], as it is stated: “Because he has found some unseemly matter [ ervat davar ] in her,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Beit Shammai say: A man may not divorce his wife unless he has found in her a matter of indecency, as it is stated: "Because he has found in her a matter of indecency" (Deuteronomy 24:1).

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ הִקְדִּיחָה תַּבְשִׁילוֹ – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: even she burned his dish, as it is stated: “Because he has found some unseemly matter in her,”
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: Even if it has been heated, its food - as it is said: "For he found in it the nakedness of a thing."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מָצָא אַחֶרֶת נָאָה הֵימֶנָּה – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה אִם לֹא תִמְצָא חֵן בְּעֵינָיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: even he found another woman better looking than her as it is stated “And it comes to pass, if she finds no favor in his eyes”
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Even if he finds another one more beautiful than her - as it is said: "And if you do not find favor in his eyes."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״דָּבָר״! אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״עֶרְוַת״!
human_translation: is taught Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: But isn’t “matter” already stated Beit Shammai said to them: But isn’t “unseemly [ ervat ]” already stated?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, tanya, amru Beit Hillel leBeit Shammai: vahaloh kevar ne'emar 'davar'! Amru lahem Beit Shammai: vahaloh kevar ne'emar 'ervat'!" English translation: "A teaching was taught: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: But has it not already been said 'thing'! Beit Shammai said to them: But has it not already been said 'nakedness'!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: אִם נֶאֱמַר ״עֶרְוַת״ וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״דָּבָר״ – הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: מִשּׁוּם ״עֶרְוָה״ תֵּצֵא, מִשּׁוּם ״דָּבָר״ לֹא תֵּצֵא; לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר: ״דָּבָר״. וְאִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״דָּבָר״ וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״עֶרְוַת״ – הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: מִשּׁוּם ״דָּבָר״ – תִּנָּשֵׂא לְאַחֵר, וּמִשּׁוּם ״עֶרְוָה״ – לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא לְאַחֵר; לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר: ״עֶרְוַת״.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to them: If “unseemly” had been stated and “matter” had not been stated, I would have said should leave due to forbidden sexual intercourse, she should not leave due to matter. Therefore, “matter” is stated. And if “matter” had been stated and “unseemly” had not been stated, I would have said due to matter she may marry another But due to forbidden sexual intercourse, she may not marry another Therefore, “unseemly” is stated,
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Hillel: If it was said "ervah" and not said "davar" - I would say: from "ervah" it shall come out, from "davar" it shall not come out; therefore it was said: "davar." And if it was said "davar" and not said "ervah" - I would say: from "davar" it shall be transferred to another, and from "ervah" it shall not be transferred to another; therefore it was said: "ervah."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי – הַאי ״דָּבָר״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״דָּבָר״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״דָּבָר״ – ״עַל פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדִים אוֹ עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יָקוּם דָּבָר״; מָה לְהַלָּן בִּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים, אַף כָּאן בִּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים.
human_translation: And what do Beit Shammai do with this “matter”? “matter” is stated here, and “matter” is stated there, “At the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, a matter shall be established” Just as there, through two witnesses, so too here, through two witnesses.
llm_translation: House of Shammai - this "matter," what does it do for him? It is stated here "matter," and it is stated there "matter" - "by the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses a matter shall be established"; just as there it is established by two witnesses, so too here it is established by two witnesses.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל – מִי כְּתִיב ״עֶרְוָה בְּדָבָר״?! וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי – מִי כְּתִיב ״אוֹ עֶרְוָה אוֹ דָּבָר״?!
human_translation: And Beit Hillel Is it written: unseemly in a matter [ erva bedavar ], And Beit Shammai Is it written: either unseemly or matter [o erva o davar ],
llm_translation: House of Hillel - Who is it written "nakedness in a matter"?! And House of Shammai - Who is it written "either nakedness or a matter"?!

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל – לְהָכִי כְּתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״; דְּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי, וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel for this “some unseemly matter [ ervat davar ]” is written, as it indicates that and it indicates this
llm_translation: Beit Hillel - therefore it is written: "nakedness of a thing"; for it implies this, and implies this.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מָצָא אַחֶרֶת: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״כִּי״ מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בְּאַרְבָּעָה לְשׁוֹנוֹת – אִי, דִּלְמָא, אֶלָּא, דְּהָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: even he found another woman With regard to what do they disagree? with regard to Reish Lakish’s as Reish Lakish said ki has four meanings: If, perhaps, rather, because.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Even if he found another teaching, with what is he arguing? With the interpretation of Resh Lakish - for Resh Lakish said: "Ki" serves in four languages - perhaps, but rather, this.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: ״וְהָיָה אִם לֹא תִמְצָא חֵן בְּעֵינָיו, כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״ – דְּהָא מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר; וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״ – אִי נָמֵי, מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר.
human_translation: Beit Shammai hold “And it comes to pass, if she finds no favor in his eyes, because [ ki ] he has found some unseemly matter in her” due to he has found some unseemly matter in her. And Rabbi Akiva holds “because [ ki ] he has found some unseemly matter in her” Or if he has found some unseemly matter in her.
llm_translation: House of Shammai holds: "And if he did not find favor in his eyes, because he found in her a matter of indecency" - for he found in her a matter of indecency; and Rabbi Akiva holds: "because he found in her a matter of indecency" - in other words, he found in her a matter of indecency.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: לֹא מָצָא בָּהּ לֹא עֶרְוָה וְלֹא דָּבָר, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: found about her neither forbidden sexual intercourse nor matter, what is
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava: "He did not find in it neither nakedness nor matter, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, מִדְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי אוֹנֶס: ״לֹא יוּכַל לְשַׁלְּחָהּ כׇּל יָמָיו״ – כׇּל יָמָיו בַּ״עֲמוֹד וְהַחְזֵיר״ קָאֵי; הָתָם הוּא דְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא, אֲבָל הָכָא – מַאי דַּעֲבַד עֲבַד.
human_translation: said to him from what the Merciful One reveals with regard to a rapist: “He may not send her away all his days” all his days he stands to arise and remarry specifically there as the Merciful One reveals But here, what he did, he did.
llm_translation: He said to him, from the flag of mercy regarding a case of coercion: "He cannot divorce her all his days" - all his days in the state of standing and returning; there it is from the flag of mercy, but here - what he did, he did.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לְרָבָא: אִם לִבּוֹ לְגָרְשָׁהּ, וְהִיא יוֹשֶׁבֶת תַּחְתָּיו וּמְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ, מַהוּ? קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״אַל תַּחֲרֹשׁ עַל רֵעֲךָ רָעָה וְהוּא יוֹשֵׁב לָבֶטַח אִתָּךְ״.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said to Rava: If he intends to divorce her and she is living with him and serving him, what is read about “Devise not evil against your neighbor, seeing he dwells securely by you”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Mesharshya to Rava: If his heart is to divorce her, and she is sitting beneath him and serving him, what is the law? He reads over her: "Do not plot harm against your neighbor while he dwells securely beside you" (Proverbs 3:29).

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַדֵּעוֹת בְּמַאֲכָל, כָּךְ דֵּעוֹת בְּנָשִׁים. יֵשׁ לְךָ אָדָם שֶׁזְּבוּב נוֹפֵל לְתוֹךְ כּוֹסוֹ – וְזוֹרְקוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹתֵהוּ; וְזוֹ הִיא מִדַּת פַּפּוּס בֶּן יְהוּדָה, שֶׁהָיָה נוֹעֵל בִּפְנֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ וְיוֹצֵא.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Meir would say: Just as there are attitudes with regard to food, so too, there are attitudes with regard to women. you have a person who, a fly falls into his cup, he throws out and does not drink it. And this is the demeanor of Pappos ben Yehuda as he would lock before his wife and leave
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir used to say, just as there are different tastes in food, so too there are different tastes in women. There was a man into whose cup a fly fell, and he would remove it and not drink it; and this is the measure of Papus ben Yehudah, who would engage in relations with his wife and withdraw.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אָדָם שֶׁזְּבוּב נוֹפֵל לְתוֹךְ כּוֹסוֹ – וְזוֹרְקוֹ, וְשׁוֹתֵהוּ; וְזוֹ הִיא מִדַּת כׇּל אָדָם, שֶׁמְּדַבֶּרֶת עִם אַחֶיהָ וּקְרוֹבֶיהָ – וּמַנִּיחָהּ.
human_translation: And you have a person who, a fly falls into his cup, he throws out and drinks And this is the demeanor of any man, whose speaks with her siblings and relatives, and he lets her
llm_translation: And there is a person that a fly falls into his cup - and he removes it, and drinks it; and this is the measure of every person, that he speaks with his brothers and relatives - and leaves it.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אָדָם שֶׁזְּבוּב נוֹפֵל לְתוֹךְ תַּמְחוּי – מוֹצְצוֹ, וְאוֹכְלוֹ; זוֹ הִיא מִדַּת אָדָם רַע, שֶׁרוֹאֶה אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ יוֹצְאָה וְרֹאשָׁהּ פָּרוּעַ, וְטוֹוָה בַּשּׁוּק,
human_translation: And you have a man who, a fly falls into serving bowl, he sucks and eats This is the demeanor of a bad man, who sees his wife going out with her head uncovered, and spinning in the marketplace
llm_translation: And there is a person that a fly falls into his drink - he crushes it, and eats it; this is the attribute of a wicked person, who sees his wife going out and her head uncovered, and wandering in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: וּפְרוּמָה מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדֶיהָ, וְרוֹחֶצֶת עִם בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: and with her garment open from both sides, and bathing with men,
llm_translation: And a protrusion from both its sides, and it washes with the sons of Adam.

hebrew_text: ״עִם בְּנֵי אָדָם״ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁבְּנֵי אָדָם רוֹחֲצִין.
human_translation: Can it enter your mind with men? Rather, in a place where men bathe.
llm_translation: "‘With the sons of men’ - Is this your understanding?! Rather, in a place where the sons of men bathe."

hebrew_text: זוֹ – מִצְוָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה לְגָרְשָׁהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת וְגוֹ׳ וְשִׁלְּחָהּ מִבֵּיתוֹ״. ״וְהָלְכָה וְהָיְתָה לְאִישׁ אַחֵר״ – הַכָּתוּב קְרָאוֹ ״אַחֵר״, לוֹמַר: שֶׁאֵין זֶה בֶּן זוּגוֹ לָרִאשׁוֹן – זֶה הוֹצִיא רְשָׁעָה מִבֵּיתוֹ, וְזֶה הִכְנִיס רְשָׁעָה לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: this it is a mitzva by Torah law to divorce her, as it is stated: “Because he has found some unseemly and he sends her out of his house…And she goes and becomes another [ aḥer ] man’s wife” The verse called to state that this is not a peer of the first that evicted a wicked woman from his house and this introduced a wicked woman into his house.
llm_translation: This – a commandment from the Torah to divorce her, as it is stated: "For he found in her an indecency, etc., and he shall write her a bill of divorce." "And she will go and become another man's" – the Scripture calls him "another," to say: that this is not her original partner – this one expelled wickedness from his house, and this one brought wickedness into his house.

hebrew_text: זָכָה שֵׁנִי – שִׁלְּחָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּשְׂנֵאָהּ הָאִישׁ הָאַחֲרוֹן״. וְאִם לָאו – קוֹבַרְתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹ כִי יָמוּת הָאִישׁ הָאַחֲרוֹן״ – כְּדַאי הוּא בְּמִיתָה; שֶׁזֶּה הוֹצִיא רְשָׁעָה מִבֵּיתוֹ, וְזֶה הִכְנִיס רְשָׁעָה לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: the second merits, he will send her out, as it is stated “And the latter husband hates And if not, she will bury him, as it is stated “Or if the latter husband dies.” appropriate for him to death, as that evicted a wicked woman from his house and this introduced a wicked woman into his house.
llm_translation: He acquired a second wife - he shall send her away, as it is stated: "And he shall hate her, the latter wife." And if not - he buries her, as it is stated: "Or if the latter husband die" - it is fitting for her to die; for this one removed wickedness from his house, and this one brought wickedness into his house.

hebrew_text: ״כִּי שָׂנֵא שַׁלַּח״ – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם שְׂנֵאתָהּ – שַׁלַּח. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: שָׂנאוּי הַמְשַׁלֵּחַ.
human_translation: “For I hate sending away, Rabbi Yehuda says: if you hate send Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who sends is hated
llm_translation: "When one hates, he should send" - Rabbi Yehuda says: If you hate her - send her away. Rabbi Yochanan says: The one who sends is hated.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא בְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן, הָא בְּזוּג שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And they do not disagree. This is with regard to a first marriage, that is with regard to a second marriage,
llm_translation: And they did not argue: this one in the first pairing, this one in the second pairing.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמְגָרֵשׁ אִשְׁתּוֹ רִאשׁוֹנָה – אֲפִילּוּ מִזְבֵּחַ מוֹרִיד עָלָיו דְּמָעוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזֹאת שֵׁנִית תַּעֲשׂוּ, כַּסּוֹת דִּמְעָה אֶת מִזְבַּח ה׳, בְּכִי וַאֲנָקָה מֵאֵין עוֹד פְּנוֹת אֶל הַמִּנְחָה, וְלָקַחַת רָצוֹן מִיֶּדְכֶם. וַאֲמַרְתֶּם: עַל מָה? עַל כִּי ה׳ הֵעִיד בֵּינְךָ וּבֵין אֵשֶׁת נְעוּרֶיךָ, אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה בָּגַדְתָּה בָּהּ, וְהִיא חֲבֶרְתְּךָ וְאֵשֶׁת בְּרִיתֶךָ״.
human_translation: As Rabbi Elazar says: anyone who divorces his first wife, even the altar sheds tears over him, as it is stated: “And this further you do: You cover the altar of the Lord with tears, with weeping, and with sighing, insomuch that He does not regard the offering anymore, nor does He receive it with goodwill from your hand. Yet you say: What for? Because the Lord has been witness between you and the wife of your youth, against whom you have dealt treacherously, though she is your companion, and the wife of your covenant”
llm_translation: As Rabbi Elazar said: "Anyone who divorces his first wife - even the altar sheds tears for him, as it is stated: 'And this you do a second time, covering the altar of the Lord with tears, with weeping and groaning, because He no longer regards the offering or accepts it with favor from your hand. Yet you ask, 'Why?' Because the Lord has been a witness between you and the wife of your youth, against whom you have broken faith, though she is your companion and your wife by covenant."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמְגָרֵשׁ וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת גִּיטִּין
llm_translation: We will return to you, the one who is divorcing, and we will go up with her to the tractate of Gittin.
